original: agre bṛhannuṣasāmūrdhvo asthān nirjaganvān tamasojyotiṣāgāt🔽agnirbhānunā ruśatā svaṅga ā jātoviśvā sadmānyaprāḥ
analyzed: agre bṛhan uṣasām ūrdhvaḥ asthāt nirjaganvān tamasaḥ jyotiṣā āgāt  agniḥ bhānunā ruśatā su aṅgaḥ ā jātaḥ viśvā sadmāni aprāḥ
translated: He hath stood up erect, the lofty one, in front of the dawns, and hath come forth from the darkness to the light.🔽Agni with his ruddy splendour hath come, self-bright, at birth, to all the seats (of worship).

original: sa jāto garbho asi rodasyoragne cārurvibhṛta oṣadhīṣu
analyzed: sa jātaḥ garbhaḥ asi rodasyoḥ agne cāruḥ vibhṛtaḥ oṣadhīṣu
translated: Thou art the child, O Agni, born of the two worlds, the lovely one distributed among the plants.

original: citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsyaktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhikanikradat gāḥ
analyzed: citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāṃsi aktūn pra mātṛbhyaḥ adhikanikradat gāḥ
translated: The wondrous child hath cast off the coverings of darkness, and hath bellowed forth to the mothers the cows.

original: viṣṇuritthā paramamasya vidvāñ jāto bṛhannabhi pātitṛtīyam
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ itthā paramam asya vidvān jātaḥ bṛhan abhi pāti tṛtīyam
translated: Vishnu, knowing this, the highest, hath come forth, the great one, to the third pressing.

original: āsā yadasya payo akrata svaṃ sacetaso abhyarcantyatra
analyzed: āsā yat asya payaḥ akrata svam sacetasaḥ abhyarcanti atra
translated: When they have made this his own milk, they, of one mind, here worship it.

original: ata u tvā pitubhṛto janitrīrannāvṛdhaṃ prati carantyannaiḥ
analyzed: atas u tvā pitu bhṛtaḥ janitrīḥ annāvṛdham prati caranti annaiḥ
translated: From thence the mothers, nourished by the father, come to him, increasing their food, with food.

original: tā īṃ pratyeṣi punaranyarūpā asi tvaṃ vikṣumānuṣīṣu hotā
analyzed: tāḥ īm pratyeṣi punar anya rūpā asi tvam vikṣu mānuṣīṣu hotā
translated: To them thou returnest again, of another form: thou art the Hotar in the families of men.

original: hotāraṃ citrarathamadhvarasya yajñasyayajñasya ketuṃruśantam
analyzed: hotāram citra ratham adhvarasya yajñasya yajñasya ketuṃruśantam
translated: The Hotar of the sacrifice, of the sacrifice, the wondrous charioteer, the radiant ensign,

original: pratyardhiṃ devasyadevasya mahnā śriyā tvagnimatithiṃ janānām
analyzed: pratyardhim devasya devasya mahnā śriyā tu agnim atithim janānām
translated: The messenger of each god by the greatness of each god, by glory, Agni, the guest of men.

original: sa tu vastrāṇyadha peśanāni vasāno agnirnābhāpṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: sa tu vastrāṇi adha peśanāni vasānaḥ agniḥ nābhāpṛthivyāḥ
translated: He, clothed in his own garments, the coverings, Agni, in the navel of the earth,

original: aruṣo jātaḥ pada iḷāyāḥ purohito rājanyakṣīha devān
analyzed: aruṣaḥ jātaḥ pade iḷāyāḥ purohitaḥ rājan yakṣi iha devān
translated: The ruddy one, born in the place of Iḷā, the priest, O king, invite hither the gods.

original: ā hi dyāvāpṛthivī agna ubhe sadā putro na mātarātatantha🔽pra yāhyachośato yaviṣṭhāthā vaha sahasyehadevān
analyzed: ā hi dyāvāpṛthivī agne ubhe sadā putraḥ na mātarā ātatantha  pra yāhi achośataḥ yaviṣṭha athā vaha sahasya ihadevān
translated: For, O Agni, thou hast ever stretched out to heaven and earth, O son, as to two mothers,🔽Go, O youngest, to the trembling ones, and then bring the gods hither, O conqueror.

original: piprīhi devānuśato yaviṣṭha vidvān ṛtūnrṛtupateyajeha
analyzed: piprīhi deva anuśataḥ yaviṣṭha vidvān ṛtūn ṛtu pate yaja iha
translated: Delight the hundreds of gods, O youngest, knowing the seasons, O lord of the seasons, worship here.

original: ye daivyā ṛtvijastebhiragne tvaṃ hotṝṇāmasyāyajiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: ye daivyāḥ ṛtvijaḥ tebhiḥ agne tvam hotṝṇām asi a yajiṣṭhaḥ
translated: You who are the divine priests, by them, O Agni, you are the most worthy to be worshipped of the priests,

original: veṣi hotramuta potraṃ janānāṃ mandhātāsi draviṇodāṛtāvā
analyzed: veṣi hotram uta potram janānām mandhātā asi draviṇaḥ dāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: You attain the office of the Hotar and the Potri of the people. You are the giver of wealth, the bestower of riches, the upholder of truth.

original: svāhā vayaṃ kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devo devānyajatvagnirarhan
analyzed: svāhā vayam kṛṇavāmā havīṃṣi devaḥ devān yajatu agniḥ arhan
translated: We will offer oblations, Svâhâ! Let the god Agni, the worthy one, offer to the gods.

original: ā devānāmapi panthāmaganma yacchaknavāma tadanupravoḷum
analyzed: ā devānām api panthām aganma yat śaknavāma tat anupravoḷum
translated: We have come to the path of the gods. We will do what we are able to do. We will follow that.

original: agnirvidvān sa yajāt sedu hotā so adhvarāṃsa ṛtūn kalpayāti
analyzed: agniḥ vidvān sa yajāt sa idu hotā saḥ adhvarāṃsaḥ ṛtūn kalpayāti
translated: Let Agni, the wise one, the priest, the one to be worshipped, he who orders the seasons of the sacrifices,

original: yad vo vayaṃ pramināma vratāni viduṣaṃ devāaviduṣṭarāsaḥ
analyzed: yat vaḥ vayam pramināma vratāni viduṣam devāḥ aviduṣṭarāsaḥ
translated: If we, O gods, the ignorant ones, should transgress your ordinances, the wise one,

original: agniṣ ṭad viśvamā pṛṇāti vidvānyebhirdevān ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti
analyzed: agniḥ tat viśvam ā pṛṇāti vidvān yebhiḥ devān ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti
translated: Agni, the all-knowing one, makes it all good, by which he orders the gods according to the seasons.

original: yat pākatrā manasā dīnadakṣā na yajñasya manvatemartyāsaḥ
analyzed: yat pākatrā manasā dīna dakṣāḥ na yajñasya manvate imartyāsaḥ
translated: If the mortal ones, the Pakathas, with a mind that is weak in action, do not think of the sacrifice,

original: agniṣ ṭad dhotā kratuvid vijānanyajiṣṭho devān ṛtuśo yajāti
analyzed: agniḥ tat hotā kratu vid vijānan yajiṣṭhaḥ devān ṛtuśas yajāti
translated: Agni, the wise one, the Hotar, knowing the rites, the best worshipper, worships the gods according to the seasons.

original: viśveṣāṃ hyadhvarāṇāmanīkaṃ citraṃ ketuṃ janitātvā jajāna
analyzed: viśveṣām hi adhvarāṇām anīkam citram ketum janitā atvā jajāna
translated: for he is the wondrous banner and sign of all sacrifices which the creator hath produced

original: sa ā yajasva nṛvatīranu kṣā spārhāiṣaḥ kṣumatīrviśvajanyāḥ
analyzed: saḥ ā yajasva nṛvatīḥ anu kṣā spārhāḥ iṣaḥ kṣumatīḥ viśvajanyāḥ
translated: do thou worship the wide-spread regions, the desirable food, the nourishing, all-supporting

original: yaṃ tvā dyāvāpṛthivī yaṃ tvāpastvaṣṭā yaṃ tvāsujanimā jajāna
analyzed: yam tvā dyāvāpṛthivī yam tvā apaḥ tvaṣṭā yam tvā asujanimā jajāna
translated: whom heaven and earth, whom the waters, whom Tvastr, whom the kindly-born one hath produced

original: panthāmanu pravidvānpitṛyāṇaṃ dyumadagne samidhāno vi bhāhi
analyzed: panthām anu pravidvān pitṛyāṇam dyumat agne samidhānaḥ vi bhāhi
translated: knowing the path which leads to the fathers, shine forth, O Agni, kindled, with thy light

original: ino rājannaratiḥ samiddho raudro dakṣāya suṣumānadarśi🔽cikid vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatāsiknīmeti ruśatīmapājan
analyzed: inaḥ rājan aratiḥ samiddhaḥ raudraḥ dakṣāya suṣumān adarśi  cikit vi bhāti bhāsā bṛhatā asiknīm eti ruśatīm apājan
translated: the terrible messenger, O king, kindled, hath appeared, well-formed, for Daksha's joy🔽he shines with his great light, he goes to the tawny one, driving away the dark one

original: kṛṣṇāṃ yadenīmabhi varpasā bhūjjanayan yoṣāmbṛhataḥ piturjām
analyzed: kṛṣṇām yadenīm abhi varpasā bhūt janayan yoṣām bṛhataḥ pituḥ jām
translated: when he became the black one, the crooked one, by his form, begetting the young woman, the sister of the great father

original: ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ sūryasya stabhāyandivo vasubhiraratirvi bhāti
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum sūryasya stabhāyan divaḥ vasubhiḥ aratiḥ vi bhāti
translated: supporting the light of the sun upwards, the messenger shines with the riches of heaven

original: bhadro bhadrayā sacamāna āgāt svasāraṃ jāro abhyetipaścāt🔽supraketairdyubhiragnirvitiṣṭhan ruśadbhirvarṇairabhi rāmamasthāt
analyzed: bhadraḥ bhadrayā sacamānaḥ āgāt svasāram jāraḥ abhyeti paścāt  su praketaiḥ dyubhiḥ agniḥ vitiṣṭhan ruśadbhiḥ varṇaiḥ abhi rāmam asthāt
translated: the fortunate one has come with the fortunate one, the lover approaches his sister from behind🔽Agni, standing with his auspicious lights, hath sat down with his ruddy forms to the feast

original: asya yāmāso bṛhato na vagnūnindhānā agneḥ sakhyuḥśivasya
analyzed: asya yāmāsaḥ bṛhataḥ na vagnūn indhānāḥ agneḥ sakhyuḥśivasya
translated: the messengers of this great one, not to be resisted, of Agni, the auspicious friend,

original: iḍyasya vṛṣṇo bṛhataḥ svāso bhāmāso yāmannaktavaścikitre🔽svanā na yasya bhāmāsaḥ pavante rocamānasya bṛhataḥsudivaḥ
analyzed: iḍyasya vṛṣṇaḥ bṛhataḥ svāsaḥ bhāmāsaḥ yāman naktavaḥ cikitre  svanāḥ na yasya bhāmāsaḥ pavante rocamānasya bṛhataḥsudivaḥ
translated: The breath of the adorable, the mighty, the lofty one, his rays, are seen in the night and in the day, in the wondrous one🔽Whose rays, like sounds, are purified, of the radiant, the lofty one, of the one with beautiful days

original: jyeṣṭhebhiryastejiṣṭhaiḥ krīḷumadbhirvarṣiṣṭhebhirbhānubhirnakṣati dyām
analyzed: jyeṣṭhebhiḥ yaḥ tejiṣṭhaiḥ krīḍumadbhiḥ varṣiṣṭhebhiḥ bhānubhiḥ nakṣati dyām
translated: He shines with the highest, the most powerful, the most delightful lights, with the best rays, on the sky

original: asya śuṣmāso dadṛśānapaverjehamānasya svanayan niyudbhiḥ
analyzed: asya śuṣmāsaḥ dadṛśāna paveḥ jehamānasya svanayan niyudbhiḥ
translated: His impetuosities are seen, of the one who moves swiftly, roaring with his teams

original: pratnebhiryo ruśadbhirdevatamo vi rebhadbhiraratirbhāti vibhvā🔽sa ā vakṣi mahi na ā ca satsi divaspṛthivyoraratiryuvatyoḥ
analyzed: pratnebhiḥ yaḥ ruśadbhiḥ devatamaḥ vi rebhadbhiḥ aratiḥ bhāti vibhvā  saḥ ā vakṣi mahi naḥ ā ca satsi divaspṛthivyoḥ aratiḥ yuvatyoḥ
translated: The one who is to be worshipped with the ancient, the ruddy ones, the singing ones, shines with the most delightful lights🔽Come to us, sit down with us, O Agni, the most delightful one, of the two young maidens, heaven and earth

original: agniḥ sutukaḥ sutukebhiraśvai rabhasvadbhīrabhasvāneha gamyāḥ
analyzed: agniḥ su tukaḥ su tukebhiḥ aśvaiḥ rabhasvat bhī rabhasvān iha gamyāḥ
translated: O Agni, with your well-kindled horses, well-kindled yourself, come with your impetuous ones

original: pra te yakṣi pra ta iyarmi manma bhuvo yathā vandyo nohaveṣu🔽dhanvanniva prapā asi tvamagna iyakṣave pūravepratna rājan
analyzed: pra te yakṣi pra te iyarmi manma bhuvaḥ yathā vandyaḥ nohaveṣu  dhanvan iva prapāḥ asi tvam agne iyakṣave pūrave pratna rājan
translated: I will serve you, I will urge my thought, that you may be praised by us in battles🔽O Agni, like a ford you are for those who desire to sacrifice, for Pūru, O ancient king

original: yaṃ tvā janāso abhi saṃcaranti gāva uṣṇamiva vrajaṃyaviṣṭha
analyzed: yam tvā janāsaḥ abhi saṃcaranti gāvaḥ uṣṇam iva vrajaṃyaviṣṭha
translated: The people come to you, O most youthful one, like cows to a warm stable

original: dūto devānāmasi martyānāmantarmahāṃścarasi rocanena
analyzed: dūtaḥ devānām asi martyānām antar mahān carasi rocanena
translated: You are the messenger of the gods among mortals, you move in the great one with your radiance

original: śiśuṃ na tvā jenyaṃ vardhayantī mātā bibhartisacanasyamānā
analyzed: śiśum na tvā jenyam vardhayantī mātā bibhartisacanasyamānā
translated: As a mother cherishes her dear son, so do they cherish thee, O Agni, the young one worthy of the people.

original: dhanoradhi pravatā yāsi haryañ jigīṣasepaśurivāvasṛṣṭaḥ
analyzed: dhanoḥ adhi pravatā yāsi haryam jigīṣase paśuḥ iva avasṛṣṭaḥ
translated: On the back of the waters thou goest along the paths, O tawny one, as if thou wert a released beast, seeking to win.

original: mūrā amūra na vayaṃ cikitvo mahitvamagne tvamaṅga vitse🔽śaye vavriścarati jihvayādan rerihyate yuvatiṃviśpatiḥ san
analyzed: mūrāḥ amūra na vayam cikitvaḥ mahitvam agne tvam aṅga vitse  śaye vavriḥ carati jihvayā adan rerihyate yuvatiṃviśpatiḥ san
translated: We are foolish, O wise one, not knowing; thou, O Agni, knowest the greatness of thy power.🔽The one who lies down, as if covered with a skin, moves along with his tongue eating; the lord of the people, as if licking, moves along with his tongue eating.

original: kūcijjāyate sanayāsu navyo vane tasthau palito dhūmaketuḥ
analyzed: kūcid jāyate sanayāsu navyaḥ vane tasthau palitaḥ dhūmaketuḥ
translated: One is born again in the new ways, the grey-haired one with the smoke-bannered fire stands in the wood.

original: asnātāpo vṛṣabho na pra veti sacetaso yaṃ parṇayantamartāḥ
analyzed: a snāta apaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na pra veti sacetasaḥ yam parṇayantam artāḥ
translated: The bull does not go forth unanointed, the one whom the mortals make to move with reins.

original: tanūtyajeva taskarā vanargu raśanābhirdaśabhirabhyadhītām
analyzed: tanūtyajā iva taskarāḥ vanargu raśanābhiḥ daśabhiḥ abhyadhītām
translated: Like a thief who has abandoned his body, he is bound with ten reins, wandering in the wood.

original: iyaṃ te agne navyasī manīṣā yukṣvā rathaṃna śucayadbhiraṅgaiḥ
analyzed: iyam te agne navyasī manīṣā yukṣvā rathaṃna śucayadbhiḥ aṅgaiḥ
translated: This newest thought of thine, O Agni, is for us: yoke thy chariot with its pure parts.

original: brahma ca te jātavedo namaśceyaṃ ca gīḥ sadamidvardhanī bhūt
analyzed: brahma ca te jātavedaḥ namaḥ ca iyam ca gīḥ sadam id vardhanī bhūt
translated: And this prayer of ours, O all-knower, with our homage, may ever prosper thee.

original: rakṣā ṇo agne tanayāni tokā rakṣota nastanvo aprayuchan
analyzed: rakṣa naḥ agne tanayāni tokā rakṣa uta naḥ tanvaḥ aprayuchan
translated: Protect our children and offspring, O Agni, and our bodies, O thou that art not to be deceived.

original: ekaḥ samudro dharuṇo rayīṇāmasmad dhṛdo bhūrijanmā vicaṣṭe
analyzed: ekaḥ samudraḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām asmat dhṛdaḥ bhūri janmā vicaṣṭe
translated: Alone, the ocean, the supporter of riches, the one of many births, looks into our heart.

original: siṣaktyūdharniṇyorupastha utsasya madhyenihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ
analyzed: siṣakti ūdhar niṇyoḥ upasthe utsasya madhye nihitam padam veḥ
translated: He hath filled the lap of the two bowls, the foot placed in the middle of the altar, the foot of the bird

original: samānaṃ nīḷaṃ vṛṣaṇo vasānāḥ saṃ jagmire mahiṣāarvatībhiḥ
analyzed: samānam nīḍam vṛṣaṇaḥ vasānāḥ sam jagmire mahiṣa aarvatībhiḥ
translated: The bulls have gone together to the common trough, the mighty ones with the mares

original: ṛtasya padaṃ kavayo ni pānti guhā nāmānidadhire parāṇi
analyzed: ṛtasya padam kavayaḥ ni pānti guhā nāmā nidadhire parāṇi
translated: The wise ones guard the foot of holy order, they have hidden the highest names in secret

original: ṛtāyinī māyinī saṃ dadhāte mitvā śiśuṃ jajñaturvardhayantī
analyzed: ṛtāyinī māyinī sam dadhāte mitvā śiśum jajñatuḥ vardhayantī
translated: They, the truthful, the wise, unite; having measured, they have brought forth the child, they who make him grow

original: viśvasya nābhiṃ carato dhruvasya kaveścittantuṃ manasā viyantaḥ
analyzed: viśvasya nābhim carataḥ dhruvasya kaveḥ cit tantum manasā viyantaḥ
translated: They, the wise, have woven with their thought the thread of the lord of the world, who moves in the navel of all that is firm

original: ṛtasya hi vartanayaḥ sujātamiṣo vājāya pradivaḥsacante
analyzed: ṛtasya hi vartanayaḥ su jāta miṣaḥ vājāya pradivaḥsacante
translated: For the paths of holy order follow the well-born food, the gift, for strength

original: adhīvāsaṃ rodasī vāvasāne ghṛtairannairvāvṛdhāte madhūnām
analyzed: adhīvāsam rodasī vāvasāne ghṛtaiḥ annaiḥ vāvṛdhāte madhūnām
translated: The two worlds have grown with ghee and food, with sweet juices, in the robe of the dwelling-place

original: sapta svasṝraruṣīrvāvaśāno vidvān madhva ujjabhārādṛśe kam
analyzed: sapta svasṝḥ aruṣīḥ vāvaśānaḥ vidvān madhvaḥ ujjabhāra ādṛśe kam
translated: The wise one, desiring to be seen, has brought forth the sweet juice, having subdued the seven ruddy sisters

original: antaryeme antarikṣe purājā ichan vavrimavidatpūṣaṇasya
analyzed: antar yeme antarikṣe purājāḥ ichan vavrim avidat pūṣaṇasya
translated: He, the ancient one, has entered the space between, desiring to find the enclosure of Pusan

original: sapta maryādāḥ kavayastatakṣustāsāmekāmidabhyaṃhuro gāt
analyzed: sapta maryādāḥ kavayaḥ tatakṣuḥ tāsām ekām id abhyaṃhuraḥ gāt
translated: The wise ones have fashioned seven boundaries; one of them the swift one hath passed over

original: āyorha skambha upamasya nīḷe pathāṃvisarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau
analyzed: āyoḥ ha skambhaḥ upamasya nīḍe pathām visarge dharuṇeṣu tasthau
translated: The prop of the sky, the son of the high one, hath stood in the paths, in the openings, in the supports

original: asacca sacca parame vyoman dakṣasya janmannaditerupasthe
analyzed: asat ca sat ca parame vyoman dakṣasya janman aditeḥ upasthe
translated: The true and the false in the highest heaven, in the womb of Aditi, in the birth-place of Daksha

original: agnirha naḥ pra thamajā ṛtasya pūrva āyuni vṛṣabhaścadhenuḥ
analyzed: agniḥ ha naḥ pra thama jāḥ ṛtasya pūrve āyuni vṛṣabhaḥ cadhenuḥ
translated: Agni is our firstborn of eternal law, and in the ancient time the bull and milchcow

original: ayaṃ sa yasya śarmannavobhiragneredhate jaritābhiṣṭau🔽jyeṣṭhebhiryo bhānubhirṛṣūṇāṃ paryeti parivītovibhāvā
analyzed: ayam sa yasya śarman navobhiḥ agneḥ edhate jaritā abhiṣṭau  jyeṣṭhebhiḥ yaḥ bhānubhiḥ ṛṣūṇām paryeti parivītaḥ vibhāvā
translated: This is he whose protection, O Agni, the singer delights in with his songs of praise🔽He who with the most excellent rays of the Ṛṣis moves about, surrounded, illuminating

original: yo bhanubhirvibhāvā vibhātyagnirdevebhirṛtāvājasraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ bhanubhiḥ vibhāvā vibhāti agniḥ devebhiḥ ṛtau ājasraḥ
translated: Agni who shines with his rays, illuminating, eternal, with the gods, the fulfiller of vows

original: ā yo vivāya sakhyā sakhibhyo 'parihvṛto atyo na saptiḥ
analyzed: ā yaḥ vivāya sakhyā sakhibhyaḥ parihvṛtaḥ atyaḥ na saptiḥ
translated: He who, for the sake of friendship, is not to be turned aside from his friends, like a swift horse

original: īśe yo viśvasyā devavīterīśe viśvāyuruṣasovyuṣṭau
analyzed: īśe yaḥ viśvasyāḥ deva vīteḥ īśe viśvāyuḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau
translated: He who is the lord of all the feast of the gods, the lord of life for all the dawns at their rising

original: ā yasmin manā havīṃṣyagnāvariṣṭarathaskabhnāti śūṣaiḥ🔽śūṣebhirvṛdho juṣāṇo arkairdevānachā raghupatvājigāti
analyzed: ā yasmin manāḥ havīṃṣi agnau ariṣṭa rathaḥ skabhnāti śūṣaiḥ  śūṣebhiḥ vṛdhaḥ juṣāṇaḥ arkaiḥ devān achā raghu patvā ājigāti
translated: In whom the sacrificial offerings are placed, O Agni, he supports with his strength the chariot that is not to be overcome🔽Accepting with his strength and his hymns, he goes to the gods, the swift one, the leader

original: mandro hotā sa juhvā yajiṣṭhaḥ sammiślo agnirā jigharti devān
analyzed: mandraḥ hotā sa juhvā yajiṣṭhaḥ sammiślaḥ agniḥ ā jigharti devān
translated: The delightful priest, the best offerer, well-anointed, Agni shines upon the gods

original: tamusrāmindraṃ na rejamānamagniṃ gīrbhirnamobhirākṛṇudhvam
analyzed: tam usrām indram na rejamānam agnim gīrbhiḥ namobhiḥ ākṛṇudhvam
translated: You must make Agni shine, who is to be praised, who is not to be overcome, with your songs and your adorations

original: ā yaṃ viprāso matibhirgṛṇanti jātavedasaṃjuhvaṃ sahānām
analyzed: ā yam viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ gṛṇanti jātavedasam juhvam sahānām
translated: Whom the sages praise with their thoughts, the knower of beings, the offerer of our sacrifices

original: saṃ yasmin viśvā vasūni jagmurvāje nāśvāḥsaptīvanta evaiḥ
analyzed: sam yasmin viśvā vasūni jagmuḥ vāje na aśvāḥ saptīvantaḥ evaiḥ
translated: In whom all the treasures have come together, like horses in a race, with their chariots

original: asme ūtīrindravātatamā arvācīnāagna ā kṛṇuṣva
analyzed: asme ūtīḥ indra vātatamāḥ arvācīnāḥ agne ā kṛṇuṣva
translated: O Agni, bring to us the most desired aids from Indra and the Maruts, from the east

original: adhā hyagne mahnā niṣadyā sadyo jajñāno havyo babhūtha
analyzed: adhā hi agne mahnā niṣadyā sadyas jajñānaḥ havyaḥ babhūtha
translated: For now, O Agni, by thy greatness, having sat down immediately after birth, thou hast become worthy of offering

original: taṃ te devāso anu ketamāyannadhāvardhanta prathamāsaūmāḥ
analyzed: tam te devāsaḥ anu ketam āyan adha avardhanta prathamāḥ aūmāḥ
translated: The gods have followed after that thy leading; the earliest, most excellent ones have increased

original: svasti no divo agne pṛthivyā viśvāyurdhehi yajathāya deva
analyzed: svasti naḥ divaḥ agne pṛthivyāḥ viśvāyuḥ dhehi yajathāya deva
translated: Grant us, O Agni, prosperity from heaven and earth, O god, for the sake of worship

original: sacemahi tava dasma praketairuruṣyā ṇa urubhirdevaśaṃsaiḥ
analyzed: sacemahi tava dasma praketaiḥ uruṣya naḥ urubhiḥ deva śaṃsaiḥ
translated: May we be united with thy wondrous leading, O protector, with thy wide-reaching divine powers

original: imā agne matayastubhyaṃ jātā gobhiraśvairabhi gṛṇantiradhaḥ
analyzed: imāḥ agne matayaḥ tubhyam jātāḥ gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ abhi gṛṇantiḥ adhas
translated: These prayers, O Agni, have been born for thee; they praise thee with cattle and horses from below

original: yadā te marto anu bhogamānaḍ vaso dadhānomatibhiḥ sujāta
analyzed: yadā te martaḥ anu bhogam ānaṭ vaso dadhānaḥ matibhiḥ su jāta
translated: When a mortal man has obtained thy favour, O good one, bearing thee with his thoughts, O well-born one

original: agniṃ manye pitaramagnimāpimagniṃ bhrātaraṃ sadamitsakhāyam
analyzed: agnim manye pitaram agnim āpim agnim bhrātaram sadam id sakhāyam
translated: I think of Agni as my father, of Agni as my brother, of Agni as my friend at all times

original: agneranīkaṃ bṛhataḥ saparyaṃ divi śukraṃyajataṃ sūryasya
analyzed: agneḥ anīkam bṛhataḥ saparyam divi śukraṃyajatam sūryasya
translated: The face of Agni, to be worshipped, is great; in the sky is the pure one to be worshipped, the sun

original: sidhrā agne dhiyo asme sanutrīryaṃ trāyase dama ānityahotā
analyzed: sidhrāḥ agne dhiyaḥ asme sanutrīryam trāyase dame ānitya hotā
translated: O Agni, may our inspired thoughts be successful for us, to be nourished, whom thou always protectest in the house as the eternal priest

original: ṛtavā sa rohidaśvaḥ purukṣurdyubhirasmāahabhirvāmamastu
analyzed: ṛtavā sa rohit aśvaḥ purukṣuḥ dyubhiḥ asmāahabhiḥ vāmam astu
translated: May he, the true one, the red-horse, the rich in food, be dear to us with his lights and days

original: dyubhirhitaṃ mitramiva prayogaṃ pratnam ṛtvijamadhvarasyajāram
analyzed: dyubhiḥ hitam mitram iva prayogam pratnam ṛtvijam adhvarasya ajāram
translated: The one to be worshipped, like a friend, is to be served with lights; the ancient priest is to be honoured at the sacrifice

original: bāhubhyāmagnimāyavo 'jananta vikṣu hotāraṃ nyasādayanta
analyzed: bāhubhyām agnim āyavaḥ jananta vikṣu hotāram nyasādayanta
translated: The priests with their arms have produced Agni, have placed the Hotar in the people.

original: svayaṃ yajasva divi deva devān kiṃ te pākaḥ kṛṇavadapracetāḥ
analyzed: svayam yajasva divi deva devān kim te pākaḥ kṛṇavat apracetāḥ
translated: Worship the gods in heaven, O god, what shall the foolish Paka do for thee?

original: yathāyaja ṛtubhirdeva devānevā yajasvatanvaṃ sujāta
analyzed: yathā ayajaḥ ṛtubhiḥ deva devān evā yajasva tanvam su jāta
translated: As thou hast worshipped the gods with the seasons, so worship thou the gods, O well-born one.

original: bhavā no agne 'vitota gopā bhavā vayaskṛduta novayodhāḥ
analyzed: bhava naḥ agne vitā uta gopāḥ bhava vayaskṛt uta no vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Be thou, O Agni, our protector and guardian, be thou our strength-giver and strength-winner.

original: rāsvā ca naḥ sumaho havyadātiṃ trāsvota nastanvo aprayuchan🔽pra ketunā bṛhatā yātyagnirā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti🔽divaścidantānupamānudānaḷ apāmupasthe mahiṣovavardha
analyzed: rāsvā ca naḥ su mahas havya dātim trāsvā uta naḥ tanvaḥ aprayuchan  pra ketunā bṛhatā yāti agniḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti  divaḥ cit antān upamān udānaḥ apām upasthe mahiṣaḥ uvavardha
translated: Be thou, O thou of great bounty, our bearer of oblations, and guard thou our bodies from falling away.🔽Agni goes forth with his great light, the bull roars to the two world-halves.🔽The bull has grown in the lap of the waters, above the measure of the sky.

original: mumoda garbho vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmānasremā vatsaḥ śimīvānarāvīt
analyzed: mumoda garbhaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ kakudmān asremā vatsaḥ śimīvān arāvīt
translated: The bull, the humped one, the embryo has rejoiced; the strong calf has bellowed with might.

original: sa devatātyudyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣuprathamo jigāti🔽ā yo mūrdhānaṃ pitrorarabdha nyadhvare dadhire sūroarṇaḥ
analyzed: sa devatā ati udyatāni kṛṇvan sveṣu kṣayeṣu prathamaḥ jigāti  ā yaḥ mūrdhānam pitroḥ arabdha ni adhvare dadhire sūroarṇaḥ
translated: He, making ready the offerings to the gods, goes forth first in his own abodes.🔽He who has seized the head of the two parents, the men have placed in the sacrifice, the strong one, the light.

original: asya patmannaruṣīraśvabhudhnā ṛtasya yonautanvo juṣanta
analyzed: asya patman aruṣīḥ aśva bhudhnāḥ ṛtasya yonau tanvaḥ juṣanta
translated: In the womb of truth, the red mares, whose path is the sky, delight their bodies.

original: uṣauṣo hi vaso agrameṣi tvaṃ yamayorabhavo vibhāvā
analyzed: uṣā oṣaḥ hi vaso agram eṣi tvam yamayoḥ abhavaḥ vibhāvā
translated: O Vasu, thou goest forth in the morning, thou art the light of the two Yamas.

original: ṛtāya sapta dadhiṣe padāni janayan mitraṃ tanve svāyai
analyzed: ṛtāya sapta dadhiṣe padāni janayan mitram tanve svāyai
translated: For truth thou hast established seven stations, begetting Mitra for thine own body

original: bhuvaścakṣurmaha ṛtasya gopā bhuvo varuṇo yad ṛtāyaveṣi
analyzed: bhuvaḥ cakṣuḥ mahaḥ ṛtasya gopāḥ bhuvaḥ varuṇaḥ yat ṛtāya veṣi
translated: Thou art the great eye of holy order, the guardian, O Varuna, when thou goest to the worshipper

original: bhuvo apāṃ napājjātavedo bhuvo dūto yasyahavyaṃ jujoṣaḥ
analyzed: bhuvaḥ apām napāt jātavedaḥ bhuvaḥ dūtaḥ yasya havyam jujoṣaḥ
translated: Thou art the son of the waters, O all-knower, thou art the messenger of him whose offering thou acceptest

original: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaśca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacaseśivābhiḥ
analyzed: bhuvaḥ yajñasya rajasaḥ ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ
translated: Thou art the leader of the sacrifice and of the realm, where thou rejoicest with thy auspicious teams

original: divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvāmagnecakṛṣe havyavāham
analyzed: divi mūrdhānam dadhiṣe svarṣām jihvām agne cakṛṣe havyavāham
translated: In the sky thou placest thy head, O self-shining one, and thou makest thy tongue, O Agni, the bearer of oblations

original: asya tritaḥ kratunā vavre antarichan dhītiṃ piturevaiḥparasya
analyzed: asya tritaḥ kratunā vavre antar ichan dhītim pituḥ eva aiḥparasya
translated: Trita, by his wisdom, chose for himself the middlemost thought of his father, the most distant

original: sacasyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe jāmi bruvāṇaāyudhāni veti
analyzed: sacasyamānaḥ pitroḥ upasthe jāmi bruvāṇaḥ āyudhāni vā iti
translated: Being united in the lap of his parents, speaking as a kinsman, he goes to the weapons

original: sa pitryāṇyāyudhani vidvanindreṣita āptyo abhyayudhyat
analyzed: sa pitryāṇi āyudhani vidvan indra iṣitaḥ āptyaḥ abhyayudhyat
translated: Knowing the weapons of his father, urged on by Indra, he fought against the Aptyas

original: triśīrṣāṇaṃ saptaraśmiṃ jaghanvān tvāṣṭrasya cinniḥ sasṛje trito gāḥ
analyzed: tri śīrṣāṇam sapta raśmim jaghanvān tvāṣṭrasya cit niḥ sasṛje tritaḥ gāḥ
translated: The one with three heads and seven rays, the lame one, Trita let loose the cows of Tvaṣṭṛ

original: bhūrīdindra udinakṣantamojo 'vābhinat satpatirmanyamānam🔽tvāṣṭrasya cid viśvarūpasya gonāmācakraṇastrīṇi śīrṣā parā vark
analyzed: bhūri id indraḥ udinakṣantam ojaḥ vā abhinat satpatiḥ manyamānam  tvāṣṭrasya cit viśva rūpasya gonāma ācakraṇaḥ trīṇi śīrṣā parā vark
translated: Indra, the lord of the good, smote down the swelling might of him who looked down from above🔽Of Tvaṣṭṛ's cows of all forms, he cut off three heads, the fourth he left

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvastā na ūrje dadhātana
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana
translated: The waters are indeed the givers of bliss; they shall bestow upon us strength and vigour.

original: maheraṇāya cakṣase
analyzed: maheraṇāya cakṣase
translated: To the great lord for beholding

original: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasastasya bhajayateha naḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhajayata iha naḥ
translated: Of you, the most auspicious juice, may he grant us here

original: uśatīrivamātaraḥ
analyzed: uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: Like eager mothers

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha
translated: To him we come to you, for whose enjoyment you quicken

original: āpojanayathā ca naḥ🔽śaṃ no devīrabhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye
analyzed: āpojanayathā ca naḥ  śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye
translated: And provide for us🔽May the waters be auspicious to us for drinking, O goddesses,

original: śaṃ yorabhi sravantu naḥ
analyzed: śam yos abhi sravantu naḥ
translated: May they flow to us for welfare

original: īśānā vāryāṇāṃ kṣayantīścarṣaṇīnām
analyzed: īśānāḥ vāryāṇām kṣayantīḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Mistresses of good things, nourishing the people

original: apoyācāmi bheṣajam
analyzed: apoyācāmi bheṣajam
translated: I ask the waters for healing

original: apsu me somo abravīdantarviśvāni bheṣajā
analyzed: apsu me somaḥ abravīt antar viśvāni bheṣajā
translated: In the waters, Soma has told me, are all the medicines

original: agniṃ caviśvaśambhuvam
analyzed: agnim ca viśva śambhuvam
translated: And Agni, who is auspicious to all

original: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajāṃ varūthaṃ tanve mama
analyzed: āpaḥ pṛṇīta bheṣajām varūtham tanve mama
translated: O waters, grant me a remedy, a protection for my body

original: jyok casūryaṃ dṛśe🔽idamāpaḥ pra vahata yat kiṃ ca duritaṃ mayi
analyzed: jyok ca sūryam dṛśe  idam āpaḥ pra vahata yat kim ca duritam mayi
translated: And long to see the sun🔽Carry away this, O waters, whatever evil there is in me

original: yad vāhamabhidudroha yad va śepa utānṛtam🔽āpo adyānvacāriṣaṃ rasena samagasmahi🔽payasvānagnaā gahi taṃ mā saṃ sṛja varcasā
analyzed: yat vā aham abhidudroha yat vaḥ śepe uta anṛtam  āpaḥ adya anvacāriṣam rasena samagasmahi  payasva anagnau gahi tam mā sam sṛja varcasā
translated: If I have rushed upon you in anger, if I have spoken falsely🔽Today I have followed the waters, with sap we have become united🔽O Agni, come with milk, unite me with radiance

original: o cit sakhāyaṃ sakhyā vavṛtyāṃ tiraḥ purū cidarṇavaṃjaganvan
analyzed: ā u cit sakhāyam sakhyā vavṛtyām tiras purū cit arṇavaṃjaganvan
translated: Even from afar may I turn to the friend with friendship, passing through many a barrier

original: piturnapātamā dadhīta vedhā adhi kṣamiprataraṃ didhyānaḥ
analyzed: piturnapātamā dadhīta vedhāḥ adhi kṣamiprataram didhyānaḥ
translated: One should hold the father's protection, the creator, in his heart, thinking of the crossing on the earth

original: na te sakhā sakhyaṃ vaṣṭyetat salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti
analyzed: na te sakhā sakhyam vaṣṭi etat salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti
translated: This friendship of yours, O you of different forms, does not please him as a friend

original: mahas putraso asurasya vīrā divo dhartāraurviyā pari khyan
analyzed: mahaḥ putrasaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ divaḥ dhartārā aurviyā pari khyan
translated: The mighty sons of the Asura, the heroes, are born to support the heaven by their own power

original: uśanti ghā te amṛtāsa etadekasya cit tyajasaṃ martyasya
analyzed: uśanti gha te amṛtāsaḥ etat ekasya cit tyajasam martyasya
translated: The immortal ones praise this of yours, O one, the abandonment of even a mortal

original: ni te mano manasi dhāyyasme janyuḥ patistanvamāviviśyāḥ
analyzed: ni te manaḥ manasi dhāyi asme janyuḥ patiḥ tanvam āviviśyāḥ
translated: Let your mind be placed in our mind, O dear husband, having entered your wife's body

original: na yat purā cakṛmā kad dha nūnam ṛtā vadanto anṛtaṃrapema
analyzed: na yat purā cakṛma kad ha nūnam ṛtā vadantaḥ anṛtaṃrapema
translated: What we have not done before, now that we speak the truth, let us not utter a falsehood

original: gandharvo apsvapyā ca yoṣā sā no nābhiḥparamaṃ jāmi tan nau🔽garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kardevāstvaṣṭā savitāviśvarūpaḥ
analyzed: gandharvaḥ apsvapyā ca yoṣā sā naḥ nābhiḥ paramam jāmi tat nau  garbhe nu nau janitā dampatī kaḥ devāḥ tvaṣṭā savitā a viśva rūpaḥ
translated: The Gandharva and the Apsarā who dwell in the waters, that is our highest common bond🔽In the womb, the creator has made us husband and wife, the gods Tvaṣṭṛ and Savitar of all forms

original: nākirasya pra minanti vratāni veda nāvasyapṛthivi uta dyauḥ
analyzed: nākirasya pra minanti vratāni veda nāvasyapṛthivi uta dyauḥ
translated: None transgresses his ordinances, the earth and the sky know him

original: ko asya veda prathamasyāhnaḥ ka īṃ dadarśa ka iha pravocat
analyzed: kaḥ asya veda prathamasya ahnaḥ kaḥ īm dadarśa kaḥ iha pravocat
translated: Who knows this first day of his? Who has seen it? Who can proclaim it here?

original: bṛhan mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kadu brava āhanovīcyā nṝn
analyzed: bṛhat mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma kadu bravaḥ āhanā uvīcyā nṝn
translated: The lofty abode of Mitra and Varuṇa, who can tell it to us, to rouse the men?

original: yamasya mā yamyaṃ kāma āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya
analyzed: yamasya mā yamyam kāmaḥ āgan samāne yonau sahaśeyyāya
translated: I have come to Yama's desire for my own self, to lie together in the same womb

original: jāyeva patye tanvaṃ riricyāṃ vi cid vṛheva rathyeva cakrā
analyzed: jāyā iva patye tanvam riricyām vi cit vṛheva rathyā iva cakrā
translated: I will stretch out my body to my husband as a wife, we will be separated as if by a chariot wheel

original: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣantyete devānāṃ spaśa iha yecaranti
analyzed: na tiṣṭhanti na ni miṣanti ete devānām spaśaḥ iha ye caranti
translated: These, the spies of the gods, who move here, neither stand still nor close their eyes

original: anyena madāhano yāhi tuyaṃ tena vi vṛha rathyevacakrā🔽rātrībhirasmā ahabhirdaśasyet sūryasya cakṣurmuhurunmimīyāt
analyzed: anyena mad āhanaḥ yāhi tuyam tena vi vṛha rathyā iva cakrā  rātrībhiḥ asmai ahabhiḥ daśasyet sūryasya cakṣuḥ muhur unmimīyāt
translated: Go to him, O thou who art to be invoked, with another, as with a chariot wheel🔽May he be honoured by the nights and days, may he often open the eye of the sun

original: divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīryamasyabibhṛyādajāmi
analyzed: divā pṛthivyā mithunā sabandhū yamīḥ yamasi abibhṛyāt ajāmi
translated: The earth and heaven are the pair with their bond, may Yama's sister bear the unborn child

original: ā ghā tā gachānuttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavannajāmi
analyzed: ā gha tā gacha anuttarā yugāni yatra jāmayaḥ kṛṇavan ajāmi
translated: To those higher unions let us go, where the sisters will make the unborn born

original: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhumanyamichasva subhagepatiṃ mat
analyzed: upa barbṛhi vṛṣabhāya bāhumanyam ichasva subhagepatim mat
translated: Lift up thy voice to the bull, O blessed one, seek another husband than me

original: kiṃ bhratāsad yadanāthaṃ bhavāti kimu svasā yan nirṛtirnigachat
analyzed: kim bhratā asat yat anātham bhavāti kimu svasā yat nirṛtiḥ nigacchat
translated: What is the use of a brother if he makes one helpless? What is the use of a sister if she goes to destruction?

original: kāmamūtā bahvetad rapāmi tanvā me tanvaṃ sampipṛgdhi
analyzed: kāma mūtā bahu etat rapāmi tanvāḥ me tanvam sampipṛgdhi
translated: I call upon thee, O much-desired one, I commit this sin to thee. Unite my body with my body.

original: na vā u te tanvā tanvaṃ saṃ papṛcyāṃ pāpamāhuryaḥsvasāraṃ nigachāt
analyzed: na vai u te tanvā tanvam sam papṛcyām pāpam āhuḥ yaḥ svasāram nigacchāt
translated: I would not unite thy body with my body. They call it a sin if one goes to his own sister.

original: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na tebhrāta subhage vaṣṭyetat
analyzed: anyena mat pramudaḥ kalpayasva na te bhrāta subhage vaṣṭi etat
translated: Make thy joy with another than me, O blessed one. This does not please thee, O brother.

original: bato batasi yama naiva te mano hṛdayaṃ cāvidāma
analyzed: bataḥ batasi yama na eva te manaḥ hṛdayam ca avidāma
translated: O Yama, thou art a child. We know not whether thy mind or heart is here.

original: anyā kilatvāṃ kakṣyeva yuktaṃ pari ṣvajāte libujeva vṛkṣam
analyzed: anyā kila tvām kakṣyā iva yuktam pari svajāte libujā iva vṛkṣam
translated: Surely another, as with a girdle, has embraced thee, as a creeper embraces a tree.

original: anyamū ṣu tvaṃ yamyanya u tvāṃ pari ṣvajāte libujevavṛkṣam
analyzed: anyamū su tvam yami anye u tvām pari svajāte
translated: Thou art to be embraced by another, another hath embraced thee, as a creeper a tree

original: tasya vā tvaṃ mana ichā sa vā tavādhā kṛṇuṣvasaṃvidaṃ subhadrām
analyzed: tasya vā tvam manaḥ icha sa vā tava adhā kṛṇuṣva a saṃvidam su bhadrām
translated: Choose thou his mind, let him choose thine, make ye an agreement most auspicious

original: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvo aditeradābhyaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā vṛṣṇe duduhe dohasā divaḥ payāṃsi yahvaḥ aditeḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The bull hath milked for the strong one the milkings of heaven, the young, unassailable, of Aditi

original: viśvaṃ sa veda varuṇo yathā dhiyā sayajñiyo yajatu yajñiyān ṛtūn
analyzed: viśvam sa veda varuṇaḥ yathā dhiyā sa yajñiyaḥ yajatu yajñiyān ṛtūn
translated: He knows all this as Varuna by his wisdom: let him, meet for sacrifice, offer sacrifice to the meet-for-sacrifice seasons

original: rapad gandharvīrapyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātume manaḥ
analyzed: rapat gandharvī rapyā ca yoṣaṇā nadasya nāde pari pātume manaḥ
translated: The Gandharvas have departed, and the maidens: let my mind be protected in the cry of the river

original: iṣṭasya madhye aditirni dhātu no bhrātā nojyeṣṭhaḥ prathamo vi vocati
analyzed: iṣṭasya madhye aditiḥ ni dhātu naḥ bhrātā nojyeṣṭhaḥ prathamaḥ vi vocati
translated: May Aditi place us in the midst of the worshipped: our eldest brother, the first, shall proclaim to you

original: so cin nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatyuṣā uvāsa manavesvarvatī
analyzed: sā u cit nu bhadrā kṣumatī yaśasvatī uṣāḥ uvāsa manave isvarvatī
translated: She, the auspicious, the prosperous, the glorious Dawn hath dwelt with Manu, rich in wealth

original: yadīmuśantamuśatāmanu kratumagniṃhotāraṃ vidathāya jījanan
analyzed: yadi īm uśantam uśatām anu kratum agniṃhotāram vidathāya jījanan
translated: When they have generated the willing Agni, willing, according to their will, for the sacrifice

original: adha tyaṃ drapsaṃ vibhvaṃ vicakṣaṇaṃ virābharadiṣitaḥ śyeno adhvare🔽yadī viśo vṛṇate dasmamāryāagniṃ hotāramadha dhīrajāyata
analyzed: adha tyam drapsam vibhvam vicakṣaṇam virābharat iṣitaḥ śyenaḥ adhvare  yadi viśaḥ vṛṇate dasmam āryāḥ agnim hotāram adha dhīḥ ajāyata
translated: Then the falcon, eager, hath brought hither that all-knowing, all-pervading drop in the sacrifice🔽When the Aryan people choose the wondrous Agni as their Hotar, then the wise one is born

original: sadāsi raṇvo yavaseva puṣyate hotrābhiragne manuṣaḥsvadhvaraḥ
analyzed: sadā asi raṇvaḥ yavasā iva puṣyate hotrābhiḥ agne manuṣaḥsu adhvaraḥ
translated: Thou art ever dear, like grass, to be nourished: by the prayers, O Agni, the pious man of the people

original: viprasya vā yacchaśamāna ukthyaṃ vājaṃsasavānupayāsi bhūribhiḥ🔽udīraya pitarā jāra ā bhagamiyakṣati haryato hṛttaiṣyati
analyzed: viprasya vā yat śaśamānaḥ ukthyam vājaṃsasavān upayāsi bhūribhiḥ  udīraya pitarā jāraḥ ā bhagam iyakṣati haryataḥ
translated: Or when thou goest to the sacrifice of the pious Brāhman with many (gifts), O bountiful one,🔽Thou sendest forth the parents, the brother, the sister, the kinsman, the friend, the guest. The eager one will seek the heart with his desire.

original: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhastaviṣyate asurovepate matī
analyzed: vivakti vahniḥ svapasyate makhaḥ taviṣyate asuraḥ vepate matī
translated: The priest is delighted, the sacrifice is pleased, the Asura is glorified, the thought trembles.

original: yaste agne sumatiṃ marto akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa praśṛṇve
analyzed: yaḥ te agne sumatim martaḥ akṣat sahasaḥ sūno ati sa praśṛṇve
translated: O Agni, the man who has gained thy favour, O son of strength, him thou dost make to prosper.

original: iṣaṃ dadhāno vahamāno aśvairā sa dyumānamavān bhūṣati dyūn
analyzed: iṣam dadhānaḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ ā sa dyumān amavān bhūṣati dyūn
translated: Bearing food, borne by horses, he adorns the luminous days with his own light.

original: yadagna eṣā samitirbhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra
analyzed: yat agne eṣā samitiḥ bhavāti devī deveṣu yajatā yajatra
translated: When this assembly of thine becomes such, O Agni, O god, among the gods who offer sacrifice, O holy one,

original: ratnā ca yad vibhajāsi svadhāvo bhāgaṃ no atra vasumantaṃvītāt
analyzed: ratnā ca yat vibhajāsi svadhāvas bhāgam naḥ atra vasumantaṃvītāt
translated: And when thou, of thine own nature, distributest treasures, grant us a share rich in goods.

original: śrudhī no agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā rathamamṛtasyadravitnum
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣva ratham amṛtasya dravitnum
translated: Listen to us, O Agni, in the abode of the righteous! Yoke the chariot of the swift immortal one!

original: ā no vaha rodasī devaputre mākirdevānāmapabhūriha syāḥ🔽dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtenābhiśrāve bhavataḥsatyavācā
analyzed: ā naḥ vaha rodasī deva putre mākir devānām apabhūḥ iha syāḥ  dyāvā ha kṣāmā prathame ṛtena abhiśrāve bhavataḥ satya vācā
translated: Bring us the two worlds, O son of a god! Be not thou far from us here, be thou near!🔽Heaven and earth, the first by holy order, are to be worshipped with true speech.

original: devo yan martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdaddhotā pratyaṃ svamasuṃ yan
analyzed: devaḥ yat martān yajathāya kṛṇvan sīdat hotā pratyam sva masum yan
translated: When the god, making (them) ready for the sacrifice of mortals, sits down as the Hotar, he goes to his own place.

original: devo devān paribhūrṛtena vahā no havyaṃ prathamaścikitvān
analyzed: devaḥ devān paribhūḥ ṛtena vaha naḥ havyam prathamaḥ cikitvān
translated: The god, the overcomer of the gods, carry our oblation by the path, the first, the wise one

original: dhūmaketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīko mandro hotā nityovācā yajīyān
analyzed: dhūma ketuḥ samidhā bhāṛjīkaḥ mandraḥ hotā nitya uvācā yajīyān
translated: The smoke-bannered one, kindled with fuel, the brilliant one, the delightful priest, the eternal one, the best sacrificer

original: svāvṛg devasyāmṛtaṃ yadī gorato jātāso dhārayantaurvī
analyzed: svāvṛj devasya amṛtam yadi goḥ rataḥ jātāsaḥ dhārayanta aurvī
translated: The true hymn of the god is the nectar of the cow. Born from that, they support the two great ones

original: viśve devā anu tat te yajurgurduhe yadenīdivyaṃ ghṛtaṃ vāḥ
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu tat te yajuḥ guḥ duhe ghṛtam vār
translated: All the gods follow that sacrificial formula of yours. It milks the divine ghee that is in the waters

original: arcāmi vāṃ vardhāyāpo ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutaṃrodasī me
analyzed: arcāmi vām vardhāya apaḥ ghṛtasnū dyāvābhūmī śṛṇutam rodasī me
translated: I praise you, O waters rich in ghee, for prosperity. O heaven and earth, listen to me, O you two wide worlds

original: ahā yad dyāvo 'sunītimayan madhvā no atrapitarā śiśītām
analyzed: ahā yat dyāvaḥ sunītimayan madhvā naḥ atra pitarā śiśītām
translated: When the days have brought misfortune, may the two fathers, heaven and earth, refresh us with sweetness here

original: kiṃ svin no rājā jagṛhe kadasyāti vrataṃ cakṛmā ko viveda
analyzed: kim svid naḥ rājā jagṛhe kadasya ati vratam cakṛma kaḥ viveda
translated: What has the king taken from us? Who has transgressed our vow? Who knows?

original: mitraścid dhi ṣmā juhurāṇo devāñchloko nayātāmapi vājo asti
analyzed: mitraḥ cit hi sma juhurāṇaḥ devān ślokaḥ nayātām api vājaḥ asti
translated: Even Mitra, when angry, may lead the gods to the hymn. There is also strength

original: durmantvatrāmṛtasya nāma salakṣmā yad viṣurūpābhavāti
analyzed: nāma salakṣmā yat viṣurūpā bhavāti
translated: The name of the immortal one is difficult to understand here. The one with the same form as the multi-formed one moves around

original: yamasya yo manavate sumantvagne tam ṛṣva pāhyaprayuchan
analyzed: yamasya yaḥ manavate sumantu agne tam ṛṣva pāhi aprayuchan
translated: O Agni, protect him, O lofty one, without fail, whom Yama, the well-minded one, favors

original: yasmin devā vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ vidathe mādayante vivasvataḥ sadane dhārayante
translated: In what assembly the gods rejoice, in which they support themselves in the abode of Vivasvat

original: sūrye jyotiradadhurmāsyaktūn pari dyotaniṃ caratoajasrā
analyzed: sūrye jyotiḥ adadhuḥ māsi aktūn pari dyotanim carataḥ ajasrā
translated: They have placed the light of the sun in the mouth. The two that move around the illuminating one without interruption

original: yasmin devā manmani saṃcarantyapīcye na vayamasya vidma
analyzed: yasmin devāḥ manmani saṃcaranti apīcye na vayam asya vidma
translated: In which the gods move, in the most excellent thought, we do not know this one

original: mitro no atrāditiranāgān savitā devo varuṇāya vocat
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ atra aditiḥ anāgān savitā devaḥ varuṇāya vocat
translated: May Mitra, Aditi, and the god Savitar speak to Varuna for our protection here

original: śrudhī no agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣvā / / /
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ agne sadane sadhasthe yukṣva
translated: Listen to us, O Agni, in the abode of the righteous, yoke the two bays, O thou of great wealth, for the offering

original: yuje vāṃ brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhirvi śloka etu pathyevasūreḥ
analyzed: yuje vām brahma pūrvyam namobhiḥ vi ślokaḥ etu pathyeva sūreḥ
translated: I yoke you two with ancient prayer and homage; may the hymn go forth like a chariot on its path

original: śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrā ā ye dhāmānidivyāni tasthuḥ
analyzed: śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrāḥ ā ye dhāmāni divyāni tasthuḥ
translated: May all the sons of the immortal one listen, who have taken their places in the heavenly abodes

original: yame iva yatamāne yadaitaṃ pra vāṃ bharan mānuṣādevayantaḥ
analyzed: yame iva yatamāne yadā etam pra vām bharan mānuṣāḥ devayantaḥ
translated: When they strive like Yama, when they bring this (oblation) to you, the worshippers of men

original: ā sīdataṃ svamu lokaṃ vidāne svāsasthebhavatamindave naḥ
analyzed: ā sīdatam svamu lokam vidāne svāsasthebhavatam indave naḥ
translated: Sit in your own world, which you have created; be easy to us in your own abode, O you who are to be praised

original: pañca padāni rupo anvarohaṃ catuṣpadīmanvemi vratena
analyzed: pañca padāni rupaḥ anvaroham catuṣpadīm anvemi vratena
translated: I follow the five steps of the one who is to be sought, I follow the four-footed one with the vow

original: akṣareṇa prati mima etām ṛtasya nābhāvadhi saṃ punāmi
analyzed: akṣareṇa prati mime etām ṛtasya nābhau adhi sam punāmi
translated: With the syllable I measure this one back, I purify it to the end of the non-existence of truth

original: devebhyaḥ kamavṛṇīta mṛtyuṃ prajāyai kamamṛtaṃnāvṛṇīta
analyzed: devebhyaḥ kam avṛṇīta mṛtyum prajāyai kam amṛtam na avṛṇīta
translated: For the gods he chose death, for offspring he chose immortality

original: bṛhaspatiṃ yajñamakṛṇvata ṛṣiṃ priyāṃyamastanvaṃ prārirecīt
analyzed: bṛhaspatim yajñam akṛṇvata ṛṣim priyām yamaḥ tanvam prārirecīt
translated: They made Brihaspati the priest, the Rishi; Yama sent forth his dear body

original: sapta kṣaranti śiśave marutvate pitre putrāso apyavīvatannṛtam
analyzed: sapta kṣaranti śiśave marutvate pitre putrāsaḥ api avīvatan nṛtam
translated: The sons of the Maruts pour seven (streams) for the child; to the father they have brought the truth

original: ubhe idasyobhayasya rājata ubhe yatete ubhayasyapuṣyataḥ
analyzed: ubhe id asya ubhayasya rājataḥ ubhe yatete
translated: He rules over both of these, over both of these he is king, both of these he leads, both of these he nourishes.

original: pareyivāṃsaṃ pravato mahīranu bahubhyaḥ panthāmanupaspaśanam
analyzed: pareyivāṃsam pravataḥ mahīḥ anu bahubhyaḥ panthām anupaspaśanam
translated: Following the far-stretching mighty ones, the path for many to follow,

original: vaivasvataṃ saṃgamanaṃ janānāṃ yamaṃrājānaṃ haviṣā duvasya🔽yamo no gātuṃ prathamo viveda naiṣa gavyūtirapabhartavā u
analyzed: vaivasvatam saṃgamanam janānām yamam rājānam haviṣā duvasya  yamaḥ naḥ gātum prathamaḥ viveda na eṣa gavyūtiḥ apabhartavai u
translated: Vaisvānara, the gathering place of people, serve with oblation King Yama.🔽Yama first knew our path, this pasture he has not taken away from us.

original: yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyurenā jajñānāḥpathyā anu svāḥ
analyzed: yatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyuḥ enā jajñānāḥ pathyāḥ anu svāḥ
translated: Where our fathers and grandfathers before us went, knowing the paths of the living.

original: mātalī kavyairyamo aṅgirobhirbṛhaspatirṛkvabhirvāvṛdhānaḥ
analyzed: mātalī kavyaiḥ yamaḥ aṅgirobhiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: With the Kavyas, Yama, with the Aṅgiras, with the Ṛk verses, Varuṇa, with the Yajus formulas, Indra, with the Sāman chants, Agni, with the Atharvan verses, Mitra, with the Gāyatrī meters, Varuṇa, with the Tristubh meters, Indra, with the Jagatī meters, Viṣṇu, with the Anustubh meters, the All-gods, with the Virāṭ and Kakup meters.

original: yāṃśca devā vāvṛdhurye ca devāṃsvāhānye svadhayānye madanti
analyzed: yān ca devāḥ vāvṛdhuḥ ye ca devān svāhā anye svadhayā anye madanti
translated: Those whom the gods have exalted, and those whom the gods have not exalted, some rejoice with oblations, some with Svāhā, some with Svadhā.

original: imaṃ yama prastaramā hi sīdāṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ
analyzed: imam yama prastaramā hi sīda aṅgirobhiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ
translated: Sit here, O Yama, on this strew, in agreement with the fathers, the Aṅgiras.

original: ā tvā mantrāḥ kaviśastā vahantvenā rājanhaviṣā mādayasva
analyzed: ā tvā mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ vahantu enā rājan haviṣā mādayasva
translated: Let the hymns, well-ordered by the sages, bring you. Rejoice here, O king, with the oblation.

original: aṅgirobhirā gahi yajñiyebhiryama vairūpairiha mādayasva
analyzed: aṅgirobhiḥ ā gahi yajñiyebhiḥ yama vairūpaiḥ iha mādayasva
translated: Come with the Aṅgiras, the worthy of sacrifice, rejoice here, O Yama, with the Vaivasvata.

original: vivasvantaṃ huve yaḥ pitā te 'smin yajñe barhiṣyāniṣadya
analyzed: vivasvantam huve yaḥ pitā te smin yajñe barhiṣi a niṣadya
translated: I invoke Vivasvan, your father, to sit on the strew in this sacrifice.

original: aṅgiraso naḥ pitaro navagvā atharvāṇo bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ naḥ pitaraḥ navagvāḥ atharvāṇaḥ bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ
translated: Our fathers the Aṅgiras, the Navagvas, the Atharvans, the Bhṛgus, the Soma-drinkers,

original: teṣāṃ vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyānāmapi bhadre saumanasesyāma
analyzed: teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanasesyāma
translated: May we be in the favour and good will of those who are to be worshipped at sacrifices.

original: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūrvyebhiryatrā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥpareyuḥ
analyzed: prehi prehi pathibhiḥ pūrvyebhiḥ yatra naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pareyuḥ
translated: Go, go by the ancient paths, by which our fathers before us have departed.

original: ubhā rājānā svadhayā madantā yamaṃ paśyāsivaruṇaṃ ca devam
analyzed: ubhā rājānā svadhayā madantā yamam paśya asi varuṇam ca devam
translated: The two kings rejoicing in their own nature, see Yama and the god Varuna.

original: saṃ gachasva pitṛbhiḥ saṃ yameneṣṭāpūrtena paramevyoman
analyzed: sam gacchasva pitṛbhiḥ sam yamena iṣṭāpūrtena parame vyoman
translated: Be united with the fathers, with Yama, with the fulfilment of sacrifice in the highest heaven.

original: hitvāyāvadyaṃ punarastamehi saṃ gachasva tanvāsuvarcāḥ
analyzed: hitvā ayāvadyam punar astam ehi sam gacchasva tanvā asu varcāḥ
translated: Having cast off your guilt, return again to the setting. Be united with your own body and with light.

original: apeta vīta vi ca sarpatāto 'smā etaṃ pitaro lokamakran
analyzed: apeta vīta vi ca sarpata atas sma etam pitaraḥ lokam akran
translated: Depart, go away, and creep along this way. The fathers have made this world for him.

original: ahobhiradbhiraktubhirvyaktaṃ yamo dadātyavasānamasmai
analyzed: ahobhiḥ adbhiḥ aktubhiḥ vyaktam yamaḥ dadāti avasānam asmai
translated: With days, with waters, with the purifying, Yama gives him a place to dwell.

original: ati drava sārameyau śvānau caturakṣau śabalau sādhunāpathā
analyzed: ati drava sārameyau śvānau catur akṣau śabalau sādhunāpathā
translated: Pass over the two dogs, the brown ones with four eyes, the good path.

original: athā pitṝn suvidatrānupehi yamena ye sadhamādammadanti
analyzed: athā pitṝn suvidatra an upehi yamena ye sadhamādam madanti
translated: Then go to the fathers who are very generous, with whom Yama rejoices in the same feast.

original: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau caturakṣau pathirakṣīnṛcakṣasau
analyzed: yau te śvānau yama rakṣitārau catur akṣau pathirakṣī nṛ cakṣasau
translated: The two dogs, O Yama, who are your guardians, the four-eyed, the path-guardians, the truth-seeing,

original: tābhyāmenaṃ pari dehi rājan svasti cāsmāanamīvaṃ ca dhehi
analyzed: tābhyām enam pari dehi rājan svasti ca asmai anamīvam ca dhehi
translated: To them, O king, give this one. And bestow on him welfare and freedom from disease.

original: urūṇasāvasutṛpā udumbalau yamasya dūtau carato janānanu
analyzed: urūṇasau asutṛpā udumbalau yamasya dūtau carataḥ janān anu
translated: The two with broad hips, the two who are not to be pressed, the two udumbara trees, Yama's messengers, move along among the people.

original: tāvasmabhyaṃ dṛśaye sūryāya punardātāmasumadyeha bhadram
analyzed: tau asmabhyam dṛśaye sūryāya punar dātām asum adya iha bhadram
translated: May they give us to see the sun again today, may they grant us good fortune here.

original: yamāya somaṃ sunuta yamaya juhutā haviḥ
analyzed: yamāya somam sunuta yamaya juhuta haviḥ
translated: Press the Soma for Yama, offer the oblation to Yama,

original: yamaṃ ha yajñogachatyagnidūto araṃkṛtaḥ🔽yamāya ghṛtavad dhavirjuhota pra ca tiṣṭhata
analyzed: yamam ha yajñaḥ gacchati agni dūtaḥ araṃkṛtaḥ  yamāya ghṛtavat haviḥ juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata
translated: for the sacrifice goes to Yama, sent by Agni, well-prepared.🔽Offer the ghee-rich oblation to Yama, and stand forth,

original: sa nodeveṣvā yamad dīrghamāyuḥ pra jīvase
analyzed: sa naḥ deva iṣvā yamat dīrgham āyuḥ pra jīvase
translated: may he grant us a long life among the gods, that we may live.

original: yamāya madhumattamaṃ rājñe havyaṃ juhotana
analyzed: yamāya madhumattamam rājñe havyam juhotana
translated: Offer the sweetest oblation to Yama, the king,

original: idaṃ namaṛṣibhyaḥ pūrvajebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ
analyzed: idam namaḥ ṛṣibhyaḥ pūrva jebhyaḥ pūrvebhyaḥ pathikṛdbhyaḥ
translated: This homage to the Rishis of the past, to those who made the ancient paths,

original: trikadrukebhiḥ patati ṣaḷ urvīrekamid bṛhat
analyzed: trikadrukebhiḥ patati ṣaṣ urvīḥ ekam id bṛhat
translated: It flies with the three mountains, the four wide expanses, the one great [sky].

original: triṣṭubgāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yama āhitā
analyzed: triṣṭubh gāyatrī chandāṃsi sarvā tā yame āhitā
translated: The Tristubh, the Gayatri, all the meters are offered to Yama.

original: udīratāmavara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥsomyāsaḥ
analyzed: udīratām avare ud parāsaḥ ud madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ
translated: Let the lower, the higher, the middle fathers, the Soma-worthy ones, rise up.

original: asuṃ ya īyuravṛkā ṛtajñāste no 'vantupitaro haveṣu
analyzed: asum ye īyuḥ avṛkāḥ ṛta jñāḥ te naḥ vantu pitaraḥ haveṣu
translated: Those who have gone to the world of the righteous, the truth-knowing, the non-violent ones, may those fathers protect us in our invocations.

original: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astvadya ye pūrvāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ astu adya ye pūrvāsaḥ ye uparāsaḥ īyuḥ
translated: Today let there be homage to the fathers, to those who have gone before and those who have come after,

original: ye pārthive rajasyā niṣattā ye vā nūnaṃ suvṛjanāsuvikṣu
analyzed: ye pārthive rajasyāḥ niṣattāḥ ye vā nūnam su vṛjanā su vikṣu
translated: To those who are seated in the earthly realm, or those who are now in the well-ordered and well-divided [worlds].

original: āhaṃ pitṝn suvidatrānavitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ caviṣṇoḥ
analyzed: ā aham pitṝn suvidatrān avitsi napātam ca vikramaṇam ca viṣṇoḥ
translated: I have found the very generous fathers, the son and the stride of Vishnu.

original: barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvastaihāgamiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvaḥ te ha āgamiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Those who sit on the sacred grass, who by their own nature enjoy the offered drink, come hither, O fathers, most worthy of worship.

original: barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūtyarvāgimā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ pitaraḥ ūtī arvāk imā vaḥ havyā cakṛma juṣadhvam
translated: O fathers who sit on the sacred grass, come hither; we have prepared these offerings for you; accept them.

original: ta ā gatāvasā śantamenāthā naḥ śaṃ yorarapodadhāta
analyzed: te ā gata avasā śantamena athā naḥ śam yorarapaḥ dadhāta
translated: Come hither to us with most easy access, and grant us security and freedom from disease.

original: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu
analyzed: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu
translated: The pious fathers are invoked, in their dear abodes on the sacred grass.

original: ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantvadhi bruvantu te 'vantvasmān
analyzed: te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu adhi bruvantu te vantu asmān
translated: May they come hither and listen here; may they speak to us and protect us.

original: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyemaṃ yajñamabhi gṛṇītaviśve
analyzed: ācya jānu dakṣiṇatas niṣadya imam yajñam abhi gṛṇīta viśve
translated: Having sat down on the right side, bending your knees, praise this sacrifice, O all (fathers).

original: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āgaḥpuruṣatā karāma
analyzed: mā hiṃsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cit naḥ yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma
translated: O fathers, do not injure us in any way, for whatever sin we have committed against you.

original: āsīnāso aruṇīnāmupasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: āsīnāsaḥ aruṇīnām upasthe rayim dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: Seated on the lap of the red (cows), grant wealth to the mortal who offers.

original: putrebhyaḥ pitarastasya vasvaḥ pra yachata ta ihorjandadhāta
analyzed: putrebhyaḥ pitaraḥ tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata te iha ūrjan dadhāta
translated: O fathers, grant to your son's portion of that wealth; here do ye bestow strength upon him.

original: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāso 'nūhire somapīthaṃvasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ nūhire soma pītham vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Those pious fathers of ours who have gone before, the most excellent, to the drinking of the Soma,

original: tebhiryamaḥ saṃrarāṇo havīṃṣyuśannuśadbhiḥ pratikāmamattu
analyzed: tebhiḥ yamaḥ saṃrarāṇaḥ havīṃṣi uśan uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu
translated: with them may Yama, rejoicing, eat the oblations, rejoicing with the rejoicing.

original: ye tātṛṣurdevatrā jehamānā hotrāvida stomataṣṭāsoarkaiḥ
analyzed: ye tātṛṣuḥ devatrā jehamānāḥ hotrā vidaḥ stoma taṣṭāsaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: Those who have thirsted in heaven, stretching out, knowing the priesthood, the makers of hymns with praises,

original: āgne yāhi suvidatrebhirarvāṃ satyaiḥ kavyaiḥpitṛbhirgharmasadbhiḥ
analyzed: ā agne yāhi suvidatrebhiḥ arvām satyaiḥ kavyaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, with the very bountiful, with the true Kavyas, with the Fathers who sit in the warm place,

original: ye satyāso havirado haviṣpā idreṇa devaiḥ sarathandadhānāḥ🔽āgne yāhi sahasraṃ devavandaiḥ paraiḥpūrvaiḥ pitṛbhirgharmasadbhiḥ
analyzed: ye satyāsaḥ haviḥ adaḥ haviṣpāḥ idreṇa devaiḥ sa rathandadhānāḥ  ā agne yāhi sahasram deva vandaiḥ paraiḥ pūrvaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ gharma sadbhiḥ
translated: Who are true, who eat the oblation, who are worthy of the oblation, yoking the chariot with the gods.🔽Come, O Agni, with a thousand divine worshippers, with the former and later Fathers who sit in the warm place.

original: agniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha gachata sadaḥsadaḥ sadatasupraṇītayaḥ
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ pitaraḥ ā iha gacchata sadaḥ sadaḥ sadatasu praṇītayaḥ
translated: The Fathers who have Agni as their world, come hither, well-guided, sit in every seat.

original: attā havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣyathārayiṃ sarvavīraṃ dadhātana
analyzed: atta havīṃṣi prayatāni barhiṣyatha arayim sarva vīram dadhātana
translated: Accept the oblations placed on the sacred grass, and grant us wealth with all heroes.

original: tvamagna īḷito jātavedo 'vāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇikṛtvī
analyzed: tvam agne īḍitaḥ jātavedaḥ vār havyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvī
translated: You, O Agni, O all-knower, when invoked, having made the offerings fragrant,

original: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣannaddhi tvandeva prayatā havīṃṣi
analyzed: prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvan deva prayatā havīṃṣi
translated: Have given to the Fathers, they have eaten with their own essence. Accept, O god, the oblations placed (in the dishes).

original: ye ceha pitaro ye ca neha yāṃśca vidma yānu ca napravidma
analyzed: ye ca iha pitaraḥ ye ca na iha yān ca vidma yā anu ca na pravidma
translated: Those Fathers who are here and those who are not here, those whom we know and those whom we do not know,

original: tvaṃ vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhiryajñaṃ sukṛtaṃ juṣasva
analyzed: tvam vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhiḥ yajñam su kṛtam juṣasva
translated: You know, O all-knower, whom they are. Accept the well-performed sacrifice with the essences.

original: ye agnidagdhā ye anagnidagdhā madhye divaḥ svadhayāmādayante
analyzed: ye agni dagdhāḥ ye an agni dagdhāḥ madhye divaḥ svadhayā āmādayante
translated: Those who are burned by fire and those who are not burned by fire, who rejoice in the middle of the sky with their own essence,

original: tebhiḥ svarāḷ asunītimetāṃ yathāvaśantanvaṃ kalpayasva
analyzed: tebhiḥ svarāj asunītim etām yathāvaśantanvam kalpayasva
translated: With them, O Svarāṭ, fashion this Asunīti body according to your will.

original: mainamagne vi daho mābhi śoco māsya tvacaṃ cikṣipo māśarīram🔽yadā śṛtaṃ kṛṇavo jātavedo 'themenaṃ prahiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ🔽śṛtaṃ yadā karasi jātavedo 'theme /
analyzed: mā enam agne vi dahaḥ mā abhi śocaḥ mā asya tvacam cikṣipaḥ mā aśarīram  yadā śṛtam kṛṇavaḥ jātavedaḥ thā imā enam prahiṇutāt pitṛbhyaḥ  śṛtam yadā karasi jātavedaḥ thā ime
translated: Burn him not, O Agni, nor scorch him, nor cast his skin off, nor his flesh.🔽When thou hast made him ready, O all-knower, then send him forth to the Fathers.

original: naṃ pari dattātpitṛbhyaḥ
analyzed: nam pari dattāt pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: When thou hast made him ready, O all-knower, then give him back to the Fathers.

original: yadā gachātyasunītimetāmathā devānāṃvaśanīrbhavāti
analyzed: yadā gachāti asunītim etām athā devānām vaśanīḥ bhavāti
translated: When he goes to this unrighteousness, then let him become subject to the gods.

original: sūryaṃ cakṣurgachatu vātamātmā dyāṃ ca gachapṛthivīṃ ca dharmaṇā
analyzed: sūryam cakṣuḥ gacchatu vātam ātmā dyām ca gaccha pṛthivīm ca dharmaṇā
translated: Let his eye go to the sun, his breath to the wind, and let him go to heaven and earth by right.

original: apo vā gacha yadi tatra te hitamoṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭhā śarīraiḥ
analyzed: apaḥ vā gacha yadi tatra te hitam oṣadhīṣu prati tiṣṭha śarīraiḥ
translated: Or go to the waters, if there is thy good, settle in thy bodies among the plants.

original: ajo bhāgastapasā taṃ tapasva taṃ te śocistapatu taṃ tearciḥ
analyzed: ajaḥ bhāgaḥ tapasā tam tapasva tam te śociḥ tapatu tam te arciḥ
translated: The portion of the goat, win it by penance; let that heat of thine burn, let that flame of thine burn.

original: yāste śivāstanvo jātavedastābhirvahainaṃsukṛtāmu lokam
analyzed: yāḥ te śivāḥ tanvaḥ jātavedaḥ tābhiḥ vaha enam su kṛtā āmu lokam
translated: O all-knower, with those of thy bodies that are auspicious, carry him to the world of the good.

original: ava sṛja punaragne pitṛbhyo yasta āhutaścaratisvadhābhiḥ
analyzed: ava sṛja punar agne pitṛbhyaḥ yaḥ te āhutaḥ carati svadhābhiḥ
translated: Send him back again, O Agni, to the Fathers, he who moves with the offerings and the Svāhā calls.

original: ayurvasāna upa vetu śeṣaḥ saṃ gachatāntanvā jātavedaḥ
analyzed: ayuḥ vasānaḥ upa vetu śeṣaḥ sam gacchata antanvā jātavedaḥ
translated: Let him come back with life, let him unite with his body, O all-knower.

original: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakuna ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpa uta vāśvāpadaḥ
analyzed: yat te kṛṣṇaḥ śakunaḥ ātutoda pipīlaḥ sarpaḥ uta vā aśvāpadaḥ
translated: If the black bird has pecked at him, or the ant, or the snake, or the beast of prey,

original: agniṣ ṭad viśvādagadaṃ kṛṇotu somaśca yobrāhmaṇānāviveśa
analyzed: agniḥ tat viśva adagadam kṛṇotu somaḥ ca yaḥ brāhmaṇān āviveśa
translated: may Agni, the all-consumer, make that harmless for him, and Soma which has entered the Brahmans.

original: agnervarma pari gobhirvyayasva saṃ prorṇuṣva pīvasāmedasā ca
analyzed: agneḥ varma pari gobhiḥ vyayasva sam pra ūrṇuṣva pīvasā medasā ca
translated: Agni, clothe thyself with the armour of the cows, be anointed with the fat and the oil.

original: net tvā dhṛṣṇurharasā jarhṛṣāṇo dadhṛgvidhakṣyan paryaṅkhayāte
analyzed: na id tvā dhṛṣṇuḥ harasā jarhṛṣāṇaḥ dadhṛṣ vidhakṣyan paryaṅkhayāte
translated: Let not the impetuous one, burning with heat, eager to consume, approach thee.

original: imamagne camasaṃ mā vi jihvaraḥ priyo devānāmutasomyānām
analyzed: imam agne camasam mā vi jihvaraḥ priyaḥ devānām uta somyānām
translated: O Agni, do not be confused about this cup, dear to the gods and to the drinkers of Soma.

original: eṣa yaścamaso devapānastasmin devā amṛtāmādayante
analyzed: eṣa yaḥ camasaḥ deva pānaḥ tasmin devāḥ amṛtā mādayante
translated: This is the cup which the gods drink, in which the immortal gods rejoice.

original: kravyādamagniṃ pra hiṇomi dūraṃ yamarājño gachaturipravāhaḥ
analyzed: kravyādam agnim pra hiṇomi dūram yama rājñaḥ gaccha turipra vāhaḥ
translated: I send away Agni the devourer to a distance, let the swift one go to the king Yama.

original: ihaivāyamitaro jātavedā devebhyo havyaṃvahatu prajānan
analyzed: iha eva ayam itaraḥ jātavedāḥ devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan
translated: Let this other all-knowing Agni carry the offering to the gods here.

original: yo agniḥ kravyāt praviveśa vo gṛhamimaṃ paśyannitaraṃjātavedasam
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ kravyād praviveśa vaḥ gṛham imam paśyan itaraṃjātavedasam
translated: The Agni who has entered your house as a devourer, looking at this other all-knowing one.

original: taṃ harāmi pitṛyajñāya devaṃ sa gharmaminvāt parame sadhasthe
analyzed: tam harāmi pitṛ yajñāya devam sa gharmam invāt parame sadhasthe
translated: I carry him away to the sacrifice to the fathers, he shall churn the hot milk in the highest abode.

original: yo agniḥ kravyavāhanaḥ pitṝn yakṣad ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ kravya vāhanaḥ pitṝn yakṣat ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: The Agni who carries the oblation, who shall serve the fathers who increase truth,

original: preduhavyāni vocati devebhyaśca pitṛbhya ā🔽uśantastvā ni dhīmahyuśantaḥ samidhīmahi
analyzed: preduhavyāni vocati devebhyaḥ ca pitṛbhyaḥ ā  uśantaḥ tvā ni dhīmahi uśantaḥ samidhīmahi
translated: he announces the offerings to the gods and to the fathers.🔽We think of thee, O Uśan, we kindle thee, O Uśan.

original: uśannuśata ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave
analyzed: uśan uśataḥ ā vaha pitṝn haviṣe attave
translated: O Uśan, bring the fathers, O Uśan, to eat the oblation.

original: yaṃ tvamagne samadahastamu nirvāpayā punaḥ
analyzed: yam tvam agne samadahaḥ tamu nirvāpaya punar
translated: What, O Agni, thou hast burnt, that do thou extinguish again.

original: kiyāmbvatra rohatu pākadūrvā vyalkaśā🔽śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati🔽maṇḍūkyā susaṃ gama imaṃ svagniṃ harṣaya🔽tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatuṃ kṛṇotītīdaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃsameti🔽yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā maho jāyā vivasvatonanāśa🔽apāgūhannamṛtāṃ martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇāmadadurvivasvate🔽utāśvināvabharad yat tadasīdajahādu dvāmithunā saraṇyūḥ🔽pūṣā tvetaścyāvayatu pra vidvānanaṣṭapaśurbhuvanasya gopāḥ🔽sa tvaitebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyo 'gnirdevebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ🔽āyurviśvāyuḥ pari pāsati tvā pūṣā tvā pātu prapathepurastāt
analyzed: kiyā ambu atra rohatu pākadūrvā vyalkaśā  śītike śītikāvati hlādike hlādikāvati  maṇḍūkyā su sam gamaḥ imam su agnim harṣaya  tvaṣṭā duhitre vahatum kṛṇoti iti idam viśvam bhuvanaṃsameti  yamasya mātā paryuhyamānā mahaḥ jāyā vivasvatā unanāśa  apāgūhan amṛtām martyebhyaḥ kṛtvī savarṇām adaduḥ vivasvate  uta aśvinau abharat yat tat asīt ajahāt u dvā mithunā saraṇyūḥ  pūṣā tvā itas cyāvayatu pra vidvān a naṣṭa paśuḥ bhuvanasya gopāḥ  sa tvā etebhyaḥ pari dadat pitṛbhyaḥ gniḥ devebhyaḥ suvidatriyebhyaḥ  āyuḥ viśvāyuḥ pari pāsati tvā pūṣā tvā pātu
translated: Let the Pākadūrvā grow here in the water, let the grass be soft.🔽In the cool one, in the very cool one, in the refreshing one, in the very refreshing one.🔽O Manda, come well to this our fire, delight it.🔽Tvaṣṭṛ makes a vehicle for his daughter, this whole world comes together.🔽Yama's mother, being carried around, the great wife of Vivasvat, disappeared.🔽They concealed the immortal one from mortals, having made her of the same color, they gave her to Vivasvat.🔽And the two Aśvins filled what was there, Saranyū abandoned the two mates.🔽May Pūṣan, the wise one, lead you forward, the protector of the world, whose cattle are not lost.🔽He, indeed, gives you over to these fathers, Agni to the gods, to the very generous ones.🔽Life, the life of all, surrounds you. May Pūṣan protect you on the path in front.

original: yatrasate sukṛto yatra te yayustatra tvādevaḥ savitā dadhātu🔽pūṣemā āśā anu veda sarvāḥ so asmānabhayatamenaneṣat🔽svastidā āghṛṇiḥ sarvavīro 'prayuchan pura etuprajānan
analyzed: yatra āsate su kṛtaḥ yatra te yayuḥ tatra tvā adevaḥ savitā dadhātu 🔽pūṣā imāḥ āśāḥ anu veda sarvāḥ saḥ asmān abhayatamena neṣat 🔽svasti dāḥ āghṛṇiḥ sarva vīraḥ prayuchan puras etu prajānan

original: prapathe pathamajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathepṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: prapathe patham ajaniṣṭa pūṣā prapathe divaḥ prapathe pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Pūṣan was born first on the path, on the path of heaven, on the path of earth.

original: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā cacarati prajānan🔽sarasvatīṃ devayanto havante sarasvatīmadhvare tāyamāne
analyzed: ubhe abhi priyatame sadhasthe ā ca parā cacarati prajānan  sarasvatīm devayantaḥ havante sarasvatīm adhvare tāyamāne
translated: He goes to both most delightful abodes, going and returning, knowing.🔽They invoke Sarasvatī, the pious, Sarasvatī when the sacrifice is being performed.

original: sarasvatīṃ sukṛto ahvayanta sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryaṃ dāt
analyzed: sarasvatīm su kṛtaḥ ahvayanta sarasvatī dāśuṣe vāryam dāt
translated: The well-doers have called upon Sarasvatī. May Sarasvatī grant the offerer a choice gift.

original: sarasvati yā sarathaṃ yayatha svadhābhirdevi pitṛbhirmadantī
analyzed: sarasvati yā sa ratham yayatha svadhābhiḥ devi pitṛbhiḥ madantī
translated: O Sarasvatī, when you went with your chariot, O goddess, delighting in the sacrificial libations and the fathers,

original: āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayasvānamīvā iṣa ādhehyasme
analyzed: āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayasva anamīvāḥ iṣaḥ ādhehi asme
translated: Having sat down on this sacred grass, rejoice, and bestow upon us food free from disease.

original: sarasvatīṃ yāṃ pitaro havante dakṣiṇā yajñamabhinakṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: sarasvatīm yām pitaraḥ havante dakṣiṇā yajñam abhinakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: Sarasvatī, whom the fathers invoke, going to the sacrifice with gifts,

original: sahasrārghamiḷo atra bhāgaṃ rāyaspoṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhehi
analyzed: sahasra argham iḷaḥ atra bhāgam rāyaspoṣam yajamāneṣu dhehi
translated: Grant them a share here worth a thousand, and bestow increase of wealth upon the sacrificers.

original: apo asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu
analyzed: apaḥ asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena naḥ ghṛta pvaḥ punantu
translated: May the waters, the mothers, purify us. May they who are rich in ghee purify us with ghee.

original: viśvaṃ hi ripraṃ pravahanti devirudidābhyaḥ śucirāpūta emi
analyzed: viśvam hi ripram pravahanti śuciḥ āpūtaḥ emi
translated: For the divine ones carry away all impurity. I go forth purified from the waters.

original: drapsaścaskanda prathamānanu dyūnimaṃ ca yonimanu yaśca purvaḥ
analyzed: drapsaḥ caskanda prathamān anu dyūn imam ca yonim anu yaḥ ca purvaḥ
translated: The drop has fallen on the first, on this womb and on the former one.

original: samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantaṃ drapsaṃ juhomyanu sapta hotrāḥ
analyzed: samānam yonim anu saṃcarantam drapsam juhomi anu sapta hotrāḥ
translated: I offer the drop that moves along the common womb, along the seven oblations.

original: yaste drapsa skandati yaste aṃśurbāhucyuto dhiṣaṇāyāupasthāt
analyzed: yaḥ te drapsaḥ skandati yaḥ te aṃśuḥ bāhu cyutaḥ dhiṣaṇāyāḥ upasthāt
translated: The drop that falls from thee, the stalk that slips from thy hand as thou liftest it to the ladle,

original: adhvaryorvā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt taṃ te juhomimanasā vaṣaṭkṛtam
analyzed: adhvaryoḥ vā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt tam te juhomi manasā vaṣaṭkṛtam
translated: Or that which is left in the Adhvaryu's cup or in the strainer, that we offer to thee with our minds, with Vashat!

original: yaste drapsa skanno yaste aṃśuravaśca yaḥ paraḥsrucā
analyzed: yaḥ te drapsaḥ skannaḥ yaḥ te aṃśuḥ avaḥ ca yaḥ paraḥsrucā
translated: The drop that has fallen from thee, the stalk that is left of thee, and that which is in the ladle,

original: ayaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ saṃ taṃ siñcatu rādhase
analyzed: ayam devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ sam tam siñcatu rādhase
translated: May this god Brihaspati pour it together for thy prosperity.

original: payasvatīroṣadhayaḥ payasvan māmakaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: payasvatīḥ oṣadhayaḥ payasvat māmakam vacaḥ
translated: The plants are full of sap, my speech is full of sap;

original: apāmpayasvadit payastena mā saha śundhata
analyzed: apām payasvat id payaḥ tena mā saha śundhata
translated: The sap of the waters is full of sap; with that make me pure.

original: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yaste sva itaro devayānāt
analyzed: param mṛtyo anu parehi panthām yaḥ te svaḥ itaraḥ deva yānāt
translated: Go beyond death, O Death, along the path that is thine own, other than that which the gods go.

original: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajāṃ rīriṣomota vīrān
analyzed: cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajām rīriṣoma uta vīrān
translated: To thee, O thou that seest and hearest, I say this: harm not our offspring nor our heroes.

original: mṛtyoḥ padaṃ yopayanto yadaita drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ padam yopayantaḥ yadā aita drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataran dadhānāḥ
translated: When ye approach the place of death, extending your life, bestowing a long life to be passed over,

original: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena śuddhāḥpūtā bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ
analyzed: āpyāyamānāḥ prajayā dhanena śuddhāḥ pūtāḥ bhavata yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: Being strengthened by offspring and wealth, become ye pure and cleansed, fit for the sacrifice.

original: ime jīvā vi mṛtairāvavṛtrannabhūd bhadrā devahūtirnoadya
analyzed: ime jīvāḥ vi mṛtaiḥ āvavṛtran abhūt bhadrā deva hūtiḥ na u adya
translated: These living ones have turned away from the dead; auspicious has been our invocation of the gods this day.

original: prāñco agāma nṛtaye hasāya drāghīya āyuḥprataraṃ dadhānāḥ
analyzed: prāñcaḥ agāma nṛtaye hasāya drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataram dadhānāḥ
translated: Facing the east, bestowing a long life to be passed over, we have gone to the dance for joy.

original: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu gādaparoarthametam
analyzed: imam jīvebhyaḥ paridhim dadhāmi mā eṣām nu gāt aparoartham etam
translated: I set this boundary for the living; let none of them go hence to the other world.

original: śataṃ jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīrantarmṛtyuṃ dadhatāṃ parvatena
analyzed: śatam jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīḥ antar mṛtyum dadhatām parvatena
translated: Let them live a hundred full years; let them keep death far away with a mountain.

original: yathāhānyanupūrvaṃ bhavanti yatha ṛtava ṛtubhiryantisādhu
analyzed: yathā ahāni anupūrvam bhavanti yathā ṛtavaḥ ṛtubhiḥ yanti sādhu
translated: As the days come in regular succession, as the seasons go with the seasons in order,

original: yathā na pūrvamaparo jahātyevā dhātarāyūṃṣi kalpayaiṣām🔽ā rohatāyurjarasaṃ vṛṇānā anupūrvaṃ yatamānā yatiṣṭha
analyzed: yathā na pūrvam aparaḥ jahāti eva dhātar āyūṃṣi kalpaya eṣām  ā rohata āyuḥ jarasam vṛṇānāḥ anupūrvam yatamānāḥ yatiṣṭha
translated: As the later does not pass away before the former, so, O Disposer, ordain their lives.🔽Come up, seeking long life and strength, striving in regular succession, stand ye here.

original: iha tvaṣṭā sujanimā sajoṣā dīrghamāyuḥkarati jīvase vaḥ
analyzed: iha tvaṣṭā su janimā sajoṣāḥ dīrgham āyuḥ karati jīvase vaḥ
translated: Here let Tvastr, well-disposed, accordant, make your life long for you that ye may live.

original: imā nārīravidhavāḥ supatnīrāñjanena sarpiṣā saṃviśantu
analyzed: imāḥ nārīḥ avidhavāḥ su patnīḥ āñjanena sarpiṣā saṃviśantu
translated: Let these women, widows no more, good wives, enter with ointment and ghee.

original: anaśravo 'namīvāḥ suratnā ā rohantu janayoyonimagre
analyzed: anaśravaḥ namīvāḥ su ratnāḥ ā rohantu janayaḥ yonim agre
translated: Without wailing, without sickness, with good treasures, let the wives first ascend to the husband's birthplace.

original: udīrṣva nāryabhi jīvalokaṃ gatāsumetamupa śeṣa ehi
analyzed: udīrṣva nāri abhi jīva lokam gatāsum etam upa śeṣe ehi
translated: Rise up, O woman, to the world of the living; come to this dead one who lies here as a remainder.

original: hastagrābhasya didhiṣostavedaṃ patyurjanitvamabhi sambabhūtha
analyzed: hasta grābhasya didhiṣoḥ tava idam patyuḥ janitvam abhi sambabhūtha
translated: Thou hast come to the mother's place of this husband of thine, who took thy hand and desired thee.

original: dhanurhastādādadāno mṛtasyāsme kṣatrāya varcasebalāya
analyzed: dhanuḥ hastāt ādadānaḥ mṛtasya asme kṣatrāya varcasebalāya
translated: Taking the bow from the dead man's hand, for the sake of our nobility, splendour, and strength,

original: atraiva tvamiha vayaṃ suvīrā viśvā spṛdhoabhimātīrjayema
analyzed: atra eva tvam iha vayam su vīrāḥ viśvāḥ spṛdhaḥ abhimātīḥ jayema
translated: Here may we be, with good heroes, and conquer all our enemies and all our rivals.

original: upa sarpa mātaraṃ bhūmimetāmuruvyacasaṃ pṛthivīṃsuśevām🔽ūrṇamradā yuvatirdakṣiṇāvata eṣā tvā pātunirṛterupasthāt
analyzed: upa sarpa mātaram bhūmim etām uru vyacasam pṛthivīm su śevām  ūrṇamradā yuvatiḥ dakṣiṇāvataḥ eṣā tvā pātu nirṛteḥ upasthāt
translated: Approach this mother, the earth, this wide-extended, very gracious earth,🔽The youthful one with wool for raiment, turning to the right. May she protect thee from the presence of Nirriti.

original: ucchvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ sūpāyanāsmai bhavasūpavañcanā
