analyzed: ucchvañcasva pṛthivi mā ni bādhathāḥ su upāyanā asmai bhavasu upavañcanā
translated: Expand thyself, O earth, do not press him sore. Be easy of access to him, easy to dwell with.

original: mātā putraṃ yathā sicābhyenaṃ bhūmaūrṇuhi
analyzed: mātā putram yathā sicā abhi enam bhūma ūrṇuhi
translated: As a mother her son, so do thou, O earth, cover him with thy womb.

original: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasraṃ mita upa hiśrayantām
analyzed: ucchvañcamānā pṛthivī su tiṣṭhatu sahasram mite upa hiśrayantām
translated: Expanding, let the earth stand firm. A thousand times let them settle down.

original: te gṛhāso ghṛtaścuto bhavantu viśvāhāsmaiśaraṇāḥ santvatra
analyzed: te gṛhāsaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ bhavantu viśvāhā asmai śaraṇāḥ santu atra
translated: Let those houses be full of ghee. May they be his shelter here for all time.

original: ut te stabhnāmi pṛthivīṃ tvat parīmaṃ logaṃ nidadhan moahaṃ riṣam🔽etāṃ sthūṇāṃ pitaro dhārayantu te 'trāyamaḥ sādanā te minotu
analyzed: ud te stabhnāmi pṛthivīm tvat pari imam logam nidadhan mā u aham riṣam  etām sthūṇām pitaraḥ dhārayantu te trāyamaḥ sādanā te minotu
translated: I set thee up, O earth, as I lay down this altar. Let me not injure thee.🔽Let the fathers hold up this post for thee. Let this seat fix thee here.

original: pratīcīne māmahanīṣvāḥ parṇamivā dadhuḥ🔽pratīcīṃ jagrabhā vācamaśvaṃ raśanayā yathā🔽ni vartadhvaṃ mānu gātāsmān siṣakta revatīḥ
analyzed: pratīcīne mām ahanīṣvāḥ parṇam iva ā dadhuḥ  pratīcīm jagrabhāḥ vācam aśvam raśanayā yathā  ni vartadhvam mā anu gāta asmān siṣakta revatīḥ
translated: In the evening they have placed thee, as in a leaf, O thou who art to be worshipped in the evening.🔽I have seized thee, as a horse with a bridle, for the evening.🔽Turn hither, come to us, O ye rich ones. Bestow upon us.

original: agnīṣomāpunarvasū asme dhārayataṃ rayim
analyzed: agnīṣomā punarvasū asme dhārayatam rayim
translated: O Agni-Soma, bring back to us our lost possessions. Do ye bestow wealth upon us.

original: punarenā ni vartaya punarenā nyā kuru
analyzed: punar enā ni vartaya punar enā nyā kuru
translated: Turn them back again. Make them return to us again.

original: indra eṇā niyachatvagnirenā upājatu
analyzed: indraḥ eṇāḥ niyacchatu agniḥ enāḥ upājatu
translated: Let Indra lead the sheep, let Agni follow them

original: punaretā ni vartantāmasmin puṣyantu gopatau
analyzed: punar etāḥ ni vartantām asmin puṣyantu gopatau
translated: Let them return again, let them prosper in this house-holder

original: ihaivāgneni dhārayeha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ🔽yan niyānaṃ nyayanaṃ saṃjñānaṃ yat parāyaṇam
analyzed: iha eva agneni dhāraya iha tiṣṭhatu yā rayiḥ  yat niyānam nyayanam saṃjñānam yat parāyaṇam
translated: Here, O Agni, hold them, here let wealth abide🔽The going, the coming, the meeting, the departing

original: āvartanaṃ nivartanaṃ yo gopā api taṃ huve🔽ya udānaḍ vyayanaṃ ya udānaṭ parāyaṇam
analyzed: āvartanam nivartanam yaḥ gopāḥ api tam huve  yaḥ udānaṭ vyayanam yaḥ udānaṭ parāyaṇam
translated: The turning back, the returning, I invoke him who is the guardian of that🔽He who has gone the going, he who has gone the departing

original: āvartanaṃnivartanamapi gopā ni vartatām
analyzed: āvartanam nivartanam api gopāḥ ni vartatām
translated: Let the guardian of the turning back and the returning return

original: ā nivarta ni vartaya punarna indra gā dehi
analyzed: ā nivarta ni vartaya punar naḥ indra gāḥ dehi
translated: Return, O Indra, make to return, give us the cattle again

original: jīvābhirbhunajāmahai
analyzed: jīvābhiḥ bhunajāmahai
translated: May we enjoy with the living

original: pari vo viśvato dadha ūrjā ghṛtena payasā
analyzed: pari vaḥ viśvatas dadhe ūrjā ghṛtena payasā
translated: I place you all around with strength, with ghee, with milk

original: ye devāḥ keca yajñiyāste rayyā saṃ sṛjantu naḥ
analyzed: ye devāḥ ke ca yajñiyāḥ te rayyā sam sṛjantu naḥ
translated: May the gods who are worthy of sacrifice unite us with wealth

original: ā nivartana vartaya ni nivartana vartaya
analyzed: ā nivartana vartaya ni nivartana vartaya
translated: O returning, make to return, make to return again, O returning

original: bhūmyāścatasraḥpradiśastābhya enā ni vartaya
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ tābhyaḥ enāḥ ni vartaya
translated: From the four quarters of the earth, from them make them return

original: bhadraṃ no api vātaya manaḥ
analyzed: bhadram naḥ api vātaya manaḥ
translated: Blow upon us an auspicious wind, O mind

original: agnimīḷe bhujāṃ yaviṣṭhaṃ śāsā mitraṃ durdharītum🔽yasya dharman svarenīḥ saparyanti māturūdhaḥ
analyzed: agnim īḍe bhujām yaviṣṭham śāsā mitram durdharītum  yasya dharman svarenīḥ saparyanti mātuḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: I invoke Agni, the youngest of the strong, to rule, the friend who is hard to subdue🔽Whose laws, the swift ones, they attend, the mother's breasts

original: yamāsā kṛpanīḷaṃ bhāsāketuṃ vardhayanti
analyzed: yamāsā kṛpanīḍam bhāsā ketum vardhayanti
translated: Whom they make the dear one, the one with the shining banner, to grow

original: bhrājateśreṇidan
analyzed: bhrājateḥ śreṇidan
translated: shines with a row of teeth

original: aryo viśāṃ gātureti pra yadānaḍ divo antān
analyzed: aryaḥ viśām gātuḥ eti pra yat ānaṭ divaḥ antān
translated: the noble one goes, the lord of the people, when he has gone to the ends of the sky

original: kavirabhraṃ didyānaḥ
analyzed: kaviḥ abhram didyānaḥ
translated: the sage, looking at the cloud

original: juṣad dhavyā mānuṣasyordhvastasthāv ṛbhvā yajñe
analyzed: juṣat havyā mānuṣasya ūrdhvastasthau ṛbhvāḥ yajñe
translated: may he enjoy the offerings of man, standing high, the mighty one, at the sacrifice

original: minvan sadma pura eti
analyzed: minvan sadma puras eti
translated: shaping the abode, he goes in front

original: sa hi kṣemo haviryajñaḥ śruṣṭīdasya gātureti
analyzed: sa hi kṣemaḥ haviḥ yajñaḥ śruṣṭīt asya gātuḥ eti
translated: for he is the safe, oblation-sacrificing one, the lord is heard to come

original: agniṃ devā vāśīmantam
analyzed: agnim devāḥ vāśīmantam
translated: the gods to Agni, the strong

original: yajñāsāhaṃ duva iṣe 'gniṃ pūrvasya śevasya
analyzed: yajñāsāham duvaḥ iṣe gnim pūrvasya śevasya
translated: to Agni, the lord of the first good thing, for worship, for food,

original: adreḥsūnumāyumāhuḥ
analyzed: adreḥ sūnum āyum āhuḥ
translated: they call the son of the mountain, the living one

original: naro ye ke cāsmadā viśvet te vāma ā syuḥ
analyzed: naraḥ ye ke ca asmadā viśvā id te vāme ā syuḥ
translated: all of us men here, whatever we are, may all be yours

original: agniṃhaviṣā vardhantaḥ
analyzed: agniṃhaviṣā vardhantaḥ
translated: strengthening Agni with oblation

original: kṛṣṇaḥ śveto 'ruṣo yāmo asya bradhna ṛjra uta śoṇoyaśasvān
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ śvetaḥ ruṣaḥ yāmaḥ asya bradhnaḥ ṛjraḥ uta śoṇaḥ yaśasvān
translated: the black, the white, the red are his paths, the tawny and the red one of fame

original: hiraṇyarūpaṃ janitā jajāna
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpam janitā jajāna
translated: the golden-hued one the creator has created

original: evā te agne vimado manīṣāmūrjo napādamṛtebhiḥsajoṣāḥ
analyzed: eva te agne vimadaḥ manīṣām ūrjaḥ napāt amṛtebhiḥsajoṣāḥ
translated: thus, O Agni, with your intoxicating thought, with the immortal ones of the same mind as the foot of strength

original: gira ā vakṣat sumatīriyāna iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ
analyzed: giraḥ ā vakṣat sumatīḥ iyānaḥ iṣam ūrjam su kṣitim viśvam ābhāḥ
translated: may he bring the praises, coming with good thoughts, all the food, strength, and good abode

original: āgniṃ na svavṛktibhirhotāraṃ tvā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: ā agnim na svavṛktibhiḥ hotāram tvā vṛṇīmahe
translated: we choose you, O Agni, as the Hotar with our own hymns

original: yajñāyastīrṇabarhiṣe vi vo made śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣaṃvivakṣase
analyzed: yajñāyaḥ tīrṇa barhiṣe vi vaḥ made śīram pāvaka śociṣam vivakṣase
translated: for the sacrifice, for you, with the strewn grass, in your joy, the pure one, with the purifying flame, you shine forth

original: tvāmu te svābhuvaḥ śumbhantyaśvarādhasaḥ
analyzed: tvāmu te su ābhuvaḥ śumbhanti aśva rādhasaḥ
translated: you, O Agni, the prosperous ones, delighting in horses, adorn

original: veti tvāmupasecanī vi vo mada ṛjītiragna āhutirvivakṣase
analyzed: vā iti tvām upasecanī vi vaḥ made ṛjītiḥ agne āhutiḥ vivakṣase
translated: The ladle serves thee, O Agni, the libation, the impetuous one, urges thee. Thou art about to expand.

original: tve dharmāṇa āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīriva
analyzed: tve dharmāṇaḥ āsate juhūbhiḥ siñcatīḥ iva
translated: The laws sit in thee, as if sprinkling with ladles.

original: kṛṣṇārūpāṇyarjunā vi vo made viśvā adhi śriyo dhiṣevivakṣase
analyzed: kṛṣṇā rūpāṇi arjunā vi vaḥ made viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ
translated: The dark forms, the tawny ones, in your rapture, thou dost bestow all the glories. Thou art about to expand.

original: yamagne manyase rayiṃ sahasāvannamartya
analyzed: yam agne manyase rayim sahasāvan amartya
translated: O Agni, the wealth which thou deemest, O thou who conquerest with a thousand (gifts), O immortal one,

original: tamā novājasātaye vi vo made yajñeṣu citramā bharā vivakṣase
analyzed: tamā no vājasātaye vi vaḥ made yajñeṣu citramā bhara vivakṣase
translated: That bring thou to us for the winning of strength. In your rapture, bring the wondrous one to the sacrifices. Thou art about to expand.

original: agnirjāto atharvaṇā vidad viśvāni kāvyā
analyzed: agniḥ jātaḥ atharvaṇā vidat viśvāni kāvyā
translated: Agni, born by Atharvan, knows all the wise sayings.

original: bhuvad dūtovivasvato vi vo made priyo yamasya kāmyo vivakṣase
analyzed: bhuvat dūtaḥ vivasvataḥ vi vaḥ made priyaḥ yamasya kāmyaḥ vivakṣase
translated: He has become the messenger of Vivasvan. In your rapture, thou art dear to Yama, to be desired. Thou art about to expand.

original: tvāṃ yajñeṣvīḷate 'gne prayatyadhvare
analyzed: tvām yajñeṣu īḍate gne prayati adhvare
translated: In sacrifices, O Agni, they delight in thee, when the rite is begun.

original: tvaṃ vasūnikāmyā vi vo made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase
analyzed: tvam vasūni kāmyāḥ vi vaḥ made viśvā dadhāsi dāśuṣe vivakṣase
translated: Thou, O most desirable of the Vasus, in your rapture, bestowest all (good things) on the worshipper. Thou art about to expand.

original: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijaṃ cārumagne ni ṣedire
analyzed: tvām yajñeṣu ṛtvijam cārumagne ni sedire
translated: In sacrifices they have placed thee, O Agni, the beautiful priest.

original: ghṛtapratīkaṃ manuṣo vi vo made śukraṃ cetiṣṭhamakṣabhirvivakṣase
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkam manuṣaḥ vi vaḥ made śukram cetiṣṭham akṣabhiḥ vivakṣase
translated: The man with the face of ghee. In your rapture, the most radiant one with the rays. Thou art about to expand.

original: agne śukreṇa śociṣoru prathayase bṛhat
analyzed: agne śukreṇa śociṣā uru prathayase bṛhat
translated: O Agni, with thy bright flame thou spreadest thee out wide.

original: abhikrandanvṛṣāyase vi vo made garbhaṃ dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase
analyzed: abhikrandan vṛṣāyase vi vaḥ made garbham dadhāsi jāmiṣu vivakṣase
translated: Roaring, thou shinest as a bull. In your rapture, thou placest the germ in the young plants. Thou art about to expand.

original: kuha śruta indraḥ kasminnadya jane mitro na śruyate
analyzed: kuha śrutaḥ indraḥ kasmin adya jane mitraḥ na śruyate
translated: Where is Indra heard, in what people is Mitra heard today?

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ vā yaḥ kṣaye guhā va carkṛṣe gira
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām vā yaḥ kṣaye guhā carkṛṣe gira
translated: Or he who in the abode of the Rishis and in the cave acts

original: iha śruta indro asme adya stave vajry ṛcīṣamaḥ
analyzed: iha śrutaḥ indraḥ asme adya stave vajrī ṛcīṣamaḥ
translated: Here Indra is heard, by us today he is praised, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the impeller of the Ṛchis.

original: mitro nayo janeṣvā yaśaścakre asāmyā
analyzed: mitraḥ nayaḥ janeṣvā yaśaḥ cakre asāmyā
translated: Like Mitra, he has made fame among the people, unequalled.

original: maho yas patiḥ śavaso asāmyā maho nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ
analyzed: mahaḥ yaḥ patiḥ śavasaḥ asāmyā mahaḥ nṛmṇasya tūtujiḥ
translated: He who is the great lord of power, unequalled, the impeller of great valor,

original: bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putramiva priyam
analyzed: bhartā vajrasya dhṛṣṇoḥ pitā putram iva priyam
translated: The bearer of the thunderbolt, the bold one, like a father his beloved son.

original: yujāno aśva vātasya dhunī devo devasya vajrivaḥ🔽syantapathā virukmatā sṛjāna stoṣyadhvanaḥ
analyzed: yujānaḥ aśva vātasya dhunī devaḥ devasya vajrivas  syanta pathā virukmatā sṛjāna stoṣyadhvanaḥ
translated: Yoking the horses of the wind, the god of the god with the thunderbolt,🔽On the path of the sun, with splendor, releasing, you shall praise the sound.

original: tvaṃ tyā cid vātasyāśvāgā ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai
analyzed: tvam tyā cit vātasya aśvāgāḥ ṛjrā tmanā vahadhyai
translated: Even those two swift horses of the wind you yoke by yourself to carry

original: yayordevo na martyo yantā nakirvidāyyaḥ🔽adha gmantośanā pṛchate vāṃ kadarthā na ā gṛham
analyzed: yayoḥ devaḥ na martyaḥ yantā nakirvidāyyaḥ  adha gmantā uśanā pṛcchate vām kadarthāḥ naḥ ā gṛham
translated: Whose charioteer is neither a god nor a mortal, whom no one can guide.🔽Then Tvaṣṭar, having come, asks you: For what purpose have you come to my house?

original: ājagmathuḥ parākād divaśca gmaśca martyam
analyzed: ājagmathuḥ parākāt divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca martyam
translated: You have come from afar, from heaven and earth to the mortal.

original: ā na indra pṛkṣase 'smākaṃ brahmodyatam
analyzed: ā naḥ indra pṛkṣase smākam brahma udyatam
translated: Come, O Indra, to our food, our prayer is raised to you.

original: tat tvāyācāmahe 'vaḥ śuṣṇaṃ yad dhannamānuṣam
analyzed: tat tvā āyācāmahe vaḥ śuṣṇam yat hanna mānuṣam
translated: We beg of you that favor, that you slay the wicked man.

original: akarmā dasyurabhi no amanturanyavrato amānuṣaḥ
analyzed: akarmā dasyuḥ abhi naḥ amantuḥ anya vrataḥ amānuṣaḥ
translated: The Dasyu, who has no work, who hates us, who has a different vow, who is not a human.

original: tvantasyāmitrahan vadhardāsasya dambhaya
analyzed: tvantasya amitra han vadhardāsasya dambhaya
translated: O slayer of enemies, destroy the foe of that slave of thine

original: tvaṃ na indra śūra śūrairuta tvotāso barhaṇā
analyzed: tvam naḥ indra śūra śūraiḥ uta tvotāsaḥ barhaṇā
translated: O Indra, the strong ones, the heroes, and those who are invoked by us

original: purutrāte vi pūrtayo navanta kṣoṇayo yathā
analyzed: purutrāte vi pūrtayaḥ navanta kṣoṇayaḥ yathā
translated: From many a place your gifts are extolled, as in the habitations of men

original: tvaṃ tān vṛtrahatye codayo nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ
analyzed: tvam tān vṛtra hatye codayaḥ nṝn kārpāṇe śūra vajrivas
translated: You have urged those men to the slaying of Vrtra, O hero, O wielder of the thunderbolt, in the battle with the sword

original: guhā yadī kavīnāṃ viśāṃ nakṣatraśavasām
analyzed: guhā yadī kavīnām viśām nakṣatra śavasām
translated: When the secret plans of the sages, of the people who shine with the splendor of the stars

original: makṣū tā ta indra dānāpnasa ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivaḥ
analyzed: makṣū tā te indra dānā apnasaḥ ākṣāṇe śūra vajrivas
translated: Those bountiful gifts of yours, O Indra, are not slow, O hero, O wielder of the thunderbolt, in the contest

original: yad dha śuṣṇasya dambhayo jātaṃ viśvaṃ sayāvabhiḥ
analyzed: yat ha śuṣṇasya dambhayaḥ jātam viśvam sa yāvabhiḥ
translated: When you destroy the offspring of Shushna with all the Svijas

original: mākudhryagindra śūra vasvīrasme bhūvannabhiṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: mākudhryak indra śūra vasvīḥ asme bhūvan abhiṣṭayaḥ
translated: Let not the blessings, O hero Indra, be far away from us, let the praises be near

original: vayaṃvayaṃ ta āsāṃ sumne syāma vajrivaḥ
analyzed: vayam vayam te āsām sumne syāma vajrivas
translated: May we, may we be in the favor of those, O wielder of the thunderbolt

original: asme tā ta indra santu satyāhiṃsantīrupaspṛśaḥ🔽vidyāmayāsāṃ bhujo dhenūnāṃ na vajrivaḥ
analyzed: asme tā te indra santu satyā a hiṃsantīḥ upaspṛśaḥ  vidyāma yāsām bhujaḥ dhenūnām na vajrivas
translated: Let those be true for you, O Indra, the harmless, the refreshing ones🔽May we know the paths of those, O wielder of the thunderbolt, of the milch cows

original: ahastā yadapadī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhirvedyānām
analyzed: a hastā yad apadī vardhata kṣāḥ śacībhiḥ vedyānām
translated: When the formless, the footless grows the worlds by your powers

original: śuṣṇaṃ pari pradakṣiṇid viśvāyave ni śiśnathaḥ
analyzed: śuṣṇam pari pradakṣiṇit viśvāyave ni śiśnathaḥ
translated: You have crushed Shushna, the all-devouring, to pieces

original: pibāpibedindra śūra somaṃ mā riṣaṇyo vasavāna vasuḥsan
analyzed: piba a pibet indra śūra somam mā riṣaṇyaḥ vasavāna vasuḥsan
translated: Drink, O Indra, the hero, the Soma, be not angry, O wealthy one, being full of wealth

original: uta trāyasva gṛṇato maghono mahaśca rāyo revataskṛdhī naḥ🔽yajāmaha indraṃ vajradakṣiṇaṃ harīṇāṃ rathyaṃvivratānām
analyzed: uta trāyasva gṛṇataḥ maghonaḥ mahaḥ ca rāyaḥ revataskṛdhi naḥ  yajāmahe indram vajra dakṣiṇam harīṇām rathyam vivratānām
translated: And do thou save the singers and the wealthy, and make our riches great, O bountiful one.🔽We worship Indra, whose right hand wields the thunderbolt, the charioteer of the two bay steeds, the leader of the free.

original: pra śmaśru dodhuvadūrdhvathā bhūd visenābhirdayamāno vi rādhasā
analyzed: pra śmaśru dodhuvat ūrdhvathā bhūt visenābhiḥ dayamānaḥ vi rādhasā
translated: He has shaken his beard upwards, he has shone forth with his armies, with his bounty.

original: harī nvasya yā vane vide vasvindro maghairmaghavāvṛtrahā bhuvat
analyzed: harī nu asya yā vane vide vasu indraḥ maghaiḥ maghavā a vṛtra hā bhuvat
translated: The two bay steeds of him who knows the forest, Indra, the bountiful, the Vr̥itra-slayer, has become rich in treasures.

original: ṛbhurvāja ṛbhukṣāḥ patyate śavo 'vakṣṇaumi dāsasya nāma cit
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ vājaḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ patyate śavaḥ vakṣṇaumi dāsasya nāma cit
translated: The strong, the powerful, the eager for strength, the lord, I crush the very name of the Dāsa.

original: yadā vajraṃ hiraṇyamidathā rathaṃ harī yamasyavahato vi sūribhiḥ
analyzed: yadā vajram hiraṇyam idathā ratham harī yamasi avahataḥ vi sūribhiḥ
translated: When he, with his charioteers, takes his golden thunderbolt, his two bay steeds, and his chariot,

original: ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sanaśruta indrovājasya dīrghaśravasas patiḥ🔽so cin nu vṛṣṭiryūthyā svā sacānindraḥ śmaśrūṇiharitābhi pruṣṇute
analyzed: ā tiṣṭhati maghavā sana śrutaḥ indrovājasya dīrghaśravasaḥ patiḥ  sā u cit nu vṛṣṭiḥ yūthyā svā sacā an indraḥ śmaśrūṇi haritā abhi pruṣṇute
translated: Then the bountiful Indra, renowned in assemblies, stands forth, the lord of the long-famed prize.🔽He, indeed, is the rain-cloud, with his own companions, Indra moistens his tawny beard.

original: ava veti sukṣayaṃ sute madhūdiddhūnoti vāto yathā vanam
analyzed: ava veti su kṣayam sute madhu udit hūnoti vātaḥ yathā vanam
translated: He comes to the well-protected place, the pressed Soma, the honey. The wind blows him as if he were a tree.

original: yo vācā vivāco mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrāśivā jaghāna
analyzed: yaḥ vācā vivācaḥ mṛdhravācaḥ purū sahasrā aśivāḥ jaghāna
translated: He who with his voice, with his discordant, spiteful voice, has slain many thousands,

original: tattadidasya pauṃsyaṃ gṛṇīmasi piteva yastaviṣīṃvāvṛdhe śavaḥ
analyzed: tat tat id asya pauṃsyam gṛṇīmasi pitā iva yaḥ taviṣī iva āvṛdhe śavaḥ
translated: That manly deed of his we extol, he who, like a father, has increased his strength and power.

original: stomaṃ ta indra vimadā ajījanannapūrvyaṃ purutamaṃsudānave
analyzed: stomam te indra vimadāḥ ajījanan apūrvyam purutamam sudānave
translated: O Indra, the ecstatic ones have generated for thee a hymn, most ancient, most manifold, O thou who givest much

original: vidmā hyasya bhojanaminasya yadā paśuṃ nagopāḥ karāmahe
analyzed: vidma hi asya bhojanaminasya yadā paśum naga upāḥ karāmahe
translated: For we know his food, O thou who art to be invoked, when we make him a victim like a cowherd

original: mākirna enā sakhyā vi yauśustava cendra vimadasya caṛśeḥ
analyzed: mākir naḥ enā sakhyā vi yauśuḥ tava ca indra vimadasya caṛśeḥ
translated: Let not our friendship with thee be broken, O Indra, nor with the ecstatic R̥ishi

original: vidmā hi te pramatiṃ deva jāmivadasme te santusakhyā śivāni
analyzed: vidma hi te pramatim deva jāmi vat asme te santu sakhyā śivāni
translated: For we know thy favour, O God, as if it were a kinsman; may thy friendships with us be auspicious

original: indra somamimaṃ piba madhumantaṃ camū sutam
analyzed: indra somam imam piba madhumantam camū sutam
translated: O Indra, drink this Soma, rich in sweetness, pressed in the wooden vessel

original: asme rayiṃni dhāraya vi vo made sahasriṇaṃ purūvaso vivakṣase🔽tvāṃ yajñebhirukthairupa havyebhirīmahe
analyzed: asme rayiṃni dhāraya vi vaḥ made sahasriṇam purūvaso vivakṣase  tvām yajñebhiḥ ukthaiḥ upa havyebhiḥ īmahe
translated: Bestow upon us wealth, O thou of abundant wealth, in a thousand portions, in your joy🔽We invite thee with sacrifices, with hymns, with offerings

original: śacīpateśacīnāṃ vi vo made śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryaṃ vivakṣase
analyzed: śacīpate śacīnām vi vaḥ made śreṣṭham naḥ dhehi vāryam vivakṣase
translated: O lord of power, bestow on us the best boon in your joy, O thou of abundant wealth

original: yas patirvāryāṇāmasi radhrasya coditā🔽indrastotṝṇāmavitā vi vo made dviṣo naḥ pāhyaṃhasovivakṣase
analyzed: yaḥ patiḥ vāryāṇām asi radhrasya coditā  indra stotṝṇām avitā vi vaḥ made dviṣaḥ naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ vivakṣase
translated: Thou who art the lord of good things, the impeller of the poor🔽O Indra, protect us from hatred, from affliction, in your joy, O thou of abundant wealth

original: yuvaṃ śakrā māyāvinā samīcī nīramanthatam
analyzed: yuvam śakrā māyāvinā samīcī nīramanthatam
translated: You two, O Shakra, have churned the waters together, you who are full of magic power

original: vimadenayadiḷita nasatya niramanthatam
analyzed: nasatya niramanthatam
translated: You have churned with the churning stick, O Nâsatyas, with the churning stick of the ecstatic one

original: viśve devā akṛpanta samicyorniṣpatantyoḥ🔽nasatyavabruvandevaḥ punarā vahataditi
analyzed: viśve devāḥ akṛpanta samicyoḥ niṣpatantyoḥ 🔽nasati avabruvan devaḥ punar ā vahatat iti
translated: All the gods were concerned when the two churning sticks fell out🔽The god said to the Nâsatyas: Bring it back!

original: madhuman me parāyaṇaṃ madhumat punarayanam
analyzed: madhumat me parāyaṇam madhumat punarayanam
translated: Sweet is my going away, sweet is my coming back again

original: ta no devadevataya yuvaṃ madhumatas kṛtam
analyzed: ta naḥ deva devataya yuvam madhumataḥ kṛtam
translated: Do ye, O ye Gods of the Gods, make that sweet for us

original: bhadraṃ no api vātaya mano dakṣamuta kratum
analyzed: bhadram naḥ api vātaya manaḥ dakṣam uta kratum
translated: Impel for us a good mind, and skill, and understanding

original: adhā tesakhye andhaso vi vo made raṇan gavo na yavase vivakṣase
analyzed: adhā tesakhye andhasaḥ vi vaḥ made raṇan gavaḥ na yavase vivakṣase
translated: Then in the joy of thy juice, in the rivalry of your joys, let the cows bellow for me in the companionship of thy juice, as in a pasture. Thou expandest

original: hṛdispṛśasta asate viśveṣu soma dha masu
analyzed: hṛdispṛśaḥ te asate viśveṣu soma dha masu
translated: They, touching the heart, are placed in all the Soma-pressings, O Soma

original: adhā kāmā imemama vi vo made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavo vivakṣase
analyzed: adha kāmāḥ imāḥ imama vi vaḥ made vi tiṣṭhante vasūyavaḥ vivakṣase
translated: Then these desires of mine, tending to wealth, are set free in the joy of your joy, in the rivalry of your joys. Thou expandest

original: uta vratani soma te prahaṃ mināmi pākyā
analyzed: uta vratani soma te praham mināmi pākyā
translated: And, O Soma, I break through thy vow, as one who is ripe for prosperity

original: adhā pitevasūnave vi vo made mṛḷa no abhi cid vadhād vivakṣase
analyzed: adhā piteva sūnave vi vaḥ made mṛḍa naḥ abhi cit vadhāt vivakṣase
translated: Then, O father, for the sake of prosperity, be gracious to us even from afar, in the joy of your joy, in the rivalry of your joys. Thou expandest

original: samu pra yanti dhītayaḥ sargāso 'vatāniva
analyzed: samu pra yanti dhītayaḥ sargāsaḥ vatān iva
translated: The thoughts go forth together, the outpourings as it were of water

original: kratuṃ naḥsoma jivase vi vo made dharayā camasāniva vivakṣase
analyzed: kratum naḥsoma jivase vi vaḥ made dharayā camasān iva vivakṣase
translated: Give us understanding, O Soma, for life, in the joy of your joy, as it were holding up the bowls. Thou expandest

original: tava tye soma śaktibhirnikāmāso vy ṛṇvire
analyzed: tava tye soma śaktibhiḥ nikāmāsaḥ vi ṛṇvire
translated: These, O Soma, have been loosened by thy powers, as it were, in their own places

original: gṛtsasyadhirastavaso vi vo made vrajaṃ gomantamaśvinaṃ vivakṣase
analyzed: gṛtsasya dhiraḥ tavasaḥ vi vaḥ made vrajam gomantam aśvinam vivakṣase
translated: The firm one of the strong one, of thee, O thou of great wealth, in the joy of your joy, the stall full of cattle and horses. Thou expandest

original: paśuṃ naḥ soma rakṣasi purutra viṣṭhitaṃ jagat
analyzed: paśum naḥ soma rakṣasi purutra viṣṭhitam jagat
translated: Thou, O Soma, protectest our cattle, O thou of much wealth, the world that is spread out

original: samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vo made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvanavivakṣase
analyzed: samākṛṇoṣi jīvase vi vaḥ made viśvā sampaśyan bhuvana vivakṣase
translated: thou orderest all things for life, looking on all the worlds in your joy, thou art about to speak

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma viśvato gopa adabhyo bhava
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma viśvatas gopa adabhyaḥ bhava
translated: be thou a protector for us, O Soma, from every side, O thou that art not to be deceived

original: sedha rājannapasridho vi vo made ma no duḥ śaṃsa īśatā vivakṣase
analyzed: sedha rājan apasridhaḥ vi vaḥ made mā naḥ duḥ śaṃsaḥ īśatā vivakṣase
translated: drive away, O king, those who are hostile, in your joy, let not the evil-wisher rule over us, thou art about to speak

original: tvaṃ naḥ soma sukraturva yodheyāya jāgṛhi
analyzed: tvam naḥ soma su kratuḥ vaḥ yodheyāya jāgṛhi
translated: be thou, O Soma, of good counsel for us, to watch over us in the conflict

original: kṣetravittaromanuṣo vi vo made druho naḥ pāhyaṃhaso vivakṣase🔽tvaṃ no vṛtra hantamendrasyendo śivaḥ sakhā🔽yat siṃhavante samithe vi vo made yudhyamanastokasātauvivakṣase
analyzed: kṣetra vittaraḥ manuṣaḥ vi vaḥ made druhaḥ naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ vivakṣase  tvam naḥ vṛtra hantama indrasya indo śivaḥ sakhā  yat siṃhavante samithe vi vaḥ made
translated: more skilled in the field than man, in your joy, protect us from the foe's attack, thou art about to speak

original: ayaṃ gha sa turo mada indrasya vardhata priyaḥ
analyzed: ayam gha sa turaḥ madaḥ indrasya vardhata priyaḥ
translated: this, O Indra, is thy strong and dear exhilarating drink, O Indu,

original: ayaṃkakṣīvato maho vi vo made matiṃ viprasya vardhayadvivakṣase
analyzed: ayaṃkakṣīvataḥ mahaḥ vi vaḥ made matim viprasya vardhayat vivakṣase
translated: this is Kakshivan's great, in your joy, which exalts the sage's thought, thou art about to speak

original: ayaṃ vipraya daśuṣe vajaniyarti gomataḥ
analyzed: ayam daśuṣe vaja niyarti gomataḥ
translated: this, O Indra, is the treasure of the worshipper, which the wealthy one distributes to the poor,

original: ayaṃsaptabhya ā varaṃ vi vo made prandhaṃ śroṇaṃ catariṣad vivakṣase
analyzed: ā varam vi vaḥ made prandham śroṇam catariṣat vivakṣase
translated: this, O Indra, is better than the seven, in your joy, the gift which the wealthy one bestows, thou art about to speak

original: pra hyachā manīṣā spārha yanti niyutaḥ
analyzed: pra hi achā manīṣā spārha yanti niyutaḥ
translated: these, O Indra, are the thoughts, the teams that long for the prize,

original: pra dasrāniyudrathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
analyzed: pra dasra a niyut rathaḥ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
translated: these, O Indra, are the two wondrous ones, the chariot-borne, the mighty Pusan, who have come to us

original: yasya tyan mahitvaṃ vatāpyamayaṃ janaḥ🔽vipra ā vaṃsaddhītibhiściketa suṣṭutīnām
analyzed: yasya tyad mahi tvam vata api amayam janaḥ  vipraḥ ā vaṃsat dhītibhiḥ ciketa suṣṭutīnām
translated: Whose greatness, though it is to be praised, this people🔽The sage has discerned with his thoughts and with the most excellent praises.

original: sa veda suṣṭutīnāmindurna pūṣa vṛṣā
analyzed: sa veda suṣṭutīnām induḥ na pūṣa vṛṣā
translated: He knows the most excellent praises, like the bull Pusan, the moon.

original: abhi psuraḥpruṣāyati vrajaṃ na ā pruṣāyati
analyzed: abhi psuraḥpruṣāyati vrajam naḥ ā pruṣāyati
translated: He causes the rain to fall on the cattle, he causes it to rain on the pen.🔽We would honor you, O god Pusan, for us

original: maṃsīmahi tvā vayamasmākaṃ deva pūṣan🔽matmāṃ casādhanaṃ viprāṇāṃ cādhavam
analyzed: maṃsīmahi tvā vayam asmākam deva pūṣan  viprāṇām ca ādhavam
translated: The impeller of the mind and the leader of the sages.

original: pratyardhiryajñanāmaśvahayo rathānām
analyzed: pratyardhiḥ yajñanām aśva hayaḥ rathānām
translated: The counter-striker of the names of sacrifices, the horse-rider of the chariots,

original: ṛṣiḥ sa yomanurhito viprasya yāvayatsakhaḥ
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ sa yaḥ manuḥ hitaḥ viprasya yāvayat sakhaḥ
translated: The sage who is well-disposed, the friend of the sage who leads.

original: adhīṣamāṇāyāḥ patiḥ śucāyāśca śucasya ca
analyzed: adhīṣamāṇāyāḥ patiḥ śucāyāḥ ca śucasya ca
translated: The husband of the one who is studying and of the one who is pure, and of the one who is pure.

original: vāsovayo 'vīnāmā vāsāṃsi marmṛjat
analyzed: vāsaḥ vayaḥ vīnāmā vāsāṃsi marmṛjat
translated: The garment of the sheep, the garment of the sheep, he cleanses the garments.

original: ino vājānāṃ patirinaḥ puṣṭīnaṃ sakha
analyzed: inaḥ vājānām patiḥ inaḥ puṣṭīnam sakha
translated: The lord of the powers, the lord of the nourishments, the friend.

original: pra śmaśruharyato dūdhod vi vṛtha yo adābhyaḥ
analyzed: pra śmaśru haryataḥ dūdhot vi vṛtha yaḥ adābhyaḥ
translated: The one with a beard, the one who is shaken, the one who is dispersed, the one who is irresistible.

original: ā te rathasya pūṣannajā dhuraṃ vavṛtyuḥ
analyzed: ā te rathasya pūṣan ajāḥ dhuram vavṛtyuḥ
translated: The two yokes of your chariot, O Pusan, have turned back the yoke.

original: viśvasyārthinaḥ sakhā sanojā anapacyutaḥ
analyzed: viśvasya arthinaḥ sakhā sanaḥ jāḥ an apacyutaḥ
translated: The friend of every seeker, the one who is born again, the one who does not fall away.

original: asmakamurjā rathaṃ pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
analyzed: asmakam ūrjā ratham pūṣā aviṣṭu māhinaḥ
translated: Pusan has mounted our chariot with great strength.

original: bhuvadvajanāṃ vṛdha imaṃ naḥ śṛṇavad dhavam
analyzed: bhuvat vajanām vṛdhaḥ imam naḥ śṛṇavat dhavam
translated: He has become the supporter of the people, may he listen to this call of ours.

original: asat su me jaritaḥ sābhivego yat sunvate yajamanaya śikṣam
analyzed: asat su me jaritar sa abhivegaḥ yat sunvate yajamanaya śikṣam
translated: May it be so for me, O worshipper, with the speed of the wind, that I may instruct the sacrificer who presses out (the Soma).

original: anāśīrdāmahamasmi prahantā satyadhvṛtaṃ vṛjināyantamābhum
analyzed: anāśīrdām aham asmi prahantā satya dhvṛtam vṛjināyantam ābhum
translated: I am the one who strikes down the one who does not give his blessing, the one who upholds truth, the one who goes to the fortress

original: yadīdahaṃ yudhaye saṃnayānyadevayūn tanvāśūśujānān
analyzed: yadīdaham yudhaye saṃnayāni a devayūn tanvā aśūśujānān
translated: When I prepare for battle, when I go to fight against those who worship other gods, those who are quick to anger

original: amā te tumraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ pacāni tīvraṃsutaṃ pañcadaśaṃ ni ṣiñcam
analyzed: amā te tumram vṛṣabham pacāni tīvraṃsutam pañcadaśam ni siñcam
translated: I will cook for you a tender bull, I will pour out the strong fifteenfold juice

original: nāhaṃ taṃ veda ya iti bravītyadevayūn samaraṇejaghanvān
analyzed: na aham tam veda yaḥ iti bravīti adevayūn samaraṇejaghanvān
translated: I do not know him who says this, who goes to the assembly with his knees knocking, worshipping other gods

original: yadāvākhyat samaraṇam ṛghāvadādid dha mevṛṣabhā pra bruvanti
analyzed: yadā avākhyat samaraṇam ha mevṛṣabhā pra bruvanti
translated: When he has spoken in the assembly, when he has spoken harshly, then indeed the bulls speak to me

original: yadajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣvāsaṃ viśve sato maghavāno maāsan
analyzed: yat ajñāteṣu vṛjaneṣu āsam viśve sataḥ maghavānaḥ mā āsan
translated: When I was among unknown people, among all the wealthy ones who were present, they were my friends

original: jināmi vet kṣema ā santamābhuṃ pra taṃkṣiṇāṃ parvate pādagṛhya
analyzed: jināmi vet kṣeme ā santam ābhum pra taṃkṣiṇām parvate pādagṛhya
translated: I conquer the one who comes to me for peace, I crush him, seizing him by the foot on the mountain

original: na vā u māṃ vṛjane vārayante na parvatāso yadahammanasye
analyzed: na vai u mām vṛjane vārayante na parvatāsaḥ yat ahammanasye
translated: They do not turn me back in the assembly, the mountains do not, when I have a thought

original: mama svanāt kṛdhukarṇo bhayāta evedanu dyūnkiraṇaḥ samejāt
analyzed: mama svanāt kṛdhu karṇaḥ bhayāt eva idanu dyūn kiraṇaḥ samejāt
translated: At the sound of my name, let him be deafened, let him be scorched by the rays of the sun

original: darśan nvatra śṛtapānanindrān bāhukṣadaḥ śaravepatyamānān
analyzed: darśan nu atra śṛta pānan indrān bāhukṣadaḥ śara vepatyamānān
translated: Seeing here the Indras who drink the hot liquor, the mighty ones trembling for the prize

original: ghṛṣuṃ vā ye niniduḥ sakhāyamadhyū nveṣu pavayo vavṛtyuḥ
analyzed: ghṛṣum vā ye niniduḥ nu eṣu pavayaḥ vavṛtyuḥ
translated: Those who have reviled the cheerful friend, the waters have turned away from them

original: abhūrvaukṣīrvyu āyurānaḍ darṣan nu pūrvo aparonu darṣat
analyzed: āyuḥ ānaṭ darṣat nu pūrvaḥ aparaḥ nu darṣat
translated: He has become, he has grown, he has extended his life, he has seen the former, he has seen the later

original: dve pavaste pari taṃ na bhūto yo asya pārerajaso viveṣa🔽gāvo yavaṃ prayutā aryo akṣan tā apaśyaṃ sahagopāścarantīḥ
analyzed: dve pavaste pari tam na bhūtaḥ yaḥ asya pārerajasaḥ viveṣa  gāvaḥ yavam prayutāḥ aryaḥ akṣan tāḥ apaśyam saha gopāḥ carantīḥ
translated: two are the sheaths that enclose him on both sides he who hath gone beyond the end of his raiment🔽the cows have eaten the barley sown by the pious i have seen them grazing with their herdsmen

original: havā idaryo abhitaḥ samāyan kiyadāsusvapatiśchandayāte
analyzed: havāḥ idaryaḥ abhitas samāyan kiyat asu sva patiḥ chandayāte
translated: the pious have come together from all sides how much will the lord of the house favour them

original: saṃ yad vayaṃ yavasādo janānāmahaṃ yavāda urvajreantaḥ🔽atrā yukto 'vasātāramichādatho ayuktaṃ yunajadvavanvān
analyzed: sam yat vayam yavasādaḥ janānām aham yava adaḥ uru ajreantaḥ  atrā yuktaḥ vasātāram ichāt atho a yuktam yunajat vavanvān
translated: when we the slayers of men's corn have gathered here i in the midst of the corn in the broad place🔽here let the yoked one seek the unyoked one and the unyoked one the yoked one when he is hungry

original: atredu me maṃsase satyamuktaṃ dvipācca yaccatuṣpātsaṃsṛjāni🔽strībhiryo atra vṛṣaṇaṃ pṛtanyādayuddhoasya vi bhajāni vedaḥ
analyzed: atrā idu me maṃsase satyam uktam dvipād ca yat catuṣpād saṃsṛjāni  strībhiḥ yaḥ atra vṛṣaṇam pṛtanyāt ayuddhaḥ asya vi bhajāni vedaḥ
translated: here i think of thy true word that i may unite the two footed and the four footed together🔽he who would fight with the bull here with the women i would divide his wealth without a struggle

original: yasyānakṣā duhitā jātvāsa kastāṃ vidvānabhimanyāte andhām
analyzed: yasya anakṣā duhitā jātu āsa kaḥ tām vidvān abhimanyāte andhām
translated: whose daughter born blind hath no eyes who knowing would desire that blind one

original: kataro meniṃ prati taṃ mucāte ya īṃvahāte ya īṃ vā vareyāt🔽kiyatī yoṣā maryato vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasāvāryeṇa
analyzed: kataraḥ menim prati tam mucāte yaḥ īṃvahāte yaḥ īm vā vareyāt  kiyatī yoṣā maryataḥ vadhūyoḥ pariprītā panyasā avāryeṇa
translated: which of you will release the thought of him who would lead her or would choose her🔽how many women are there of the two brides well pleased with the good choice of the noble one

original: bhadrā vadhūrbhavati yat supeśāḥ svayaṃ sāmitraṃ vanute jane cit
analyzed: bhadrā vadhūḥ bhavati yat supeśāḥ svayam sāmitram vanute jane cit
translated: she is a happy bride who with fair locks of hair wins friendship for herself even among the people

original: patto jagāra pratyañcamatti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhauvarūtham
analyzed: pattas jagāra pratyañcam atti śīrṣṇā śiraḥ prati dadhau varūtham
translated: the bird hath eaten the food that comes from the front with his head he hath set his head as a covering

original: āsīna ūrdhvāmupasi kṣiṇāti nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveti bhūmim
analyzed: āsīnaḥ ūrdhvām upasi kṣiṇāti nyaṃ uttānām anveti bhūmim
translated: Sitting above, he licks the upper one; he follows the prone one, the earth.

original: bṛhannachāyo apalāśo arvā tasthau mātā viṣito attigarbhaḥ
analyzed: bṛhan achāyaḥ a palāśaḥ arvā tasthau mātā viṣitaḥ atti garbhaḥ
translated: The great one, with no shade, no leaves, stands here; the mother, the extended one, eats the son.

original: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā nidadhe dhenurūdhaḥ
analyzed: anyasyāḥ vatsam rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā nidadhe dhenu rūdhaḥ
translated: Licking the calf of another, she melts; with what substance has the cow placed her udders?

original: sapta vīrāso adharādudāyannaṣṭottarāttāt samajagmiran te🔽nava paścātāt sthivimanta āyan daśa prāksānu vi tirantyaśnaḥ
analyzed: sapta vīrāsaḥ adharāt udāyan aṣṭa uttarāttāt samajagmiran te  nava paścātāt sthivimantaḥ āyan daśa prāk sānu vi tiranti aśnaḥ
translated: Seven heroes have come up from below; eight have come together from above.🔽Nine have come from behind with a firm base; ten extend the light in front.

original: daśānāmekaṃ kapilaṃ samānaṃ taṃ hinvanti kratavepāryāya🔽garbhaṃ mātā sudhitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvavenantantuṣayantī bibharti
analyzed: daśānām ekam kapilam samānam tam hinvanti kratu vepāryāya  garbham mātā sudhitam vakṣaṇāsu avenantantuṣayantī bibharti
translated: The tawny one is the common one of the ten; they urge him on for the sake of the highest goal.🔽The mother bears the well-formed embryo in her womb, nourishing it as it moves.

original: pīvānaṃ meṣamapacanta vīrā nyuptā akṣā anu dīvaāsan🔽dvā dhanuṃ bṛhatīmapsvantaḥ pavitravantā carataḥpunantā
analyzed: pīvānam meṣam apacanta vīrāḥ nyuptāḥ akṣāḥ anu dīvaḥ āsan  dvā dhanum bṛhatīm apsu antar pavitravantā carataḥpunantā
translated: The heroes have cooked the fat sheep; the dice have been cast for the gambling match.🔽Two, in the waters, move the great bow, purifying and cleansing, with the strainer.

original: vi krośanāso viṣvañca āyan pacāti nemo nahi pakṣadardhaḥ
analyzed: vi krośanāsaḥ viṣvañcaḥ āyan pacāti nemaḥ nahi pakṣa dardhaḥ
translated: The far-reachers have gone out in all directions; the one who is not cut in half cooks.

original: ayaṃ me devaḥ savitā tadāha drvanna id vanavatsarpirannaḥ
analyzed: ayam me devaḥ savitā tat āha dru annaḥ id vanavat sarpiḥ annaḥ
translated: This god Savitar has told me that; he who eats food eats ghee.

original: apaśyaṃ grāmaṃ vahamānamārādacakrayā svadhayāvartamānam
analyzed: apaśyam grāmam vahamānam ārāt acakrayā svadhayā āvartamānam
translated: I have seen a village being carried from afar, moving by its own unmoving law.

original: siṣaktyaryaḥ pra yugā janānāṃ sadyaḥśiśnā pramināno navīyān
analyzed: siṣakti aryaḥ pra yugā janānām sadyas śiśnā praminānaḥ navīyān
translated: He yokes the teams of men, the guest of men, the new one, with feet that are born anew,

original: etau me gāvau pramarasya yuktau mo ṣu pra sedhīrmuhurinmamandhi🔽āpaścidasya vi naśantyarthaṃ sūraśca markauparo babhūvān
analyzed: etau me gāvau pramarasya yuktau mā u su pra sedhīḥ muhur id mamandhi  āpaḥ cit asya vi naśanti artham sūraḥ ca markauparaḥ babhūvān
translated: These two oxen of mine are yoked, the swift ones; do not delay, but quickly think of me.🔽Even the waters destroy his purpose; the sun and the wolf have become his superior.

original: ayaṃ yo vajraḥ purudhā vivṛtto 'vaḥ sūryasya bṛhataḥpurīṣāt
analyzed: ayam yaḥ vajraḥ purudhā vivṛttaḥ vaḥ sūryasya bṛhataḥ purīṣāt
translated: This thunderbolt of his, which has been hurled in many places, is from the lofty dung of the sun.

original: śrava idenā paro anyadasti tadavyathījarimāṇastaranti
analyzed: śravaḥ id enā paras anyat asti tat avyathī jarimāṇaḥ taranti
translated: There is another glory beyond this; they cross it, the undecaying ones, the old ones.

original: vṛkṣevṛkṣe niyatā mīmayad gaustato vayaḥ pra patānpuruṣādaḥ
analyzed: vṛkṣe vṛkṣe niyatā mīmayat gauḥ tatas vayaḥ pra patān puruṣādaḥ
translated: The cow, restrained, is lowing at every tree; from there the bird, the man-eater, flies away.

original: athedaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ bhayāta idrāyasunvad ṛṣaye ca śikṣat
analyzed: athā idam viśvam bhuvanam bhayāt idrāya sunvat ṛṣaye ca śikṣat
translated: Then this whole world was frightened; it submitted to Indra, the Soma-presser, and to the Rishi.

original: devānāṃ māne prathamā atiṣṭhan kṛntatradeṣamupara udāyan
analyzed: devānām māne prathamāḥ atiṣṭhan kṛntatrat iṣam upare udāyan
translated: They stood in the highest measure of the gods; they rose up above the cutting and the tearing.

original: trayastapanti pṛthivimanūpa dva bṛbūkaṃ vahataḥpurīṣam
analyzed: trayaḥ tapanti pṛthivim anūpa dva bṛbūkam vahataḥpurīṣam
translated: Three burn the earth from above; two carry the dung of the bull.

original: sā te jīvāturuta tasya viddhi ma smaitādṛgapa gūhaḥsamarye
analyzed: sā te jīvātuḥ uta tasya viddhi mā smā etādṛś apa gūhaḥ samarye
translated: Know that one is your living one, and that one; do not hide such a one in the assembly.

original: aviḥ svaḥ kṛṇute gūhate busaṃ sa pādurasyanirṇijo na mucyate
analyzed: aviḥ svar kṛṇute gūhate busam sa pādurasya nirṇijaḥ na mucyate
translated: The cow makes her own heaven, she conceals the calf; she is not released from her covering.

original: viśvo hyanyo arirājagāma mamedaha śvaśuro na jagāma
analyzed: viśvaḥ hi anyaḥ arirājagāma mama id aha śvaśuraḥ na jagāma
translated: For all the other enemies have come; this one, my father-in-law, has not come to me.

original: jakṣīyād dhanā uta somaṃ papīyāt svāśitaḥ punarastaṃ jagāyāt
analyzed: jakṣīyāt dhanā uta somam papīyāt su āśitaḥ punar astam jagāyāt
translated: He would eat wealth and drink Soma, well-fed, he would return again to his home

original: sa roruvad vṛṣabhastigmaśṛngo varṣman tasthāu varimannāpṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: sa roruvat vṛṣabhaḥ tigma śṛngaḥ varṣman tasthau variman ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: He roars, the bull with a sharp horn, he stands in the wide space of the earth

original: viśveṣvenaṃ vṛjaneṣu pāmi yo me kukṣisutasomaḥ pṛṇāti
analyzed: viśveṣu enam vṛjaneṣu pāmi yaḥ me kukṣi suta somaḥ pṛṇāti
translated: I honour him in all the assemblies who fills my belly with Soma-juice

original: adriṇā te mandina indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvameśām
analyzed: adriṇā te mandinaḥ indra tūyān sunvanti somān pibasi tvam īśām
translated: With the stone, O Indra, the impetuous ones press for thee the strong Soma; thou drinkest of them as their lord

original: pacanti te vṛṣabhānatsi teṣāṃ pṛkṣeṇa yanmaghavan hūyamānaḥ
analyzed: pacanti te vṛṣabha anatsi teṣām pṛkṣeṇa yat maghavan hūyamānaḥ
translated: They cook for thee; thou eatest the bulls; when, O bountiful one, thou art invoked with food

original: idaṃ su me jaritarā cikiddhi pratīpaṃ śāpaṃ nadyovahanti
analyzed: idam su me jaritarā cikiddhi pratīpam śāpam nadyaḥ vahanti
translated: Mark this of mine, O singer! The rivers carry away the curse that is turned against me

original: lopāśaḥ siṃhaṃ pratyañcamatsāḥ kroṣṭāvarāhaṃ niratakta kakṣāt
analyzed: lopāśaḥ siṃham pratyañca matsāḥ kroṣṭāvarāham niratakta kakṣāt
translated: Lopāśa, the lion, the boar, the jackal, the fire have driven away

original: katha ta etadahamā ciketaṃ gṛtsasya pākastavasomanīṣām
analyzed: katha te etat aham ā ciketam gṛtsasya pākastavasoma nīṣām
translated: How have I understood this, the wise one's thought, O Pākastamba?

original: tvaṃ no vidvān ṛtuthā vi voco yamardhaṃ temaghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ🔽evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ vardhayanti divaścin me bṛhatauttarā dhuḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ vidvān ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ yam ardham te maghavan kṣemyā dhūḥ  eva hi mām tavasam vardhayanti divaścit me bṛhatā auttarāḥ dhuḥ
translated: Thou, O wise one, declare to us in due season which way, O bountiful one, is the safe path🔽For they strengthen me, the impetuous one; even from the high heaven above me they carry me

original: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākamaśatruṃhi ma janitā jajāna
analyzed: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi sākamaśatruṃhi ma janitā jajāna
translated: I have slain many thousands together; for my father begot me as a foe-destroyer

original: evā hi māṃ tavasaṃ jajñurugraṃ karmankarman vṛṣaṇamindra devāḥ
analyzed: eva hi mām tavasam jajñuḥ ugram karman karman vṛṣaṇam indra devāḥ
translated: For thus, O Indra, the gods have generated me, the strong, the mighty, in every deed.

original: vadhīṃ vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasano 'pa vrajammahinā dāśuṣe vam
analyzed: vadhīm vṛtram vajreṇa mandasano pa vrajam mahinā dāśuṣe vam
translated: I have slain Vṛtra with the thunderbolt, and with my might have opened the stall for the worshipper.

original: devāsa āyan paraśūnrabibhran vanā vṛścanto abhi viḍbhirāyan
analyzed: devāsaḥ āyan paraśūn rabibhran vanā vṛścantaḥ abhi viḍbhiḥ āyan
translated: The gods have come bearing axes, cutting down the woods, coming with the people.

original: ni sudrvaṃ dadhato vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭamanutad dahanti🔽śaśaḥ kṣuraṃ pratyañcaṃ jagārādriṃ logena vyabhedamārāt
analyzed: ni su drvam dadhataḥ vakṣaṇāsu yatrā kṛpīṭam anutat dahanti  śaśaḥ kṣuram pratyañcam jagāra adrim logena vyabhedam ārāt
translated: They have placed the well-formed one in their laps, where they burn the chaff.🔽The hare has swallowed the sharp-edged razor, the stone has been cleft by the stake.

original: bṛhantaṃ cid ṛhate randhayāni vayad vatso vṛṣabhaṃśūśuvānaḥ
analyzed: bṛhantam cit ṛhate randhayāni vayat vatsaḥ vṛṣabham śūśuvānaḥ
translated: I would destroy even the great one, the young calf shining like a bull.

original: suparṇa itthā nakhamā siṣāyāvaruddhaḥ paripadaṃ nasiṃhaḥ
analyzed: suparṇaḥ itthā nakham ā siṣāya avaruddhaḥ paripadam na siṃhaḥ
translated: The eagle here has sharpened his claw, confined like a lion in the foot-print.

original: niruddhaścin mahiṣastarṣyāvān godhā tasmāayathaṃ karṣadetat
analyzed: niruddhaḥ cit mahiṣaḥ tarṣyāvān godhā tasmāayatham karṣat etat
translated: Even the mighty buffalo, when thirsty, is confined, the alligator drags him to the water.

original: tebhyo godhā ayathaṃ karṣadetad ye brahmaṇaḥ pratipiyantyannaiḥ
analyzed: tebhyaḥ godhāḥ karṣat etat ye brahmaṇaḥ pratipiyanti annaiḥ
translated: To them the alligator drags the water, to those who follow the Brahman with food.

original: sima ukṣṇo 'vasṛṣṭānadanti svayaṃ balānitanvaḥ śṛṇānāḥ
analyzed: sime ukṣṇaḥ vasṛṣṭāḥ anadanti svayam balāni tanvaḥ śṛṇānāḥ
translated: The bulls, unyoked, roar themselves, rending their own bodies with their horns.

original: ete śamībhiḥ suśamī abhūvan ye hinvire tanvaḥ somaukthaiḥ
analyzed: ete śamībhiḥ suśamī abhūvan ye hinvire tanvaḥ soma aukthaiḥ
translated: They have become very friendly with the shami trees, who have stimulated their bodies with Soma and hymns.

original: nṛvad vadannupa no māhi vājān divi śravodadhiṣe nāma vīraḥ
analyzed: nṛvat vadan upa naḥ māhi vājān divi śravaḥ udadhiṣe nāma vīraḥ
translated: speaking like a man, grant us strength, in heaven thou hast set thy fame as a treasure, a hero

original: vane na vā yo nyadhāyi cākañchucirvāṃ stomo bhuraṇāvajīgaḥ
analyzed: vane na vā yaḥ nyadhāyi cākan śuciḥ vām stomaḥ bhuraṇau ajīgaḥ
translated: he who hath been laid in the wood like a horse, or your pure praise, O ye who move swiftly, hath prevailed

original: yasyedindraḥ purudineṣu hotā nṛṇāṃ naryonṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān
analyzed: yasya id indraḥ puru dineṣu hotā nṛṇām naryaḥ unṛtamaḥ kṣapāvān
translated: whose priest, O Indra, thou art in many days, the best of men, the guardian of men's hymns

original: pra te asyā uṣasaḥ prāparasyā nṛtau syāma nṛtamasyanṛṇām
analyzed: pra te asyāḥ uṣasaḥ pra aparasyāḥ nṛtau syāma
translated: in the assembly of that best of men, may we be in the assembly of this thy rising dawn

original: anu triśokaḥ śatamāvahan nṝn kutsena ratho yoasat sasavān
analyzed: anu triśokaḥ śatam āvahat nṝn kutsena rathaḥ yoasat sasavān
translated: following the three sorrows, a hundred men have been brought by Kutsa, the chariot that is well-equipped

original: kaste mada indra rantyo bhūd duro giro abhyugro vi dhāva🔽kad vāho arvāgupa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyamupamaṃrādho annaiḥ
analyzed: kaḥ te madaḥ indra rantyaḥ bhūt duraḥ giraḥ abhi ugraḥ vi dhāva  kad vāho arvāk upa mā manīṣā ā tvā śakyam upamaṃrādhaḥ annaiḥ
translated: what is thy gladdening drink, O Indra, what the songs? run thou to us, O mighty one🔽what is the near chariot? what the thought? I am able to come to thee with gifts of food

original: kadu dyumnamindra tvāvato nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kan naāgan
analyzed: kadu dyumnam indra tvāvataḥ nṝn kayā dhiyā karase kad na āgan
translated: what is the glory, O Indra, of the men who are thine? with what thought wilt thou come to us?

original: mitro na satya urugāya bhṛtyā anne samasya yadasanmanīṣāḥ
analyzed: mitraḥ na satyaḥ uru gāya bhṛtyāḥ anne samasya yat asat manīṣāḥ
translated: like a faithful friend, O thou of wide paths, are thy servants, when their thought is set on food

original: preraya sūro arthaṃ na pāraṃ ye asya kāmaṃ janidhā ivagman
analyzed: preraya sūraḥ artham na pāram ye asya kāmam janidhāḥ ivagman
translated: send forth the sun to his goal, to the farther shore, they who have come to his desire as to a birthplace

original: giraśca ye te tuvijāta pūrvīrnara indrapratiśikṣantyannaiḥ
analyzed: giraḥ ca ye te tuvi jāta pūrvīḥ naraḥ indra pratiśikṣanti annaiḥ
translated: and the many hymns, O thou who art much invoked, O Indra, which the men have in return for food

original: mātre nu te sumite indra pūrvī dyaurmajmanā pṛthivīkāvyena
analyzed: mātre nu te su mite indra pūrvī dyauḥ majmanā pṛthivī kāvyena
translated: to thy two mothers, O Indra, well-measured are the many, heaven with its greatness, earth with her wisdom

original: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantupītaye madhūni
analyzed: varāya te ghṛtavantaḥ sutāsaḥ svādman bhavantu pītaye madhūni
translated: For thee have they been pressed, rich in ghee, let the sweet juices be made ready for thy drinking

original: ā madhvo asmā asicannamatramindrāya pūrṇaṃ sa hisatyarādhāḥ
analyzed: ā madhvaḥ asmai asicat namatram indrāya pūrṇam sa hi satya rādhāḥ
translated: Pour into this the honey-mixture full to the brim for Indra, for he is the true bestower

original: sa vāvṛdhe varimannā pṛthivyā abhi kratvānaryaḥ pauṃsyaiśca
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhe varimannā pṛthivyāḥ abhi kratvā anaryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ ca
translated: He hath grown great in the wide room of the earth, the holy one through his manly powers

original: vyānaḷ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā āsmai yatante sakhyāyapūrvīḥ
analyzed: vyānaṭ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ sva ojāḥ ā asmai yatante sakhyāyapūrvīḥ
translated: Indra hath overcome the battles, the mighty, many strive to win his friendship

original: ā smā rathaṃ na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yaṃ bhadrayāsumatyā codayāse
analyzed: ā smā ratham na pṛtanāsu tiṣṭha yam bhadrayā asumatyā codayāse
translated: Mount thou the car in the battles as thou usest, which thou urgest on with auspicious favour

original: pra devatrā brāhmaṇe gāturetvapo achā manaso naprayukti
analyzed: pra devatrā brāhmaṇe achā manasaḥ naprayukti
translated: Go to the gods, to the Brāhman, to the singer, as the waters go to the gathering-place of thought

original: mahīṃ mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsiṃ pṛthujrayaserīradhā suvṛktim
analyzed: mahīm mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim pṛthujrayasā irīradhā suvṛktim
translated: To the great support of Mitra, of Varuṇa, offer the hymn, O ye of wide dominion

original: adhvaryavo haviṣmanto hi bhūtāchāpa itośatīruśantaḥ🔽ava yāścaṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇastamāsyadhvamūrmimadyā suhastāḥ
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ hi bhūta achā apaḥ ita uśatīḥ uśantaḥ  ava yāḥ caṣṭe aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ tam āsyadhvam ūrmim adyā su hastāḥ
translated: Ye Adhvaryus, be ye rich in sacrificial food, go forth from hence with eager longing🔽The red bird hath spread it out, ye skilful ones, bring ye hitherward the wave of it to-day

original: adhvaryavo 'pa itā samudramapāṃ napātaṃ haviṣā yajadhvam
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ paḥ ita samudram apām napātam haviṣā yajadhvam
translated: Ye Adhvaryus, worship with oblation the waters, the ocean, the waters' offspring

original: sa vo dadadūrmimadyā supūtaṃ tasmai somaṃ madhumantaṃsunota
analyzed: sa vaḥ dadat ūrmi madyā su pūtam tasmai somam madhumantam sunota
translated: He will give you the well-purified wave to-day, for him press ye the Soma rich in sweetness

original: yo anidhmo dīdayadapsvantaryaṃ viprāsa īḷateadhvareṣu
analyzed: yaḥ anidhmaḥ dīdayat apsu antaryam viprāsaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu
translated: He who shines in the waters without fuel, whom the sages invoke at the sacrifices

original: apāṃ napān madhumatīrapo dā yābhirindrovāvṛdhe vīryāya
analyzed: apām napāt madhumatīḥ apaḥ dāḥ yābhiḥ indraḥ uvāvṛdhe vīryāya
translated: O son of waters, give us waters rich in sweets, wherewith Indra hath grown in strength to hero might

original: yābhiḥ somo modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhiryuvatibhirnamaryaḥ
analyzed: yābhiḥ somaḥ modate harṣate ca kalyāṇībhiḥ yuvatibhiḥ namaryaḥ
translated: Wherewith Soma is glad and rejoices, as a young man with fair maidens delights him

original: tā adhvaryo apo achā parehi yadāsiñcāoṣadhībhiḥ punītāt
analyzed: tāḥ adhvaryo apaḥ achā parehi yat āsiñca a oṣadhībhiḥ punītāt
translated: Go thou, O Adhvaryu, to the waters, and bring them hither, when thou hast purified them with the plants

original: eved yūne yuvatayo namanta yadīmuśannuśatīretyacha
analyzed: eva id yūne yuvatayaḥ namanta yadi īm uśan uśatīḥ etya cha
translated: Even thus the maidens bow to the young man, when the loving one comes nigh to the loving

original: saṃ jānate manasā saṃ cikitre 'dhvaryavo dhiṣaṇāpaścadevīḥ
analyzed: sam jānate manasā sam cikitre dhvaryavaḥ dhiṣaṇā paśca devīḥ
translated: They agree in mind, they are of one accord, the Adhvaryus and the goddesses, the thoughts

original: yo vo vṛtābhyo akṛṇodu lokaṃ yo vo mahyā abhiśasteramuñcat
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ vṛtābhyaḥ akṛṇotu lokam yaḥ vaḥ mahyāḥ abhiśasteḥ amuñcat
translated: He who hath made you room in the full places, who hath set you free from the great curse

original: tasmā indrāya madhumantamūrmiṃ devamādanampra hiṇotanāpaḥ🔽prāsmai hinota madhumantamūrmiṃ garbho yo vaḥ sindhavomadhva utsaḥ
analyzed: tasmai indrāya madhumantam ūrmim deva mādanam pra hiṇotana apaḥ  pra asmai hinota madhumantam ūrmim garbhaḥ yaḥ vaḥ sindhavaḥ madhvaḥ utsaḥ
translated: To him, to Indra, send ye forth a wave of sweetness, a draught for the god, O ye waters🔽Send ye to him a wave of sweetness, O ye rivers, the babe who is your gladdening store of meath

original: ghṛtapṛṣṭhamīḍyamadhvareṣvāpo revatīḥśṛṇutā havaṃ me
analyzed: ghṛta pṛṣṭham īḍyam adhvareṣu āpaḥ revatīḥ śṛṇuta havam me
translated: Whose back is bathed in oil, to be adored at sacrifices, O ye waters, rich in blessings, hear my call

original: taṃ sindhavo matsaramindrapānamūrmiṃ pra heta ya ubheiyarti
analyzed: tam sindhavaḥ matsaram indra pānam ūrmim pra heta yaḥ ubhā iiyarti
translated: Send ye forth, O ye rivers, that wave which gladdens, which Indra drinks, and which impels the two

original: madacyutamauśānaṃ nabhojāṃ pari tritantuṃvicarantamutsam
analyzed: mada cyutam auśānam nabhaḥ jām pari tri tantum vicarantam utsam
translated: The gladdening juice of heaven, which Trita hath sent forth, the babe who wanders round the reservoir of meath

original: āvarvṛtatīradha nu dvidhārā goṣuyudho na niyavaṃcarantīḥ
analyzed: āvarvṛtatīḥ adha nu dvi dhārāḥ goṣuyudhaḥ na niyavaṃcarantīḥ
translated: The two streams which flow round about, like two combatants in the fight for kine, which wander in their course

original: ṛṣe janitrīrbhuvanasya patnīrapo vandasvasavṛdhaḥ sayonīḥ
analyzed: ṛṣe janitrīḥ bhuvanasya patnīḥ apaḥ vandasva asavṛdhaḥ sayonīḥ
translated: O sage, worship the waters, the mothers of the world, the wives, the strengtheners, of the same origin.

original: hinotā no adhvaraṃ devayajyā hinota brahma sanayedhanānām
analyzed: hinota naḥ adhvaram deva yajyā hinota brahma sanayedhanānām
translated: Impel our sacrifice to the worship of the gods, impel the prayer to the winning of riches.

original: ṛtasya yoge vi śyadhvamūdhaḥ śruṣṭīvarīrbhūtanāsmabhyamāpaḥ🔽āpo revatīḥ kṣayathā hi vasvaḥ kratuṃ ca bhadrambibhṛthāmṛtaṃ ca
analyzed: ṛtasya yoge vi śyadhvam ūdhaḥ śruṣṭīvarīḥ bhūtana asmabhyam āpaḥ  āpaḥ revatīḥ kṣayatha hi vasvaḥ kratum ca bhadram bibhṛtha amṛtam ca
translated: At the union of truth, open the udders, be ye bountiful to us, O waters.🔽Ye are the rich waters, for ye are the abode of wealth; ye have the good will and the nectar.

original: rāyaśca stha svapatyasya patnīḥsarasvatī tad gṛṇate vayo dhāt
analyzed: rāyaḥ ca stha su apatyasya patnīḥ sarasvatī tat gṛṇate vayaḥ dhāt
translated: And ye are the wives of self-dependent riches; may Sarasvatî grant strength to him who sings this.

original: prati yadāpo adṛśramāyatīrghṛtaṃ payāṃsi bibhratīrmadhūni
analyzed: prati yadā apaḥ adṛśram āyatīḥ ghṛtam payāṃsi bibhratīḥ madhūni
translated: When the waters have been seen coming, bearing ghee and sweet juices,

original: adhvaryubhirmanasā saṃvidānā indrāya somaṃsuṣutaṃ bharantīḥ
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ manasā saṃvidānāḥ indrāya somaṃsuṣutam bharantīḥ
translated: agreeing with the Adhvaryus in mind, bringing the well-pressed Soma to Indra.

original: emā agman revatīrjīvadhanyā adhvaryavaḥ sādayatāsakhāyaḥ
analyzed: ā imāḥ agman revatīḥ jīva dhanyāḥ adhvaryavaḥ sādayatā sakhāyaḥ
translated: These have come, the rich, the life-giving, the Adhvaryus; O friends, seat them.

original: ni barhiṣi dhattana somyāso 'pāṃ naptrāsaṃvidānāsa enāḥ
analyzed: ni barhiṣi dhattana somyāsaḥ pām naptrā a saṃvidānāsaḥ enāḥ
translated: Place them on the sacrificial grass, ye who are meet for Soma, these who are the daughters of the waters, agreeing together.

original: āgmannāpa uśatīrbarhiredaṃ nyadhvare asadandevayantīḥ
analyzed: āgman āpaḥ uśatīḥ barhiḥ ā idam ni adhvare asadan devayantīḥ
translated: The eager waters have come to this grass; they have sat down in the sacrifice, paying worship to the gods.

original: adhvaryavaḥ sunutendrāya somamabhūdu vaḥsuśakā devayajyā
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ sunuta indrāya somam abhūt vaḥ su śakā deva yajyā
translated: O Adhvaryus, press the Soma for Indra; good luck be yours in the worship of the gods.

original: ā no devānāmupa vetu śaṃso viśvebhisturairavaseyajatraḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ devānām upa vetu śaṃsaḥ viśvebhiḥ turaiḥ avaseya jatraḥ
translated: may the praise of the gods come to us with all the swift ones to help us who are worthy of sacrifice

original: tebhirvayaṃ suṣakhāyo bhavema taranto viśvāduritā syāma
analyzed: tebhiḥ vayam su sakhāyaḥ bhavema tarantaḥ viśva a duritāḥ syāma
translated: may we be very friendly with them may we pass over all misfortunes

original: pari cin marto draviṇaṃ mamanyād ṛtasya pathā namasāvivāset🔽ata svena kratunā saṃ vadeta śreyāṃsandakṣaṃ manasā jagṛbhyāt
analyzed: pari cit martaḥ draviṇam mamanyāt ṛtasya pathā namasā āvivāset  atas svena kratunā sam vadeta śreyāṃsan dakṣam manasā jagṛbhyāt
translated: even a mortal man should covet wealth he should win it by the path of truth by homage🔽he should speak with his own thought he should grasp a better hand with his mind

original: adhāyi dhītirasasṛgramaṃśāstīrthe /
analyzed: adhāyi dhīti rasa sṛgram aṃśāḥ tīrthe
translated: the thought is set the portions have flowed to the place

original: na dasmamupayantyumāḥ
analyzed: na dasmam upayanti umāḥ
translated: the wondrous ones the companions come not

original: abhyānaśma suvitasya śūṣaṃ navedasoamṛtānāmabhūma
analyzed: abhyānaśma suvitasya śūṣam navedasaḥ amṛtānām abhūma
translated: we have attained the impulse of good fortune we have become the immortal ones of new knowledge

original: nityaścākanyāt svapatirdāmūnā yasmā u devaḥ savitajajāna
analyzed: nityaḥ cākanyāt sva patiḥ dāmūnāḥ yasmai u devaḥ savitā jajāna
translated: the ever young lord of the house the kind one whom the god savitar has generated

original: bhago vā gobhiraryamemanajyāt so asmai caruśchadayaduta syāt🔽iyaṃ sā bhūyā uṣasāmiva kṣa yad dha kṣumantaḥśavasā samāyan
analyzed: bhagaḥ vā gobhiḥ aryamā imanajyāt saḥ asmai caruḥ chadayat uta syāt  iyam sā bhūyāḥ uṣasām iva kṣa yat ha kṣumantaḥ śavasā samāyan
translated: may bhaga or aryaman be pleased with the cattle that oblation may be offered to him🔽may this be like the dawn of dawns when ye who are strong with strength have come together

original: asya stutiṃ jariturbhikṣamāṇā ānaḥ śagmāsa upa yantu vājāḥ
analyzed: asya stutim jarituḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ ānaḥ śagmāsaḥ upa yantu vājāḥ
translated: seeking the praise of this singer may our vigorous forces come to us

original: asyedeṣā sumatiḥ paprathānābhavat pūrvyā bhumanāgauḥ
analyzed: asya id eṣā sumatiḥ paprathānā abhavat pūrvyā bhumanāgauḥ
translated: this his favour hath spread forth like the ancient earth like a cow

original: asya sanīḷā asurasya yonau samāna ā bharaṇebibhramāṇāḥ
analyzed: asya sanīḍāḥ asurasya yonau samāne ā bharaṇe bibhramāṇāḥ
translated: in the womb of the asura of this one bearing the same ornament in the bearing

original: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ
analyzed: kim svid vanam kaḥ u sa vṛkṣaḥ āsa yatas dyāvāpṛthivīn iṣṭatakṣuḥ
translated: What is the wood, what is the tree, whence they have fashioned out the heaven and earth?

original: santasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrvīruṣaso jaranta🔽naitāvadenā paro anyadastyukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivībibharti
analyzed: santasthāne ajare itaūtī ahāni pūrvīruṣasaḥ jaranta  na etāvat enā paras anyat asti ukṣā sa dyāvāpṛthivī bibharti
translated: The two, standing firm, the undecaying, the far-extending, the ancient days and dawns are singing.🔽There is nothing higher than this, no other; the bull supports the heaven and earth.

original: tvadaṃ pavitraṃ kṛṇuta svadhāvān yadīṃsūryaṃ na harito vahanti
analyzed: tvadam pavitram kṛṇuta svadhāvān yadi īṃ sūryam na haritaḥ vahanti
translated: The self-moving one makes his own filter, when the two bays bear him, as it were, the sun.

original: stego na kṣāmatyeti pṛthvīṃ mihaṃ na vāto vi havāti bhūma
analyzed: stegaḥ na kṣām atyeti pṛthvīm miham na vātaḥ vi havāti bhūma
translated: He passes over the broad earth, as it were, a bull; the wind blows over the earth, as it were, a cloud.

original: mitro yatra varuṇo ajyamāno 'gnirvane na vyasṛṣṭa śokam
analyzed: mitraḥ yatra varuṇaḥ ajyamānaḥ gniḥ vane na vyasṛṣṭa śokam
translated: Where Varuṇa and Mitra are anointed, Agni has sent forth his flame in the wood.

original: starīryat sūta sadyo ajyamānā vyathiravyathiḥ kṛṇutasvagopā
analyzed: starīḥ yat sūta sadyas ajyamānā vyathiḥ avyathiḥ kṛṇuta sva gopā
translated: When the swift one, as soon as anointed, has gone forth, he makes the unmoving one his own protector.

original: putro yat purvaḥ pitrorjaniṣṭa śamyāṃ gaurjagāra yad dha pṛchān
analyzed: putraḥ yat purvas pitroḥ janiṣṭa śamyām gauḥ jagāra yat ha pṛchān
translated: When the first son is born to his parents, the cow lowed, as it were, when the one who seeks (it) is near.

original: uta kaṇvaṃ nṛṣadaḥ putramāhuruta śyāvo dhanamādattavāji
analyzed: uta kaṇvam nṛṣadaḥ putram āhuḥ uta śyāvaḥ dhanam ādatta vāji
translated: The men call Kaṇva also a son; the dark one also has taken the wealth, as it were, the strong one.

original: pra kṛṣṇāya ruśadapinvatodharṛtamatra nakirasmā apīpet
analyzed: pra kṛṣṇāya ruśat apinvatodha ṛtam atra nakir asmai apīpet
translated: To the dark one they have caused the ruddy one to swell; not one of them would have refused (it).

original: pra su gmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhirvarānabhiṣu prasīdataḥ
analyzed: pra su gmantā dhiyasānasya sakṣaṇi varebhiḥ varān abhiṣu prasīdataḥ
translated: The two swift ones, the companion of the one who seeks with the choicest (gifts), are pleased with the choicest (gifts).

original: asmākamindra ubhayaṃ jujoṣati yatsomyasyāndhaso bubodhati
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ ubhayam jujoṣati yat somyasya andhasaḥ bubodhati
translated: Indra approves of both of these things of ours when he awakens to the Soma juice

original: vīndra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasāpuruṣṭuta🔽ye tvā vahanti muhuradhvarānupa te suvanvantu vagyanānarādhasaḥ
analyzed: vi indra yāsi divyāni rocanā vi pārthivāni rajasāpuruṣṭuta  ye tvā vahanti muhur adhvarān upa te suvanvantu vagyanān arādhasaḥ
translated: O Indra, thou goest through the luminous heavenly regions and through the earthly ones, O much-praised one, with thy chariot🔽May those who carry thee again and again to the sacrifices, those who press thee, grant me boons, O bountiful one

original: tadin me chantsat vapuṣo vapuṣṭaraṃ putro yajjānampitroradhīyati
analyzed: tat id me chantsat vapuṣaḥ vapuṣṭaram putraḥ yat jānam pitroḥ adhīyati
translated: That is my most beautiful form among beautiful forms, when the son sits in the place of the father and mother

original: jāyā patiṃ vahati vagnunā sumat puṃsaid bhadro vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: jāyā patim vahati vagnunā sumat puṃsā ed bhadraḥ vahatuḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The wife carries the husband with her consent, well-endowed, the fortunate one, purified by the act of carrying

original: tadit sadhasthamabhi cāru dīdhaya gāvo yacchāsanvahatuṃ na dhenavaḥ
analyzed: tat id sadhastham abhi cāru dīdhaya gāvaḥ yat śāsan vahatum na dhenavaḥ
translated: I look upon that beautiful abode, where the cows, as if directing the carrying, are like milch cows

original: mātā yan manturyūthasyapūrvyābhi vāṇasya saptadhāturijjanaḥ
analyzed: mātā yat mantuḥ yūthasya pūrvyā abhi vāṇasya sapta dhātuḥ id janaḥ
translated: When the mother, the leader of the herd, the people of the seven-stringed instrument, the singer,

original: pra vo 'chā ririce devayuṣ padameko rudrebhiryātiturvaṇiḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ śā ririce devayuḥ padam ekaḥ rudrebhiḥ yāti turvaṇiḥ
translated: Your path, which is dear to the gods, has been extended by me. Alone, with the Rudras, he has gone to Turvaṇa.

original: jarā vā yeṣvamṛteṣu dāvane pari vaūmebhyaḥ siñcatā madhu
analyzed: jarā vā yeṣu amṛteṣu dāvane pari vaūmebhyaḥ siñcata madhu
translated: To those in whom old age is for the bestowal of immortality, pour out honey around them.

original: nidhīyamānamapagūḷamapsu pra me devānāṃ vratapāuvāca
analyzed: nidhīyamānam apagūḍam apsu pra me devānām vrata pāḥ uvāca
translated: The one who is placed in the waters, the one who is hidden in the waters, has told me the vow of the gods.

original: indro vidvānanu hi tvā cacakṣa tenāhamagneanuśiṣṭa āgām
analyzed: indraḥ vidvān anu hi tvā cacakṣa tena aham agne anuśiṣṭaḥ āgām
translated: Indra, the wise one, has indeed seen thee. Instructed by him, O Agni, I have come.

original: akṣetravit kṣetravidaṃ hyaprāṭ sa praitikṣetravidānuśiṣṭaḥ
analyzed: a kṣetra vid kṣetra vidam hi aprāṭ sa praiti kṣetra vidā anuśiṣṭaḥ
translated: The ignorant one, not knowing the field, to the one who knows the field, the ignorant one has gone to the one who knows the field, instructed

original: etad vai bhadramanuśāsanosyotasrutiṃ vindatyañjasīnām
analyzed: etat vai bhadram anuśāsanā usya utasrutim vindati añjasīnām
translated: This indeed is the good of his instruction, he finds the easy path of the easy ones

original: adyedu prāṇīdamamannimāhāpīvṛto adhayan māturūdhaḥ
analyzed: adya idu apīvṛtaḥ adhayat mātuḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: Today he has eaten, he has said, he has drunk, covered, the milk of his mother's breast

original: emenamāpa jarimā yuvānamaheḷan vasuḥ sumanābabhūva
analyzed: āpa jarimā yuvānam aheḍan vasuḥ sumanāḥ babhūva
translated: Thus old age has come to this young man, the good one has become well-disposed, free from disease

original: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadato maghāni
analyzed: etāni bhadrā kalaśa kriyāma kuruśravaṇa dadataḥ maghāni
translated: O pot, do these good deeds for me, O Kurusravana, while giving these gifts

original: dāna id vo maghavānaḥ so astvayaṃ ca somo hṛdi yambibharmi
analyzed: dāne id vaḥ maghavānaḥ saḥ astu ayam ca somaḥ hṛdi yam bibharmi
translated: May this be your gift, O wealthy ones, and this Soma which I hold in my heart

original: pra mā yuyujre prayujo janānāṃ vahāmi sma puṣaṇamantareṇa
analyzed: pra mā yuyujre prayujaḥ janānām vahāmi sma puṣaṇam antareṇa
translated: The yokes of people have yoked me, I have carried Pusan in between

original: viśve devāso adha māmarakṣan duḥśāsurāgāditi ghoṣa āsīt🔽saṃ mā tapantyabhitaḥ sapatnīriva parśavaḥ🔽ni bādhateamatirnagnatā jasurverna vevīyate matiḥ
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ adha mām arakṣan duḥśāsuḥ āgāt iti ghoṣaḥ āsīt  sam mā tapanti abhitas sapatnīḥ iva parśavaḥ  ni bādhate amatiḥ nagna tā jasuḥ veḥ na vevīyate matiḥ
translated: All the gods have protected me, there was a cry: The wicked one has come!🔽My ribs torment me, as if from rivals🔽Poverty, nakedness, and disease oppress me, my thought is not carried away like a boat

original: mūṣo na śiśnā vyadanti mādhya stotāraṃ te śatakrato
analyzed: mūṣaḥ na śiśnā vyadanti mā adhya stotāram te śatakrato
translated: Like mice my sides gnaw at me, O Shatakratu, my praiser

original: sakṛt su no maghavannindra mṛḷayādhā piteva no bhava
analyzed: sakṛt su naḥ maghavan indra mṛḍaya adha pitā iva naḥ bhava
translated: Once, O Indra, be gracious to us, O Maghavan, be a father to us

original: kuruśravaṇamāvṛṇi rājānaṃ trāsadasyavam
analyzed: kuruśravaṇam āvṛṇi rājānam trāsadasyavam
translated: I have chosen as king Trasadasyu, the son of Kurusravana

original: maṃhiṣṭhaṃvāghatām ṛṣiḥ
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ
translated: The most bountiful of priests, the sage,

original: yasya mā harito rathe tisro vahanti sādhuyā
analyzed: yasya mā haritaḥ rathe tisraḥ vahanti sādhuyā
translated: Whose three bay steeds carry him well on his chariot,

original: stavaisahasradakṣiṇe
analyzed: stavai sahasra dakṣiṇe
translated: At the sacrifice with a thousand gifts.

original: yasya prasvādaso gira upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ
analyzed: yasya prasvādasaḥ giraḥ upamaśravasaḥ pituḥ
translated: Whose songs, O Upamashrava, whose father's,

original: kṣetraṃ naraṇvamūcuṣe🔽adhi putropamaśravo napān mitrātitherihi
analyzed: kṣetram naraṇvam ūcuṣe  adhi putra upamaśravaḥ napāt mitra atithā īrihi
translated: You have sung as if to a field that delights in it.🔽Go to the son of Upamashrava, the grandson of Mitra-Atithi,

original: pituṣ ṭe asmivanditā
analyzed: pituḥ te asmivanditā
translated: Your father is praised by us.

original: yadīśīyāmṛtānāmuta vā martyānām
analyzed: yadi īśīya amṛtānām uta vā martyānām
translated: If I were to live among the immortals or among mortals,

original: jīvedinmaghavā mama
analyzed: jīvedidh maghavā mama
translated: May Maghavan live for me.

original: na devānāmati vrataṃ śatātmā cana jīvati
analyzed: na devānām ati vratam śata ātmā cana jīvati
translated: The vow of the gods is not transgressed, one does not live a hundred years,

original: tathāyujā vi vāvṛte
analyzed: tathā yujā vi vāvṛte
translated: Thus yoked, he turns away.

original: prāvepā mā bṛhato mādayanti pravātejā iriṇe varvṛtānāḥ
analyzed: prāvepāḥ mā bṛhataḥ mādayanti pravātejāḥ iriṇe varvṛtānāḥ
translated: They delight in me, the mighty ones, whirling in the wind, on the barren ground,

original: somasyeva maujavatasya bhakṣo vibhīdako jāgṛvirmahyamachān
analyzed: somasya iva maujavatasya bhakṣaḥ vibhīdakaḥ jāgṛviḥ mahyam achān
translated: Like the enjoyment of Soma, the possessor of strength, the watchful one, the fearful one, is sent to me.

original: na mā mimetha na jihīḷa eṣā śivā sakhibhya uta mahyamāsīt
analyzed: na mā mimetha na jihīḍe eṣā śivā sakhibhyaḥ uta mahyam āsīt
translated: He did not deceive me, he did not despise me, he was auspicious to his friends and to me.

original: akṣasyāhamekaparasya hetoranuvratāmapa jāyāmarodham
analyzed: akṣasya aham eka parasya hetoḥ anuvratām apa jāyām arodham
translated: For the sake of the one-wheeled cart, I have taken back my wife who was following another.

original: dveṣṭi śvaśrūrapa jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthito vindatemarḍitāram
analyzed: dveṣṭi jāyā ruṇaddhi na nāthitaḥ
translated: The mother-in-law hates, the wife holds back, the one who seeks help does not find a comforter.

original: aśvasyeva jarato vasnyasya nāhaṃ vindāmikitavasya bhogam
analyzed: aśvasya iva jarataḥ vasnyasya na aham vindāmikitavasya bhogam
translated: I do not find the enjoyment of the gambler, like that of a well-born horse.

original: anye jāyāṃ pari mṛśantyasya yasyāgṛdhad vedane vājyakṣaḥ🔽pitā matā bhrātara enamāhurna jānīmo nayatābaddhametam
analyzed: anye jāyām pari mṛśanti asya yasya agṛdhat vedane vājī akṣaḥ  pitā matāḥ bhrātaraḥ enam āhuḥ na jānīmaḥ nayata ābaddham etam
translated: Others, whose wife he has coveted, will not accept his offering, the strong and swift one.🔽His father, mother, and brothers say of him: We do not know where they have taken this bound one.

original: yadādīdhye na daviṣāṇyebhiḥ parāyadbhyo 'va hīyesakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: yat ādīdhye na daviṣāṇi ebhiḥ parāyadbhyaḥ
translated: If I were to think of them with hatred, I would be lost to those friends who have gone away.

original: nyuptāśca babhravo vācamakratanemīdeṣāṃ niṣkṛtaṃ jāriṇīva
analyzed: nyuptāḥ ca babhravaḥ vācamakrata nemī deṣām niṣkṛtam jāriṇī iva
translated: The brown ones have been placed, they have uttered speech. The one who acts will bring forth their accomplishment.

original: sabhāmeti kitavaḥ pṛchamāno jeṣyāmīti tanvāśūśujānaḥ
analyzed: sabhām ā iti kitavaḥ pṛcchamānaḥ jeṣyāmi iti tanvā aśūśujānaḥ
translated: The gambler goes to the assembly, asking, Shall I win? with his body shining.

original: akṣāso asya vi tiranti kāmaṃ pratidīvnedadhata ā kṛtāni
analyzed: akṣāsaḥ asya vi tiranti kāmam pratidīvnā idadhataḥ ā kṛtāni
translated: The dice fulfill his desire. They give to the opponent the things that have been won.

original: akṣāsa idan /
analyzed: akṣāsaḥ idan
translated: The dice are like this.

original: kuśino nitodino nikṛtvānastapanāstāpayiṣṇavaḥ
analyzed: kuśinaḥ nitodinaḥ nikṛtvānaḥ tapanāḥ tāpayiṣṇavaḥ
translated: The sharp, piercing, cutting, burning, scorching ones.

original: kumāradeṣṇā jayataḥ punarhaṇo madhvāsampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā
analyzed: kumāradeṣṇāḥ jayataḥ punarhaṇaḥ madhvā asampṛktāḥ kitavasya barhaṇā
translated: The youthful ones, the victorious, the life-giving, mixed with honey, are the great ones of the gambler.

original: tripañcāśaḥ krīḷati vrāta eṣāṃ deva iva savitāsatyadharmā
analyzed: tripañcāśaḥ krīḍati vrātaḥ eṣām devaḥ iva savitā a satya dharmā
translated: The group of these plays with fifty-three. He is like the god Savitar, of true law.

original: ugrasya cin manyave nā namante rājā cidebhyonama it kṛṇoti🔽nīcā vartanta upari sphurantyahastāso hastavantaṃ sahante
analyzed: ugrasya cit manyave nā namante rājā cit ebhyaḥ namaḥ id kṛṇoti  nīcā vartante upari sphuranti ahastāsaḥ hastavantam sahante
translated: Even the fierce ones do not bow to his anger. Even the king must bow to them.🔽They move below, they flash above. They endure the one with hands, though they are handless.

original: divyā aṅgārā iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santo hṛdayaṃnirdahanti
analyzed: divyāḥ aṅgārāḥ iriṇe nyuptāḥ śītāḥ santaḥ hṛdayam nirdahanti
translated: The heavenly coals are placed on the barren ground. Though cold, they burn the heart.

original: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kvasvit
analyzed: jāyā tapyate kitavasya hīnā mātā putrasya carataḥ kvasvid
translated: The wife of the gambler is afflicted by loss, the mother of the son who wanders away somewhere.

original: ṛṇāvā bibhyad dhanamichamāno 'nyeṣāmastamupanaktameti
analyzed: ṛṇāvā bibhyat dhanam icchamānaḥ ni eṣām astam upanaktam eti
translated: Fearing debt, desiring wealth, he goes to the homes of others in the evening.

original: striyaṃ dṛṣṭvāya kitavaṃ tatāpānyeṣāṃ jāyāṃsukṛtaṃ ca yonim🔽pūrvāhṇe aśvān yuyuje hi babhrūn soagnerante vṛṣalaḥ papāda
analyzed: striyam dṛṣṭvāya kitavam tatāpa anyeṣām jāyāṃsu kṛtam ca yonim  pūrvāhṇe aśvān yuyuje hi babhrūn saḥ agneḥ ante vṛṣalaḥ papāda
translated: Seeing another's wife, the well-made womb, the gambler was tormented.🔽In the forenoon he yoked his brown horses, the Vr̥ishala at the end of the fire.

original: yo vaḥ senānīrmahato gaṇasya rājā vrātasya prathamobabhūva
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ senānīḥ mahataḥ gaṇasya rājā vrātasya prathamaḥ babhūva
translated: He who is the general of your great host, the king of the multitude, became the first.

original: tasmai kṛṇomi na dhanā ruṇadhmi daśāhamprācīstad ṛtaṃ vadāmi
analyzed: tasmai kṛṇomi na dhanā ruṇadhmi daśa aham prācīḥ tat ṛtam vadāmi
translated: To him I make offerings, I do not withhold wealth; for ten days I speak this truth.

original: akṣairmā dīvyaḥ kṛṣimit kṛṣasva vitte ramasva bahumanyamānaḥ
analyzed: akṣaiḥ mā dīvyaḥ kṛṣi mit kṛṣasva vitte ramasva bahu manyamānaḥ
translated: Do not gamble with dice, but plow this field; be content and highly esteemed.

original: tatra gāvaḥ kitava tatra jāyā tan me vicaṣṭe savitāyamaryaḥ🔽mitraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ khalu mṛlatā no mā no ghoreṇa caratābhidhṛṣṇu
analyzed: tatra gāvaḥ kitava tatra jāyā tat me vicaṣṭe savitā ayam aryaḥ  mitram kṛṇudhvam khalu mṛlata naḥ mā naḥ ghoreṇa carata abhidhṛṣṇu
translated: There, O gambler, are the cows, there is the wife; may Savitar, this righteous one, decide for me.🔽Make Mitra, indeed, be gracious to us; do not oppress us with terrible hostility.

original: ni vo nu manyurviśatāmarātiranyo babhrūṇāmprasitau nvastu
analyzed: ni vaḥ nu manyuḥ viśatām arātiḥ anyaḥ babhrūṇām prasitau nu astu
translated: Let your anger, O men, depart, let your hostility; let another be caught in the snare of the brown ones.

original: abudhramu tya indravanto agnayo jyotirbharanta uṣasovyuṣṭiṣu
analyzed: abudhramu tye indravantaḥ agnayaḥ jyotiḥ bharantaḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: The fires, accompanied by Indra, have awakened; they bear light in the dawns' rising.

original: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatāmapo 'dyādevānāmava ā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī cetatām apaḥ dyā devānām avaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May the earth, the sky, the two great worlds, and the waters be gracious to us. Today we choose the grace of the gods.

original: divaspṛthivyorava ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parvatāñcharyaṇāvataḥ
analyzed: divaspṛthivyā uravaḥ ā vṛṇīmahe mātṝn sindhūn parvatān śaryaṇāvataḥ
translated: We choose the grace of heaven and earth, the mothers, the rivers, and the mountains with the forests.

original: anāgāstvaṃ sūryamuṣāsamīmahe bhadraṃsomaḥ suvāno adyā kṛṇotu naḥ
analyzed: anāgāstvam sūryam uṣāsam īmahe bhadram somaḥ suvānaḥ adyā kṛṇotu naḥ
translated: We implore the guiltless sun and dawn. May Soma, being pressed, make all auspicious for us today.

original: dyāvā no adya pṛthivī anāgaso mahī trāyetāṃ suvitāyamātarā
analyzed: dyāvā naḥ adya pṛthivī anāgasaḥ mahī trāyetām suvitāyamātarā
