translated: May the great heaven and earth, the mothers, protect us from guilt for welfare.

original: uṣā uchantyapa bādhatāmaghaṃ svastyagniṃsamidhānamīmahe
analyzed: uṣāḥ uchantī apa bādhatām agham svasti agniṃsamidhānam īmahe
translated: May the rising dawn drive away evil. We implore the auspicious Agni, when kindled.

original: iyaṃ na usrā prathamā sudevyaṃ revat sanibhyo revatī vyuchatu
analyzed: iyam naḥ usrā prathamā su devyam revat sanibhyaḥ revatī vyuchatu
translated: May this dawn, the first, most divine, rich with good things, rise for us, rich, for the rich.

original: āre manyuṃ durvidatrasya dhīmahi svastyagniṃsamidhānamīmahe
analyzed: āre manyum durvidatrasya dhīmahi svasti agniṃsamidhānamīmahe
translated: We will direct our thought away from the anger of the one who is difficult to know. We implore the auspicious Agni, when kindled.

original: pra yāḥ sisrate sūryasya raśmibhirjyotirbharantīruṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu
analyzed: pra yāḥ sisrate sūryasya raśmibhiḥ jyotiḥ bharantīḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: Those which spread forth with the rays of the sun, bearing light in the dawns at the break of day,

original: bhadrā no adya śravase vyuchata svastyagniṃ samidhānamīmahe
analyzed: bhadrāḥ naḥ adya śravase vyuchata svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: May they rise for us today for fame. We implore the auspicious Agni, when kindled.

original: anamīvā uṣasa ā carantu na udagnayo jihatāṃ jyotiṣābṛhat
analyzed: anamīvāḥ uṣasaḥ ā carantu naḥ udagnayaḥ jihatām jyotiṣā abṛhat
translated: May the dawns come to us without disease. May the fires blaze with great light.

original: āyukṣātāmaśvinā tūtujiṃ rathaṃ svastyagniṃsamidhānamīmahe
analyzed: āyukṣātām aśvinā tūtujim ratham svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: O Asvins, yoke your swift chariot. We implore the auspicious Agni, when kindled.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ no adya savitarvareṇyaṃ bhāgamā suva sa hiratnadhā asi
analyzed: śreṣṭham naḥ adya savitar vareṇyam bhāgam ā suva sa hiratna dhāḥ asi
translated: Best for us today, O Savitar, bestow the most excellent portion. Thou art the giver of treasures.

original: rāyo janitrīṃ dhiṣaṇāmupa bruve svastyagniṃ samidhānamīmahe
analyzed: rāyaḥ janitrīm dhiṣaṇām upa bruve svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: I address the thought, the mother of wealth. We invoke Agni, well kindled, for our welfare.

original: pipartu mā tad ṛtasya pravācanaṃ devānāṃ yan manuṣyāamanmahi
analyzed: pipartu mā tat ṛtasya pravācanam devānām yat manuṣyā amanmahi
translated: May that declaration of truth protect me, which we mortals have conceived of the gods.

original: viśvā idusrā spaḷ udeti sūryaḥ svastyagniṃ samidhānamīmahe🔽adveṣo adya barhiṣa starīmaṇi grāvṇāṃ yoge manmanaḥsādha īmahe
analyzed: viśvāḥ idusrāḥ spaṣ udeti sūryaḥ svasti agnim samidhānamīmahe  a dveṣaḥ adya barhiṣaḥ starīmaṇi grāvṇām yoge manmanaḥ sādhaḥ īmahe
translated: All the people rise up when the sun rises. We invoke Agni, well kindled, for our welfare.🔽Today, on the strewing of the sacred grass, in the union of the pressing-stones, we accomplish our thought.

original: ādityānāṃ śarmaṇi sthā bhuraṇyasi svastyagniṃ samidhānamīmahe
analyzed: ādityānām śarmaṇi stha bhuraṇyasi svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: You move in the protection of the Adityas. We invoke Agni, well kindled, for our welfare.

original: ā no barhiḥ sadhamāde bṛhad divi devānīḷe sādayāsapta hotṝn
analyzed: ā naḥ barhiḥ sadhamāde bṛhat divi devānīḍe sādaya asapta hotṝn
translated: To our great assembly on the sacrificial grass in heaven, O Adityas, sit down with the seven priests.

original: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhagaṃ svastyagniṃ samidhānamīmahe
analyzed: indram mitram varuṇam sātaye bhagam svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: We invoke Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Bhaga for our gain. We invoke Agni, well kindled, for our welfare.

original: ta ādityā ā gatā sarvatātaye vṛdhe no yajñamavatāsajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: te ādityāḥ ā gata sarvatātaye vṛdhe naḥ yajñamavatāsajoṣasaḥ
translated: O Adityas, come to us for all-embracing prosperity. Help our sacrifice, being of one mind.

original: bṛhaspatiṃ pūṣaṇamaśvinā bhagaṃ svastyagniṃ samidhānamīmahe
analyzed: bṛhaspatim pūṣaṇam aśvinā bhagam svasti agnim samidhānam īmahe
translated: We invoke Brihaspati, Pusan, the Ashvins, Bhaga. We invoke Agni, well kindled, for our welfare.

original: tan no devā yachata supravācanaṃ chardirādityāḥ subharaṃnṛpāyyam
analyzed: tat naḥ devāḥ yacchata su pravācanam chardiḥ ādityāḥ subharam nṛpāyyam
translated: O gods, grant us that which is well-spoken, the protection of the Adityas, the good abode worthy of men.

original: paśve tokāya tanayāya jīvase svastyagniṃsamidhānamīmahe
analyzed: paśve tokāya tanayāya jīvase svasti agniṃsamidhānam īmahe
translated: For the sake of our cattle, for the sake of our offspring, for the sake of our life, we invoke Agni, the kindled one, for welfare.

original: viśve adya maruto viśva ūtī viśve bhavantvagnayaḥsamiddhāḥ
analyzed: viśve adya marutaḥ viśve ūtī viśve bhavantu agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ
translated: May all the Maruts today be our helpers, may all the fires be kindled for us.

original: viśve no devā avasā gamantu viśvamastudraviṇaṃ vājo asme
analyzed: viśve naḥ devāḥ avasā gamantu viśva mastu draviṇam vājaḥ asme
translated: May all the gods come to us with help, may all wealth and strength be ours.

original: yaṃ devāso 'vatha vājasātau yaṃ trāyadhve yaṃ pipṛthātyaṃhaḥ
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ vatha vājasātau yam trāyadhve yam pipṛtha ati aṃhaḥ
translated: O gods, whom you help in the battle for strength, whom you protect, whom you deliver from distress,

original: yo vo gopīthe na bhayasya veda te syāmadevavītaye turāsaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ gopīthe na bhayasya veda te syāma deva vītaye turāsaḥ
translated: May we be those who know no fear in your drinking of the cows, O mighty ones, for the enjoyment of the gods.

original: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇomitro aryamā
analyzed: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī supeśasā dyāvākṣāmā varuṇaḥ umitraḥ aryamā
translated: Dawn and Night, vast and beautiful, Heaven and Earth, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: indraṃ huve marutaḥ parvatānapa ādityāndyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ
analyzed: indram huve marutaḥ parvatān apaḥ ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svar
translated: I invoke Indra, the Maruts, the mountains, the Ādityas, Heaven and Earth, the waters, and the sky.

original: dyauśca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasa ṛtāvarī rakṣatāmaṃhasoriṣaḥ
analyzed: dyauḥ ca naḥ pṛthivī ca pracetasaḥ ṛtāvarī rakṣatām aṃhasā ūriṣaḥ
translated: May Heaven and Earth, the wise ones, who follow the truth, protect us from misfortune.

original: mā durvidatrā nirṛtirna īśata tad devānāmavoadyā vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: mā durvidatrā nirṛtiḥ naḥ īśata tat devānām avoadyā vṛṇīmahe
translated: May the ill-disposed Nirrti not rule over us. We choose that grace of the gods today.

original: viśvasmān no aditiḥ pātvaṃhaso mātā mitrasya varuṇasyarevataḥ
analyzed: viśvasmāt naḥ aditiḥ pātu aṃhasaḥ mātā mitrasya varuṇasya revataḥ
translated: May all Aditi protect us from misfortune, the mother of Mitra, Varuna, and Aryaman.

original: svarvajjyotiravṛkaṃ naśīmahi tad devānāṃ / / /
analyzed: svarvat jyotiḥ avṛkam naśīmahi tat devānām
translated: May we attain the heavenly light, free from danger. We choose that grace of the gods.

original: grāvā vadannapa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣvapnyaṃ nirṛtiṃviśvamatriṇam
analyzed: grāvā vadan apa rakṣāṃsi sedhatu duṣvapnyam nirṛtim viśva matriṇam
translated: May the pressing stone, speaking, drive away the Rākṣasas, bad dreams, Nirrti, and all the devourers.

original: ādityaṃ śarma marutāmaśīmahi taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: ādityam śarma marutām aśīmahi tat devānām
translated: We invoke the sun, the shelter of the Maruts, that of the gods...

original: endro barhiḥ sīdatu pinvatāmiḷā bṛhaspatiḥ sāmabhirṛkvo arcatu
analyzed: ā indraḥ barhiḥ sīdatu pinvatām iḷā bṛhaspatiḥ sāmabhiḥ ṛkvaḥ arcatu
translated: May Indra sit on the sacred grass, may Pinvata and Ila, may Brihaspati with the Sāmans and the Rkv hymns praise (him).

original: supraketaṃ jīvase manma dhīmahi taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: su praketam jīvase manma dhīmahi tat devānām
translated: We meditate on the well-known thought for the sake of living, that of the gods...

original: divispṛśaṃ yajñamasmākamaśvinā jīrādhvaraṃ kṛṇutaṃsumnamiṣṭaye
analyzed: divispṛśam yajñam asmākam aśvinā jīra adhvaram kṛṇutam sumnam iṣṭaye
translated: O Aśvins, make our sacrifice reach the sky, make it rich in oblations, for the sake of prosperity and well-being.

original: prācīnaraśmimāhutaṃ ghṛtena taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: prācīna raśmim āhutam ghṛtena tat devānām
translated: The one whose rays reach far, offered with ghee, that of the gods...

original: upa hvaye suhavaṃ mārutaṃ gaṇaṃ pāvakam ṛṣvaṃ sakhyāyaśambhuvam
analyzed: upa hvaye su havam mārutam gaṇam pāvakam ṛṣvam sakhyāya śambhuvam
translated: I invoke the easily invoked group of Maruts, the purifying, lofty one, for the sake of auspicious friendship.

original: rāyas poṣaṃ sauśravasāya dhīmahi taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣam sauśravasāya dhīmahi tat devānām
translated: We meditate on the increase of wealth for the sake of fame, that of the gods...

original: apāṃ peruṃ jīvadhanyaṃ bharāmahe devāvyaṃ suhavamadhvaraśriyam
analyzed: apām perum jīva dhanyam bharāmahe devāvyam su havam adhvara śriyam
translated: We bring the swift one, the one rich in living beings, the one belonging to the gods, the easily invoked one, the one with the glory of sacrifice.

original: suraśmiṃ somamindriyaṃ yamīmahi taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: su raśmim somam indriyam yamīmahi tat devānām
translated: We long for the Soma with good rays, the powerful one, that of the gods...

original: sanema tat susanitā sanitvabhirvayaṃ jīvā jīvaputrāanāgasaḥ🔽brahmadviṣo viṣvageno bharerata taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: sanema tat su sanitā sanitvabhiḥ vayam jīvāḥ jīva putrāḥ anāgasaḥ  brahma dviṣaḥ viṣvak enaḥ bharerata tat devānām
translated: May we obtain that with good obtainers, we who are living, with living children, sinless.🔽Let the haters of prayer be burdened with all sin, that of the gods...

original: ye sthā manoryajñiyāste śṛṇotana yad vo devā īmahetad dadātana
analyzed: ye stha manoḥ yajñiyāḥ te śṛṇotana yat vaḥ devāḥ īmahe itat dadātana
translated: O you who are to be worshipped in the mind, listen to that, O gods, which we implore of you, grant that.

original: jaitraṃ kratuṃ rayimad vīravad yaśastaddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: jaitram kratum rayimat vīravat yaśaḥ tat devānām
translated: The victorious sacrifice, rich in wealth and heroic glory, that of the gods...

original: mahadadya mahatāmā vṛṇīmahe 'vo devānāṃ bṛhatāmanarvaṇām
analyzed: mahat adya mahatām ā vṛṇīmahe vaḥ devānām bṛhatām anarvaṇām
translated: We choose today the great protection of the great gods, the lofty and irresistible.

original: yathā vasu vīrajātaṃ naśāmahai taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: yathā vasu vīra jātam naśāmahai tat devānām
translated: So that we may enjoy the wealth born of heroes, that of the gods...

original: maho agneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇyanāgā mitre varuṇesvastaye
analyzed: mahaḥ agneḥ samidhānasya śarmaṇyanāgāḥ mitre varuṇesvastaye
translated: In the great protection of the kindled Agni, in Mitra and Varuna for safety,

original: śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani taddevānāṃ / / /
analyzed: śreṣṭhe syāma savituḥ savīmani tat devānām
translated: May we be the best in the impulse of Savitar, that of the gods...

original: ye savituḥ satyasavasya viśve mitrasya vrate varuṇasyadevāḥ
analyzed: ye savituḥ satya savasya viśve mitrasya vrate varuṇasya devāḥ
translated: All you gods of Savitar, the one with true impulse, in the rule of Mitra and Varuna,

original: te saubhagaṃ vīravad gomadapno dadhātanadraviṇaṃ citramasme
analyzed: te saubhagam vīravat gomat apnaḥ dadhātana draviṇam citram asme
translated: Grant us good fortune with heroic sons and abundant cattle, and various wealth.

original: savitā paścātāt savitā purastāt savitottarāttātsavitādharāttāt
analyzed: savitā paścātāt savitā purastāt savitā uttarāttāt savitā adharāttāt
translated: Savitar from the west, Savitar from the east, Savitar from the north, Savitar from the south,

original: savitā naḥ suvatu sarvatātiṃ savitā norāsatāṃ dīrghamayuḥ
analyzed: savitā naḥ suvatu sarvatātim savitā naḥ āsatām dīrgham ayuḥ
translated: May Savitar grant us all protection, may Savitar grant us long life.

original: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtaṃsaparyata
analyzed: namaḥ mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase mahaḥ devāya tat ṛtaṃsaparyata
translated: Homage to the watch of Mitra and Varuna, to the great god, honor that truth!

original: dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāyasūryāya śaṃsata
analyzed: dūredṛśe deva jātāya ketave divaḥ putrāya sūryāya śaṃsata
translated: To the far-seeing banner born of the gods, to the son of heaven, to Surya, sing praises!

original: sā mā satyoktiḥ pari pātu viśvato dyāvā ca yatratatanannahāni ca
analyzed: sā mā satya uktiḥ pari pātu viśvatas dyāvā ca ca
translated: May that true utterance protect me on every side, where the heavens and the days are spread out.

original: viśvamanyan ni viśate yadejativiśvāhāpo viśvāhodeti sūryaḥ
analyzed: viśvam anyat ni viśate yat ejati viśvāhā apaḥ viśvāhā udeti sūryaḥ
translated: All other things enter into the all-pervading one when it moves. All days the waters flow, all days the sun rises.

original: na te adevaḥ pradivo ni vāsate yadetaśebhiḥ patarairatharyasi
analyzed: na te adevaḥ pradivaḥ ni vāsate yat etaśebhiḥ pataraiḥ atharyasi
translated: No godless man can clothe you in the sky when you go forth with your swift-moving steeds.

original: prācīnamanyadanu vartate raja udanyenajyotiṣā yāsi sūrya
analyzed: prācīnam anyat anu vartate rajaḥ udanyena jyotiṣā yāsi sūrya
translated: One other region lies in front, the other behind. With the other light you go, O sun.

original: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamo jagacca viśvamudiyarṣibhānunā
analyzed: yena sūrya jyotiṣā bādhase tamaḥ jagat ca viśvam udiya ṛṣi bhānunā
translated: With that light, O sun, with which you overcome the darkness and illumine the whole world with your radiance,

original: tenāsmad viśvāmanirāmanāhutimapāmīvāmapa duṣvapnyaṃ suva
analyzed: tena asmat viśvāmanirāman āhutim apa amīvām apa duṣvapnyam suva
translated: with that light, O all-knowing one, remove from us the oblation that is not, the evil spirit, the bad dream, and drive it away.

original: viśvasya hi preṣito rakṣasi vratamaheḷayannuccarasisvadhā anu
analyzed: viśvasya hi preṣitaḥ rakṣasi vratam aheḍayan ucca rasi svadhāḥ anu
translated: For you are sent forth to guard the vow of all. Moving upwards, you go along your own path.

original: yadadya tvā sūryopabravāmahai taṃ no devāanu maṃsīrata kratum
analyzed: yat adya tvā sūrya upabravāmahai tam naḥ devāḥ anu maṃsīrata kratum
translated: Whatever we today, O sun, are about to address to you, may the gods accept that intention of ours.

original: taṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī tan na āpa indraḥ śṛṇvantu marutohavaṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: tam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī tat naḥ āpaḥ indraḥ śṛṇvantu marutaḥ havam vacaḥ
translated: May Dyaus and Prithivī, the waters, Indra, the Maruts listen to our call and our speech.

original: mā śūne bhūma sūryasya sandṛśibhadraṃ jīvanto jaraṇāmaśīmahi
analyzed: mā śūne bhūma sūryasya sandṛśi bhadram jīvantaḥ jaraṇām aśīmahi
translated: Let us not be childless at the rising of the sun. May we, living happily, attain old age.

original: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ sucakṣasaḥ prajāvanto anamīvāanāgasaḥ
analyzed: viśvāhā tvā sumanasaḥ su cakṣasaḥ prajāvantaḥ anamīva aanāgasaḥ
translated: All days may we be well-disposed, well-sighted, with offspring, free from disease, and sinless.

original: udyantaṃ tvā mitramaho divedive jyog jīvāḥprati paśyema sūrya
analyzed: udyantam tvā mitra mahas dive dive jyok jīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya
translated: May we long live to behold you rising, O sun, day after day, O you whose greatness is like that of Mitra.

original: mahi jyotirbibhrataṃ tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantaṃ cakṣuṣe cakṣuṣe mayaḥ
analyzed: mahi jyotiḥ bibhratam tvā vicakṣaṇa bhāsvantam cakṣuṣe cakṣuṣe mayaḥ
translated: Bearing great light, O all-seeing one, shining, for the eye, for the eye, for happiness

original: ārohantaṃ bṛhataḥ pājasas pari vayaṃjīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya
analyzed: ārohantam bṛhataḥ pājasaḥ pari vayaṃjīvāḥ prati paśyema sūrya
translated: We shall behold thee, O Sūrya, rising from the height of the great light, we living

original: yasya te viśvā bhuvanāni ketunā pra cerate ni ca viśanteaktubhiḥ
analyzed: yasya te viśvā bhuvanāni ketunā pra cerate ni ca viśante aktubhiḥ
translated: Whose light is the banner of all existing things, and who moves forth and enters them with his rays

original: anāgāstvena harikeśa sūryāhnāhnā novasyasāvasyasodihi
analyzed: anāgāstvena hari keśa sūrya ahnā ahnā novasyasā avasyasā udihi
translated: O Sūrya, with tawny hair, free from sin, come to us day by day with increasing favour

original: śaṃ no bhava cakṣasā śaṃ no ahnā śaṃ bhānunā śaṃhimā śaṃ ghṛṇena
analyzed: śam naḥ bhava cakṣasā śam naḥ ahnā śam bhānunā śaṃhimā śam ghṛṇena
translated: Be auspicious to us with thy sight, be auspicious to us with the day, be auspicious with thy light, be auspicious with thy wrath

original: yathā śamadhvañchamasad duroṇetat sūrya draviṇaṃ dhehi citram
analyzed: yathā śamadhvan śamasad duroṇā itat sūrya draviṇam dhehi citram
translated: As thou art auspicious, O Sūrya, so make our dwelling auspicious. Bestow that wealth, O Sūrya, which is varied

original: asmākaṃ devā ubhayāya janmane śarma yachata dvipadecatuṣpade
analyzed: asmākam devāḥ ubhayāya janmane śarma yacchata dvipade catuṣpade
translated: Grant protection, O gods, to both our generations, to the bipeds and to the quadrupeds

original: adat pibadūrjayamānamāśitaṃ tadasmeśaṃ yorarapo dadhātana
analyzed: adat pibat ūrjayamānam āśitam tat asmā īśam yā urarapaḥ dadhātana
translated: What he hath eaten, drunk, and what he hath gained, bestow ye on us, O ye who are good, that wealth

original: yad vo devāścakṛma jihvayā guru manaso vā prayutīdevaheḷanam
analyzed: yat vaḥ devāḥ cakṛma jihvayā guru manasaḥ vā
translated: Whatever sin we have committed with our tongue, O gods, or with our mind, in our devotion to the gods

original: arāvā yo no abhi duchunāyate tasmin tadenovasavo ni dhetana
analyzed: arāvā yaḥ naḥ abhi duchunāyate tasmin tad enaḥ vasavaḥ ni dhetana
translated: Place that guilt, O Vasus, on him who injures us with evil intent

original: asmin na indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāvasātaye
analyzed: asmin naḥ indra pṛtsutau yaśasvati śimīvati krandasi prāvasātaye
translated: In this battle, O Indra, which is glorious, which is full of strength, which is for the sake of cattle

original: yatra goṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvakpatanti didyavo nṛṣāhye
analyzed: yatra goṣātā dhṛṣiteṣu khādiṣu viṣvak patanti didyavaḥ nṛṣāhye
translated: Where in the battle of men, in the contests of the bold, the arrows fly in all directions,

original: sa naḥ kṣumantaṃ sadane vyūrṇuhi goarṇasaṃ rayimindraśravāyyam
analyzed: sa naḥ kṣumantam sadane vyūrṇuhi go arṇasam rayim indra śravāyyam
translated: Unfold for us, O Indra, in our dwelling, wealth that is full of food, full of milk, to be praised by us.

original: syāma te jayataḥ śakra medino yathā vayamuśmasi tad vaso kṛdhi
analyzed: syāma te jayataḥ śakra medinaḥ yathā vayam uśmasi tat vaso kṛdhi
translated: We would be the friends of thee the victorious, O Sakra, O Vasu, make that possible for us.

original: yo no dāsa āryo vā puruṣṭutādeva indra yudhaye ciketati
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dāsaḥ āryaḥ vā puruṣṭutādevaḥ indra yudhaye ciketati
translated: He who, whether a slave or an Aryan, is much praised, O Indra, thinks of us for the fight,

original: asmābhiṣ ṭe suṣahāḥ santu śatravastvayā vayaṃ tānvanuyāma saṃgame
analyzed: asmābhiḥ te suṣahāḥ santu śatravaḥ tvayā vayam tān vanuyāma saṃgame
translated: Let thy enemies be easy to conquer for us. With thee we will follow them in the encounter.

original: yo dabhrebhirhavyo yaśca bhūribhiryo abhīke varivovinnṛṣāhye🔽taṃ vikhāde sasnimadya śrutaṃ naramarvāñcamindramavase karāmahe
analyzed: yaḥ dabhrebhiḥ havyaḥ yaḥ ca bhūribhiḥ yaḥ abhīke varivaḥ vid nṛṣāhye  tam vikhāde sasnim adya śrutam naram arvāñcam indram avase karāmahe
translated: He who is to be invoked with the weak and with the strong, who is the bestower of room in the battle of men,🔽To that Indra, the swift, the strong, the famous, we come for help, to the hero who bends (to us).

original: svavṛjaṃ hi tvāmahamindra śuśravānānudaṃ vṛṣabharadhracodanam
analyzed: svavṛjam hi tvām aham indra śuśrava anānudam vṛṣabha radhra codanam
translated: For I have heard, O Indra, that thou art self-dependent, the bull who urges on the worshipper.

original: pra muñcasva pari kutsādihā gahi kimutvāvān muṣkayorbaddha āsate
analyzed: pra muñcasva pari kutsa adihā gahi muṣkayoḥ baddhaḥ āsate
translated: Let loose, come hither from Kutsa. What is it that stays bound to thy testicles?

original: yo vāṃ parijmā suvṛdaśvinā ratho doṣāmuṣāso havyohaviṣmatā
analyzed: yaḥ vām parijmā suvṛt aśvinā rathaḥ doṣāmuṣāsaḥ havyaḥ haviṣmatā
translated: Your chariot, O Asvins, which is swift, with good horses, to be invoked at the two twilights, with the offering of oblations,

original: śaśvattamāsastamu vāmidaṃ vayaṃ piturnanāma suhavaṃ havāmahe
analyzed: śaśvattamāsaḥ tamu vām idam vayam pituḥ nanāma su havam havāmahe
translated: We call upon that, which is most enduring, like a father, easy to invoke, for this (boon).

original: codayataṃ sūnṛtāḥ pinvataṃ dhiya ut purandhīrīrayatantaduśmasi
analyzed: codayatam sūnṛtāḥ pinvatam dhiyaḥ ud purandhīḥ īrayatan tat uśmasi
translated: Impel the kindly ones, make our thoughts to swell, and give us wisdom: this we ask of you.

original: yaśasaṃ bhāgaṃ kṛṇutaṃ no aśvinā somaṃ nacāruṃ maghavatsu nas kṛtam🔽amājuraścid bhavatho yuvaṃ bhago 'nāśościdavitārāpamasya cit
analyzed: yaśasam bhāgam kṛṇutam naḥ aśvinā somam nacārum maghavatsu naḥ kṛtam  amājuraḥ cit bhavathaḥ yuvam bhagaḥ nāśoḥ cit avitārā apamasya cit
translated: Make ye our portion, O ye Aṣvins, glorious fame: make ye us rich in kine and horses, O ye Lords of splendour.🔽Ye are the benefactors even of the aged: ye are the helpers of the man without a son.

original: andhasya cin nāsatyā kṛśasya cid yuvāmidāhurbhiṣajā rutasya cit
analyzed: andhasya cit nāsatyā kṛśasya cit yuvām id āhuḥ bhiṣajā rutasya cit
translated: Even of the blind, O Nâsatyas, and the weak, even of the cripple ye are called the physicians.

original: yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ sanayaṃ yathā rathaṃ punaryuvānaṃcarathāya takṣathuḥ
analyzed: yuvam cyavānam sanayam yathā ratham punaryuvānam carathāya takṣathuḥ
translated: Ye made Cyavana, who was bent together like a bow, straight again, and set him on his car to travel.

original: niṣ ṭaugryamūhathuradbhyas pariviśvet tā vāṃ savaneṣu pravācyā
analyzed: niḥ taugryam ūhathuḥ adbhyaḥ pariviśvā id tā vām savaneṣu pravācyā
translated: Ye brought Taugrya out of the waters: all this shall be declared at your libations.

original: purāṇā vāṃ vīryā pra bravā jane 'tho hāsathurbhiṣajāmayobhuvā
analyzed: purāṇā vām vīryā pra bravā jane tho hāsathuḥ bhiṣajā mayobhuvā
translated: I will proclaim your ancient deeds of prowess among men: then ye shall be the physicians who heal all pain.

original: tā vāṃ nu navyāvavase karāmahe 'yaṃnāsatyā śradariryathā dadhat
analyzed: tā vām nu navyau avase karāmahe yaṃnāsatyā śradariḥ yathā dadhat
translated: To you, O Nâsatyas, we will come for aid, as one who brings a gift to him who loves him.

original: iyaṃ vāmahve śṛṇutaṃ me aśvinā putrāyeva pitarā mahyaṃśikṣatam
analyzed: iyam vāmahve śṛṇutam me aśvinā putrāya iva pitarā mahyam śikṣatam
translated: I call you hither: listen to me, O Aṣvins. As to a son, instruct ye me, O ye two, as Fathers.

original: anāpirajñā asajātyāmatiḥ purā tasyāabhiśasterava spṛtam
analyzed: an āpiḥ ajñāḥ a sajātyā a matiḥ purā spṛtam
translated: The curse of the kinsmanless, the ignorant, the alien, the curse of him who is not of our kin, avert from us before it comes.

original: yuvaṃ rathena vimadāya śundhyuvaṃ nyūhathuḥ purumitrasyayoṣaṇām
analyzed: yuvam rathena vimadāya śundhyuvam nyūhathuḥ purumitrasya yoṣaṇām
translated: Ye brought the chariot to Vimada, and brought the wife of Purumitra to Sûndhu.

original: yuvaṃ havaṃ vadhrimatyā agachataṃ yuvaṃsuṣutiṃ cakrathuḥ purandhaye
analyzed: yuvam havam vadhrimatyāḥ agachatam yuvaṃsuṣutim cakrathuḥ purandhaye
translated: ye went to the invocation of the feeble one ye made susobhari a giver of joy to the maiden

original: yuvaṃ viprasya jaraṇāmupeyuṣaḥ punaḥ kalerakṛṇutaṃyuvad vayaḥ
analyzed: yuvam viprasya jaraṇām upeyuṣaḥ punar kaleḥ akṛṇutam yuvat vayaḥ
translated: ye gave back youth to the singer who had grown old ye gave him life again o ye who have all things in your power

original: yuvaṃ vandanam ṛśyadādudūpathuryuvaṃsadyo viśpalāmetave kṛthaḥ
analyzed: yuvam vandanam ṛśyadā dudūpathuḥ yuvaṃsadyaḥ viśpalām etave kṛthaḥ
translated: ye raised up the hymn for ṛṣya to sing ye made the dwelling of viṣpalā to be his

original: yuvaṃ ha rebhaṃ vṛṣaṇā guhā hitamudairayatammamṛvāṃsamaśvinā
analyzed: yuvam ha rebham vṛṣaṇā guhā hitam udairayatam mamṛvāṃsam aśvinā
translated: ye aśvins raised up from the cave the bull rebha the active one to life again

original: yuvam ṛbīsamuta taptamatrayaomanvantaṃ cakrathuḥ saptavadhraye
analyzed: yuvam ṛbīsam uta taptamatrayaḥ omanvantam cakrathuḥ saptavadhraye
translated: ye gave ṛbīsa and the heated bath to saptavadhri

original: yuvaṃ śvetaṃ pedave 'śvināśvaṃ navabhirvājairnavatīca vājinam
analyzed: yuvam śvetam pedave śvinā aśvam navabhiḥ vājaiḥ navatīca vājinam
translated: ye aśvins gave to peedu the white horse with nine horses to draw and nine strong horses

original: carkṛtyaṃ dadathurdrāvayatsakhaṃ bhagaṃ nanṛbhyo havyaṃ mayobhubam
analyzed: carkṛtyam dadathuḥ drāvayat sakham bhagam nanṛbhyaḥ havyam mayobhubam
translated: the car that goes with speed ye gave as a gift to bhaga the men to be his share the offering that brings delight

original: na taṃ rājānāvadite kutaścana nāṃho aśnoti duritaṃnakirbhayam
analyzed: na tam rājā anāvadite kutaścana na aṃhaḥ aśnoti duritaṃnakir bhayam
translated: o royal pair no one from any side injures him no evil or fear approaches him

original: yamaśvinā suhavā rudravartanī purorathaṃkṛṇuthaḥ patnyā saha
analyzed: yam aśvinā su havā rudravartanī puroratham kṛṇuthaḥ patnyā saha
translated: whom o ye aśvins swift to hear who follow the rudras ye make the first to win the prize with his wife

original: ā tena yātaṃ manaso javīyasā rathaṃ yaṃ vām ṛbhavaścakruraśvinā
analyzed: ā tena yātam manasaḥ javīyasā ratham yam vām ṛbhavaḥ cakruḥ aśvinā
translated: come hither with that car which is swifter than thought o ye aśvins which the ṛbhus have constructed for you

original: yasya yoge duhitā jāyate diva ubhe ahanīsudine vivasvataḥ
analyzed: yasya yoge duhitā jāyate divaḥ ubhe ahanī sudine vivasvataḥ
translated: in whose companionship his daughter is born of heaven both days of vivasvān the fair day and the bright

original: tā vartiryātaṃ jayuṣā vi parvatamapinvataṃ śayavedhenumaśvinā
analyzed: tā vartiḥ yātam jayuṣā vi parvatam apinvatam śayavedhenum aśvinā
translated: That is your path, O ye Aṣvins, with your conquering might ye burst the mountain open and set free the milch-cow for the singer

original: vṛkasya cid vartikāmantarāsyād yuvaṃśacībhirgrasitāmamuñcatam
analyzed: vṛkasya cit vartikām antara āsyāt yuvam śacībhiḥ grasitām amuñcatam
translated: Ye with your powers set free the Vr̥ikâ who was swallowed up within the wolf's capacious mouth

original: etaṃ vāṃ stomamaśvināvakarmātakṣāma bhṛgavo na ratham
analyzed: etam vām stomam aśvinau akarma atakṣāma bhṛgavaḥ na ratham
translated: This hymn of praise, O Aṣvins, we have fashioned like a car, as Bhṛigus fashion a car

original: nyamṛkṣāma yoṣaṇāṃ na marye nityaṃ na sūnuntanayaṃ dadhānāḥ
analyzed: nyamṛkṣāma yoṣaṇām na marye nityam na sūnuntanayam dadhānāḥ
translated: We have prepared the couch as for a youthful man, bestowing on you a son who shall endure

original: rathaṃ yāntaṃ kuha ko ha vāṃ narā prati dyumantaṃsuvitāya bhūṣati
analyzed: ratham yāntam kuha kaḥ ha vām narā prati dyumantam suvitāya bhūṣati
translated: Who, O ye Heroes, who will deck for you the car, the splendid car, to bring you to our side?

original: prātaryāvāṇaṃ vibhvaṃ viśeviśevastor vastorvahamānaṃ dhiyā śami🔽kuha svid doṣā kuha vastoraśvinā kuhābhipitvaṃ karataḥkuhoṣatuḥ
analyzed: prātaryāvāṇam vibhvam viśe viśe vastoḥ vastoḥ vahamānam dhiyā śami  kuha svid doṣā kuha vastoḥ aśvinā kuha abhipitvam karataḥ kuha uṣatuḥ
translated: The car that comes at early morn, the car that comes at eve, the car that comes at every call, I bring to you with prayer🔽Where are ye now, O ye who come at eve and morn? Where is your coming now? Where is your dwelling-place?

original: ko vāṃ śayutrā vidhaveva devaraṃ maryaṃ nayoṣā kṛṇute sadhastha ā
analyzed: kaḥ vām śayutrā vidhavā iva devaram maryam na yoṣā kṛṇute sadhasthe ā
translated: Who, like a widow, brings her husband to your house, a mortal man, O Aṣvins, to your home?

original: prātarjarethe jaraṇeva kāpayā vastorvastoryajatā gachathogṛham
analyzed: prātar jarethe jaraṇā iva kāpayā vastoḥ vastoḥ yajatā gachathaḥ gṛham
translated: Ye come at eve and morn, as 'twere with weary feet, to every house where sacrifice is paid.

original: kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rājaputrevasavanāva gachathaḥ
analyzed: kasya dhvasrā bhavathaḥ kasya vā narā rāja putrā ivasavanā ava gachathaḥ
translated: Whose are ye, O ye Rulers? Whose, O Heroes? Like princes of a king, to whom do ye come?

original: yuvāṃ mṛgeva vāraṇā mṛgaṇyavo doṣā vastorhaviṣā nihvayāmahe
analyzed: yuvām mṛgā iva vāraṇā mṛgaṇyavaḥ doṣā vastoḥ haviṣā nihvayāmahe
translated: Like two wild beasts, O ye who seek the forest, we call you with our gifts at eve and morn.

original: yuvaṃ hotrām ṛtuthā juhvate nareṣaṃ janāyavahathaḥ śubhas patī
analyzed: yuvam hotrām ṛtuthā juhvate narā iṣam janāya vahathaḥ śubhaḥ patī
translated: ye two as priests at due seasons offer sacrifice ye lords of splendour bring felicity to the people

original: yuvāṃ ha ghoṣā paryaśvinā yatī rājña ūce duhitāpṛche vāṃ narā
analyzed: yuvām ha ghoṣā paryaśvinā yatī rājñaḥ ūce duhitā apṛcche vām narā
translated: the daughter of the king ghosā hath called you o aśvins ye men i ask you to come to me

original: bhūtaṃ me ahna uta bhūtamaktave'śvāvate rathine śaktamarvate🔽yuvaṃ kavī ṣṭhaḥ paryaśvinā rathaṃ viśo na kutsojariturnaśāyathaḥ
analyzed: bhūtam me ahne uta bhūtam aktave iśvāvate rathine śaktam arvate  yuvam kavī ṣṭhaḥ pari aśvinā ratham viśaḥ na kutsaḥ jarituḥ naśāyathaḥ
translated: be ye for me to-day and be ye for me at eve to aśvavān the charioteer to ṛbhu the steed🔽ye two as sages o ye aśvins have mounted the car as the people of kutsa as the singers have mounted it

original: yuvorha makṣā paryaśvinā madhvāsā bharata niṣkṛtaṃ na yoṣaṇā
analyzed: yuvoḥ ha makṣā paryaśvinā madhvāsā bharata niṣkṛtam na yoṣaṇā
translated: your two bees o ye aśvins have brought the meath to the presser as a woman brings her gift to her lord

original: yuvaṃ ha bhujyuṃ yuvamaśvinā vaśaṃ yuvaṃ śiñjāramuśanāmupārathuḥ
analyzed: yuvam ha bhujyum yuvam aśvinā vaśam yuvam śiñjāram uśanām upārathuḥ
translated: ye have helped bhujyu o ye aśvins and vaśa and ye have raised up śiñjāra from the water

original: yuvo rarāvā pari sakhyamāsate yuvorahamavasā sumnamā cake
analyzed: yuvoḥ rarāvā pari sakhyam āsate yuvoḥ aham avasā sumnam ā cake
translated: they who are far away and they who are near to you come to your friendship i have sought your grace o aśvins

original: yuvaṃ ha kṛśaṃ yuvamaśvinā śayuṃ yuvaṃ vidhantaṃvidhavāmuruṣyathaḥ
analyzed: yuvam ha kṛśam yuvam aśvinā śayum yuvam vidhantam vidhavām uruṣyathaḥ
translated: ye have helped the weakling o ye aśvins and śayu ye have protected the widow and the man who mourns

original: yuvaṃ sanibhya stanayantamaśvināpavrajamūrṇuthaḥ saptāsyam🔽janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnako vi cāruhan vīrudhodaṃsanā anu
analyzed: yuvam sanibhyaḥ stanayantam aśvinā apavrajam ūrṇuthaḥ sapta āsyam  janiṣṭa yoṣā patayat kanīnakaḥ vi cāru han vīrudhaḥ daṃsanāḥ anu
translated: ye have loosed for the slayers the roaring aśvins the cloud that hath seven heads🔽the maiden hath brought forth the infant who hath flown away the plants have opened themselves in beauty as he looks on them

original: āsmai rīyante nivaneva sindhavo 'smā ahnebhavati tat patitvanam
analyzed: ā asmai rīyante nivanā iva sindhavaḥ sma ahnebhavati tat patitvanam
translated: to him the rivers flow as to a watercourse that is his lordship which he hath at eve

original: jīvaṃ rudanti vi mayante adhvare dīrghāmanu prasitindīdhiyurnaraḥ
analyzed: jīvam rudanti vi mayante adhvare dīrghām anu prasitin dīdhiyuḥ naraḥ
translated: they weep for life and are disquieted in sacrifice the men follow the long-extended course of thought

original: vāmaṃ pitṛbhyo ya idaṃ samerire mayaḥpatibhyo janayaḥ pariṣvaje
analyzed: vāmam pitṛbhyaḥ ye idam samerire mayaḥ patibhyaḥ janayaḥ pariṣvaje
translated: to the fathers who have established this as good the sons cling closely to the lords of the house

original: na tasya vidma tadu ṣu pra vocata yuvā ha yad yuvatyāḥkṣeti yoniṣu🔽priyosriyasya vṛṣabhasya retino gṛhaṃgamemāśvinā taduśmasi🔽ā vāmagan sumatirvājinīvasū nyaśvinā hṛtsu kāmāayaṃsata
analyzed: na tasya vidma tat u su pra vocata yuvā ha yat yuvatyāḥkṣeti yoniṣu  priya usriyasya vṛṣabhasya retinaḥ gṛhaṃgamā imā aśvinā tat uśmasi  ā vām agan sumatiḥ vājinīvasū ni aśvinā hṛtsu kāmā ayaṃsata
translated: we know not that nor can it be told how the young man rests in the wombs of the young maiden🔽he goes to the house of the dear bull the lover of the woman that is our grief o aśvins🔽come to us o ye lords of wealth in a friendly spirit the desires in our hearts have been active o aśvins

original: abhūtaṃ gopā mithunā śubhas patī priyāaryamṇo duryānaśīmahi
analyzed: abhūtam gopā mithunā śubhaḥ patī priyā a aryamṇaḥ
translated: we have come to the dwelling of the auspicious pair the guardians who are dear to aryaman

original: tā mandasānā manuṣo duroṇa ā dhattaṃ rayiṃ sahavīraṃvacasyave
analyzed: tā mandasānā manuṣaḥ duroṇe ā dhattam rayim saha vīraṃvacasyave
translated: rejoicing in the house of men bestow wealth with heroes on the singer

original: kṛtaṃ tīrthaṃ suprapāṇaṃ śubhas patīsthāṇuṃ patheṣṭhāmapa durmatiṃ hatam
analyzed: kṛtam tīrtham su prapāṇam śubhaḥ patīsthāṇum patheṣṭhām apa durmatim hatam
translated: ye lords of splendour have made a ford a good drinkingplace ye have smitten down the standing thing that stayed the way and evil thoughts

original: kva svidadya katamāsvaśvinā vikṣu dasrā mādayeteśubhas patī
analyzed: kva svid adya katamāsu aśvinā vikṣu dasrā mādayeta īśubhaḥ patī
translated: where now this day o ye aśvins lords of splendour are the wondrous twain carousing among the folk

original: ka īṃ ni yeme katamasya jagmaturviprasya vāyajamānasya vā gṛham
analyzed: kaḥ īm ni yeme katamasya jagmatuḥ viprasya vā a yajamānasya vā gṛham
translated: who has led them who has brought them to the house of the singer or of the liberal worshipper

original: samānamu tyaṃ puruhūtamukthyaṃ rathaṃ tricakraṃ savanāganigmatam
analyzed: samānam u tyam puru hūtam ukthyam ratham tri cakram sava nāga nigmatam
translated: that one to be invoked by many worthy of praise the chariot with three wheels that ever comes to the solemn rites

original: parijmānaṃ vidathyaṃ suvṛktibhirvayaṃvyuṣṭā uṣaso havāmahe
analyzed: parijmānam vidathyam suvṛktibhiḥ vayam vyuṣṭau uṣasaḥ havāmahe
translated: We call on him who wanders round, who visits the assembly, with our hymns, at the dawnings of the dawn

original: prātaryujaṃ nāsatyādhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātaryāvāṇammadhuvāhanaṃ ratham
analyzed: prātar yujam nāsatyā adhi tiṣṭhathaḥ prātar yāvāṇam madhu vāhanam ratham
translated: Ye mount the chariot yoked at dawn, the car that brings the meath, the car that travels at the dawn

original: viśo yena gachatho yajvarīrnarākīreścid yajñaṃ hotṛmantamaśvinā
analyzed: viśaḥ yena gachathaḥ yajvarīḥ narā akīreḥ cit yajñam hotṛmantam aśvinā
translated: By which, O Heroes, ye visit the people who offer sacrifice, O ye Aṣvins, even the sacrifice

original: adhvaryuṃ vā madhupāṇiṃ suhastyamagnidhaṃ vādhṛtadakṣaṃ damūnasam
analyzed: adhvaryum vā madhu pāṇim suhastyam agnidham vā ādhṛtadakṣam damūnasam
translated: Of the Adhvaryu, whose hands are full of meath, who is skilled in sacrifice, or of the kindler of the sacred fire, who is firm in strength and rules his house

original: viprasya vā yat savanani gachatho'ta ā yātaṃ madhupeyamaśvinā
analyzed: viprasya vā yat savanani gacchatha uta ā yātam madhupeyam aśvinā
translated: Or when ye come to the libations of the sage, come hither, O ye Aṣvins, to the drinking of the meath

original: asteva su prataraṃ lāyamasyan bhūṣanniva pra bharāstomamasmai🔽vācā viprāstarata vācamaryo ni rāmayajaritaḥ soma indram🔽dohena gāmupa śikṣā sakhāyaṃ pra bodhaya jaritarjāramindram
analyzed: astā iva su prataram lāyam asyan bhūṣan iva pra bhara a stomam asmai  vācā viprāstarata vācam aryaḥ ni rāmaya jaritar somaḥ indram  dohena gām upa śikṣa sakhāyam pra bodhaya jaritar jāram indram
translated: As one who seeks a well-constructed bridge, prepare for him this hymn as one who decks himself🔽O priests, spread out your speech, O men, delight your speech; O thou who art led forward, make Indra glad with Soma🔽With milk instruct the friend, the cow; O thou who art led forward, wake up Indra, the singer's friend

original: kośaṃ na pūrṇaṃ vasunā nyṛṣṭamā cyāvayamaghadeyāya śūram
analyzed: kośam na pūrṇam vasunā nyṛṣṭam ā cyāvaya agha deyāya śūram
translated: Like a full treasure-house, rich in wealth, urge ye the hero on to give his guerdon

original: kimaṅga tvā maghavan bhojamāhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayantvā śṛṇomi
analyzed: kim aṅga tvā maghavan bhojam āhuḥ śiśīhi mā śiśayan tvā śṛṇomi
translated: Why, O bountiful one, do they call thee a feeder? Exalt me: I hear that thou exaltest (others)

original: apnasvatī mama dhīrastu śakra vasuvidambhagamindrā bharā naḥ
analyzed: apnasvatī mama dhīraḥ tu śakra vasu vidambhagam indra ā bhara naḥ
translated: Be thou, O Indra, with me, O mighty one, who hast abundant wealth, a finder of treasures, and bring us wealth

original: tvāṃ janā mamasatyeṣvindra santasthānā vi hvayantesamīke
analyzed: tvām janāḥ mamasatyeṣu indra santasthānāḥ vi hvayante samīke
translated: O Indra, in your battles men who are devoted to you call you to the fray

original: atrā yujaṃ kṛṇute yo haviṣmān nāsunvatāsakhyaṃ vaṣṭi śūraḥ
analyzed: atrā yujam kṛṇute yaḥ haviṣmān na a sunvatā a sakhyam vaṣṭi śūraḥ
translated: Here he makes an ally who offers sacrifice, the hero does not choose friendship with one who does not press out the juice

original: dhanaṃ na syandraṃ bahulaṃ yo asmai tīvrān somānāsunotiprayasvān
analyzed: dhanam na syandram bahulam yaḥ asmai tīvrān somān āsunoti prayasvān
translated: The wealth of him who presses out strong Soma juices for him, O Indra, is abundant

original: tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātarahno nisvaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram
analyzed: tasmai śatrūn sutukān prātarahnaḥ nisvaṣṭrān yuvati hanti vṛtram
translated: To him he hurls the wicked foes in the morning, the youthful one slays Vrtra

original: yasmin vayaṃ dadhimā śaṃsamindre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavākāmamasme🔽ārāccit san bhayatāmasya śatrurnyasmaidyumnā janyā namantām
analyzed: yasmin vayam śaṃsam indre yaḥ śiśrāya maghavā akāmam asme  ārāt cit san bhayatām asya śatruḥ ni asmai dyumnāḥ janyāḥ namantām
translated: In whom we place our hope, O Indra, who, the wealthy one, has taken pity on us🔽Let him fear your wrath even from afar, O foe, let the people's glory bow to him

original: ārācchatrumapa bādhasva dūramugro yaḥ śambaḥpuruhūta tena
analyzed: ārāt śatrum apa bādhasva dūram ugraḥ yaḥ śambaḥ puruhūta tena
translated: Drive the foe far away with that terrible thunderbolt, O you who are invoked by many

original: asme dhehi yavamad gomadindra kṛdhī dhiyaṃjaritre vājaratnām
analyzed: asme dhehi yavamat gomat indra kṛdhi dhiyam jaritre vāja ratnām
translated: Bestow on us, O Indra, wealth in barley and in cattle, and make the singer's thought rich in booty

original: pra yamantarvṛṣasavāso agman tīvrāḥ somā bahulāntāsaindram🔽nāha dāmānaṃ maghavā ni yaṃsan ni sunvate vahatibhūri vāmam
analyzed: pra yam antarvṛṣa savāsaḥ agman tīvrāḥ somāḥ bahula antāsā aindram  na aha dāmānam maghavā ni yaṃsat ni sunvate vahati bhūri vāmam
translated: The strong Soma juices have come to him who is to be praised, the abundant ones, the strong ones, to Indra🔽Maghavan will not withhold the gift he has given, he brings much good to the man who presses out the juice

original: uta prahāmatidīvyā jayāti kṛtaṃ yacchvaghnī vicinotikāle
analyzed: uta prahā mati dīvyā jayāti kṛtam yat śvaghnī vicinoti kāle
translated: He also wins the victory in a great contest, the wicked one who looks for a flaw at the right time

original: yo devakāmo na dhanā ruṇaddhi samit taṃ rāyāsṛjati svadhāvān
analyzed: yaḥ deva kāmaḥ na dhanā ruṇaddhi samidh tam rāyā āsṛjati svadhāvān
translated: He who, being desirous of the gods, does not withhold wealth, the self-moving one sends him forth with prosperity.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ durevāṃ yavena kṣudhaṃ puruhūtaviśvām
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim durevām yavena kṣudham puruhūta viśvām
translated: With cows may we overcome evil desire, with barley all hunger, O you who are invoked by many.

original: vayaṃ rājabhiḥ prathamā dhanānyasmākenavṛjanenā jayema
analyzed: vayam rājabhiḥ prathamāḥ dhanāni asmākena vṛjanena jayema
translated: May we be the first to win riches with the kings, with our own people, with our own clan.

original: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari pātu paścādutottarasmādadharādaghāyoḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari pātu paścāt uta uttarasmāt adharāt aghāyoḥ
translated: May Brihaspati protect us from the rear, from above, from below, from the evil foe.

original: idraḥ purastāduta madhyato naḥ sakhā sakhibhyovarivaḥ kṛṇotu
analyzed: idraḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ sakhā sakhibhyaḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu
translated: May Indra from the front, from the middle, be our friend, and make room for the friends.

original: achā ma indraṃ matayaḥ svarvidaḥ sadhrīcīrviśvāuśatīranūṣata
analyzed: achā me indram matayaḥ svar vidaḥ sadhrīcīḥ viśvāḥ auśatīḥ anūṣata
translated: My thoughts, finding the heavenly world, have come to Indra, all the helpful ones from every side.

original: pari ṣvajante janayo yathā patiṃ maryaṃna śundhyuṃ maghavānamūtaye
analyzed: pari svajante janayaḥ yathā patim maryaṃna śundhyum maghavānam ūtaye
translated: They embrace him as a wife her husband, the bountiful one, the young man, for help.

original: na ghā tvadrigapa veti me manastve it kāmaṃ puruhūtaśiśraya
analyzed: na ghā tvadrigapa veti me manaḥ tve id kāmam puruhūta śiśraya
translated: The stone does not turn away my mind from you; in you, O you who are invoked by many, I place my desire.

original: rājeva dasma ni ṣado 'dhi barhiṣyasmin su some'vapānamastu te
analyzed: rājā iva dasma ni sadaḥ dhi barhiṣi asmin su soma iva pānam astu te
translated: O wondrous one, like a king on the sacrificial grass, let there be a drinking place for you in this good Soma.

original: viṣūvṛdindro amateruta kṣudhaḥ sa id rāyo maghavāvasva īśate
analyzed: viṣūvṛt indraḥ amateḥ uta kṣudhaḥ saḥ id rāyaḥ maghavā avasvaḥ īśate
translated: Indra, who turns away from want and hunger, he, the wealthy one, rules over wealth.

original: tasyedime pravaṇe sapta sindhavo vayovardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
analyzed: tasya id ime pravaṇe sapta sindhavaḥ vayaḥ vardhanti vṛṣabhasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
translated: To him these seven rivers flow in the hollows, they increase the strength of the strong bull.

original: vayo na vṛkṣaṃ supalāśamāsadan somāsa indraṃ mandinaścamūṣadaḥ🔽praiṣāmanīkaṃ śavasā davidyutad vidatsvarmanave jyotirāryam
analyzed: vayaḥ na vṛkṣam su palāśam āsadan somāsaḥ indram mandinaḥ camūṣadaḥ  pra eṣām anīkam śavasā davidyutat vidat svar manave jyotiḥ āryam
translated: The Somas, the gladdening ones, have sat them down on the tree with its fair leaves, on Indra, in the wooden tub🔽The host of the impellers hath shone forth with might, it hath found the light of heaven for the man who knows

original: kṛtaṃ na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargaṃ yan maghavāsūryaṃ jayat
analyzed: kṛtam na śvaghnī vi cinoti devane saṃvargam yat maghavā asūryam jayat
translated: The housewife doth not arrange the gambling of the gods, when Maghavan hath won the sun in the general gathering

original: na tat te anyo anu vīryaṃ śakan napurāṇo maghavan nota nūtanaḥ
analyzed: na tat te anyaḥ anu vīryam śakat na purāṇaḥ maghavan na uta nūtanaḥ
translated: None other than thee is able to equal thy prowess, neither the ancient one, O Maghavan, nor the new one

original: viśaṃviśaṃ maghavā paryaśāyata janānāṃ dhenāavacākaśad vṛṣā
analyzed: viśam viśam maghavā paryaśāyata janānām dhenā avacākaśat vṛṣā
translated: Maghavan hath lain down in every clan, the bull hath looked down upon the people's songs

original: yasyāha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati satīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ
analyzed: yasya āha śakraḥ savaneṣu raṇyati satīvraiḥ somaiḥ sahate pṛtanyataḥ
translated: Whose (clan) Sakra delights in at the libations, he with the strong Soma-draughts conquers the foe

original: āpo na sindhumabhi yat samakṣaran somāsa indraṃ kulyāiva hradam
analyzed: āpaḥ na sindhum abhi yat samakṣaran somāsaḥ indram kulyāḥ iva hradam
translated: As the waters flow together to the river, so the Soma-streams to Indra to the lake

original: vardhanti viprā maho asya sādane yavaṃ navṛṣṭirdivyena dānunā
analyzed: vardhanti viprāḥ mahaḥ asya sādane yavam navṛṣṭiḥ divyena dānunā
translated: The sages increase his greatness in his abode, as the rain the barley with the heavenly moisture

original: vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayad rajassvā yo aryapatnīrakṛṇodimā apaḥ🔽sa sunvate maghavā jīradānave 'vindajjyotirmanave haviṣmate
analyzed: vṛṣā na kruddhaḥ patayat rajassvā yaḥ arya patnīḥ akṛṇot imāḥ apaḥ  sa sunvate maghavā jīra dānave vindat jyotiḥ manave haviṣmate
translated: The bull, as if angry, hath flown over the regions, he who hath made these waters the wives of the noble one🔽He hath found light for the man who presses (Soma) and offers gifts, the bountiful one for the man who gives quickly

original: ujjāyatāṃ paraśurjyotiṣā saha bhūyā ṛtasya sudughāpurāṇavat
analyzed: ujjāyatām paraśuḥ jyotiṣā saha bhūyāḥ ṛtasya sudughā purāṇa vat
translated: Let the axe spring up with the light, let it be as of old, the milker of good things of holy order

original: vi rocatāmaruṣo bhānunā śuciḥ svarṇaśukraṃ śuśucīta satpatiḥ
analyzed: vi rocatām aruṣaḥ bhānunā śuciḥ svarṇa śukram śuśucīta sat patiḥ
translated: May the ruddy one shine with his pure light, may the lord of the good shine with golden radiance.

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ / / /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim
translated: May we cross over distress with our cattle.

original: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari / / /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari
translated: May Brihaspati protect us on all sides.

original: ā yātvindraḥ svapatirmadāya yo dharmaṇā tūtujānastuviṣmān
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ sva patiḥ madāya yaḥ dharmaṇā tūtujānaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: May Indra, the lord of creatures, come for our joy, he who is mighty by his own power, who is ready to act.

original: pratvakṣāṇo ati viśvā sahāṃsyapāreṇamahatā vṛṣṇyena🔽suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ suyamā harī te mimyakṣa vajro nṛpategabhastau
analyzed: pratvakṣāṇaḥ ati viśvā sahāṃsi apāreṇa mahatā vṛṣṇyena  suṣṭhāmā rathaḥ su yamā harī te mimyakṣa vajraḥ nṛpate gabhastau
translated: Who surpasses all opponents by his boundless and mighty virility.🔽Your chariot is well-equipped, your two bay horses are easy to drive, O lord of men, your thunderbolt is well-tempered in the handle.

original: śībhaṃ rājan supathā yāhyarvāṃ vardhāmate papuṣo vṛṣṇyāni
analyzed: śībham rājan su pathā yāhi arvām vardhāmate papuṣaḥ vṛṣṇyāni
translated: O king, come quickly by the good path to increase, to enjoy your mighty powers.

original: endravāho nṛpatiṃ vajrabāhumugramugrāsastaviṣāsa enam
analyzed: ā indravāhaḥ nṛpatim vajra bāhum ugram ugrāsaḥ taviṣāsaḥ enam
translated: O Indra's steed, bring the lord of men, whose arm is strong like a thunderbolt, the mighty one, whose powers are mighty,

original: pratvakṣasaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ satyaśuṣmamemasmatrā sadhamādovahantu🔽evā patiṃ droṇasācaṃ sacetasamūrja skambhaṃ dharuṇaā vṛṣāyase
analyzed: pratvakṣasam vṛṣabham satya śuṣmam ā imasmatrā sadhamādaḥ vahantu  eva patim droṇasācam sacetasam ūrjaḥ skambham dharuṇaā vṛṣāyase
translated: The bull who is ready to act, whose strength is true, let them bring him to us to the feast.🔽Thus, O lord, I strengthen the wise Dronasa, the supporter, the bull,

original: ojaḥ kṛṣva saṃ gṛbhāya tve apyaso yathākenipānāmino vṛdhe
analyzed: ojaḥ kṛṣva sam gṛbhāya tve apyasaḥ yathā kenipānāminaḥ vṛdhe
translated: Gather strength, grasp it, as thy bow, for the increase of the swift ones.

original: gamannasme vasūnyā hi śaṃsiṣaṃ svāśiṣaṃ bharamāyāhi sominaḥ
analyzed: gaman asme vasūni ā hi śaṃsiṣam su āśiṣam bharam āyāhi sominaḥ
translated: Come to us, for I will proclaim the treasures, bring the blessing, come to the Soma-pressers.

original: tvamīśiṣe sāsminnā satsi barhiṣyanādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā
analyzed: tvam īśiṣe sā asmin ā satsi barhiṣi anādhṛṣyā tava pātrāṇi dharmaṇā
translated: Thou art the lord, sit on this sacrificial grass, thy vessels are invincible by law.

original: pṛthak prāyan prathamā devahūtayo 'kṛṇvata śravasyāniduṣṭarā
analyzed: pṛthak prāyan prathamāḥ deva hūtayaḥ kṛṇvata śravasyā aniduṣṭarā
translated: The first divine invocations have gone forth separately, they have made the most excellent glories

original: na ye śekuryajñiyāṃ nāvamāruhamīrmaivate nyaviśanta kepayaḥ
analyzed: na ye śekuḥ yajñiyām nāvam āruhamīḥ maivate nyaviśanta kepayaḥ
translated: Those who could not ascend the sacrificial ship, the waters, the slow ones have settled down

original: evaivāpāgapare santu dūḍhyo 'śvā yeṣāṃ duryujaāyuyujre
analyzed: eva eva apāk apare santu śvā yeṣām duryujaḥ āyuyujre
translated: Even so, let the evil ones be far away, the horses whose yoking is difficult have been yoked

original: itthā ye prāgupare santi dāvane purūṇiyatra vayunāni bhojanā🔽girīnrajrān rejamānānadhārayad dyauḥ krandadantarikṣāṇi kopayat
analyzed: itthā ye prāk upare santi dāvane purūṇiyatra vayunāni bhojanā  girīn rajrān rejamānān adhārayat dyauḥ krandat antarikṣāṇi kopayat
translated: Here are many, who are above and below, for giving, where there are many deeds and enjoyments🔽He holds the moving, compact mountains, the sky roars, the intermediate spaces are agitated

original: samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi ṣkabhāyativṛṣṇaḥ pītvā mada ukthāni śaṃsati
analyzed: samīcīne dhiṣaṇe vi skabhāyati vṛṣṇaḥ pītvā made ukthāni śaṃsati
translated: He stretches out the two meeting bowls, having drunk the strong drink, he praises the hymns

original: imaṃ bibharmi sukṛtaṃ te aṅkuśaṃ yenārujāsi maghavañchaphārujaḥ
analyzed: imam bibharmi su kṛtam te aṅkuśam yena ārujāsi maghavan śaphārujaḥ
translated: I bear this well-made goad of yours, O Maghavan, with which you break the shanks [of your enemies]

original: asmin su te savane astvokyaṃ suta iṣṭaumaghavan bodhyābhagaḥ
analyzed: asmin su te savane astu okyam sute iṣṭau maghavan bodhyā bhagaḥ
translated: Let there be a place for you at this libation, O bountiful one, be mindful at the pressing of the offered juice

original: gobhiṣ ṭaremāmatiṃ / / /
analyzed: gobhiḥ tarema amatim
translated: With the cows we cross over the distress...

original: bṛhaspatirnaḥ pari / / /
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ pari
translated: May Brihaspati...

original: divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe agnirasmad dvitīyaṃ parijātavedāḥ
analyzed: divaḥ pari prathamam jajñe agniḥ asmat dvitīyam parijātavedāḥ
translated: Agni was first born from the sky, from us a second time was born Jātavedas

original: tṛtīyamapsu nṛmaṇā ajasramindhāna enaṃjarate svādhīḥ
analyzed: tṛtīyam apsu nṛmaṇāḥ ajasram indhānaḥ enam jarate svādhīḥ
translated: A third time in the waters, the ever-vigorous one, the self-controlled one kindles him

original: vidmā te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtāpurutrā
analyzed: vidma te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidma te dhāma vibhṛtā purutrā
translated: We know thy three powers, O Agni, in three stations: we know thy forms divided in many places

original: vidmā te nāma paramaṃ guhā yad vidmā tamutsaṃ yata ājagantha
analyzed: vidma te nāma paramam guhā yat vidma tam utsam yatas ājagantha
translated: We know thy highest name, which is in the secret place: we know that birthplace whence thou hast come forth

original: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsvantarnṛcakṣā īdhe divo agnaūdhan
analyzed: samudre tvā nṛmaṇāḥ apsu antar nṛ cakṣāḥ īdhe divaḥ agni ūdhan
translated: O Agni, the men's friend, in the waters, in the ocean, the men's observer, have kindled thee, the supporter of the sky

original: tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsamapāmupasthemahiṣā avardhan🔽akrandadagni stanayanniva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥsamañjan
analyzed: tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāṃsam apām upasthe mahiṣāḥ avardhan  akrandat agniḥ stanayan iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihat vīrudhaḥ samañjan
translated: In the third region, in the waters' lap, the buffaloes have magnified thee as thou standest🔽Agni hath cried like Dyaus who thunders, shaking the earth, and kindling the plants with his glow

original: sadyo jajñāno vi hīmiddho akhyadā rodasībhānunā bhātyantaḥ
analyzed: sadyas jajñānaḥ vi hi īm iddhaḥ akhyadāḥ rodasī bhānunā bhāti antar
translated: As soon as born he hath shone forth, well kindled: within the two world-halves he shineth with his light

original: śrīṇāmudāro dharuṇo rayīṇāṃ manīṣāṇāmprārpaṇaḥ somagopāḥ
analyzed: śrīṇām udāraḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām manīṣāṇām prārpaṇaḥ soma gopāḥ
translated: The bountiful one, the supporter of the spacious abodes of wealth, the offerer of thoughts, the guardian of the Soma

original: vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahaso apsu rājāvi bhātyagra uṣasāmidhānaḥ
analyzed: vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahasaḥ apsu rājā avi bhāti agre uṣasā amidhānaḥ
translated: The son of strength, the good, the king in the waters, shineth first, kindled, in the dawns

original: viśvasya keturbhuvanasya garbha ā rodasī apṛṇājjāyamānaḥ🔽vīḷuṃ cidadrimabhinat parāyañ janā yadagnimayajanta pañca
analyzed: viśvasya ketuḥ bhuvanasya garbhaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāt jāyamānaḥ  vīḷum cit adrim abhinat parāyam janāḥ yat agnim ayajanta pañca
translated: The ensign of all the world, the germ of being, hath filled the two world-halves as he was born🔽He hath cleft the rock even Vîlu as he went away, when the five peoples worshipped Agni

original: uśik pāvako aratiḥ sumedhā marteṣvagniramṛto ni dhāyi
analyzed: uśij pāvakaḥ aratiḥ sumedhāḥ marteṣu agniḥ amṛtaḥ ni dhāyi
translated: The active, the purifying, the wise, the immortal Agni have they placed among mortals

original: iyarti dhūmamaruṣaṃ bharibhraducchukreṇa śociṣādyā inakṣan
analyzed: iyarti dhūmam aruṣam bharibhrat ucchukreṇa śociṣā adyāḥ inakṣan
translated: Bearing the ruddy smoke, the bearer, with his bright flame, when he is about to shine forth

original: dṛśāno rukma urviyā vyadyaud durmarṣamāyuḥ śriyerucānaḥ🔽agniramṛto abhavad vayobhiryadenaṃ dyaurjanayat suretāḥ
analyzed: dṛśānaḥ rukmaḥ urviyā vyadyaut durmarṣam āyuḥ śriyerucānaḥ  agniḥ amṛtaḥ abhavat vayobhiḥ yat enam dyauḥ janayat su retāḥ
translated: Shining, golden-hued, he hath shone forth in his splendour, his life-breath hard to bear, shining for glory🔽Agni became immortal through his powers, when the all-impregnating Dyaus begat him

original: yaste adya kṛṇavad bhadraśoce 'pūpaṃ deva ghṛtavantamagne
analyzed: yaḥ te adya kṛṇavat bhadra śoce pūpam deva ghṛtavantam agne
translated: Who today, O God, shall make for thee, O thou of fair flames, a cake anointed with ghee, O Agni

original: pra taṃ naya prataraṃ vasyo achābhi sumnaṃ devabhaktaṃyaviṣṭha🔽ā taṃ bhaja sauśravaseṣvagna ukthauktha ā bhaja śasyamāne
analyzed: pra tam naya prataram vasyaḥ acha abhi sumnam deva bhaktaṃyaviṣṭha  ā tam bhaja sauśravaseṣu agne ukthaukthe ā bhaja śasyamāne
translated: Lead him to the better, to the most delightful place, O thou most youthful, to the favour of the Gods🔽O Agni, give him a share in fame, give him a share in every hymn that is recited

original: priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavātyujjātena bhinadadujjanitvaiḥ
analyzed: priyaḥ sūrye priyaḥ agnā bhavāti ujjātena bhinadat ujjanitvaiḥ
translated: May he be dear to the Sun, dear to Agni, may he, with the strength of his birth, break through with his own strength

original: tvāmagne yajamānā anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi
analyzed: tvām agne yajamānāḥ anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi
translated: O Agni, the sacrificers, through the days, have placed in thee all the precious treasures

original: tvayā saha draviṇamichamānā vrajaṃ gomantamuśijo vivavruḥ
analyzed: tvayā saha draviṇam icchamānāḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vivavruḥ
translated: The Uṣija people, longing for wealth with thee, have gone forth to the stall filled with cattle

original: astāvyagnirnarāṃ suśevo vaiśvānara ṛṣibhiḥsomagopāḥ
analyzed: astāvi agniḥ narām su śevaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ ṛṣibhiḥ soma gopāḥ
translated: Agni, the very gracious, has been praised by men, Vaisvānara, by the Ṛṣis, the guardians of Soma

original: adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayimasme suvīram
analyzed: a dveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devāḥ dhatta rayim asme su vīram
translated: We will invoke Dyaus and Pṛthivī in their kindness. O Gods, grant us wealth with brave sons

original: pra hotā jāto mahān nabhovin nṛṣadvā sīdadapāmupasthe
analyzed: pra hotā jātaḥ mahān nabhaḥ vid nṛṣadvā sīdat apām upasthe
translated: The great priest, born, extending over the vault, seated in the lap of the waters, among men

original: dadhiryo dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni vidhatetanūpāḥ
analyzed: dadhiḥ yaḥ dhāyi sa te vayāṃsi yantā vasūni
translated: He whom they have made to be thy supporter, he who guards thy vital airs, the bestower of treasures, the protector of the pious

original: imaṃ vidhanto apāṃ sadhasthe paśuṃ na naṣṭaṃ padairanu gman🔽guhā catantamuśijo namobhirichanto dhīrābhṛgavo 'vindan
analyzed: imam vidhantaḥ apām sadhasthe paśum na naṣṭam padaiḥ anu gman  guhā catantam uśijaḥ namobhiḥ ichantaḥ dhīrābhṛgavaḥ vindan
translated: Seeking him who had disappeared, they found him in the abode of the waters, like a lost animal, following his tracks🔽The wise, the Bhṛgus, seeking him who had gone into hiding, found him with their prayers

original: imaṃ trito bhūryavindadichan vaibhūvaso mūrdhanyaghnyāyāḥ
analyzed: imam tritaḥ bhūri avindat icchan vaibhūvasaḥ mūrdhani aghnyāyāḥ
translated: Trita, desiring, found him, the great one, the possessor of wealth, at the head of the victim

original: sa śevṛdho jāta ā harmyeṣu nābhiryuvābhavati rocanasya
analyzed: sa śevṛdhaḥ jātaḥ ā harmyeṣu nābhiḥ yuvā bhavati rocanasya
translated: He, the prosperous one, born in the houses, becomes the young navel of the radiant one

original: mandraṃ hotāramuśijo namobhiḥ prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ netāramadhvarāṇām
analyzed: mandram hotāram uśijaḥ namobhiḥ prāñcam yajñam netāram adhvarāṇām
translated: The wise ones with their prayers have made the pleasant one the priest, the leader of the sacrifice, of the rites

original: viśāmakṛṇvannaratiṃ pāvakaṃ havyavāhandadhato mānuṣeṣu
analyzed: viśām akṛṇvan aratim pāvakam havyavāhan dadhataḥ mānuṣeṣu
translated: Making him the delight of the people, the pure one, the carrier of oblations, among men

original: pra bhūrjayantaṃ mahāṃ vipodhāṃ mūrā amūraṃ purāndarmāṇam
analyzed: pra bhūrjayantam mahām vipodhām mūrāḥ amūram purāndarmāṇam
translated: The great one, the victorious, the far-reaching, the wise one, the one with the radiant face, the one to be praised

original: nayanto garbhaṃ vanāṃ dhiyaṃ dhurhiriśmaśruṃ nārvāṇaṃ dhanarcam
analyzed: nayantaḥ garbham vanām dhiyam dhurhiri śmaśrum na arvāṇam dhana ṛcam
translated: Leading the embryo, the thought, the one with a radiant beard, the swift one, the one to be honored

original: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivīto yonau sīdadantaḥ🔽ataḥ saṃgṛbhyā viśāṃ damūnā vidharmaṇāyantrairīyatenṝn🔽asyājarāso damāmaritrā arcaddhūmāso agnayaḥ pāvakāḥ
analyzed: ni pastyāsu trita stabhūyan parivītaḥ yonau sīdat antaḥ  atas saṃgṛbhyā viśām damūnāḥ vidharmaṇā ayantraiḥ īyatenṝn  asya ajarāsaḥ dama a maritrāḥ arcat dhūmāsaḥ agnayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: Trita, having been extended over the houses, sits in the womb, surrounded🔽From there, the one who delights in the people, the one who is to be led to the law, is carried by the instruments to the men🔽His ageless, immortal, flaming, pure fires, with their smoke ascending,

original: śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāso bhuraṇyavo vanarṣado vāyavo nasomāḥ
analyzed: śvitīcayaḥ śvātrāsaḥ bhuraṇyavaḥ vanarṣadaḥ vāyavaḥ na somāḥ
translated: The white-heaped, swift, busy, rain-pouring winds, the Soma-accompanied Vāyu

original: pra jihvayā bharate vepo agniḥ pra vayunāni cetasāpṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: pra jihvayā bharate vepaḥ agniḥ pra vayunāni cetasā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Agni with his tongue, with his thought, stirs the activities of the earth.

original: tamāyavaḥ śucayantaṃ pāvakaṃ mandraṃhotāraṃ dadhire yajiṣṭham
analyzed: tam āyavaḥ śucayantam pāvakam mandraṃhotāram dadhire yajiṣṭham
translated: The living beings have made him, the pure, the purifying, the delightful, the best sacrificer, the Hotar.

original: dyāvā yamagniṃ pṛthivī janiṣṭāmāpastvaṣṭā bhṛgavoyaṃ sahobhiḥ🔽īḷenyaṃ prathamaṃ mātariśvā devāstatakṣurmanave yajatram
analyzed: dyāvā yam agnim pṛthivī janiṣṭa āma apaḥ tvaṣṭā bhṛgavaḥ yam sahobhiḥ  īḍenyam prathamam mātariśvā devāḥ tatakṣuḥ manave yajatram
translated: Heaven and earth have generated Agni, the waters, Tvastr, the Bhṛgus this one with his powers.🔽The gods fashioned him, the adorable, the first, the all-pervading, the worthy of sacrifice, for Manu.

original: yaṃ tvā devā dadhire havyavāhaṃ puruspṛho mānuṣāsoyajatram🔽sa yāmannagne stuvate vayo dhāḥ pra devayanyaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ🔽jagṛbhmā te dakṣiṇamindra hastaṃ vasūyavo vasupatevasūnām🔽vidmā hi tvā gopatiṃ śūra gonāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ🔽svāyudhaṃ svavasaṃ sunīthaṃ catuḥsamudraṃ dharunaṃrayīṇām
analyzed: yam tvā devāḥ dadhire havya vāham puruspṛhaḥ mānuṣāsaḥ yajatram  sa yāman agne stuvate vayaḥ dhāḥ pra devayan yaśasaḥ sam hi pūrvīḥ  jagṛbhma te dakṣiṇam indra hastam vasūyavaḥ vasu pate vasūnām  vidma hi tvā go patim śūra gonām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ  su āyudham su avasam su nītham catur samudram dharunam rayīṇām
translated: You whom the gods have appointed as the bearer of oblations, the most desired by men, the worthy of sacrifice,

original: carkṛtyaṃ śaṃsyaṃ bhūrivāramasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ🔽subrahmāṇaṃ devavantaṃ bṛhantamuruṃ gabhīraṃ pṛthubudhnamindra
analyzed: carkṛtyam śaṃsyam bhūri vāram asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ 🔽su brahmāṇam devavantam bṛhantam urum gabhīram pṛthu budhnam indra
translated: In your going, O Agni, grant life to the one who praises, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods, for the one who goes to the gods

original: śrutaṛṣimugramabhimātiṣāhamasmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: śruta ṛṣim ugram abhimātiṣāham asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: O Indra, the sage, the mighty, the conqueror of foes, grant us varied wealth, O hero.

original: sanadvājaṃ vipravīraṃ tarutraṃ dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃsudakṣam
analyzed: sanat vājam vipra vīram tarutram dhana spṛtam śūśuvāṃsam su dakṣam
translated: Endowed with abundant wealth, with heroes, with the power to conquer, to protect our riches, resplendent, of great might,

original: dasyuhanaṃ pūrbhidamindra satyamasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: dasyu hanam pūrbhidam indra satyam asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: Slayer of the Dasyus, breaker of forts, O Indra, grant us varied wealth, O hero.

original: aśvāvantaṃ rathinaṃ vīravantaṃ sahasriṇaṃ śatinaṃvājamindra
analyzed: aśvāvantam rathinam vīravantam sahasriṇam śatinam vājam indra
translated: Endowed with horses, chariots, heroes, with a thousand, with a hundred, with strength, O Indra,

original: bhadravrātaṃ vipravīraṃ svarṣāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: bhadra vrātam vipra vīram svarṣām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: With a splendid troop, with heroes, with your own light, grant us varied wealth, O hero.

original: pra saptagum ṛtadhītiṃ sumedhāṃ bṛhaspatiṃ matirachājigāti
analyzed: pra saptagum ṛta dhītim su medhām bṛhaspatim matiḥ achā ājigāti
translated: The thought approaches the seven-versed, the wise, the true-minded Bṛhaspati,

original: ya āṅgiraso namasopasadyo 'smabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ āṅgirasaḥ namasā upasadyaḥ smabhyam citraṃvṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: The son of Aṅgiras, who is to be worshipped with homage, grant us varied wealth, O hero.

original: vanīvāno mama dūtāsa indraṃ stomāścaranti sumatīriyānāḥ
analyzed: vanīvānaḥ mama dūtāsaḥ indram stomāḥ caranti sumatīḥ iyānāḥ
translated: My messengers, like foresters, my praises move, seeking your favour, O Indra.

original: hṛdispṛśo manasā vacyamānā asmabhyaṃ citraṃvṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: hṛdispṛśaḥ manasā vacyamānāḥ asmabhyam citraṃvṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: Touching the heart, uttered by the mind, grant us varied wealth, O hero.

original: yat tvā yāmi daddhi tan na indra bṛhantaṃ kṣayamasamaṃjanānām
analyzed: yat tvā yāmi daddhi tat naḥ indra bṛhantam kṣayamasamaṃjanānām
translated: What I ask of you, give that to me, O Indra, the vast abode of the unvanquished.

original: abhi tad dyāvāpṛthivī gṛṇītāmasmabhyaṃcitraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ rayiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: abhi tat dyāvāpṛthivī gṛṇītām asmabhyam citram vṛṣaṇam rayim dāḥ
translated: May heaven and earth praise that, grant us varied wealth, O hero.

original: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ vasunaḥ pūrvyas patirahaṃ dhanāni saṃjayāmi śaśvataḥ
analyzed: aham bhuvam vasunaḥ pūrvyaḥ patiḥ aham dhanāni saṃjayāmi śaśvataḥ
translated: I was the first lord of wealth, I always distribute the riches.

original: māṃ havante pitaraṃ na jantavo 'handāśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam
analyzed: mām havante pitaram na jantavaḥ handa aśuṣe vi bhajāmi bhojanam
translated: Beings call on me as their father; I divide food for the eager one.

original: ahamindro rodho vakṣo atharvaṇastritāya gā ajanayamaheradhi
analyzed: aham indraḥ rodhaḥ vakṣaḥ atharvaṇaḥ tritāya gāḥ ajanayam aheḥ adhi
translated: I am Indra, the barrier, the chest of Atharvan; I produced the cows for Trita on the mountain.

original: ahaṃ dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇamā dade gotrā śikṣandadhīce mātariśvane
analyzed: aham dasyubhyaḥ pari nṛmṇamā dade gotrā śikṣan dadhīce mātariśvane
translated: I took away the manly power from the Dasyus, I gave the lineage to Dadhyach for Matarishvan.

original: mahyaṃ tvaṣṭā vajramatakṣadāyasaṃ mayi devāso 'vṛjannapi kratum
analyzed: mahyam tvaṣṭā vajram atakṣat āyasam mayi devāsaḥ vṛjan api kratum
translated: Tvashtar fashioned the thunderbolt for me, of iron; the gods placed power in me, and also wisdom.

original: mamānīkaṃ sūryasyeva duṣṭaraṃ māmāryantikṛtena kartvena ca
analyzed: mama anīkam sūryasya iva duṣṭaram mām āryanti kṛtena kartvena ca
translated: My splendor is like the sun's, hard to look at; they honor me with the deed and with the work.

original: ahametaṃ gavyayamaśvyaṃ paśuṃ purīṣiṇaṃ sāyakenāhiraṇyayam
analyzed: aham etam gavyayam aśvyam paśum purīṣiṇam sāyakena a hiraṇyayam
translated: I, with my arrow, have slain this cattle, this horse, this wealth-giving beast of gold.

original: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yan māsomāsa ukthino amandiṣuḥ
analyzed: purū sahasrā ni śiśāmi dāśuṣe yat mā asomāsaḥ ukthinaḥ amandiṣuḥ
translated: I have bestowed many thousands on the worshipper, when the Soma-pressing months have delighted me.

original: ahamindro na parā jigya id dhanaṃ na mṛtyave 'va tasthekadā cana
analyzed: aham indraḥ na parā jigye id dhanam na mṛtyave tastha ikadā cana
translated: I am Indra; no wealth is won beyond me; never do I stand in the way of death.

original: somamin mā sunvanto yācatā vasu na mepūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana
analyzed: somam id mā sunvantaḥ yācata vasu na mepūravaḥ sakhye riṣāthana
translated: While pressing Soma, ask me for wealth; do not offend me, O Pûru, in my friendship.

original: ahametāñchāśvasato dvādvendraṃ ye vajraṃ yudhaye'kṛṇvata
analyzed: aham etān śāśvasataḥ dvādvā indram ye vajram yudhayekṛṇvata
translated: I have slain these two who were ever hostile, who made the thunderbolt to fight against Indra.

original: āhvayamānānava hanmanāhanaṃ dṛḷā vadannanamasyurnamasvinaḥ
analyzed: āhvayamānān ava hanmanā ahanam dṛḍā vadan anamasyuḥ namasvinaḥ
translated: I strike down the inviter, the inviter who invites me, the bold one who speaks, the bold one who bows not to me.

original: abhīdamekameko asmi niṣṣāḷ abhī dvā kimu trayaḥkaranti
analyzed: abhi idam ekam ekaḥ asmi niṣṣāh abhī dvā kimu trayaḥ karanti
translated: Each one of these is alone to me, alone I am to them. What will two or three do?

original: khale na parṣān prati hanmi bhūri kiṃ mā nindantiśatravo 'nindrāḥ
analyzed: khale na parṣān prati hanmi bhūri kim mā nindanti śatravaḥ n indrāḥ
translated: I strike down many in the desert land. Why do the enemies, the powerless ones, revile me?

original: ahaṃ guṅgubhyo atithigvamiṣkaramiṣaṃ na vṛtraturaṃvikṣu dhārayam
analyzed: aham guṅgubhyaḥ na vṛtra turaṃvikṣu
translated: I, Atithigva, have given to the Guṅgus the food of the Vr̥itra-slayer, as if it were food among the people.

original: yat parṇayaghna uta vā karañjahe prāhammahe vṛtrahatye aśuśravi🔽pra me namī sāpya iṣe bhuje bhūd gavāmeṣe sakhyākṛṇuta dvitā
analyzed: yat parṇaya ghne uta vā karañja he prāhammahe vṛtra hatye aśuśravi  pra me namī sāpyaḥ iṣe bhuje bhūt gavām iṣe sakhyā akṛṇuta dvitā
translated: When I, the killer of Parṇaya, or the killer of Karañja, have proclaimed myself at the slaying of Vr̥itra.🔽May the bending, the bending to me for food and enjoyment, be for me. We have made friendship for two days in the contest for cows.

original: didyuṃ yadasya samitheṣu maṃhayamādidenaṃ śaṃsyamukthyaṃ karam
analyzed: didyum yat asya samitheṣu maṃhayam ādidenam śaṃsyam ukthyam karam
translated: When I have extolled his thunderbolt in battles, I have made him to be praised and worthy of praise.

original: pra nemasmin dadṛśe somo antargopā nemamāvirasthākṛṇoti
analyzed: pra nemasmin dadṛśe somaḥ antargopāḥ
translated: Soma is seen in this one, within, the guardian of this one. He makes him to be born.

original: sa tigmaśṛṅgaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ yuyutsan druhastasthaubahule baddho antaḥ
analyzed: sa tigma śṛṅgam vṛṣabham yuyutsan druhaḥ tasthau bahule baddhaḥ antar
translated: Striving for the sharp-horned bull, he, Druhasthā, is bound within the many.

original: ādityānāṃ vasūnāṃ rudriyāṇāṃ devo devānāṃ namināmi dhāma
analyzed: ādityānām vasūnām rudriyāṇām devaḥ devānām namināmi dhāma
translated: The god of the Ādityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, I form the abode of those who are to be worshipped.

original: te mā bhadrāya śavase tatakṣuraparājitamastṛtamaṣāḷam
analyzed: te mā bhadrāya śavase tatakṣuḥ aparājitam astṛtam aṣāḍam
translated: They have fashioned me for auspicious strength, invincible, most excellent, free from disease.

original: ahaṃ dāṃ gṛṇate pūrvyaṃ vasvahaṃ brahma kṛṇavaṃ mahyaṃvardhanam
analyzed: aham dām gṛṇate pūrvyam vasu aham brahma kṛṇavam mahyam vardhanam
translated: I give the singer wealth in days of old, I make the prayer that shall increase my power

original: ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya coditāyajvanaḥ sākṣiviśvasmin bhare
analyzed: aham bhuvam yajamānasya codita ayajvanaḥ sākṣi viśvasmin bhare
translated: I am the impeller of the sacrificer, the witness in all need of him who offers not

original: māṃ dhurindraṃ nāma devatā divaśca gmaścāpāṃ cajantavaḥ
analyzed: mām dhuḥ indram nāma devatāḥ divaḥ ca gmaḥ ca apām ca jantavaḥ
translated: Me, Indra, as the God, do all things that move on earth and heaven and the waters call

original: ahaṃ harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū ahaṃvajraṃ śavase dhṛṣṇvā dade
analyzed: aham harī vṛṣaṇā vivratā raghū aham vajram śavase dhṛṣṇvā dade
translated: I am the two bay steeds, the mighty, the far-striding; I have given the thunderbolt for strength, the weapon that slays

original: ahamatkaṃ kavaye śiśnathaṃ hathairahaṃ kutsamāvamābhirūtibhiḥ
analyzed: kavaye śiśnatham hathaiḥ aham
translated: I with my hands have shattered the impious Atka, I with my succours have helped the lowly Kuts

original: ahaṃ śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadharyamaṃna yo rara āryaṃ nāma dasyave
analyzed: aham śuṣṇasya śnathitā vadharyamaṃna yaḥ rare āryam nāma dasyave
translated: I have slain the impious Sûṣṇa, the wicked, who gave the Aryan name to the Dâsa

original: ahaṃ piteva vetasūnrabhiṣṭaye tugraṃ kutsāya smadibhaṃca randhayam🔽ahaṃ bhuvaṃ yajamānasya rājani pra yad bharetujaye na priyādhṛṣe🔽ahaṃ randhayaṃ mṛgayaṃ śrutarvaṇe yan mājihīta vayunācanānuṣak
analyzed: aham pitā iva vetasūn rabhiṣṭaye tugram kutsāya smadibham ca randhayam  aham bhuvam yajamānasya rājani pra yat bharetujaye na priyādhṛṣe  aham randhayam mṛgayam śrutarvaṇe yat mā ājihīta vayunā cana anuṣak
translated: I have helped the son of Vetasu as a father, I have given Tugra to Kutsas to be his slave🔽I am the king of the sacrificer, when I bear him to victory, as one dear to be cherished🔽I have given R̥idhravana to Srutakarman, when he was fain to give me the choice of boons

original: ahaṃ veśaṃ namramāyave 'karamahaṃsavyāya paḍgṛbhimarandhayam
analyzed: aham veśam namra māyave karama haṃsavyāya paḍgṛbhim arandhayam
translated: I have made the house of Namra to Âyus, I have given the five-grasped to Savya

original: ahaṃ sa yo navavāstvaṃ bṛhadrathaṃ saṃ vṛtreva dāsaṃvṛtrahārujam
analyzed: aham sa yaḥ navavāstvam bṛhat ratham sam vṛtrā iva dāsam vṛtra hā arujam
translated: I am he who has slain the nine-walled Vr̥itra, and the Dâsa Vr̥itra-slayer, as Vr̥itra

original: yad vardhayantaṃ prathayantamānuṣag dūrepāre rajaso rocanākaram
analyzed: yat vardhayantam prathayantam ānuṣak dūrepāre rajasaḥ rocana ākaram
translated: Whom they increase and extend in human fashion, who makes the far-reaching light of the firmament,

original: ahaṃ sūryasya pari yāmyāśubhiḥ praitaśebhirvahamānaojasā
analyzed: aham sūryasya pari yāmi āśubhiḥ pra etaśebhiḥ vahamānaḥ ojasā
translated: I with the swift steeds of the sun go round, bearing with might those that are swift of foot.

original: yan mā sāvo manuṣa āha nirṇija ṛdhak kṛṣedāsaṃ kṛtvyaṃ hathaiḥ
analyzed: yat mā sāvaḥ manuṣe āha nirṇijaḥ ṛdhak kṛṣedāsam kṛtvyam hathaiḥ
translated: When a man, O Savitar, speaks of me as a garment, he may make me, the ready one, with his hands.

original: ahaṃ saptahā nahuṣo nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāva yaṃ śavasāturvaśaṃ yadum
analyzed: aham sapta hā nahuṣaḥ nahuṣṭaraḥ prāśrāva yam śavasā āturvaśam yadum
translated: I am the seven-horsed, more powerful than the powerful, I have made to resound the one who is to be praised, the strong Yadu.

original: ahaṃ nyanyaṃ sahasā sahas karaṃ navavrādhato navatiṃ ca vakṣayam🔽ahaṃ sapta sravato dhārayaṃ vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyāṃsīrā adhi
analyzed: aham nyanyam sahasā sahaḥ karam nava vrādhataḥ navatim ca vakṣayam  aham sapta sravataḥ dhārayam vṛṣā dravitnvaḥ pṛthivyām irāḥ adhi
translated: I have made another to tremble with force, the one with ninefold strength, and ninety I have struck down.🔽I, the bull, hold back the seven flowing ones, the swift ones, on the paths of the earth.

original: ahamarṇāṃsi vi tirāmi sukraturyudhā vidammanave gātumiṣṭaye
analyzed: aham arṇāṃsi vi tirāmi su kratuḥ yudhā vidam manave gātum iṣṭaye
translated: With good thoughts I traverse the waters, I have found the way for Manu to victory with the weapon.

original: ahaṃ tadāsu dhārayaṃ yadāsu na devaścanatvaṣṭādhārayad ruśat
analyzed: aham tadā āsu dhārayam yadā āsu na devaḥ cana tvaṣṭā adhārayat ruśat
translated: I hold that which is in them, which no god can hold, which Tvastr held, the ruddy one.

original: spārhaṃ gavāmūdhassuvakṣaṇāsvā madhormadhu śvātryaṃ somamāśiram
analyzed: spārham gavām ūdhaḥ su vakṣaṇāsva ā madhoḥ madhu śvātryam somam āśiram
translated: The desirable honey in the udders of the cows, the honey of honey, the Soma that is to be drunk.

original: evā devānindro vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavāsatyarādhāḥ
analyzed: eva devān indraḥ vivye nṝn pra cyautnena maghavā asatya rādhāḥ
translated: Thus Indra, O gods, has divided men and men by his might, O bountiful one, you who are true to your promises.

original: viśvet tā te harivaḥ śacīvo 'bhiturāsaḥ svayaśo gṛṇanti
analyzed: viśvā id tā te harivas śacīvas bhiturāsaḥ sva yaśaḥ gṛṇanti
translated: All these, O lord of bays, your mighty deeds, your own glories, they proclaim with loud songs.

original: pra vo mahe mandamānāyāndhaso 'rcā viśvānarāyaviśvābhuve🔽indrasya yasya sumakhaṃ saho mahi śravonṛmṇaṃ ca rodasī saparyataḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mandamānāya andhasaḥ rcā viśvānarāya viśvābhuve  indrasya yasya su makham sahaḥ mahi śravaḥ nṛmṇam ca rodasī saparyataḥ
translated: I praise for you the great gladdening juice of the plant, to the All-man, to the All-creator🔽Whose great and excellent strength, whose fame and heroism, Indra's, the heaven and earth attend upon

original: so cin nu sakhyā narya ina stutaścarkṛtya indro māvatenare
analyzed: saḥ cit nu sakhyā naryaḥ inaḥ stutaḥ carkṛtyaḥ indraḥ māvatenare
translated: He, too, is a friend to be sought, Indra, when praised, to be served by the man who has a hero

original: viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vāpsvabhi śūra mandase
analyzed: viśvāsu dhūrṣu vājakṛtyeṣu satpate vṛtre vā apsu abhi śūra mandase
translated: In all the contests for booty, O lord of the people, O hero, you rejoice in the battles against Vritra

original: ke te nara indra ye ta iṣe ye te sumnaṃ sadhanyamiyakṣān
analyzed: ke te naraḥ indra ye te iṣe ye te sumnam sa dhanyam iyakṣān
translated: What men are they, O Indra, who are yours to support, who long for your favour and abundant wealth?

original: ke te vājāyāsuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsūrvarāsupauṃsye
analyzed: ke te vājāya asuryāya hinvire ke apsu svāsu urvarāsu pauṃsye
translated: Who urge you on to the impetuous, heavenly booty? Who in the waters, in the good fields, in manly deeds?

original: bhuvastvamindra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvo viśveṣu savaneṣuyajñiyaḥ
analyzed: bhuvaḥ tvam indra brahmaṇā mahān bhuvaḥ viśveṣu savaneṣu yajñiyaḥ
