translated: You, O Indra, are great by the holy power, you are to be worshipped at all the libations

original: bhuvo nṝṃścyautno viśvasmin bharejyeṣṭhaśca mantro viśvacarṣaṇe🔽avā nu kaṃ jyāyān yajñavanaso mahīṃ ta omātrāṃkṛṣṭayo viduḥ
analyzed: bhuvaḥ nṝn cyautnaḥ viśvasmin bharejyeṣṭhaḥ ca mantraḥ viśvacarṣaṇe  avā nu kam jyāyān yajñavanasaḥ mahīm te omātrāṃkṛṣṭayaḥ viduḥ
translated: You are the punisher of men, in every contest, and the most excellent hymn, O you who are worshipped by all people🔽Do you know, O Indra, who are most bountiful in sacrifices, the extent of your greatness?

original: aso nu kamajaro vardhāśca viśvedetāsavanā tūtumā kṛṣe
analyzed: asaḥ nu kam ajaraḥ vardhāḥ ca viśvā id etā asavanā tūtumā kṛṣe
translated: Do you know, O you who are most bountiful, who are most powerful, who are most prosperous, who are most worthy of worship, who are most bountiful in all these libations?

original: etā viśvā savanā tūtumākṛṣe svayaṃ sūno sahaso yānidadhiṣe
analyzed: etā viśvā savanā tūtuma ākṛṣe svayam sūno sahasaḥ yā nidadhiṣe
translated: You are most bountiful in all these libations, O son of strength, which you have established yourself

original: varāya te pātraṃ dharmaṇe tanā yajño mantrobrahmodyataṃ vacaḥ
analyzed: varāya te pātram dharmaṇe tanā yajñaḥ mantraḥ brahma udyatam vacaḥ
translated: For thy choice, thy vessel for the pious, sacrifice, prayer, holy verse, exalted speech

original: ye te vipra brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnāṃ ca vasunaścadāvane
analyzed: ye te vipra brahma kṛtaḥ sute sacā vasūnām ca
translated: Those who, O sage, with the pressed Soma, have made thee the Brahman for the bestowal of treasures and wealth

original: pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasyasomyasyāndhasaḥ
analyzed: pra te sumnasya manasā pathā bhuvan made sutasya somyasya andhasaḥ
translated: They have become by the path of thy favour, in the rapture of the pressed, of the sweet juice of Soma

original: mahat tadulbaṃ sthaviraṃ tadāsīd yenāviṣṭitaḥpraviveśithāpaḥ
analyzed: mahat tat ulbam sthaviram tadā āsīt yena āviṣṭitaḥ praviveśitha apaḥ
translated: That was the great, the ancient womb, wherewith thou didst enter, didst penetrate the waters

original: viśvā apaśyad bahudhā te agne jātavedastanvo deva ekaḥ
analyzed: viśvāḥ apaśyat bahudhā te agne jātavedaḥ tanvaḥ devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: O Jātavedas Agni, thou hast seen in many ways all those bodies of thine, O God, as one

original: ko mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devo yo me tanvo bahudhāparyapaśyat
analyzed: kaḥ mā dadarśa katamaḥ sa devaḥ yaḥ me tanvaḥ bahudhā aparyapaśyat
translated: Who saw me? Which of those gods saw me, who saw in many ways my bodies?

original: kvāha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyantyagnervisvāḥsamidho devayānīḥ
analyzed: kva aha mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyanti agneḥ visvāḥ samidhaḥ deva yānīḥ
translated: Where, O Mitra-Varuṇa, do the all-pervading sacrificial sticks of Agni, leading to the gods, lie?

original: aichāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭamagne apsvoṣadhīṣu
analyzed: aichāma tvā bahudhā jātavedaḥ praviṣṭam agne apsu oṣadhīṣu
translated: We have sought thee in many ways, O Jātavedas Agni, entered into the waters and plants

original: taṃ tvā yamo acikeccitrabhāno daśāntaruṣyādatirocamānam
analyzed: tam tvā yamaḥ aciket citrabhāno daśa antaruṣyāt atirocamānam
translated: Thee, O Varuna, YAMA has pointed out, O thou of wondrous light, shining beyond the ten (regions),

original: hotrādahaṃ varuṇa bibhyadāyaṃ nedeva mā yunajannatradevāḥ
analyzed: hotrāt aham varuṇa bibhyat āyam na id eva mā yunajan atra devāḥ
translated: Through fear of the Hotar I have come to thee, O Varuna, lest the gods should yoke me here

original: tasya me tanvo bahudhā niviṣṭā etamarthaṃ naciketāhamagniḥ
analyzed: tasya me tanvaḥ bahudhā niviṣṭāḥ etam artham naciketā aham agniḥ
translated: My bodies, which are entered into in many ways, this is the object, I, NACIKETAS, am Agni

original: ehi manurdevayuryajñakāmo 'raṃkṛtyā tamasi kṣeṣyagne
analyzed: ehi manuḥ devayuḥ yajña kāmaḥ raṃkṛtya ā tamasi kṣeṣi agne
translated: Come, Manu, the god-loving one, desiring sacrifice, I will place you in the light, O Agni, beyond the darkness.

original: sugān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi devayānān vaha havyānisumanasyamānaḥ
analyzed: su gān pathaḥ kṛṇuhi deva yānān vaha havyānisumanasyamānaḥ
translated: Make the paths easy to travel, leading to the gods, carry the oblations with a joyful mind.

original: agneḥ pūrve bhrātaro arthametaṃ rathīvādhvānamanvāvarīvuḥ
analyzed: agneḥ pūrve bhrātaraḥ artham etam rathī iva adhvānam anvāvarīvuḥ
translated: The brothers of Agni before him have followed this purpose like a charioteer the path.

original: tasmād bhiyā varuṇa dūramāyaṃ gauro nakṣepnoravije jyāyāḥ
analyzed: tasmāt bhiyā varuṇa dūram āyam gauraḥ nakṣepnoḥ avije jyāyāḥ
translated: From that fear, O Varuṇa, I have gone far away, like a bull from the yoke, to be unyoked and superior.

original: kurmasta āyurajaraṃ yadagne yathā yukto jātavedo nariṣyāḥ
analyzed: kurmaḥ te āyuḥ ajaram yat agne yathā yuktaḥ jātavedaḥ nariṣyāḥ
translated: We make your life free from old age, O Agni, so that, O all-knower, you may not perish.

original: athā vahāsi sumanasyamāno bhāgaṃ devebhyohaviṣaḥ sujāta
analyzed: atha ā vahāsi sumanasyamānaḥ bhāgam devebhyaḥ haviṣaḥ su jāta
translated: Then, with a joyful mind, you carry the portion of the oblations to the gods, O well-born one.

original: prayājān me anuyājāṃśca kevalānūrjasvantaṃ haviṣodatta bhāgam
analyzed: prayājān me anuyājān ca kevalān ūrjasvantam haviṣā datta bhāgam
translated: May my fore-sacrifices, after-sacrifices, and those performed alone be full of strength, and may the portion of the oblation be given.

original: ghṛtaṃ cāpāṃ puruṣaṃ cauṣadhīnāmagneśca dīrghamāyurastu devāḥ
analyzed: ghṛtam ca apām puruṣam ca oṣadhīnām agneḥ ca dīrgham āyuḥ astu devāḥ
translated: May ghee be the man of the waters, and the man of the plants, and may the gods have long life, O Agni.

original: tava prayājā anuyājāśca kevala ūrjasvanto haviṣaḥ santubhāgāḥ
analyzed: tava prayājāḥ anuyājāḥ ca kevale ūrjasvantaḥ haviṣaḥ santu bhāgāḥ
translated: May your fore-sacrifices, after-sacrifices, and those performed alone be full of strength, and may the portions of the oblations be yours.

original: tavāgne yajño 'yamastu sarvastubhyaṃ namantāmpradiśaścatasraḥ
analyzed: tava agne yajñaḥ yamaḥ tu sarvaḥ tubhyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: O Agni, may this sacrifice be all yours, and may the four quarters of the world bow down to you.

original: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yatheha hotā vṛto manavai yanniṣadya
analyzed: viśve devāḥ śāstana mā yathā iha hotā vṛtaḥ manavai yat niṣadya
translated: O All-gods, instruct me, as I am chosen here as the Hotri, sitting down by the mind.

original: pra me brūta bhāgadheyaṃ yathā vo yena pathāhavyamā vo vahāni
analyzed: pra me brūta bhāgadheyam yathā vaḥ yena pathā ahavyamā vaḥ vahāni
translated: Declare to me my share, by what path I may carry your oblation to you.

original: ahaṃ hotā nyasīdaṃ yajīyān viśve devā maruto mājunanti
analyzed: aham hotā nyasīdam yajīyān viśve devāḥ marutaḥ mā ājunanti
translated: I, the priest, have sat down, the most worshipful; all the gods, the Maruts, quicken me.

original: aharaharaśvinādhvaryavaṃ vāṃ brahmā samid bhavatisāhutirvām
analyzed: ahar ahar aśvinā ādhvaryavam vām brahmā samidh bhavati sa āhutiḥ vām
translated: Day by day, O Asvins, your Adhvaryu is; your Brahman is the kindling-stick, your offering.

original: ayaṃ yo hotā kiru sa yamasya kamapyūhe yat samañjantidevāḥ
analyzed: ayam yaḥ hotā kiru sa yamasya kam api ūhe yat samañjantidevāḥ
translated: This priest who is here, he is Yama's; I know what the gods put together.

original: aharaharjāyate māsimāsyathā devā dadhirehavyavāham
analyzed: ahar ahar jāyate māsi māsi athā devāḥ dadhire havyavāham
translated: Day by day he is born in each month; thus the gods have made him the bearer of oblations.

original: māṃ devā dadhire havyavāhamapamluktaṃ bahu kṛchrācarantam
analyzed: mām devāḥ dadhire havya vāham apamluktam bahu kṛchra ācarantam
translated: The gods have made me the bearer of oblations, me who am smeared with water, who have gone through many hardships.

original: agnirvidvān yajñaṃ naḥ kalpayāti pañcayāmantrivṛtaṃ saptatantum
analyzed: agniḥ vidvān yajñam naḥ kalpayāti pañca yāmān trivṛtam sapta tantum
translated: The wise Agni arranges our sacrifice, fivefold, with three enclosing-sticks, with seven threads.

original: ā vo yakṣyamṛtatvaṃ suvīraṃ yathā vo devā varivaḥkarāṇi
analyzed: ā vaḥ yakṣi amṛta tvam su vīram yathā vaḥ devāḥ varivaḥ karāṇi
translated: I will worship you for immortality, for good heroes, that you gods may grant us favour.

original: ā bāhvorvajramindrasya dheyāmathemāviśvāḥ pṛtanā jayāti
analyzed: ā bāhvoḥ vajram indrasya dheyām atha imāḥ viśvāḥ pṛtanāḥ jayāti
translated: I will place the thunderbolt in Indra's arms, then he will conquer all these battles.

original: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇyagniṃ triṃśacca devā navacāsaparyan
analyzed: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇi agnim triṃśat ca devāḥ nava ca asaparyan
translated: Three hundred and three thousand, and thirty-nine gods have attended on Agni.

original: aukṣan ghṛtairastṛṇan barhirasmā ādiddhotāraṃ nyasādayanta
analyzed: aukṣan ghṛtaiḥ astṛṇan barhiḥ asmai ādit hotāram nyasādayanta
translated: They have anointed him with ghee, they have strewn the sacred grass for him, they have raised the Hotri and seated him.

original: yamaichāma manasā so 'yamāgād yajñasya vidvānparuṣaścikitvān
analyzed: yam aichāma manasā saḥ yam āgāt yajñasya vidvān paruṣaḥ cikitvān
translated: He whom we have desired in our mind has come, knowing the sacrifice and its parts, the wise one.

original: sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān ni hiṣatsadantaraḥ pūrvo asmat
analyzed: sa naḥ yakṣat devatātā yajīyān ni hiṣatsat antaraḥ pūrvaḥ asmat
translated: May he, the most worthy to offer to the gods, sit down between us and those who are before us.

original: arādhi hotā niṣadā yajīyanabhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hikhyat🔽yajāmahai yajñiyān hanta devānīḷāmahāīḍyānājyena
analyzed: arādhi hotā niṣadā yajīyan abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hikhyat  yajāmahai yajñiyān hanta devān īḍāmahai īḍyān ājyena
translated: The most worthy to offer, the priest, has been gratified, he has proclaimed the well-ordered invitations.🔽Let us worship the gods worthy of sacrifice, let us serve the adorable ones with ghee.

original: sādhvīmakardevavītiṃ no adya yajñasya jihvāmavidāmaguhyām
analyzed: sādhvīm akaḥ deva vītim naḥ adya yajñasya jihvām avidām aguhyām
translated: We have found today the secret tongue of the sacrifice, the good way to the gods.

original: sa āyurāgāt surabhirvasāno bhadrāmakardevahūtiṃ no adya
analyzed: saḥ āyuḥ āgāt surabhiḥ vasānaḥ bhadrām akaḥ deva hūtim naḥ adya
translated: He has come with fragrant garments, bringing life. We have done well today in invoking the gods.

original: tadadya vācaḥ prathamaṃ masīya yenāsurānabhi devāasāma🔽ūrjāda uta yajñiyasaḥ pañca janā mama hotraṃjuṣadhvam
analyzed: tat adya vācaḥ prathamam masīya yena asurān abhi devāḥ asāma  ūrjādaḥ uta yajñiyasaḥ pañca janāḥ mama hotram juṣadhvam
translated: Today let us be the first to utter this word whereby we may overcome the Asuras with the gods.🔽And you, O five people who are worthy of sacrifice, rejoice in my oblation.

original: pañca janā mama hotraṃ juṣantāṃ gojātā uta yeyajñiyāsaḥ
analyzed: pañca janāḥ mama hotram juṣantām go jātāḥ uta yeyajñiyāsaḥ
translated: May the five people rejoice in my oblation, those born of the cow and those worthy of sacrifice.

original: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātvaṃ
analyzed: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātvam
translated: May the earth protect us from what is earthly,

original: aso'ntarikṣaṃ divyāt pātvasmān
analyzed: asaḥ ntarikṣam divyāt pātu asmān
translated: may the atmosphere protect us from what is divine.

original: tantuṃ tanvan rajaso bhānumanvihi jyotiṣmataḥ pathorakṣa dhiyā kṛtān
analyzed: tantum tanvan rajasaḥ bhānum anvihi jyotiṣmataḥ pathoḥ akṣa dhiyā kṛtān
translated: Weaving the thread, follow the light of the realm, guard the paths made by the mind, which are full of light.

original: anulbaṇaṃ vayata joguvāmapo manurbhava janayā daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: anulbaṇam vayata joguvām apaḥ manuḥ bhava janaya daivyam janam
translated: Weave without flaw, be ready for the young cows. Be Manu, generate the divine people.

original: akṣānaho nahyatanota somyā iṣkṛṇudhvaṃ raśanā otapiṃśata
analyzed: akṣānahaḥ nahyatana uta somyāḥ iṣkṛṇudhvam raśanāḥ otapiṃśata
translated: O Soma-pressing priests, do not delay, prepare the reins, make the traces fast

original: aṣṭāvandhuraṃ vahatābhito rathaṃ yena devāsoanayannabhi priyam
analyzed: aṣṭāvandhuram vahata abhitas ratham yena devāsaḥ anayan abhi priyam
translated: Bear the chariot with its eight wheels around, wherewith ye have brought the gods to the dear place

original: aśmanvatī rīyate saṃ rabhadhvamut tiṣṭhata pra taratāsakhāyaḥ
analyzed: aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam ud tiṣṭhata pra tarata a sakhāyaḥ
translated: The stone-filled (stream) flows on; be ye ready, rise up, O friends, and cross over

original: atrā jahāma ye asannaśevāḥ śivān vayamuttaremābhi vājān🔽tvaṣṭā māyā vedapasāmapastamo bibhrat pātrādevapānāni śantamā
analyzed: atra jahāma ye a sanna śevāḥ śivān vayam uttarema abhi vājān  tvaṣṭā māyāḥ vedapasām apastamaḥ bibhrat pātrā deva pānāni śantamā
translated: Here we leave those who are like dogs; may we go to the auspicious higher riches🔽Tvastr, the most skilful of those who know the art of magic, bearing the most auspicious vessels for the drinking of the gods

original: śiśīte nūnaṃ paraśuṃ svāyasaṃyena vṛścādetaśo brahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: śiśīte nūnam paraśum su āyasam yena vṛścāt etaśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: He now sharpens his own steel axe, with which the lord of holy power will cut down the Etasa tree

original: sato nūnaṃ kavayaḥ saṃ śiśīta vāśībhiryābhiramṛtāya takṣatha
analyzed: sataḥ nūnam kavayaḥ sam śiśīta vāśībhiḥ yābhiḥ amṛtāya takṣatha
translated: The wise ones have now sharpened the saws with which they fashion the immortal one

original: vidvāṃsaḥ padā guhyāni kartana yenadevāso amṛtatvamānaśuḥ
analyzed: vidvāṃsaḥ padā guhyāni kartana yena devāsaḥ amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: The wise ones, knowing the secret steps, by which the gods attained immortality, are working

original: garbhe yoṣāmadadhurvatsamāsanyapīcyena manasotajihvayā
analyzed: garbhe yoṣām adadhuḥ vatsam āsani apīcyena manasā uta jihvayā
translated: They have placed the child in the womb of the woman, the calf in the cow, with the most excellent mind and tongue

original: sa viśvāhā sumanā yogyā abhi siṣāsanirvanatekāra ijjitim
analyzed: sa viśvāhā sumanāḥ yogyāḥ abhi siṣāsaniḥ vanatekāraḥ id jitim
translated: He, who is good-natured in all things, who is worthy of worship, who desires to conquer, who is the best, who is to be praised, who is to be glorified

original: tāṃ su te kīrtiṃ maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasīahvayetām
analyzed: tām su te kīrtim maghavan mahitvā yat tvā bhīte rodasī ahvayetām
translated: That fame of thine, O Maghavan, through thy greatness, for which the two trembling worlds invoked thee,

original: prāvo devānātiro dāsamojaḥ prajāyaitvasyai yadaśikṣa indra
analyzed: prāvaḥ devān ātiraḥ dāsam ojaḥ prajāyai etu asyai yat aśikṣaḥ indra
translated: O Indra, may thy might prevail over the Dāsa, over the foe, for the sake of this our progeny, since thou hast taught it.

original: yadacarastanvā vāvṛdhāno balānīndra prabruvāṇo janeṣu
analyzed: yat acaraḥ tanvāḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ balāni indra prabruvāṇaḥ janeṣu
translated: When thou didst wax in strength by thy body, O Indra, proclaiming thy powers among the people,

original: māyet sā te yāni yuddhānyāhurnādya śatruṃ nanupurā vivitse
analyzed: mā ayet sā te yāni yuddhāni āhuḥ na adya śatrum nanu purā vivitse
translated: Let not that deceit of thine come to us, wherewith thou didst not find the foe of old, nor didst thou conquer.

original: ka u nu te mahimanaḥ samasyāsmat pūrva ṛṣayo 'ntamāpuḥ
analyzed: kaḥ u nu te mahimanaḥ samasya asmat pūrve ṛṣayaḥ ntam āpuḥ
translated: Who among us shall attain the limit of thy greatness, O Indra, which the ancient sages attained?

original: yan mātaraṃ ca pitaraṃ ca sākamajanayathāstanvaḥsvāyāḥ
analyzed: yat mātaram ca pitaram ca sākam ajanayathāḥ tanvaḥ svāyāḥ
translated: Since thou hast generated together the mother and the father from thy own body.

original: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāmādābhyāni mahiṣasya santi
analyzed: catvāri te asuryāṇi nāma adābhyāni mahiṣasya santi
translated: Four are thy names, O Asura, which are free from stain, which belong to the great one.

original: tvamaṅga tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavañcakartha
analyzed: tvam aṅga tāni viśvāni vitse yebhiḥ karmāṇi maghavan cakartha
translated: Thou, O Indra, knowest all those (names), by which thou hast accomplished thy deeds, O bountiful one.

original: tvaṃ viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yānyāviryā ca guhāvasūni
analyzed: tvam viśvā dadhiṣe kevalāni yāni āvis yā ca guhāvasūni
translated: Thou possessest all the treasures, both those which are manifest and those which are hidden.

original: kāmamin me maghavan mā vi tārīstvamājñātātvamindrāsi dātā
analyzed: kāmam id me maghavan mā vi tārīḥ tvam ājñātā tvam indra asi dātā
translated: O bountiful one, do not deceive me in my desire. Thou art the knower, thou art Indra, the giver.

original: yo adadhājjyotiṣi jyotirantaryo asṛjan madhunā sammadhūni
analyzed: yaḥ adadhāt jyotiṣi jyotiḥ antar yaḥ asṛjat madhunā sammadhūni
translated: He who has placed the light in the light, who has created the sweet things with honey,

original: adha priyaṃ śūṣamindrāya manma brahmakṛtobṛhadukthādavāci
analyzed: adha priyam śūṣam indrāya manma brahma kṛtaḥ bṛhat ukthāt avāci
translated: Now the dear praise for Indra have I uttered, the great hymn, as one skilled in prayer.

original: dūre tan nāma guhyaṃ parācairyat tvā bhīte ahvayetāṃvayodhai
analyzed: dūre tat nāma guhyam parācais yat tvā bhīte
translated: Far away is that secret name of thine, which the feeble ones, in fear, have invoked from afar.

original: udastabhnāḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmabhīke bhrātuḥputrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ
analyzed: udastabhnāḥ pṛthivīm dyām abhīke bhrātuḥ putrān maghavan titviṣāṇaḥ
translated: Thou hast upheld the earth and the sky in the conflict, O Maghavan, with the sons of thy brother

original: mahat tan nāma guhyaṃ puruspṛg yena bhūtaṃ janayo yenabhavyam
analyzed: mahat tat nāma guhyam puruspṛh yena bhūtam janayaḥ yena bhavyam
translated: That is thy great secret name, much sought after, by which thou hast generated the existent and the non-existent

original: pratnaṃ jātaṃ jyotiryadasya priyaṃ priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca
analyzed: pratnam jātam jyotiḥ yat asya priyam priyāḥ samaviśanta pañca
translated: The ancient light that is dear to him, the dear ones have entered into the five

original: ā rodasī apṛṇādota madhyaṃ pañca devān ṛtuśaḥ sapta sapta
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇāt ā uta madhyam pañca devān ṛtuśas sapta sapta
translated: He has filled the two worlds and the space between, the five gods in due season, seven times seven

original: catustriṃśatā purudhā vi caṣṭe sarūpeṇa jyotiṣāvivratena
analyzed: catustriṃśatā purudhā vi caṣṭe sa rūpeṇa jyotiṣā a vi vratena
translated: He looks with his own form, with his unerring light, in many ways with thirty-four

original: yaduṣa auchaḥ prathamā vibhānāmajanayo yena puṣṭasyapuṣṭam
analyzed: yat uṣaḥ auchaḥ prathamā vibhānām ajanayaḥ yena puṣṭasya puṣṭam
translated: When thou didst send forth the first of the shining ones, by whom thou hast increased the increased

original: yat te jāmitvamavaraṃ parasyā mahan mahatyāasuratvamekam
analyzed: yat te jāmi tvam avaram parasyāḥ mahat mahatyāḥ asura tvam ekam
translated: Thy lowliness as a kinsman of the higher, thy greatness as a great Asura is one

original: vidhuṃ dadrāṇaṃ samane bahūnāṃ yuvānaṃ santaṃ palitojagāra
analyzed: vidhum dadrāṇam samane bahūnām yuvānam santam palitaḥ ujagāra
translated: The ruddy bird, the young one among many, who runs to the sacrifice, has been seized by old age

original: devasya paśya kāvyaṃ mahitvādyā mamāra sa hyaḥsamāna
analyzed: devasya paśya kāvyam mahi tvāt yā mamāra sa hyas samāna
translated: Behold the greatness of the god's plan, today he has died, he who is equal

original: śākmanā śāko aruṇaḥ suparṇa ā yo mahaḥ śūraḥsanādanīḷaḥ
analyzed: śākmanā śākaḥ aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ ā yaḥ mahaḥ śūraḥ sanādanīḍaḥ
translated: The ruddy bird of strength, the red bird, who is a great hero, unbending from of old

original: yacciketa satyamit tan na moghaṃ vasuspārhamuta jetota dātā
analyzed: yat ciketa satyam id tat na mogham vasu spārham uta jetā uta dātā
translated: What he has known is true, not false, he who has gained wealth will conquer and give

original: aibhirdade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhiraukṣad vṛtrahatyāyavajrī
analyzed: ā ebhiḥ dade vṛṣṇyā pauṃsyāni yebhiḥ aukṣat vṛtra hatyāya vajrī
translated: By these he gained manly powers, by which the wielder of the thunderbolt urged himself to slay Vrtra.

original: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahna ṛtekarmamudajāyanta devāḥ
analyzed: ye karmaṇaḥ kriyamāṇasya mahnaḥ ṛtekarmam udajāyanta devāḥ
translated: Those by whom the gods were born, mighty ones, of the great work that is being done, without work.

original: yujā karmāṇi janayan viśvaujā aśastithā viśvamanāsturāṣāṭ
analyzed: yujā karmāṇi janayan viśva ojāḥ aśastithā viśva manāḥ turāṣāh
translated: Begetting works with the all-powerful one, all-possessing, free from blame, unconquered in all things.

original: pītvī somasya diva ā vṛdhānaḥ śūro niryudhādhamad dasyūn
analyzed: pītvī somasya divaḥ ā vṛdhānaḥ śūraḥ niryudhā adhamat dasyūn
translated: Having drunk the Soma, grown great in heaven, the hero has driven away the Dasyus with his weapons.

original: idaṃ ta ekaṃ para ū ta ekaṃ tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃviśasva
analyzed: idam te ekam paras te ekam tṛtīyena jyotiṣā saṃviśasva
translated: This one is one, and that one is one, with the third light enter thou.

original: saṃveśane tanvaścāruredhi priyo devānāmparame janitre
analyzed: saṃveśane tanvaḥ cāruḥ edhi priyaḥ devānām parame janitre
translated: In the resting place be thou gracious to thy body, dear to the gods in the highest birthplace.

original: tanūṣ ṭe vājin tanvaṃ nayantī vāmamasmabhyaṃ dhātuśarma tubhyam
analyzed: tanūḥ te vājin tanvam nayantī vāmam asmabhyam dhātu śarma tubhyam
translated: O strong one, let thy body lead thy body, grant us what is good, and to thee protection.

original: ahruto maho dharuṇāya devān divīvajyotiḥ svamā mimīyāḥ
analyzed: ahrutaḥ mahaḥ dharuṇāya devān divi iva jyotiḥ svamā mimīyāḥ
translated: Unerring, for the great support of the gods, measure thou out thy own light in the heaven.

original: vājyasi vājinenā suvenīḥ suvita stomaṃ suvito divaṃgāḥ
analyzed: vājī asi vājinena suvenīḥ suvitaḥ stomam suvitaḥ divaṃgāḥ
translated: Thou art the strong one, O strong one, with thy strength, with good guidance, guide the praise with good guidance, go to the heaven.

original: suvito dharma prathamānu satyā suvito devān suvito'nu patma
analyzed: suvitaḥ dharma prathamā anu satyā suvitaḥ devān suvitaḥ unu patma
translated: With good guidance, O law, spread out the first truth, with good guidance the gods, with good guidance the path.

original: mahimna eṣāṃ pitaraścaneśire devā deveṣvadadhurapikratum
analyzed: mahimnaḥ eṣām pitaraḥ cana īśire devāḥ deveṣu adadhuḥ apikratum
translated: Even the fathers have looked up to their greatness, the gods have placed their highest wisdom in the gods.

original: samavivyacuruta yānyatviṣuraiṣāṃ tanūṣu niviviśuḥ punaḥ
analyzed: samavivyacuḥ uta yāni atviṣuḥ ā eṣām tanūṣu niviviśuḥ punar
translated: They have spread out the things that shine, they have entered again into their bodies.

original: sahobhirviśvaṃ pari cakramū rajaḥ pūrvā dhāmānyamitāmimānāḥ
analyzed: sahobhiḥ viśvam pari cakramuḥ rajaḥ pūrvā dhāmāni amita āmimānāḥ
translated: with their powers they have gone round the whole world, the region, measuring the immeasurable

original: tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayantapurudha prajā anu
analyzed: tanūṣu viśvā bhuvanā ni yemire prāsārayantapurudha prajāḥ anu
translated: they have settled in their bodies all the worlds, they have extended their offspring in many ways

original: dvidhā sūnavo 'suraṃ svarvidamāsthāpayanta tṛtīyenakarmaṇā
analyzed: dvidhā sūnavaḥ suram svar vidam āsthāpayanta tṛtīyena karmaṇā
translated: the two sons of the Asura who found the heaven established him with the third act

original: svāṃ prajāṃ pitaraḥ pitryaṃ saha āvareṣvadadhustantumātatam
analyzed: svām prajām pitaraḥ pitryam sahaḥ ā avareṣu adadhuḥ tantum ātatam
translated: the fathers have placed their own offspring, their own fatherly power, on the lower worlds, on the extended thread

original: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhiratidurgāṇi viśvā
analyzed: nāvā na kṣodaḥ pradiśaḥ pṛthivyāḥ svastibhiḥ ati durgāṇi viśvā
translated: like a boat in the directions of the earth, with their blessings beyond all difficulties

original: svāṃ prajāṃ bṛhaduktho mahitvāvareṣvadadhādā pareṣu
analyzed: svām prajām bṛhadukthaḥ mahitvā avareṣu adadhāt ā pareṣu
translated: with his greatness Bṛhaduktha has placed his own offspring on the lower worlds and on the higher

original: mā pra gāma patho vayaṃ mā yajñādindra sominaḥ
analyzed: mā pra gāma pathaḥ vayam mā yajñāt indra sominaḥ
translated: let us not go astray from the paths, O Indra, from the sacrifices of the Soma-offerers

original: mānta sthurno arātayaḥ
analyzed: mā antar sthuḥ naḥ arātayaḥ
translated: let not the evil spirits remain among us

original: yo yajñasya prasādhanastanturdeveṣvātataḥ
analyzed: yaḥ yajñasya prasādhanaḥ tantuḥ deveṣu ātataḥ
translated: he who is the completion of the sacrifice, the thread stretched among the gods

original: tamāhutaṃ naśīmahi
analyzed: tam āhutam naśīmahi
translated: let us serve him when offered

original: mano nvā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena
analyzed: manaḥ nu ā huvāmahe nārāśaṃsena somena
translated: we invoke the mind with the Nārāśaṃsa Soma

original: pitṝṇāṃ camanmabhiḥ
analyzed: pitṝṇām ca manmabhiḥ
translated: with the thoughts of the fathers

original: ā ta etu manaḥ punaḥ kratve dakṣāya jīvase
analyzed: ā te etu manaḥ punar kratve dakṣāya jīvase
translated: may that mind come back to us again for thought, for power, for life

original: jyok casūryaṃ dṛśe
analyzed: jyok ca sūryam dṛśe
translated: to see the sun for a long time

original: punarnaḥ pitaro mano dadātu daivyo janaḥ
analyzed: punar naḥ pitaraḥ manaḥ dadātu daivyaḥ janaḥ
translated: may the divine people, the fathers, grant us our mind again

original: jīvaṃ vrātaṃsacemahi
analyzed: jīvam vrātaṃsacemahi
translated: may we live together with the living kinsmen

original: vayaṃ soma vrate tava manastanūṣu bibhrataḥ
analyzed: vayam soma vrate tava manaḥ tanūṣu bibhrataḥ
translated: We, O Soma, bearing thy mind in our bodies in thy vow,

original: prajāvantaḥ sacemahi
analyzed: prajāvantaḥ sacemahi
translated: May we live with offspring.

original: yat te yamaṃ vaivasvataṃ mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te yamam vaivasvatam manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to Yama, the son of Vivasvat,

original: tat ta āvartayāmasīha kṣayāya jīvase
analyzed: tat te āvartayāmasi iha kṣayāya jīvase
translated: We bring it back to thee for enjoyment and life.

original: yat te divaṃ yat pṛthivīṃ mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te divam yat pṛthivīm manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to heaven and earth,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te bhūmiṃ caturbhṛṣṭiṃ mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te bhūmim catur bhṛṣṭim manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the four-cornered earth,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te catasraḥ pradiśo mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te catasraḥ pradiśaḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the four quarters,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te samudramarṇavaṃ mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te samudram arṇavam manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the ocean and the sea,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te marīcīḥ pravato mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te marīcīḥ pravataḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the rays and the streams,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te apo yadoṣadhīrmano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te apaḥ yat oṣadhīḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the waters and the plants,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te sūryaṃ yaduṣasaṃ mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te sūryam yat uṣasam manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the sun and the dawn,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te parvatān bṛhato mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te parvatān bṛhataḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the great mountains,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te viśvamidaṃ jagan mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te viśvam idam jagat manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to this entire world,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te parāḥ parāvato mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te parāḥ parāvataḥ manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: That thy mind has gone far away to the farthest distance,

original: tat ta / / /
analyzed: tat te
translated: We bring it back to thee.

original: yat te bhūtaṃ ca bhavyaṃ ca mano jagāma dūrakam
analyzed: yat te bhūtam ca bhavyam ca manaḥ jagāma dūrakam
translated: Whatever past and future thought of thine hath wandered far away🔽That

original: tat ta / / /🔽pra tāryāyuḥ prataraṃ navīya sthātāreva kratumatārathasya🔽adha cyavāna ut tavītyarthaṃ parātaraṃ sOGām
analyzed: tat te  pra tārya āyuḥ prataram navīya sthātārā iva kratumatā rathasya  adha cyavānaḥ ud tavi iti artham parātaram sogām
translated: .🔽Do thou, O thou who art to be crossed, cross over life, the newer ford, as one who hath wisdom to guide the chariot🔽And do thou, O Chyavana, cross over to the farther shore of the object to be attained

original: sāman nu rāye nidhiman nvannaṃ karāmahe su purudhaśravāṃsi
analyzed: sāman nu rāye nidhimat nu annam karāmahe su purudha śravāṃsi
translated: We will make the hymn for the sake of wealth, and food for the sake of nourishment, and great fame

original: tā no viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaraṃ sunirṛtirjihītām
analyzed: tā naḥ viśvāni jaritā mamattu parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: May all these delight the singer for us, may ill-fortune turn away from us in the distance

original: abhī ṣvaryaḥ pauṃsyairbhavema dyaurna bhūmiṃ girayonājran
analyzed: abhi su aryaḥ pauṃsyaiḥ bhavema dyauḥ na bhūmim girayaḥ na ajran
translated: May we be rich in manly powers, as heaven is rich in earth and the mountains in water

original: tā no viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaraṃ sunirṛtirjihītām
analyzed: tā naḥ viśvāni jaritā ciketa parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: May the singer know all these for us, may ill-fortune turn away from us in the distance

original: mo ṣu ṇaḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam
analyzed: mā u su naḥ soma mṛtyave parā dāḥ paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam
translated: Do not lead us, O Soma, to death, may we behold the rising sun

original: dyubhirhito jarimā sū no astu parātaraṃ sunirṛtirjihītām
analyzed: dyubhiḥ hitaḥ jarimā su naḥ astu parātaram su nirṛtiḥ jihītām
translated: May the dawn be propitious to us, may ill-fortune turn away from us in the distance

original: asunīte mano asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tirā naāyuḥ
analyzed: asunīte manaḥ asmāsu dhāraya jīvātave su pra tira naāyuḥ
translated: O Asuniti, keep thy mind with us, grant us life for a long time

original: rārandhi naḥ sūryasya sandṛśi ghṛtena tvantanvaṃ vardhayasva
analyzed: rārandhi naḥ sūryasya sandṛśi ghṛtena tvantanvam vardhayasva
translated: Be gracious to us in the sight of the sun, increase thy own body with ghee

original: asunīte punarasmāsu cakṣuḥ punaḥ prāṇamiha no dhehibhogam
analyzed: asunīte punar asmāsu cakṣuḥ punar prāṇam iha naḥ dhehi bhogam
translated: O Asuniti, give us back our eye, give us back our breath and enjoyment here

original: jyok paśyema sūryamuccarantamanumate mṛḷayā nahsvasti
analyzed: jyok paśyema sūryam uccarantam anumate mṛḍaya nahsvasti
translated: May we long behold the sun rising, O Anumati, be gracious and bestow welfare.

original: punarno asuṃ pṛthivī dadātu punardyaurdevī punarantarikṣam
analyzed: punar naḥ asum pṛthivī dadātu punar dyauḥ devī punar antarikṣam
translated: May the earth give us life again, may the divine sky give it to us again, may the atmosphere give it to us again.

original: punarnaḥ somastanvaṃ dadātu punaḥ pūṣāpathyāṃ yā svastiḥ
analyzed: punar naḥ somaḥ tanvam dadātu punar pūṣā apathyām yā svastiḥ
translated: May Soma give us our body again, may Pūṣan give us the path and the blessing.

original: śaṃ rodasī subandhave yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
analyzed: śam rodasī su bandhave yahvī ṛtasya mātarā
translated: May the two worlds, the bountiful, the young mothers of truth,

original: bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo mo ṣu te kiṃcanāmamat
analyzed: bharata amapa yat rapaḥ dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapaḥ mā u su te kiṃcana amamat
translated: bear away whatever evil there is. May the sky and earth forgive the evil. Let nothing of yours be lost to us.

original: ava dvake ava trikā divaścaranti bheṣajā
analyzed: ava dvake ava trikā divaḥ caranti bheṣajā
translated: The two-footed and the three-footed remedies move about in the sky.

original: kṣamācariṣṇvekakaṃ bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamārapo mo ṣu te kiṃ canāmamat
analyzed: kṣamā cariṣṇu ekakam bharata amapa yat rapaḥ dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapaḥ mā u su te kim cana amamat
translated: The one-footed moves about on the earth. Bear away whatever evil there is. May the sky and earth forgive the evil. Let nothing of yours be lost to us.

original: samindreraya gāmanaḍvāhaṃ ya āvahaduśīnarāṇyāanaḥ
analyzed: sam indra īraya gām anaḍvāham yaḥ āvahat uśīnarāṇyā aanaḥ
translated: O Indra, send forth the ox and the wagon that brought the wagon of the Uśīnara people.

original: bharatāmapa yad rapo dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapo moṣu te kiṃ canāmamat
analyzed: bharata amapa yat rapaḥ dyauḥ pṛthivi kṣamā rapaḥ mā u su te kim cana amamat
translated: Bear away whatever evil there is. May the sky and earth forgive the evil. Let nothing of yours be lost to us.

original: ā janaṃ tveṣasandṛśaṃ māhīnānāmupastutam
analyzed: ā janam tveṣa sandṛśam māhīnānām upastutam
translated: To the people whose appearance is brilliant, praised by the Māhīnas,

original: aganmabibhrato namaḥ🔽asamātiṃ nitośanaṃ tveṣaṃ niyayinaṃ ratham
analyzed: aganma bibhrataḥ namaḥ  asamātim nitośanam tveṣam niyayinam ratham
translated: we have come, bearing homage.🔽To the unequalled, ever-angry, brilliant, guiding chariot,

original: bhajerathasya satpatim
analyzed: bhajerathasya sat patim
translated: I honor the good lord of the chariot.

original: yo janān mahiṣānivātitasthau pavīravān
analyzed: yaḥ janān mahiṣān iva atitasthau pavīravān
translated: He who stood over the people like a mighty bull, the powerful one,

original: utāpavīravānyudhā
analyzed: uta a pavīravān yudhā
translated: And to the one who is not a hero in battles

original: yasyekṣvākurupa vrate revān marāyyedhate
analyzed: yasya ikṣvākuḥ upa vrate revān marāyī edhate
translated: Whose Ikshvaku has grown strong in the vow, the rich one in the house of the weak

original: divīvapañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: divi ivapañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Like five furrows in the sky

original: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya
analyzed: indra kṣatrāsamātiṣu rathaproṣṭheṣu dhāraya
translated: O Indra, in the unequalled battles, in the chariot-borne ones, uphold

original: divīvasūryaṃ dṛśe
analyzed: divīvasūryam dṛśe
translated: Like the sun in the sky to be seen

original: agastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā
analyzed: agastyasya nadbhyaḥ saptī yunakṣi rohitā
translated: You yoke the two red horses of Agastya to the rivers

original: paṇīn nyakramīrabhi viśvān rājannarādhasaḥ
analyzed: paṇīn nyakramīḥ abhi viśvān rājan arādhasaḥ
translated: You have gone to all the Pāṇis, O King, to the offerings

original: ayaṃ mātāyaṃ pitāyaṃ jīvāturāgamat
analyzed: ayam mātā ayam pitā ayam jīvātuḥ āgamat
translated: This is the mother, this is the father, this has come to us for life

original: idaṃ tavaprasarpaṇaṃ subandhavehi nirihi
analyzed: idam tava prasarpaṇam subandhava ihi nirihi
translated: This is your spreading, come to the well-bound, come to the loose

original: yathā yugaṃ varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam
analyzed: yathā yugam varatrayā nahyanti dharuṇāya kam
translated: Just as a yoke is fastened by a strap to a post to hold it

original: evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave 'tho ariṣṭatātaye
analyzed: eva adādhāra te manaḥ jīvātave na mṛtyave thaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: So I have grasped your mind for life, not for death, and for well-being

original: yatheyaṃ pṛthivī mahī dādhāremān vanaspatīn
analyzed: yathā iyam pṛthivī mahī dādhāra imān vanaspatīn
translated: Just as this great earth supports these trees

original: evādādhāra te mano jīvātave na mṛtyave 'tho ariṣṭatātaye
analyzed: eva adādhāra te manaḥ jīvātave na mṛtyave thaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: So I have grasped your mind for life, not for death, and for well-being

original: yamādahaṃ vaivasvatāt subandhormana ābharam
analyzed: yamāt aham vaivasvatāt subandhoḥ manaḥ ābharam
translated: The good bond that I have brought from Yama, the son of Vivasvat,

original: jīvātavena mṛtyave 'tho ariṣṭatātaye
analyzed: jīvātavena mṛtyave thaḥ ariṣṭatātaye
translated: For life, not for death, and for well-being

original: nyag vāto 'va vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ
analyzed: nyak vātaḥ va vāti nyak tapati sūryaḥ
translated: The wind blows downward, the sun shines downward

original: nīcīnamaghnyāduhe nyag bhavatu te rapaḥ
analyzed: nīcīnam aghnyā duhe nyak bhavatu te rapaḥ
translated: The cow yields milk downward, downward be your disease

original: ayaṃ me hasto bhagavānayaṃ me bhagavattaraḥ
analyzed: ayam me hastaḥ bhagavān ayam me bhagavattaraḥ
translated: this is my hand o blessed one this is my other hand o most blessed one

original: ayaṃ meviśvabheṣajo 'yaṃ śivābhimarśanaḥ
analyzed: ayam me viśva bheṣajaḥ yam śiva abhimarśanaḥ
translated: this is my universal remedy this is my auspicious anointing

original: idamitthā raudraṃ gūrtavacā brahma kratvā śacyāmantarājau🔽krāṇā yadasya pitarā maṃhaneṣṭhāḥ parṣatpakthe ahannā sapta hotṝn
analyzed: idam itthā raudram gūrta vacāḥ brahma kratvā śacyām antarājau  krāṇāḥ yat asya pitarā maṃhaneṣṭhāḥ parṣat pakthe ahannā sapta hotṝn
translated: thus is this fierce hymn of praise the holy power with might in the two midmost battles🔽when his parents were made strong in the great sacrifice the seven priests were carried in the house of the cooked offering

original: sa id dānāya dabhyāya vanvañcyavānaḥ sūdairamimītavedim🔽tūrvayāṇo gūrtavacastamaḥ kṣodo na reta itaūtisiñcat
analyzed: saḥ id dānāya dabhyāya vanvan cyavānaḥ sūdaiḥ amimīta vedim  tūrvayāṇaḥ gūrta vacastamaḥ kṣodaḥ na retaḥ itaūtisiñcat
translated: he the bountiful the wise the prosperous has measured out the altar for the sake of gain and destruction🔽the most eloquent the most active has poured down seed like a stream of water

original: mano na yeṣu havaneṣu tigmaṃ vipaḥ śacyā vanuthodravantā
analyzed: manaḥ na yeṣu havaneṣu tigmam vipaḥ śacyā vanutha udravantā
translated: in whose libations ye two the sharp mind the inspired speech have been gratified and have run forward

original: ā yaḥ śaryabhistuvinṛmṇoasyāśrīṇītādiśaṃ gabhastau
analyzed: ā yaḥ śari abhistuvi nṛmṇaḥ asya āśrīṇīta ādiśam gabhastau
translated: he the powerful by whose arrows the region has been joined together and his arms have been extended

original: kṛṣṇā yad goṣvaruṇīṣu sīdad divo napātāśvināhuve vām
analyzed: kṛṣṇā yat goṣu aruṇīṣu sīdat divaḥ napātā aśvinā āhuve vām
translated: when ye two the dark and the red have sat down among the cows o aśvins i call you o ye two sons of heaven

original: vītaṃ me yajñamā gataṃ me annaṃ vavanvāṃsāneṣamasmṛtadhrū🔽prathiṣṭa yasya vīrakarmamiṣṇadanuṣṭhitaṃ nu naryoapauhat
analyzed: vītam me yajñam ā gatam me annam vavanvāṃsa an iṣam asmṛtadhrū  prathiṣṭa yasya vīra karmam iṣṇat anuṣṭhitam nu
translated: come to my sacrifice come to my food ye two who are ever mindful of the worshipper🔽he whose heroic deed has been widely spread has brought back the wife who had been carried off by a man

original: punastadā vṛhati yat kanāyā duhiturāanubhṛtamanarvā
analyzed: punar tadā vṛhati yat kanāyāḥ
translated: again he takes her whom the young girl the daughter has served without being asked

original: madhyā yat kartvamabhavadabhīke kāmaṃ kṛṇvāṇepitari yuvatyām
analyzed: madhyā yat kartvam abhavat abhīke kāmam kṛṇvāṇe pitari yuvatyām
translated: The middle one, what was to be done in the conflict, while the young woman was making love to her father,

original: manānag reto jahaturviyantā sānauniṣiktaṃ sukṛtasya yonau
analyzed: manānaś retaḥ jahatuḥ viyantā sānau niṣiktam sukṛtasya yonau
translated: The two, longing, let the seed fall on the lap, in the womb of good deeds.

original: pitā yat svāṃ duhitaramadhiṣkan kṣmayā retaḥsaṃjagmāno ni ṣiñcat
analyzed: pitā yat svām duhitaram adhiṣkan kṣmayā retaḥ saṃjagmānaḥ ni siñcat
translated: When the father embraced his own daughter, joining with her in love, he poured it in.

original: svādhyo 'janayan brahma devāvāstoṣ patiṃ vratapāṃ niratakṣan
analyzed: su ādhyaḥ janayan brahma devāvāstoḥ patim vrata pām niratakṣan
translated: The well-born one generated the Brahman, the lord of the house, the guardian of vows, they fashioned.

original: sa īṃ vṛṣā na phenamasyadājau smadā paraidapadabhracetāḥ🔽sarat padā na dakṣiṇā parāvṛṃ na tā nume pṛśanyo jagṛbhre
analyzed: saḥ īm vṛṣā na phenam asyat ājau smadā parait apa dabhra cetāḥ  sarat padā na dakṣiṇā parāvṛm na tāḥ nume pṛśanyaḥ jagṛbhre
translated: He, the bull, did not foam in the battle, he went away, his mind on the distant path.🔽He went away on his feet, not turning back to the right, he did not grasp the two praiseworthy ones.

original: makṣū na vahniḥ prajāyā upabdiragniṃ na nagna upasīdadūdhaḥ
analyzed: makṣū na vahniḥ prajāyāḥ upabdiḥ agnim na nagnaḥ upasīdat ūdhas
translated: The fire was not quickly extinguished for offspring, the naked one did not approach the fire.

original: sanitedhmaṃ sanitota vājaṃ sa dhartājajñe sahasā yavīyut
analyzed: sanitā idhmam sanitā uta vājam sa dhartā ājajñe sahasā yavīyudh
translated: The supporter was born with strength, the supporter of the wood and the supporter of the strength, the upholder, the younger one with power.

original: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyaṃ navagvā ṛtaṃ vadanta ṛtayuktimagman
analyzed: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyam navagvāḥ ṛtam vadantaḥ ṛta yuktim agman
translated: The Navagvas did not quickly reach the friendship of the young girl, speaking the truth, they came to the one who is yoked with truth.

original: dvibarhaso ya upa gopamāguradakṣiṇāso acyutādudukṣan
analyzed: dvibarhasaḥ ye upa gopam āguḥ a dakṣiṇāsaḥ acyutāt udukṣan
translated: The two who came to the cowpen with double strength, they milked from the unmoving one the gifts.

original: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyaṃ navīyo rādho na reta ṛtamitturaṇyan
analyzed: makṣū kanāyāḥ sakhyam navīyaḥ rādhaḥ na retaḥ ṛtam id turaṇyan
translated: The young girl's renewed friendship did not quickly come, like the seed of the one who has truth as his wealth.

original: śuci yat te rekṇa āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ payausriyāyāḥ🔽paśvā yat paścā viyutā budhanteti bravīti vaktarīrarāṇaḥ
analyzed: śuci yat te rekṇaḥ āyajanta sabardughāyāḥ payausriyāyāḥ  paśvā yat paścā viyutā budhanta iti bravīti vaktari īrarāṇaḥ
translated: Pure is the wealth which they have gained from thee, the milk of the milch-cow who yields all that is good,🔽When the cattle, separated, low in the rear, he speaks with a voice that is pleased.

original: vasorvasutvā kāravo 'nehā viśvaṃ viveṣṭidraviṇamupa kṣu
analyzed: vasoḥ vasu tvā kāravaḥ nehāḥ viśvam viveṣṭi draviṇam upa kṣu
translated: The singers, through the favour of the good one, all around him, in the house, rejoice in the wealth which he distributes.

original: tadin nvasya pariṣadvāno agman purū sadanto nārṣadambibhitsan
analyzed: tat id nu asya pariṣadvānaḥ agman purū sadantaḥ nārṣadam bibhitsan
translated: Then indeed his attendants have come, many have sat down, he, the son of Ṛṣad, is eager to give.

original: vi śuṣṇasya saṃgrathitamanarvā vidatpuruprajātasya guhā yat
analyzed: vi śuṣṇasya saṃgrathitam anarvā vidat puru prajātasya guhā yat
translated: He has loosed the firmly bound up, the hidden, of Ṣushṇa, who has many offspring.

original: bhargo ha nāmota yasya devāḥ svarṇa ye triṣadhastheniṣeduḥ
analyzed: bhargaḥ ha nāma uta yasya devāḥ ye
translated: The light, indeed, is his name, of whom the gods, who are in the three realms, have sat down.

original: agnirha nāmota jātavedāḥ śrudhī no hotarṛtasya hotādhruk
analyzed: agniḥ ha nāma uta jātavedāḥ śrudhi naḥ hotar ṛtasya hotā adhruk
translated: Agni, indeed, is his name, the all-knower; hear us, O Hotar, the priest of truth, the unerring one.

original: uta tyā me raudrāvarcimantā nāsatyāvindra gūrtayeyajadhyai
analyzed: uta tyā me raudrau arcimantā nāsatyau indra gūrtayā iyajadhyai
translated: And you two, O Nāsatyas, with terrible splendour, O Indra, I am to worship for praise.

original: manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣe rarāṇā mandūhitaprayasā vikṣu yajyū
analyzed: manuṣvat vṛktabarhiṣe rarāṇā mandūhita prayasā vikṣu yajyū
translated: Favouring, like Manu, him whose sacrificial grass is cut, with the praise of the one who is helped by his wife, in the houses, the one who is to be worshipped.

original: ayaṃ stuto rājā vandi vedhā apaś va viprastaratisvasetuḥ
analyzed: ayam stutaḥ rājā vandi vedhāḥ
translated: This king, praised, the creator of the singer, the sage, crosses over the waters, which are hard to cross.

original: sa kakṣīvantaṃ rejayat so agniṃ nemiṃ nacakramarvato raghudru
analyzed: sa kakṣīvantam rejayat saḥ agnim nemim na cakra marvataḥ raghudru
translated: He has made Kakṣīvān strong; he has made Agni his wheel, his chariot, which moves swiftly.

original: sa dvibandhurvaitaraṇo yaṣṭā sabardhuṃ dhenumasvanduhadhyai
analyzed: sa dvi bandhuḥ vaitaraṇaḥ yaṣṭā sabardhum dhenum asvan duhadhyai
translated: He is the kinsman of the two, the sacrificer, the son of Vaitaraṇī, to milk the cow Sabardhu.

original: saṃ yan mitrāvaruṇā vṛñja ukthairjyeṣṭhebhiraryamaṇaṃ varūthaiḥ
analyzed: sam yat mitrāvaruṇā vṛñje ukthaiḥ jyeṣṭhebhiḥ aryamaṇam varūthaiḥ
translated: When you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, win with hymns, Āryaman with your highest protections,

original: tadbandhuḥ sūrirdivi te dhiyandhā nābhānediṣṭho rapatipra venan
analyzed: tad bandhuḥ sūriḥ divi te dhiyan dhāḥ nābhānediṣṭhaḥ rapati pra venan
translated: That kinsman, the lord, whose thoughts are directed to you in heaven, the nearest kinsman, singing, seeking.

original: sā no nābhiḥ paramāsya vā ghāhaṃ tatpaścā katithaścidāsa
analyzed: sā naḥ nābhiḥ paramā asya vā gha aham tad paścā katithaḥ cit āsa
translated: That navel of ours, or this one, or which one of you is the highest?

original: iyaṃ me nābhiriha me sadhasthamime me devā ayamasmisarvaḥ
analyzed: iyam me nābhiḥ iha me sadhastham ime me devāḥ ayam asmi sarvaḥ
translated: This is my navel, here is my abode, these are my gods, here is all of me.

original: dvijā aha prathamajā ṛtasyedaṃ dhenuraduhajjāyamānā
analyzed: dvijāḥ aha prathama jāḥ ṛtasya idam dhenuḥ aduhat jāyamānā
translated: The twice-born, the firstborn of order, this cow milked when born.

original: adhāsu mandro aratirvibhāvāva syati dvivartanirvaneṣāṭ🔽ūrdhvā yacchreṇirna śiśurdan makṣū sthiraṃśevṛdhaṃ sūta mātā
analyzed: mandraḥ aratiḥ vibhāvā ava syati dvi vartaniḥ vaneṣāh  ūrdhvā yat śreṇiḥ na śiśuḥ dat makṣū sthiram śevṛdham sūta mātā
translated: Then the delightful, the active, the radiant one moves from the abode, having two courses.🔽Like a mother, she has brought forth the child, the line that stands high, the young one.

original: adhā gāva upamātiṃ kanāyā anu śvāntasya kasya citpareyuḥ
analyzed: adhā gāvaḥ upamātim kanāyāḥ anu śvāntasya kasya cit pareyuḥ
translated: Then the cows went away from the misfortune of the maiden, beyond the end of anything.

original: śrudhi tvaṃ sudraviṇo nastvaṃ yāḷ āśvaghnasyavavṛdhe sūnṛtābhiḥ
analyzed: śrudhi tvam su draviṇaḥ naḥ tvam yāṭ āśvaghnasi avavṛdhe sūnṛtābhiḥ
translated: Listen to us, O Indra, you who have good wealth, you who have grown with the truth of Aśvagu.

original: adha tvamindra viddhyasmān maho rāye nṛpate vajrabāhuḥ
analyzed: adha tvam indra viddhi asmān mahaḥ rāye nṛpate vajra bāhuḥ
translated: Now, O Indra, lord of men, with your thunderbolt arm, direct us to great wealth.

original: rakṣā ca no maghonah pāhi sūrīnanehasaste harivoabhiṣṭau
analyzed: rakṣā ca naḥ maghonah pāhi sūrīn anehasaḥ te harivas abhiṣṭau
translated: protect our wealth, o maghavan, and guard the princes, o thou of many gifts, in our contests

original: adha yad rājānā gaviṣṭau sarat saraṇyuḥ kāravejaraṇyuḥ🔽vipraḥ preṣṭhaḥ sa hyeṣāṃ babhūva parā cavakṣaduta parṣadenān
analyzed: adha yat rājānā gaviṣṭau sarat saraṇyuḥ kāravejaraṇyuḥ  vipraḥ preṣṭhaḥ sa hi eṣām babhūva parā cavakṣat uta parṣat enān
translated: when the two kings, the swift and the swift to move, are eager in the fight for the cow🔽he has become their dearest priest, and shall carry them afar, and lead them forward

original: adhā nvasya jenyasya puṣṭau vṛthā rebhanta īmahe tadūnu
analyzed: adhā nu asya jenyasya puṣṭau vṛthā rebhantaḥ īmahe tad ūnu
translated: now we sing to him, to the son of the noble one, to the one who is to be praised, to the one who is to be exalted

original: saraṇyurasya sūnuraśvo vipraścāsi śravasaścasātau
analyzed: saraṇyuḥ asya sūnuḥ aśvaḥ vipraḥ ca asi śravasaścasātau
translated: his son is the swift to move, the horse, and he is the priest in the contest for glory

original: yuvoryadi sakhyāyāsme śardhāya stomaṃ jujuṣe namasvānviśvatra yasminnā giraḥ samīcīḥ pūrvīva gatūrdāśat sūnṛtāyai
analyzed: yuvoḥ yadi sakhyāya asme śardhāya stomam jujuṣe namasvān viśvatra yasmin ā giraḥ samīcīḥ pūrvīḥ iva gatūḥ dāśat sūnṛtāyai
translated: if thou, with this prayer, acceptest the praise of our company, for the sake of our friendship, in which all the songs are in harmony,

original: sa gṛṇāno adbhirdevavāniti subandhurnamasā sūktaiḥ🔽vardhadukthairvacobhirā hi nūnaṃ vyadhvaiti payasausriyāyāḥ
analyzed: sa gṛṇānaḥ adbhiḥ devavān iti su bandhuḥ namasā sūktaiḥ  vardhat ukthaiḥ vacobhiḥ ā hi nūnam vyadhvā eti payasā ausriyāyāḥ
translated: he, praised with the waters, with the hymn, with the prayer, with the good friend,🔽with the lauds, with the words, is to be worshipped, as he goes on his way to the milk of the cow

original: ta ū ṣu ṇo maho yajatrā bhūta devāsa ūtaye sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: te ū su naḥ yajatrāḥ bhūta devāsaḥ ūtaye sajoṣāḥ
translated: be ye now, o ye great gods, of one mind with us, for help, in the sacrifice

original: ye vājānanayatā viyanto ye sthā nicetāro amūrāḥ
analyzed: ye vājān anayatāḥ viyantaḥ ye stha nicetāraḥ amūrāḥ
translated: ye who have brought the treasures, who move, who are the unerring leaders in the place

original: ye yajñena dakṣiṇayā samaktā indrasya sakhyamamṛtatvamānaśa
analyzed: ye yajñena dakṣiṇayā samaktāḥ indrasya sakhyam amṛta tvam ānaśa
translated: who have been bound by sacrifice and by the sacrificial fee, have gained immortality and the friendship of Indra

original: tebhyo bhadramaṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ
analyzed: tebhyaḥ bhadram aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇītam ānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: To you, O Angirases, be good fortune; receive the wise man's offering.

original: ya udājan pitaro gomayaṃ vasv ṛtenābhindan parivatsarevalam
analyzed: ye udājan pitaraḥ go mayam vasu ṛtena abhindan parivatsarevalam
translated: Those Fathers who have sent down the cow-dung, the wealth, with the law, breaking the year-long enclosure,

original: dīrghāyutvamaṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ
analyzed: dīrgha āyu tvam aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇītam ānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: Long life be yours, O Angirases; receive the wise man's offering.

original: ya ṛtena sūryamārohayan divyaprathayan pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃvi
analyzed: ye ṛtena sūryam ārohayan divi aprathayan pṛthivīm mātaraṃvi
translated: Those who with the law have raised the sun to heaven, extending the mother earth,

original: suprajāstvamaṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavaṃsumedhasaḥ
analyzed: suprajāstvam aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇīta mānavan sumedhasaḥ
translated: Good offspring be yours, O Angirases; receive the wise man's offering.

original: ayaṃ nābhā vadati valgu vo gṛhe devaputrā ṛṣayastacchṛṇotana
analyzed: ayam nābhā vadati valgu vaḥ gṛhe deva putrāḥ ṛṣayaḥ tat śṛṇotana
translated: This navel speaks sweetly in your house; O sons of gods, Rishis, listen to that.

original: subrahmaṇyamaṅgiraso vo astu prati gṛbhṇītamānavaṃ sumedhasaḥ
analyzed: subrahmaṇyam aṅgirasaḥ vaḥ astu prati gṛbhṇītam ānavam sumedhasaḥ
translated: Good Brahman be yours, O Angirases; receive the wise man's offering.

original: virūpāsa id ṛṣayasta id gambhīravepasaḥ
analyzed: virūpāsaḥ id ṛṣayaḥ te id gambhīra vepasaḥ
translated: The Rishis are indeed of varied form, they are of deep-reaching power.

original: te aṅgirasaḥsūnavaste agneḥ pari jajñire
analyzed: te aṅgirasaḥ sūnavaḥ te agneḥ pari jajñire
translated: They are the sons of Angiras, they were born from Agni's side.

original: ye agneḥ pari jajñire virūpāso divas pari
analyzed: ye agneḥ pari jajñire virūpāsaḥ divaḥ pari
translated: Those who were born from Agni's side, of varied form, from the sky,

original: navagvo nudaśagvo aṅgirastamo sacā deveṣu maṃate
analyzed: navagvaḥ nu daśagvaḥ aṅgirastamaḥ sacā deveṣu maṃate
translated: The most Angiras-like of the nine-versed and ten-versed, together with the gods in the mind,

original: indreṇa yujā niḥ sṛjanta vāghato vrajaṃ gomantamaśvinam
analyzed: indreṇa yujā niḥ sṛjanta vāghataḥ vrajam gomantam aśvinam
translated: With Indra as their ally, they release the cow-pen and the horse-pen belonging to the sacrificer.

original: sahasraṃ me dadato aṣṭakarṇyaḥ śravo deveṣvakrata
analyzed: sahasram me dadataḥ aṣṭakarṇyaḥ śravaḥ deveṣu akrata
translated: When I give a thousand, may the eight-eared ones make fame for me among the gods

original: pra nūnaṃ jāyatāmayaṃ manustokmeva rohatu
analyzed: pra nūnam jāyatām ayam manuḥ tokmā iva rohatu
translated: May this Manu now be born, may he grow like a plant

original: yaḥ sahasraṃśatāśvaṃ sadyo dānāya maṃhate
analyzed: yaḥ sahasram śata aśvam sadyas dānāya maṃhate
translated: He who suddenly gives a thousand with a hundred horses for a gift

original: na tamaśnoti kaścana diva iva sānvārabham🔽sāvarṇyasya dakṣiṇā vi sindhuriva paprathe
analyzed: na tam aśnoti kaścana divaḥ iva sa anvārabham  sāvarṇyasya dakṣiṇā vi sindhuḥ iva paprathe
translated: No one can reach him, like the sky with its peaks🔽The gifts of Savarni spread out like a river

original: uta dāsā pariviṣe smaddiṣṭī goparīṇasā
analyzed: uta dāsā pariviṣe smaddiṣṭī go parīṇasā
translated: Even the Dasa, with his own food, with his cow-pen,

original: yadusturvaśca māmahe
analyzed: yaduḥ turvaḥ ca māmahe
translated: Yadu and Turva praise us

original: sahasradā grāmaṇīrmā riṣan manuḥ sūryeṇāsyayatamānaitu dakṣiṇā
analyzed: sahasra dāḥ grāmaṇīḥ mā riṣat manuḥ sūryeṇa asya yatamānā etu dakṣiṇā
translated: May the thousand-giver, the village chief, not be harmed. May Manu, stretched out with the sun, come with his gifts

original: sāvarṇerdevāḥ pra tirantvāyuryasminnaśrāntā asanāma vājam
analyzed: sāvarṇeḥ devāḥ pra tirantu āyuḥ yasmin a śrāntāḥ asanāma vājam
translated: May the gods grant long life to Savarni, in whom we have offered the inexhaustible strength

original: parāvato ye didhiṣanta āpyaṃ manuprītāso janimāvivasvataḥ
analyzed: parāvataḥ ye didhiṣante āpyam manu prītāsaḥ janimā vivasvataḥ
translated: Those who from afar desire the obtainable, pleased with Manu, the offspring of Vivasvat

original: yayāterye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devā āsate teadhi bruvantu naḥ
analyzed: yayāteḥ ye nahuṣyasya barhiṣi devāḥ āsate te adhi bruvantu naḥ
translated: Those who on the grass of Yayati, the son of Nahusha, sit as gods, may they speak to us

original: viśvā hi vo namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devā uta yajñiyānivaḥ
analyzed: viśvā hi vaḥ namasyāni vandyā nāmāni devāḥ uta
translated: For all your names are to be honored, to be worshipped, O gods, as if they were worthy of sacrifice

original: ye stha jātā aditerabdhyas pari ye pṛthivyāstema iha śrutā havam
analyzed: ye stha jātāḥ aditeḥ abdhyaḥ pari ye pṛthivyāḥ te ime iha śruta havam
translated: You who are born around the ocean of Aditi, you who are on the earth, may they hear our call here

original: yebhyo mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣaṃ dyauraditiradribarhāḥ
analyzed: yebhyaḥ mātā madhumat pinvate payaḥ pīyūṣam dyauḥ aditiḥ adri barhāḥ
translated: from whom the mother pours out honey-sweet milk, the ambrosia, Aditi, the cloud-resisting [sky],

original: ukthaśuṣmān vṛṣabharān svapnasastānādityānanu madā svastaye
analyzed: uktha śuṣmān vṛṣa bharān svapnasaḥ tān ādityān anu madā svastaye
translated: the Adityas, who are nourished with praise, who are strong, who are to be praised in sleep, I honour for well-being.

original: nṛcakṣaso animiṣanto arhaṇā bṛhad devāso amṛtatvamānaśuḥ
analyzed: nṛ cakṣasaḥ a nimiṣantaḥ arhaṇā bṛhat devāsaḥ amṛta tvam ānaśuḥ
translated: The gods, whose eyes are men, who are unblinking, who are worthy of worship, have attained immortality.

original: jyotīrathā ahimāyā anāgaso divo varṣmāṇaṃvasate svastaye🔽samrājo ye suvṛdho yajñamāyayuraparihvṛtā dadhire divikṣayam
analyzed: jyotīrathāḥ ahi māyāḥ anāgasaḥ divaḥ varṣmāṇam vasate svastaye  samrājaḥ ye suvṛdhaḥ yajñam āyayuḥ aparihvṛtāḥ dadhire divikṣayam
translated: The luminous ones, the guileless ones, the ones without sin, dwell in the height of the sky for well-being.🔽The Suvr̥idhas, the emperors, who have come to the sacrifice, have established the abode in the sky, free from destruction.

original: tānā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhirmaho ādityānaditiṃ svastaye
analyzed: tān ā vivāsa namasā suvṛktibhiḥ mahas ādityān aditim svastaye
translated: I invoke them with homage and good hymns, the great Adityas and Aditi, for well-being.

original: ko va stomaṃ rādhati yaṃ jujoṣatha viśve devāso manuṣoyati ṣṭhana
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ stomam rādhati yam jujoṣatha viśve devāsaḥ manuṣaḥ yati ṣṭhana
translated: Who will delight in the praise that you approve? All you gods, be present with the man.

original: ko vo 'dhvaraṃ tuvijātā araṃ karad yo naḥparṣadatyaṃhaḥ svastaye
analyzed: kaḥ vaḥ dhvaram tuvi jātāḥ aram karat yaḥ naḥparṣat ati aṃhaḥ svastaye
translated: Who will make your sacrifice easy to perform, O you of great birth, who will carry us over misfortune for well-being?

original: yebhyo hotrāṃ prathamāmāyeje manuḥ samiddhāgnirmanasāsapta hotṛbhiḥ
analyzed: yebhyaḥ hotrām prathamām āyeje manuḥ samiddha agniḥ manasā asapta hotṛbhiḥ
translated: To whom Manu first offered the priesthood, with kindled fire, with mind, with seven priests,

original: ta ādityā abhayaṃ śarma yachata sugā naḥkarta supathā svastaye
analyzed: te ādityāḥ abhayam śarma yacchata sugā naḥ karta su pathā svastaye
translated: to those Adityas grant protection and peace. Make our path easy and good for well-being.

original: ya īśire bhuvanasya pracetaso viśvasya sthāturjagataścamantavaḥ
analyzed: ye īśire bhuvanasya pracetasaḥ viśvasya sthātuḥ jagataḥ camantavaḥ
translated: To those who are the wise rulers of the world, who are to be praised by all that stands and moves,

original: te naḥ kṛtādakṛtādenasas paryadyā devāsaḥpipṛtā svastaye
analyzed: te naḥ kṛtāt a kṛtāt enasaḥ pari adyā devāsaḥ pipṛta svastaye
translated: Do ye, O Gods, deliver us from the sin we have committed and that which we have not, for welfare.

original: bhareṣvindraṃ suhavaṃ havāmahe 'ṃhomucaṃ sukṛtandaivyaṃ janam
analyzed: bhareṣu indram su havam havāmahe ṃhaḥ mucam su kṛtan daivyam janam
translated: In battles we invoke Indra, the easy to invoke, the well-made, the divine people, the deliverer from distress.

original: agniṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sātaye bhagandyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye
analyzed: agnim mitram varuṇam sātaye bhagan dyāvāpṛthivī marutaḥ svastaye
translated: Agni, Mitra, Varuna, for gain, Bhaga, heaven and earth, the Maruts, for welfare.

original: sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyāmanehasaṃ suśarmāṇamaditiṃsupraṇītim
analyzed: su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim
translated: The earth, the all-supporting, the sky, the uninjured, Aditi, the well-ordered, the good protector.

original: daivīṃ nāvaṃ svaritrāmanāgasamasravantīmā ruhemā svastaye
analyzed: daivīm nāvam su aritrām anāgasam asravantī imāḥ ruhema svastaye
translated: We will ascend the divine ship, the self-moving, the unswerving, the flowing, for welfare.

original: viśve yajatrā adhi vocatotaye trāyadhvaṃ no durevāyāabhihrutaḥ
analyzed: viśve yajatrāḥ adhi vocata ūtaye trāyadhvam naḥ durevāya aabhihrutaḥ
translated: All you who are to be worshipped, speak for our protection. Deliver us from evil, from slander.

original: satyayā vo devahūtyā huvema śṛṇvato devāavase svastaye
analyzed: satyayā vaḥ deva hūtyā huvema śṛṇvataḥ devāavase svastaye
translated: With true invocation of the gods we will invoke you, O listening gods, for help, for welfare.

original: apāmīvāmapa viśvāmanāhutimapārātiṃ durvidatrāmaghāyataḥ
analyzed: apa amīvām apa viśvām anāhutim apa arātim durvidatrām aghāyataḥ
translated: Away the evil word, away all the unoffered oblation, away the foe, the evil-wishing, the evil-finding.

original: āre devā dveṣo asmad yuyotanoru ṇaḥ śarmayachatā svastaye🔽ariṣṭaḥ sa marto viśva edhate pra prajābhirjāyatedharmaṇas pari
analyzed: āre devāḥ dveṣaḥ asmat yuyotana uru naḥ śarmayacchata svastaye  ariṣṭaḥ sa martaḥ viśvaḥ edhate pra prajābhiḥ jāyate dharmaṇaḥ pari
translated: O gods, remove from us hatred; grant us wide protection, for welfare.🔽That mortal prospers, all around, who has you for his allies; he is born with offspring, in the course of the law.

original: yamādityāso nayathā sunītibhirativiśvāni duritā svastaye
analyzed: yam ādityāsaḥ nayathā su nītibhiḥ ati viśvāni duritā svastaye
translated: O Adityas, lead us by your good guidance beyond all evils, for welfare.

original: yaṃ devāso 'vatha vājasātau yaṃ śūrasātā maruto hitedhane
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ vatha vājasātau yam śūrasātau marutaḥ hitedhane
translated: Whom the gods help in the winning of booty, whom the Maruts in the fight for heroic fame

original: prātaryāvāṇaṃ rathamindra sānasimariṣyantamāruhemā svastaye
analyzed: prātar yāvāṇam ratham indra sānasim ariṣyantam āruhema svastaye
translated: We will mount the chariot of the early morning, O Indra, which is to be desired, in order to be happy

original: svasti naḥ pathyāsu dhanvasu svastyapsu vṛjane svarvati
analyzed: svasti naḥ pathyāsu dhanvasu svasti apsu vṛjane svarvati
translated: Be it well with us on the paths, on the desert ways, be it well with us in the water, in the watery place

original: svasti naḥ putrakṛtheṣu yoniṣu svasti rāye maruto dadhātana🔽svastirid dhi prapathe śreṣṭhā rekṇasvatyabhi yāvāmameti
analyzed: svasti naḥ putrakṛtheṣu yoniṣu svasti rāye marutaḥ dadhātana  svastiḥ id hi prapathe śreṣṭhā rekṇasvatī abhi yāvāmama iti
translated: Be it well with us in the wombs that are the abode of sons, be it well with us for wealth, O Maruts🔽For this is the best prosperity on the path, which comes to us from the wealthy one

original: sā no amā so araṇe ni pātu svāveśā bhavatudevagopā
analyzed: sā naḥ amā saḥ araṇe ni pātu su āveśā bhavatu deva gopā
translated: May it protect us from the evil one, from the desert, may it be our own, guarded by the gods

original: evā plateḥ sūnuravīvṛdhad vo viśva ādityā aditemanīṣī
analyzed: eva plateḥ sūnuḥ avīvṛdhat vaḥ viśve ādityāḥ adite manīṣī
translated: Thus the son of Plati has increased you, O All-Ādityas, the wise one with Āditya

original: īśānāso naro amartyenāstāvi jano divyogayena🔽kathā devānāṃ katamasya yāmani sumantu nāma śṛṇvatāmmanāmahe
analyzed: īśānāsaḥ naraḥ amartyena astāvi janaḥ divyogayena  kathā devānām katamasya yāmani sumantu nāma śṛṇvatām manāmahe
translated: The lords, the men, have been made famous by the immortal one, the people in heaven by the sacrifice🔽How shall we hear the name of which of the gods, of the gods who listen, on whose path we shall go?

original: ko mṛḷāti katamo no mayas karat katama ūtī abhyā vavartati
analyzed: kaḥ mṛḷāti katamaḥ naḥ mayaḥ karat katamaḥ ūtī abhyā vavartati
translated: Who will be kind to us? Who will do us good? Which one will come to us for help?

original: kratūyanti kratavo hṛtsu dhītayo venanti venāḥ patayantyā diśaḥ
analyzed: kratūyanti kratavaḥ hṛtsu dhītayaḥ venanti venāḥ patayantyāḥ diśaḥ
translated: The thoughts in the hearts, the desires, are quickened; the desires move, the quarters move.

original: na marḍitā vidyate anya ebhyo deveṣu me adhikāmā ayaṃsata
analyzed: na marḍitā vidyate anyaḥ ebhyaḥ deveṣu me adhikāmāḥ ayaṃsata
translated: There is no other one to be praised than these; among the gods my highest hope has been fulfilled.

original: narā vā śaṃsaṃ pūṣaṇamagohyamagniṃ deveddhamabhyarcase girā
analyzed: narā vā śaṃsam pūṣaṇam agohyam agnim deva iddham abhyarcase girā
translated: You praise with your speech Narāśaṃsa, Pūṣan who is not to be deceived, Agni who is kindled by the gods

original: sūryāmāsā candramasā yamaṃ divi tritaṃvātamuṣasamaktumaśvinā
analyzed: sūryāmāsā candramasā yamam divi tritam vātam uṣasam aktum aśvinā
translated: The sun and moon, the moon, Yama in the sky, Trita, Vāta, Uṣas, the Aśvins, the lightning

original: kathā kavistuvīravān kayā girā bṛhaspatirvāvṛdhatesuvṛktibhiḥ
analyzed: kathā kaviḥ tuvīravān kayā girā bṛhaspatiḥ vāvṛdhate suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: How is the poet to be praised? With what speech does Bṛhaspati prosper with good hymns?

original: aja ekapāt suhavebhirṛkvabhirahiḥ śṛṇotubudhnyo havīmani
analyzed: ajaḥ ekapād su havebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ ahiḥ śṛṇotubudhnyaḥ havīmani
translated: May the one-footed Agni, the swift one, the Ahi, the deep one, listen to the invocation with the Rkv-s, the swift ones

original: dakṣasya vādite janmani vrate rājānā mitrāvaruṇāvivāsasi
analyzed: dakṣasya vā adite janmani vrate rājānā mitrāvaruṇā vivāsasi
translated: In the birth, in the vow, in the creation of Dakṣa, you invoke the two kings Mitra and Varuṇa

original: atūrtapanthāḥ pururatho aryamā saptahotāviṣurūpeṣu janmasu
analyzed: a tūrta panthāḥ puru rathaḥ aryamā sapta hotā aviṣurūpeṣu janmasu
translated: Aryaman, whose path is uninterrupted, who has many chariots, the seven-hotar, in the various births

original: te no arvanto havanaśruto havaṃ viśve śṛṇvantu vājinomitadravaḥ
analyzed: te naḥ arvantaḥ havana śrutaḥ havam viśve śṛṇvantu vājinā umita dravaḥ
translated: May all those swift horses, who hear the invocation, all listen to our call, the strong ones who drip with ghee

original: sahasrasā medhasātāviva tmanā maho yedhanaṃ samitheṣu jabhrire
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ medha sātau iva tmanā mahaḥ yedhanam samitheṣu jabhrire
translated: Who, with a thousand powers, with a mind that desires the sacrifice, have brought great wealth in the assemblies

original: pra vo vāyuṃ rathayujaṃ purandhiṃ stomaiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃsakhyāya pūṣaṇam
analyzed: pra vaḥ vāyum ratha yujam purandhim stomaiḥ kṛṇudhvam sa khyāya pūṣaṇam
translated: You should make Vāyu, who yokes the chariot, Purandhi, Pūṣan, to be your friend with your hymns

original: te hi devasya savituḥ savīmanikratuṃ sacante sacitaḥ sacetasaḥ
analyzed: te hi devasya savituḥ savīmanikratum sacante sacitaḥ sacetasaḥ
translated: For they, the wise, the thoughtful, follow the thought of the god Savitr, the one with the measured thought

original: triḥ sapta sasrā nadyo mahīrapo vanaspatīn parvatānagnimūtaye
analyzed: tris sapta sasrāḥ nadyaḥ mahīḥ apaḥ vanaspatīn parvatān agnim ūtaye
translated: The three times seven thousand rivers, the great waters, the trees, the mountains, Agni, for help

original: kṛśānumastṝn tiṣyaṃ sadhastha ā rudraṃrudreṣu rudriyaṃ havāmahe
analyzed: kṛśānu mastṝn tiṣyam sadhasthe ā rudram rudreṣu rudriyam havāmahe
translated: we call on Rudra in the Rudras' company, on Tishya in the home of the Angirases, on the lean ones, on the swift ones, on the lordly one

original: sarasvatī sarayuḥ sindhurūrmibhirmaho mahīravasā yantuvakṣaṇīḥ🔽devīrāpo mātaraḥ sūdayitnvo ghṛtavat payomadhuman no arcata
analyzed: sarasvatī sarayuḥ sindhuḥ ūrmibhiḥ mahaḥ mahī ravasā yantu vakṣaṇīḥ  devīḥ āpaḥ mātaraḥ sūdayitnvaḥ ghṛtavat payaḥ madhumat naḥ arcata
translated: may Sarasvatî and the Sarayu with their waves, the great and mighty waters come to us for our help🔽O ye divine waters, O ye mothers, ye purifiers, be ye gracious to us with fair streams

original: uta mātā bṛhaddivā śṛṇotu nastvaṣṭā devebhirjanibhiḥpitā vacaḥ
analyzed: uta mātā bṛhat divā śṛṇotu naḥ tvaṣṭā devebhiḥ janibhiḥ pitā vacaḥ
translated: and may our great mother Dyaus hear our call, and Tvashtar with the gods, our father, hear our words

original: ṛbhukṣā vājo rathaspatirbhago raṇvaḥśaṇsaḥ śaśamānasya pātu naḥ
analyzed: ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ rathaspatiḥ bhagaḥ raṇvaḥ śaṇsaḥ śaśamānasya pātu naḥ
translated: may Rbhukṣan Vâja, lord of the chariot, Bhaga, the kind, the bounteous, guard us when we strive

original: raṇvaḥ sandṛṣṭau pitumāniva kṣayo bhadrā rudrāṇāmmarutāmupastutiḥ
analyzed: raṇvaḥ san dṛṣṭau pitumān iva kṣayaḥ bhadrā rudrāṇām marutām upastutiḥ
translated: kindly to look on us, like a father on his son, is the good praise of the Rudras and the Maruts

original: gobhiḥ ṣyāma yaśaso janeṣvā sadādevāsa iḷayā sacemahi
analyzed: gobhiḥ syāma yaśasaḥ janeṣvā sadā devāsaḥ iḷayā sacemahi
translated: with the cows may we be rich, and glorious among the people, and may we be united with the gods by our devotion

original: yāṃ me dhiyaṃ maruta indra devā adadāta varuṇa mitra yūyam
analyzed: yām me dhiyam marutaḥ indra devāḥ adadāta varuṇa mitra yūyam
translated: O ye Maruts, O ye Indra, O ye gods, O Varuna, O Mitra, that thought of mine which ye have given

original: tāṃ pīpayata payaseva dhenuṃ kuvid giro adhi rathevahātha🔽kuvidaṅga prati yathā cidasya naḥ sajātyasya marutobubodhatha
analyzed: tām pīpayata payasā iva dhenum kuvid giraḥ adhi  kuvid aṅga prati yathā cit asya naḥ sajātyasya marutaḥ bubodhatha
translated: make it to swell like a cow with milk: will ye not bring the songs as a chariot is brought?🔽How will ye, O ye Maruts, be aware of this, of the kinship of him who is here?

original: nābhā yatra prathamaṃ saṃnaśāmahe tatrajāmitvamaditirdadhātu naḥ
analyzed: nābhā yatra prathamam saṃnaśāmahe tatra jāmi tvam aditiḥ dadhātu naḥ
translated: Where we first meet together, there may Aditi grant us the state of being kinsmen.

original: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī mātarā mahī devī devāñ janmanāyajñiye itaḥ
analyzed: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī mātarā mahī devī devām janmanā ayajñiye itaḥ
translated: For these two, Heaven and Earth, are the great mothers, the divine ones, worthy of sacrifice, the birthplace of the gods.

original: ubhe bibhṛta ubhayaṃ bharīmabhiḥ purūretāṃsi pitṛbhiśca siñcataḥ
analyzed: ubhe bibhṛtaḥ ubhayam bharīmabhiḥ purūretāṃsi pitṛbhiḥ ca siñcataḥ
translated: They support both, they who are to be supported by both, they who pour out the many seed-sorts with the fathers.

original: vi ṣā hotrā viśvamaśnoti vāryaṃ bṛhaspatiraramatiḥpanīyasī
analyzed: vi sā hotrā viśvam aśnoti vāryam bṛhaspatiḥ aramatiḥ panīyasī
translated: The priest's office obtains all good things here, the most venerable favour of Brhaspati.

original: grāvā yatra madhuṣuducyate bṛhadavīvaśantamatibhirmanīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: grāvā yatra madhuṣut ucyate
translated: Where the stone is set in motion, sweet to the taste, the wise ones shout with their thoughts, with their thoughts.

original: evā kavistuvīravān ṛtajñā draviṇasyurdraviṇasaścakānaḥ
analyzed: eva kaviḥ tuvīravān ṛta jñāḥ draviṇasyuḥ draviṇasaḥ cakānaḥ
translated: So the wise one, knowing the truth, desirous of praise and wealth, seeking riches,

original: ukthebhiratra matibhiśca vipro 'pīpayad gayodivyāni janma
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ atra matibhiḥ ca vipraḥ pīpayat gayaḥ divyāni janma
translated: The priest here with his hymns and thoughts has filled the heavenly births with Gāya's son.

original: evā plateḥ sūnur / / /
analyzed: eva plateḥ sūnuḥ
translated: So the son of Plati...

original: agnirindro varuṇo mitro aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatīsajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā vāyuḥ pūṣā sarasvatī sajoṣasaḥ
translated: Agni, Indra, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, Vayu, Pusan, Sarasvati of one mind,

original: ādityā viṣṇurmarutaḥ svarbṛhat somo rudroaditirbrahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: ādityāḥ viṣṇuḥ marutaḥ svar bṛhat somaḥ rudraḥ aditiḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: The Adityas, Vishnu, the Maruts, the lofty heaven, Soma, Rudra, Aditi, Brahmanaspati,

original: indrāgnī vṛtrahatyeṣu satpatī mitho hinvānā tanvāsamokasā
analyzed: indra agnī vṛtra hatyeṣu sat patī mithas hinvānā tanvā asamokasā
translated: Indra and Agni, lords of the true, in the slaying of Vrtra, mutually impelling each other with their bodies,

original: antarikṣaṃ mahyā paprurojasā somo ghṛtaśrīrmahimānamīrayan
analyzed: antarikṣam mahyā papruḥ ojasā somaḥ ghṛtaśrīḥ mahimānam īrayan
translated: They have filled the great mid-region with their might, Soma, glorious with ghee, extolling his greatness.

original: teṣāṃ hi mahnā mahatāmanarvaṇāṃ stomāniyarmyṛtajñā ṛtāvṛdhām
analyzed: teṣām hi mahnā mahatām anarvaṇām stoma aniyarmi ṛta jñāḥ ṛtāvṛdhām
translated: For them, of great might, of great power, I arrange the hymns, knowing the truth, increasing truth,

original: ye apsavamarṇavaṃ citrarādhasasteno rāsantāṃ mahaye sumitryāḥ
analyzed: ye apsavam arṇavam citra rādhasaḥ tena u rāsantām mahaye sumitryāḥ
translated: may they, the bountiful, the wondrously beneficent, who are the waters, the ocean, come nigh for our great exaltation

original: svarṇaramantarikṣāṇi rocanā dyāvābhūmī pṛthivīṃskambhurojasā
analyzed: svarṇaram antarikṣāṇi rocanā dyāvābhūmī pṛthivīṃskambhuḥ ojasā
translated: the golden-hued firmaments, the luminous regions, the heavens and earth, the supportress, he upholds with might

original: pṛkṣā iva mahayantaḥ surātayo devāstavante manuṣāya sūrayaḥ
analyzed: pṛkṣāḥ iva mahayantaḥ su rātayaḥ devāḥ tavante manuṣāya sūrayaḥ
translated: the bounteous ones, exalting him as 'twere a bull, the gods and the princes praise him with the hymn of men

original: mitrāya śikṣa varuṇāya dāśuṣe yā samrājā manasā naprayuchataḥ🔽yayordhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhad yayorubherodasī nādhasī vṛtau
analyzed: mitrāya śikṣa varuṇāya dāśuṣe yā samrājā manasā naprayuchataḥ  yayoḥ dhāma dharmaṇā rocate bṛhat yayoḥ ubheḥ odasī nādhasī vṛtau
translated: to Mitra and to Varuna, to him who offers, teach thou, who as the two great kings never forsake🔽whose lofty abode shines forth in the ordinance, whose two worlds are not far distant, the upper and the lower

original: yā gaurvartaniṃ paryeti niṣkṛtaṃ payo duhānā vratanīravārataḥ
analyzed: yā gauḥ vartanim paryeti niṣkṛtam payaḥ duhānā vrata nīra vārataḥ
translated: the cow who goeth round the path that is well-trodden, who milketh out the milk, who goeth to the ordinances without transgression

original: sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyodāśad dhaviṣā vivasvate
analyzed: sā prabruvāṇā varuṇāya dāśuṣe devebhyaḥ udāśat haviṣā vivasvate
translated: she, proclaiming to Varuna the worshipper, hath brought oblation to the gods and to Vivasvan

original: divakṣaso agnijihvā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtasya yoniṃ vimṛśanta āsate
analyzed: divakṣasaḥ agni jihvāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtasya yonim vimṛśantaḥ āsate
translated: the heaven-born ones, whose tongue is Agni, the strengtheners of holy order, they sit reflecting on the womb of holy order

original: dyāṃ skabhitvyapa ā cakrurojasā yajñaṃ janitvītanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
analyzed: dyām skabhitvī apaḥ ā cakruḥ ojasā yajñam janitvī itanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
translated: having fixed the heaven, they have by their might brought down the waters; the slender one hath cleansed the sacrifice, the sacrifice's birth

original: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥsamokasā
analyzed: parikṣitā pitarā pūrvajāvarī ṛtasya yonā kṣayataḥ samokasā
translated: the two parents, the two first-born, the two all-encompassing, the two dwelling together in the womb of holy order

original: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payomahiṣāya pinvataḥ
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇāya savrate ghṛtavat payaḥ mahiṣāya pinvataḥ
translated: the two heavens and the two earths swell with milk rich in ghee for Varuna of true law, for the bull

original: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇendravāyū varuṇo mitroaryamā
analyzed: parjanyāvātā vṛṣabhā purīṣiṇā indra vāyū varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Parjanya and Vata, bulls, the two with fertilizing seed, Indra and Vayu, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman

original: devānādityānaditiṃ havāmahe ye pārthivāsodivyāso apsu ye🔽tvaṣṭāraṃ vāyum ṛbhavo ya ohate daivyā hotārā uṣasaṃsvastaye
analyzed: devān ādityān aditim havāmahe ye pārthivāsaḥ divyāsaḥ apsu ye  tvaṣṭāram vāyum ṛbhavaḥ yaḥ ohate daivyā hotārau uṣasam svastaye
translated: We invoke the Adityas, the gods, Aditi, those who are on earth, in heaven, in the waters🔽Tvashtar, Vayu, the Rbhus who bestow, the two divine Hotars, and Ushas for our welfare

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛtrakhādaṃ sumedhasamindriyaṃsomaṃ dhanasā u īmahe
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛtra khādam sumedhasam indriyaṃsomam dhana sāḥ u īmahe
translated: We implore Brihaspati, the Vrtra-killer, the wise one, Soma, the lord of power, the finder of wealth

original: brahma gāmaśvaṃ janayanta oṣadhīrvanaspatīn pṛthivīmparvatānapaḥ
analyzed: brahma gām aśvam janayantaḥ oṣadhīḥ vanaspatīn pṛthivīm parvatān apaḥ
translated: The Brahmans have generated the cow, the horse, the plants, the trees, the earth, the mountains, the waters

original: sūryaṃ divi rohayantaḥ sudānava āryāvratā visṛjanto adhi kṣami
analyzed: sūryam divi rohayantaḥ sudānavaḥ āryāvratāḥ visṛjantaḥ adhi kṣami
translated: The bountiful ones, setting the sun in the sky, spreading out the Aryan vows upon the earth

original: bhujyumaṃhasaḥ pipṛtho niraśvinā śyāvaṃ putraṃvadhrimatyā ajinvatam
analyzed: bhujyum aṃhasaḥ pipṛthaḥ niḥ aśvinā śyāvam putraṃvadhrimatyāḥ ajinvatam
translated: You, O Asvins, have delivered Bhujyu from his sorrow; you have quickened the lame son of Vadhrimat

original: kamadyuvaṃ vimadāyohathuryuvaṃviṣṇāpvaṃ viśvakāyāva sṛjathaḥ
analyzed: kamadyuvam vimadāya ūhathuḥ yuvam viṣṇāpvam viśvakāya ava sṛjathaḥ
translated: You have brought the impetuous one to the one without intoxication; you have loosed Vishnapva for Vishvaka

original: pāvīravī tanyaturekapādajo divo dhartā sindhurāpaḥsamudriyaḥ
analyzed: pāvīravī tanyatuḥ eka pāda jaḥ divaḥ dhartā sindhuḥ āpaḥsamudriyaḥ
translated: The one with the single foot, the son of Pavi, the upholder of heaven, the ocean, the rivers

original: viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṃsi me sarasvatīsaha dhībhiḥ purandhyā
