analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ śṛṇavan vacāṃsi me sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā
translated: May all the gods hear my words, Sarasvati together with the thoughts, with the inspiration

original: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā manoryajatrāamṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: viśve devāḥ saha dhībhiḥ purandhyā manoḥ yajatrāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: All the gods together with the thoughts, the holy ones, the immortals, the knowers of truth

original: rātiṣāco abhiṣācaḥ svarvidaḥ svargiro brahma sūktaṃ juṣerata
analyzed: rātiṣācaḥ abhiṣācaḥ svar vidaḥ svar giraḥ brahma sūktam juṣerata
translated: May the givers of gifts, the givers of honour, the finders of heaven, the heavenly singers, accept the hymn and prayer.

original: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanābhipratasthuḥ🔽te no rāsantāmurugāyamadya yūyaṃ pātasvastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: devān vasiṣṭhaḥ amṛtān vavande ye viśvā bhuvanā abhipratasthuḥ  te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Vasishtha has praised the immortal gods who have gone forth over all existing things.🔽May they grant us wide protection this day. Do ye, O ye gods, evermore protect us with your blessings.

original: devān huve bṛhacchravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛto adhvarasyapracetasaḥ
analyzed: devān huve bṛhat śravasaḥ svastaye jyotiṣkṛtaḥ adhvarasya apracetasaḥ
translated: I invoke the gods of great glory for welfare, the illuminators of the sacrifice, the wise ones,

original: ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataraṃ viśvavedasaindrajyeṣṭhāso amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
analyzed: ye vāvṛdhuḥ prataram viśva vedasā aindra jyeṣṭhāsaḥ amṛtāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Who have grown in strength through all-knowledge, the foremost among the Maruts, the immortals, the promoters of truth.

original: indraprasūtā varuṇapraśiṣṭā ye sūryasya jyotiṣo bhāgamānaśuḥ
analyzed: indra prasūtāḥ varuṇa praśiṣṭāḥ ye sūryasya jyotiṣaḥ bhāgam ānaśuḥ
translated: Urged on by Indra, directed by Varuna, they have attained their share of the light of the sun.

original: marudgaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñaṃjanayanta sūrayaḥ
analyzed: marut gaṇe vṛjane manma dhīmahi māghone yajñaṃjanayanta sūrayaḥ
translated: We will think of the hymn in the Marut host, in the Maghona, the sons generate the sacrifice.

original: indro vasubhiḥ pari pātu no gayamādityairno aditḥ śarmayachtu
analyzed: indraḥ vasubhiḥ pari pātu naḥ gayam ādityaiḥ naḥ aditiḥ śarma yacchtu
translated: May Indra with the Vasus protect our dwelling. May Aditi with the Adityas grant us protection.

original: rudro rudrebhirdevo mṛḷayāti nastvaṣṭā nognābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu
analyzed: rudraḥ rudrebhiḥ devaḥ mṛḍayāti naḥ tvaṣṭā na ugnābhiḥ suvitāya jinvatu
translated: May the god Rudra with the Rudras be gracious to us. May Tvastr with the wives stimulate us for prosperity.

original: aditirdyāvāpṛthivī ṛtaṃ mahadindrāviṣṇū marutaḥsvarbṛhat
analyzed: aditiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtam mahat indra viṣṇū marutaḥ svar bṛhat
translated: Aditi, heaven and earth, great truth, Indra and Vishnu, the Maruts, the lofty heaven,

original: devānādityānavase havāmahe vasūn rudrāṃsavitāraṃ sudaṃsasam
analyzed: devān ādityān avase havāmahe vasūn rudrān savitāram su daṃsasam
translated: For the sake of the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, and the bountiful Savitar, we invoke the gods.

original: sarasvān dhībhirvaruṇo dhṛtavratḥ pūṣā viṣṇurmahimāvāyuraśvinā
analyzed: sarasvān dhībhiḥ varuṇaḥ dhṛta vrataḥ pūṣā viṣṇuḥ mahimā vāyuḥ aśvinā
translated: Sarasvat, Varuna of firm vows, Pusan, Vishnu's greatness, Vayu, the Ashvins

original: brahmakṛto amṛtā viśvavedasaḥ śarma noyaṃsan trivarūthamaṃhasaḥ🔽vṛṣā yajño vṛṣaṇaḥ santu yajñiyā vṛṣaṇo devāvṛṣaṇo haviṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: brahma kṛtaḥ amṛtāḥ viśva vedasaḥ śarma naḥ yaṃsan tri varūtham aṃhasaḥ  vṛṣā yajñaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ santu yajñiyāḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ devāvṛṣaṇaḥ haviṣkṛtaḥ
translated: Brahma-makers, immortal, all-knowing, may grant us shelter, a threefold refuge from distress.🔽Let the sacrifice be strong, let the sacrificers be strong, let the gods be strong, let the offerers of oblations be strong.

original: vṛṣaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāvarīvṛṣā parjanyo vṛṣaṇo vṛṣastubhaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣaṇā dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāvarī vṛṣā parjanyaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ vṛṣa stubhaḥ
translated: Let the strong Dyaus and Prithivī, rich in truth, be strong, let Parjanya be strong, let the strong ones be strong.

original: agnīṣomā vṛṣaṇā vājasātaye purupraśastā vṛṣaṇā upabruve
analyzed: agnīṣomā vṛṣaṇā vājasātaye puru praśastā vṛṣaṇau upabruve
translated: O Agni and Soma, strong ones, for the sake of strength, I address you, praised by many, O strong ones.

original: yāvījire vṛṣaṇo devayajyayā tā naḥ śarmatrivarūthaṃ vi yaṃsataḥ🔽dhṛtavratāḥ kṣatriyā yajñaniṣkṛto bṛhaddivā adhvarāṇāmabhiśriyaḥ
analyzed: yā avījire vṛṣaṇaḥ deva yajyayā tā naḥ śarma atri varūtham vi yaṃsataḥ  dhṛta vratāḥ kṣatriyāḥ yajña niṣkṛtaḥ bṛhat divāḥ adhvarāṇām abhiśriyaḥ
translated: Those who have become strong through the worship of the gods, may they grant us a threefold refuge of peace.🔽The Kshatriyas of firm vows, the performers of sacrifices, the great lights of the sacrifices,

original: agnihotāra ṛtasāpo adruho 'po asṛjannanuvṛtratūrye🔽dyāvāpṛthivī janayannabhi vratāpa oṣadhīrvanināniyajñiyā🔽antarikṣaṃ svarā paprurūtaye vaśaṃ devāsastanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
analyzed: agni hotāraḥ ṛtasāpaḥ adruhaḥ asṛjan anu vṛtratūrye  dyāvāpṛthivī janayan abhi vratā apaḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninā aniyajñiyā  antarikṣam svarā papruḥ ūtaye vaśam devāsaḥ tanvī ni māmṛjuḥ
translated: The Agnihotras, the truthful ones, the guileless ones, have created the waters in the battle against Vritra.🔽Dyaus and Prithivī, begetting the waters, have chosen the sacrificial plants.🔽The gods have spread out the atmosphere for protection, and have arranged the slender heaven.

original: dhartāro diva ṛbhavaḥ suhastā vātāparjanyā mahiṣasyatanyatoḥ
analyzed: dhartāraḥ divaḥ ṛbhavaḥ su hastāḥ vātāparjanyā mahiṣasyatanyatoḥ
translated: The Rbhus, the supporters of heaven, with good hands, Vata, Parjanya, the two thunderers of the bull,

original: āpa oṣadhīḥ pra tirantu no giro bhago rātirvājino yantu me havam
analyzed: āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ pra tirantu naḥ giraḥ bhagaḥ rātiḥ vājinaḥ yantu me havam
translated: May the waters and plants favor our songs; may Bhaga, Rati, and the strong ones come to my call.

original: samudraḥ sindhū rajo antarikṣamaja ekapāt tanayitnurarṇavaḥ
analyzed: samudraḥ sindhuḥ rajaḥ antarikṣam ajaḥ ekapād tanayitnuḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: The ocean, the rivers, the dust of the atmosphere, the one-footed cloud, the roaring abyss,

original: ahirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇavad vacāṃsi me viśve devāsauta sūrayo mama
analyzed: ahirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇavat vacāṃsi me viśve sūrayaḥ mama
translated: May Ahi Budhnya listen to my words; may all the gods, the wise ones, favor me.

original: syāma vo manavo devavītaye prāñcaṃ no yajñaṃ pra ṇayatasādhuyā
analyzed: syāma vaḥ manavaḥ deva vītaye prāñcam naḥ yajñam pra nayata sādhuyā
translated: May we be in your favor, O gods, for the feast; lead our sacrifice forward in the right way.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sudānava imā brahmaśasyamānāni jinvata
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ sudānavaḥ imā brahma śasyamānāni jinvata
translated: O Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, givers of good gifts, quicken these things praised by the Brahman.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā purohita ṛtasya panthāmanvemisādhuyā
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā purohitaḥ ṛtasya panthām anvemi sādhuyā
translated: The divine Hotars, first priests, I follow in the right way the path of truth.

original: kṣetrasya patiṃ prativeśamīmahe viśvān devānamṛtānaprayuchataḥ
analyzed: kṣetrasya patim prativeśam īmahe viśvān devān amṛtān aprayuchataḥ
translated: We pray to the lord of the field, the neighbor, to all the immortal gods who do not forsake.

original: vasiṣṭhāsaḥ pitṛvad vācamakrata devānīḷānā ṛṣivatsvastaye
analyzed: vasiṣṭhāsaḥ pitṛ vat vācam akrata devān īḍānāḥ ṛṣi vat svastaye
translated: The Vasishthas have uttered a speech like a father, calling the gods for welfare like seers.

original: prītā iva jñātayaḥ kāmametyāsme devāso 'vadhūnutā vasu
analyzed: prītāḥ iva jñātayaḥ kāmam etya asme devāsaḥ vadhūnuta vasu
translated: Like pleased relatives who have come for their own sake, O gods, shake out the wealth for us.

original: devān vasiṣṭho amṛtān vavande / / /
analyzed: devān vasiṣṭhaḥ amṛtān vavande
translated: Vasishtha has praised the immortal gods.

original: imāṃ dhiyaṃ saptaśīrṣṇīṃ pitā na ṛtaprajātāṃ bṛhatīmavindat
analyzed: imām dhiyam sapta śīrṣṇīm pitā naḥ ṛta prajātām bṛhatīm avindat
translated: The father found this thought, born of truth, vast, with seven heads.

original: turīyaṃ svijjanayad viśvajanyo 'yāsya ukthamindrāya śaṃsan
analyzed: turīyam svid janayat viśvajanyaḥ yā asyaḥ uktham indrāya śaṃsan
translated: The all-creating one generated the fourth oblation, the hymn, singing it to Indra.

original: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛju dīdhyānā divas putrāso asurasyavīrāḥ
analyzed: ṛtam śaṃsantaḥ ṛju dīdhyānāḥ divaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ
translated: The sons of Dyaus, the Asura's heroes, who think aright, proclaim the truth,

original: vipraṃ padamaṅgiraso dadhānā yajñasya dhāmaprathamaṃ mananta
analyzed: vipram padam aṅgirasaḥ dadhānāḥ yajñasya dhāma prathamam mananta
translated: The Angirases, placing the Brahman in the foremost place, first thought upon the form of sacrifice.

original: haṃsairiva sakhibhirvāvadadbhiraśmanmayāni nahanāvyasyan
analyzed: haṃsaiḥ iva sakhibhiḥ vāvadadbhiḥ aśmanmayāni nahanau asyan
translated: Like swans, with their friends who utter pleasant cries, he burst asunder the stone-built forts of Vyaṣva.

original: bṛhaspatirabhikanikradad gā uta prāstauduccavidvānagāyat
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ abhikanikradat gāḥ uta prāstaut ucca vidvān agāyat
translated: Br̥ihaspati, bellowing at the kine, sang aloud, and, knowing the height, sang forth his song.

original: avo dvābhyāṃ para ekayā gā guhā tiṣṭhantīranṛtasyasetau
analyzed: avas dvābhyām paras ekayā gāḥ guhā tiṣṭhantīḥ anṛtasya setau
translated: He, with two, with one, hath loosed the kine that stood in the cave, on the leash of untruth.

original: bṛhaspatistamasi jyotirichannudusrā ākarvihi tisra āvaḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ tamasi jyotiḥ ichan udusrāḥ ākarvihi tisraḥ āvaḥ
translated: Br̥ihaspati, desiring light in the darkness, hath drawn the three bright Dawns to him.

original: vibhidyā puraṃ śayāthemapācīṃ nistrīṇi sākamudadherakṛntat
analyzed: vibhidya puram śayātha hemapācīm nistrīṇi sākam udadheḥ akṛntat
translated: He cleft the easternmost fort of ŚyāvAśva, and from the ocean rent the three together.

original: bṛhaspatiruṣasaṃ sūryaṃ gāmarkaṃviveda stanayanniva dyauḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ uṣasam sūryam gām arkam viveda stanayan iva dyauḥ
translated: Br̥ihaspati hath found the cow, the sun, the dawn, like Dyaus thundering out his voice.

original: indro valaṃ rakṣitāraṃ dughānāṃ kareṇeva vi cakartāraveṇa
analyzed: indraḥ valam rakṣitāram dughānām kareṇa iva vi cakarta araveṇa
translated: Indra, with his roar, hath cleft Vala, the guardian of the milch-kine, as with a hatchet.

original: svedāñjibhirāśiramichamāno 'rodayat paṇimāgā amuṣṇāt
analyzed: sveda añjibhiḥ āśiram icchamānaḥ rodayat paṇim āgāḥ amuṣṇāt
translated: Seeking the head with drops that glisten like sweat, he hath caused the milch-kine to low and hath milked them.

original: sa īṃ satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhirgodhāyasaṃ vidhanasairadardaḥ
analyzed: saḥ īm satyebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ śucadbhiḥ godhāyasam vidhanasaiḥ adardar
translated: He, with his true, bright friends, with those who carry loads, hath cleft the mountain of the Ghodhas.

original: brahmaṇas patirvṛṣabhirvarāhairgharmasvedebhirdraviṇaṃ vyānaṭ
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ vṛṣabhiḥ varāhaiḥ gharma svedebhiḥ draviṇam vyānaṭ
translated: Br̥ihaspati, with the strong, with the boars that sweat with heat, hath scattered wealth.

original: te satyena manasā gopatiṃ gā iyānāsa iṣaṇayantadhībhiḥ
analyzed: te satyena manasā go patim gāḥ iyānāsaḥ iṣaṇayanta dhībhiḥ
translated: with truthful mind they have approached the lord of the cows, they have urged him with their thoughts

original: bṛhaspatirmithoavadyapebhirudusriyā asṛjatasvayugbhiḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ mithoavadyapebhiḥ udusriyāḥ asṛjata svayugbhiḥ
translated: bṛhaspati with those that are his own companions, free from mutual blame, has created the bright cows

original: taṃ vardhayanto matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃ
analyzed: tam vardhayantaḥ matibhiḥ śivābhiḥ siṃ
translated: exalting him with auspicious thoughts, they

original: amiva nānadataṃsadhasthe
analyzed: am iva nānadatam sadhasthe
translated: roar like lions in the assembly

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ śūrasātau bharebhare anumadema jiṣṇum
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛṣaṇam śūrasātau bharebhare anumadema jiṣṇum
translated: in the winning of the hero let us rejoice in bṛhaspati the mighty in every battle

original: yadā vājamasanad viśvarūpamā dyāmarukṣaduttarāṇisadma
analyzed: yadā vājam asanat viśva rūpam ā dyām arukṣat uttarāṇi sadma
translated: when he hath mounted the steed of every form and hath ascended the abode of the highest heaven

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vardhayanto nānā santobibhrato jyotirāsā
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vṛṣaṇam vardhayantaḥ nānā santaḥ bibhrataḥ jyotiḥ āsā
translated: exalting bṛhaspati the mighty, bearing light though they be many, yet are they one

original: satyāmāśiṣaṃ kṛṇutā vayodhai kīriṃ cid dhyavathasvebhirevaiḥ
analyzed: satyām āśiṣam kṛṇutā vayodhai kīrim cit hi avathasva ebhiḥ evaiḥ
translated: make ye true the benediction that we may live long, help ye even the poor man with your own help

original: paścā mṛdho apa bhavantu viśvāstadrodasī śṛṇutaṃ viśvaminve
analyzed: paścā mṛdhaḥ apa bhavantu viśvāḥ tat rodasī śṛṇutam viśvaminve
translated: let all the enemies be behind us let the two worldhalves hear this which all must mark

original: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vi mūrdhānamabhinadarbudasya
analyzed: indraḥ mahnā mahataḥ arṇavasya vi mūrdhānam abhinat arbudasya
translated: bṛhaspati with his greatness hath cleft the head of the mighty demon of the deep

original: ahannahimariṇāt sapta sindhūn devairdyāvāpṛthivīprāvataṃ naḥ🔽udapruto na vayo rakṣamāṇā vāvadato abhriyasyeva ghoṣāḥ
analyzed: ahan ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn devaiḥ dyāvāpṛthivī prāvatam naḥ  uda prutaḥ na vayaḥ rakṣamāṇāḥ vāvadataḥ abhriyasya iva ghoṣāḥ
translated: he hath slain ahi and let loose the seven rivers heaven and earth with the gods have helped us🔽like birds flying up to the sky their voices are like the roar of the raincloud

original: giribhrajo normayo madanto bṛhaspatimabhyarkā anāvan
analyzed: giri bhrajaḥ na ūrmayaḥ madantaḥ bṛhaspatim abhi arkāḥ anāvan
translated: like the waves of a mountain stream rejoicing the hymns have sung forth to bṛhaspati

original: saṃ gobhirāṅgiraso nakṣamāṇo bhaga ivedaryamaṇaṃnināya
analyzed: sam gobhiḥ āṅgirasaḥ nakṣamāṇaḥ bhagaḥ iva idam aryamaṇaṃnināya
translated: Angiras, seeking with the cows, brought Yama hither like Bhaga,

original: jane mitro na dampatī anakti bṛhaspatevājayāśūnrivājau
analyzed: jane mitraḥ na dampatī anakti bṛhaspatiḥ iva ajayā āśūn iva ājau
translated: like Mitra he anoints the two spouses among the people, like Brhaspati the horses in the race.

original: sādhvaryā atithinīriṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāanavadyarūpāḥ
analyzed: sādhvaryāḥ atithinīḥ iṣirā spārhāḥ suvarṇāḥ anavadya rūpāḥ
translated: The excellent guests, the sages, the desirable, of beautiful form, irreproachable,

original: bṛhaspatiḥ parvate bhyo vitūryā nirgāūpe yavamiva sthivibhyaḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ parvate vitūrya nirgāūpe yavam iva sthivibhyaḥ
translated: Brhaspati, having burst open the mountains, brought forth the cows from the stall like barley from the husks.

original: āpruṣāyan madhuna ṛtasya yonimavakṣipannarka ulkāmivadyoḥ
analyzed: āpruṣāyan madhunaḥ ṛtasya yonim avakṣipan arkaḥ ulkām iva yos
translated: The honey-sweet source of truth, the sun, has poured down the lightning from the sky, like a spark from the fire.

original: bṛhaspatiruddharannaśmano gā bhūmyā udneva vitvacaṃ bibheda
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ uddharan aśmanaḥ gāḥ bhūmyāḥ udnā iva vitvacam bibheda
translated: Brhaspati, having torn open the cow-stall of the rock, cleft the earth as with a flood, like a skin.

original: apa jyotiṣā tamo antarikṣādudnaḥ śīpālamiva vātaājat🔽bṛhaspatiranumṛśyā valasyābhramiva vāta ā cakraā gāḥ
analyzed: apa jyotiṣā tamaḥ antarikṣāt udnaḥ śīpālam iva vāta ājat  bṛhaspatiḥ anumṛśya valasya abhram iva vātaḥ ā gāḥ
translated: The light has driven away the darkness from the atmosphere, as the wind drives away the mist.🔽Brhaspati, having crushed the cow-stall of the Vala, brought forth the cows, as the wind drives away the clouds.

original: yadā valasya pīyato jasuṃ bhed bṛhaspatiragnitapobhirarkaiḥ
analyzed: yadā valasya pīyataḥ jasum bhet bṛhaspatiḥ agni tapobhiḥ arkaiḥ
translated: When Brhaspati with his flames and songs burst open the strong drink of the Vala,

original: dadbhirna jihvā pariviṣṭamādadāvirnidhīnrakṛṇodusriyāṇām
analyzed: dadbhiḥ na jihvā pariviṣṭam ādada āvis nidhīn rakṛṇot usriyāṇām
translated: he took away what was enclosed by the teeth, as if by the tongue, and opened the doors of the stalls of the cows.

original: bṛhaspatiramata hi tyadāsāṃ nāma svarīṇāṃ sadaneguhā yat
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ amata hi tyadāsām nāma svarīṇām sadaneguhā yat
translated: Brhaspati has found the name of these, the sounds, which was hidden in the house of the Vala,

original: āṇḍeva bhittvā śakunasya garbhamudusriyāḥparvatasya tmanājat
analyzed: āṇḍā iva bhittvā śakunasya garbham udusriyāḥ parvatasya tmanā ajat
translated: as if breaking open the egg of a bird, he brought forth the cow from the mountain by his own power.

original: aśnāpinaddhaṃ madhu paryapaśyan matsyaṃ na dīna udanikṣiyantam
analyzed: aśnā apinaddham madhu paryapaśyat matsyam na dīnaḥ udanikṣiyantam
translated: They saw the honey covered over with a lid, like a fish in the deep water.

original: niṣ ṭajjabhāra camasaṃ na vṛkṣādbṛhaspatirviraveṇā vikṛtya
analyzed: niḥ tat jabhāra camasam na vṛkṣāt bṛhaspatiḥ viraveṇa vikṛtya
translated: He burst open the pot like a tree with his roar, like Brihaspati.

original: soṣāmavindat sa svaḥ so agniṃ so arkeṇa vi babādhetamāṃsi
analyzed: sa uṣām avindat sa svar saḥ agnim saḥ arkeṇa vi babādhe tamāṃsi
translated: He found the light, the heaven, the fire. With his light he dispelled the darkness.

original: bṛhaspatirgovapuṣo valasya nirmajjānaṃ naparvaṇo jabhāra
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ go vapuṣaḥ valasya nirmajjānam na parvaṇaḥ jabhāra
translated: Brihaspati brought forth the marrow of the mountain in the form of a cow, like a joint.

original: himeva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinākṛpayad valo gāḥ
analyzed: himā iva parṇā muṣitā vanāni bṛhaspatinā akṛpayat valaḥ gāḥ
translated: Like leaves stripped off by frost the woods, Brihaspati made the mountain yield the cows.

original: anānukṛtyamapunaścakāra yāt sūryāmāsā mithauccarātaḥ🔽abhi śyāvaṃ na kṛśanebhiraśvaṃ nakṣatrebhiḥ pitarodyāmapiṃśan
analyzed: anānukṛtyam apunar cakāra yāt sūryāmāsā  abhi śyāvam na kṛśanebhiḥ aśvam nakṣatrebhiḥ pitaraḥ udyām apiṃśan
translated: He made it without return, without recompense, that the sun and moon may rise together.🔽The fathers adorned the dark horse with the stars, as with reins, in the sky.

original: rātryāṃ tamo adadhurjyotirahanbṛhaspatirbhinadadriṃ vidad gāḥ
analyzed: rātryām tamaḥ adadhuḥ jyotiḥ ahan bṛhaspatiḥ bhinat adrim vidat gāḥ
translated: They placed darkness in the night and light in the day. Brihaspati cleft the mountain and found the cows.

original: idamakarma namo abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīranvānonavīti
analyzed: idam akarma namaḥ abhriyāya yaḥ pūrvīḥ anvānonavīti
translated: This is the homage to the cloud, which follows the ancient ones.

original: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ so aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sanṛbhirno vayo dhāt
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ sa hi gobhiḥ saḥ aśvaiḥ sa vīrebhiḥ sa nṛbhiḥ naḥ vayaḥ dhāt
translated: Brihaspati, for he is with the cows, with the horses, with the heroes, with the men, may he bestow life upon us.

original: bhadrā agnervadhryaśvasya sandṛśo vāmī praṇītiḥsuraṇā upetayaḥ
analyzed: bhadrāḥ agneḥ vadhryaśvasya sandṛśaḥ vāmī praṇītiḥ suraṇāḥ upetayaḥ
translated: The appearances of Agni, the son of Vadhrysoma, are auspicious. The bringing forward is lovely, the praises are delightful.

original: yadīṃ sumitrā viśo agra indhateghṛtenāhuto jarate davidyutat
analyzed: yadi īm sumitrāḥ viśaḥ agre indhate ghṛtena āhutaḥ jarate davidyutat
translated: When the people, his good friends, kindle him at the beginning, offered with ghee, he shines, blazing

original: ghṛtamagnervadhryaśvasya vardhanaṃ ghṛtamannaṃ ghṛtaṃ vasya medanam
analyzed: ghṛtam agneḥ vadhryaśvasya vardhanam ghṛtam annam ghṛtam vasyaḥ medanam
translated: Ghee is the strengthener of Agni, the son of Vr̥ishākapi, ghee is food, ghee is the balm of my body

original: ghṛtenāhuta urviyā vi paprathe sūrya ivarocate sarpirāsutiḥ
analyzed: ghṛtena āhutaḥ urviyā vi paprathe sūryaḥ iva rocate sarpiḥ āsutiḥ
translated: Offered with ghee, he spreads out in his own way, he shines like the sun, supported by ghee

original: yat te manuryadanīkaṃ sumitraḥ samīdhe agne tadidaṃnavīyaḥ
analyzed: yat te manuḥ yat anīkam sumitraḥ samīdhe agne tat idam navīyaḥ
translated: What, O Manu, what, O good friend, is your form, O Agni, that is now new

original: sa revacchoca sa giro juṣasva sa vājaṃ darṣisa iha śravo dhāḥ
analyzed: sa revat śoca sa giraḥ juṣasva sa vājam darṣi saḥ iha śravaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Shine forth, O rich one, accept the songs, win strength here, bestow glory

original: yaṃ tvā pūrvamīḷito vadhryaśvaḥ samīdhe agne sa idaṃjuṣasva
analyzed: yam tvā pūrvam īḍitaḥ vadhryaśvaḥ samīdhe agne saḥ idam juṣasva
translated: Whom you, Vr̥ishākapi, have formerly kindled, O Agni, accept this now

original: sa na stipā uta bhavā tanūpā dātraṃ rakṣasvayadidaṃ te asme
analyzed: sa na stipāḥ uta bhavā tanū pāḥ dātram rakṣasva ayat idam te asme
translated: Be a protector of our goods, and a protector of our bodies, guard the gift which is here to us

original: bhavā dyumnī vādhryaśvota gopā mā tvā tārīdabhimātirjanānām
analyzed: bhava dyumnī vādhryaśva uta gopāḥ mā tvā tārīt abhimātiḥ janānām
translated: Be glorious, O Vr̥ishākapi, and a guardian, let the hatred of men not overcome you

original: śūra iva dhṛṣṇuścyavanaḥ sumitraḥ pra nuvocaṃ vādhryaśvasya nāma
analyzed: śūraḥ iva dhṛṣṇuḥ cyavanaḥ sumitraḥ pra nuvocam vādhryaśvasya nāma
translated: Like a bold hero, O bold one, O good friend, I proclaim the name of Vr̥ishākapi

original: samajryā parvatyā vasūni dāsā vṛtrāṇyāryā jigetha
analyzed: samajryā parvatyā vasūni dāsā vṛtrāṇi āryā jigetha
translated: With the help of the mountain, O noble one, you have conquered the treasures, the Vr̥itras, O noble one

original: śūra iva dhṛṣṇuścyavano janānāṃ tvamagne pṛtanāyūnrabhi ṣyāḥ
analyzed: śūraḥ iva dhṛṣṇuḥ cyavanaḥ janānām tvam agne pṛtanāyūn abhi syāḥ
translated: Like a bold hero, O bold one, among men, O Agni, you must conquer the warriors

original: dīrghatanturbṛhadukṣāyamagniḥ sahasrastarīḥ śatanīthaṛbhvā
analyzed: dīrgha tantuḥ bṛhat ukṣā ayam agniḥ sahasra starīḥ śata nītha ṛbhvā
translated: The long-fibred, greatly nourishing, wide-ruling Agni, with a thousand layers, a hundred-powered, mighty,

original: dyumān dyumatsu nṛbhirmṛjyamānaḥ sumitreṣu dīdayodevayatsu
analyzed: dyumān dyumatsu nṛbhiḥ mṛjyamānaḥ sumitreṣu dīdayaḥ udevayatsu
translated: Shining among the radiant men, being cleansed, shine among the well-disposed, the pious.

original: tve dhenuḥ sudughā jātavedo 'saścateva samanā sabardhuk
analyzed: tve dhenuḥ su dughā jātavedaḥ saścatā iva samanā sabarduh
translated: In you, O all-knower, the well-milking cow, like an unfailing one, is fully laden.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhirdakṣiṇāvadbhiragne sumitrebhiridhyasedevayadbhiḥ
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ dakṣiṇāvadbhiḥ agne sumitrebhiḥ idhyase devayadbhiḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are kindled by men who have gifts to give, by well-disposed, pious ones.

original: devāścit te amṛtā jātavedo mahimānaṃ vādhryaśva pra vocan
analyzed: devāḥ cit te amṛtāḥ jātavedaḥ mahimānam vādhryaśva pra vocan
translated: Even the immortal gods, O all-knower, O son of Vadhryaṣva, have proclaimed your greatness,

original: yat sampṛchaṃ mānuṣīrviśa āyan tvaṃ nṛbhirajayastvāvṛdhebhiḥ
analyzed: yat sampṛccham mānuṣīḥ viśaḥ āyan tvam nṛbhiḥ ajayaḥ tvāvṛdhebhiḥ
translated: When they came to the human clans, asking for you, you were conquered by men who have grown strong.🔽Like a father, he has borne his son in his lap, Vadhryaṣva has served you, O Agni,

original: piteva putramabibharupasthe tvāmagne vadhryaśvaḥ saparyanjuṣāṇo asya samidhaṃ yaviṣṭhota pūrvānavanorvrādhataścit
analyzed: pitā iva putram abibhar upasthe tvām agne vadhryaśvaḥ saparyan juṣāṇaḥ asya samidham yaviṣṭha uta pūrvān avanoḥ vrādhataḥ cit
translated: Accepting his fuel, O youngest, he has overcome even the former enemies.

original: śaśvadagnirvadhryaśvasya śātrūn nṛbhirjigāyasutasomavadbhiḥ
analyzed: śaśvat agniḥ vadhryaśvasya śātrūn nṛbhiḥ jigāya suta somavadbhiḥ
translated: Agni has always conquered the enemies of Vadhryaṣva, with men who have offered Soma.

original: samanaṃ cidadahaścitrabhāno 'vavrādhantamabhinad vṛdhaścit
analyzed: samanam cit adahaḥ citrabhāno vavrādhantam abhinat vṛdhaḥ cit
translated: Even the equal one, the brightly shining one, has overcome the one who was to be overcome, the one who was to be strengthened.

original: ayamagnirvadhryaśvasya vṛtrahā sanakāt preddhonamasopavākyaḥ
analyzed: ayam agniḥ vadhryaśvasya vṛtrahā sanakāt preddhaḥ namasā upavākyaḥ
translated: This Agni of Vadhryaṣva is the slayer of Vrtra, kindled from ancient times, worthy of worship.

original: sa no ajāmīnruta vā vijāmīnabhitiṣṭha śardhato vādhryaśva
analyzed: sa naḥ ajāmīn ruta vā vijāmīn abhitiṣṭha śardhataḥ vādhryaśva
translated: O Agni, stand thou up for us, O horse of the waters, for the Ajâs or the Vijâs, or for the impetuous ones

original: imāṃ me agne samidhaṃ juṣasveḷas pade prati haryāghṛtācīm
analyzed: imām me agne samidham juṣasva iḍaḥ pade prati harya a ghṛtācīm
translated: Accept, O Agni, this my fuel, in the place of the flame, the oil-fed (oblation) bear to the gods

original: varṣman pṛthivyāḥ sudinatve ahnāmūrdhvobhava sukrato devayajyā
analyzed: varṣman pṛthivyāḥ su dina tve ahnām ūrdhvaḥ bhava su krato deva yajyā
translated: On the back of the earth, for the fair day, rise up, O wise one, to the worship of the gods

original: ā devānāmagrayāveha yātu narāśaṃso viśvarūpebhiraśvaiḥ
analyzed: ā devānām agra yāvā iha yātu narāśaṃsaḥ viśva rūpebhiḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: Let Narâṣansa come hither on the path of the gods, on the path of holy order, with his all-formed horses

original: ṛtasya pathā namasā miyedho devebhyo devatamaḥsuṣūdat
analyzed: ṛtasya pathā namasā miyedhaḥ devebhyaḥ devatamaḥ suṣūdat
translated: By the path of holy order, with reverence, with the most acceptable offering, he has purified himself for the gods

original: śaśvattamamīḷate dūtyāya haviṣmanto manuṣyāso agnim
analyzed: śaśvattamam īḍate dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ manuṣyāsaḥ agnim
translated: Most constantly, for the office of messenger, men who bring oblations have kindled Agni

original: vahiṣṭhairaśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathenā devān vakṣi niṣadeha hotā
analyzed: vahiṣṭhaiḥ aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena devān vakṣi niṣadā iha hotā
translated: With the most distant horses, on a well-yoked car, bear the gods to their seat, O priest

original: vi prathatāṃ devajuṣṭaṃ tiraścā dīrghaṃ drāghmāsurabhi bhūtvasme
analyzed: vi prathatām deva juṣṭam tiraścā dīrgham bhūtvā asme
translated: Let it spread out, divine, across and along, and be long, O thou of long life, and fragrant for us

original: aheḷatā manasā deva barhirindrajyeṣṭhānuśato yakṣi devān
analyzed: a heḍatā manasā deva barhiḥ indra jyeṣṭha anuśataḥ yakṣi devān
translated: With a mind free from anger, O god, worship the grass, O thou who art to be worshipped by Indra, worship the gods

original: divo vā sānu spṛśatā varīyaḥ pṛthivyā vā mātrayā viśrayadhvam
analyzed: divaḥ vā sānu spṛśata varīyaḥ pṛthivyāḥ vā mātrayā viśrayadhvam
translated: Touch the farther ridge of heaven, or rest you on the measure of the earth

original: uśatīrdvāro mahinā mahadbhirdevaṃ rathaṃrathayurdhārayadhvam
analyzed: uśatīḥ dvāraḥ mahinā mahadbhiḥ devam ratham rathayuḥ dhārayadhvam
translated: Ye doors, that love (the gods), with the great ones, with the most distant (horses), bear the divine chariot, O chariot-loving ones

original: devī divo duhitarā suśilpe uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ niyonau
analyzed: devī divaḥ duhitarā su śilpe uṣāsānaktā sadatām niyonau
translated: Ye two divine daughters of heaven, of fair forms, O Dawn and Night, sit in the place of sacrifice

original: ā vāṃ devāsa uśatī uśanta urau sīdantu subhageupasthe
analyzed: ā vām devāsaḥ uśatī uśantaḥ urau sīdantu subhageupasthe
translated: May your eager worshippers, O ye Deities, sit in your most blessed lap.

original: ūrdhvo grāvā bṛhadagniḥ samiddhaḥ priyā dhāmānyaditerupasthe
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ grāvā bṛhat agniḥ samiddhaḥ priyā dhāmāni aditeḥ upasthe
translated: The lofty stone, the great Agni when enkindled, in the dear abode of Aditi.

original: purohitāv ṛtvijā yajñe asmin viduṣṭarādraviṇamā yajethām
analyzed: purohitau ṛtvijā yajñe asmin viduṣṭarā a draviṇamā yajethām
translated: As chief priests at this sacrifice, ye who are most skilled, offer to us wealth.

original: tisro devīrbarhiridaṃ varīya ā sīdata cakṛmā vaḥsyonam
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ idam varīyaḥ ā sīdata cakṛma vaḥ syonam
translated: O ye three goddesses, sit on this most spacious strew: we have made it pleasant for you.

original: manuṣvad yajñaṃ sudhitā havīṃṣīḷā devīghṛtapadī juṣanta
analyzed: manuṣvat yajñam sudhitā havīṃṣi iḷā devī ghṛtapadī juṣanta
translated: Accept the sacrifice after the manner of Manu, the well-ordered oblations, O goddess Ghrtpadi.

original: deva tvaṣṭaryad dha cārutvamānaḍ yadaṅgirasāmabhavaḥ sacābhūḥ
analyzed: deva tvaṣṭar yat ha cāru tvam ānaṭ yat aṅgirasām abhavaḥ sacābhūḥ
translated: O god Tvastr, whatever beauty thou hast added, whatever thou hast become in common with the Angirases,

original: sa devānāṃ pātha upa pra vidvānuśan yakṣi draviṇodaḥ suratnaḥ
analyzed: sa devānām pāthaḥ upa pra vidvān uśan yakṣi draviṇaḥ daḥ su ratnaḥ
translated: Go thou, knowing the way of the gods, as a giver of wealth, rich in treasures, to the sacrifice.

original: vanaspate raśanayā niyūyā devānāṃ pātha upa vakṣividvān
analyzed: vanaspate raśanayā niyūya devānām pāthaḥ upa vakṣi vidvān
translated: O lord of the forest, lead them with the rope, knowing the way, to the place of the gods.

original: svadāti devaḥ kṛṇavad dhavīṃṣyavatāndyāvāpṛthivī havaṃ me🔽āgne vaha varuṇamiṣṭaye na indraṃ divo marutoantarikṣāt
analyzed: svadāti devaḥ kṛṇavat havīṃṣi avatān dyāvāpṛthivī havam me  ā agne vaha varuṇam iṣṭaye naḥ indram divaḥ marutaḥ antarikṣāt
translated: The god shall taste, shall make ready the oblations: may Dyaus and Prithivī accept my call.🔽O Agni, bring hither Varuṇa for our worship, Indra from heaven, the Maruts from the atmosphere.

original: sīdantu barhirviśva ā yajatrāḥ svāhādevā amṛtā mādayantām
analyzed: sīdantu barhiḥ viśve ā yajatrāḥ svāhā devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām
translated: Let all the invoked gods sit on the strew: Hail! let the immortal gods rejoice.

original: bṛhaspate prathamaṃ vāco agraṃ yat prairata nāmadheyandadhānāḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspate prathamam vācaḥ agram yat prairata nāmadheyan dadhānāḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, the first, the foremost of utterances, which they set in motion, bestowing names,

original: yadeṣāṃ śreṣṭhaṃ yadaripramāsītpreṇā tadeṣāṃ nihitaṃ guhāviḥ
analyzed: yat eṣām śreṣṭham yat aripram āsīt preṇā tat eṣām nihitam guhā āvis
translated: What is their best, what is their most excellent, what is their most secret,

original: saktumivatitaunā punanto yatra dhīrā manasā vācamakrata🔽atrā sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadraiṣāṃlakṣmīrnihitādhi vāci
analyzed: saktum iva titaunā punantaḥ yatra dhīrāḥ manasā vācam akrata  atra sakhāyaḥ sakhyāni jānate bhadrā eṣām lakṣmīḥ nihitā adhi vāci
translated: Purifying them as with a sieve, where the wise have made their speech with mind,🔽Here the friends know their friendships, their auspicious glory is laid up in their speech.

original: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyamāyan tāmanvavindannṛṣiṣupraviṣṭām
analyzed: yajñena vācaḥ padavīyam āyan tām anvavindan ṛṣi ṣu praviṣṭām
translated: By sacrifice they have attained the path of speech, they have found it again, entered into the Rishis.

original: tāmābhṛtyā vyadadhuḥ purutrā tāṃ saptarebhā abhi saṃ navante
analyzed: tām ābhṛtyāḥ vyadadhuḥ purutrā tām sapta rebhāḥ abhi sam navante
translated: Having brought it, they have established it in many places, the seven priests sing over it.

original: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācamuta tvaḥ śṛṇvan naśṛṇotyenām🔽uto tvasmai tanvaṃ vi sasre jāyeva patyauśatī suvāsāḥ
analyzed: uta tvaḥ paśyan na dadarśa vācam uta tvaḥ śṛṇvan na śṛṇoti enām  uta u tvasmai tanvam vi sasre jāyā iva patyau śatī su vāsāḥ
translated: And some, beholding, have not seen speech, and some, hearing, have not heard it.

original: uta tvaṃ sakhye sthirapītamāhurnainaṃ hinvantyapivājineṣu
analyzed: uta tvam sakhye sthira pītam āhuḥ na enam hinvanti api vājineṣu
translated: And some, for friendship, have stretched out their bodies to it, like a wife in love with her husband, well-dressed.🔽And some call it to be drunk by the firm-seated, they do not urge it on in the races.

original: adhenvā carati māyayaiṣa vācaṃ śuśruvānaphalāmapuṣpām
analyzed: a dhenvā carati māyayā eṣa vācam śuśruvān aphalām apuṣpām
translated: He wanders with the cow by his magic power, he has heard speech fruitless and flowerless.

original: yastityāja sacividaṃ sakhāyaṃ na tasya vācyapi bhāgoasti
analyzed: yaḥ tityāja sacividam sakhāyam na tasya vāci api
translated: He who has abandoned the faithful friend, for him there is not even a share in speech.

original: yadīṃ śṛṇotyalakaṃ śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasyapanthām
analyzed: yadi īm śṛṇoti alakam śṛṇoti nahi praveda sukṛtasya panthām
translated: If he hears it, he hears it as if it were not, for he does not know the path of the well-done.

original: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyo manojaveṣvasamābabhūvuḥ
analyzed: akṣaṇvantaḥ karṇavantaḥ sakhāyaḥ manojaveṣu a samābabhūvuḥ
translated: The friends, with eyes and ears, have not been equal in the swiftness of thought.

original: ādaghnāsa upakakṣāsa u tve hradā iva snātvā utve dadṛśre
analyzed: ādaghnāsaḥ upakakṣāsaḥ u tve hradāḥ iva snātvā utve dadṛśre
translated: The waters, up to the armpits, have seen thee, as in lakes, O thou who art to be bathed in.

original: hṛdā taṣṭeṣu manaso javeṣu yad brāhmaṇāḥ saṃyajantesakhāyaḥ
analyzed: hṛdā taṣṭeṣu manasaḥ javeṣu yat brāhmaṇāḥ saṃyajante sakhāyaḥ
translated: When the Brahmans, friends, join together in the swift movements of the mind, fashioned by the heart,

original: atrāha tvaṃ vi jahurvedyābhirohabrahmāṇo vicarantyu tve
analyzed: atra aha tvam vi jahuḥ vedyā abhiroha brahmāṇaḥ vicaranti u tve
translated: Here they have left thee, O Veda, the priests who ascend the sacrificial altar move about thee.

original: ime ye nārvāṃ na paraścaranti na brāhmaṇāso nasutekarāsaḥ
analyzed: ime ye na arvām na paras caranti na brāhmaṇāsaḥ na sutekarāsaḥ
translated: These who do not go far or near, who are not Brahmans, who do not perform sacrifices,

original: ta ete vācamabhipadya pāpayā sirīstantraṃ tanvate aprajajñayaḥ
analyzed: te ete vācam abhipadya pāpayā sirīḥ tantram tanvate a prajajñayaḥ
translated: These, having seized upon speech with evil intent, weave a web, not knowing offspring.

original: sarve nandanti yaśasāgatena sabhāsāhena sakhyā sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: sarve nandanti yaśasā āgatena sabhāsāhena sakhyā sakhāyaḥ
translated: All friends rejoice in the fame that has come, in the conquest of the assembly, in the friend.

original: kilbiṣaspṛt pituṣaṇirhyeṣāmaraṃ hito bhavativājināya
analyzed: kilbiṣa spṛt pituṣaṇiḥ hi eṣā amaram hitaḥ bhavati vājināya
translated: For they have a remover of sin, a purifier of the father, who is set free for the sake of strength.

original: ṛcāṃ tvaḥ poṣamāste pupuṣvān gāyatraṃ tvo gāyatiśakvarīṣu
analyzed: ṛcām tvaḥ poṣam āste pupuṣvān gāyatram tvaḥ gāyati śakvarīṣu
translated: The nourisher dwells in the nourishment of the Ṛc verses, the Gāyatrī praises thee among the Śakvari verses.

original: brahmā tvo vadati jātavidyāṃ yajñasyamātrāṃ vi mimīta u tvaḥ
analyzed: brahmā tvaḥ vadati jāta vidyām yajñasyamātrām vi mimīte u tvaḥ
translated: The Brahman priest speaks to thee the knowledge of the born, he measures out the extent of the sacrifice for thee.

original: devānāṃ nu vayaṃ jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā
analyzed: devānām nu vayam jānā pra vocāma vipanyayā
translated: We will proclaim to the gods, O Jāna, with our hymn,

original: uktheṣuśasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyāduttare yuge
analyzed: uktheṣu śasyamāneṣu yaḥ paśyāt uttare yuge
translated: He who sees in the following age, when the hymns are being praised,

original: brahmaṇas patiretā saṃ karmāra ivādhamat
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ etā sam karmāraḥ iva adhamat
translated: Brahmanaspati has beaten them out like a smith,

original: devānāmpūrvye yuge 'sataḥ sadajāyata
analyzed: devānām pūrvye yuge sataḥ sat ajāyata
translated: In the former age of the gods, the existent was born from the non-existent.

original: devānāṃ yuge prathame 'sataḥ sadajāyata🔽tadāśā anvajāyanta taduttānapadas pari
analyzed: devānām yuge prathame sataḥ sat ajāyata  tad āśāḥ anvajāyanta tat uttāna padaḥ pari
translated: In the first age of the gods, being was born from non-being.🔽Then the directions were born, then Uttanapada all around.

original: bhūrjajña uttānapado bhuva āśā ajāyanta🔽aditerdakṣoajāyata dakṣād vaditiḥ pari
analyzed: bhūrja jñaḥ uttānapadaḥ bhuvaḥ āśāḥ ajāyanta  aditeḥ dakṣaḥ ajāyata dakṣāt vaditiḥ pari
translated: Bhū was born, Uttanapada, the directions were born.🔽From Aditi Daksha was born, from Daksha Vāḍi was born.

original: aditirhyajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava🔽tāṃ devāanvajāyanta bhadrā amṛtabandhavaḥ
analyzed: aditiḥ hi ajaniṣṭa dakṣa yā duhitā tava  tām devāḥ anvajāyanta bhadrāḥ amṛta bandhavaḥ
translated: For Aditi was born, O Daksha, she who is your daughter.🔽The gods were born after her, the auspicious ones, the friends of immortality.

original: yad devā adaḥ salile susaṃrabdhā atiṣṭhata
analyzed: yat devāḥ adaḥ salile su saṃrabdhāḥ atiṣṭhata
translated: When the gods stood in the waters here, very angry,

original: atrā vonṛtyatāmiva tīvro reṇurapāyata
analyzed: atrā vaḥ nṛtyatām iva tīvraḥ reṇuḥ apāyata
translated: Here the violent dust went away, as if they were dancing.

original: yad devā yatayo yathā bhuvanānyapinvata
analyzed: yat devāḥ yatayaḥ yathā bhuvanāni apinvata
translated: When the gods, like ascetics, expanded the worlds,

original: atrā samudraā gūḷamā sūryamajabhartana
analyzed: atra samudraāḥ gūḷam ā sūryam ajabhartana
translated: Here they supported the sun, the ball in the ocean.

original: aṣṭau putrāso aditerye jātāstanvas pari
analyzed: aṣṭau putrāsaḥ aditeḥ ye jātāḥ tanvaḥ pari
translated: The eight sons of Aditi, who were born around her body,

original: devānupaprait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍamāsyat
analyzed: devān upaprait saptabhiḥ parā mārtāṇḍam āsyat
translated: Followed the gods with seven (sons), she sent Mārtāṇḍa away with seven.

original: saptabhiḥ putrairaditirupa prait pūrvyaṃ yugam
analyzed: saptabhiḥ putraiḥ aditiḥ upa prait pūrvyam yugam
translated: With seven sons Aditi followed the first age,

original: prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punarmārtāṇḍamābharat
analyzed: prajāyai mṛtyave tvat punar mārtāṇḍam ābharat
translated: For the sake of offspring, from you she again brought Mārtāṇḍa to death.

original: janiṣthā ugraḥ sahase turāya mandra ojiṣṭhobahulābhimānaḥ
analyzed: janiṣthāḥ ugraḥ sahase turāya mandraḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ bahula abhimānaḥ
translated: The fierce one for strength and speed, the joyful one, the most powerful, with abundant power,

original: avardhannindraṃ marutaścidatra mātāyad vīraṃ dadhanad dhaniṣṭhā
analyzed: avardhan indram marutaḥ cit atra mātāyat vīram dadhanat dhaniṣṭhā
translated: The Maruts here increased Indra, when the firm mother gave birth to the hero.

original: druho niṣattā pṛśanī cidevaiḥ purū śaṃsena vāvṛdhuṣṭa indram
analyzed: druhaḥ niṣattā pṛśanī cit evaiḥ purū śaṃsena vāvṛdhuṣṭaḥ indram
translated: Even the deceitful one, seated on the tree, has grown great by many praises, O Indra.

original: abhīvṛteva tā mahāpadena dhvāntāt prapitvādudaranta garbhāḥ
analyzed: abhīvṛtā iva tāḥ mahā padena dhvāntāt prapitvāt udaranta garbhāḥ
translated: As if covered by a great calamity, the embryos have come forth from the womb, from the darkness.

original: ṛṣvā te pādā pra yajjigāsyavardhan vājā uta ye cidatra
analyzed: ṛṣvā te pādā pra yat jigāsya avardhan vājāḥ uta ye cit atra
translated: Thy lofty feet, O Indra, have grown great, and the mighty powers that are here.

original: tvamindra sālāvṛkān sahasramāsan dadhiṣe aśvināvavṛtyāḥ
analyzed: tvam indra sālāvṛkān sahasram āsan dadhiṣe aśvinau avṛtyāḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast placed a thousand wolves in the jaws of the two Asvins, to be turned back.

original: samanā tūrṇirupa yāsi yajñamā nāsatyā sakhyāyavakṣi
analyzed: samanā tūrṇiḥ upa yāsi yajñamā nāsatyā sakhyāya vakṣi
translated: With the two Nāsatyas thou goest quickly to the sacrifice, to be entreated for friendship.

original: vasāvyāmindra dhārayaḥ sahasrāśvinā śūra dadaturmaghāni
analyzed: vasāvyām indra dhārayaḥ sahasrā aśvinā śūra dadatuḥ maghāni
translated: O Indra, the two Asvins have given the Vasavya-worthy thousands of treasures, O hero.

original: mandamāna ṛtādadhi prajāyai sakhibhirindra iṣirebhirartham
analyzed: mandamānaḥ ṛtāt adhi prajāyai sakhibhiḥ indraḥ iṣirebhiḥ artham
translated: Rejoicing in the truth, for offspring, with friends who strive, Indra seeks wealth.

original: ābhirhi māyā upa dasyumāgān mihaḥ pratamrā avapat tamāṃsi
analyzed: ābhiḥ hi māyāḥ upa dasyum āgāt mihaḥ pratamrāḥ avapat tamāṃsi
translated: For with these illusions he came to the Dasyu, and the red mists have cast down the darkness.

original: sanāmānā cid dhvasayo nyasmā avāhannindra uṣasoyathānaḥ ṛṣvairagachaḥ sakhibhirnikāmaiḥ sākampratiṣṭhā hṛdyā jaghantha
analyzed: sanāmānā cit dhvasayaḥ ni asmai avāhan indraḥ uṣasaḥ yathā anaḥ ṛṣvaiḥ agachaḥ sakhibhiḥ nikāmaiḥ sākampratiṣṭhāḥ hṛdyāḥ jaghantha
translated: Even the well-known ones have been destroyed by him, as Indra by the dawns, when he went with the lofty friends, the desired ones, together with the established ones, thou hast struck down the heart's enemies.

original: tvaṃ jaghantha namuciṃ makhasyuṃ dāsaṃ kṛṇvāna ṛṣayevimāyam
analyzed: tvam jaghantha namucim makhasyum dāsam kṛṇvānaḥ
translated: Thou hast struck down Namuci the sacrificer, making the Dāsa a slave for the Ṛṣi.

original: tvaṃ cakartha manave syonān patho devatrāñjasevayānān
analyzed: tvam cakartha manave syonān pathaḥ devatrā añjasā iva yānān
translated: Thou hast made the paths easy for Manu to go to the gods, as if to be entreated.

original: tvametāni papriṣe vi nāmeśāna indra dadhiṣe gabhastau
analyzed: tvam etāni papriṣe vi nāma īśānaḥ indra dadhiṣe gabhastau
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the lord of these names, thou graspest the reins

original: anu tvā devāḥ śavasā madantyuparibudhnān vaninaścakartha
analyzed: anu tvā devāḥ śavasā madanti uparibudhnān vaninaḥ cakartha
translated: The gods rejoice in thee for thy strength, thou hast made the trees bend down their tops

original: cakraṃ yadasyāpsvā niṣattamuto tadasmai madhviccachadyāt
analyzed: cakram yat asya apsvā niṣattam uta u tat asmai madhu id cachadyāt
translated: The wheel which is set in the waters, let that be ready for him as sweet drink

original: pṛthivyāmatiṣitaṃ yadūdhaḥ payo goṣvadadhā oṣadhīṣu🔽aśvādiyāyeti yad vadantyojaso jātamuta manya enam
analyzed: pṛthivyām atiṣitam yat ūdhar payaḥ goṣu adadhāḥ oṣadhīṣu  aśvāt iyāya iti yat vadanti ojasaḥ jātam uta manye enam
translated: The milk which is stored in the earth, the udder, thou hast placed in the cows and in the plants🔽When they say 'it has gone from the horse', they think it has come from strength, or from the mind

original: manyoriyāya harmyeṣu tasthau yataḥ prajajña indro asya veda🔽vayaḥ suparṇā upa sedurindraṃ priyamedhā ṛṣayonādhamānāḥ
analyzed: manyoriyāya harmyeṣu tasthau yatas prajajñe indraḥ asya veda  vayaḥ suparṇāḥ upa seduḥ indram priyamedhāḥ ṛṣayaḥ nādhamānāḥ
translated: It has come from the mind, it has stood in the chambers, from where it was born, Indra knows it🔽The well-winged, the wise Ṛṣis have approached Indra, longing for the dear thought

original: apa dhvāntamūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣurmumugdhyasmān nidhayeva baddhān
analyzed: apa dhvāntam ūrṇuhi pūrdhi cakṣuḥ mumugdhi asmān nidhayā iva baddhān
translated: Drive away the darkness, make the eye grow, deliver us who are bound as with a bond

original: vasūnāṃ vā carkṛṣa iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñairvārodasyoḥ
analyzed: vasūnām vā carkṛṣe iyakṣan dhiyā vā yajñaiḥ vārodasyoḥ
translated: Or if they long for the Vasus' favour, with thought or with sacrifices, for the two who have a flood of wealth

original: arvanto vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanuṃ vā yesuśruṇaṃ suśruto dhuḥ
analyzed: arvantaḥ vā ye rayimantaḥ sātau vanum vā yesuśruṇam su śrutaḥ dhuḥ
translated: Or the horses who are rich in wealth in the contest, or those who have brought the well-known favour to the well-known one

original: hava eṣāmasuro nakṣata dyāṃ śravasyatā manasā niṃsatakṣā
analyzed: have eṣām asuraḥ nakṣata dyām śravasyatā manasā niṃsatakṣā
translated: The Asura of these calls to the sky, they have sharpened the axe with a mind longing for glory

original: cakṣāṇā yatra suvitāya devā dyaurna vārebhiḥkṛṇavanta svaiḥ
analyzed: cakṣāṇāḥ yatra suvitāya devāḥ dyauḥ na vārebhiḥ kṛṇavanta svaiḥ
translated: Where the gods make (their) own ways for prosperity, as the sky with its own ways

original: iyameṣāmamṛtānāṃ gīḥ sarvatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam
analyzed: iyam eṣām amṛtānām gīḥ sarvatātā ye kṛpaṇanta ratnam
translated: This is the immortal song of these who pour forth wealth, all-nourishing, who perfect thought and sacrifice

original: dhiyaṃ ca yajñaṃ ca sādhantaste no dhāntu vasavyamasāmi
analyzed: dhiyam ca yajñam ca sādhantaḥ te naḥ dhāntu vasavyam asāmi
translated: May they bestow upon us wealth to be desired

original: ā tat ta indrāyavaḥ panantabhi ya ūrvaṃ gomantantitṛtsān
analyzed: ā tat te indra āyavaḥ pananta abhi yaḥ ūrvam gomantantitṛtsān
translated: To that, O ye who long for Indra, sing your songs, ye who desire the ample wealth in kine

original: sakṛtsvaṃ ye puruputrāṃ mahīṃ sahasradhārāmbṛhatīṃ dudukṣan
analyzed: sakṛtsvam ye puru putrām mahīm sahasra dhārām bṛhatīm dudukṣan
translated: Who have milked the great earth, the one who hath many sons, the bountiful, with a thousand streams

original: śacīva indramavase kṛṇudhvamanānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn
analyzed: śacīvas indram avase kṛṇudhvam an ānatam damayantam pṛtanyūn
translated: Do ye make Indra rich in kine to be entreated, him who is not to be bent, who subdueth foes

original: ṛbhukṣaṇaṃ maghavānaṃ suvṛktiṃ bhartā yo vajraṃ naryampurukṣuḥ
analyzed: ṛbhukṣaṇam maghavānam suvṛktim bhartā yaḥ vajram naryam purukṣuḥ
translated: The bountiful, the lord of heroes, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the rich in food, the breaker of forts

original: yad vāvāna purutamaṃ purāṣāḷ ā vṛtrahendro nāmānyaprāḥ🔽aceti prāsahas patistuviṣmān yadīmuśmasikartave karat tat
analyzed: yat vāvāna purutamam purāṣāh ā vṛtra hā indraḥ nāmāni aprāḥ  aceti prāsahaḥ patiḥ stuviṣmān karat tat
translated: When Indra, the most ancient of all, hath taken his ancient names, the names of the Vr̥itra-slayer🔽He, the mighty lord of the brave, is ready, if ye will, to do what must be done

original: pra su va āpo mahimānamuttamaṃ kārurvocāti sadanevivasvataḥ
analyzed: pra su vaḥ āpaḥ mahimānam uttamam kāruḥ vocāti sadanevivasvataḥ
translated: The waters have declared your highest greatness in the seat of Vivasvan, O ye singers

original: pra saptasapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ prasṛtvarīṇāmati sindhurojasā
analyzed: pra sapta sapta tredhā hi cakramuḥ prasṛtvarīṇām ati sindhuḥ ojasā
translated: The seven and seven have moved in three directions: the river hath passed beyond with might

original: pra te 'radad varuṇo yātave pathaḥ sindho yad vājānabhyadravastvam
analyzed: pra te radat varuṇaḥ yātave pathaḥ sindho yat vājān abhyadravaḥ tvam
translated: Varuṇa hath cleft the paths for thee to travel, O river, when thou didst rush upon the spoil

original: bhūmyā adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yadeṣāmagraṃ jagatāmirajyasi🔽divi svano yatate bhūmyoparyanantaṃ śuṣmamudiyartibhānunā🔽abhrādiva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhuryadeti vṛṣabho na roruvat
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ adhi pravatā yāsi sānunā yat eṣām agram jagatām irajyasi  divi svanaḥ yatate bhūmyā upari anantam śuṣmam udiyarti bhānunā  abhrāt iva pra stanayanti vṛṣṭayaḥ sindhuḥ yadā iti vṛṣabhaḥ na roruvat
translated: thou goest over the earth by the paths of the mountains when thou art the first of these moving things🔽thy voice is stretched out in the sky over the earth thou sendest forth with thy light endless strength🔽like rains from the cloud they roar when the river comes like a bull bellowing

original: abhi tvā sindho śiśumin na mātaro vāśrā arṣantipayaseva dhenavaḥ
analyzed: abhi tvā sindho śiśumit na mātaraḥ vāśrāḥ arṣanti payasā iva dhenavaḥ
translated: as to a child so the streams o sindhu flow to thee with milk like milch cows with tears

original: rājeva yudhvā nayasi tvamit sicau yadāsāmagraṃ pravatāminakṣasi
analyzed: rājā iva yudhvā nayasi tvam id sicau yat āsām agram pravatā aminakṣasi
translated: like a warrior thou leadest them o king in the two channels when thou findest the first of the moving things

original: imaṃ me gaṅge yamune sarasvati śutudri stemaṃ sacatā paruṣṇyā
analyzed: imam me gaṅge yamune sarasvati śutudri stemam sacata paruṣṇyā
translated: this my prayer o ganga yamuna sarasvati and sutudri flow together with parushni

original: asiknyā marudvṛdhe vitastayārjīkīye śṛṇuhyāsuṣomayā
analyzed: asiknyā marut vṛdhe vitastayā ārjīkīye śṛṇuhi āsuṣomayā
translated: with asnikni marudvrddha vitasta arjikiya and srnuhya with asusoma

original: tṛṣṭāmayā prathamaṃ yātave sajūḥ sasartvā rasayāśvetyā tyā
analyzed: tṛṣṭā āmayā prathamam yātave sajūs sasartvā rasayā aśvā ityā tyā
translated: with tridamya first to go with sasrtva and rasya and asveti

original: tvaṃ sindho kubhayā gomatīṃ krumummehatnvā sarathaṃ yābhirīyase
analyzed: tvam sindho kubhayā gomatīm krumum mehatnvā sa ratham yābhiḥ īyase
translated: o sindhu with kubha and gomati and krumu and mehatnu with those by whom thou art carried on a chariot

original: ṛjītyenī ruśatī mahitvā pari jrayāṃsi bharate rajāṃsi🔽adabdhā sindhurapasāmapastamāśvā na citrāvapuṣīva darśatā
analyzed: ṛjītyenī ruśatī mahitvā pari jrayāṃsi bharate rajāṃsi 🔽adabdhā sindhuḥ apasām apastamā aśvāḥ na citrā vapuṣī iva darśatā
translated: the red mare with her great power brings the regions and the firmaments

original: svaśvā sindhuḥ surathā suvāsā hiraṇyayī sukṛtāvājinīvatī
analyzed: su aśvā sindhuḥ su rathā su vāsāḥ hiraṇyayī su kṛtā vājinīvatī
translated: The river is his own, with good chariots, good garments, golden, well-made, rich in food

original: ūrṇāvatī yuvatiḥ sīlamāvatyutādhi vastesubhagā madhuvṛdham
analyzed: ūrṇāvatī yuvatiḥ sīlamāvatī uta adhi vaste subhagā madhuvṛdham
translated: The young maiden, rich in wool, and in modesty, and in good fortune, wears the garment of the sweet-growing one

original: sukhaṃ rathaṃ yuyuje sidhuraśvinaṃ tena vājaṃ saniṣadasminnājau
analyzed: sukham ratham yuyuje sidhuḥ aśvinam tena vājam saniṣadasmin ājau
translated: He has yoked the pleasant chariot, the swift horse, by which he gains strength in this battle

original: mahān hyasya mahimā panasyate 'dabdhasyasvayaśaso virapśinaḥ
analyzed: mahān hi asya mahimā panasyate dabdhasya a sva yaśasaḥ virapśinaḥ
translated: For his greatness is celebrated, of the undaunted one, of the one with his own glory, the one with beautiful hair

original: ā va ṛñjasa ūrjāṃ vyuṣṭiṣvindraṃ maruto rodasīanaktana
analyzed: ā vaḥ ṛñjasaḥ ūrjām vyuṣṭiṣu indram marutaḥ rodasī īanaktana
translated: To Indra, to the Maruts, to the two world-halves, in the dawns, in the rising, do I come for strength

original: ubhe yathā no ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥsadovarivasyāta udbhidā
analyzed: ubhe yathā naḥ ahanī sacābhuvā sadaḥ sadaḥ varivasyā atas udbhidā
translated: That the two days may be for us together, in every assembly, may they serve us with abundance

original: tadu śreṣṭhaṃ savanaṃ sunotanā /
analyzed: tat u śreṣṭham savanam sunotana
translated: That is the best libation, press it out

original: tyo na hastayato adriḥsotari
analyzed: tyaḥ na hasta yataḥ adriḥsotari
translated: The stone which is not guided by the hand, the presser

original: vidad dhyaryo abhibhūti pauṃsyaṃ maho rāye cittarute yadarvataḥ
analyzed: vidat hi aryaḥ abhibhūti pauṃsyam mahaḥ rāye citta rute yat arvataḥ
translated: For the noble one knows the lordship of men, the great wealth in the mind of the swift one

original: tadid dhyasya savanaṃ viverapo yathā purā manavegātumaśret🔽goarṇasi tvāṣṭre aśvanirṇiji premadhvareṣvadhvarānaśiśrayuḥ
analyzed: tat id hi asya savanam viverapaḥ yathā purā  go arṇasi tvāṣṭre aśva nirṇiji prem adhvareṣu adhvarān aśiśrayuḥ
translated: For that is his libation which he opened, as he was wont to do for Manu of old🔽In the milk-stream, in the Tvastr-made, in the horse-covered (libation), they have established the sacrifices in the sacrifice

original: apa hata rakṣaso bhaṅgurāvata skabhāyata nirṛtiṃsedhatāmatim
analyzed: apa hata rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ skabhāyata
translated: Drive away the Raksases, make them totter, crush down Nirrti, ward off the curse

original: ā no rayiṃ sarvavīraṃ sunotana devāvyambharata ślokamadrayaḥ🔽divaścidā vo 'mavattarebhyo vibhvanā cidāśvapastarebhyaḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ rayim sarva vīram sunotana deva avyambharata ślokam adrayaḥ  divaḥ cidā vaḥ mavattarebhyaḥ vibhvanā cit aśva apastarebhyaḥ
translated: Press out for us wealth with all heroes, O ye stones, bring to the Gods the song of praise🔽Even from the lowest depths of heaven, O ye who are most bountiful in horses,

original: vāyościda somarabhastarebhyo 'gneścidarcapitukṛttarebhyaḥ
analyzed: vāyoḥ cit soma rabhastarebhyaḥ gneḥ cit arca pitukṛttarebhyaḥ
translated: Even from the lowest depths of Vayu, O ye who are most bountiful in the fire's flame,

original: bhurantu no yaśasaḥ sotvandhaso grāvāṇo vācā divitādivitmatā
analyzed: bhurantu naḥ yaśasaḥ sotu andhasaḥ grāvāṇaḥ vācā divitā a divitmatā
translated: Let the glorious pressers move us on, the stone with speech, the wise with wisdom.

original: naro yatra duhate kāmyaṃ madhvāghoṣayantoabhito mithasturaḥ
analyzed: naraḥ yatra duhate kāmyam madhu āghoṣayantaḥ abhitas mithas turaḥ
translated: Where the men milk the desirable meath, crying out to each other on every side,

original: sunvanti somaṃ rathirāso adrayo nirasya rasaṃ gaviṣoduhanti te
analyzed: sunvanti somam rathirāsaḥ adrayaḥ nirasya rasam gaviṣā duhanti te
translated: The swift stones press out Soma for the sacrifice, they pour forth the juice of the milch-cow.

original: duhantyūdharupasecanāya kaṃ naro havya nāmarjayanta āsabhiḥ
analyzed: duhanti ūdhar upasecanāya kam naraḥ havya na amarjayantaḥ āsabhiḥ
translated: They milk the udder for the sprinkling, the men, with the steed, glorify the oblation.

original: ete naraḥ svapaso abhūtana ya indrāya sunutha somamadrayaḥ
analyzed: ete naraḥ su apasaḥ abhūtana ye indrāya sunutha somam adrayaḥ
translated: These men, O ye stones, have become wise who press out Soma for Indra.

original: vāmaṃvāmaṃ vo divyāya dhāmne vasuvasu vaḥ pārthivayasunvate
analyzed: vāmam vāmam vaḥ divyāya dhāmne vasu vasu vaḥ pārthivaya sunvate
translated: For your heavenly abode, O ye stones, the most excellent of all, for your earthly abode, the most excellent of all,

original: abhrapruṣo na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmanto na yajñāvijānuṣaḥ
analyzed: abhrapruṣaḥ na vācā pruṣā vasu haviṣmantaḥ na yajña avijānuṣaḥ
translated: Like rain-clouds with rain, with speech, with wealth, the sacrificers, like the wise, have found the oblation.

original: sumārutaṃ na brahmāṇamarhase gaṇamastoṣyeṣāṃ na śobhase
analyzed: su mārutam na brahmāṇam arhase gaṇam astoṣi eṣām na śobhase
translated: Thou art worthy of the Maruts, of the Brahman, of the host of these, by whom thou shinest.

original: śriye maryāso añjīnrakṛṇvata sumarutaṃ na pūrviratikṣapaḥ
analyzed: śriye maryāsaḥ añjīn rakṛṇvata su marutam na pūrviratikṣapaḥ
translated: for glory they have made themselves bright garments, the Maruts, like a young bull, in the morning

original: divas putrāsa etā na yetira ādityāsaste akrana vāvṛdhuḥ🔽pra ye divaḥ pṛthivya na barhaṇā tmanā riricre abhrānna sūryaḥ
analyzed: divaḥ putrāsaḥ etāḥ na yetire ādityāsaḥ te akrana vāvṛdhuḥ  pra ye divaḥ pṛthivya na barhaṇā tmanā riricre abhrāt na sūryaḥ
translated: the sons of heaven, these Ādityas, have not been overcome, they have grown in strength🔽who have spread out from heaven and earth, in their own might, like a cloud, like the sun

original: pājasvanto na vīrāḥ panasyavo riśādaso namaryā abhidyavaḥ
analyzed: pājasvantaḥ na vīrāḥ panasyavaḥ riśādasaḥ namaryāḥ abhidyavaḥ
translated: like vigorous heroes, like those who have their own share, like the R̥ishis, like those who conquer foes

original: yuṣmākaṃ budhne apāṃ na yāmani vithuryati na mahīśratharyati
analyzed: yuṣmākam budhne apām na yāmani vithuryati na mahīśratharyati
translated: at your ford of the waters, as on a way, a weak man does not tremble, a strong man does not shake

original: viśvapsuryajño arvāgayaṃ su vaḥprayasvanto na satrāca ā gata
analyzed: viśvapsuḥ yajñaḥ arvāk ayam su vaḥ prayasvantaḥ na satrācaḥ ā gata
translated: the sacrifice is all-supporting, come hither, O ye bountiful ones, to our assembly

original: yūyaṃ dhūrṣu prayujo na raśmibhirjyotiṣmanto na bhāsāvyuṣṭiṣu
analyzed: yūyam dhūrṣu prayujaḥ na raśmibhiḥ jyotiṣmantaḥ na bhāsā vyuṣṭiṣu
translated: ye who are yoked with reins in the reins, like the light-bringing ones with the lights at the break of day

original: śyenāso na svayaśaso riśādasaḥ pravāsona prasitāsaḥ paripruṣaḥ
analyzed: śyenāsaḥ na sva yaśasaḥ riśādasaḥ pravāsona prasitāsaḥ paripruṣaḥ
translated: like hawks, of your own glory, like those who conquer foes, like those who travel far, like those who are smeared with oil

original: pra yad vahadhve marutaḥ parākād yūyaṃ mahaḥsaṃvaraṇasya vasvaḥ
analyzed: pra yat vahadhve marutaḥ parākāt yūyam mahaḥ saṃvaraṇasya vasvaḥ
translated: when ye, O Maruts, bring from afar this great treasure of Saṃvaraṇa

original: vidānāso vasavo rādhyasyārācciddveṣaḥ sanutaryuyota
analyzed: vidānāsaḥ vasavaḥ rādhyasya ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyota
translated: ye who are finders, O ye Vasus, of what is to be accomplished, ward off even from afar the hatred of the enemy

original: ya udṛci yajñe adhvareṣṭhā marudbhyo na mānuṣo dadāśat
analyzed: yaḥ udṛci yajñe adhvareṣṭhāḥ marudbhyaḥ na mānuṣaḥ dadāśat
translated: he who, in the performance of sacrifice, as chief of the sacrifice, has offered to the Maruts as a man

original: revat sa vayo dadhate suvīraṃ sa devānāmapi gopītheastu
analyzed: revat sa vayaḥ dadhate su vīram sa devānām api gopīthe astu
translated: they bestow abundant life with noble heroes: may he be in the drinking of the gods.

original: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmā ādityena nāmnāśambhaviṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsaḥ ūmāḥ ādityena nāmnā aśambhaviṣṭhāḥ
translated: For they are the most auspicious at sacrifices, the most prosperous under the name of Âditya.

original: te no 'vantu rathatūrmanīṣāṃ mahaścayāmannadhvare cakānāḥ
analyzed: te naḥ vantu rathatūrmanīṣām mahaḥ cayāman adhvare cakānāḥ
translated: May they help us, the singers, in the chariot-race, shining in the sacrifice, with great wealth.

original: viprāso na manmabhiḥ svādhyo devāvyo na yajñaiḥsvapnasaḥ
analyzed: viprāsaḥ na manmabhiḥ su ādhyaḥ na yajñaiḥsvapnasaḥ
translated: The sages with our hymns, the good, the pious with sacrifices, the gods with their own.

original: rājāno na citrāḥ susandṛśaḥ kṣitīnāṃ namaryā arepasaḥ
analyzed: rājānaḥ na citrāḥ su sandṛśaḥ kṣitīnām namaryāḥ arepasaḥ
translated: Like kings, they are wondrous, fair to behold, like the lords of the people, free from blemish.

original: agnirna ye bhājasā rukmavakṣaso vātāso na svayujaḥsadyaūtayaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ na ye bhājasā rukma vakṣasaḥ vātāsaḥ na sva yujaḥ sadyaūtayaḥ
translated: Like Agni, they are to be served with oblations, with golden breasts, like the winds, their own companions, swift to come.

original: prajñātāro na jyeṣṭhāḥ sunītayaḥsuśarmāṇo na somā ṛtaṃ yate
analyzed: prajñātāraḥ na jyeṣṭhāḥ su nītayaḥ su śarmāṇaḥ na somāḥ ṛtam yate
translated: Like the most famous, of good counsel, like the Somas, they are our good protectors, established in truth.

original: vātāso na ye dhunayo jigatnavo 'gnīnāṃ na jihvāvirokiṇaḥ🔽varmaṇvanto na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇāṃna śaṃsāḥ surātayaḥ
analyzed: vātāsaḥ na ye dhunayaḥ jigatnavaḥ gnīnām na jihvā virokiṇaḥ  varmaṇvantaḥ na yodhāḥ śimīvantaḥ pitṝṇām na śaṃsāḥ su rātayaḥ
translated: Like the winds, they are shaking, eager, like the tongues of the fires, shining.🔽Like warriors, they are armoured, strong, like the praises of the fathers, bestowing good boons.

original: rathānāṃ na ye 'rāḥ sanābhayo jigīvāṃso na śūrāabhidyavaḥ🔽vareyavo na maryā ghṛtapruṣo 'bhisvartāroarkaṃ na suṣṭubhaḥ
analyzed: rathānām na ye rāḥ sanābhayaḥ jigīvāṃsaḥ na śūrāḥ abhidyavaḥ  vareyavaḥ na maryāḥ ghṛta pruṣaḥ bhisvartāraḥ arkam na suṣṭubhaḥ
translated: Like the spokes of chariots, they are of one nave, like victorious heroes, not to be overcome.🔽Like the best of men, they are greedy for choice food, like the praisers, they are eager to win the praise.

original: aśvāso na ye jyeṣṭhāsa āśavo didhiṣavo na rathyaḥsudānavaḥ
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ na ye jyeṣṭhāsaḥ āśavaḥ didhiṣavaḥ na rathyaḥsudānavaḥ
translated: Like the swiftest horses, they are the best, like the charioteers, they are bountiful.

original: āpo na nimnairudabhirjigatnavo viśvarūpāaṅgiraso na sāmabhiḥ🔽grāvāṇo na sūrayaḥ sindhumātara ādardirāso adrayo naviśvahā
analyzed: āpaḥ na nimnaiḥ udabhiḥ jigatnavaḥ viśva rūpāḥ aṅgirasaḥ na sāmabhiḥ  grāvāṇaḥ na sūrayaḥ sindhu mātaraḥ ādardirāsaḥ adrayaḥ na viśvahā
translated: The waters, like those that flow in a low place, the Aṅgiras, of various forms, with their Sāmans🔽The pressing-stones, like princes, born from the river, the impetuous, the mountains, on all sides

original: śiśūlā na krīḷayaḥ sumātaro mahāgrāmo nayāmannuta tviṣā
analyzed: śiśūlāḥ na krīḍayaḥ su mātaraḥ mahā grāmaḥ na yāman uta tviṣā
translated: The young ones, like those who play, of good mothers, the great village, like those who are fed, with radiance

original: uṣasāṃ na ketavo 'dhvaraśriyaḥ śubhaṃyavo nāñjibhirvyaśvitan
analyzed: uṣasām na ketavaḥ dhvara śriyaḥ śubhaṃyavaḥ nā añjibhiḥ vyaśvitan
translated: The banners of the dawns, the glory of the sacrifice, the well-fed, like those with variegated tails

original: sindhavo na yayiyo bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ parāvato nayojanāni mamire
analyzed: sindhavaḥ na bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ parāvataḥ na yojanāni mamire
translated: The rivers, like those who go, with shining eyes, have measured out the distances, like those from afar

original: subhāgān no devāḥ kṛṇutā suratnānasmān stotṝn marutovāvṛdhānāḥ
analyzed: subhāgān naḥ devāḥ kṛṇutā su ratnān asmān stotṝn marutaḥ vāvṛdhānāḥ
translated: Make us fortunate, O gods, grant us good treasures, O Maruts, increasing us who praise you

original: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gāta sanād dhi voratnadheyāni santi
analyzed: adhi stotrasya sakhyasya gāta sanāt hi vaḥ ratna dheyāni santi
translated: Sing in the place of the hymn and friendship, for from of old there are treasures to be given to us

original: apaśyamasya mahato mahitvamamartyasya martyāsu vikṣu🔽nānā hanū vibhṛte saṃ bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūryattaḥ
analyzed: apaśyam asya mahataḥ mahi tvam amartyasya martyāsu vikṣu  nānā hanū vibhṛte sam bharete asinvatī bapsatī bhūryattaḥ
translated: I have seen the greatness of this great one, of the immortal one, in the mortal people🔽The two jaws, separated, he supports, the unwasting one, the one who sucks, the one who is full

original: guhā śiro nihitam ṛdhagakṣī asinvannatti jihvayāvanāni
analyzed: guhā śiraḥ nihitam ṛdhak akṣī asinvan atti jihvayā avanāni
translated: The head is laid down in a hidden place, the one with a crooked eye, the unwasting one eats the food with his tongue

original: atrāṇyasmai paḍbhiḥ saṃ bharantyuttānahastānamasādhi vikṣu
analyzed: atrāṇi asmai paḍbhiḥ sam bharanti uttāna hastānam asādhi vikṣu
translated: For him they gather these with their feet, with uplifted hands, with humility, in the people

original: pra mātuḥ prataraṃ guhyamichan kumāro na vīrudhaḥsarpadurvīḥ
analyzed: pra mātuḥ prataram guhyam icchan kumāraḥ na
translated: Seeking the secret ford of his mother, the child creeps like a creeper over the plants

original: sasaṃ na pakvamavidacchucantaṃririhvāṃsaṃ ripa upasthe antaḥ
analyzed: sasam na pakvam avidat śucantam ririhvāṃsam ripaḥ upasthe antar
translated: He finds the cooked food, the shining one, in the lap of the house, trembling, in the bosom

original: tad vām ṛtaṃ rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamāno mātarā garbhoatti
analyzed: tat vām ṛtam rodasī pra bravīmi jāyamānaḥ mātarā garbhā uatti
translated: That truth I declare to you, O Heaven and Earth, the child born, the son, eats his mothers in the womb

original: nāhaṃ devasya martyaściketāgniraṅga vicetāḥ sapracetāḥ
analyzed: na aham devasya martyaḥ ciketa agniḥ aṅga vicetāḥ sa pracetāḥ
translated: I, a mortal, do not know the god, Agni, the limb, the discerning, the well-discerning one

original: yo asmā annaṃ tṛṣvādadhātyājyairghṛtairjuhotipuṣyati
analyzed: yaḥ asmai annam tṛṣu ādadhāti ājyaiḥ ghṛtaiḥ juhoti puṣyati
translated: Who places food in our mouths, offers with ghee and clarified butter, he prospers

original: tasmai sahasramakṣabhirvi cakṣe 'gne viśvataḥpratyaṃṃ asi tvam
analyzed: tasmai sahasram akṣabhiḥ vi cakṣe gne viśvatas pratyaṃ asi tvam
translated: To him I look with a thousand eyes, O Agni, you are on every side

original: kiṃ deveṣu tyaja enaścakarthāgne pṛchāmi nu tvāmavidvān🔽akrīḷan krīḷan harirattave 'dan vi parvaśaścakarta gāmivāsiḥ
analyzed: kim deveṣu tyajaḥ enaḥ cakartha agne pṛcchāmi nu tvām avidvān  a krīḍan krīḍan vi parvaśas cakarta gāmi vā asiḥ
translated: What have you done to the gods, O Agni? I ask you, not knowing🔽Playing, playing, the tawny one, eating, he cut the joints of the cow, as if with a knife

original: viṣūco aśvān yuyuje vanejā ṛjītibhī raśanābhirgṛbhītān
analyzed: viṣūcaḥ aśvān yuyuje vanejāḥ ṛjītibhiḥ raśanābhiḥ gṛbhītān
translated: The forest-born one yoked the horses in opposite directions, held by the reins with the swift ones

original: cakṣade mitro vasubhiḥ sujātaḥ samānṛdheparvabhirvāvṛdhānaḥ
analyzed: cakṣade mitraḥ vasubhiḥ su jātaḥ samānṛdhe parvabhiḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ
translated: Mitra, well-born, with the Vasus, shines forth, grown by the joints, he has been made to move

original: agniḥ saptiṃ vājambharaṃ dadātyagnirvīraṃ śrutyaṃkarmaniṣṭhām
analyzed: agniḥ saptim vājambharam dadāti agniḥ vīram śrutyam karma niṣṭhām
translated: Agni gives the horse, the strong one, Agni the hero, famous, devoted to work

original: agnī rodasī vi carat samañjannagnirnārīṃ vīrakukṣiṃ purandhim🔽agnerapnasaḥ samidastu bhadrāgnirmahī rodasī ā viveśa
analyzed: agniḥ rodasī vi carat samañjan agniḥ nārīm vīra kukṣim purandhim  agneḥ apnasaḥ samidh astu bhadrā agniḥ mahī rodasī ā viveśa
translated: Agni moves between the two world-halves, making ready; Agni, the man, the womb of heroes, the bountiful woman.🔽Let the kindling-stick be auspicious of bountiful Agni; Agni hath entered the two great world-halves.

original: agnirekaṃ codayat samatsvagnirvṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi🔽agnirha tyaṃ jarataḥ karṇamāvāgniradbhyo niradahajjarūtham
analyzed: agniḥ ekam codayat samatsu agniḥ vṛtrāṇi dayate purūṇi  agniḥ ha tyam jarataḥ karṇam āvā agniḥ adbhyaḥ niradahat jarūtham
translated: Agni impels the one in battles; Agni slays many Vritras.🔽Agni hath brought to us the ear of the eager one; Agni hath burned up the worthless chaff from the grain.

original: agniratriṃ gharma uruṣyadantaragnirnṛmedhampra jayāsṛjat sam
analyzed: agniḥ atrim gharmaḥ uruṣyat antar agniḥ nṛmedham pra jaya asṛjat sam
translated: Agni hath protected Atri in the heat; Agni hath sent forth Nṛmedha to great prosperity.

original: agnirdād draviṇaṃ vīrapeśā agnirṛṣiṃ yaḥ sahasrāsanoti🔽agnirdivi havyamā tatānāgnerdhāmānivibhṛtā purutrā
analyzed: agniḥ dāt draviṇam vīra peśāḥ agniḥ ṛṣim yaḥ sahasrā āsanoti  agniḥ divi havyamā tatāna agneḥ dhāma ani vibhṛtā purutrā
translated: Agni giveth wealth, the bestower of heroic strength; Agni the Rishi who winneth a thousand.🔽Agni hath stretched the offering in the sky; the abodes of Agni are distributed in many places.

original: agnimukthairṛṣayo vi hvayante 'gniṃ naro yāmanibādhitāsaḥ
analyzed: agnim ukthaiḥ ṛṣayaḥ vi hvayante gnim naraḥ yāma nibādhitāsaḥ
translated: The Rishis invoke Agni with their hymns; men invoke Agni, the invincible, on the way.

original: agniṃ vayo antarikṣe patanto 'gniḥ sahasrāpari yāti gonām
analyzed: agnim vayaḥ antarikṣe patantaḥ gniḥ sahasrā apari yāti gonām
translated: The birds flying in the atmosphere invoke Agni; Agni goes round with a thousand cows.

original: agniṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryā agniṃ manuṣo nahuṣo vijātāḥ
analyzed: agnim viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīryāḥ agnim manuṣaḥ nahuṣaḥ vijātāḥ
translated: The human tribes invoke Agni, the tribes of men born of Nahusha;

original: agnirgāndharvīṃ pathyām ṛtasyāgnergavyūtirghṛta ā niṣattā
analyzed: agniḥ gāndharvīm pathyām ṛtasya agneḥ gavyūtiḥ ghṛte ā niṣattā
translated: Agni the path of the Gandharva, the path of holy order; the stall of Agni is seated in ghee.

original: agnaye brahma ṛbhavastatakṣuragniṃ mahāmavocāmā suvṛktim
analyzed: agnaye brahma ṛbhavaḥ tatakṣuḥ agnim mahām avocāma suvṛktim
translated: The Rbhus have fashioned Agni for the Brahman; to Agni we have spoken the good hymn.

original: agne prāva jaritāraṃ yaviṣṭhāgne mahi draviṇamāyajasva
analyzed: agne prāva jaritāram yaviṣṭha agne mahi draviṇam āyajasva
translated: O Agni, O most youthful, protect the singer, O Agni, bestow great wealth on him who worships

original: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvad ṛṣirhotā nyasīdatpitā naḥ
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvat ṛṣiḥ hotā nyasīdat pitā naḥ
translated: The Rishi who, as our father, sat down as Hotar, offering up all these existing things

original: sa āśiṣā draviṇamichamānaḥ prathamachadavarānā viveśa
analyzed: saḥ āśiṣā draviṇam ichamānaḥ viveśa
translated: He, desiring wealth with his blessing, entered the first-born and best-covered (places)

original: kiṃ svidāsīdadhiṣṭhanamārambhaṇaṃ katamat svitkathāsīt
analyzed: kim svid āsīt adhiṣṭhanam ārambhaṇam katamat svid kathā āsīt
translated: What was the foundation, what the support, what was the contrivance, what the measure?

original: yato bhūmiṃ janayan viśvakarma vi dyāmaurṇon mahinā viśvacakṣāḥ
analyzed: yatas bhūmim janayan viśva karma vi dyām aurṇot mahinā viśva cakṣāḥ
translated: From whom, generating the earth, all-creating, he covered the sky with his greatness, all-seeing

original: viśvataścakṣuruta viśvatomukho viśvatobāhurutaviśvataspāt
analyzed: viśvatas cakṣuḥ uta viśvatomukhaḥ viśvatobāhuḥ uta viśvataspād
translated: He who has eyes on all sides, a mouth on all sides, arms on all sides, feet on all sides

original: saṃ bāhubhyāṃ dhamati saṃ patatrairdyāvābhūmī janayan deva ekaḥ
analyzed: sam bāhubhyām dhamati sam patatraiḥ dyāvābhūmī janayan devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: With his two arms he blows, with his wings, the one God, generating heaven and earth

original: kiṃ svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivīniṣṭatakṣuḥ
analyzed: kim svid vanam kaḥ u sa vṛkṣaḥ āsa yatas dyāvāpṛthivīn iṣṭatakṣuḥ
translated: What was the wood, what the tree, from which they fashioned out the sky and the earth?

original: manīṣiṇo manasā pṛchatedu tad yadadhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan
analyzed: manīṣiṇaḥ manasā pṛcchata idu tat yat adhyatiṣṭhat bhuvanāni dhārayan
translated: The wise one should ask this with his mind, that which he stood over, supporting the worlds

original: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yāvamā yā madhyamāviśvakarmannutemā
analyzed: yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yā avamā yā madhyamā viśvakarman uta imā
translated: Thy highest abodes, O all-worker, thy lowest, and those in the middle, these

original: śikṣā sakhibhyo haviṣi svadhāvaḥsvayaṃ yajasva tanvaṃ vṛdhānaḥ
analyzed: śikṣa sakhibhyaḥ haviṣi svadhāvas svayam yajasva tanvam vṛdhānaḥ
translated: Learn them from thy friends, O thou of sweet voice, worship thyself, increasing thy own body

original: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayaṃ yajasva pṛthivīmuta dyām
analyzed: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayam yajasva pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: O Visvakarman, having grown by the oblation, offer thyself to the earth and to the sky.

original: muhyantvanye abhito janāsa ihāsmākaṃ maghavāsūrirastu🔽vācas patiṃ viśvakarmāṇamūtaye manojuvaṃ vāje adyāhuvema
analyzed: muhyantu anye abhitas janāsaḥ iha asmākam maghavā asūriḥ astu  vācaḥ patim viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manaḥ juvam vāje adya āhuvema
translated: Let other people be confused on all sides. Here let the bountiful one be our protector.🔽To the lord of speech, to Visvakarman, let us call today with our thought for help, swift in battle.

original: sa no viśvāni havanāni joṣad viśvaśambhūravasesādhukarmā
analyzed: sa naḥ viśvāni havanāni joṣat viśva śambhūḥ avase sādhu karmā
translated: May he accept all our invocations, the bestower of all, the well-working one, for help.

original: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīro ghṛtamene ajanannannamāne
analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīraḥ ghṛtam ene ajanan annamāne
translated: The father of sight, the wise one with the mind, has generated food with ghee, when it was being measured.

original: yadedantā adadṛhanta pūrva ādiddyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām
analyzed: yadā idantāḥ adadṛhanta pūrve ādit dyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām
translated: When the ancient ones, the teeth, were firmly established, heaven and earth were extended, they were spread apart.

original: viśvakarmā vimanā ād vihāyā dhātā vidhātā paramotasandṛk
analyzed: viśvakarmā vimanāḥ āt vihāyāḥ dhātā vidhātā parama uta sandṛś
translated: Visvakarman, the wise one, the bird, the creator, the ordainer, and the highest seer.

original: teṣāmiṣṭāni samiṣā madanti yatrāsaptaṛṣīn para ekamāhuḥ
analyzed: teṣām iṣṭāni samiṣā madanti yatra a sapta ṛṣīn paras ekam āhuḥ
translated: Their wishes are fulfilled with food, where they say there is one beyond the seven Rishis.

original: yo naḥ pitā janitā yo vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāniviśvā
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ pitā janitā yaḥ vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who is our father, the begetter, the ordainer, who knows all the abodes and all the worlds,

original: yo devānāṃ nāmadhā eka eva taṃ sampraśnambhuvanā yantyanyā
analyzed: yaḥ devānām nāmadhāḥ ekaḥ eva tam sampraśnambhuvanāḥ yanti anyā
translated: He who alone bears the names of the gods, to him the other worlds go for consultation.

original: ta āyajanta draviṇaṃ samasmā ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāro nabhūnā
analyzed: te āyajanta draviṇam samasmai ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāraḥ nabhūnā
translated: The ancient Rishis, the singers, have generated wealth for him, for the unborn one.

original: asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtānisamakṛṇvannimāni
analyzed: asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye
translated: They are established in the path, the visible and invisible, who have made these beings equal.

original: paro divā para enā pṛthivyā paro devebhirasurairyadasti
analyzed: paras divā paras enā pṛthivyā paras devebhiḥ asuraiḥ yat asti
translated: Higher than heaven, higher than this earth, higher than all that the gods and Asuras possess

original: kaṃ svid garbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamapaśyanta viśve🔽tamid garbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥsamagachanta viśve
analyzed: kam svid garbham prathamam dadhre āpaḥ yatra devāḥ samapaśyanta viśve  tam id garbham prathamam dadhre āpaḥ yatra devāḥ samagacchanta viśve
translated: What germ did the waters first conceive, wherein all the gods beheld (him)?🔽That germ did the waters first conceive, wherein all the gods came together

original: ajasya nābhāvadhyekamarpitaṃyasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ
analyzed: ajasya nābhau adhi ekam arpitam yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ
translated: In the navel of the unborn one, one is laid, in whom all existing things have their place

original: na taṃ vidātha ya imā jajānāyad yuṣmākamantarambabhūva
analyzed: na tam vidātha yaḥ imāḥ jajānāyat yuṣmākam antaram babhūva
translated: Ye find not him who produced these (worlds), since he hath become your innermost (part)

original: nīhāreṇa prāvṛtā jalpyā cāsutṛpa ukthaśāsaścaranti🔽yaste manyo 'vidhad vajra sāyaka saha ojaḥ puṣyati viśvamānuṣak
analyzed: nīhāreṇa prāvṛtāḥ jalpyā ca asutṛpaḥ uktha śāsaḥ caranti  yaḥ te manyo vidhat vajra sāyaka sahaḥ ojaḥ puṣyati viśva mānuṣak
translated: Enveloped in mist and in darkness, the greedy, the greedy for praise, move about🔽O Manyu, he who hath made thee, O Manyu, the wielder of the thunderbolt, increaseth his strength in every way

original: sāhyāma dāsamāryaṃ tvayā yujā sahaskṛtenasahasā sahasvatā
analyzed: sāhyāma dāsam āryam tvayā yujā sahaskṛtena sahasā sahasvatā
translated: With thee for an ally we may conquer the Dāsa, the Ārya, the one who hath done a hundred wrongs, with the irresistible (Manyu)

original: manyurindro manyurevāsa devo manyurhotā varuṇojātavedāḥ🔽manyuṃ viśa īḷate mānuṣīryāḥ pāhi nomanyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: manyuḥ indraḥ manyuḥ eva āsa devaḥ manyuḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ  manyum viśaḥ īḍate mānuṣīryāḥ pāhi nomanyo tapasā sajoṣāḥ
translated: Manyu is Indra, Manyu is the god, Manyu is the Hotar, Varuna, the all-knower🔽The human people seek Manyu, be thou of one mind with Manyu, O thou who art to be worshipped, protect us

original: abhīhi manyo tavasastavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn
analyzed: abhīhi manyo tavasaḥ tavīyān tapasā yujā vi jahi śatrūn
translated: Come hither, O Manyu, mightier than the mighty, slay our enemies with heat as thy ally

original: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhā ca viśvā vasūnyā bharātvaṃ naḥ
analyzed: amitra hā vṛtra hā dasyu hā ca viśvā vasūni ā bharātvam naḥ
translated: slayer of foes, slayer of vṛtra, slayer of dasyu, bring to us all good things

original: tvaṃ hi manyo abhibhūtyojāḥ svayambhūrbhāmoabhimātiṣāhaḥ
analyzed: tvam hi manyo abhibhūti ojāḥ svayambhūḥ bhāmaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: for thou art manyu, o'erpowering in thy strength, selfborn, a flame, overcoming the spiteful

original: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvānasmāsvojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi🔽abhāgaḥ sannapa pareto asmi tava kratvā taviṣasyapracetaḥ
analyzed: viśvacarṣaṇiḥ sahuriḥ sahāvān asmāsu ojaḥ pṛtanāsu dhehi  a bhāgaḥ san apa paretaḥ asmi tava kratvā taviṣasya apracetaḥ
translated: all men's supporter, strong, and strong to save: bestow on us strength in the battles that we fight🔽i am come nigh to thee, o thou of mighty power, though i be one who hath no share in sacrifice

original: taṃ tvā manyo akraturjihīḷāhaṃ svā tanūrbaladeyāya mehi🔽ayaṃ te asmyupa mehyarvāṃ pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśvadhāyaḥ🔽manyo vajrinnabhi māmā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūnrutabodhyāpeḥ
analyzed: tam tvā manyo akratuḥ jihīḍa aham svā tanūḥ bala deyāya mā ihi  ayam te asmi upa mā ihi arvām pratīcīnaḥ sahure viśva dhāyaḥ  manyo vajrin abhi mā amā ā vavṛtsva hanāva dasyūn ruta bodhyāpeḥ
