translated: i, manyu, who am wise, will win thee for myself: come to me with thy body to give me strength🔽here am i: come thou to me: come hitherward: be thou all-bounteous, ever present at my call🔽turn thee, o manyu, thunderer, hitherward: slay the dasyus, wake thee up to aid us well

original: abhi prehi dakṣiṇato bhavā me 'dhā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanāvabhūri🔽juhomi te dharuṇaṃ madhvo agramubhā upāṃśuprathamā pibāva
analyzed: abhi prehi dakṣiṇatas bhava me dhāḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanau abhūri  juhomi te dharuṇam madhvaḥ agram ubhau upāṃśu prathamā pibāva
translated: come hitherward and be thou on my right hand: trample to pieces many a firmset fort🔽i offer thee the firm support, the meath's first draught: drink both together, first of all, in secret

original: tvayā manyo sarathamārujanto harṣamāṇāso dhṛṣitāmarutvaḥ
analyzed: tvayā manyo sa ratham ārujantaḥ harṣamāṇāsaḥ
translated: mounting thy car with thee, o manyu, joyful, bold, with the āmṛta maruts,

original: tigmeṣava āyudhā saṃśiśānā abhi pra yantunaro agnirūpāḥ
analyzed: tigma iṣavaḥ āyudhā saṃśiśānāḥ abhi pra yantunaraḥ agni rūpāḥ
translated: sharpening their keen darts and their weapons, the men go forth, having the aspect of a flame

original: agniriva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senānīrnaḥ sahure hūtaedhi
analyzed: agniḥ iva manyo tviṣitaḥ sahasva senā nīḥ naḥ sahure hūtaḥ edhi
translated: be thou, o manyu, like a flame, to be revered: be thou our general, O thou who givest strength.

original: hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva veda ojo mimāno vi mṛdhonudasva
analyzed: hatvāya śatrūn vi bhajasva vedaḥ ojaḥ mimānaḥ vi mṛdhonudasva
translated: Having slain the enemies, distribute the wealth, O Veda, measuring strength, drive away the enemies

original: sahasva manyo abhimātimasme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehiśatrūn
analyzed: sahasva manyo abhimātim asme rujan mṛṇan pramṛṇan prehi śatrūn
translated: Be victorious, O Manyu, over the hostility against us, striking, slaying, crushing, go forth against the enemies

original: ugraṃ te pājo nanvā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃnayasa ekaja tvam
analyzed: ugram te pājaḥ nanvā rurudhre vaśī vaśaṃnayase eka ja tvam
translated: Thy fierce impulse now is restrained, thou art the one who leads under control, thou art the one who is alone

original: eko bahūnāmasi manyavīḷito viśaṃviśaṃ yudhaye saṃśiśādhi
analyzed: ekaḥ bahūnām asi manya vīḍitaḥ viśam viśam yudhaye saṃśiśādhi
translated: Thou art alone among many, irresistible, sharpen thyself for the battle of each clan

original: akṛttaruk tvayā yujā vayaṃ dyumantaṃ ghoṣaṃvijayāya kṛṇmahe
analyzed: a kṛtta ruc tvayā yujā vayam dyumantam ghoṣam vijayāya kṛṇmahe
translated: With thee as our ally, O unwounded one, we make a glorious shout for victory

original: vijeṣakṛdindra ivānavabravo 'smākaṃ manyo adhipā bhaveha
analyzed: vijeṣa kṛt indraḥ iva anavabravaḥ smākam manyo adhipāḥ bhava iha
translated: Like Indra, victorious, we call on thee, O Manyu, be thou our overlord

original: priyaṃ te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidmā tamutsaṃ yataābabhūtha
analyzed: priyam te nāma sahure gṛṇīmasi vidma tam utsam yatas ābabhūtha
translated: We sing thy dear name, O hero, we know that spring from which thou hast come

original: ābhūtyā sahajā vajra sāyaka saho bibharṣyabhibhūtauttaram
analyzed: ābhūtyā sahajāḥ vajra sāyaka sahaḥ bibharṣi abhibhūta auttaram
translated: With prosperity, born together, O thunderbolt, thou bearest the higher strength for conquest

original: kratvā no manyo saha /
analyzed: kratvā naḥ manyo saha
translated: By wisdom, O Manyu, be thou united with us

original: medyedhi mahādhanasya puruhūtasaṃsṛji
analyzed: medyā idhi mahādhanasya puruhūta saṃsṛji
translated: Be thou ready for the great wealth, O much-invoked one, to be bestowed

original: saṃsṛṣṭaṃ dhanamubhayaṃ samākṛtamasmabhyaṃ dattāṃvaruṇaśca manyuḥ
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭam dhanam ubhayam samākṛtam asmabhyam dattām varuṇaḥ ca manyuḥ
translated: The wealth bestowed is both gathered together, grant us the best, O Varuna and Manyu

original: bhiyaṃ dadhānā hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥparājitāso apa ni layantām
analyzed: bhiyam dadhānāḥ hṛdayeṣu śatravaḥ parājitāsaḥ apa ni layantām
translated: Let the enemies, with fear in their hearts, be defeated and driven away

original: satyenottabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇottabhitā dyauḥ
analyzed: satyena uttabhitā bhūmiḥ sūryeṇa uttabhitā dyauḥ
translated: The earth is upheld by truth, the sky is upheld by the sun

original: ṛtenādityāstiṣṭhanti divi somo adhi śritaḥ
analyzed: ṛtena ādityāḥ tiṣṭhanti divi somaḥ adhi śritaḥ
translated: By the law the Adityas stand in heaven, Soma is established on high.

original: somenādityā balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī
analyzed: somena ādityāḥ balinaḥ somena pṛthivī mahī
translated: By Soma the Adityas are strong, by Soma the earth is great.

original: athonakṣatrāṇāmeṣāmupasthe soma āhitaḥ
analyzed: atha ūnakṣatrāṇām eṣām upasthe somaḥ āhitaḥ
translated: And in the lap of these stars Soma is placed.

original: somaṃ manyate papivan yat sampiṃṣantyoṣadhim
analyzed: somam manyate papivan yat sampiṃṣanti oṣadhim
translated: He thinks of Soma when he drinks the crushed plant.

original: somaṃ yambrahmāṇo vidurna tasyāśnāti kaścana
analyzed: somam yam brahmāṇaḥ viduḥ na tasya aśnāti kaścana
translated: The Brahmans know Soma, none eats of him.

original: āchadvidhānairgupito bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ
analyzed: āchad vidhānaiḥ gupitaḥ bārhataiḥ soma rakṣitaḥ
translated: He is guarded by the Rgvedic rules, Soma is protected.

original: gravṇāmicchṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ
analyzed: gravṇām id śṛṇvan tiṣṭhasi na te aśnāti pārthivaḥ
translated: Thou standest listening to the pressing-stones, the earthly one does not eat of thee.

original: yat tvā deva prapibanti tata ā pyāyase punaḥ
analyzed: yat tvā deva prapibanti tatas ā pyāyase punar
translated: When the gods drink thee, O god, then thou art strengthened again.

original: vāyuḥsomasya rakṣitā samānāṃ māsa ākṛtiḥ
analyzed: vāyuḥsomasya rakṣitā samānām māsaḥ ākṛtiḥ
translated: Vayu is the protector of Soma, the year is the form of the months.

original: raibhyāsīdanudeyī nārāśaṃsi nyocanī
analyzed: raibhī āsīt anudeyī nārāśaṃsi nyocanī
translated: Raibhya was the bride's attendant, Narāśaṁsa the one who carried the water-pot.

original: sūryāyābhadramid vāso gāthayaiti pariṣkṛtam
analyzed: sūryāya abhadram id vāsaḥ gāthayā eti pariṣkṛtam
translated: The garment of ill-omen of Sūryā goes about adorned with a verse.

original: cittirā upabarhaṇaṃ cakṣurā abhyañjanam
analyzed: cittirāḥ upabarhaṇam cakṣurāḥ abhyañjanam
translated: Thought was the pillow, sight the ointment.

original: dyaurbhūmiḥkośa āsīd yadayāt sūryā patim
analyzed: dyauḥ bhūmiḥ kośaḥ āsīt yat ayāt sūryā patim
translated: The sky and earth were the sheath when Sūryā went to her husband.

original: stomā āsan pratidhayaḥ kuriraṃ chanda opaśaḥ
analyzed: stomāḥ āsan pratidhayaḥ kuriram chandaḥ opaśaḥ
translated: The hymns were the counter-chants, the Kurīri metre the pillow.

original: sūryāyāaśvinā varāgnirāsīt purogavaḥ
analyzed: varā agniḥ āsīt purogavaḥ
translated: The Aśvins were the boons of Sūryā, Agni was the leader.

original: somo vadhūyurabhavadaśvināstāmubhā varā
analyzed: somaḥ vadhūyuḥ abhavat aśvinā āstām ubhā varā
translated: Soma became the bridegroom, the Aśvins were the two boons.

original: sūryāṃyat patye śaṃsantīṃ manasā savitādadāt
analyzed: sūryāṃyat patye śaṃsantīm manasā savitā adadāt
translated: Savitar gave to Surya's lord the hymn which she had sung in spirit.

original: mano asyā ana āsīd dyaurāsīduta chadiḥ🔽śukrāvanaḍvāhavāstāṃ yadayāt sūryā bṛham
analyzed: manaḥ asyāḥ anaḥ āsīt dyauḥ āsīt uta chadiḥ  śukrau anaḍvāhau āstām yat ayāt sūryā bṛham
translated: Her mind was the axle, the heaven was the covering.🔽The two bright oxen were yoked when Surya went to the great (heaven).

original: ṛksāmābhyāmabhihitau gāvau te sāmanāvitaḥ🔽śrotraṃ tecakre āstāṃ divi panthāścarācāraḥ
analyzed: ṛk sāmābhyām abhihitau gāvau te sāma nāvitaḥ  śrotram te cakre āstām divi panthāḥ cara ācāraḥ
translated: The two cows are mentioned by the Rik and the Saman. They are thy two Samans.🔽The two ears were thy wheels. The path in the heaven is the way of the moving and the unmoving.

original: śucī te cakre yātyā vyāno akṣa āhataḥ🔽anomanasmayaṃ sūryārohat prayati patim
analyzed: śucī te cakre yātyāḥ vyānaḥ akṣaḥ āhataḥ  anaḥ manasmayam sūryā ārohat prayati patim
translated: The two pure wheels on which thou goest are the two out-breathings. The axle is struck by the wind.🔽The mind, the thought, hath mounted the sun. It hath gone forth to its lord.

original: sūryāyā vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yamavāsṛjat🔽aghāsuhanyante gāvo 'rjunyoḥ paryuhyate
analyzed: sūryāyāḥ vahatuḥ prāgāt savitā yam avāsṛjat  gāvaḥ rjunyoḥ paryuhyate
translated: From the womb of Surya Savitar hath brought forth. Yama hath loosed it.🔽The cows are slain in the dark half of the month. The brown (cows) are yoked in the two (halves of the month).

original: yadaśvinā pṛchamānāvayātaṃ tricakreṇa vahatuṃsūryāyāḥ
analyzed: yat aśvinā pṛcchamānau ayātam tri cakreṇa
translated: When the two Asvins went forth, being questioned, in the three-wheeled car of Surya,

original: viśve devā anu tad vāmajānan putraḥpitarāvavṛṇīta pūṣā
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anu tat vām ajānan putraḥ pitarau avṛṇīta pūṣā
translated: All the gods knew that as their own. Pusan, the son, chose the two parents.

original: yadayātaṃ śubhas patī vareyaṃ sūryāmupa
analyzed: yat ayātam śubhaḥ patī vareyam sūryām upa
translated: When ye two lords of splendour went to choose Surya,

original: kvaikaṃcakraṃ vāmāsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ
analyzed: kva ekaṃcakram vām āsīt kva deṣṭrāya tasthathuḥ
translated: Where was the one-wheeled one? Where did ye stand for the charioteer?

original: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇa ṛtutha viduḥ
analyzed: dve te cakre sūrye brahmāṇaḥ viduḥ
translated: The Brahmans know thy two wheels, O Surya, and the seasons.

original: athaikaṃcakraṃ yad guhā tadaddhātaya id viduḥ
analyzed: atha ekaṃcakram yat guhā tat addhātayaḥ id viduḥ
translated: But the one wheel which is in the secret place, that the singers know.

original: sūryāyai devebhyo mitrāya varuṇāya ca
analyzed: sūryāyai devebhyaḥ mitrāya varuṇāya ca
translated: To Surya, to the gods, to Mitra, to Varuna,

original: ye bhūtasyapracetasa idaṃ tebhyo 'karaṃ namaḥ
analyzed: ye bhūtasya pracetasaḥ idam tebhyaḥ karam namaḥ
translated: Those who are the wise ones of the past, to them I offer this homage.

original: pūrvāparaṃ carato māyayaitau śiśū kriḷantau pari yatoadhvaram
analyzed: pūrva aparam carataḥ māyayā etau śiśū kriḍantau pari yatas adhvaram
translated: These two move in the past and future by magic power, playing as children around the sacrifice.

original: viśvānyanyo bhuvanābhicaṣṭa ṛtunranyovidadhajjāyate punaḥ
analyzed: viśvāni anyaḥ bhuvanā abhicaṣṭe ṛtun anyaḥ vidadhat jāyate punar
translated: One observes all the worlds, the other, establishing the seasons, is born again.

original: navonavo bhavati jāyamāno 'hnāṃ keturuṣasāmetyagram
analyzed: navaḥ navaḥ bhavati jāyamānaḥ hnām ketuḥ uṣasām eti agram
translated: He becomes new and new when born, the banner of the days, he comes to the front of the dawns.

original: bhāgaṃ devebhyo vi dadhātyāyan pra candramāstiratedīrghamayuḥ
analyzed: bhāgam devebhyaḥ vi dadhāti āyan pra candramāḥ tirate dīrgham ayuḥ
translated: Going, he distributes a share to the gods, and the moon extends his life for a long time.

original: sukiṃśukaṃ śalmaliṃ viśvarūpaṃ hiraṇyavarṇaṃ suvṛtaṃsucakram
analyzed: su kiṃśukam śalmalim viśva rūpam hiraṇya varṇam suvṛtam su cakram
translated: The well-formed, all-formed, golden-colored, well-covered, well-wheeled Śalmali tree.

original: ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokaṃ syonaṃ patye vahatuṃkṛṇuṣva
analyzed: ā roha sūrye amṛtasya lokam syonam patye vahatuṃkṛṇuṣva
translated: Ascend to the world of immortality in the sun, make yourself fit to be carried by your husband.

original: udīrṣvātaḥ pativatī hyeṣā viśvāvasuṃ namasāgīrbhirīḷe
analyzed: ud īrṣva atas pativatī hi eṣā viśvāvasum namasā a gīrbhiḥ īḍe
translated: Rise up from here, for this (earth) is full of lords. I praise Viśvāvasu with homage and songs.

original: anyāmicha pitṛṣadaṃ vyaktāṃ sa te bhāgojanuṣā tasya viddhi
analyzed: anyām icha pitṛṣadam vyaktām sa te bhāgaḥ januṣā tasya viddhi
translated: Seek another, the manifest one who dwells with the fathers. That is your share, know that by your nature.

original: udīrṣvāto viśvāvaso namaseḷā mahe tvā
analyzed: udīrṣva atas viśvāvaso namasā iḍā mahe tvā
translated: Rise up from here, O Viśvāvasu, for praise and adoration, for great you are.

original: anyāmichaprapharvyaṃ saṃ jāyāṃ patyā sṛja
analyzed: anyām ichaprapharvyam sam jāyām patyā sṛja
translated: Seek another, the pregnant one, unite the wife with the husband.

original: anṛkṣarā ṛjavaḥ santu panthā yebhiḥ sakhāyo yanti novareyam
analyzed: anṛkṣarāḥ ṛjavaḥ santu panthāḥ yebhiḥ sakhāyaḥ yanti novareyam
translated: May the paths be free from pebbles and straight, by which our friends go to the highest (place).

original: samaryamā saṃ bhago no ninīyāt saṃ jaspatyaṃsuyamamastu devāḥ
analyzed: sam aryamā sam bhagaḥ naḥ ninīyāt sam jaspati aṃsuyamam astu devāḥ
translated: May Aryaman, may Bhaga lead us to meet, may the Gods be gracious to the worshipper.

original: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśād yena tvābadhnāt savitāsuśevaḥ
analyzed: pra tvā muñcāmi varuṇasya pāśāt yena tvā abadhnāt savitā asu śevaḥ
translated: I loose thee from the fetter of Varuna, wherewith the very gracious Savitar hath bound thee.

original: ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke 'riṣṭāṃ tvā sahapatyā dadhāmi
analyzed: ṛtasya yonau sukṛtasya loke riṣṭām tvā sahapatyā dadhāmi
translated: In the womb of truth, in the world of good deeds, I place thee safe with thy husband.

original: preto muñcāmi nāmutaḥ subaddhāmamutas karam
analyzed: pretaḥ muñcāmi na amutas su baddhām amutas karam
translated: I lead thee hither from thence, well-bound, from hence I make thee free.

original: yatheyamindra mīḍhvaḥ suputrā subhagāsati🔽pūṣā tveto nayatu hastagṛhyāśvinā tvā pra vahatāṃrathena
analyzed: yathā iyam indra mīḍhvaḥ su putrā subhagā asati  pūṣā tvā itas nayatu hasta gṛhya aśvinā tvā pra vahatāṃrathena
translated: So that thou, O thou of bounteous gifts, mayst have good sons and good fortune, O Indra.🔽Let Pusan lead thee hither, taking thee by the hand. Let the Asvins bear thee on their car.

original: gṛhān gacha gṛhapatnī yathāso vaśinī tvaṃvidathamā vadāsi
analyzed: gṛhān gacha gṛha patnī yathā asaḥ vaśinī tvaṃvidathamā vadāsi
translated: Go to the house, the mistress of the house. As thou art, so be thou powerful, speaking in the assembly.

original: iha priyaṃ prajayā te sam ṛdhyatāmasmin gṛhe gārhapatyāyajāgṛhi
analyzed: iha priyam prajayā te sam ṛdhyatām asmin gṛhe gārhapatyāya jāgṛhi
translated: Here let thy love of children prosper. In this house watch thou for the householder.

original: enā patyā tanvaṃ saṃ sṛjasvādhā jivrī vidathamā vadāthaḥ
analyzed: enā patyā tanvam sam sṛjasva adhā jivrī vidathamā vadāthaḥ
translated: With this husband unite thy body. Live thou long, speaking in the assembly.

original: nīlalohitaṃ bhavati kṛtyāsaktirvyajyate
analyzed: nīla lohitam bhavati kṛtyā āsaktiḥ vyajyate
translated: It becomes blue and red. The noose of witchcraft is seen.

original: edhante asyājñātayaḥ patirbandheṣu badhyate
analyzed: edhante asya ajñātayaḥ patiḥ bandheṣu badhyate
translated: Her kinsmen prosper. The husband is bound in fetters.

original: parā dehi śāmulyaṃ brahmabhyo vi bhajā vasu
analyzed: parā dehi śāmulyam brahmabhyaḥ vi bhajā vasu
translated: Give up the quarrel. Divide the wealth among the priests.

original: kṛtyaiṣāpadvatī bhūtvyā jāyā viśate patim
analyzed: kṛtyā eṣā āpadvatī bhūtvā ā jāyā viśate patim
translated: This wife, having become a misfortune, enters her husband.

original: aśrīrā tanūrbhavati ruśatī pāpayāmuyā
analyzed: aśrīrā tanūḥ bhavati ruśatī pāpayā amuyā
translated: The body becomes ugly, repulsive, with evil-smelling discharge,

original: patiryadvadhvo vāsasā svamaṅgamabhidhitsate
analyzed: patiḥ yat vadhvaḥ vāsasā svam aṅgam abhidhitsate
translated: When the husband covers his own body with the garment of the bride.

original: ye vadhvaścandraṃ vahatuṃ yakṣmā yanti janādanu
analyzed: ye vadhvaḥ candram vahatum yakṣmāḥ yanti janāt anu
translated: Those who follow the people and go to the bride's house with the disease of consumption,

original: punastān yajñiyā devā nayantu yata āgatāḥ🔽mā vidan paripanthino ya āsīdanti dampatī
analyzed: punar tān yajñiyāḥ devāḥ nayantu yatas āgatāḥ  mā vidan paripanthinaḥ ye āsīdanti dampatī
translated: May the divine ones who are worthy of sacrifice lead them back to where they came from.🔽May the enemies who lie in wait for the newlyweds as they go along the road,

original: sugebhirdurgamatītāmapa drāntvarātayaḥ
analyzed: sugebhiḥ durgam atītām apa drāntu arātayaḥ
translated: May the evil spirits flee away, and may they go by easy paths.

original: sumaṅgalīriyaṃ vadhūrimāṃ sameta paśyata
analyzed: su maṅgalīḥ iyam vadhūḥ imām sameta paśyata
translated: This bride is auspicious, look upon her with favor,

original: saubhāgyamasyai dattvāyāthāstaṃ vi paretana
analyzed: saubhāgyam asyai dattvāya atha astam vi parā itana
translated: Having given her good fortune, go away as you came.

original: tṛṣṭametat kaṭukametadapāṣṭhavad viṣavan naitadattave
analyzed: tṛṣṭam etat kaṭukam etat apāṣṭhavat viṣavat na etat attave
translated: This is bitter, this is harsh, like a poisonous plant, it should not be eaten.

original: sūryāṃ yo brahmā vidyāt sa id vādhūyamarhati
analyzed: sūryām yaḥ brahmā vidyāt saḥ id vādhūyam arhati
translated: Only he who knows the sun as Brahman is worthy of the bride.

original: āśasanaṃ viśasanamatho adhivikartanam
analyzed: āśasanam viśasanam atho adhivikartanam
translated: The cutting, the carving, and the cutting up,

original: sūryāyaḥ paśyarūpāṇi tāni brahmā tu śundhati🔽gṛbhṇāmi te saubhagatvāya hastaṃ mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiryathāsaḥ
analyzed: sūrya ayaḥ paśya rūpāṇi tāni brahmā tu śundhati  gṛbhṇāmi te saubhaga tvāya hastam mayā patyā jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā asaḥ
translated: The sun sees the forms, but the Brahman purifies them.🔽I take your hand for good fortune, may I be to you a husband of long life.

original: bhago aryamā savitā purandhirmahyaṃ tvādurgārhapatyāya devāḥ
analyzed: bhagaḥ aryamā savitā purandhiḥ mahyam tvā a dus gārhapatyāya devāḥ
translated: May Bhaga, Aryaman, Savitar, Purandhi, the gods, give her to me for the household fire.

original: tāṃ pūṣañchivatamāmerayasva yasyāṃ bījaṃ manuṣyāvapanti
analyzed: tām pūṣan śivatamām erayasva yasyām bījam manuṣya āvapanti
translated: O Pusan, bring her to me, the most auspicious one, in whom men sow their seed.

original: yā na ūrū uśatī viśrayāte yasyāmuśantaḥpraharāma śepam
analyzed: yā naḥ ūrū uśatī viśrayāte yasyām uśantaḥ praharāma śepam
translated: whose thighs the eager one embraces, in whom the eager one thrusts his member

original: tubhyamagre paryavahan sūryāṃ vahatunā saha🔽punaḥpatibhyo jāyāṃ dā agne prajayā saha
analyzed: tubhyam agre paryavahan sūryām vahatunā saha  punaḥpatibhyaḥ jāyām dāḥ agne prajayā saha
translated: first they brought the sun to you together with the carrying🔽you have given back the wife to her husbands, O Agni, together with offspring

original: punaḥ patnīmagniradādāyuṣā saha varcasā
analyzed: punar patnīm agniḥ adāt āyuṣā saha varcasā
translated: Agni has given back the wife to him together with life and splendor

original: dīrghāyurasyā yaḥ patirjīvāti śaradaḥ śatam
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ asyāḥ yaḥ patiḥ jīvāti śaradaḥ śatam
translated: long-lived be the husband of this one, may he live a hundred autumns

original: somaḥ prathamo vivide gandharvo vivida uttaraḥ
analyzed: somaḥ prathamaḥ vivide gandharvaḥ vivide uttaraḥ
translated: Soma first found her, the Gandharva found her next

original: tṛtīyoagniṣ ṭe patisturīyaste manuṣyajāḥ🔽somo dadad gandharvāya gandharvo dadadagnaye
analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ agniḥ te patiḥ turīyaḥ te manuṣya jāḥ  somaḥ dadat gandharvāya gandharvaḥ dadat agnaye
translated: Agni is your third husband, your fourth is a man🔽Soma gave her to the Gandharva, the Gandharva gave her to Agni

original: rayiṃ caputrāṃścādādagnirmahyamatho imām
analyzed: rayim ca putrān ca adāt agniḥ mahyam atha u imām
translated: Agni gave me wealth and sons, and also this one

original: ihaiva staṃ mā vi yauṣṭaṃ viśvamāyurvyaśnutam
analyzed: iha eva stam mā vi viśvam āyuḥ vyaśnutam
translated: do not be separated from him here, attain full life

original: kṝḷantau putrairnaptṛbhirmodamānau sve gṛhe
analyzed: kṝḷantau putraiḥ naptṛbhiḥ modamānau sve gṛhe
translated: rejoicing with your sons and grandsons in your own house

original: ā naḥ prajāṃ hanayatu prajāpatirājarasāya samanaktvaryamā
analyzed: ā naḥ prajām hanayatu prajāpatiḥ āja rasāya samanaktu aryamā
translated: may Prajapati bring us offspring, may Aryaman anoint us with royal power

original: adurmaṅgalīḥ patilokamā viśa śaṃ no bhavadvipade śaṃ catuṣpade
analyzed: adurmaṅgalīḥ pati lokam ā viśa śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: go to the world of your husband, O auspicious one, be auspicious to us in misfortune and in good fortune

original: aghoracakṣurapatighnyedhi śivā paśubhyaḥ sumanāḥsuvarcāḥ
analyzed: aghora cakṣuḥ a pati ghnī edhi śivā paśubhyaḥ sumanāḥ suvarcāḥ
translated: be auspicious to cattle and men, be propitious to our offspring🔽be auspicious to our cattle, be propitious to our offspring

original: vīrasūrdevakāmā syonā śaṃ no bhava dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade
analyzed: vīra sūḥ deva kāmā syonā śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Be thou a mother of heroes, loving the gods, kindly to us, be thou auspicious to us, to the two-footed and to the four-footed.

original: imāṃ tvamindra mīḍhvaḥ suputrāṃ subhagāṃ kṛṇu
analyzed: imām tvam indra mīḍhvaḥ su putrām subhagām kṛṇu
translated: O Indra, the bountiful, make this well-born, well-favoured woman

original: daśāsyāṃ putrānā dhehi patimekādaśaṃ kṛdhi
analyzed: daśa asyām putrān ā dhehi patim ekādaśam kṛdhi
translated: give her ten sons, make her husband the eleventh.

original: samrājñī śvaśure bhava samrājñī śvaśrvāṃ bhava🔽nanāndari samrājñī bhava samrājñī adhi devṛṣu
analyzed: samrājñī śvaśure bhava samrājñī śvaśrvām bhava  nanāndari samrājñī bhava samrājñī adhi devṛṣu
translated: Be a queen to thy father-in-law, be a queen to thy mother-in-law,🔽be a queen to thy sister-in-law, be a queen over the kinsmen.🔽May all the gods agree, may the waters agree with our hearts,

original: samañjantu viśve devāḥ samāpo hṛdayāni nau🔽sammātariśvā saṃ dhātā samu deṣṭrī dadhātu nau
analyzed: samañjantu viśve devāḥ sama apaḥ hṛdayāni nau  sam mātariśvā sam dhātā samu deṣṭrī dadhātu nau
translated: may the all-creating Dhatr, and the all-directing Aditi agree with us.

original: vi hi sotorasṛkṣata nendraṃ devamamaṃsata
analyzed: vi hi sotoḥ asṛkṣata na indram devam amaṃsata
translated: For the two pressers have flowed apart, they have not thought of the god Indra,

original: yatrāmadadvṛṣākapiraryaḥ puṣṭeṣu matsakhā viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: yatra amadat vṛṣākapiḥ aryaḥ puṣṭeṣu mad sakhā viśvasmāt indrauttaraḥ
translated: where the bull Vr̥ishâkapa, the foe, has intoxicated my friend among the nourished ones. Indra is supreme over all.

original: parā hīndra dhāvasi vṛṣākaperati vyathiḥ
analyzed: parā hi indra dhāvasi vṛṣākapeḥ ati vyathiḥ
translated: Thou runnest away, O Indra, beyond the distress of Vr̥ishâkapa,

original: no aha pravindasyanyatra somapītaye viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: na u aha pravindasi anyatra soma pītaye viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: thou findest not the Soma draught elsewhere. Indra is supreme over all.

original: kimayaṃ tvāṃ vṛṣākapiścakāra harito mṛgaḥ
analyzed: kim ayam tvām vṛṣākapiḥ cakāra haritaḥ mṛgaḥ
translated: What hath this Vr̥ishâkapa, the tawny beast, done to thee,

original: yasmāirasyasīdu nvaryo vā puṣṭimad vasu viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: nu aryaḥ vā puṣṭimat vasu viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: that thou art so angry, O Aryaman, or hast thou not obtained wealth that is nourishing? Indra is supreme over all.

original: yamimaṃ tvaṃ vṛṣākapiṃ priyamindrābhirakṣasi
analyzed: yam imam tvam vṛṣākapim priyam indra abhirakṣasi
translated: Whom, O Indra, thou protectest, this Vr̥ishâkapa, as a dear friend,

original: śvā nvasya jambhisadapi karṇe varahayurviśvasmadindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: śvā nu asya jambhisad api karṇe vara hayuḥ viśvasmat indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: The dog is in his mouth, the boar in his ear, the horse in all his limbs, Indra is above all.

original: priyā taṣṭāni me kapirvyaktā vyadūduṣat
analyzed: priyā taṣṭāni me kapiḥ vyaktā vyadūduṣat
translated: The monkey has burst open the dear ones fashioned by the carpenter.

original: śiro nvasya rāviṣaṃ na sugaṃ duṣkṛte bhuvaṃ viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: śiraḥ nu asya rāviṣam na sugam duṣkṛte bhuvam viśvasmāt indrauttaraḥ
translated: I will tear out his head, it will not be easy for the wicked one to find a place, Indra is above all.

original: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat
analyzed: na mat strī subhasattarā na suyāśutarā bhuvat
translated: No woman is more beautiful than me, no woman is swifter than me,

original: na matpraticyavīyasī na sakthyudyamīyasī viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: na mat praticyavīyasī na sakthi udyamīyasī viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: no woman is more skilled than me, no woman has stronger thighs than me, Indra is above all.

original: uve amba sulābhike yathevāṅga bhaviṣyati
analyzed: amba su lābhike yathā iva aṅga bhaviṣyati
translated: O mother, easy to obtain, as if you were my limb,

original: bhasan me ambasakthi me śiro me vīva hṛṣyati viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ🔽kiṃ subāho svaṅgure pṛthuṣṭo pṛthujāghane
analyzed: bhasad me amba sakthi me śiraḥ me vi iva hṛṣyati viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ  kim su bāho su aṅgure
translated: my buttocks ache, my head throbs, as if it were bursting, Indra is above all.🔽O you with beautiful arms, with strong thighs, with broad hips, with broad buttocks,

original: kiṃ śūrapatninastvamabhyamīṣi vṛṣākapiṃ viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: kim śūra patninaḥ tvam abhyamīṣi vṛṣākapim viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: why do you despise Vṛṣākapi, the wife of a hero? Indra is above all.

original: avīrāmiva māmayaṃ śarārurabhi manyate
analyzed: avīrām iva mām ayam śarāruḥ abhi manyate
translated: This wicked one thinks of me as if I were powerless,

original: utāhamasmivīriṇīndrapatnī marutsakhā viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: uta aham asmi vīriṇī indra patnī marut sakhā viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: but I am a hero's wife, the wife of Indra, the friend of the Maruts, Indra is above all.

original: saṃhotraṃ sma purā nārī samanaṃ vāva gachati
analyzed: saṃhotram sma purā nārī samanam vāva gacchati
translated: In the past, a woman used to go to the Saman assembly as a Saman priest,

original: vedhāṛtasya vīriṇīndrapatnī mahīyate viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: vedhā aṛtasya vīriṇī indra patnī mahīyate viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: the wife of Indra, the discoverer of the truth, is honored, Indra is above all.

original: indrāṇīmāsu nāriṣu subhagāmahamaśravam
analyzed: indrāṇi imāsu nāriṣu subhagām aham aśravam
translated: I have heard that among all women Indra's wife is the most fortunate

original: nahyasyāaparaṃ cana jarasā marate patirviśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: na hi asyāḥ aparam cana jarasā marate patiḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: For her husband does not die before her, by old age, Indra is superior to all

original: nāhamindrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyurvṛṣākaperṛte
analyzed: na aham indrāṇi rāraṇa sakhyuḥ vṛṣākapeḥ ṛte
translated: I do not delight, O Indra's wife, except in the friend of Vrishākapi

original: yasyedamapyaṃ haviḥ priyaṃ deveṣu gachati viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: yasya idam apyam haviḥ priyam deveṣu gacchati viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: Whose dear oblation goes to the gods, Indra is superior to all

original: vṛṣākapāyi revati sūputra ādu susnuṣe
analyzed: vṛṣākapāyi revati su putre ādu su snuṣe
translated: O Revati, to the wife of Vrishākapi, to the good mother and good daughter-in-law

original: ghasat ta indraukṣaṇaḥ priyaṃ kācitkaraṃ havirviśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: ghasat te indraukṣaṇaḥ priyam kācitkaram haviḥ viśvasmāt indrauttaraḥ
translated: May Indra enjoy your dear oblation, which makes him glad, Indra is superior to all

original: ukṣṇo hi me pañcadaśa sākaṃ pacanti viṃśatim
analyzed: ukṣṇaḥ hi me pañcadaśa sākam pacanti viṃśatim
translated: For fifteen bulls they cook for me together with twenty

original: utāhamadmi pīva idubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: uta aham admi pīvaḥ id ubhā kukṣī pṛṇanti me viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: And I eat well, both my bellies are filled by them, Indra is superior to all

original: vṛṣabho na tigmaśṛṅgo 'ntaryūtheṣu roruvat
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ na tigma śṛṅgaḥ ntar yūtheṣu roruvat
translated: Like a bull with sharp horns, roaring among the herds

original: manthastaindra śaṃ hṛde yaṃ te sunoti bhāvayurviśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: manthaḥ taindra śam hṛde yam te sunoti bhāvayuḥ viśvasmāt indrauttaraḥ
translated: The churner, the friend of Indra, whom the pious one presses for you, Indra is superior to all

original: na seśe yasya rambate 'ntarā sakthyā kapṛt
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya rambate ntarā kapṛth
translated: He is not a lord whose knee cap rattles inside

original: sedīśeyasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate viśvasmāt indrauttaraḥ
translated: He is a lord whose hairy knee cap trembles when he sits down, Indra is superior to all

original: na seśe yasya romaśaṃ niṣeduṣo vijṛmbhate
analyzed: na sa īśe yasya romaśam niṣeduṣaḥ vijṛmbhate
translated: He is not a lord whose hairy knee cap trembles when he sits down

original: sedīśeyasya rambate 'ntarā sakthyā kapṛd viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: rambate ntarā kapṛth viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: He who is the lord of this, his knee trembles within, the goat is for all, Indra is above.

original: ayamindra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantaṃ hataṃ vidat
analyzed: ayam indra vṛṣākapiḥ parasvantam hatam vidat
translated: This Indra, Vṛṣākapi, has found the slain one who had much wealth.

original: asiṃsūnāṃ navaṃ carumādedhasyāna ācitaṃ viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: asiṃsūnām navam carum ā dedhasya anaḥ ācitam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: Of the weavers, the new food, the woven, the piled up, for all, Indra is above.

original: ayamemi vicākaśad vicinvan dāsamāryam
analyzed: ayam emi vicākaśat vicinvan dāsam āryam
translated: I go forth, looking around, seeking the noble slave.

original: pibāmipākasutvano 'bhi dhīramacākaśaṃ viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: pibāmipākasutvanaḥ bhi dhīram acākaśam viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: I will drink, O son of Pāk, I have looked up to the wise one, for all, Indra is above.

original: dhanva ca yat kṛntatraṃ ca kati svit tā vi yojanā
analyzed: dhanva ca yat kṛntatram ca kati svid tā vi yojanā
translated: How many are the joints of the bow and the sword?

original: nedīyāso vṛṣākape 'stamehi gṛhānupa viśvasmādindrauttarah
analyzed: nedīyāsaḥ vṛṣākape stam ehi gṛhān upa viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: Come near, O Vṛṣākapi, come to the house, for all, Indra is above.

original: punarehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai
analyzed: punar ehi vṛṣākape suvitā kalpayāvahai
translated: Come back, O Vṛṣākapi, let us arrange good fortune.

original: ya eṣasvapnanaṃśano 'stameṣi patha punarviśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ stam eṣi patha punar viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: You who go back along the path, O Vṛṣākapi, to the one who devours dreams, for all, Indra is above.

original: yadudañco vṛṣākape gṛhamindrājagantana
analyzed: yat udañcaḥ vṛṣākape gṛham indra ajagantana
translated: When you, O Vṛṣākapi, went to the house, O Indra,

original: kva sya pulvaghomṛgaḥ kamagañ janayopano viśvasmādindra uttaraḥ
analyzed: kva sya pulu aghaḥ mṛgaḥ kam agam jana yopanaḥ viśvasmāt indraḥ uttaraḥ
translated: where is that wicked deer? Where did he go, the one who is near the people? For all, Indra is above.

original: parśurha nāma mānavi sākaṃ sasūva viṃśa tim
analyzed: parśuḥ ha nāma mānavi sākam sasūva viṃśa tim
translated: The axe, O Mānavi, that is his name, she bore twenty at once.

original: bhadrambhala tyasyā abhūd yasyā udaramamayad viśvasmādindrauttaraḥ
analyzed: bhadrambhala viśvasmāt indra auttaraḥ
translated: Blessed is the one whose womb he filled, for all, Indra is above.

original: rakṣohaṇaṃ vājinamā jigharmi mitraṃ prathiṣṭhamupayāmi śarma
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇam vājinam ā jigharmi mitram prathiṣṭham upayāmi śarma
translated: I warm the mighty Rakshas-slayer, I approach the widest shelter, the Friend.

original: śiśāno agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa nodivā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
analyzed: śiśānaḥ agniḥ kratubhiḥ samiddhaḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
translated: Agni, sharpened by holy rites, enkindled, may he by day and night protect us from distress.

original: ayodaṃṣṭro arciṣā yātudhānānupa spṛśa jātavedaḥsamiddhaḥ
analyzed: ayaḥ daṃṣṭraḥ arciṣā yātudhānān upa spṛśa jātavedaḥ samiddhaḥ
translated: With thy flame, O all-knower, touch the Rakshasas with thy iron teeth, when thou art enkindled.

original: ā jihvayā muradevān rabhasva kravyādo vṛktvyapi dhatsvāsan
analyzed: ā jihvayā muradevān rabhasva kravyādaḥ vṛktvī api dhatsva āsan
translated: Seize the Murundhas with thy tongue. Devour the flesh-eaters, O thou that art chosen.

original: ubhobhayāvinnupa dhehi daṃṣṭrā hiṃsraḥ śiśāno 'varamparaṃ ca
analyzed: ubhā ubhayāvin upa dhehi daṃṣṭrā hiṃsraḥ śiśānaḥ varamparam ca
translated: O thou that art both ways victorious, set thy teeth together. The fierce one, sharpened, [seizes] the lower and the upper.

original: utāntarikṣe pari yāhi rājañ jambhaiḥ sandhehyabhi yātudhānān
analyzed: uta antarikṣe pari yāhi rājam jambhaiḥ sandhehi abhi yātudhānān
translated: And, O king, go round in the atmosphere. With thy jaws seize the Rakshasas.

original: yajñairiṣūḥ saṃnamamāno agne vācā śalyānaśanibhirdihānaḥ
analyzed: yajñaiḥ iṣūḥ saṃnamamānaḥ agne vācā śalyān aśanibhiḥ dihānaḥ
translated: Sharpening thy arrows with sacrifices, O Agni, anointing thy shaft with speech and darts,

original: tābhirvidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīco bāhūnprati bhaṃdhyeṣām
analyzed: tābhiḥ vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān pratīcaḥ bāhūn prati bhaṃdhi eṣām
translated: With them pierce the Rakshasas in the heart. Bind their arms behind their backs.

original: agne tvacaṃ yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsrāśanirharasāhantvenam
analyzed: agne tvacam yātudhānasya bhindhi hiṃsra aśaniḥ harasā ahantu enam
translated: O Agni, rend the skin of the Rakshasa. Let the fierce dart, the slayer, strike him.

original: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyātkraviṣṇurvi cinotu vṛkṇam
analyzed: pra parvāṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kravyād kraviṣṇuḥ vi cinotu vṛkṇam
translated: Sharpen the joints, O all-knower. Let the flesh-eater, the devourer of raw flesh, tear the rent asunder.

original: yatredānīṃ paśyasi jātavedastiṣṭhantamagna uta vācarantam
analyzed: yatra idānīm paśyasi jātavedaḥ tiṣṭhantam agne uta vā ācarantam
translated: Where thou seest him now, O all-knower, standing or moving about, O Agni,

original: yad vāntarikṣe pathibhiḥ patantaṃ tamastāvidhya śarvā śiśānaḥ
analyzed: yat vā antarikṣe pathibhiḥ patantam śarvā śiśānaḥ
translated: When Sharva, sharpening himself, pierced thee with his arrows as thou fliest through the paths of air,

original: utālabdhaṃ spṛṇuhi jātaveda ālebhānād ṛṣṭibhiryātudhānāt
analyzed: uta ālabdham spṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ ālebhānāt ṛṣṭibhiḥ yātudhānāt
translated: Do thou, O Jâtavedas, win that which thou hast not obtained, with thy tongues from the Raksas, from the Yâtu.

original: agne pūrvo ni jahi śośucāna āmādaḥkṣviṅkāstamadantvenīḥ
analyzed: agne pūrvaḥ ni jahi śośucānaḥ
translated: O Agni, burn him first who is inflamed with rage: let the raw-devouring flames of fire consume him.

original: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ so agne yo yātudhāno ya idaṃkṛṇoti
analyzed: iha pra brūhi yatamaḥ saḥ agne yaḥ yātudhānaḥ yaḥ idaṃkṛṇoti
translated: Here speak thou forth, O Agni, who he is, who is a Yâtu, who hath done this thing.

original: tamā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛcakṣasaścakṣuṣe randhayainam
analyzed: tam ā rabhasva samidhā yaviṣṭha nṛ cakṣasaḥ cakṣuṣe randhaya enam
translated: Seize him, O thou most youthful God, with fuel: for the eye of man, O thou who lookest on mankind, destroy him.

original: tīkṣṇenāgne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñaṃ prāñcaṃ vasubhyaḥpra ṇaya pracetaḥ
analyzed: tīkṣṇena agne cakṣuṣā rakṣa yajñam prāñcam vasubhyaḥ pra naya pracetaḥ
translated: With thy keen eye, O Agni, guard the sacrifice: lead it forward to the Vasus, O thou Wise One.

original: hiṃsraṃ rakṣāṃsyabhi śośucānammā tvā dabhan yātudhānā nṛcakṣaḥ
analyzed: hiṃsram rakṣāṃsi abhi śośuca anam mā tvā dabhan yātudhānāḥ nṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: Let not the Yâtudhâna, O thou who lookest on mankind, deceive thee, burning against the Raksas.

original: nṛcakṣā rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi pratiśṛṇīhyagrā🔽tasyāgne pṛṣṭīrharasā śṛṇīhi tredhāmūlaṃ yātudhānasya vṛśca
analyzed: nṛ cakṣāḥ rakṣaḥ pari paśya vikṣu tasya trīṇi pratiśṛṇīhi agrā  tasya agne pṛṣṭīḥ harasā śṛṇīhi tredhā mūlam yātudhānasya vṛśca
translated: Look round thee, O thou who lookest on mankind, on the Raksases in all their haunts. Destroy thou three of their heads.🔽Rend thou, O Agni, with thy flame the joints of him, and cut thou off the root of the Yâtudhâna in three places.

original: triryātudhānaḥ prasitiṃ ta etv ṛtaṃ yo agne anṛtena hanti
analyzed: tris yātudhānaḥ prasitim te etu ṛtam yaḥ agne anṛtena hanti
translated: Let the Yâtudhâna thrice go to his ruin, he who, O Agni, with untruth assails thee with truth.

original: tamarciṣā sphūrjayañ jātavedaḥ samakṣamenaṃ gṛṇateni vṛṃdhi
analyzed: tam arciṣā sphūrjayam jātavedaḥ samakṣam enam vṛṃdhi
translated: With thy flame, O all-knower, drive him to our front, and give him up to him who lauds thee.

original: tadagne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujaṃ yenapaśyasi yātudhānam
analyzed: tat agne cakṣuḥ prati dhehi rebhe śaphārujam yena paśyasi yātudhānam
translated: O Agni, O singer, grant me that eye whereby I may behold the Yātudhāna who breaks the fetters.

original: atharvavajjyotiṣā daivyena satyandhūrvantamacitaṃ nyoṣa
analyzed: atharva vat jyotiṣā daivyena satyan dhūrvantam acitam nyoṣa
translated: With the divine light of the Atharvan, with the true thunderbolt, drive away the wicked.

original: yadagne adya mithunā śapāto yad vācastṛṣṭaṃ janayantarebhāḥ
analyzed: yat agne adya mithunā śapātaḥ yat vācaḥ tṛṣṭam janayanta rebhāḥ
translated: Whatever curse, O Agni, the pairs have uttered today, whatever the discordant people have sharpened with their words,

original: manyormanasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhyahṛdaye yātudhānān
analyzed: manyoḥ manasaḥ śaravyā jāyate yā tayā vidhya hṛdaye yātudhānān
translated: The arrow is born from the mind and the heart; with that pierce the hearts of the Yātudhānas.

original: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parāgne rakṣo harasāśṛṇīhi🔽parārciṣā mūradevāñchṛṇīhi parāsutṛpo abhiśośucānaḥ
analyzed: parā śṛṇīhi tapasā yātudhānān parā agne rakṣaḥ harasā āśṛṇīhi  parā arciṣā mūradevān śṛṇīhi parā asutṛpaḥ abhiśośucānaḥ
translated: Sharpen the Yātudhānas with thy heat, O Agni, sharpen the Rakṣas with thy flame, O powerful one.🔽Sharpen the Mūrti-devas with thy flame, O powerful one, burn the evil-minded with thy heat.

original: parādya devā vṛjinaṃ śṛṇantu pratyagenaṃ śapathā yantutṛṣṭāḥ
analyzed: parā adya devāḥ vṛjinam śṛṇantu pratyak enam śapathāḥ yantu tṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Let the gods today sharpen the wicked one; let the curses, sharpened by the people, turn against him.

original: vācāstenaṃ śarava ṛchantu marman viśvasyaituprasitiṃ yātudhānaḥ
analyzed: vācāstenam śaravaḥ ṛchantu marman viśvasya aituprasitim yātudhānaḥ
translated: Let the words pierce him to the quick; let the Yātudhāna go to all destruction.

original: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yo aśveyena paśunāyātudhānaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ pauruṣeyeṇa kraviṣā samaṅkte yaḥ aśveyena paśunā a yātudhānaḥ
translated: He who is smeared with human blood, he who is a Yātudhāna with the blood of a horse-sacrifice,

original: yo aghnyāyā bharati kṣīramagne teṣāṃśīrṣāṇi harasāpi vṛśca
analyzed: yaḥ aghnyāyāḥ bharati kṣīram agne teṣām śīrṣāṇi harasā api vṛśca
translated: He who milks the cow that should not be milked, O Agni, crush with thy flame their heads.

original: saṃvatsarīṇaṃ paya usriyāyāstasya māśīd yātudhānonṛcakṣaḥ
analyzed: saṃvatsarīṇam payaḥ usriyāyāḥ tasya mā aśīt yātudhānā unṛ cakṣaḥ
translated: Let not the Yātudhāna, the man of evil eyes, drink the milk of the cow that yields milk for a year.

original: pīyūṣamagne yatamastitṛpsāt taṃ pratyañcamarciṣā vidhya marman
analyzed: pīyūṣam agne yatamaḥ titṛpsāt tam pratyañcam arciṣā vidhya marman
translated: O Agni, whoever thirsts for nectar, pierce him with thy flame, pierce him in his vital parts.

original: viṣaṃ gavāṃ yātudhānāḥ pibantvā vṛścyantāmaditayedurevāḥ
analyzed: viṣam gavām yātudhānāḥ pibantvā vṛścyantām aditayā idurevāḥ
translated: Let the demons drink the poison of the cows. Let the evil ones be cut off for Aditi.

original: parainān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgamoṣadhīnāṃ jayantām🔽sanādagne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsujigyuḥ🔽anu daha sahamūrān kravyādo mā te hetyā mukṣatadaivyāyāḥ
analyzed: parā enān devaḥ savitā dadātu parā bhāgam oṣadhīnām jayantām  sanāt agne mṛṇasi yātudhānān na tvā rakṣāṃsi pṛtanāsu jigyuḥ  anu daha sahamūrān kravyādaḥ mā te hetyāḥ mukṣata daivyāyāḥ
translated: May the god Savitar give them away. May they be defeated, the shares of the plants.🔽From of old, O Agni, thou crushest the demons. The Rakshas have not conquered thee in battles.🔽Burn them, O thou of mighty strength, with thy flame. Let not the divine dart of thine escape.

original: tvaṃ no agne adharādudaktāt tvaṃ paścāduta rakṣāpurastāt
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne adharāt udaktāt tvam paścāt uta rakṣa apurastāt
translated: From below, O Agni, from above, from behind, from the front, protect us.

original: prati te te ajarāsastapiṣṭhā aghaśaṃsaṃśośucato dahantu🔽paścāt purastādadharādudaktāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhirājan
analyzed: prati te te ajarāsaḥ tapiṣṭhāḥ agha śaṃsam śośucataḥ dahantu  paścāt purastāt adharāt udaktāt kaviḥ kāvyena pari pāhi rājan
translated: Let thy most burning, undecaying flames burn up the evil-doer.🔽From behind, from the front, from below, from above, O wise one, protect us with thy wisdom, O king.

original: sakhe sakhāyamajaro jarimṇe 'gne martānamartyastvaṃ naḥ
analyzed: sakhe sakhāyam ajaraḥ jarimṇe gne martān amartyaḥ tvam naḥ
translated: O Agni, as a friend, O immortal one, protect thy friend from old age, O thou that art immortal among mortals.

original: pari tvāgne puraṃ vayaṃ vipraṃ sahasya dhīmahi🔽dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ divedive hantāraṃ bhaṅgurāvatām
analyzed: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi  dhṛṣat varṇam dive dive hantāram bhaṅgurāvatām
translated: We will place thee, O Agni, as a fort, as a wise one, as a hero, in front.🔽The red-hued one, day by day, the destroyer of the unsteady ones.

original: viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati ṣma rakṣaso daha
analyzed: viṣeṇa bhaṅgurāvataḥ prati sma rakṣasaḥ daha
translated: With poison, O unsteady one, burn up the Rakshas with thy dart.

original: agnetigmena śociṣā tapuragrābhirṛṣṭibhiḥ
analyzed: agne tigmena śociṣā tapuḥ agrābhiḥ ṛṣṭibhiḥ
translated: O Agni, with thy sharp flame, with thy spears that grasp fiercely,

original: pratyagne mithuna daha yātudhānā kimīdinā
analyzed: pratyagne mithuna daha yātudhānā kimīdinā
translated: O Agni, burn the pairs of demons, the Kimīdins,

original: saṃ tvāśiśāmi jābṛhyadabdhaṃ vipra manmabhiḥ
analyzed: sam tvā āśiśāmi vipra manmabhiḥ
translated: I, O Jābriha, with thoughts, thee the uninjured, I, the sage, I strengthen.

original: pratyagne harasā haraḥ śṛṇīhi viśvataḥ prati
analyzed: prati agne harasā haraḥ śṛṇīhi viśvatas prati
translated: O Agni, with thy flame, O flame, burn on all sides

original: yātudhānasya rakṣaso balaṃ vi ruja vīryam
analyzed: yātudhānasya rakṣasaḥ balam vi ruja vīryam
translated: The strength of the demon, the Rākṣasa, the Yātudhāna, destroy his vigour.

original: haviṣ pāntamajaraṃ svarvidi divispṛśyāhutaṃ juṣṭamagnau
analyzed: haviḥ pāntam ajaram svarvidi divispṛśi āhutam juṣṭam agnau
translated: The immortal protector of the oblation in the heaven-like sky, offered in the heaven-reaching fire, acceptable.

original: tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devā dharmaṇe kaṃsvadhayā paprathanta
analyzed: tasya bharmaṇe bhuvanāya devāḥ dharmaṇe kaṃsvadhayā paprathanta
translated: For his bearing, for the world, the gods have extended him in his own abode, in his own law.

original: gīrṇaṃ bhuvanaṃ tamasapagūḷamāviḥ svarabhavajjāteagnau
analyzed: gīrṇam bhuvanam āvis svar abhavat jāte agnau
translated: The world, swallowed by darkness, was covered. Light arose from the born Agni.

original: tasya devāḥ pṛthivi dyaurutāpo 'raṇayannoṣadhīḥ sakhye asya
analyzed: tasya devāḥ pṛthivi dyauḥ uta apaḥ raṇayan oṣadhīḥ sakhye asya
translated: The gods, the earth, the sky, and the waters warmed him, and the plants, for his friendship.

original: devebhirnviṣito yajñiyebhiragniṃ stoṣāṇyajarambṛhantam
analyzed: devebhiḥ nu iṣitaḥ yajñiyebhiḥ agnim stoṣāṇi ajaram bṛhantam
translated: By the gods indeed, by the worthy ones, Agni, the undecaying great one, is sought. I will praise him.

original: yo bhānunā pṛthiviṃ dyāmutemāmātatānarodasī antarikṣam
analyzed: yaḥ bhānunā pṛthivim dyām uta imām ātatāna rodasī antarikṣam
translated: He who with his light has stretched out the earth, the sky, and these two worlds, the atmosphere.

original: yo hotāsīt prathamo devajuṣṭo yaṃ samañjannājyenāvṛṇānaḥ🔽sa patatrītvaraṃ stha jagad yacchvātramagnirakṛnojjātavedaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ hotā āsīt prathamaḥ deva juṣṭaḥ yam samañjan ājyena āvṛṇānaḥ  sa patatrītvaram stha jagat yat śvātram agniḥ akṛnot jātavedaḥ
translated: He who was the first Hotṛ, dear to the gods, whom they anointed with clarified butter, making him ready.🔽He, O ye two, has made the moving world, the light, the swift one, Agni, the all-knower.

original: yajjatavedo bhuvanasya mūrdhannatiṣṭho agne saha rocanena
analyzed: yat jata vedaḥ bhuvanasya mūrdhan atiṣṭhaḥ agne saha rocanena
translated: Thou who, O all-knower, standest on the head of the world, O Agni, with thy radiance.

original: taṃ tvahema matibhirgīrbhirukthaiḥ sa yajñiyo abhavorodasiprāḥ
analyzed: tam tvahema matibhiḥ gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ sa yajñiyaḥ abhava uroda siprāḥ
translated: him have they made with hymns and songs of praise meet for the worship of the two worldhalves

original: mūrdhā bhuvo bhavati naktamagnistataḥ suryo jāyateprātarudyan
analyzed: mūrdhā bhuvaḥ bhavati naktam agniḥ tatas suryaḥ jāyate prātar udyan
translated: he is the head of earth and of the night and from him is the sun when he ascends at dawn

original: mayāmu tu yajñiyānāmetamapo yattūrṇiścarati prajānan
analyzed: mayā āmu tu yajñiyānām etam apaḥ yat tūrṇiḥ carati prajānan
translated: he who knows well this order of the holy ones moves quickly through the waters

original: dṛśenyo yo mahinā samiddho 'rocata diviyonirvibhāvā
analyzed: dṛśenyaḥ yaḥ mahinā samiddhaḥ rocata diviyoniḥ vibhāvā
translated: he who is seen with majesty when kindled hath shone forth from the heaven his origin his light

original: tasminnagnau sūktavākena devā havirviśva ajuhavustanūpāḥ🔽sūktavakaṃ prathamamādidagnimādid dhavirajanayantadevāḥ
analyzed: tasmin agnau sūktavākena devāḥ haviḥ viśve ajuhavuḥ tanū pāḥ  sūktavakam prathamam ādit agnim ādit haviḥ ajanayanta devāḥ
translated: in him the gods who guard our life have offered oblations with the hymn in agni🔽the gods have made the hymn the first and agni and have produced in him the sacrificial food

original: sa eṣāṃ yajño abhavat tanūpastaṃ dyaurvedataṃ prithivi tamāpaḥ
analyzed: saḥ eṣām yajñaḥ abhavat tanū paḥ tam dyauḥ vedatam prithivi tam āpaḥ
translated: he became their sacrifice their guardian they know him heaven and earth and the waters

original: yaṃ devāso ajanayantāgniṃ yasminnājuhavurbhuvanāniviśvā
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ ajanayanta agnim yasmin ājuhavuḥ bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: the gods who have produced this agni in whom they have offered up all living creatures

original: so arciṣā pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemām ṛjūyamānoatapan mahitvā
analyzed: saḥ arciṣā pṛthivīm dyām uta imām ṛjūyamānaḥ atapat mahitvā
translated: he hath with his flame warmed this earth and heaven with his greatness as he moved along in order

original: stomena hi divi devāso agnimajījanañchaktibhīrodasiprām
analyzed: stomena hi divi devāsaḥ agnim ajījanan śaktibhīrodasiprām
translated: for by the hymn the gods in heaven have generated agni with their powers the worldpossessor

original: tamū akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kaṃ sa oṣadhīḥpacati viśvarūpāḥ
analyzed: tam ū akṛṇvan tredhā bhuve kam saḥ oṣadhīḥ pacati viśva rūpāḥ
translated: they have made him threefold for existence he cooks the plants of every form and colour

original: yadedenamadadhuryajñiyāso divi devāḥ sūryamāditeyam
analyzed: yadā id enam adadhuḥ yajñiyāsaḥ divi devāḥ sūryam āditeyam
translated: when the gods who are worthy of sacrifice have set him in heaven the son of aditi sūrya

original: yadā cariṣṇū mithunāvabhūtāmādit prāpaśyanbhuvanāni viśvā
analyzed: yadā cariṣṇū mithunau abhūtām ādit prāpaśyan bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: When the two moving twins became manifest, then he beheld all the worlds.

original: viśvasmā agniṃ bhuvanāya devā vaiśvānaraṃ ketumahnāmakṛṇvan
analyzed: viśvasmai agnim bhuvanāya devāḥ vaiśvānaram ketum ahnām akṛṇvan
translated: The gods made Agni Vaiśvānara, the light of great names, for all the worlds.

original: ā yastatānoṣaso vibhātīrapo ūrṇoti tamoarciṣā yan
analyzed: ā yaḥ tatāna uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ apaḥ ūrṇoti tamaḥ arciṣā yan
translated: He who hath stretched out the shining dawns, who with his flame draweth the darkness from the waters,

original: vaiśvānaraṃ kavayo yajñiyāso 'gniṃ devā ajanayannajuryam
analyzed: vaiśvānaram kavayaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ gnim devāḥ ajanayan ajuryam
translated: The wise, the holy, the gods have generated Agni Vaiśvānara, the undecaying one.

original: nakṣatraṃ pratnamaminaccariṣṇu yakṣasyādhyakṣantaviṣaṃ bṛhantam
analyzed: nakṣatram pratnam aminat cariṣṇu yakṣasya adhyakṣantaviṣam bṛhantam
translated: The ancient, moving star, the great, far-reaching overseer of the Yakṣa,

original: vaiśvānaraṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsaṃ mantrairagniṃ kavimachā vadāmaḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānaram viśvahā dīdivāṃsam mantraiḥ agnim kavim achā vadāmaḥ
translated: We address with our hymns Agni Vaiśvānara, the shining one, the wise one, the god.

original: yo mahimnā paribabhūvorvī utāvastādutadevaḥ parastāt
analyzed: yaḥ mahimnā paribabhūva urvī uta avastāt uta devaḥ parastāt
translated: He who hath encompassed the two wide worlds in his greatness, the god who is beyond and below,

original: dve srutī aśṛṇavaṃ pitṝṇāmahaṃ devānāmutamartyānām
analyzed: dve srutī aśṛṇavam pitṝṇām aham devānām uta martyānām
translated: I have heard two paths of the fathers, of the gods and of mortals.

original: tābhyāmidaṃ viśvamejat sameti yadantarāpitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca
analyzed: tābhyām idam viśvam ejat sameti yat antarā pitaram mātaram ca
translated: On these two this whole moving world rests, that which is between the father and the mother.

original: dve samīcī bibhṛtaścarantaṃ śīrṣato jātaṃ manasāvimṛṣṭam
analyzed: dve samīcī bibhṛtaḥ carantam śīrṣataḥ jātam manasā a vimṛṣṭam
translated: The two straight-going, supporting ones move, born from the head, examined by the mind.

original: sa pratyaṃ viśvā bhuvanāni tasthāvaprayuchantaraṇirbhrājamānaḥ
analyzed: sa pratyam viśvā bhuvanāni tasthau aprayuchanta raṇiḥ bhrājamānaḥ
translated: He hath stood firm over all the worlds, the swift one, shining, not to be turned aside.

original: yatrā vadete avaraḥ paraśca yajñanyoḥ kataro nau vi veda
analyzed: yatra vadete avaraḥ paraḥ ca yajñanyoḥ kataraḥ nau vi veda
translated: Where the lower and the higher speak, which of the two knows us in the place of sacrifice?

original: ā śekurit sadhamādaṃ sakhāyo nakṣanta yajñaṃ kaidaṃ vi vocat
analyzed: ā śekuḥ id sadhamādam sakhāyaḥ nakṣanta yajñam kā idam vi vocat
translated: The friends have come to the common feast, they have reached the sacrifice, tell me this, ye who know.

original: katyagnayaḥ kati sūryāsaḥ katyuṣāsaḥ katyu svidāpaḥ
analyzed: kati agnayaḥ kati sūryāsaḥ kati uṣāsaḥ kati u svid apaḥ
translated: How many are the fires, how many suns, how many dawns, and how many waters?

original: nopaspijaṃ vaḥ pitaro vadāmi pṛchāmi vaḥ kavayovidmane kam
analyzed: na upaspijam vaḥ pitaraḥ vadāmi pṛcchāmi vaḥ kavayaḥ vidmane kam
translated: I speak to you, O Fathers, who are not to be deceived. I ask you, O wise ones, for the sake of knowledge.

original: yāvanmātramuṣaso na pratīkaṃ suparṇyo vasatemātariśvaḥ
analyzed: yāvanmātram uṣasaḥ na pratīkam suparṇyaḥ vasate mātariśvaḥ
translated: As far as the form of the dawns extends, O Suparṇī, O Mātariśvan,

original: tāvad dadhātyupa yajñamāyan brāhmaṇohoturavaro niṣīdan
analyzed: tāvat dadhāti upa yajñam āyan brāhmaṇaḥ hotuḥ avaraḥ niṣīdan
translated: so much does the Brāhmaṇa place in the sacrifice when he comes, sitting down as the Hotṛ's assistant.

original: indraṃ stavā nṛtamaṃ yasya mahnā vibabādhe rocanā vi jmoantān
analyzed: indram stavā nṛtamam yasya mahnā vibabādhe rocanā vi jmaḥ antān
translated: Praise Indra, best of men, by whose greatness he hath filled the luminous realms and the ends of the earth,

original: ā yaḥ paprau carṣaṇīdhṛd varobhiḥ prasindhubhyo riricāno mahitvā
analyzed: ā yaḥ paprau carṣaṇī dhṛt varobhiḥ prasindhubhyaḥ riricānaḥ mahitvā
translated: He who hath spread out the people with boons, overflowing with greatness beyond the rivers.

original: sa sūryaḥ paryurū varāṃsyendro vavṛtyād rathyevacakrā🔽atiṣṭhantamapasyaṃ na sargaṃ kṛṣṇā tamāṃsitviṣyā jaghāna
analyzed: sa sūryaḥ paryurū varāṃsi indraḥ vavṛtyāt rathyā iva cakrā  atiṣṭhantam apasyam na sargam kṛṣṇā tamāṃsi tviṣyā jaghāna
translated: That Indra hath turned away the boons, like a chariot its wheels, from the sun.🔽He hath struck down the black darkness that was seen to stand obstructing the creation.

original: samānamasmā anapāvṛdarca kṣmayā divo asamaṃ brahmanavyam🔽vi yaḥ pṛṣṭheva janimānyarya indraścikāya nasakhāyamīṣe
analyzed: samānam asmai an apāvṛt arca kṣmayā divaḥ asamam brahma navyam  vi yaḥ pṛṣṭhā iva janimāni aryaḥ indraḥ cikāya na sakhāyam īṣe
translated: He hath made the praise that is common to all, the unequalled prayer of the earth, to be turned away from him.🔽He who, like a back, hath looked upon the generations, Indra, hath not sought a friend.

original: indrāya giro aniśitasargā apaḥ prerayaṃ sagarasya budhnāt
analyzed: indrāya giraḥ aniśita sargāḥ apaḥ prerayam sagarasya budhnāt
translated: To Indra have been sent the songs with keen impulse, the waters from the depths of the ocean.

original: yo akṣeṇeva cakriyā śacībhirviṣvak tastambhapṛthivīmuta dyām🔽āpāntamanyustṛpalaprabharmā dhuniḥ śimīvāñcharumānṛjīṣī
analyzed: yaḥ akṣeṇa iva cakriyā śacībhiḥ viṣvak tastambha pṛthivīm uta dyām  āpāntamanyuḥ tṛpala prabharmā dhuniḥ śimīvān śarumān ṛjīṣī
translated: he who with dice and mighty power hath stayed on every side the earth and heaven🔽the impetuous one with wrath that knows no check the strong the mighty the impetuous one

original: somo viśvānyatasā vanāni nārvāgindrampratimānāni debhuḥ
analyzed: somaḥ viśvāni atasā vanāni na arvāk indram pratimānāni debhuḥ
translated: soma hath brought all woods to subjection and the gods have brought all things to indra

original: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī na dhanva nāntarikṣaṃ nādrayaḥsomo akṣāḥ
analyzed: na yasya dyāvāpṛthivī na dhanva na antarikṣam na adrayaḥ somaḥ akṣāḥ
translated: whose dice are not the heavens the earth the desert not the air not the mountains

original: yadasya manyuradhinīyamānaḥ sṛṇāti vīḷurujati sthirāṇi
analyzed: yat asya manyuḥ adhinīyamānaḥ sṛṇāti vīḷuḥ ujati sthirāṇi
translated: when his wrath is restrained he breaks the firm things and the strong things as a hatchet cuts the wood

original: jaghāna vṛtraṃ svadhitirvaneva ruroja puro aradan nasindhūn
analyzed: jaghāna vṛtram svadhitiḥ vanā iva ruroja puraḥ aradat na sindhūn
translated: he slew vṛtra as a wood with an axe he cleft the forts and dug the rivers as a plough

original: bibheda giriṃ navamin na kumbhamā gā indroakṛṇuta svayugbhiḥ
analyzed: bibheda girim navamin na kumbhamā gāḥ indraḥ akṛṇuta svayugbhiḥ
translated: he cleft the mountain as a bowl in the ninth month and with his friends indra made the kine

original: tvaṃ ha tyad ṛṇayā indra dhīro 'sirna parva vṛjināśṛṇāsi🔽pra ye mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma yujaṃ na janāminanti mitram
analyzed: tvam ha tyad ṛṇayāḥ indra dhīraḥ sirna parva vṛjinā aśṛṇāsi  pra ye mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma yujam na jana āminanti mitram
translated: thou art that indra who with ṛṇaya art wise as a stone art thou who breakest the joints🔽they who transgress the law of varuṇa and mitra as if they knew not mitra who is joined with them

original: pra ye mitraṃ prāryamaṇaṃ durevāḥ pra saṃgiraḥ pravaruṇaṃ minanti
analyzed: pra ye mitram pra aryamaṇam durevāḥ pra saṃgiraḥ pravaruṇam minanti
translated: they who transgress the law of mitra and aryaman and the holy songs and transgress varuṇa

original: nyamitreṣu vadhamindra tumraṃ vṛṣanvṛṣāṇamaruṣaṃ śiśīhi
analyzed: nyamitreṣu vadham indra tumram vṛṣan vṛṣāṇam aruṣam śiśīhi
translated: on those who hate us o indra sharpen thy strong weapon strong bull red bull

original: indro diva indra īśe pṛthivyā indro apāmindra itparvatānām
analyzed: indraḥ divaḥ indraḥ īśe pṛthivyāḥ indraḥ apām indraḥ id parvatānām
translated: Indra is lord of heaven, Indra of earth, Indra of waters, Indra of the mountains.

original: indro vṛdhāmindra in medhirāṇāmindraḥkṣeme yoge havya indraḥ🔽prāktubhya indraḥ pra vṛdho ahabhyaḥ prāntarikṣāt prasamudrasya dhāseḥ
analyzed: indraḥ vṛdhām indraḥ id medhirāṇām indraḥ kṣeme yoge havyaḥ indraḥ  pra aktubhyaḥ indraḥ pra vṛdhaḥ ahabhyaḥ pra antarikṣāt pra samudrasya dhāseḥ
translated: Indra is lord of the increasing, Indra of the wise, Indra of the prosperous union, Indra of the oblation.🔽Indra from the east, Indra from the increasers, Indra from the atmosphere, Indra from the abode of the ocean,

original: pra vātasya prathasaḥ pra jmo antātpra sindhubhyo ririce pra kṣitibhyaḥ
analyzed: pra vātasya prathasaḥ pra jmaḥ antāt pra sindhubhyaḥ ririce pra kṣitibhyaḥ
translated: Indra from the wind's course, from the ends of the earth, Indra from the rivers, Indra from the abodes.

original: pra śośucatyā uṣaso na keturasinvā te vartatāmindrahetiḥ🔽aśmeva vidhya diva ā sṛjānastapiṣṭhena heṣasādroghamitrān🔽anvaha māsā anvid vanānyanvoṣadhīranu parvatāsaḥ
analyzed: pra śośucatyāḥ uṣasaḥ na ketuḥ asin vā te vartatām indra hetiḥ  aśmā iva vidhya divaḥ ā sṛjānaḥ tapiṣṭhena heṣasā adrogha mitrān  anu aha māsāḥ anu id vanāni anu oṣadhīḥ anu parvatāsaḥ
translated: Like the light of the dawns, shine forth, O Indra, let thy dart move swiftly.🔽Pierce them as with a stone, O Indra, from heaven, with thy sharpest roar, the enemies.🔽After the days, the months, the woods, the plants, the mountains,

original: anvindraṃ rodasī vāvaśāne anvāpo ajihatajāyamānam
analyzed: anu indram rodasī vāvaśāne anu apaḥ ajihata jāyamānam
translated: After Indra, the two world-halves have bowed in worship, the waters have followed him as he was born.

original: karhi svit sā ta indra cetyāsadaghasya yad bhinado rakṣaeṣat
analyzed: karhi svid sā te indra cetyā asat aghasya yat bhinadaḥ rakṣaḥ eṣat
translated: When, O Indra, will that be for thee, when thou wilt burst open the sinner's stronghold?

original: mitrakruvo yacchasane na gāvaḥ pṛthivyā āpṛgamuyā śayante
analyzed: mitra kruvaḥ yat śasane na gāvaḥ pṛthivyāḥ āpṛgamuyā śayante
translated: Like cows in the pasture, the enemies lie down, covered by the earth, by the all-embracing one.

original: śatrūyanto abhi ye nastatasre mahi vrādhanta ogaṇāsaindra
analyzed: śatrūyantaḥ abhi ye nastatasre mahi vrādhantaḥ ogaṇāsa indra
translated: Those who have risen against us, who have spread themselves out, O Indra, the great, the arrogant,

original: andhenāmitrāstamasā sacantāṃ sujyotiṣo aktavastānabhi ṣyuḥ
analyzed: andhena amitrāḥ tamasā sacantām su jyotiṣaḥ aktavaḥ tān abhi syuḥ
translated: Let the enemies be covered with the blind darkness, let the well-lighted ones shine upon them.

original: purūṇi hi tvā savanā janānāṃ brahmāṇi mandan gṛṇatāmṛṣīṇām
analyzed: purūṇi hi tvā savanā janānām brahmāṇi mandan gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām
translated: For many are the libations of the people, the prayers of the singing sages delight thee.

original: imāmāghoṣannavasā sahūtiṃ tiro viśvānarcato yāhyarvāṃ🔽evā te vayamindra bhuñjatīnāṃ vidyāma sumatīnāṃnavānām🔽vidyāma vastoravasā gṛṇanto viśvāmitrā utata indra nūnam
analyzed: imām āghoṣan avasā sahūtim tiras viśvān arcataḥ yāhi arvān  eva te vayam indra bhuñjatīnām vidyāma sumatīnāṃnavānām  vidyāma vastoḥ avasā gṛṇantaḥ viśvāmitrāḥ utatas indra nūnam
translated: Announcing this praise with abundant invocation, pass over all the singing ones and come hither.🔽Thus, O Indra, may we enjoy thy most recent gracious favours.🔽May we, the Vishvadevas, singing with devotion, find that treasure, O Indra, even now.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānaṃ / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the lord of the ruddy cows, the breaker of forts, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the breaker of the stalls.

original: sahasraśīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasrākṣaḥ sahasrapāt
analyzed: sahasra śīrṣā puruṣaḥ sahasra akṣaḥ sahasra pād
translated: The thousand-headed Purusha, thousand-eyed, thousand-footed,

original: sabhūmiṃ viśvato vṛtvātyatiṣṭhad daśāṅgulam
analyzed: sa bhūmim viśvatas vṛtvā atyatiṣṭhat daśa aṅgulam
translated: pervading the earth on all sides, he extended ten fingers' width beyond.

original: puruṣa evedaṃ sarvaṃ yad bhūtaṃ yacca bhavyam
analyzed: puruṣaḥ eva idam sarvam yat bhūtam yat ca bhavyam
translated: This all that yet hath been and all that is to be,

original: utāmṛtatvasyeśāno yadannenātirohati
analyzed: uta amṛta tvasya īśānaḥ yat annena atirohati
translated: the lord of immortality which waxes greater still.

original: etāvānasya mahimāto jyāyāṃśca pūruṣaḥ🔽pādo 'syaviśvā bhūtāni tripādasyāmṛtaṃ divi
analyzed: etāvān asya mahimā atas jyāyān ca pūruṣaḥ  pādaḥ sya viśvā bhūtāni tri pādasya amṛtam divi
translated: Even so great is his greatness, greater than this is Purusha.🔽His foot is all that yet hath been and all that is to be;🔽on two feet he supports this universe.🔽The Purusha extends over three quarters of this (universe); a quarter of him is the immortal in heaven.

original: tripādūrdhva udait puruṣaḥ pādo 'syehābhavat punaḥ
analyzed: tri pād ūrdhvaḥ udait puruṣaḥ pādaḥ u sya iha abhavat punar
translated: Three feet of him are the mortal world; a quarter of him is the immortal in heaven.

original: tato viṣvaṃ vyakrāmat sāśanānaśane abhi
analyzed: tatas viṣvam vyakrāmat sa aśana anaśane abhi
translated: From that (quarter) he spread upwards and downwards with food and without food.

original: tasmād virāḷ ajāyata virājo adhi pūruṣaḥ
analyzed: tasmāt virāj ajāyata virājaḥ adhi pūruṣaḥ
translated: From that Virāj was born; from Virāj Purusha (was born).

original: sa jātoatyaricyata paścād bhūmimatho puraḥ
analyzed: sa jātaḥ atyaricyata paścāt bhūmim atho puras
translated: He, being born, surpassed the earth on all sides and in front.

original: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devā yajñamatanvata
analyzed: yat puruṣeṇa haviṣā devāḥ yajñam atanvata
translated: When the gods spread the sacrifice with the offering of Purusha,

original: vasantoasyāsīdājyaṃ grīṣma idhmaḥ śarad dhaviḥ
analyzed: vasantoasya āsīt ājyam grīṣmaḥ idhmaḥ śarad haviḥ
translated: Spring was its ghee, summer its fuel, autumn its oblation.

original: taṃ yajñaṃ barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣaṃ jātamagrataḥ
analyzed: tam yajñam barhiṣi praukṣan puruṣam jātam agratas
translated: They sprinkled that sacrifice on the sacrificial grass, the man who was born first.

original: tena devā ayajanta sādhyā ṛṣayaśca ye
analyzed: tena devāḥ ayajanta sādhyāḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca ye
translated: With him the gods sacrificed, and the Sadhyas and the Rishis.

original: tasmād yajñāt sarvahutaḥ sambhṛtaṃ pṛṣadājyam
analyzed: tasmāt yajñāt sarva hutaḥ sambhṛtam pṛṣadājyam
translated: From that sacrifice, offered in all ways, the speckled ghee was produced.

original: paśūntāṃścakre vāyavyānāraṇyān grāmyāśca ye🔽tasmād yajñāt sarvahuta ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire
analyzed: paśūn tān cakre vāyavyān āraṇyān grāmyāḥ ca ye  tasmāt yajñāt sarva hutaḥ ṛcaḥ sāmāni jajñire
translated: He made the animals, those belonging to Vayu, those of the forest, and those of the village.🔽From that sacrifice, offered in all ways, the Rik and Saman verses were born.

original: chandāṃsijajñire tasmād yajustasmādajāyata🔽tasmādaśvā ajāyanta ye ke cobhayādataḥ
analyzed: chandāṃsi jajñire tasmāt yajuḥ tasmāt ajāyata  tasmāt aśvāḥ ajāyanta ye ke ca ubhayāt atas
translated: The Chandas were born from that, the Yajus was born from that.🔽From that were born the horses, whatever animals have two rows of teeth.

original: gāvo hajajñire tasmāt tasmājjātā ajāvayaḥ
analyzed: gāvaḥ hajajñire tasmāt tasmāt jātāḥ aja avayaḥ
translated: The cows were born from that, from that were born the goats and sheep.

original: yat puruṣaṃ vyadadhuḥ katidhā vyakalpayan
analyzed: yat puruṣam vyadadhuḥ katidhā vyakalpayan
translated: When they divided the man into how many parts?

original: mukhaṃ kimasya kau bāhū kā ūrū pādā ucyete
analyzed: mukham kim asya kau bāhū kau ūrū pādau ucyete
translated: What was his mouth? What were his two arms? What were his thighs and feet called?

original: brāhmaṇo 'sya mukhamāsīd bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ sya mukham āsīt bāhū rājanyaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: His mouth became the Brahmin, his two arms were made into the Kshatriya,

original: ūrūtadasya yad vaiśyaḥ padbhyāṃ śūdro ajāyata
analyzed: ūrūtadasya yat vaiśyaḥ padbhyām śūdraḥ ajāyata
translated: His thighs became the Vaishya, the Shudra was born from his feet.

original: candramā manaso jātaścakṣoḥ sūryo ajāyata
analyzed: candramāḥ manasaḥ jātaḥ cakṣoḥ sūryaḥ ajāyata
translated: The moon was born from the mind, the sun was born from the eye,

original: mukhādindraścāgniśca prāṇād vāyurajāyata
analyzed: mukhāt indraḥ ca agniḥ ca prāṇāt vāyuḥ ajāyata
translated: Indra and Agni were born from his mouth, Vayu from his breath,

original: nābhyā āsīdantarikṣaṃ śīrṣṇo dyauḥ samavartata
analyzed: nābhyāḥ āsīt antarikṣam śīrṣṇaḥ dyauḥ samavartata
translated: The atmosphere from his navel, and the sky was formed from his head.

original: padbhyāṃ bhūmirdiśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokānakalpayan
analyzed: padbhyām bhūmiḥ diśaḥ śrotrāt tathā lokān akalpayan
translated: The earth from his feet, and the directions, thus they created the worlds.

original: saptāsyāsan paridhayastriḥ sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ🔽devāyad yajñaṃ tanvānā abadhnan puruṣaṃ paśum
analyzed: sapta asya āsan paridhayaḥ tris sapta samidhaḥ kṛtāḥ  devāyat yajñam tanvānāḥ abadhnan puruṣam paśum
translated: He had seven enclosing sticks, three times seven kindling sticks were made.🔽The gods, while spreading the sacrifice, bound Purusha as the sacrificial animal.

original: yajñena yajñamayajanta devāstāni dharmāṇi prathamānyāsan
analyzed: yajñena yajñam ayajanta devāḥ tāni dharmāṇi prathamāni āsan
translated: The gods performed the sacrifice with the sacrifice, those were the first rites.

original: te ha nākaṃ mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥsanti devāḥ
analyzed: te ha nākam mahimānaḥ sacanta yatra pūrve sādhyāḥ santi devāḥ
translated: Those who are great in glory follow the god, where the Sadhyas, the ancient gods, are.

original: saṃ jāgṛvadbhirjaramāṇa idhyate dame damūnā iṣayanniḷas pade🔽viśvasya hotā haviṣo vareṇyo vibhurvibhāvāsuṣakhā sakhīyate
analyzed: sam jāgṛvadbhiḥ jaramāṇaḥ idhyate dame damūnāḥ iṣayan iḍaḥ pade  viśvasya hotā haviṣaḥ vareṇyaḥ vibhuḥ vibhāvā asu sakhā sakhīyate
translated: He is kindled, the one who wakes together with the watchful ones, in the house, in the house, the guest in the house, desiring food in the place of food.🔽He is the priest of all, the most excellent of oblations, the all-pervading, the one who shines in the luminous ones, the friend of friends.

original: sa darśataśrīratithirgṛhegṛhe vanevane śiśriyetakvavīriva
analyzed: sa darśata śrīḥ atithiḥ gṛhe gṛhe vane vane śiśriyeta kvavīḥ iva
translated: He, of beautiful glory, is the guest in every house, he rests in every forest like a bird.

original: janaṃjanaṃ janyo nāti manyate viśa ākṣeti viśyo viśaṃ viśam
analyzed: janaṃjanam janyaḥ na ati manyate viśaḥ ākṣeti viśyaḥ viśam viśam
translated: He, the young one, does not think himself superior to any people, he moves among the people as a young man among the people, people after people.

original: sudakṣo dakṣaiḥ kratunāsi sukraturagne kaviḥ kāvyenāsiviśvavit
analyzed: su dakṣaḥ dakṣaiḥ kratunā asi su kratuḥ agne kaviḥ kāvyena asi viśva vid
translated: You are well-skilled with skills, well-sacrificed with sacrifice, O Agni, you are the all-knowing sage with wisdom.

original: vasurvasūnāṃ kṣayasi tvameka id dyāvā cayāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ
analyzed: vasuḥ vasūnām kṣayasi tvam ekaḥ id dyāvā cayāni pṛthivī ca puṣyataḥ
translated: Vasu, thou art the one abode of all good things, and heaven and earth support thee as their treasure

original: prajānannagne tava yonim ṛtviyamiḷāyās pade ghṛtavantamāsadaḥ
analyzed: prajānan agne tava yonim ṛtviyam iḷāyāḥ pade ghṛtavantam āsadaḥ
translated: Knowing, O Agni, thy proper place, thou hast sat down in the lap of Iḷā, rich in ghee

original: ā te cikitra uṣasāmivetayo 'repasaḥ sūryasyevaraśmayaḥ
analyzed: ā te cikitre uṣasām iva etayaḥ repasaḥ sūryasya iva raśmayaḥ
translated: Thy rays are like the rays of the sun, like the paths of the dawns, O thou who art to be beheld

original: tava śriyo varṣyasyeva vidyutaścitrāścikitra uṣasāṃna ketavaḥ🔽yadoṣadhīrabhisṛṣṭo vanāni ca parisvayaṃ cinuṣe annamāsye
analyzed: tava śriyaḥ varṣyasya iva vidyutaḥ citrāḥ cikitre uṣasām na ketavaḥ  yat oṣadhīḥ abhisṛṣṭaḥ vanāni ca pari svayam cinuṣe annam āsye
translated: Thy glories are like the flashes of rain, like the banners of the dawns, O thou who art to be beheld🔽When thou art sent forth to the plants and the woods, thou gatherest food into thy mouth

original: tamoṣadhīrdadhire garbham ṛtviyaṃ tamāpo agniṃjanayanta mātaraḥ
analyzed: tam oṣadhīḥ dadhire garbham ṛtviyam tam āpaḥ agnim janayanta mātaraḥ
translated: The plants have received thee as their proper child, the waters, O Agni, have generated thee as their son

original: tamit samānaṃ vaninaśca vīrudho'ntarvatīśca suvate ca viśvahā
analyzed: tam id samānam vaninaḥ ca vīrudhaḥ ntarvatīḥ ca suvate ca viśvahā
translated: Thee, O Agni, the trees and the plants, the fruitful and the barren, have all together produced

original: vātopadhūta iṣito vaśānanu tṛṣu yadannā veviṣadvitiṣṭhase
analyzed: vāta upadhūtaḥ iṣitaḥ vaśān anu tṛṣu yat annā veviṣat vitiṣṭhase
translated: Urged on by the wind, as it wills, thou goest to the three foods, when thou art about to rest

original: ā te yatante rathyo yathā pṛthak chardhāṃsyagne ajarāṇi dhakṣataḥ
analyzed: ā te yatante rathyaḥ yathā pṛthak chardhāṃsi agne ajarāṇi dhakṣataḥ
translated: Thy impetuous flames, O Agni, which are never extinguished, strive to reach thee, as if they were chariot-steeds

original: medhākāraṃ vidathasya prasādhanamagniṃ hotāramparibhūtamaṃ matim
analyzed: medhā kāram vidathasya prasādhanam agnim hotāram paribhūtamam matim
translated: The bestower of wisdom, the accomplisher of the sacrifice, Agni, the priest, the most widely spread thought

original: tamidarbhe haviṣyā samānamittamin mahe vṛṇate nānyaṃ tvat
analyzed: tamidarbhe haviṣyā samānam id tamid mahe vṛṇate na anyam tvat
translated: In the great assembly they choose thee, and none other than thee, as the friend who is to be invoked with the sacrificial grass

original: tvāmidatra vṛṇate tvāyavo hotāramagne vidatheṣuvedhasaḥ
analyzed: tvām id atra vṛṇate tvāyavaḥ hotāram agne vidatheṣu vedhasaḥ
translated: here they choose thee for their own, O Agni, as the priest at sacrifices, O wise one,

original: yad devayanto dadhati prayāṇsi te haviṣmantomanavo vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
analyzed: yat devayantaḥ dadhati prayāṇsi te haviṣmantaḥ manavaḥ vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: when they who worship thee, O god, prepare thy offerings, the men with oblations, strewing the grass.

original: tavāgne hotraṃ tava potram ṛtviyaṃ tava neṣṭraṃ tvamagnid ṛtāyataḥ
analyzed: tava agne hotram tava potram ṛtviyam tava neṣṭram tvam agnidh ṛta āyataḥ
translated: To thee, O Agni, is the office of Hotar, to thee the office of Potri is meet, to thee the office of Neṣṭr, thou art the Agnid of the righteous.

original: tava praśāstraṃ tvamadhvarīyasi brahmācāsi gṛhapatiśca no dame🔽yastubhyamagne amṛtāya martyaḥ samidhā dāśaduta vāhaviṣkṛti
analyzed: tava praśāstram tvam adhvarīyasi brahmā acā asi gṛhapatiḥ ca naḥ dame  yaḥ tubhyam agne amṛtāya martyaḥ samidhā dāśat uta vā a haviṣkṛti
translated: Thou art the Praśāstr, thou officiatest as Adhvaryu, thou art the Brahman, and the lord of the house in our house.🔽The mortal man, O Agni, who brings thee, O immortal one, fuel and oblations,

original: tasya hotā bhavasi yāsi dūtyamupa brūṣeyajasyadhvarīyasi
analyzed: tasya hotā bhavasi yāsi dūtyam upa brūṣeyajasi adhvarīyasi
translated: to him thou art a priest, thou goest as a messenger, thou callest to the sacrifice, thou officiatest as Adhvaryu.

original: imā asmai matayo vāco asmadān ṛco giraḥ suṣṭutayaḥsamagmata
analyzed: imāḥ asmai matayaḥ vācaḥ asmadān ṛcaḥ giraḥ suṣṭutayaḥ samagmata
translated: These thoughts, these words of ours, these hymns and songs have come together for him who is well praised.

original: vasūyavo vasave jātavedase vṛddhāsu cid vardhanoyāsu cākanat
analyzed: vasūyavaḥ vasave jātavedase vṛddhāsu cit vardhanoyāsu cākanat
translated: Seeking wealth, I have rejoiced in thee, O Jātavedas, even in thy most prosperous and most bountiful (days).

original: imāṃ pratnāya suṣṭutiṃ navīyasīṃ voceyamasmā uśateśṛṇotu naḥ
analyzed: imām pratnāya suṣṭutim navīyasīm voceyam asmai uśate śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: To him the ancient one I will utter this newest praise, to him who delights in it. May he listen to us.

original: bhūyā antarā hṛdyasya nispṛśe jāyevapatya uśatī suvāsāḥ
analyzed: bhūyāḥ antarā hṛdyasya nispṛśe uśatī su vāsāḥ
translated: May he be more within the heart, as a loving wife with fair garments, to her husband.

original: yasminnaśvāsa ṛṣabhāsa ukṣaṇo vaśā meṣāavasṛṣṭāsa āhutāḥ
analyzed: yasmin aśvāsaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ vaśāḥ meṣāavasṛṣṭāsaḥ āhutāḥ
translated: In whom are offered the horses, bulls, oxen, heifers, rams, and the released (sheep).

original: kīlālape somapṛṣṭhāya vedhasehṛdā matiṃ janaye cārumagnaye
analyzed: kīlāla pe soma pṛṣṭhāya matim janaye cārum agnaye
translated: Speak to him, to the Soma-sprinkled creator, generate in your heart a beautiful thought for Agni

original: ahāvyagne havirāsye te srucīva ghṛtaṃ camvīva somaḥ
analyzed: ahāvyagne haviḥ āsye te sruci iva ghṛtam camvi iva somaḥ
translated: O Agni, let the oblation be in your mouth, like a ladle, the ghee like a cup, the Soma

original: vājasaniṃ rayimasme suvīraṃ praśastaṃ dhehi yaśasambṛhantam
analyzed: vāja sanim rayim asme su vīram praśastam dhehi yaśasam bṛhantam
translated: Grant us wealth, O Agni, that wins booty, with good heroes, praised, exalted, glorious

original: yajñasya vo rathyaṃ viśpatiṃ viśāṃ hotāramaktoratithiṃ vibhāvasum🔽śocañchuṣkāsu hariṇīṣu jarbhuradvṛṣā keturyajato dyāmaśāyata🔽imamañjaspāmubhaye akṛṇvata dharmāṇamagniṃ vidathasyasādhanam
analyzed: yajñasya vaḥ rathyam viśpatim viśām hotāram aktoḥ atithim vibhāvasum  śocan śuṣkāsu hariṇīṣu jarbhurat vṛṣā ketuḥ yajataḥ dyām aśāyata  imam añjaspām ubhaye akṛṇvata dharmāṇam agnim vidathasya sādhanam
translated: The charioteer of your sacrifice, the lord of the people, the priest of the altar, the guest of the shining ones🔽Shining, he moves in the dry, withered woods; the bull, the banner of the worshipper, has laid the sky low🔽They have made this Agni, the impeller, the fulfiller of the sacrifice, the lord of all laws

original: aktuṃ na yahvamuṣasaḥ purohitaṃ tanūnapātamaruṣasya niṃsate🔽baḷ asya nīthā vi paṇeśca manmahe vayā asya prahutāāsurattave
analyzed: aktum na yahvam uṣasaḥ purohitam tanū napātam aruṣasya niṃsate  baṭ asya nīthā vi paṇeḥ ca manmahe vayāḥ asya
translated: The young, the priest of the dawns, he who spreads out, is worshipped by the red one🔽We think of his laws and his mind, of his offspring, of his most ancient help

original: yadā ghorāso amṛtatvamāśatādijjanasyadaivyasya carkiran🔽ṛtasya hi prasitirdyaururu vyaco namo mahyaramatiḥpanīyasī
analyzed: yadā ghorāsaḥ amṛta tvam āśata adit janasya daivyasya carkiran  ṛtasya hi prasitiḥ dyauḥ uru vyacaḥ namaḥ mahya ramatiḥ panīyasī
translated: When the terrible ones have attained immortality, they have become the food of the divine people🔽For the expanse of truth is the wide sky, the most venerable homage is the great hymn

original: indro mitro varuṇaḥ saṃ cikitrire 'tho bhagaḥsavitā pūtadakṣasaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ sam cikitrire thaḥ bhagaḥ savitā pūta dakṣasaḥ
translated: Indra, Mitra, Varuna have thought together, and also Bhaga, Savitar, of pure power

original: pra rudreṇa yayinā yanti sindhavastiro mahīmaramatindadhanvire
analyzed: pra rudreṇa yayinā yanti sindhavaḥ tiras mahīm aramatin dadhanvire
translated: the rivers flow with rudra who goes on his way they have passed over the great one who stays at home

original: yebhiḥ parijmā pariyannuru jrayo vi roruvajjaṭhare viśvamukṣate
analyzed: yebhiḥ parijmā pariyan uru jrayaḥ vi roruvat jaṭhare viśvam ukṣate
translated: by whom the courser parijman going round fills his belly and roars aloud with all his might

original: krāṇā rudrā maruto viśvakṛṣṭayo divaḥ śyenāsoasurasya nīḷayaḥ
analyzed: krāṇāḥ rudrāḥ marutaḥ viśvakṛṣṭayaḥ divaḥ śyenāsaḥ asurasya nīḷayaḥ
translated: the maruts rudras are enraged allpowerful the falcons of the sky the bonds of the asura

original: tebhiścaṣṭe varuṇo mitro aryamendrodevebhirarvaśebhirarvaśaḥ🔽indre bhujaṃ śaśamānāsa āśata sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaśca pauṃsye
analyzed: tebhiḥ caṣṭe varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā indraḥ devebhiḥ arvaśebhiḥ arvaśaḥ  indre bhujam śaśamānāsaḥ āśata sūraḥ dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaḥ ca pauṃsye
translated: with them varuṇa mitra aryaman indra with the gods who speed to the goal speed to the goal🔽the worshippers have come to indra for the arm the strong for the sight of the sun and manly might

original: pra ye nvasyārhaṇā tatakṣire yujaṃ vajraṃnṛṣadaneṣu kāravaḥ
analyzed: pra ye nu asya arhaṇā tatakṣire yujam vajraṃnṛṣadaneṣu kāravaḥ
translated: who have fashioned for him his reverent gifts the bolt to be yoked in the dwellings of men

original: sūraścidā harito asya rīramadindrādā kaścid bhayatetavīyasaḥ
analyzed: sūraścidā haritaḥ asya rīramat indra adā kaścid bhayatetavīyasaḥ
translated: even the sun delights in his tawny steeds and from indra none is more to be feared for his might

original: bhīmasya vṛṣṇo jaṭharādabhiśvaso divedivesahuri stannabādhitaḥ
analyzed: bhīmasya vṛṣṇaḥ jaṭharāt abhiśvasaḥ divedivesahuri stanna bādhitaḥ
translated: from the terrible the strong the bellys inbreathing day by day the swift one is not to be resisted

original: stomaṃ vo adya rudrāya śikvase kṣayadvīrāya namasādidiṣṭana
analyzed: stomam vaḥ adya rudrāya śikvase kṣayadvīrāya namasā ādidiṣṭana
translated: today to rudra the shaker offer your hymn and with homage go to him who slays the hero
