original: yebhiḥ śivaḥ svavānevayāvabhirdivaḥsiṣakti svayaśā nikāmabhiḥ
analyzed: yebhiḥ śivaḥ svavān eva yāvabhiḥ divaḥ siṣakti sva yaśāḥ nikāmabhiḥ
translated: by whom the auspicious one of easy conquest from heaven sends down his own glory his desires

original: te hi prajāyā abharanta vi śravo bṛhaspatirvṛṣabhaḥsomajāmayaḥ
analyzed: te hi prajāyai abharanta vi śravaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ soma jāmayaḥ
translated: for they have brought to men the fame of progeny bṛhaspati the bull the son of soma

original: yajñairatharvā prathamo vi dhārayad devādakṣairbhṛgavaḥ saṃ cikitrire
analyzed: yajñaiḥ atharvā prathamaḥ vi dhārayat devādakṣaiḥ bhṛgavaḥ sam cikitrire
translated: Atharvan first established the sacrifices, the Bhṛgus devised them with the dice of the gods.

original: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā narāśaṃsaścaturaṅgoyamo 'ditiḥ
analyzed: te hi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri retasā narāśaṃsaḥ catur aṅgaḥ yamaḥ ditiḥ
translated: They, Dyaus and Pṛthivī, with abundant seed, Narāśaṃsa, Caturaṅga, Yama, Aditi,

original: devastvaṣṭā draviṇodā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ prarodasī maruto viṣṇurarhire
analyzed: devaḥ tvaṣṭā draviṇaḥ dāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ prarodasī marutaḥ viṣṇuḥ arhire
translated: The god Tvaṣṭar, the bestower of wealth, the Rbhukṣaṇs, the Maruts, Viṣṇu have all been worshipped.

original: uta sya na uśijāmurviyā kavirahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyohavīmani
analyzed: uta sya naḥ uśijām urviyā kaviḥ ahiḥ śṛṇotu budhnyaḥ havīmani
translated: And may the wise Ahi, the supporter, hear our call, in the wide expanse of the eager ones.

original: sūryāmāsā vicarantā divikṣitā dhiyāśamīnahuṣī asya bodhatam
analyzed: sūryāmāsā vicarantā divikṣitā dhiyā śamī nahuṣī asya bodhatam
translated: The sun and moon, moving about, looking towards heaven, may they, the two mighty ones, be aware of this prayer.

original: pra naḥ pūṣā carathaṃ viśvadevyo 'pāṃ napādavatuvāyuriṣṭaye
analyzed: pra naḥ pūṣā caratham viśvadevyā u pām napāt avatu vāyuḥ iṣṭaye
translated: May Pūṣan, with all the deities, the foot of the waters, Vāyu, help our chariot for our prosperity.

original: ātmānaṃ vasyo abhi vātamarcata tadaśvinā suhavā yāmani śrutam
analyzed: ātmānam vasyaḥ abhi vātam arcata tat aśvinā su havā yāmani śrutam
translated: Praise Vāta, the good one, for your own sake; O Aśvins, hear that call in the journey, ye who are easily invoked.

original: viśāmāsāmabhayānāmadhikṣitaṃ gīrbhiru svayaśasaṃgṛṇīmasi🔽gnābhirviśvābhiraditimanarvaṇamaktoryuvānaṃ nṛmaṇā adhā patim
analyzed: viśām āsām abhayānām adhikṣitam gīrbhiḥ u sva yaśasam gṛṇīmasi  gnābhiḥ viśvābhiḥ aditim anarvaṇam aktoḥ yuvānam nṛmaṇāḥ adhā patim
translated: We praise with our songs the one who is the lord of the fearless and prosperous people, the one who is famous by himself.🔽With all the Gna (sisters) we praise Aditi, the young lord of men, the one who is not to be overcome, the one who is above the darkness.

original: rebhadatra januṣā pūrvo aṅgirā grāvāṇa ūrdhvā abhicakṣuradhvaram
analyzed: rebhat atra januṣā pūrvaḥ aṅgirāḥ grāvāṇaḥ ūrdhvāḥ abhicakṣuḥ adhvaram
translated: The ancient sage Rebha, by his birth, the pressing-stones, looking upwards, the sacrifice.

original: yebhirvihāyā abhavad vicakṣaṇaḥpāthaḥ sumekaṃ svadhitirvananvati
analyzed: yebhiḥ vihāyāḥ abhavat vicakṣaṇaḥ pāthaḥ sumekam svadhitiḥ vananvati
translated: By which (stones) he became the discerning one, the axe follows the well-fashioned path.

original: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtamurvī nārī yahvī na rodasīsadaṃ naḥ
analyzed: mahi dyāvāpṛthivī bhūtam urvī nārī yahvī na rodasīsadam naḥ
translated: Be ye the mighty heaven and earth, the wide earth, the two young women, the two all-supporting, the two that never fail us

original: tebhirnaḥ pātaṃ sahyasa ebhirnaḥ pātaṃśūṣaṇi
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ pātam sahyasaḥ ebhiḥ naḥ pātam śūṣaṇi
translated: Protect us with those, O ye that deserve to be worshipped, protect us with those, O ye that are to be invoked

original: yajñeyajñe sa martyo devān saparyati
analyzed: yajñeyajñe sa martyaḥ devān saparyati
translated: In every sacrifice that mortal worships the gods

original: yaḥ sumnairdīrghaśruttama āvivāsatyenān
analyzed: yaḥ sumnaiḥ dīrghaśruttamaḥ āvivāsati enān
translated: Who with his favours most renowned invites them

original: viśveṣāmirajyavo devānāṃ vārmahaḥ
analyzed: viśveṣām irajyavaḥ devānām vārmahaḥ
translated: The most liberal of all the gods, the most bountiful

original: viśve hiviśvamahaso viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ
analyzed: viśve hi viśva mahasaḥ viśve yajñeṣu yajñiyāḥ
translated: For all are bountiful, all are worthy of worship at sacrifices

original: te ghā rājāno amṛtasya mandrā aryamā mitro varuṇaḥparijmā
analyzed: te gha rājānaḥ amṛtasya mandrāḥ aryamā mitraḥ varuṇaḥ parijmā
translated: They are the kings, the joyful ones of immortality, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, the guardian

original: kad rudro nṛṇāṃ stuto marutaḥ pūṣaṇo bhagaḥ
analyzed: kad rudraḥ nṛṇām stutaḥ marutaḥ pūṣaṇaḥ bhagaḥ
translated: How is Rudra praised by men, the Maruts, Pushan, Bhaga?

original: uta no naktamapāṃ vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāyasadhanyā
analyzed: uta naḥ naktam apām vṛṣaṇvasū sūryāmāsā sadanāyasa dhanyā
translated: And ye, O ye of mighty wealth, grant us room by night, O ye of the waters, O ye of the sun and moon, for the sake of our wealth

original: sacā yat sādyeṣāmahirbudhneṣu budhnyaḥ
analyzed: sacā yat sādi eṣām ahirbudhneṣu budhnyaḥ
translated: When ye, the deep ones, are seated together in the deep places of the serpent

original: uta no devāvaśvinā śubhas patī dhāmabhirmitrāvaruṇāuruṣyatām
analyzed: uta naḥ devau aśvinā śubhaḥ patī dhāmabhiḥ mitrāvaruṇau auruṣyatām
translated: And ye, O ye two gods, the Asvins, lords of splendour, Mitra and Varuna, protect us with your powers

original: mahaḥ sa rāya eṣate 'ti dhanveva duritā
analyzed: mahaḥ sa rāyaḥ eṣate ti dhanva iva duritā
translated: He seeks great wealth, as it were, beyond the difficulties

original: uta no rudrā cin mṛḷatāmaśvinā viśve devāso rathaspatirbhagaḥ
analyzed: uta naḥ rudrā cit mṛḍatām aśvinā viśve devāsaḥ rathaspatiḥ bhagaḥ
translated: And may the Rudras, the Asvins, be gracious to us, all the gods, the lord of the chariot, Bhaga

original: ṛbhurvāja ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ parijmā viśvavedasaḥ
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ vājaḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ parijmā viśva vedasaḥ
translated: The strong, the powerful, the swift, the all-knowing

original: ṛbhurṛbhukṣā ṛbhurvidhato mada ā te harī jūjuvānasyavājinā
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ ṛbhuḥ vidhataḥ madaḥ ā te harī jūjuvānasya vājinā
translated: Ṛbhu is the consumer of food, Ṛbhu is the creator, Ṛbhu is the inspirer, may thy two bay steeds, O thou who art to be invoked, be swift

original: duṣṭaraṃ yasya sāma cid ṛdhag yajño namānuṣaḥ
analyzed: duṣṭaram yasya sāma cit ṛdhak yajñaḥ namānuṣaḥ
translated: Whose Sāman is hard to overcome, whose sacrifice is not human

original: kṛdhī no ahrayo deva savitaḥ sa ca stuṣe maghonām
analyzed: kṛdhī naḥ ahrayaḥ deva savitar sa ca stuṣe maghonām
translated: Make us free from enemies, O god Savitar, and be thou the praiser of the wealthy

original: saho naindro vahnibhirnyeṣāṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ cakraṃ raśmiṃ nayoyuve
analyzed: sahaḥ na aindraḥ vahnibhiḥ ni eṣām carṣaṇīnām cakram raśmim nayoyuve
translated: Like Indra with the fires of these people, he has yoked the wheel and the reins of these people

original: aiṣu dyāvāpṛthivī dhātaṃ mahadasme vīreṣu viśvacarṣaṇiśravaḥ
analyzed: ā eṣu dyāvāpṛthivī dhātam mahat asme vīreṣu viśvacarṣaṇi śravaḥ
translated: Place in these two, heaven and earth, the great support, the glory in all our heroes

original: pṛkṣaṃ vājasya sātaye pṛkṣaṃ rāyotaturvaṇe
analyzed: pṛkṣam vājasya sātaye pṛkṣam rāyā utaturvaṇe
translated: The portion for the winning of strength, the portion for the sake of wealth

original: etaṃ śaṃsamindrāsmayuṣ ṭvaṃ kūcit santaṃ sahasāvannabhiṣṭaye sadā pāhyabhiṣṭaye
analyzed: etam śaṃsam indra asmayuḥ tvam kūcid santam sahasāvan abhiṣṭaye sadā pāhi abhiṣṭaye
translated: This praise, O Indra, who art to be invoked, thou, O mighty one, who art near, for help, ever help for help

original: medatāṃ vedatā vaso
analyzed: medatām vedata vaso
translated: Be thou the bestower of wealth, O good one

original: etaṃ me stomaṃ tanā na sūrye dyutadyāmānaṃ vāvṛdhantanṛṇām
analyzed: etam me stomam tanā na sūrye dyutat yāmānam vāvṛdhanta nṛṇām
translated: This praise of mine, like a cow for the sun, they have increased, the shining ones, the men's praise

original: saṃvananaṃ nāśvyaṃ taṣṭevānapacyutam
analyzed: saṃvananam na aśvyam taṣṭā iva an apacyutam
translated: The gathering, like a horse's, is wrought, like a chariot, not to be turned back

original: vāvarta yeṣāṃ rāyā yuktaiṣāṃ hiraṇyayī
analyzed: vāvarta yeṣām rāyā yuktā eṣām hiraṇyayī
translated: They have turned back whose wealth is like a yoked (team), whose wealth is like a golden (team)

original: nemadhitāna pauṃsyā vṛtheva viṣṭāntā
analyzed: pauṃsyā vṛthā iva viṣṭa antā
translated: The manly deeds are well-fashioned, as it were, the ends of the days are as it were scattered

original: pra tad duḥśīme pṛthavāne vene pra rāme vocamasuremaghavatsu
analyzed: pra tat duḥśīme pṛthavāne vene pra rāme
translated: That I announce to the wide-ruling Dūḥśīme, to the Aṣuras, to the wealthy Vena, to the Rāmas

original: ye yuktvāya pañca śatāsmayu pathā viśrāvyeṣām
analyzed: ye yuktvāya pañca śatā asmayu pathā viśrāvyeṣām
translated: Those who have yoked five hundred for you, O Asmayu, on the path to be proclaimed by them

original: adhīn nvatra saptatiṃ ca sapta ca
analyzed: adhi id nu atra saptatim ca sapta ca
translated: Here are indeed seventy and seven

original: sadyo didiṣṭa tānvaḥsadyo didiṣṭa pārthyaḥ sadyo didiṣṭa māyavaḥ
analyzed: sadyas didiṣṭa tānvaḥ sadyas didiṣṭa pārthyaḥ sadyas didiṣṭa māyavaḥ
translated: May Parthy immediately give them, may Mayava immediately give them, may Parthy immediately give them

original: praite vadantu pra vayaṃ vadāma grāvabhyo vācaṃ vadatāvadadbhyaḥ
analyzed: pra ete vadantu pra vayam vadāma grāvabhyaḥ vācam vadata a vadadbhyaḥ
translated: Let them speak forth, let us speak forth, let us speak to the pressing-stones, to those that speak, to those that are to be spoken to

original: yadadrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākamāśavaḥ ślokaṃghoṣaṃ bharathendrāya sominaḥ
analyzed: yat adrayaḥ parvatāḥ sākamāśavaḥ ślokaṃghoṣam bharatha indrāya sominaḥ
translated: When the swift, the rocky mountains, together, make the sound of praise for Indra, the Soma-pourers

original: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravadabhi krandanti haritebhirāsabhiḥ
analyzed: ete vadanti śatavat sahasravat abhi krandanti haritebhiḥ āsabhiḥ
translated: These speak in hundreds, in thousands, they shout with their green asses

original: viṣṭvī grāvāṇaḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā hotuścit pūrve haviradyamāśata
analyzed: viṣṭvī grāvāṇaḥ su kṛtaḥ su kṛtyayā hotuḥ cit pūrve haviḥ adyam āśata
translated: The well-fashioned pressing-stones, well-fashioned by the sacrificer, have come to the Hotri's first oblation

original: ete vadantyavidannanā madhu nyūṅkhayante adhi pakvaāmiṣi
analyzed: ete madhu nyūṅkhayante adhi pakva āmiṣi
translated: These speak, not knowing the honey; they hum over the ripe flesh

original: vṛkṣasya śākhāmaruṇasya bapsataste sūbharvāvṛṣabhāḥ premarāviṣuḥ🔽bṛhad vadanti madireṇa mandinendraṃ krośanto 'vidannanāmadhu
analyzed: vṛkṣasya śākhām aruṇasya bapsataḥ te sūbharvāvṛṣabhāḥ prema rāviṣuḥ  bṛhat vadanti madireṇa mandinā indram krośantaḥ
translated: They, the good singers, have sung forth, having seized the branch of the red tree, the bulls🔽They speak loudly, roaring with intoxication, crying to Indra, having found the sweet drink

original: saṃrabhyā dhīrāḥ svasṛbhiranartiṣurāghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīmupabdibhiḥ
analyzed: saṃrabhyāḥ dhīrāḥ svasṛbhiḥ anartiṣuḥ āghoṣayantaḥ pṛthivīm upabdibhiḥ
translated: The wise ones, having come together, have danced with their sisters, proclaiming with their voices

original: suparṇā vācamakratopa dyavyākhare kṛṣṇā iṣirāanartiṣuḥ
analyzed: suparṇāḥ vācam akrata upa dyavi ākhare kṛṣṇāḥ iṣirāḥ anartiṣuḥ
translated: the swift black birds have danced in the sky's wide space the birds have sung their song to the god's delight

original: nyaṃ ni yantyuparasya niṣkṛtaṃ purū retodadhire sūryaśvitaḥ🔽ugrā iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākaṃ yuktā vṛṣaṇobibhrato dhuraḥ
analyzed: ni yanti uparasya niṣkṛtam purū retaḥ udadhire sūryaśvitaḥ  ugrāḥ iva pravahantaḥ samāyamuḥ sākam yuktāḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ bibhrataḥ dhuraḥ
translated: they have brought down the upper one's punishment on many they have drunk the sun's bright seed🔽like fierce ones they have drawn together and rushed on bearing the yoke the strong ones yoked together

original: yacchvasanto jagrasānā arāviṣuḥśṛṇva eṣāṃ prothatho arvatāmiva
analyzed: yat śvasantaḥ jagrasānāḥ arāviṣuḥ śṛṇvaḥ eṣām prothathaḥ arvatām iva
translated: panting devouring roaring they have gone forth like the neighing of horses is the sound of them

original: daśāvanibhyo daśakakṣyebhyo daśayoktrebhyo daśayojanebhyaḥ🔽daśābhīśubhyo arcatājarebhyo daśa dhuro daśa yuktāvahadbhyaḥ
analyzed: daśa avanibhyaḥ daśa kakṣyebhyaḥ daśa yoktrebhyaḥ daśa yojanebhyaḥ  daśa abhīśubhyaḥ arcata ajarebhyaḥ daśa dhuraḥ daśa yuktā vahadbhyaḥ
translated: to the ten regions to the ten girdles to the ten yokings to the ten harnessings🔽to the ten reins to the ten ancient ones who are to be praised to the ten poles to the ten yoked ones who draw

original: te adrayo daśayantrāsa āśavasteṣāmādhānaṃ paryetiharyatam
analyzed: te adrayaḥ daśa yantrāsaḥ āśavaḥ teṣām ādhānam paryetiharyatam
translated: those swift ones the ten-formed the ten-contrived the ten-yoked the ten-harnessed

original: ta ū sutasya somyasyāndhaso 'ṃśoḥ pīyūṣamprathamasya bhejire🔽te somādo harī indrasya niṃsate 'ṃśuṃ duhanto adhyāsategavi
analyzed: te ū sutasya somyasya andhasaḥ u ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam prathamasya bhejire  te somādaḥ harī indrasya niṃsate ṃśum duhantaḥ adhyāsategavi
translated: they have drunk the first portion of the sweet soma juice🔽those two bay steeds of Indra the pressers of Soma sit down milking the stalk

original: tebhirdugdhaṃ papivān somyaṃ madhvindro vardhateprathate vṛṣāyate
analyzed: tebhiḥ dugdham papivān somyam madhu indraḥ vardhate prathate vṛṣāyate
translated: having drunk the sweet Soma juice Indra waxes strong he grows he becomes a bull

original: vṛṣā vo aṃśurna kilā riṣāthanelāvantaḥ sadamitsthanāśitāḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā vaḥ aṃśuḥ na kilā riṣāthana ilāvantaḥ sadamidh sthana āśitāḥ
translated: your stalk O bulls is not to be injured the brown ones are ever to be honoured in the house

original: raivatyeva mahasā cārava sthana yasyagrāvāṇo ajuṣadhvamadhvaram🔽tṛdilā atṛdilāso adrayo 'śramaṇā aśṛthitā amṛtyavaḥ
analyzed: raivatyā iva mahasā cāravaḥ sthana yasya agrāvāṇaḥ ajuṣadhvam adhvaram  tṛdilāḥ atṛdilāsaḥ adrayaḥ śramaṇāḥ aśṛthitāḥ amṛtyavaḥ
translated: Ye are as firm as the Raivata mountain, ye are as bright as the sun, ye are as strong as the wind.🔽Ye are the firmest of the firm, the most enduring of the enduring, the most unassailable of the unassailable, the most invincible of the invincible, the most immortal of the immortal.

original: anāturā ajarā sthāmaviṣṇavaḥ supīvaso atṛṣitāatṛṣṇajaḥ
analyzed: anāturāḥ ajarāḥ stha a maviṣṇavaḥ su pīvasaḥ atṛṣitāḥ atṛṣṇajaḥ
translated: Ye are the most healthy of the healthy, the most vigorous of the vigorous, the most insatiable of the insatiable, the most thirstless of the thirstless.

original: dhruvā eva vaḥ pitaro yugeyuge kṣemakāmāsaḥ sadaso nayuñjate
analyzed: dhruvāḥ eva vaḥ pitaraḥ yuge yuge kṣema kāmāsaḥ sadasaḥ na yuñjate
translated: Your fathers, O people, are firm in every age, desiring peace, they are yoked to the seat of sacrifice.

original: ajuryāso hariṣāco haridrava ā dyāṃ raveṇapṛthivīmaśuśravuḥ
analyzed: ajuryāsaḥ hari dravaḥ ā dyām raveṇa pṛthivīm aśuśravuḥ
translated: They are immortal, tawny, tawny-flowing, they have made the heaven and earth resound with their radiance.

original: tadid vadantyadrayo vimocane yāmannañjaspā iva ghedupabdibhiḥ🔽vapanto bījamiva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcantisomaṃ na minanti bapsataḥ
analyzed: tat id vadanti adrayaḥ vimocane yāman añjaspāḥ iva gha idupabdibhiḥ  vapantaḥ bījam iva dhānyākṛtaḥ pṛñcanti somam na minanti bapsataḥ
translated: There the mountains speak at the time of release, as if going swiftly with their voices.🔽Scattering the seed as if it were grain, they press the Soma, they do not diminish the sacrificer.

original: sute adhvare adhi vācamakratā krīḷayo na mātarantudantaḥ🔽vi ṣū muñcā suṣuvuṣo manīṣāṃ vi vartantāmadrayaścāyamānāḥ
analyzed: sute adhvare adhi vācam akratā krīḍayaḥ na mātar antudantaḥ  vi su muñca suṣuvuṣaḥ manīṣām vi vartantām adrayaḥ cāyamānāḥ
translated: In the pressed sacrifice they have uttered a voice, as if playing children striking their mother.🔽Let the thoughts of the pressers be set free in all directions, let the mountains be set in motion, being pressed.

original: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi miśrākṛṇavāvahai nu
analyzed: haye jāye manasā tiṣṭha ghore vacāṃsi nu
translated: O wife, stand firm in thy heart, O terrible one, let us make our words agree together.

original: na nau mantrā anuditāsa ete mayas karanparatare canāhan
analyzed: na nau mantrāḥ anuditāsaḥ ete mayaḥ karan paratare cana ahan
translated: Let not these admonitions of ours, sent forth, make us miserable even at a greater distance.

original: kimetā vācā kṛṇavā tavāhaṃ prākramiṣamuṣasāmagriyeva
analyzed: kim etāḥ vācā kṛṇavā tava aham prākramiṣam uṣasām agriyā iva
translated: What shall I do with this speech of thine? I have gone forth as at the rising of the dawn.

original: purūravaḥ punarastaṃ parehi durāpanā vātaivāhamasmi
analyzed: purūravaḥ punar astam parehi durāpanā vātā eva aham asmi
translated: Purūravas, go back again to the other side, I am hard to win like the wind

original: iṣurna śriya iṣudherasanā goṣāḥ śatasā na raṃhiḥ
analyzed: iṣuḥ na śriyaḥ iṣudheḥ asanā goṣāḥ śata sāḥ na raṃhiḥ
translated: Like an arrow, like a dart, like a shaft of the archer, like a hundred-winning prize

original: avīre kratau vi davidyutan norā na māyuṃ citayantadhunayaḥ
analyzed: avīre kratau vi davidyutan nā urāḥ na māyum
translated: In the hero-less sacrifice they flashed upon us, the clouds, like two houses, did not think of the rain

original: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vaya uṣo yadi vaṣṭyantigṛhāt
analyzed: sā vasu dadhatī śvaśurāya vayaḥ uṣaḥ yadi
translated: She, bestowing wealth on her father-in-law, if Dawn wishes to leave her house

original: astaṃ nanakṣe yasmiñcākan divā naktaṃśnathitā vaitasena
analyzed: astam nanakṣe yasmin cākan divā naktaṃśnathitā vaitasena
translated: In which she has gone to rest, whether by day or night, torn by the Vaitas

original: triḥ sma māhnaḥ śnathayo vaitasenota sma me 'vyatyaipṛṇāsi
analyzed: tris sma mā ahnaḥ śnathayaḥ vaitasena uta sma me
translated: Three times in the day the Vaitas have torn me, and once they have filled me for my own sake

original: purūravo 'nu te ketamāyaṃ rājā me vīra tanvastadāsīḥ🔽yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpirhradecakṣurna granthinīcaraṇyuḥ
analyzed: purūravaḥ nu te keta māyam rājā me vīra tanvaḥ tadā āsīḥ  yā sujūrṇiḥ śreṇiḥ sumnaāpiḥ hradecakṣuḥ na granthinīcaraṇyuḥ
translated: Purūravas has come to thy light, O king, thou wast my body, O hero🔽Which is well-turned, a row, a giver of bliss, like an eye in the lake, unknotted, swift

original: tā añjayo 'ruṇayo na sasruḥ śriye gāvo nadhenavo 'navanta
analyzed: tāḥ añjayaḥ ruṇayaḥ na sasruḥ śriye gāvaḥ na dhenavaḥ navanta
translated: Those two have flowed like two red anointings, for glory, like cows, like milch cows, have they increased

original: samasmiñ jāyamāna āsata gnā utemavardhan nadyaḥsvagūrtāḥ
analyzed: samasmin jāyamāne āsata gnāḥ nadyaḥ sva gūrtāḥ
translated: The Gnas sat together when he was born, and the rivers, well-praised, have increased him

original: mahe yat tvā purūravo raṇāyāvardhayandasyuhatyāya devāḥ
analyzed: mahe yat tvā purūravaḥ raṇāya avardhayan dasyu hatyāya devāḥ
translated: When, for the great contest, Purūravas, the gods have exalted thee for slaying the Dasyus

original: sacā yadāsu jahatīṣvatkamamānuṣīṣu mānuṣo niṣeve
analyzed: sacā yadā āsu jahatīṣu atkam amānuṣīṣu mānuṣaḥ niṣeve
translated: When thou, the human one, hast left those unwilling human ones, and hast gone to those that are willing

original: apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyustā atrasan rathaspṛśonāśvāḥ🔽yadāsu marto amṛtāsu nispṛk saṃ kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhirnapṛṅkte
analyzed: apa sma mat tarasantī na bhujyustāḥ atrasan ratha spṛśaḥ ūna aśvāḥ  yadā āsu martaḥ amṛtāsu nispṛś sam kṣoṇībhiḥ kratubhiḥ na pṛṅkte
translated: The swift ones have run their course, the chariot-steeds have trembled,🔽When the mortal man, in the immortal ones, has no power to touch them, he is not sprinkled with the regions and the rites.

original: tā ātayo na tanvaḥ śumbhata svā aśvāso nakrīḷayo dandaśānāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ ātayaḥ na tanvaḥ śumbhata svāḥ aśvāsaḥ nakrīḍayaḥ dandaśānāḥ
translated: Those bodies are adorned like birds, their horses are playful like dogs, biting.

original: vidyun na yā patantī davidyod bharantī me apyā kāmyāni
analyzed: vidyut na yā patantī davidyot bharantī me apyā kāmyāni
translated: Like lightning flashing down, she has flashed, bringing me my desired things.

original: janiṣṭo apo naryaḥ sujātaḥ prorvaśī tirata dīrghamāyuḥ
analyzed: janiṣṭa u apaḥ naryaḥ su jātaḥ pra urvaśī tirata dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: The good-born man has generated the waters; Urvasi has extended her long life.

original: jajñiṣa itthā gopīthyāya hi dadhātha tat purūravo maojaḥ
analyzed: jajñiṣe itthā gopīthyāya hi tat purūravaḥ maojaḥ
translated: He has been born here for the protection of the cows; you have placed that strength in Pururava.

original: aśāsaṃ tvā viduṣī sasminnahan na ma āśṛṇoḥkimabhug vadāsi
analyzed: aśāsam tvā viduṣī na me āśṛṇoḥ kim abhuj vadāsi
translated: I, the wise one, have instructed you in this; do not shed tears; why do you speak so sadly?

original: kadā sūnuḥ pitaraṃ jāta ichāccakran nāśru vartayadvijānan
analyzed: kadā sūnuḥ pitaram jātaḥ ichāt cakran na aśru vartayat vijānan
translated: When will the son desire his father, born, crying, shedding tears, knowing?

original: ko dampatī samanasā vi yūyodadha yadagniḥśvaśureṣu dīdayat🔽prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru cakran na krandadādhyeśivāyai
analyzed: kaḥ dampatī samanasā vi yat agniḥ śvaśureṣu dīdayat  prati bravāṇi vartayate aśru na
translated: Who will separate the couple with one mind, when Agni shines among the fathers-in-law?🔽I will answer the one who sheds tears, crying, for the sake of the inauspicious.

original: pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehyastaṃ nahimūra māpaḥ
analyzed: pra tat te hinavā yat te asme parehi astam nahimūra mā āpaḥ
translated: I will take away from you what is with us; come, do not weep, O son of the earth.

original: sudevo adya prapatedanāvṛt parāvataṃ paramāṃ gantavā u
analyzed: sudevaḥ adya prapatet anāvṛt parāvatam paramām gantavai u
translated: Today the well-god will fall back, unable to return, to go to the farthest distance.

original: adhā śayīta nirṛterupasthe 'dhainaṃ vṛkā rabhasāsoadyuḥ
analyzed: adhā śayīta nirṛteḥ upasthe dhā enam vṛkāḥ rabhasāsaḥ adyuḥ
translated: Then would he lie in the lap of destruction, then would the wolves and the greedy devour him.

original: purūravo mā mṛthā mā pra papto mā tvā vṛkāso aśivāsa ukṣan
analyzed: purūravaḥ mā mṛthāḥ mā pra paptaḥ mā tvā vṛkāsaḥ aśivāsaḥ ukṣan
translated: Do not die, Purūravas, do not fall away, may the wolves and the greedy not seize you.

original: na vai straiṇāni sakhyāni santi sālāvṛkāṇāṃhṛdayānyetā
analyzed: na vai straiṇāni sakhyāni santi śālāvṛkāṇām hṛdayāni etā
translated: There are no female friendships, the hearts of the wolves are like this.

original: yad virūpācaraṃ martyeṣvavasaṃ rātrīḥ śaradaścatasraḥ
analyzed: yat virūpā acaram martyeṣu avasam rātrīḥ śaradaḥ catasraḥ
translated: When I, Viरूप, lived among mortals for four autumns and nights,

original: ghṛtasya stokaṃ sakṛdahna āśnāṃ tādevedantātṛpāṇā carāmi
analyzed: ghṛtasya stokam sakṛt ahnaḥ āśnām carāmi
translated: I ate a drop of ghee once a day, and with that I go about satisfied.

original: antarikṣaprāṃ rajaso vimānīmupa śikṣāmyurvaśīṃvasiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: antarikṣa prām rajasaḥ vimānīm upa śikṣāmi urvaśīm vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: I, Vasishtha, approach Urvashi, who is in the sky, who measures the space,

original: upa tvā rātiḥ sukṛtasya tiṣṭhān ni vartasvahṛdayaṃ tapyate me🔽iti tvā devā ima āhuraiḷa yathemetad bhavasimṛtyubandhuḥ
analyzed: upa tvā rātiḥ sukṛtasya tiṣṭhāt ni vartasva hṛdayam tapyate me  iti tvā devāḥ ime āhuḥ aiḍa yathā imā itat bhavasi mṛtyu bandhuḥ
translated: May the reward of your good deeds come to you, turn back, my heart is burning.🔽Thus do these gods speak to you, as if you were a friend of the dead,

original: prajā te devān haviṣā yajāti svarga u tvamapi mādayāse
analyzed: prajā te devān haviṣā yajāti svarge u tvam api mādayāse
translated: Your offspring worships the gods with oblations, and you too rejoice in heaven.

original: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣaṃ harī pra te vanve vanuṣoharyataṃ madam
analyzed: pra te mahe vidathe śaṃsiṣam harī pra te vanve vanuṣoharyatam madam
translated: I will proclaim your great deeds in the assembly, I will win for you, O eager one, the eager one's joy.

original: ghṛtaṃ na yo haribhiścāru secata ā tvāviśantu harivarpasaṃ giraḥ
analyzed: ghṛtam na yaḥ haribhiḥ cāru secate ā tvā āviśantu hari varpasam giraḥ
translated: Like ghee, which is poured out with the two bay horses, may the songs, which have the form of a bay horse, enter into you.

original: hariṃ hi yonimabhi ye samasvaran hinvanto harī divyaṃyathā sadaḥ
analyzed: harim hi yonim abhi ye samasvaran hinvantaḥ harī divyaṃyathā sadaḥ
translated: They who have sung to Hari, the womb, urging the two bay steeds to the seat in heaven

original: ā yaṃ pṛṇanti haribhirna dhenava indrāyaśūṣaṃ harivantamarcata
analyzed: ā yam pṛṇanti haribhiḥ na dhenavaḥ indra āyaśūṣam harivantam arcata
translated: Whom tawny cows fill full, to Indra sing praise to the tawny one who loves the tawny steed

original: so asya vajro harito ya āyaso harirnikāmo harirāgabhastyoḥ
analyzed: saḥ asya vajraḥ haritaḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ hariḥ nikāmaḥ hariḥ ā gabhastyoḥ
translated: His is this tawny thunderbolt of iron, the tawny steed is dear, the tawny one in the womb

original: dyumnī suśipro harimanyusāyaka indre ni rūpāharitā mimikṣire🔽divi na keturadhi dhāyi haryato vivyacad vajro harito naraṃhyā
analyzed: dyumnī su śipraḥ harimanyusāyakaḥ indre ni rūpāharitāḥ mimikṣire  divi na ketuḥ adhi dhāyi haryataḥ vivyacat vajraḥ haritaḥ na raṃhyā
translated: The glorious one with beautiful eyebrows, with tawny wrath and dart, in Indra are mingled tawny forms🔽Like a banner in the sky is set the tawny one, the tawny one's thunderbolt is stretched out, swift

original: tudadahiṃ hariśipro ya āyasaḥ sahasraśokāabhavad dharimbharaḥ
analyzed: tudat ahim hari śipraḥ yaḥ āyasaḥ sahasraśokāḥ abhavat harimbharaḥ
translated: The tawny-browed one, the iron one, hath smitten the dragon: he hath become the tawny one's supporter, the thousand-scorcher

original: tvaṃtvamaharyathā upastutaḥ pūrvebhirindra harikeśayajvabhiḥ
analyzed: tvam tvam ahar yathā upastutaḥ pūrvebhiḥ indra hari keśa yajvabhiḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, as thou art praised, hast been like that by the former sacrificers, O tawny-haired one

original: tvaṃ haryasi tava viśvamukthyamasāmi rādhoharijāta haryatam
analyzed: tvam haryasi tava viśvam ukthyam asāmi rādhaḥ hari jāta haryatam
translated: Thou shinest tawny, all praise is thine, O thou whose wealth is tawny, the tawny one's gift is to be desired

original: tā vajriṇaṃ mandinaṃ stomyaṃ mada indraṃ rathe vahatoharyatā harī
analyzed: tā vajriṇam mandinam stomyam made indram rathe vahatoharyatā harī
translated: They bear on the chariot the tawny steeds, the two tawny ones, to Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the gladdener, the one to be praised in the hymn

original: purūṇyasmai savanāni haryata indrāyasomā harayo dadhanvire
analyzed: purūṇi asmai savanāni haryate indra ayasomāḥ harayaḥ dadhanvire
translated: The tawny ones have flowed for him, for Indra, the many libations to be offered, the tawny Soma juices

original: araṃ kāmāya harayo dadhanvire sthirāya hinvan harayo harīturā
analyzed: aram kāmāya harayaḥ dadhanvire sthirāya hinvan harayaḥ harīturā
translated: The tawny ones have flowed for the wish, for the firm one, the tawny ones, the swift ones, are urged on

original: arvadbhiryo haribhirjoṣamīyate so asya kāmaṃharivantamānaśe🔽hariśmaśārurharikeśa āyasasturaspeye yo haripāavardhata🔽arvadbhiryo haribhirvājinīvasurati viśvāduritā pāriṣad dharī
analyzed: arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ joṣam īyate saḥ asya kāmam harivantam ānaśe  hari śmaśāruḥ hari keśaḥ āyasaḥ turaspeye yaḥ hari pāḥ avardhata  arvadbhiḥ yaḥ haribhiḥ vājinīvasuḥ ati viśvā duritā pāriṣat harī
translated: He who goes to the assembly with the tawny coursers, he has fulfilled his wish, the tawny one's wish.🔽The tawny-bearded, tawny-haired one, the iron one, who has been strengthened in the swift race by the tawny ones.🔽He who with the tawny coursers, the lord of strength, shall carry us over all misfortunes.

original: sruveva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya hariṇīdavidhvataḥ
analyzed: sruvā iva yasya hariṇī vipetatuḥ śipre vājāya
translated: Whose two tawny ones have flowed like a ladle, the two tawny ones for the swift prize.

original: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjad dharī pītvāmadasya hayatasyādhasaḥ🔽uta sma sadma haryatasya pastyoratyo na vājaṃ harivānacikradat🔽mahī cid dhi dhiṣaṇāharyadojasā bṛhad vayodadhiṣe haryataścidā
analyzed: pra yat kṛte camase marmṛjat harī pītvā amadasya hayatasya adhasaḥ  uta sma sadma haryatasya pastyoḥ atyaḥ na vājam harivān acikradat  mahī cit hi dhiṣaṇā haryat ojasā bṛhat vayaḥ udadhiṣe haryataścidā
translated: When he has cleansed the two tawny ones in the prepared vessel, for the sake of the strong drink, the intoxicating one.🔽And he has roared like a horse, bearing the prize, in the house and dwelling of the tawny one.🔽For even the great one, the tawny one, with his power, has placed the great life in the tawny one.

original: ā rodasī haryamāṇo mahitvā navyaṃnavyaṃ haryasi manmanu priyam
analyzed: ā rodasī haryamāṇaḥ mahitvā navyam navyam haryasi manmanu priyam
translated: Shining with thy greatness between the two worlds, thou art ever new, O tawny one, to the dear hymn.

original: pra pastyamasura haryataṃ gorāviṣkṛdhi harayesūryāya
analyzed: pra pastyam asura haryatam goḥ āviṣkṛdhi haraye sūryāya
translated: O Asura, make the tawny dwelling of the cow shine forth for the tawny Surya.

original: ā tvā haryantaṃ prayujo janānāṃ rathe vahantu hariśipramindra
analyzed: ā tvā haryantam prayujaḥ janānām rathe vahantu hari śipram indra
translated: Let the teams of men bring thee hither, O joyous one, O Indra, on the chariot, O thou of tawny eyebrows.

original: pibā yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvo haryan yajñaṃsadhamāde daśoṇim
analyzed: pibāḥ yathā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ haryan yajñaṃsadhamāde daśa ūṇim
translated: Drink as thou likest of the honey that is set before thee, rejoicing in the sacrifice, in the assembly of ten.

original: apāḥ pūrveṣāṃ harivaḥ sutānāmatho idaṃ savanaṃkevalaṃ te
analyzed: apāḥ pūrveṣām harivas sutānām atho idam savanam kevalam te
translated: Thou hast drunk the pressed Soma of our fathers, and this libation is wholly thine

original: mamaddhi somaṃ madhumantamindra satrā vṛṣañjaṭhara ā vṛṣasva
analyzed: mamaddhi somam madhumantam indra satrā vṛṣan jaṭhare ā vṛṣasva
translated: Drink the sweet Soma, O Indra, and be ever filled with strength in thy belly, O bull

original: yā oṣadhīḥ pūrvā jātā devebhyastriyugaṃ purā
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ pūrvāḥ jātāḥ devebhyaḥ tri yugam purā
translated: Those plants which were born first, three ages ago, for the gods

original: manainu babhrūṇāmahaṃ śataṃ dhāmāni sapta ca
analyzed: babhrūṇām aham śatam dhāmāni sapta ca
translated: I think of the hundred and seven abodes of the brown ones

original: śataṃ vo amba dhāmāni sahasramuta vo ruhaḥ
analyzed: śatam vaḥ amba dhāmāni sahasram uta vaḥ ruhaḥ
translated: A hundred are your abodes, O Amba, and a thousand your shoots

original: adhāśatakratvo yūyamimaṃ me agadaṃ kṛta
analyzed: adha a śata kratvaḥ yūyam imam me agadam kṛta
translated: Now you, having ten powers, have made this man of mine well

original: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvaṃ puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvam puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ
translated: Rejoice in the plants, in those that are full of flowers and full of sap

original: aśvāiva sajitvarīrvīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ
analyzed: aśvāḥ iva sa jitvarīḥ vīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ
translated: The plants, like mares to be trained, are to be crossed over

original: oṣadhīriti mātarastad vo devīrupa bruve🔽saneyamaśvaṃgāṃ vāsa ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa🔽aśvatthe vo niṣadanaṃ parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ iti mātaraḥ tat vaḥ devīḥ upa bruve  saneyam aśvaṃgām vāsaḥ ātmānam tava pūruṣa  aśvatthe vaḥ niṣadanam parṇe vaḥ vasatiḥ kṛtā
translated: O plants, mothers, I tell you this, O goddesses🔽I would win the possession of a horse, and my own body, O Purusha🔽The fig tree is your seat, in the leaf your dwelling is made

original: gobhāja itkilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam
analyzed: go bhājaḥ itkila asatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam
translated: You are indeed the sharers of the cow, when you restore the man to life

original: yatrauṣadhīḥ samagmata rājānaḥ samitāviva
analyzed: yatra oṣadhīḥ samagmata rājānaḥ samitau iva
translated: Where the plants have come together, like kings in a council

original: vipraḥ saucyate bhiṣag rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ
analyzed: vipraḥ saḥ ucyate bhiṣaj rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ
translated: The Brahman is called the physician, the slayer of demons, the remover of disease

original: aśvāvatīṃ somāvatīmūrjayantīmudojasam
analyzed: aśvāvatīm somāvatīm ūrjayantīm udojasam
translated: Rich in horses, rich in Soma, strengthening, full of vigour

original: āvitsisarvā oṣadhīrasmā ariṣṭatātaye
analyzed: āvitsi sarvāḥ oṣadhīḥ asmai ariṣṭatātaye
translated: i have obtained all plants for his safety and well being

original: ucchuṣmā oṣadhīnāṃ gāvo goṣṭhādiverate
analyzed: ud śuṣmāḥ oṣadhīnām gāvaḥ goṣṭhāt iva īrate
translated: the plants have sent forth their strong power the cows have lowed as from a stall

original: dhanaṃsaniṣyantīnāmātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa🔽iṣkṛtirnāma vo mātātho yūyaṃ stha niṣkṛtīḥ
analyzed: dhanaṃsaniṣyantīnām ātmānam tava pūruṣa  iṣkṛtiḥ nāma vaḥ mātā atha u yūyam stha niṣkṛtīḥ
translated: of those that will bring forth wealth o man is thy body preserved🔽your mother is called the purifier and ye are purifiers yourselves

original: sīrāḥpatatṛṇī sthana yadāmayati niṣ kṛtha
analyzed: sīrāḥpatatṛṇīḥ sthana yadā āmayati niḥ kṛtha
translated: o ploughs go ye forward ye are the grasscutters when ye have cut away the disease

original: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhā stena iva vrajamakramuḥ
analyzed: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhāḥ stenaḥ iva vrajam akramuḥ
translated: they have passed over all the obstacles like a thief over the pasture

original: oṣadhīḥprācucyavuryat kiṃ ca tanvo rapaḥ
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ prācucyavuḥ yat kim ca tanvaḥ rapaḥ
translated: the plants have shaken off whatever disease there was in the body

original: yadimā vājayannahamoṣadhīrhasta ādadhe
analyzed: yat imāḥ vājayan aham oṣadhīḥ haste ādadhe
translated: when i have taken the plants in my hand and have made them strong

original: ātmāyakṣmasya naśyati purā jīvagṛbho yathā
analyzed: ātmā ayakṣmasya naśyati purā jīva gṛbhaḥ yathā
translated: the soul of consumption perishes even as one is seized alive

original: yasyauṣadhīḥ prasarpathāṅgamañgaṃ paruṣparuḥ
analyzed: yasya oṣadhīḥ prasarpatha aṅgam añgam paruḥ paruḥ
translated: when ye creep o plants into every limb into every joint

original: tatoyakṣmaṃ vi bādhadhva ugro madhyamaśīriva🔽sākaṃ yakṣma pra pata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā
analyzed: tatas yakṣmam vi bādhadhve ugraḥ madhyamaśīḥ iva  sākam yakṣma pra pata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā
translated: from thence ye drive away consumption as a strong man drives away the feeble🔽away flies consumption together with the chiding crow

original: sākaṃvātasya dhrājyā sākaṃ naśya nihākayā
analyzed: sākaṃvātasya dhrājyā sākam naśya nihākayā
translated: together with the wind's rush together with the hawk's swoop away

original: anyā vo anyāmavatvanyānyasyā upāvata
analyzed: anyā vaḥ anyām avatu anyā anyasyai upāvata
translated: one of you shall support another another shall support this one

original: tāḥ sarvāḥsaṃvidānā idaṃ me prāvatā vacaḥ
analyzed: tāḥ sarvāḥ saṃvidānāḥ idam me prāvata vacaḥ
translated: all of you in harmony further this speech of mine

original: yāḥ phalinīryā aphalā apuṣpā yāśca puṣpiṇīḥ
analyzed: yāḥ phalinīḥ yāḥ aphalāḥ apuṣpāḥ yāḥ ca puṣpiṇīḥ
translated: whether ye be plants with fruit or fruitless with flowers or flowerless

original: bṛhaspatiprasūtāstā no muñcantvaṃhasaḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu aṃhasaḥ
translated: May they, born of Brihaspati, deliver us from tribulation.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyādatho varuṇyāduta🔽atho yamasyapaḍbīśāt sarvasmād devakilbiṣāt
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta  atha u sarvasmāt deva kilbiṣāt
translated: May they deliver me from an oath, and also from Varuna's noose,🔽And from Yama's fetter, from all sin against the gods.

original: avapatantīravadan diva oṣadhayas pari
analyzed: avapatantīḥ avadan divaḥ oṣadhayaḥ pari
translated: Falling down, the plants have spoken from heaven:

original: yaṃ jīvamaśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ
analyzed: yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ
translated: Let us enjoy this living one; he shall not perish, the man.

original: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīrbahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma rājñīḥ bahvīḥ śata vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: O you many plants, with Soma as your king, of a hundred different kinds,

original: tāsāṃ tvamasyuttamāraṃ kāmāya śaṃ hṛde
analyzed: tāsām tvam asi uttamā aram kāmāya śam hṛde
translated: You are the best of them; be gracious to this man, to his heart.

original: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīrviṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīmanu
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma rājñīḥ viṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīm anu
translated: O plants, with Soma as your king, that are spread out over the earth,

original: bṛhaspatiprasūtā asyai saṃ datta vīryam
analyzed: bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ asyai sam datta vīryam
translated: Impelled by Brihaspati, give strength to this (woman).

original: mā vo riṣat khanitā yasmai cāhaṃ khanāmi vaḥ
analyzed: mā vaḥ riṣat khanitā yasmai ca aham khanāmi vaḥ
translated: Let not the digging harm you, nor him for whom I dig you.

original: dvipaccatuṣpadasmākaṃ sarvamastvanāturam
analyzed: dvipad catuṣpada asmākam sarvam astu anāturam
translated: Let all be well with our two-footed and four-footed (cattle).

original: yāścedamupaśṛṇvanti yāśca dūraṃ parāgatāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ ca idam upaśṛṇvanti yāḥ ca dūram parāgatāḥ
translated: Those that listen to this, and those that have gone far away,

original: sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudho 'syai saṃ datta vīryam
analyzed: sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudhaḥ syai sam datta vīryam
translated: Having all assembled together, O plants, give strength to this (woman).

original: oṣadhayaḥ saṃ vadante somena saha rājñā
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ sam vadante somena saha rājñā
translated: The plants speak together with Soma, the king:

original: yasmai kṛṇotibrāhmaṇastaṃ rājan pārayāmasi
analyzed: yasmai kṛṇoti brāhmaṇaḥ tam rājan pārayāmasi
translated: O king, we deliver him whom the Brâhmana has made.

original: tvamuttamāsyoṣadhe tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ
analyzed: tvam uttamā asi oṣadhe tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ
translated: Thou art the best of plants; the trees are thy supporters.

original: upastirastuso 'smākaṃ yo asmānabhidāsati🔽bṛhaspate prati me devatāmihi mitro vā yad varuṇo vāsipūṣā
analyzed: upastiḥ astusaḥ smākam yaḥ asmān abhidāsati  bṛhaspate prati me devatā āmihi mitraḥ vā yat varuṇaḥ vā asi pūṣā
translated: May he who hates us be beneath us,🔽O Brihaspati, come to my deity, if Mitra, Varuna, or Vasu-Pusha,

original: ādityairvā yad vasubhirmarutvān sa parjanyaṃśantanave vṛṣāya🔽ā devo dūto ajiraścikitvān tvad devāpe abhi māmagachat
analyzed: ādityaiḥ vā yat vasubhiḥ marutvān sa parjanyam śantanave vṛṣāya  ā devaḥ dūtaḥ ajiraḥ cikitvān tvat devāpe abhi mām agacchat
translated: Or if with the Adityas, the Vasus, or the Maruts, you have sent Parjanya to Shatananda to rain.🔽The swift and wise god, the messenger, has come to me at your god-appointed sacrifice.

original: pratīcīnaḥ prati māmā vavṛtsva dadhāmi te dyumatīṃvācamāsan
analyzed: pratīcīnaḥ prati mām ā vavṛtsva dadhāmi te dyumatīm vācam āsan
translated: Turn to me, O messenger, and face me. I offer you the glorious speech.

original: asme dhehi dyumatīṃ vācamāsan bṛhaspate anamīvāmiṣirām
analyzed: asme dhehi dyumatīm vācam āsan bṛhaspate anamīvām iṣirām
translated: Give us the glorious speech, O Brihaspati, free from sickness and powerful,

original: yayā vṛṣṭiṃ śantanave vanāva divo drapsomadhumānā viveśa
analyzed: yayā vṛṣṭim śantanave vanāva divaḥ drapsaḥ madhumānā viveśa
translated: By which you sent rain to Shatananda, and the honey-dripping drop of heaven entered.

original: ā no drapsā madhumanto viśantvindra dehyadhirathaṃsahasram🔽ni ṣīda hotram ṛtuthā yajasva devān devāpehaviṣā saparya
analyzed: ā naḥ drapsāḥ madhumantaḥ viśantu indra dehi adhiratham sahasram  ni sīda hotram ṛtuthā yajasva devān devāpe haviṣā saparya
translated: May the honey-rich drops enter us. O Indra, give us a thousand horses.🔽Sit down as Hotri, offer according to the season, serve the gods with the sacrifice at the god-appointed sacrifice.

original: ārṣṭiṣeṇo hotram ṛṣirniṣīdan devāpirdevasumatiṃcikitvān🔽sa uttarasmādadharaṃ samudramapo divyā asṛjadvarṣyā abhi
analyzed: ārṣṭiṣeṇaḥ hotram ṛṣiḥ niṣīdan devāpiḥ deva sumatim cikitvān  saḥ uttarasmāt adharam samudram apaḥ divyāḥ asṛjat varṣyāḥ abhi
translated: The Rishi Arshtishena, the son of Devahuti, sitting down as Hotri, wise, seeking the favor of the gods,🔽Sent the heavenly waters from the northern to the southern ocean, to rain down.

original: asmin samudre adhyuttarasminnāpo devebhirnivṛtā atiṣṭhan
analyzed: asmin samudre adhi uttarasmin āpaḥ devebhiḥ nivṛtāḥ atiṣṭhan
translated: The waters were held back by the gods in that northern ocean.

original: tā adravannārṣṭiṣeṇena sṛṣṭā devāpinā preṣitāmṛkṣiṇīṣu
analyzed: tāḥ adravan ārṣṭiṣeṇena sṛṣṭāḥ devāpinā preṣitām ṛkṣiṇīṣu
translated: Those have flowed forth, created by Arshtishéna, sent by Dévapi to the Ṛṣis.

original: yad devāpiḥ śantanave purohito hotrāya vṛtaḥ kṛpayannadīdhet
analyzed: yat devāpiḥ śantanave purohitaḥ hotrāya vṛtaḥ kṛpayan adīdhet
translated: When Dévapi, chosen as priest by Shantanu, was about to bestow his favor,

original: devaśrutaṃ vṛṣṭivaniṃ rarāṇo bṛhaspatirvācamasmā ayachat
analyzed: deva śrutam vṛṣṭi vanim rarāṇaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vācam asmai ayacchat
translated: Brihaspati, desiring the god-heard, rain-winning speech, granted it to him.

original: yaṃ tvā devāpiḥ śuśucāno agna ārṣṭiṣeṇo manuṣyaḥsamīdhe🔽viśvebhirdevairanumadyamānaḥ pra parjanyamīrayā vṛṣṭimantam
analyzed: yam tvā devāpiḥ śuśucānaḥ agne ārṣṭiṣeṇaḥ manuṣyaḥ samīdhe  viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ anumadyamānaḥ pra parjanyam īraya vṛṣṭimantam
translated: You whom Dévapi, the shining man, Arshtishéna, has kindled, O Agni,🔽Being approved by all the gods, send forth Parjanya, the rain-bearing one.

original: tvāṃ pūrva ṛṣayo gīrbhirāyan tvāmadhvareṣu puruhūtaviśve
analyzed: tvām pūrve ṛṣayaḥ gīrbhiḥ āyan tvām adhvareṣu puruhūta viśve
translated: You whom the ancient Ṛṣis have invoked with songs, you whom all, O much-invoked one, have chosen at sacrifices,

original: sahasrāṇyadhirathānyasme ā no yajñaṃrohidaśvopa yāhi
analyzed: sahasrāṇi adhirathāni asme ā naḥ yajñaṃrohit aśva upa yāhi
translated: Give us thousands of chariots, O you whose horse is red. Come to our sacrifice.

original: etānyagne navatirnava tve āhutānyadhirathā sahasra
analyzed: etāni agne navatiḥ nava tve āhutāni adhirathā sahasra
translated: These, O Agni, ninety-nine thousand chariots,

original: tebhirvardhasva tanvaḥ śūra pūrvīrdivo no vṛṣṭimiṣitorirīhi
analyzed: tebhiḥ vardhasva tanvaḥ śūra pūrvīḥ divaḥ naḥ vṛṣṭim iṣitaḥ urirīhi
translated: With them, O hero, increase your many forms. Send us rain from the sky, O you who desire to send.

original: etānyagne navatiṃ sahasrā saṃ pra yacha vṛṣṇa indrāyabhāgam
analyzed: etāni agne navatim sahasrā sam pra yaccha vṛṣṇe indrāyabhāgam
translated: These, O Agni, ninety thousand, give to Indra as his share, O mighty one.

original: vidvān patha ṛtuśo devayānānapyaulānaṃ divideveṣu dhehi
analyzed: vidvān pathaḥ ṛtuśas deva yānān api aulānam divideveṣu dhehi
translated: Knowing the paths according to the seasons, leading to the gods, place the son of Ulūkhalin among the gods in heaven.

original: agne bādhasva vi mṛdho vi durgahāpāmīvāmaparakṣāṃsi sedha
analyzed: agne bādhasva vi mṛdhaḥ vi durgaha apa amīvām aparakṣāṃsi sedha
translated: O Agni, drive away the enemies, drive away the misfortunes, drive away the evil words, drive away the evil designs.

original: asmāt samudrād bṛhato divo no 'pāmbhūmānamupa naḥ sṛjeha🔽kaṃ naścitramiṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthugmānaṃ vāśraṃvāvṛdhadhyai🔽kat tasya dātu śavaso vyuṣṭau takṣadvajraṃ vṛtraturamapinvat
analyzed: asmāt samudrāt bṛhataḥ divaḥ naḥ pāmbhūmānam upa naḥ sṛja iha  kam naḥ citram iṣaṇyasi cikitvān pṛthugmānam  kad tasya dātu śavasaḥ vyuṣṭau takṣat vajram vṛtra turam apinvat
translated: From this great ocean, from the sky, bestow upon us here the greatness of the waters🔽What wondrous thing do you intend to do, O wise one, to increase the wide expanse or the dwelling?🔽At the dawning of his power, who shall give him that? He fashioned the thunderbolt, victorious over Vṛtra, and extended it

original: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthuṃ yonimasuratvāsasāda🔽sa sanīḷebhiḥ prasahāno asya bhrāturna ṛtesaptathasya māyāḥ🔽sa vājaṃ yātāpaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari ṣadatsaniṣyan
analyzed: sa hi dyutā vidyutā veti sāma pṛthum yonim asura tvā āsasāda  sa sanīḍebhiḥ prasahānaḥ asya bhrātuḥ na ṛtesaptathasya māyāḥ  sa vājam yātā apaduṣpadā yan svarṣātā pari sadat saniṣyan
translated: For he moves with lightning and with the flash of lightning, he has attained the wide womb, the state of an Asura🔽He, conquering with his companions, the illusions of this his brother, the seventh, without him🔽He, going to the prize, when his foot is hard to tread on, sits down, desiring to win, when he is self-luminous

original: anarvā yacchatadurasya vedo ghnañchiśnadevānabhi varpasā bhūt
analyzed: anarvā yat śatadurasya vedaḥ ghnan śiśna devān abhi varpasā bhūt
translated: The weapon of him who has a hundred treasures is not to be resisted; he became terrible, destroying the godless with his magic power

original: sa yahvyo 'vanīrgoṣvarvā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ🔽apādo yatra yujyāso 'rathā droṇyaśvāsa īrate ghṛtaṃvāḥ
analyzed: sa yahvyaḥ vanīḥ goṣu arvā juhoti pradhanyāsu sasriḥ  a pādaḥ yatra yujyāsaḥ rathāḥ droṇī aśvāsaḥ īrate ghṛtaṃvāḥ
translated: He, the young one, offers in the lowing cows, the most excellent, the swift one,🔽Where the unyoked, the carless, the chariotless, the mares that draw the chariot move, the waters of ghee

original: sa rudrebhiraśastavāra ṛbhvā hitvī gayamāreavadyaāgāt
analyzed: sa rudrebhiḥ aśasta vāraḥ ṛbhvā hitvī gayam āreavadya āgāt
translated: He, the impetuous one, with the Rudras, the one who has no weapon, having left the house, the abode of sin, has come

original: vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annamabhītyārodayanmuṣāyan
analyzed: vamrasya manye mithunā vivavrī annam abhītya arodayat muṣāyan
translated: I think the two of Vamra have been separated, having obtained food, having caused to flow, having deceived

original: sa id dāsaṃ tuvīravaṃ patirdan ṣaḷakṣantriśīrṣāṇaṃ damanyat
analyzed: saḥ id dāsam tuvīravam patirdan ṣaṣ akṣan tri śīrṣāṇam damanyat
translated: He, the lord, has destroyed the Dāsa, the strong one, he has killed the one with thirty-six heads

original: asya trito nvojasā vṛdhāno vipāvarāhamayoagrayā han🔽sa druhvaṇe manuṣa ūrdhvasāna ā sāviṣadarśasānāyaśarum
analyzed: asya tritaḥ nu ojasā vṛdhānaḥ vipāvarāham ayoagrayā han  sa druhvaṇe manuṣe ūrdhvasānaḥ ā sāviṣa darśasāna ayaśarum
translated: Trita, indeed, by his strength, waxing great, slew the boar with the foremost of arrows🔽He, for the man who looks on with uplifted face, sent down the arrow to the one who hates him

original: sa nṛtamo nahuṣo 'smat sujātaḥ puro 'bhinadarhandasyuhatye
analyzed: sa nṛtamaḥ nahuṣaḥ smat su jātaḥ puraḥ bhinat arhan dasyu hatye
translated: He, best of men, of noble birth, among us, deserves to be praised, to slay the Dasyus in the front

original: so abhriyo na yavasa udanyan kṣayāya gātuṃ vidan no asme
analyzed: saḥ abhriyaḥ na yavasaḥ udanyan kṣayāya gātum vidat naḥ asme
translated: He, like a cloud, having sent down rain on the grass, found a way to the abode, to us

original: upa yat sīdadinduṃ śarīraiḥ śyeno 'yopāṣṭirhantidasyūn
analyzed: upa yat sīdat indum śarīraiḥ śyenaḥ yopāṣṭiḥ hanti dasyūn
translated: When he sits down with his limbs on the moon, the hawk with iron talons slays the Dasas

original: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhirasya kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ kṛpaṇeparādāt
analyzed: sa vrādhataḥ śavasānebhiḥ asya kutsāya śuṣṇam kṛpaṇeparādāt
translated: He, with his most powerful ones, for Kutsa, in the battle, drove away the evil-doing Sushna

original: ayaṃ kavimanayacchasyamānamatkaṃ vo asyasanitota nṛṇām
analyzed: ayam kavim anayat śasyamānam atkam vaḥ nṛṇām
translated: This one led the wise one, the one to be praised, the young one, the one who sits in the midst of men

original: ayaṃ daśasyan naryebhirasya dasmo devebhirvaruṇo namāyī
analyzed: ayam daśasyan naryebhiḥ asya dasmaḥ devebhiḥ varuṇaḥ namāyī
translated: This one, bestowing, with his heroes, with his wondrous gods, is Varuna, the one to be worshipped

original: ayaṃ kanīna ṛtupā avedyamimītāraruṃ yaścatuṣpāt
analyzed: ayam kanīnaḥ ṛtu pāḥ avet yamimīta ararum yaḥ catuṣpād
translated: This one, the young one, knowing the seasons, measured the four-footed one, the one with the red feet

original: asya stomebhirauśija ṛjiśvā vrajaṃ darayad vṛṣabheṇapiproḥ
analyzed: asya stomebhiḥ auśijaḥ ṛjiśvā vrajam darayat vṛṣabheṇapiproḥ
translated: By his praises, Rijiṣvan of Auśija, with the bull of Piprū, broke open the pen

original: sutvā yad yajato dīdayad gīḥ pura iyāno abhivarpasā bhūt
analyzed: sutvā yat yajataḥ dīdayat gīḥ puras iyānaḥ abhivarpasā bhūt
translated: When he, the one to be praised, having pressed, shines forth, he became one who goes forward with abundant wealth

original: evā maho asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhirupa sarpadindram
analyzed: eva mahaḥ asura vakṣathāya vamrakaḥ paḍbhiḥ upa sarpat indram
translated: So, O great Asura, for the sake of speech, Vamraka should approach Indra with his eight (feet)

original: sa iyānaḥ karati svastimasmā iṣamūrjaṃsukṣitiṃ viśvamābhāḥ
analyzed: saḥ iyānaḥ karati svastim asmai iṣam ūrjam su kṣitim viśvam ābhāḥ
translated: He, being thus invoked, grants him welfare, food, strength, and all good things.

original: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvadid bhuja iha stutaḥ sutapābodhi no vṛdhe🔽devebhirnaḥ savitā prāvatu śrutamāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: indra dṛhya maghavan tvāvadid bhuja iha stutaḥ suta pābodhi naḥ vṛdhe  devebhiḥ naḥ savitā prāvatu śrutam āsarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: O Indra, be firm, O bountiful one, for us, praised here, be a good drinker, be aware of our prosperity.🔽May Savitar the God impel us to renown, we choose the all-surpassing help of Aditi.

original: bharāya su bharata bhāgam ṛtviyaṃ pra vāyave śucipekrandadiṣṭaye
analyzed: bharāya su bharata bhāgam ṛtviyam pra vāyave śuci pekrandat iṣṭaye
translated: Bring to the feast the due portion, O ye who are to be bidden, to Vayu who delights in the pure for the sake of the cry of joy.

original: gaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītimānaśa āsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe🔽ā no devaḥ savitā sāviṣad vaya ṛjūyate yajamānāyasunvate
analyzed: gaurasya yaḥ payasaḥ pītimān aśe āsarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe  ā naḥ devaḥ savitā sāviṣat vayaḥ ṛjūyate yajamānāya sunvate
translated: He who is worthy to drink the milk of the cow, we choose the all-surpassing help of Aditi.🔽May the God Savitar impel us to strength, to the upright path, to the sacrificer who presses (Soma).

original: yathā devān pratibhūṣema pākavadā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: yathā devān pratibhūṣema pākavadā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: That we may be able to serve the Gods with food, we choose the all-surpassing help of Aditi.

original: indro asme sumanā astu viśvahā rājā somaḥ suvitasyādhyetu naḥ
analyzed: indraḥ asme sumanāḥ astu viśvahā rājā somaḥ suvitasya adhyetu naḥ
translated: May Indra be well-disposed to us always, may Soma, the King, be the impeller of our prosperity.

original: yathāyathā mitradhitāni sandadhurā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: yathā yathā mitradhitāni sandadhurā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: That the agreements made with the friends may be firm, we choose the all-surpassing help of Aditi.

original: indra ukthena śavasā parurdadhe bṛhaspate pratarītāsyāyuṣaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ ukthena śavasā parurdadhe bṛhaspate pratarītā asya āyuṣaḥ
translated: By the Uktha Indra has made his body strong, O Brhaspati, be the leader of our life.

original: yajño manuḥ pramatirnaḥ pitā hi kamāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: yajñaḥ manuḥ pramatiḥ naḥ pitā hi kam asarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: The sacrifice, Manu, the forethought, is our father, we choose the all-surpassing help of Aditi.

original: indrasya nu sukṛtaṃ daivyaṃ saho 'gnirgṛhe jaritāmedhiraḥ kaviḥ
analyzed: indrasya nu su kṛtam daivyam sahaḥ gniḥ gṛhe jaritāmedhiraḥ kaviḥ
translated: Indra's well-performed divine strength, Agni in the house, the wise, singing, sage,

original: yajñaśca bhūd vidathe cārurantama āsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe🔽na vo guhā cakṛma bhūri duṣkṛtaṃ nāviṣṭyaṃ vasavodevaheḷanam
analyzed: yajñaḥ ca bhūt vidathe cāruḥ antamaḥ āsarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe  na vaḥ guhā cakṛma bhūri duṣkṛtam na āviṣṭyam vasavaḥ deva heḍanam
translated: and the sacrifice became beautiful in the assembly, we choose Aditi for all-protection.🔽We have not done much evil in secret, O Vasus, no treachery, O gods, to be offended at.

original: mākirno devā anṛtasya varpasa ā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: mākir naḥ devāḥ anṛtasya varpasaḥ ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: Let not the gods' form of untruth come near us, we choose Aditi for all-protection.

original: apāmīvāṃ savitā sāviṣan nyag varīya idapa sedhantvadrayaḥ
analyzed: apa amīvām savitā sāviṣat varīyaḥ id apa sedhantu adrayaḥ
translated: Savitar has sent away our evil cry, may the Adryas drive away the worst of it.

original: grāvā yatra madhuṣuducyate bṛhadāsarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe🔽ūrdhvo grāvā vasavo 'stu sotari viśvā dveṣāṃsi sanutaryuyota
analyzed: grāvā yatra madhuṣut ucyate bṛhat āsarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe  ūrdhvaḥ grāvā vasavaḥ stu sotari viśvā dveṣāṃsi sanutarā uyota
translated: Where the stone is set in motion, sweet-sounding, high, we choose Aditi for all-protection.🔽Let the stone be high, O Vasus, in the pressing, drive away all enmities, O all-surpassing one.

original: sa no devaḥ savitā pāyurīḍya ā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: sa naḥ devaḥ savitā pāyuḥ īḍyaḥ ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: That god Savitar is to be praised as our protector, we choose Aditi for all-protection.

original: ūrjaṃ gāvo yavase pīvo attana ṛtasya yāḥ sadane kośeaṅgdhve
analyzed: ūrjam gāvaḥ yavase pīvaḥ attana ṛtasya yāḥ sadane kośe aṅgdhve
translated: Let the cows eat food and fatten on the fodder, which are fastened in the house of truth, in the trough.

original: tanūreva tanvo astu bheṣajamā sarvatātiṃaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe
analyzed: tanūḥ eva tanvaḥ astu bheṣajam ā sarvatātiṃaditim vṛṇīmahe
translated: Let the body be a remedy for the body, we choose Aditi for all-protection.

original: kratuprāvā jaritā śaśvatāmava indra id bhadrāpramatiḥ sutāvatām
analyzed: kratuprāvā jaritā śaśvatām avaḥ indraḥ id bhadra apramatiḥ sutāvatām
translated: The singer, with the stone for his organ, is the all-surpassing one of all, Indra is the one who approves the good of the pressed (Soma).

original: pūrṇamūdhardivyaṃ yasya siktayaā sarvatātimaditiṃ vṛṇīmahe🔽citraste bhānuḥ kratuprā abhiṣṭiḥ santi spṛdhojaraṇiprā adhṛṣṭāḥ
analyzed: pūrṇa mūdhar divyam yasya siktaye ā sarvatātim aditim vṛṇīmahe  citraḥ te bhānuḥ kratu prāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ santi spṛdhaḥ jaraṇi prāḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Whose head is full, divine, sprinkled with all libations, we choose Aditi🔽Your light is wondrous, O Agni, it is the protector of the sacrifice, it is invincible, it is swift to consume the enemies

original: rajiṣṭhayā rajyā paśva ā gostūtūrṣaty paryagraṃ duvasyuḥ
analyzed: rajiṣṭhayā rajyā paśve ā goḥ tūtūrṣati paryagram duvasyuḥ
translated: With the most excellent rule, the worshipper strives to win cattle and the prize

original: ud budhyadhvaṃ samanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ samagnimindhvaṃ bahavaḥsanīḷāḥ
analyzed: ud budhyadhvam samanasaḥ sakhāyaḥ sam agnim indhvam bahavaḥ sanīḍāḥ
translated: Awaken, with one mind, O friends; kindle the fire, O many, with fuel

original: dadhikrāmagnimuṣasaṃ ca devīmindrāvato'vase ni hvaye vaḥ
analyzed: dadhikrām agnim uṣasam ca devīm indrāvatovase ni hvaye vaḥ
translated: I call to you Dadhikrâvan, Agni, and the divine Dawn, for the sake of Indra, for help

original: mandrā kṛṇudhvaṃ dhiya ā tanudhvaṃ nāvamaritraparaṇīṃkṛṇudhvam🔽iṣkṛṇudhvamāyudhāraṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ prāñcaṃyajñaṃ pra ṇayatā sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: mandrā kṛṇudhvam dhiyaḥ ā tanudhvam nāva maritra paraṇīṃkṛṇudhvam  iṣkṛṇudhvam āyudhā aram kṛṇudhvam prāñcaṃyajñam pra nayata sakhāyaḥ
translated: Make yourselves cheerful, make your thoughts ready; make the boat that carries over to the immortals ready🔽Make the life-upholding ready; make the sacrifice go forward, O friends

original: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvaṃ kṛte yonau vapateha bījam
analyzed: yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvam kṛte yonau vapata iha bījam
translated: Yoke the ploughs, spread out the yokes; having prepared the womb, sow here the seed

original: girā ca śruṣṭiḥ śabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥpakvameyāt
analyzed: girā ca śruṣṭiḥ śabharāḥ asat naḥ nedīyaḥ id sṛṇyaḥ pakvam eyāt
translated: And may the hearing be favourable to us, O word; may the reaper come soon, when the corn is ripe

original: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yugā vi tanvate pṛthak
analyzed: sīrā yuñjanti kavayaḥ yugā vi tanvate pṛthak
translated: The wise yoke the ploughs, they spread out the yokes separately

original: dhīrādeveṣu sumnayā
analyzed: dhīrādeveṣu sumnayā
translated: The wise, with devotion to the gods

original: nirāhāvān kṛṇotana saṃ varatrā dadhātana
analyzed: nirāhāvān kṛṇotana sam varatrāḥ dadhātana
translated: Make the ploughs go straight; put the cross-bars together

original: siñcāmahāavatamudriṇaṃ vayaṃ suṣekamanupakṣitam
analyzed: siñcāmahai avata mudriṇam vayam suṣekam an upakṣitam
translated: We will pour down the rain-filled (cloud), the well-oiled, the unspilt

original: iṣkṛtāhāvamavataṃ suvaratraṃ suṣecanam
analyzed: iṣkṛta āhāvam avatam su varatram suṣecanam
translated: The well-filled trough, the good halter, the good sprinkler

original: udriṇaṃ siñceakṣitam
analyzed: udriṇam siñca īakṣitam
translated: I sprinkle the inexhaustible one.

original: prīṇītāśvān hitaṃ jayātha svastivāhaṃ rathamitkṛṇudhvam
analyzed: prīṇīta aśvān hitam jayātha svasti vāham ratham id kṛṇudhvam
translated: Honor the horses, win the prize, make the chariot that carries well and safely.

original: droṇāhāvamavatamaśmacakramaṃsatrakośaṃsiñcatā nṛpāṇam
analyzed: droṇa āhāvam avatam aśma cakram aṃsatra kośam siñcata nṛpāṇam
translated: Make the trough for the Drona measure, the low place, the stone-rimmed trough, the one that pours for the kings.

original: vrajaṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ sa hi vo nṛpāṇo varma sīvyadhvaṃ bahulāpṛthūni
analyzed: vrajam kṛṇudhvam sa hi vaḥ nṛpāṇaḥ varma sīvyadhvam bahulāpṛthūni
translated: Make the pen, for he is the king for you. Sew the many broad coverings.

original: puraḥ kṛṇudhvamāyasīradhṛṣṭā mā vaḥ susroccamaso dṛṃhatā tam
analyzed: puraḥ kṛṇudhvam āyasīḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ mā vaḥ susrot camasaḥ dṛṃhata tam
translated: Make the iron forts that cannot be breached. Let not the well-made cauldron shake it.

original: ā vo dhiyaṃ yajñiyāṃ varta ūtaye devā devīṃ yajatāṃyajñiyāmiha
analyzed: ā vaḥ dhiyam yajñiyām varte ūtaye devāḥ devīm yajatām yajñiyām iha
translated: We invoke your divine thought for help, O gods, the divine one worthy of sacrifice, here at the sacrifice.

original: sā no duhīyad yavaseva gatvī sahasradhārāpayasā mahī gauḥ🔽ā tū ṣiñca harimīṃ drorupasthe vāśībhistakṣatāśmanmayībhiḥ
analyzed: sā naḥ duhīyat yavasā iva gatvī sahasra dhārā payasā mahī gauḥ  ā tu siñca harimīm droḥ upasthe vāśībhiḥ takṣata aśmanmayībhiḥ
translated: May it yield for us like a cow when milked, with a thousand streams, with great milk, when it has gone to the fodder.🔽Pour out the tawny one into the lap of the trough. Cut it with the stone knives.

original: pari ṣvajadhvaṃ daśa kakṣyābhirubhe dhurau prati vahniṃ yunakta
analyzed: pari svajadhvam daśa kakṣyābhiḥ ubhe dhurau prati vahnim yunakta
translated: Embrace it with the ten girdles. Yoke the fire to both poles.

original: ubhe dhurau vahnirāpibdamāno 'ntaryoneva carati dvijāniḥ
analyzed: ubhe dhurau vahniḥ āpibdamānaḥ ntaryonā iva carati dvi jāniḥ
translated: The fire, being pressed, moves between the two poles, like a bird in its nest.

original: vanaspatiṃ vana āsthāpayadhvaṃ ni ṣū dadhidhvamakhananta utsam
analyzed: vanaspatim vane āsthāpayadhvam ni su dadhidhvam a khanantaḥ utsam
translated: Establish the tree in the forest. Press it down. Dig the spring.

original: kapṛn naraḥ kapṛthamud dadhātana codayata khudatavājasātaye
analyzed: kapṛth naraḥ kapṛtham ud dadhātana codayata khudata vājasātaye
translated: O men, raise up the hero Kapṛth, urge him on to win the prize

original: niṣṭigryaḥ putramā cyāvayotaya indraṃsabādha iha somapītaye
analyzed: niṣṭigryaḥ putram ā cyāvaya ūtaye indraṃsabādhaḥ iha soma pītaye
translated: Nistriṃśa's son, and Sābadhi, invite Indra here to drink the Soma

original: pra te rathaṃ mithūkṛtamindro 'vatu dhṛṣṇuyā
analyzed: pra te ratham mithūkṛtam indraḥ vatu dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: May Indra aid thy chariot yoked in pairs for daring

original: asminnājau puruhūta śravāyye dhanabhakṣeṣu no 'va
analyzed: asmin ājau puruhūta śravāyye dhana bhakṣeṣu naḥ vaḥ
translated: In this battle, O much-invoked one, for glory, be thou the enjoyer of our wealth

original: ut sma vāto vahati vāso 'syā adhirathaṃ yadajayat sahasram🔽rathīrabhūn mudgalānī gaviṣṭau bhare kṛtaṃ vyacedindrasenā
analyzed: ud sma vātaḥ vahati vāsaḥ syāḥ adhiratham yat ajayat sahasram  rathīḥ abhūt mudgalānī gaviṣṭau bhare kṛtam vyacet indrasenā
translated: The wind blows her garment, which she won in the chariot race, a thousand🔽Mudgalani was the charioteer in the contest for the cow, Indra's army broke the prepared obstacle

original: antaryacha jighāṃsato vajramindrābhidāsataḥ
analyzed: antaryaccha jighāṃsataḥ vajram indra abhidāsataḥ
translated: Hide within thyself the thunderbolt, O Indra, against the would-be slayers, the revilers

original: dāsasyavā maghavannāryasya vā sanutaryavayā vadham🔽udno hradamapibajjarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭaṃ sma tṛṃhadabhimātimeti🔽pra muṣkabhāraḥ śrava ichamāno 'jirambāhū abharat siṣāsan
analyzed: maghavan āryasya vā sanutaryavayā vadham  udnaḥ hradam apibat jarhṛṣāṇaḥ kūṭam sma tṛṃhat abhimātim eti  pra muṣka bhāraḥ śravaḥ icchamānaḥ jirambāhū abharat siṣāsan
translated: Of the Dāsa or the Ārya, O mighty one, to smite them down in their strength🔽The trembling one drank the lake and the pool, he gnawed the horn and attacked the enemy🔽The one with the heavy testicles, seeking glory, longing, stretched out his unwearying arms

original: nyakrandayannupayanta enamamehayan vṛṣabhaṃ madhya ājeḥ
analyzed: nyakrandayan upayantaḥ enam amehayan vṛṣabham madhye ājeḥ
translated: They made him roar, they made him flow, they made the bull bellow in the midst of the goats

original: tena sūbharvaṃ śatavat sahasraṃ gavāṃ mudgalaḥ pradhanejigāya
analyzed: tena sūbharvam śatavat sahasram gavām mudgalaḥ pradhane jigāya
translated: By him Mudgala won in the contest a hundred times a thousand excellent cattle

original: kakardave vṛṣabho yukta āsīdavāvacīt sārathirasya keśī🔽dudheryuktasya dravataḥ sahānasa ṛchanti ṣmā niṣpadomudgalānīm🔽uta pradhimudahannasya vidvānupāyunag vaṃsagamatraśikṣan🔽indra udāvat patimaghnyānāmaraṃhatapadyābhiḥ kakudmān🔽śunamaṣtrāvyacarat kapardī varatrāyāṃ dārvānahyamānaḥ🔽nṛmṇāni kṛṇvan bahave janāya gāḥpaspaśānastaviṣīradhatta🔽imaṃ taṃ paśya vṛṣabhasya yuñjaṃ kāṣṭhāyā madhyedrughaṇaṃ śayānam
analyzed: kakardave vṛṣabhaḥ yuktaḥ āsīt avāvacīt sārathiḥ asya keśī  dudheḥ yuktasya dravataḥ saha anase ṛchanti sma niṣpadaḥ mudgalānīm  uta pradhim udahan asya vidvān upāyunak vaṃsagam atra śikṣan  indraḥ udāvat patim aghnyānām araṃhata padyābhiḥ kakudmān  śunamaṣtrā avyacarat kapardī varatrāyām dārvā nahyamānaḥ  nṛmṇāni kṛṇvan bahave janāya  imam tam paśya vṛṣabhasya yuñjam kāṣṭhāyāḥ madhyedrughaṇam śayānam
translated: The bull was yoked to the mire, his driver Keśin urged him on

original: yena jigāya śatavat sahasraṃ gavāmmudgalaḥ pṛtanājyeṣu🔽āre aghā ko nvitthā dadarśa yaṃ yuñjanti taṃ vāsthāpayanti🔽nāsmai tṛṇaṃ nodakamā bharantyuttaro dhurovahati pradediśat🔽parivṛkteva patividyamānaṭ pīpyānā kūcakreṇeva siñcan🔽eṣaiṣyā cid rathyā jayema sumaṅgalaṃ sinavadastu sātam
analyzed: yena jigāya śatavat sahasram gavām mudgalaḥ pṛtanājyeṣu 🔽āre aghā kaḥ nu itthā dadarśa yam yuñjanti tam vā āsthāpayanti 🔽na asmai tṛṇam na udakam ā bharanti uttaraḥ dhuraḥ vahati pradediśat 🔽parivṛktā iva pati vidyamānaṭ pīpyānā kūcakreṇa iva siñcan 🔽eṣaiṣyā cit rathyā jayema su maṅgalam sinavat astu sātam
translated: The swift-moving one yoked to the udder, the one with the hump, the one with the hoof, the one with the foot, the one with the tail, the one with the dewlap, the one with the horns, the one with the hooves, the one with the hooves, the

original: tvaṃ viśvasya jagataścakṣurindrāsi cakṣuṣaḥ🔽vṛṣāyadājiṃ vṛṣaṇā siṣāsasi codayan vadhriṇā yujā
analyzed: tvam viśvasya jagataḥ cakṣuḥ indra asi cakṣuṣaḥ  vṛṣāyat ājim vṛṣaṇā siṣāsasi codayan vadhriṇā yujā
translated: You are the eye of the universe and of the world, O Indra, and of the eye🔽You urge on the battle, O mighty one, with your lame companion, striving for the prize, O you who delight in the battle

original: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaścarṣaṇīnām
analyzed: āśuḥ śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ carṣaṇīnām
translated: Swift, sharpened, terrible like a bull, the crusher of forts, the agitator of peoples

original: saṃkrandano 'nimiṣa ekavīraḥ śataṃ senāajayat sākamindraḥ
analyzed: saṃkrandanaḥ nimiṣaḥ eka vīraḥ śatam senāḥ ajayat sākamindraḥ
translated: The roaring, unblinking, solitary hero, Indra, together with the hundred armies, has conquered

original: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanenadhṛṣṇunā
analyzed: saṃkrandanena animiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā
translated: With the roaring, unblinking, victorious, fighting, hard-to-move, daring

original: tadindreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho naraiṣuhastena vṛṣṇā
analyzed: tat indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvam yudhaḥ nara eṣu hastena vṛṣṇā
translated: With that, O men, conquer with Indra, unite in the battle with the mighty one who wields the arrow in his hand

original: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhirvaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhaindro gaṇena
analyzed: saḥ iṣu hastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhiḥ vaśī saṃsraṣṭā sa yudhā aindraḥ gaṇena
translated: He, the powerful one, with the arrow-bearers, with the quiver-bearers, the gatherer, Indra with the troop

original: saṃsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhyugradhanvāpratihitābhirastā
analyzed: saṃsṛṣṭa jit soma pā bāhuśardhī ugra dhanvā apratihita abhirastā
translated: The conqueror in the gathering, the drinker of Soma, the mighty-armed, the wielder of the fierce bow, with the well-aimed arrows

original: bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrānapabādhamānaḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspate pari dīya rathena rakṣaḥ hā amitrān apabādhamānaḥ
translated: O Brihaspati, go around with your chariot, the slayer of demons, repelling the enemies

original: prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇo yudhā jayannasmākamedhyavitā rathānām
analyzed: prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇaḥ yudhā jayan asmākamedhya vitā rathānām
translated: Crushing the armies, destroying in battle, victorious, be the protector of our chariots

original: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaugraḥ
analyzed: sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamāna augraḥ
translated: The powerful, the heroic, the mighty, the victorious, the strong, the conqueror of the strong

original: abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitramindra rathamātiṣṭha govit
analyzed: abhivīraḥ abhisatvā sahaḥ jāḥ jaitram indra ratham ātiṣṭha go vid
translated: The hero, the powerful, the mighty, the victorious, O Indra, mount the chariot that finds the cattle

original: gotrabhidaṃ govidaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantamajma pramṛṇantamojasā
analyzed: gotrabhidam go vidam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā
translated: The clan-splitter, the finder of cattle, the one with the thunderbolt in his arm, the victorious, the one who crushes the wicked with his strength,

original: imaṃ sajātā anu vīrayadhvamindraṃ sakhāyo anusaṃ rabhadhvam
analyzed: imam sajātāḥ anu vīrayadhvam indram sakhāyaḥ anusam rabhadhvam
translated: Exert yourselves after this Indra, O kinsmen, O friends, be eager after him.

original: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamāno 'dayo vīraḥ śatamanyurindraḥ
analyzed: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamānaḥ dayaḥ vīraḥ śatamanyuḥ indraḥ
translated: This Indra, the hero who does not give way, with a hundred resentments, penetrating the clans with violence,

original: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḷ ayudhyo 'smākaṃ senāavatu pra yutsu
analyzed: duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāh ayudhyaḥ smākam senā avatu pra yutsu
translated: Hard to overthrow, victorious in battle, may he protect our army in the battles.

original: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatirdakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etusomaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ āsām netā bṛhaspatiḥ dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ puras etusomaḥ
translated: May Indra be their leader, may Brihaspati be on their right, may the sacrifice go in front, may Soma

original: devasenānāmabhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnāṃ marutoyantvagram
analyzed: deva senānām abhibhañjatīnām jayantīnām marutaḥ yantu agram
translated: Go in front of the victorious, conquering armies of the gods, of the Maruts.

original: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutāṃśardha ugram🔽mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣodevānāṃ jayatāmudasthāt
analyzed: indrasya vṛṣṇaḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ ādityānām marutām śardhaḥ ugram  mahāmanasām bhuvanacyavānām ghoṣaḥ devānām jayatām udasthāt
translated: The mighty shout of Indra the mighty, of Varuna the king, of the Adityas, of the Maruts,🔽The shout of the gods who conquer, who have great minds, who shake the world, has arisen.

original: ud dharṣaya maghavannāyudhānyut satvanāṃ māmakānāmmanāṃsi
analyzed: ud dharṣaya maghavan āyudhāni ud satvanām māmakānām manāṃsi
translated: Exalt the weapons, O mighty one, exalt the spirits of my heroes.

original: ud vṛtrahan vājināṃ vājinānyud rathānāṃjayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ🔽asmākamindraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣvasmākaṃ yā iṣavastājayantu
analyzed: ud vṛtrahan vājinām vājināni ud rathānām jayatām yantu ghoṣāḥ  asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tā jayantu
translated: Exalt the powers of the powerful, O Vrtra-killer, let the shouts of the victorious chariots go forth.🔽May Indra be with our banners when they are victorious, may our arrows be victorious.

original: asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantvasmānu devā avatāhaveṣu
analyzed: asmākam vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmān anu devāḥ avata āhaveṣu
translated: May our heroes be superior, O gods, help us in the battles.

original: amīṣāṃ cittaṃ pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇāṅgānyapve parehi
analyzed: amīṣām cittam pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi
translated: Attracting the hearts of these, take away their limbs and depart in peace

original: abhi prehi nirdaha hṛtsu śokairandhenāmitrāstamasāsacantām
analyzed: abhi prehi nirdaha hṛtsu śokaiḥ andhena amitrāḥ tamasā asacantām
translated: Go forth and burn them in their hearts with grief, let the enemies be covered with blinding darkness

original: pretā jayatā nara indro vaḥ śarma yachatu
analyzed: pra ita jayata naraḥ indraḥ vaḥ śarma yacchatu
translated: Go forth, O men, to victory, may Indra grant you protection

original: ugrā vaḥ santubāhavo 'nādhṛṣyā yathāsatha
analyzed: ugrāḥ vaḥ santubāhavaḥ na adhṛṣyāḥ yathā asatha
translated: Let your arms be strong, that they may not be overcome

original: asāvi somaḥ puruhūta tubhyaṃ haribhyāṃ yajñamupa yāhitūyam
analyzed: asāvi somaḥ puruhūta tubhyam haribhyām yajñam upa yāhitūyam
translated: The Soma has been pressed for you, O much-invoked one, come with your two bay steeds to this sacrifice

original: tubhyaṃ giro vipravīrā iyānā dadhanvira indrapibā sutasya
analyzed: tubhyam giraḥ vipra vīrāḥ iyānāḥ dadhanvire indra pibā sutasya
translated: My songs, led by the wise, going to you, O Indra, have flowed forth; drink of the juice

original: apsu dhūtasya harivaḥ pibeha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharampṛṇasva
analyzed: apsu dhūtasya harivas piba iha nṛbhiḥ sutasya jaṭharampṛṇasva
translated: Drink of the Soma washed in the waters, O you who love the tawny (horses); fill your belly with the juice pressed by men

original: mimikṣuryamadraya indra tubhyaṃ tebhirvardhasvamadamukthavāhaḥ
analyzed: mimikṣuḥ yam adrayaḥ indra tubhyam tebhiḥ vardhasva amadam uktha vāhaḥ
translated: Mixed by the pressers, O Indra, for you; with them increase your joy, O you who carry the praises (of the sacrificer)

original: progrāṃ pītiṃ vṛṣṇa iyarmi satyāṃ prayai sutasyaharyaśva tubhyam
analyzed: pra ugrām pītim vṛṣṇe iyarmi satyām prayai sutasya haryaśva tubhyam
translated: I send forth the true strong draught for the strong one; send forth the juice for you, O you who have tawny horses

original: indra dhenābhiriha mādayasva dhībhirviśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: indra dhenābhiḥ iha mādayasva dhībhiḥ viśvābhiḥ śacyā gṛṇānaḥ
translated: O Indra, rejoice here with the milkings, with all the thoughts, being praised with the powerful (songs)

original: ūtī śacīvastava vīryeṇa vayo dadhānā uśija ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: ūtī śacīvas tava vīryeṇa vayaḥ dadhānāḥ uśijaḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: With your help, O powerful one, by your strength, the sages, knowing the truth, have gained life

original: prajāvadindra manuṣo duroṇe tasthurgṛṇantaḥsadhamādyāsaḥ
analyzed: prajāvat indra manuṣaḥ duroṇe tasthuḥ gṛṇantaḥ sadhamādyāsaḥ
translated: In the house of men, O Indra, abounding in offspring, they have stood, the best at the feast, singing (your praises)

original: praṇītibhiṣ ṭe haryaśva suṣṭoḥ suṣumnasya pururucojanāsaḥ
analyzed: praṇītibhiḥ te hari aśva suṣṭoḥ suṣumnasya puru rucaḥ janāsaḥ
translated: With the Praṇītī verses, O thou whose Bay Steeds are well-praised, well-disposed, much-invoked,

original: maṃhiṣṭhāmūtiṃ vitire dadhānā stotāraindra tava sūnṛtābhiḥ
analyzed: maṃhiṣṭhā amūtim vitire dadhānā stotārā aindra tava sūnṛtābhiḥ
translated: Endowed with most munificent protection, with thy delights, O Indra, we thy praisers.

original: upa brahmāṇi harivo haribhyāṃ somasya yāhi pītaye sutasya
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi harivas haribhyām somasya yāhi pītaye sutasya
translated: Come with thy Bay Steeds to the prayers, O thou who hast Bay Steeds, to drink the juice of Soma, of the pressed (juice),

original: indra tvā yajñaḥ kṣamamāṇamānaḍ dāśvānasyadhvarasya praketaḥ
analyzed: indra tvā yajñaḥ kṣamamāṇam ānaṭ dāśvānasi adhvarasya praketaḥ
translated: O Indra, the sacrifice hath made thee its object, the sign of the worshipper's rite.

original: sahasravājamabhimātiṣāhaṃ suteraṇaṃ maghavānaṃ suvṛktim
analyzed: sahasra vājam abhimātiṣāham suta īraṇam maghavānam suvṛktim
translated: The thousand-powered, the conqueror of enemies, the liberal giver, the bountiful, the well-praised,

original: upa bhūṣanti giro apratītamindraṃ namasyā jarituḥpananta
analyzed: upa bhūṣanti giraḥ apratītam indram namasyāḥ jarituḥ pananta
translated: The songs of praise approach the matchless Indra: they comfort him, the singer's adoration.

original: saptāpo devīḥ suraṇā amṛktā yābhiḥ sindhumatara indrapūrbhit
analyzed: sapta apaḥ devīḥ su raṇāḥ amṛktāḥ yābhiḥ sindhumataraḥ indra pūrbhid
translated: The seven divine, unerring, rapid currents, wherewith thou, O Indra, hast filled the river,

original: navatiṃ srotyā nava ca sravantīrdevebhyo gātummanuṣe ca vindaḥ
analyzed: navatim srotyāḥ nava ca sravantīḥ devebhyaḥ gātum manuṣe ca vindaḥ
translated: The ninety-nine and nine, the streams that flow together, thou hast found for the Gods and for mankind.

original: apo mahīrabhiśasteramuñco 'jāgarāsvadhi deva ekaḥ
analyzed: apaḥ mahīḥ abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ jāgarāsu adhi devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: Thou, O God, alone hast loosed the waters, the mighty ones, from the curse of sleep.

original: indra yāstvaṃ vṛtratūrye cakartha tābhirviśvāyustanvaṃ pupuṣyāḥ
analyzed: indra yāḥ tvam vṛtratūrye cakartha tābhiḥ viśvāyuḥ tanvam pupuṣyāḥ
translated: O Indra, with those deeds which thou hast done in the fight with Vritra, do thou, all-living, nourish thy body.

original: vīreṇyaḥ kraturindraḥ suśastirutāpi dhenā puruhūtamīṭṭe
analyzed: vīreṇyaḥ kratuḥ indraḥ su śastiḥ uta api dhenā puruhūtam īṭṭe
translated: Indra is a hero's rite, well-praised, even the milch-cow yields milk to him, the much-invoked,

original: ārdayad vṛtramakṛṇodu lokaṃ sasāhe śakraḥpṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ
analyzed: ārdayat vṛtram akṛṇot u lokam sasāhe śakraḥpṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ
translated: He hath smitten Vritra, made the world his own: as a warrior, as a protector, Indra hath overcome the armies.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānamindraṃ / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the mighty one...

original: kadā vaso stotraṃ haryata āva śmaśā rudhad vāḥ
analyzed: kadā vasoḥ stotram haryataḥ āva śmaśā rudhat vāḥ
translated: When, O Vasu, will you delight in the praise? Come to the place of the flowing waters!

original: dīrghaṃ sutaṃ vātāpyāya
analyzed: dīrgham sutam vātāpyāya
translated: The long-drawn Soma has been pressed, to be offered to Vata.

original: harī yasya suyujā vivratā verarvantānu śepā🔽ubhārajī na keśinā patirdan
analyzed: harī yasya su yujā vivratā verarvantā anu śepā  ubhā arajī na keśinā
translated: The two well-yoked, well-directed bay horses of the one who has the chariot, the swift one, follow.🔽The lord, the one with the long mane, is not with the one who has no mane.

original: apa yorindraḥ pāpaja ā marto na śaśramāṇo bibhīvān
analyzed: apa yoḥ indraḥ pāpa jaḥ ā martaḥ na śaśramāṇaḥ bibhīvān
translated: Indra, like a frightened mortal, has gone away from the two sinful ones.

original: śubhe yad yuyuje taviṣīvān🔽sacāyorindraścarkṛṣa ānupānasaḥ saparyan
analyzed: śubhe yat yuyuje taviṣīvān  sacā ayoḥ indraḥ carkṛṣe ānupānasaḥ saparyan
translated: When he has yoked himself for the good, as if powerful.🔽Indra has come to the two who are acting together, who are not to be surpassed, who are to be served.

original: nadayorvivratayoḥ śūra indraḥ
analyzed: nadayoḥ vivratayoḥ śūraḥ indraḥ
translated: Indra, the hero, is between the two who are separated, who are flowing.

original: adhi yastasthau keśavantā vyacasvantā na puṣṭyai
analyzed: adhi yaḥ tasthau keśavantā vyacasvantā na puṣṭyai
translated: He who has stood on the two with long hair, the two wide ones, for prosperity.

original: vanoti śiprābhyāṃ śipriṇīvān🔽prāstaud ṛṣvaujā ṛṣvebhistatakṣa śūraḥ śavasā🔽ṛbhurna kratubhirmātariśvā
analyzed: vanoti śiprābhyām śipriṇīvān  prāstaut ṛṣva ojāḥ ṛṣvebhiḥ tatakṣa śūraḥ śavasā  ṛbhuḥ na kratubhiḥ mātariśvā
