translated: The one with the beautiful eyebrows shines with his two beautiful eyebrows.🔽The one with great strength has praised with the two great ones. The hero has fashioned with his strength.🔽The one with power, like Matariśvan, with his powers.

original: vajraṃ yaścakre suhanāya dasyave hirīmaśo hirīmān
analyzed: vajram yaḥ cakre su hanāya dasyave hirīmaśaḥ hirīmān
translated: The one who has made the thunderbolt for the good Dasyu, the one who is fearless, the one who is full of fear.

original: arutahanuradbhutaṃ na rajaḥ
analyzed: a ruta hanuḥ adbhutam na rajaḥ
translated: The one with the uninjured jaw, the wonderful one, is not in the dust.

original: ava no vṛjinā śiśīhy ṛcā vanemānṛcaḥ
analyzed: ava naḥ vṛjinā śiśīhi ṛcā vanema anṛcaḥ
translated: Sharpen us, O Vrīhin, with the Ṛc, the one who is to be praised with the Ṛc.

original: nābrahmā yajñaṛdhag joṣati tve
analyzed: na abrahmā yajñaṛdhak joṣati tve
translated: The one who is not a brahmin does not approve of the sacrifice.

original: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūd yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman
analyzed: ūrdhvā yat te tretinī bhūt yajñasya dhūrṣu sadman
translated: When your third part has risen, in the abode of the smoke of the sacrifice,

original: sajūrnāvaṃ svayaśasaṃ sacāyoḥ
analyzed: sajūs nāvam sva yaśasam sacā ayoḥ
translated: The boat with the same impulse as your own fame, together with the iron

original: śriye te pṛśnirupasecanī bhūcchriye darvirarepāḥ
analyzed: śriye te pṛśniḥ upasecanī bhūt śriye darviḥ arepāḥ
translated: For your glory may the dappled one be your sprinkling vessel, for your glory the unsoiled ladle

original: yayā sve pātre siñcasa ut
analyzed: yayā sve pātre siñcase ud
translated: With which you sprinkle your own vessel

original: śataṃ vā yadasurya prati tvā sumitra itthāstaud durmitraitthāstau
analyzed: śatam vā yat asurya prati tvā sumitraḥ itthā astaut durmitra etthā astau
translated: Or a hundred times, as the Asura, so have you been praised here by Sumitra, so have you been praised here by Durmitra

original: āvo yad dasyuhatye kutsaputraṃ prāvo yaddasyuhatye kutsavatsam🔽ubhā u nūnaṃ tadidarthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyovaśtrāpaseva🔽sadhrīcīnā yātave premajīgaḥ sudinevapṛkṣa ā taṃsayethe
analyzed: āvaḥ yat dasyu hatye kutsa putram prāvaḥ yat dasyu hatye kutsa vatsam  ubhau u nūnam tat idarthayethe vi tanvāthe dhiyovaśtrā apasā iva  sadhrīcīnā yātave premajīgaḥ sudinā ivapṛkṣaḥ ā taṃsayethe
translated: When you were praised at the slaying of the Dasyu, you were praised at the slaying of the Dasyu's son🔽Both of you now strive for this, you spread out your thoughts like a garment for the sake of help🔽You have gone forth together to be worshipped, like two well-timed portions of food, you have been seized like two prizes

original: uṣṭāreva pharvareṣu śrayethe prāyogeva śvātryā śāsurethaḥ
analyzed: uṣṭārā iva pharvareṣu śrayethe prāyogā iva śvātryā śāsurethaḥ
translated: You have been seized in the morning like two camels, you have been seized in the evening like two dogs

original: dūteva hi ṣṭho yaśasā janeṣu māpa sthātammahiṣevāpānāt🔽sākaṃyujā śakunasyeva pakṣā paśveva citrā yajurāgamiṣṭam
analyzed: dūtā iva hi sthaḥ yaśasā janeṣu mā apa sthātam mahiṣā iva apānāt  sākaṃyujā śakunasya iva pakṣā paśū eva citrā yajuḥ āgamiṣṭam
translated: For you are like messengers with fame among the people, do not stay away like a bull from drinking🔽Like the two wings of a bird yoked together, like two variegated sacrificial formulas have come

original: agniriva devayordīdivāṃsā parijmānevayajathaḥ purutrā
analyzed: agniḥ iva devayoḥ dīdivāṃsā parijmānā iva yajathaḥ purutrā
translated: Like two gods shining with Agni, you have been worshipped in many ways, like two runners

original: āpī vo asme pitareva putrogreva rucā nṛpatīva turyai
analyzed: āpī vaḥ asme pitarā iva putrā ugrā iva rucā nṛpatī iva turyai
translated: Like a father to us, like a son to a father, like two kings with great splendor

original: iryeva puṣṭyai kiraṇeva bhujyai śruṣṭīvāneva havamāgamiṣṭam
analyzed: iryā iva puṣṭyai kiraṇā iva bhujyai havam āgamiṣṭam
translated: Like two friends for prosperity, like two rays for enjoyment, like two obedient ones have come to the invocation

original: vaṃsageva pūṣaryā śimbātā mitreva ṛtā śatarāśātapantā🔽vājevoccā vayasā gharmyeṣṭhā meṣeveṣāsaparyā purīṣā
analyzed: vaṃsagā iva pūṣaryā śimbātā mitrā iva ṛtā śata rāśā ātapantā  vājā iva uccā vayasā gharmyeṣṭhā meṣā iva īṣā saparyā purīṣā
translated: Like a bull, O Pusan, you have bellowed, like Mitra, you have shone with a hundred rays, like a horse, you have risen high with your own strength, like a ram, you have scattered the dust.

original: sṛṇyeva jarbharī turpharītū naitośeva turpharīparpharīkā🔽udanyajeva jemanā maderū tā me jarāyvajarammarāyu
analyzed: sṛṇyā iva jarbharī naitośā iva turpharīparpharīkā  udanya jā iva jemanā maderū tā me jarāyū ajarammarāyu
translated: Like a ram, you have bleated, O you who make the sound turphari, like one who delights in the Naiṭas, you have made the sound turphari-parphari.🔽Like one who sacrifices to the waters, you have rejoiced in the joy, O you who have the life of old age, you who have the life of immortality.

original: pajreva carcaraṃ jāraṃ marāyu kṣadmevārtheṣu tartarīthaugrā🔽ṛbhū nāpat kharamajrā kharajrurvāyurna parpharatkṣayad rayīṇām
analyzed: carcaram jāram marāyu kṣadma iva artheṣu tartarītha ugrā  ṛbhū kharamajrā kharajruḥ vāyuḥ na rayīṇām
translated: Like a bird, you have flown away, O you who have the life of youth, like a hawk, you have flown swiftly over the objects of desire.🔽Like a swift-moving Rbhukṣan, you have moved swiftly, like Vayu, you have filled the abodes with wealth.

original: gharmeva madhu jaṭhare sanerū bhagevitā turpharīphārivāram
analyzed: gharmā iva madhu jaṭhare sanerū
translated: Like honey in the belly of a hot (fire), you have rejoiced, like a woman, you have made the sound turphari-parphari.

original: patareva cacarā candranirṇiṃ manaṛṅgāmananyā na jagmī
analyzed: patarā iva cacarā candra nirṇim manaṛṅgām ananyā na jagmī
translated: Like a bird, you have flown to the moon, you have gone to the mind, you have not gone to another.

original: bṛhanteva gambhareṣu pratiṣṭhāṃ pādeva gādhaṃ taratevidāthaḥ
analyzed: bṛhantā iva gambhareṣu pratiṣṭhām pādā iva gādham taratā iva athaḥ
translated: Like a great (bird) in the depths, you have found support, like a foot, you have found a foothold in the water.

original: karṇeva śāsuranu hi smarātho 'ṃśeva nobhajataṃ citramapnaḥ🔽āraṅgareva madhverayethe sāragheva gavi nīcīnabāre
analyzed: karṇā iva śāsuḥ anu hi smara atha u ṃśā iva naḥ ubhajatam citram apnaḥ  āraṅgarā iva madhū erayethe sāraghā iva gavi nīcīna bāre
translated: Like an ear, you have remembered the instruction, like a share, you have divided for us the wonderful food.🔽Like two birds, you have drunk the sweet (drink), like two bees, you have gone to the low-hanging fruit.

original: kīnāreva svedamāsiṣvidānā kṣāmevorjā sūyavasātsacethe
analyzed: kīnārā iva svedam āsiṣvidānā kṣāmā iva ūrjā sūyavasāt sacethe
translated: Like two birds, you have sweated in the water, like two fields, you have come together for the sake of good grass.

original: ṛdhyāma stomaṃ sanuyāma vājamā no mantraṃ sarathehopayātam🔽yaśo na pakvaṃ madhu goṣvantarā bhūtāṃśoaśvinoḥ kāmamaprāḥ
analyzed: ṛdhyāma stomam sanuyāma vājam ā naḥ mantram sa rathā iha upayātam  yaśaḥ na pakvam madhu goṣu antarā bhūtāṃśu aśvinoḥ kāmam aprāḥ
translated: May we prosper in our praise, win strength, and may your thought come to us in the chariot.🔽Like ripe glory, like sweet honey in the cows, the Ashvins have attained the desire of being.

original: āvirabhūn mahi māghonameṣāṃ viśvaṃ jīvaṃ tamaso niramoci
analyzed: āvirabhūt mahi māghonam eṣām viśvam jīvam tamasaḥ niramoci
translated: The great and mighty power of these two has appeared; it has freed all living beings from darkness.

original: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhirdattamāgāduruḥ panthādakṣiṇāyā adarśi
analyzed: mahi jyotiḥ pitṛbhiḥ dattam āgāt uruḥ panthāḥ dakṣiṇāyāḥ adarśi
translated: The great light given by the fathers has come; the difficult path of the southern course has been seen.

original: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvanto asthurye aśvadāḥ saha tesūryeṇa
analyzed: uccā divi dakṣiṇāvantaḥ asthuḥ ye aśva dāḥ saha te sūryeṇa
translated: Those who give horses have gone up high in heaven with the Dakshina; they have gone up with the sun.

original: hiraṇyadā amṛtatvaṃ bhajante vāsodāḥ soma pratiranta āyuḥ
analyzed: hiraṇya dāḥ amṛta tvam bhajante vāsaḥ dāḥ soma pratirante āyuḥ
translated: Those who give gold attain immortality; those who give garments prolong their life, O Soma.

original: daivī pūrtirdakṣiṇā devayajyā na kavāribhyo nahi tepṛṇanti
analyzed: daivī pūrtiḥ dakṣiṇā deva yajyā na kavā aribhyaḥ nahi tepṛṇanti
translated: The Dakshina is the fulfillment of the gods, the worship of the gods; they do not satisfy the niggards, for they do not give.

original: athā naraḥ prayatadakṣiṇāso 'vadyabhiyābahavaḥ pṛṇanti
analyzed: athā naraḥ prayata dakṣiṇāsaḥ vadya bhiyā bahavaḥ pṛṇanti
translated: But the men who are ready with the Dakshina, the many who are free from blame, they give.

original: śatadhāraṃ vāyumarkaṃ svarvidaṃ nṛcakṣasaste abhicakṣate haviḥ
analyzed: śata dhāram vāyum arkam svar vidam nṛ cakṣasaḥ te abhicakṣate haviḥ
translated: The hundred-streamed wind, the sun, the finder of heaven, the men who look on it, they look on the oblation.

original: ye pṛṇanti pra ca yachanti saṃgame tedakṣiṇāṃ duhate saptamātaram
analyzed: ye pṛṇanti pra ca yacchanti saṃgame te dakṣiṇām duhate sapta mātaram
translated: Those who give and bestow at the meeting, they milk the Dakshina with its seven mothers.

original: dakṣiṇāvān prathamo hūta eti dakṣiṇāvān grāmaṇīragrameti
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvān prathamaḥ hūtaḥ eti dakṣiṇāvān grāmaṇīḥ agram eti
translated: He who has the Dakshina goes first, invited; he who has the Dakshina, the leader, goes first.

original: tameva manye nṛpatiṃ janānāṃ yaḥ prathamodakṣiṇāmāvivāya
analyzed: tam eva manye nṛpatim janānām yaḥ prathamaḥ udakṣiṇām āvivāya
translated: I consider that king of men, who first offered the sacrificial fee,

original: tameva ṛṣiṃ tamu brahmāṇamāhuryajñanyaṃ sāmagāmukthaśāsam
analyzed: tam eva ṛṣim tam u brahmāṇam āhuḥ yajñanyam sāma gām uktha śāsam
translated: I call him a sage, him a Brahman, the one who is worthy of sacrifice, the one who knows the Saman, the one who teaches the hymns.

original: sa śukrasya tanvo veda tisro yaḥ prathamodakṣiṇayā rarādha
analyzed: sa śukrasya tanvaḥ veda tisraḥ yaḥ prathamaḥ udakṣiṇayā rarādha
translated: He who first satisfied with the sacrificial fee knows the three forms of the bright one.

original: dakṣiṇāśvaṃ dakṣiṇā gāṃ dadāti dakṣiṇā candramuta yad dhiraṇyam
analyzed: dakṣiṇā aśvam dakṣiṇā gām dadāti dakṣiṇā candram uta yat hiraṇyam
translated: He gives the sacrificial fee of a horse, the sacrificial fee of a cow, the sacrificial fee of the moon and gold.

original: dakṣiṇānnaṃ vanute yo na ātmādakṣiṇāṃ varma kṛṇute vijānan
analyzed: dakṣiṇā annam vanute yaḥ naḥ ātmā a dakṣiṇām varma kṛṇute vijānan
translated: The sacrificial fee he wins is food, the sacrificial fee he knows is a shield.

original: na bhojā mamrurna nyarthamīyurna riṣyanti na vyathante habhojāḥ
analyzed: na bhojāḥ mamruḥ na nyartham īyuḥ na riṣyanti na vyathante habhojāḥ
translated: The Bhojas do not die, they do not go to ruin, they are not harmed, the Bhojas do not suffer.

original: idaṃ yad viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ svaścaitat sarvandakṣiṇaibhyo dadāti🔽bhojā jigyuḥ surabhiṃ yonimagre bhojā jigyurvadhvaṃ yāsuvāsāḥ🔽bhojā jigyurantaḥpeyaṃ surāyā bhojā jigyurye ahūtāḥ prayanti
analyzed: idam yat viśvam bhuvanam svar ca etat sarvan dakṣiṇā ebhyaḥ dadāti  bhojāḥ jigyuḥ surabhim yonim agre bhojāḥ jigyuḥ vadhvam yāsu vāsāḥ  bhojāḥ jigyuḥ antaḥpeyam surāyāḥ bhojāḥ jigyuḥ ye a hūtāḥ prayanti
translated: He gives to the Bhojas all this universe and what is his own.🔽The Bhojas first won the fragrant womb, the Bhojas won the bride with her clothes.🔽The Bhojas won the drink within the Surā, the Bhojas won those who go forth when called.

original: bhojāyāśvaṃ saṃ mṛjantyāśuṃ bhojāyāste kanyāśumbhamānā
analyzed: bhojāya aśvam sam mṛjanti āśum bhojāya āste kanyā āśumbhamānā
translated: For the Bhoja they anoint the swift horse, for the Bhoja your daughter is adorned.

original: bhojasyedaṃ puṣkariṇīva veśma pariṣkṛtandevamāneva citram
analyzed: bhojasya idam puṣkariṇī iva veśma citram
translated: This house of the Bhoja is like a lotus-pond, well-fashioned, variegated like a temple of the gods.

original: bhojamaśvāḥ suṣṭhuvāho vahanti suvṛd ratho vartatedakṣiṇāyāḥ
analyzed: bhojam aśvāḥ suṣṭhuvāhaḥ vahanti suvṛt rathaḥ vartate dakṣiṇāyāḥ
translated: the horses carry the Bhojam well, the chariot turns to the right for the Dakshina

original: bhojaṃ devāso 'vatā bhareṣu bhojaḥśatrūn samanīkeṣu jetā🔽kimichantī saramā predamānaḍ dūre hyadhvā jaguriḥparācaiḥ
analyzed: bhojam devāsaḥ vatā bhareṣu bhojaḥśatrūn samanīkeṣu jetā  kim icchantī saramā pra idam ānaṭ dūre hi adhvā jaguriḥ parācais
translated: the gods help the Bhojam in battles, the Bhojam is the victor over enemies in the assemblies🔽what did Saramā desire when she came to us? for the path is long and the cry is far away

original: kāsmehitiḥ kā paritakmyāsīt kathaṃ rasāyāataraḥ payāṃsi
analyzed: kā asmehitiḥ kā paritakmyā āsīt katham payāṃsi
translated: what was her purpose for us? what was her purpose for the other? how did she cross the waters and the milk?

original: indrasya dūtīriṣitā carāmi maha ichantī paṇayo nidhīnvaḥ
analyzed: indrasya dūtīḥ iṣitā carāmi mahaḥ ichantī paṇayaḥ nidhīn vaḥ
translated: I go as a messenger of Indra, longing for the great, for your treasures, O Paṇis

original: atiṣkado bhiyasā tan na āvat tathā rasāyā atarampayāṃsi
analyzed: atiṣkadaḥ bhiyasā tat naḥ āvat tathā rasāyāḥ ataram payāṃsi
translated: I have passed beyond that which frightened me, thus I have crossed the waters and the milk

original: kīdṛṃṃ indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraḥ parākāt
analyzed: kīdṛṃṃ indraḥ sarame kā dṛśīkā yasya idam dūtīra saraḥ parākāt
translated: what kind is Indra, O Saramā, what like, of whom you have come as a messenger from afar?

original: ā ca gachān mitramenā dadhāmāthāgavāṃ gopatirno bhavāti
analyzed: ā ca gacchāt mitram enā dadhāma atha a gavām go patiḥ naḥ bhavāti
translated: we will come to him and make him our friend, then he will be the lord of our cattle

original: nāhaṃ taṃ veda dabhyaṃ dabhat sa yasyedaṃ dūtīrasaraṃ parākāt
analyzed: na aham tam veda dabhyam dabhat sa yasya idam parākāt
translated: I do not know him who has deceived the deceiver, of whom you have come as a messenger from afar

original: na taṃ gūhanti sravato gabhīrā hatāindreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve
analyzed: na tam gūhanti sravataḥ gabhīrāḥ hatāḥ aindreṇa paṇayaḥ śayadhve
translated: the deep waters do not conceal him, the Paṇis are struck down by Indra, they are destroyed

original: imā gāvaḥ sarame yā aichaḥ pari divo antān subhagepatantī
analyzed: imāḥ gāvaḥ sarame yāḥ aichaḥ pari divaḥ antān subhagā patantī
translated: these are the cows, O Saramā, which you sought, flying around the ends of the sky, O blessed one

original: kasta enā ava sṛjādayudhvyutāsmākamāyudhāsanti tigmā
analyzed: kaḥ te enāḥ ava sṛjāt ayudhvī uta asmākam āyudhā asanti tigmā
translated: who will release them, the unwarlike? or our weapons are sharp

original: asenyā vaḥ paṇayo vacāṃsyaniṣavyāstanvaḥ santu pāpīḥ
analyzed: asenyā vaḥ paṇayaḥ vacāṃsi aniṣavyāḥ tanvaḥ santu pāpīḥ
translated: Let your words, O Panis, be unwarlike, let your bodies be unassailable, O evil ones.

original: adhṛṣṭo va etavā astu panthā bṛhaspatirva ubhayā namṛḷāt
analyzed: adhṛṣṭaḥ vaḥ etavai astu panthāḥ bṛhaspatiḥ vaḥ ubhayā namṛḷāt
translated: Let your path be unassailable, O you two, may Brihaspati favor us on both sides.

original: ayaṃ nidhiḥ sarame adribudhno gobhiraśvebhirvasubhirnyṛṣṭaḥ
analyzed: ayam nidhiḥ sarame adri budhnaḥ gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ vasubhiḥ ni ṛṣṭaḥ
translated: This treasure, O Saramâ, is in the mountain's lap, filled with kine, with horses, with good things.

original: rakṣanti taṃ paṇayo ye sugopā reku padamalakamā jagantha
analyzed: rakṣanti tam paṇayaḥ ye su gopāḥ jagantha
translated: The Panis guard it, who are good guardians. Thou hast come to the place which is not to be trodden.

original: eha gamannṛṣayaḥ somaśitā ayāsyo aṅgiraso navagvāḥ
analyzed: ā iha gaman ṛṣayaḥ soma śitāḥ ayāsyaḥ aṅgirasaḥ navagvāḥ
translated: Come hither, O Rishis, who are purified by Soma, who are free from sin, O Angirases, O Navagvas.

original: ta etamūrvaṃ vi bhajanta gonāmathaitad vacaḥ paṇayovamannit
analyzed: te etam ūrvam vi bhajanta gonām atha etat vacaḥ paṇayaḥ vaman id
translated: They have divided this pasture which is called Urva. Then the Panis have eaten this food.

original: evā ca tvaṃ sarama ājagantha prabādhitā sahasā daivyena
analyzed: evā ca tvam sarame ājagantha prabādhitā sahasā daivyena
translated: Thus, O Saramâ, thou hast come hither, oppressed by the divine power.

original: svasāraṃ tvā kṛṇavai mā punargā apa te gavāṃ subhagebhajāma
analyzed: svasāram tvā kṛṇavai mā punar gāḥ apa te gavām subhagebhajāma
translated: I will make thee my sister. Go not back. O thou of good fortune, I will give thee a share of the kine.

original: nāhaṃ veda bhrātṛtvaṃ no svasṛtvamindro viduraṅgirasaśca ghorāḥ
analyzed: na aham veda bhrātṛ tvam no svasṛ tvam indraḥ viduḥ aṅgirasaḥ ca ghorāḥ
translated: I know not our brotherhood nor our sisterhood. Indra and the terrible Angirases know it.

original: gokāmā me achadayan yadāyamapāta ita paṇayovarīyaḥ
analyzed: go kāmāḥ me achadayan yadā ayam apātaḥ ita paṇayoḥ varīyaḥ
translated: They have given me the kine, since this one, the best of the Panis, has fallen from here.

original: dūramita paṇayo varīya ud gāvo yantu minatīrṛtena
analyzed: dūramita paṇayaḥ varīyaḥ ud gāvaḥ yantu minatīḥ ṛtena
translated: Far away is the best of the Panis. Let the kine go forth by the Ritu.

original: bṛhaspatiryā avindan nigūḷāḥ somo grāvāṇa ṛṣayaśca viprāḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ yāḥ avindat nigūḷāḥ somaḥ grāvāṇaḥ ṛṣayaḥ ca viprāḥ
translated: Brihaspati, Soma, the pressing-stones, and the Rishis, the inspired ones, have found the hidden ones.

original: te 'vadan prathamā brahmakilbiṣe 'kūpāraḥ salilomātariśvā
analyzed: te vadan prathamāḥ brahma kilbiṣe kūpāraḥ salilomātariśvā
translated: They said: The first (were) Akupāra, Salila, and Matariśvan,

original: vīḷuharāstapa ugro mayobhūrāpo devīḥprathamajā ṛtena
analyzed: vīḍu harāḥ tapaḥ ugraḥ mayaḥ bhūḥ āpaḥ devīḥ prathama jāḥ ṛtena
translated: Vīḷuhara, the fierce heat, and the beneficent one, the divine waters, the first-born by law.

original: somo rājā prathamo brahmajāyāṃ punaḥ prāyachadahṛṇīyamānaḥ
analyzed: somaḥ rājā prathamaḥ brahma jāyām punar prāyacchat a hṛṇīyamānaḥ
translated: King Soma, being displeased, first gave back the Brahman's wife.

original: anvartitā varuṇo mitra āsīdagnirhotāhastagṛhyā nināya
analyzed: anvartitā varuṇaḥ mitraḥ āsīt agniḥ hotā a hasta gṛhya ā nināya
translated: Varuṇa and Mitra followed, and the priest Agni took her by the hand and led her away.

original: hastenaiva grāhya ādhirasyā brahmajāyeyamiti cedavocan
analyzed: hastena eva grāhyaḥ ādhiḥ asyāḥ brahma jāyā iyam iti ced avocan
translated: If they say: The fire-pan should be taken with the hand, this is the Brahman's wife,

original: na dūtāya prahye tastha eṣā tathā rāṣṭraṃ gupitaṃkṣatriyasya
analyzed: na dūtāya prahye tasthe eṣā tathā rāṣṭram gupitam kṣatriyasya
translated: One should not stand as a messenger for her, for thus the kingdom of the Kshatriya is protected.

original: devā etasyāmavadanta pūrve saptaṛṣayastapase ye niṣeduḥ
analyzed: devāḥ etasyām avadanta pūrve sapta ṛṣayaḥ tapase ye niṣeduḥ
translated: The gods spoke about this in the past, the seven Rishis who sat in austerity by law.

original: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasyopanītā durdhāṃ dadhātiparame vyoman🔽brahmacārī carati veviṣad viṣaḥ sa devānāṃ bhavatyekamaṅgam
analyzed: bhīmā jāyā brāhmaṇasya upanītā durdhām dadhāti parame vyoman  brahmacārī carati veviṣat viṣaḥ sa devānām bhavati ekam aṅgam
translated: The terrible wife of the Brahman, when brought, places a burden in the highest heaven.🔽 The celibate one wanders about, moving in the world of the gods, he becomes one of the limbs of the gods.

original: tena jāyāmanvavindad bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītāṃjuhvaṃ na devāḥ
analyzed: tena jāyām anvavindat bṛhaspatiḥ somena nītām juhvam na devāḥ
translated: Through him Brihaspati found his wife again, the gods led her, who was to be offered, with Soma.

original: punarvai devā adaduḥ punarmanuṣyā uta
analyzed: punar vai devāḥ adaduḥ punar manuṣyāḥ uta
translated: The gods gave her back again, and so did men.

original: rājānaḥsatyaṃ kṛṇvānā brahmajāyāṃ punardaduḥ
analyzed: rājānaḥ satyam kṛṇvānāḥ brahma jāyām punar daduḥ
translated: The kings, making truth their vow, gave back the Brahman's wife.

original: punardāya brahmajāyāṃ kṛtvī devairnikilbiṣam
analyzed: punar dāya brahma jāyām kṛtvī devaiḥ nikilbiṣam
translated: Having given back the Brahman's wife, the gods are freed from sin.

original: ūrjampṛthivyā bhaktvāyorugāyamupāsate
analyzed: ūrjam pṛthivyā bhaktvāya urugāyam upāsate
translated: Having enjoyed the strength of the earth, they attend upon the one with great strength.

original: samiddho adya manuṣo duroṇe devo devān yajasi jātavedaḥ
analyzed: samiddhaḥ adya manuṣaḥ duroṇe devaḥ devān yajasi jātavedaḥ
translated: Kindled today in the house of men, O god, you worship the gods, O all-knower.

original: ā ca vaha mitramahaścikitvān tvaṃ dūtaḥ kavirasipracetāḥ
analyzed: ā ca vaha mitra mahaḥ cikitvān tvam dūtaḥ kaviḥ asi pracetāḥ
translated: And bring the wise one who is dear to Mitra. You are the wise messenger, the discerning one.

original: tanūnapāt patha ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadayāsujihva
analyzed: tanūnapāt pathaḥ ṛtasya yānān madhvā samañjan svadaya asujihva
translated: O Tanūnapāt, arranging the paths of the sacrifice with honey, with your sweet tongue,

original: manmāni dhībhiruta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā cakṛṇuhyadhvaraṃ naḥ
analyzed: manmāni dhībhiḥ uta yajñam ṛndhan devatrā cakṛṇuhi adhvaram naḥ
translated: Inspiring our thoughts and the sacrifice, make our offering go to the gods.

original: ājuhvāna īḍyo vandyaścā yāhyagne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: ājuhvānaḥ īḍyaḥ vandyaḥ ca ā yāhi agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: To be invoked, to be praised, and to be honored, go, O Agni, in accord with the Vasus.

original: tvaṃ devānāmasi yahva hotā sa enān yakṣīṣito yajīyān
analyzed: tvam devānām asi yahva hotā saḥ enān yakṣi iṣitaḥ yajīyān
translated: You are the young Hotṛ priest of the gods. As such, invoked, offer them the best sacrifice.

original: prācīnaṃ barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyā vastorasyā vṛjyateagre ahnām
analyzed: prācīnam barhiḥ pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ vastoḥ asyāḥ vṛjyate agre ahnām
translated: The ancient sacrificial grass is spread out in the direction of the earth, in the wide expanse of this (earth), in the beginning of the days.

original: vyu prathate vitaraṃ varīyo devebhyo aditayesyonam
analyzed: vi u prathate vitaram varīyaḥ devebhyaḥ aditaye syonam
translated: It extends widely, in a wide area, more widely, favorable to the gods and to Aditi.

original: vyacasvatīrurviyā vi śrayantāṃ patibhyo na janayaḥśumbhamānāḥ
analyzed: vyacasvatīḥ urviyā vi śrayantām patibhyaḥ na janayaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
translated: May the spacious ones extend in their own places, like women adorning themselves for their husbands.

original: devīrdvāro bṛhatīrviśvaminvā devebhyobhavata suprāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ bṛhatīḥ viśvaminvāḥ devebhyaḥ bhavata su prāyaṇāḥ
translated: O divine doors, vast, all-encompassing, be easy of access for the gods.

original: ā suṣvayantī yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatāṃ niyonau🔽divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī surukme adhi śriyaṃśukrapiśaṃ dadhāne
analyzed: ā yajate upāke uṣāsānaktā sadatām niyonau  divye yoṣaṇe bṛhatī su rukme adhi śriyam śu krapiśam dadhāne
translated: The two who are well-disposed to the sacrificer, the dawn and night, let them sit in the womb,🔽The two divine maidens, the lofty, golden-winged ones, bestowing the bright and dark splendour.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā suvācā mimānā yajñaṃ manuṣoyajadhyai
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā su vācā mimānā yajñam manuṣaḥ yajadhyai
translated: The two divine Hotars, first with good speech, measuring the sacrifice for men to worship,

original: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnaṃ jyotiḥpradiśā diśantā
analyzed: pracodayantā vidatheṣu kārū prācīnam jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā
translated: Urging the priests in the assemblies, showing the light of the east in the directions,

original: ā no yajñaṃ bhāratī tūyametviḷā manuṣvadihacetayantī
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam bhāratī tūyam etu iḷā manuṣvat iha cetayantī
translated: May Bharati come quickly to our sacrifice, inspiring here as among men,

original: tisro devīrbarhiredaṃ syonaṃ sarasvatīsvapasaḥ sadantu
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam syonam sarasvatīsu apasaḥ sadantu
translated: Let the three goddesses, Sarasvati and the wise ones, sit on this pleasant sacrificial grass.

original: ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpairapiṃśad bhuvanāniviśvā
analyzed: yaḥ ime dyāvāpṛthivī janitrī rūpaiḥ apiṃśat bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: He who has fashioned with forms these two, heaven and earth, the mothers, and all the worlds,

original: tamadya hotariṣito yajīyān devaṃ tvaṣṭāramiha yakṣi vidvān
analyzed: tam adya hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān devam tvaṣṭāram iha yakṣi vidvān
translated: To him, the Hotar, the most powerful, the wise one, today, invoke here the god Tvastr.

original: upāvasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānāṃ pātha ṛtuthāhavīṃṣi
analyzed: upa avasṛja tmanyā samañjan devānām pāthaḥ ṛtuthā havīṃṣi
translated: Sending forth, uniting with the self, offer the oblations to the gods in due season.

original: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devo agniḥ svadantu havyammadhunā ghṛtena
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ śamitā devaḥ agniḥ svadantu havyam madhunā ghṛtena
translated: The tree, the oblator, the god Agni, let the oblation be relished with honey and ghee.

original: sadyo jāto vyamimīta yajñamagnirdevānāmabhavatpurogāḥ
analyzed: sadyas jātaḥ vyamimīta yajñam agniḥ devānām abhavat purogāḥ
translated: As soon as born, he measured out the sacrifice. Agni became the leader of the gods.

original: asya hotuḥ pradiśy ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtaṃhaviradantu devāḥ
analyzed: asya hotuḥ pradiśi ṛtasya vāci svāhākṛtam haviḥ adantu devāḥ
translated: In the direction of this Hotar's speech of truth, let the gods enjoy the oblation offered with svāhā.

original: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvaṃ manīṣāṃ yathāyathā matayaḥsanti nṛṇām🔽indraṃ satyairerayāmā kṛtebhiḥ sa hivīro girvaṇasyurvidānaḥ
analyzed: manīṣiṇaḥ pra bharadhvam manīṣām yathā yathā matayaḥ santi nṛṇām  indram satyaiḥ erayāma kṛtebhiḥ sa hi vīraḥ girvaṇasyuḥ vidānaḥ
translated: O wise ones, bring forth your wisdom, as the thoughts of men are various.🔽He has been urged on by the true deeds of Indra, for he is the hero, the lover of praise, the finder.

original: ṛtasya hi sadaso dhītiradyaut saṃ gārṣṭeyo vṛṣabhogobhirānaṭ
analyzed: ṛtasya hi sadasaḥ dhītiḥ adyaut sam gārṣṭeyaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ gobhiḥ ānaṭ
translated: For the thought of the seat of truth has shone forth, the son of Garṣṭa has been gladdened by the bulls.

original: udatiṣṭhat taviṣeṇā raveṇa mahānti citsaṃ vivyācā rajāṃsi
analyzed: udatiṣṭhat taviṣeṇa raveṇa mahānti citsam vivyāca rajāṃsi
translated: He has arisen with mighty roar, he has looked through the great expanses.

original: indraḥ kila śrutyā asya veda sa hi jiṣṇuḥ pathikṛtsūryāya
analyzed: indraḥ kila śrutyāḥ asya veda sa hi jiṣṇuḥ pathikṛt sūryāya
translated: Indra, indeed, knows him by his fame, for he is the victorious one, the maker of paths for the sun.

original: ān menāṃ kṛṇvannacyuto bhuvad goḥ patirdivaḥ sanajā apratītaḥ
analyzed: āt menām kṛṇvan acyutaḥ bhuvat goḥ patiḥ divaḥ sana jāḥ apratītaḥ
translated: Making the cow's milk flow, he has become the unshaken lord of the heaven, the unconquered one of the people.

original: indro mahnā mahato arṇavasya vratāminādaṅgirobhirgṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ mahnā mahataḥ arṇavasya vratā amināt aṅgirobhiḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Indra, praised by the Aṅgiras, has burst the womb of the great ocean with his might.

original: purūṇi cin ni tatānā rajāṃsi dādhāra yodharuṇaṃ satyatātā
analyzed: purūṇi cit ni tatāna rajāṃsi dādhāra yodharuṇam satyatātā
translated: He has stretched out many expanses, he has supported the swift one, the one who has truth as his support.

original: indro divaḥ pratimānaṃ pṛthivyā viśvā veda savanā hantiśuṣṇam
analyzed: indraḥ divaḥ pratimānam pṛthivyāḥ viśvā veda savanā hantiśuṣṇam
translated: Indra is the measure of heaven and earth, he knows all the libations, he has slain Śuṣṇa.

original: mahīṃ cid dyāmātanot sūryeṇa cāskambha citkambhanena skabhīyān
analyzed: mahīm cit dyām ātanot sūryeṇa cāskambha cit kambhanena skabhīyān
translated: He has stretched out the great heaven with the sun, he has propped up what is to be propped up with the prop.

original: vajreṇa hi vṛtrahā vṛtramastaradevasya śūśuvānasyamāyāḥ
analyzed: vajreṇa hi vṛtrahā vṛtram astaradevasya śūśuvānasya māyāḥ
translated: For with the thunderbolt the slayer of Vṛtra has slain Vṛtra, the magic of the shining god.

original: vi dhṛṣṇo atra dhṛṣatā jaghanthāthābhavomaghavan bāhvojāḥ
analyzed: vi dhṛṣṇaḥ atra dhṛṣatā jaghantha atha abhavaḥ maghavan bāhu ojāḥ
translated: O bold one, here thou slewest with thy boldness, then, O Maghavan, thou becamest strong of arm

original: sacanta yaduṣasaḥ sūryeṇa citrāmasya ketavo rāmavindan
analyzed: sacanta yat uṣasaḥ sūryeṇa citrāmasya ketavaḥ rāmavindan
translated: When the dawns follow the sun, his wondrous rays have found the light that shines afar

original: ā yan nakṣatraṃ dadṛśe divo na punaryato nakiraddhā nu veda
analyzed: ā yat nakṣatram dadṛśe divaḥ na punaryataḥ nakirat hā nu veda
translated: When the star of heaven is seen, none knoweth whether it will return or not

original: dūraṃ kila prathamā jagmurāsāmindrasya yāḥ prasavesasrurāpaḥ
analyzed: dūram kila prathamāḥ jagmuḥ āsām indrasya yāḥ prasavesasruḥ āpaḥ
translated: Far away, indeed, have flowed the first of these waters which at the impulse of Indra have flowed forth

original: kva svidagraṃ kva budhna āsāmāpomadhyaṃ kva vo nūnamantaḥ
analyzed: kva svid agram kva budhnaḥ āsām āpaḥ madhyam kva vaḥ nūnam antaḥ
translated: What is their beginning, what their end, O waters? what is the middle of you, O waters, indeed?

original: sṛjaḥ sindhūnrahinā jagrasānānādidetāḥ pra vivijrejavena
analyzed: sṛjaḥ sindhūn rahinā jagrasa an an ādidetāḥ pra vivij rejavena
translated: Thou hast let loose the rivers, the greedy ones, the eaters of food have moved away with speed

original: mumukṣamāṇā uta yā mumucre 'dhedetā naramante nitiktāḥ🔽sadhrīcīḥ sindhumuśatīrivāyan sanājjāra āritaḥpūrbhidāsām
analyzed: mumukṣamāṇāḥ uta yāḥ mumucre dhedetāḥ naramante nitiktāḥ  sadhrīcīḥ sindhum uśatīḥ iva āyan sanāt jāraḥ āritaḥpūrbhidāsām
translated: Those which have been let loose, and those which are yet to be let loose, have been placed in the end of the man, full of longing🔽The ancient one, the friend, has come to the river, as if to the longing ones, to the waters of the filled-in (lake)

original: astamā te pārthivā vasūnyasme jagmuḥsūnṛtā indra pūrvīḥ
analyzed: astamā te pārthivā vasūni asme jagmuḥ sūnṛtāḥ indra pūrvīḥ
translated: Thy earthly treasures have gone down, O Indra, thy many bounties have gone down to us

original: indra piba pratikāmaṃ sutasya prātaḥsāvastava hipūrvapītiḥ
analyzed: indra piba pratikāmam sutasya prātaḥsāvaḥ tava hi pūrva pītiḥ
translated: O Indra, drink according to thy desire of the pressed (Soma); thy first drinking is at the morning pressing

original: harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūnukthebhiṣ ṭevīryā pra bravāma
analyzed: harṣasva hantave śūra śatrūn ukthebhiḥ tevī iryā pra bravāma
translated: Rejoice, O hero, to smite the foes; in the hymns we proclaim thy mighty deeds

original: yaste ratho manaso javīyānendra tena somapeyāya yāhi
analyzed: yaḥ te rathaḥ manasaḥ javīyān indra tena soma peyāya yāhi
translated: O Indra, come on that car of thine which is swifter than thought, to drink the Soma

original: tūyamā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhiryāsi vṛṣabhirmandamānaḥ
analyzed: tūyamā te harayaḥ pra dravantu yebhiḥ yāsi vṛṣabhiḥ mandamānaḥ
translated: Let thy tawny coursers speed forward, wherewith thou comest, O thou who art gladdened by the strong (drink),

original: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhai rūpaistanvaṃsparśayasva
analyzed: haritvatā varcasā sūryasya śreṣṭhaiḥ rūpaiḥ tanvam sparśayasva
translated: With the tawny splendour of the sun, with the best forms, adorn thy body.

original: asmābhirindra sakhibhirhuvānaḥ sadhrīcīnomādayasvā niṣadya
analyzed: asmābhiḥ indra sakhibhiḥ huvānaḥ sadhrīcīnaḥ umā ādayasva niṣadya
translated: O Indra, being invoked by us, thy friends, being seated together, be joyful.

original: yasya tyat te mahimānaṃ madeṣvime mahī rodasīnāviviktām
analyzed: yasya tyad te mahimānam madeṣu ime mahī rodasīn āviviktām
translated: Whose greatness, in thy wild joy, these two great worlds, the heaven and the earth, have not discriminated,

original: tadoka ā haribhirindra yuktaiḥ priyebhiryāhi priyamannamacha
analyzed: tat okaḥ ā haribhiḥ indra yuktaiḥ priyebhiḥ yāhi priyam annam acha
translated: Come to that abode, O Indra, with thy yoked tawny (horses), with thy dear (steeds), come to the dear food.

original: yasya śaśvat papivānindra śatrūnanānukṛtyā raṇyācakartha
analyzed: yasya śaśvat papivān indra śatrūn anā anukṛtyā
translated: Whose enemies, O Indra, thou hast ever made powerless by drinking, without showing anger,

original: sa te purandhiṃ taviṣīmiyarti sa te madāyasuta indra somaḥ
analyzed: sa te purandhim taviṣīm iyarti sa te madāya sutaḥ indra somaḥ
translated: He, O Indra, strives for thy Purandhi, for thy strength; this Soma is pressed for thy rapture.

original: idaṃ te pātraṃ sanavittamindra pibā somamenā śatakrato
analyzed: idam te pātram sanavittam indra piba somam enā śatakrato
translated: This, O Indra, is thy cup, which thou hast often won; drink the Soma with it, O thou of a hundred powers.

original: pūrṇa āhāvo madirasya madhvo yaṃ viśva idabhiharyantidevāḥ
analyzed: pūrṇaḥ āhāvaḥ madirasya madhvaḥ yam viśve id abhiharyanti devāḥ
translated: The libation of the gladdening sweet drink, which all the gods here delight in, is full.

original: vi hi tvāmindra purudhā janāso hitaprayaso vṛṣabhahvayante
analyzed: vi hi tvām indra purudhā janāsaḥ hita prayasaḥ vṛṣabha hvayante
translated: For, O Indra, the people in many places, striving to win (thy favour), the strong one, call thee.

original: asmākaṃ te madhumattamānīmā bhuvan savanā teṣuharya
analyzed: asmākam te madhumattamāni imā bhuvan savanā teṣuharya
translated: May these our libations be the sweetest for thee, O thou who rejoicest in them.

original: pra ta indra pūrvyāṇi pra nūnaṃ vīryā vocaṃ prathamākṛtāni
analyzed: pra te indra pūrvyāṇi pra nūnam vīryā vocam prathamākṛtāni
translated: I will tell of thy ancient deeds, O Indra, and of thy recent mighty exploits, the first which thou didst.

original: satīnamanyuraśrathāyo adriṃ suvedanāmakṛṇorbrahmaṇe gām
analyzed: satīna manyuḥ aśrathāyaḥ adrim su vedanām akṛṇoḥ brahmaṇe gām
translated: Thou madest the stone easy to be found, with grass, with anger, for the chariot-pole, and gavest the Brahman the cow easy to be seen.

original: ni ṣu sīda gaṇapate gaṇeṣu tvāmāhurvipratamaṃkavīnām
analyzed: ni su sīda gaṇapate gaṇeṣu tvām āhuḥ vipratamam kavīnām
translated: Sit down among the clans, O Lord of the clan! In thee they call the best of poets, of singers.

original: na ṛte tvat kriyate kiṃ canāre mahāmarkaṃmaghavañcitramarca🔽abhikhyā no maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasupatesakhīnām🔽raṇaṃ kṛdhi raṇakṛt satyaśuṣmābhakte cidābhajā rāye asmān
analyzed: na ṛte tvat kriyate kim cana are mahām arkam maghavan citram arca  naḥ maghavan nādhamānān sakhe bodhi vasupate sakhīnām  raṇam kṛdhi raṇa kṛt satya śuṣma a bhakte cit ābhaja rāye asmān
translated: Without thee nothing is done, O thou of great glory! O Maghavan, we praise the wonderful.🔽Be thou, O Maghavan, the protector of us who are oppressed, O friend, O Lord of treasure, of thy friends.🔽Make us to rejoice, O thou who makest to rejoice, O thou of true strength, even the faithless: give us riches.

original: tamasya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhirdevairanuśuṣmamāvatām
analyzed: tam asya dyāvāpṛthivī sacetasā viśvebhiḥ devaiḥ anuśuṣmam āvatām
translated: May Heaven and Earth, of one mind, with all the Gods, help us to strength, to glory.

original: yadait kṛṇvāno mahimānamindriyampītvī somasya kratumānavardhata🔽tamasya viṣṇurmahimānamojasāṃśuṃ dadhanvān madhunovi rapśate
analyzed: yadā ait kṛṇvānaḥ mahimānam indriyam pītvī somasya kratumān avardhata  tam asya viṣṇuḥ mahimānam ojasā aṃśum dadhanvān madhunā uvi rapśate
translated: When he, performing great deeds, making power, having drunk Soma, increased in wisdom.🔽Vishnu, with his greatness, with his strength, hath extended the light, hath filled the heaven with sweetness.

original: devebhirindro maghavā sayāvabhirvṛtraṃjaghanvānabhavad vareṇyaḥ
analyzed: devebhiḥ indraḥ maghavā sa yāvabhiḥ vṛtram jaghanvān abhavat vareṇyaḥ
translated: Indra, Maghavan, with the Gods, the helpers, became the slayer of Vrtra, the most excellent.

original: vṛtreṇa yadahinā bibhradāyudhā samasthithā yudhayeśaṃsamāvide
analyzed: vṛtreṇa yat ahinā bibhrat āyudhā samasthithāḥ yudhayeśaṃsam āvide
translated: When, bearing weapons, thou didst stand against the dragon, the foe, to fight, to win the praise.

original: viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanāvardhannugra mahimānamindriyam
analyzed: viśve te atra marutaḥ saha tmanā avardhan ugra mahimānam indriyam
translated: Here all the Maruts with their own selves increased thy great power, O terrible one, O Indra.

original: jajñāna eva vyabādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyad vīro abhipauṃsyaṃ raṇam🔽avṛścadadrimava sasyadaḥ sṛjadastabhnān nākaṃ svapasyayā pṛthum
analyzed: jajñānaḥ eva vyabādhata spṛdhaḥ prāpaśyat vīraḥ abhipauṃsyam raṇam  avṛścat adrim ava sasyadaḥ sṛjat astabhnāt nākam su apasyayā pṛthum
translated: Even as he was born he overcame the enemies, the hero looked on the battle for manly glory🔽He cleft the rock, the sower of seed, he loosed, he firmly fixed the vast vault with his own power

original: ādindraḥ satrā taviṣīrapatyata varīyo dyāvāpṛthivīabādhata
analyzed: āt indraḥ satrā taviṣīḥ apatyata varīyaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī abādhata
translated: Indra from the beginning has obtained great powers, he has made Dyaus and Prithivī more spacious, he has overcome (them)

original: avābharad dhṛṣito vajramāyasaṃ śevaṃ mitrāyavaruṇāya dāśuṣe🔽indrasyātra taviṣībhyo virapśina ṛghāyato araṃhayantamanyave
analyzed: avābharat dhṛṣitaḥ vajram āyasam śevam mitrāya varuṇāya dāśuṣe  indrasya atra taviṣībhyaḥ virapśinaḥ ṛghāyataḥ a raṃhayanta manyave
translated: He, the daring one, has brought the iron thunderbolt, the good one, for Mitra and Varuṇa, for the worshipper🔽Here the ribs of Indra's great powers have been torn out, the impetuous one has been driven away with a wound

original: vṛtraṃ yadugro vyavṛścadojasāpo bibhratantamasā parīvṛtam
analyzed: vṛtram yat ugraḥ vyavṛścat ojasā apaḥ bibhratan tamasā parīvṛtam
translated: When the mighty one cleft Vṛtra with his strength, carrying the waters, surrounded by darkness

original: yā vīryāṇi prathamāni kartvā mahitvebhiryatamānausamīyatuḥ
analyzed: yā vīryāṇi prathamāni kartvā mahitvebhiḥ yatamānau samīyatuḥ
translated: The two who, in order to perform their first heroic deeds, strove with their greatness, came together

original: dhvāntaṃ tamo 'va dadhvase hata indro mahnāpūrvahūtāvapatyata
analyzed: dhvāntam tamaḥ vaḥ dadhvase hataḥ indraḥ mahnā apūrva hūtau apatyata
translated: The darkness, the gloom, was destroyed, Indra was filled with might, he was invoked in the beginning

original: viśve devāso adha vṛṣṇyāni te 'vardhayan somavatyāvacasyayā
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ adha vṛṣṇyāni te vardhayan somavatyā avacasyayā
translated: All the gods have given you your powers, they have increased you with the praise accompanied by Soma

original: raddhaṃ vṛtramahimindrasya hanmanāgnirnajambhaistṛṣvannamāvayat
analyzed: raddham vṛtram ahim indrasya hanmanā agniḥ na jambhaiḥ tṛṣu annam āvayat
translated: Indra's thunderbolt, which is to slay Vṛtra, Agni has sharpened with his teeth, in the three (worlds) he has brought the food

original: bhūri dakṣebhirvacanebhirṛkvabhiḥ sakhyebhiḥ sakhyānipra vocata
analyzed: bhūri dakṣebhiḥ vacanebhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ sakhyebhiḥ sakhyāni pra vocata
translated: With many powers, with the words of the Ṛk-sages, with the friendships, he has declared the friendships (to you)

original: indro dhuniṃ ca cumuriṃ ca dambhayañchraddhāmanasyā śṛṇute dabhītaye🔽tvaṃ purūṇyā bharā svaśvyā yebhirmaṃsai nivacanāniśaṃsan
analyzed: indraḥ dhunim ca cumurim ca dambhayan śraddhāmanasyā śṛṇute dabhītaye  tvam purūṇyā bhara su aśvyā yebhiḥ maṃsai nivacanā a niśaṃsan
translated: Indra, subduing Dhuni and Chumur, listens to the prayer of the faithful for the sake of the strong🔽You, O Indra, bring many good things, with which, rejoicing, you fulfill your promises

original: sugebhirviśvā duritā tarema vido ṣu ṇa urviyāgādhamadya
analyzed: sugebhiḥ viśvā duritā tarema vidaḥ su naḥ urviyā agādham adya
translated: By easy paths may we pass over all difficulties, and find today a ford across the wide expanse

original: gharmā samantā trivṛtaṃ vyāpatustayorjuṣṭimmātariśvā jagāma
analyzed: gharmā samantā trivṛtam vyāpatuḥ tayoḥ juṣṭim mātariśvā jagāma
translated: The three hot-rayed ones have pervaded the threefold one; the wind has gone to the service of those two

original: divas payo didhiṣāṇā aveṣan vidurdevāḥ sahasāmānamarkam
analyzed: divaḥ payaḥ didhiṣāṇāḥ aveṣan viduḥ devāḥ sahasāmānam arkam
translated: The gods have sought the milk of heaven, longing for it; they have found the hymn of praise, which is to be sung with the Sāman

original: tisro deṣṭrāya nirṛtīrupāsate dīrghaśruto vi hijānanti vahnayaḥ
analyzed: tisraḥ deṣṭrāya nirṛtīḥ upāsate dīrgha śrutaḥ vi hi jānanti vahnayaḥ
translated: Three Nirrtis attend on the observer of vows, for the far-famed priests know them well

original: tāsāṃ ni cikyuḥ kavayo nidānampareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu
analyzed: tāsām ni cikyuḥ kavayaḥ nidānam pareṣu yāḥ guhyeṣu vrateṣu
translated: The wise have discerned their origin, those which are among the secret vows of the others

original: catuṣkapardā yuvatiḥ supeśā ghṛtapratīkā vayunāni vaste
analyzed: catur kapardā yuvatiḥ supeśāḥ ghṛta pratīkā vayunāni vaste
translated: The four-breasted, well-formed young woman, with the appearance of ghee, wears the garments

original: tasyāṃ suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni ṣedaturyatra devā dadhirebhāgadheyam
analyzed: tasyām suparṇā vṛṣaṇā ni sedatuḥ yatra devāḥ dadhire bhāgadheyam
translated: On her the two strong birds sit down, where the gods have placed their portion

original: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudramā viveṣa sa idaṃ viśvambhuvanaṃ vi caṣṭe
analyzed: ekaḥ suparṇaḥ sa samudramāḥ viveṣa saḥ idam viśvambhuvanam vi caṣṭe
translated: One strong bird has entered the ocean; he looks around on this whole world

original: taṃ pākena manasāpaśyamantitastammātā reḷi sa u reḷi mātaram
analyzed: tam pākena manasā apaśyam antitas tam mātā reḍi saḥ u reḍi mātaram
translated: I have seen him with a mind purified by the sacred rites; his mother licks him, and he licks his mother back

original: suparṇaṃ viprāḥ kavayo vacobhirekaṃ santaṃ bahudhākalpayanti
analyzed: suparṇam viprāḥ kavayaḥ vacobhiḥ ekam santam bahudhā kalpayanti
translated: The sages, the wise ones, with their words, make the one Suparna into many.

original: chandāṃsi ca dadhato adhvareṣu grahān somasyamimate dvādaśa
analyzed: chandāṃsi ca dadhataḥ adhvareṣu grahān dvādaśa
translated: And they place the metres and the twelve cups of Soma in the sacrifices.

original: ṣaṭtriṃśāṃśca caturaḥ kalpayantaśchandāṃsi cadadhata ādvādaśam
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśān ca caturaḥ kalpayantaḥ chandāṃsi ca dadhataḥ ādvādaśam
translated: And they arrange the four and thirty and place the twelve metres.

original: yajñaṃ vimāya kavayo manīṣaṛksāmābhyāṃ pra rathaṃ vartayanti
analyzed: yajñam vimāya kavayaḥ manīṣā ṛk sāmābhyām pra ratham vartayanti
translated: Having measured the sacrifice with the Ṛc and Sāman, the wise ones set the chariot in motion.

original: caturdaśānye mahimāno asya taṃ dhīrā vācā pra ṇayantisapta
analyzed: caturdaśā anye mahimānaḥ asya tam dhīrāḥ vācā pra nayanti sapta
translated: The other fourteen of his greatness the wise ones lead forth with speech.

original: āpnānaṃ tīrthaṃ ka iha pra vocad yena pathāprapibante sutasya
analyzed: āpnānam tīrtham kaḥ iha pra vocat yena pathā a prapibante sutasya
translated: Who here will tell the ford of attainment, by which path they drink of the pressed (Soma)?

original: sahasradhā pañcadaśānyukthā yāvad dyāvāpṛthivītāvadit tat
analyzed: sahasradhā pañcadaśāni ukthāḥ yāvat dyāvāpṛthivī tāvat id tat
translated: The fifteen praises are in a thousand ways, as great as heaven and earth are that is it.

original: sahasradhā mahimānaḥ sahasraṃ yāvadbrahma viṣṭhitaṃ tāvatī vāk🔽kaśchandasāṃ yogamā veda dhīraḥ ko dhiṣṇyāṃ prativācaṃ papāda
analyzed: sahasradhā mahimānaḥ sahasram yāvat brahma viṣṭhitam tāvatī vāc  kaḥ chandasām yogam ā veda dhīraḥ kaḥ dhiṣṇyām prativācam papāda
translated: The greatness is in a thousand ways, the speech is as great as the Brahman is extended.🔽What wise man knows the union of the metres? Who has found the reply to the question?

original: kam ṛtvijāmaṣṭamaṃ śūramāhurharīindrasya ni cikāya kaḥ svit
analyzed: kam ṛtvijām aṣṭamam śūram āhuḥ harī indrasya ni cikāya kaḥ svid
translated: Who do they call the eighth of the priests, the hero? Who has observed the two bay steeds of Indra?

original: bhūmyā antaṃ paryeke caranti rathasya dhūrṣu yuktāsoasthuḥ
analyzed: bhūmyāḥ antam pari eke caranti rathasya dhūrṣu yuktāsaḥ asthuḥ
translated: Some wander around the end of the earth, they are yoked to the pole of the chariot.

original: śramasya dāyaṃ vi bhajantyebhyo yadā yamo bhavatiharmye hitaḥ🔽citra icchiśostaruṇasya vakṣatho na yo mātarāvapyetidhātave
analyzed: śramasya dāyam vi bhajantyebhyaḥ yadā yamaḥ bhavati harmye hitaḥ  citraḥ id śiśoḥ taruṇasya vakṣathaḥ na yaḥ mātarau apyeti dhātave
translated: when he is set as yamas friend in the house they distribute to him the reward of toil🔽wonderful is the young plants growth which even to its mothers it will not submit for nurture

original: anūdhā yadi jījanadadhā ca nu vavakṣa sadyomahi dūtyaṃ caran
analyzed: ca nu vavakṣa sadyomahi dūtyam caran
translated: if indeed the mother gave it birth and the nurse fostered it it grew great in a moment going on its errand

original: agnirha nāma dhāyi dannapastamaḥ saṃ yo vanā yuvatebhasmanā datā
analyzed: agniḥ ha nāma dhāyi danna pastamaḥ sam yaḥ vanā yuvate bhasmanā datā
translated: agni indeed is called the best provider of food who with his flame burns up the wood with fire

original: abhipramurā juhvā svadhvara ino naprothamāno yavase vṛṣā
analyzed: abhipramurā juhvā su adhvaraḥ inaḥ na prothamānaḥ yavase vṛṣā
translated: he with his tongue most pure hath roared forth with might like a bull bellowing for the food that swells him

original: taṃ vo viṃ na druṣadaṃ devamandhasa induṃ prothantampravapantamarṇavam🔽āsā vahniṃ na śociṣā virapśinammahivrataṃ na sarajantamadhvanaḥ🔽vi yasya te jrayasānasyājara dhakṣorna vātāḥ pari santyacyutāḥ
analyzed: tam vaḥ vim na druṣadam devam andhasaḥ indum prothantam pravapantam arṇavam  āsā vahnim na śociṣā virapśinam mahi vratam na sarajantam adhvanaḥ  vi yasya te jrayasānasya ajara dhakṣoḥ na vātāḥ pari santi acyutāḥ
translated: we will bring to you that god who loves the juice indu who swells and flows like the sea🔽like a bird with his flame the farseeing one who moves along the paths of sacrifice🔽whose flames like winds that never fail him attend on him who moves with rapid stride

original: ā raṇvāso yuyudhayo na satvanaṃ tritaṃnaśanta pra śiṣanta iṣṭaye
analyzed: ā raṇvāsaḥ yuyudhayaḥ na satvanam tritaṃnaśanta pra śiṣantaḥ iṣṭaye
translated: they have sent forth the strong one to the fight as they sent forth tṛta to the slaughter for his help

original: sa idagniḥ kanvvatamaḥ kaṇvasakhāryaḥ parasyāntarasyataruṣaḥ
analyzed: saḥ id agniḥ kanvatamaḥ kaṇva sakhā āryaḥ
translated: he is this agni most to be invoked the friend of kaṇva the helper of kaṇva in the conflict

original: agniḥ pātu gṛṇato agniḥ sūrīnagnirdadātuteṣāmavo naḥ
analyzed: agniḥ pātu gṛṇataḥ agniḥ sūrīn agniḥ dadātu teṣām avaḥ naḥ
translated: may agni protect the singers agni the princes may agni grant us of their favours a share

original: vājintamāya sahyase supitrya tṛṣu cyavāno anu jātavedase🔽anudre cid yo dhṛṣatā varaṃ sate mahintamāya dhanvanedaviṣyate🔽evāgnirmartaiḥ saha sūribhirvasu ṣṭave sahasaḥ sūnaronṛbhiḥ🔽mitrāso na ye sudhitā ṛtāyavo dyāvo na dyumnairabhi santi mānuṣān🔽ūrjo napāt sahasāvanniti tvopastutasya vandate vṛṣā vāk🔽tvāṃ stoṣāma tvayā suvīrā drāghīya āyuḥ pratarandadhānāḥ🔽iti tvāgne vṛṣṭihavyasya putrā upastutāsa ṛṣayo 'vocan🔽tāṃśca pāhi gṛṇataśca sūrīn vaṣaḍ vaṣaḷ ityūrdhvāso anakṣan namo nama ityūrdhvāso anakṣan🔽pibā somaṃ mahata indriyāya pibā vṛtrāya hantaveśaviṣṭha🔽piba rāye śavase hūyamānaḥ piba madhvastṛpadindrā vṛṣasva
analyzed: vājintamāya sahyase su pitrya tṛṣu cyavānaḥ anu jātavedase  anudre cit yaḥ dhṛṣatā varam sate mahintamāya dhanvanā idaviṣyate  eva agniḥ martaiḥ saha sūribhiḥ vasu stave sahasaḥ sūnaraḥ ūnṛbhiḥ  mitrāsaḥ na ye sudhitāḥ ṛtāyavaḥ dyāvaḥ na dyumnaiḥ abhi santi mānuṣān  ūrjaḥ napāt sahasāvan iti tvā upastutasya vandate vṛṣā vāc  tvām stoṣāma tvayā su vīrāḥ drāghīyaḥ āyuḥ prataran dadhānāḥ  iti tvā agne vṛṣṭihavyasya putrāḥ upastutāsaḥ ṛṣayaḥ vocan  tān ca pāhi gṛṇataḥ ca sūrīn vaṣaṭ vaṣaṭ iti ūrdhvāsaḥ anakṣan namaḥ namaḥ iti ūrdhvāsaḥ anakṣan  piba somam mahate indriyāya piba vṛtrāya hantave śaviṣṭha  piba rāye śavase hūyamānaḥ piba madhvaḥ tṛpat indra ā vṛṣasva
translated: To the most powerful, to the victorious, to the very friendly, to the three, to the deceased, to the all-knowing,🔽To the river, to the bold, to the best giver, to the most mighty, to the archer, to the seeker of wealth,🔽Thus Agni, together with the mortal lords, with the men, the son of strength, is praised for wealth,🔽Like the well-ordered friends who are devoted to truth, like the heavens with their splendors they approach the humans,🔽O son of strength, the bull praises your speech, the one who is praised,🔽We praise you, O Agni, through you may we have good heroes, extending our life, crossing over.🔽Thus, O Agni, the sons of the one whose oblation is rain, the Rishis who are praised by you, have spoken.🔽And protect them, and the lords who sing, they have offered with Vashat, Vashat, they have offered with Namah, Namah.🔽Drink the Soma for great power, O Indra, drink for the slaying of Vrtra, O most excellent one!🔽Drink for wealth and strength, when offered, drink the sweet drink, O Indra, be strong!🔽

original: asya piba kṣumataḥ prasthitasyendra somasya varamāsutaśya
analyzed: asya piba kṣumataḥ prasthitasya indra somasya varam āsutaśya
translated: To the most powerful one, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the one who is to be overcome, to the

original: svastidā manasā mādayasvārvācīno revatesaubhagāya
analyzed: svasti dāḥ manasā mādayasva arvācīnaḥ revate saubhagāya
translated: Delight thyself with the Soma, O Indra, that is pressed, for prosperity, for bliss.

original: mamattu tvā divyaḥ soma indra mamattu yaḥ sūyatepārthiveṣu
analyzed: mamattu tvā divyaḥ somaḥ indra mamattu yaḥ sūyate pārthiveṣu
translated: Let the heavenly Soma delight thee, O Indra, let that which is pressed among the people delight thee.

original: mamattu yena varivaścakartha mamattu yenaniriṇāsi śatrūn
analyzed: mamattu yena varivaḥ cakartha mamattu yena niriṇāsi śatrūn
translated: Let that which thou hast drunk delight thee, wherewith thou hast made room, delight thee, wherewith thou hast destroyed the enemies.

original: ā dvibarhā amino yātvindro vṛṣā haribhyāṃ pariṣiktamandhaḥ🔽gavyā sutasya prabhṛtasya madhvaḥ satrā khedāmaruśahā vṛṣasva
analyzed: ā dvibarhāḥ aminaḥ yātu indraḥ vṛṣā haribhyām pariṣiktam andhaḥ  gavyā sutasya prabhṛtasya madhvaḥ satrā khedāma ruśa hā vṛṣasva
translated: Let Indra come, the mighty, the unvanquished, with his two bay steeds, to the sprinkled (Soma).🔽Rejoice in the sweet juice of the cow, of the pressed (Soma), O slayer of enemies, rejoice evermore.

original: ni tigmāni bhrāśayan bhrāśyānyava sthirā tanuhiyātujūnām
analyzed: ni tigmāni bhrāśayan sthirā tanu hi yātu jūnām
translated: Sharpening thy sharp, most sharp arrows, make the firm ones soft for the Yātudhānas.

original: ugrāya te saho balaṃ dadāmi pratītyāśatrūn vigadeṣu vṛśca
analyzed: ugrāya te sahaḥ balam dadāmi pratītya a śatrūn vigadeṣu vṛśca
translated: I give thee strength, thy strong strength, O terrible one, overcoming the enemies, crush them in the battles.

original: vyarya indra tanuhi śravāṃsyoja sthireva dhanvano'bhimātīḥ
analyzed: vyaryaḥ indra tanuhi śravāṃsi ojaḥ sthirā iva dhanvanaḥ abhimātīḥ
translated: Stretch out thy glories, O Indra, as a strong man his bow, and crush the enemies as a firm one the assailants.

original: asmadryag vāvṛdhānaḥ sahobhiranibhṛṣṭastanvaṃ vāvṛdhasva🔽idaṃ havirmaghavan tubhyaṃ rātaṃ prati samrāḷ ahṛṇānogṛbhāya
analyzed: asmadryak vāvṛdhānaḥ sahobhiḥ a nibhṛṣṭaḥ tanvam vāvṛdhasva  idam haviḥ maghavan tubhyam rātam prati samrāj a hṛṇānaḥ gṛbhāya
translated: Increasing by thy powers, O thou who art to be invoked, O thou who art to be praised, increase thy own body.🔽This oblation, O Lord of treasures, is offered to thee. Accept it, O King, and take it.

original: tubhyaṃ suto maghavan tubhyaṃ pakvo 'ddhīndra pibaca prasthitasya
analyzed: tubhyam sutaḥ maghavan tubhyam pakvaḥ ddhi indra pibaca prasthitasya
translated: The Soma is pressed for thee, O bountiful one, the cake is baked for thee. Come, O Indra, and drink of the prepared (oblation).

original: addhīdindra prasthitemā havīṃṣi cano dadhiṣva pacatotasomam
analyzed: addhi id indra prasthita imā havīṃṣi canaḥ dadhiṣva pacatotasomam
translated: Accept these offerings, O Indra, when they are brought to thee, and be pleased with the Soma when it is pressed.

original: prayasvantaḥ prati haryāmasi tvā satyāḥ santuyajamānasya kāmāḥ
analyzed: prayasvantaḥ prati haryāmasi tvā satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ
translated: We will serve thee with gifts, may the desires of the sacrificer be fulfilled.

original: prendrāgnibhyāṃ suvacasyāmiyarmi sindhāviva prerayaṃnāvamarkaiḥ
analyzed: pra indra agnibhyām suvacasyām iyarmi sindhau iva prerayaṃn avamarkaiḥ
translated: I send forth to Indra and Agni this most eloquent speech, as with songs I urge on a boat on the water.

original: ayā iva pari caranti devā ye asmabhyandhanadā udbhidaśca
analyzed: ayāḥ iva pari caranti devāḥ ye asmabhyandhana dāḥ udbhidaḥ ca
translated: The gods move around like birds, those who give us wealth and springs of water.

original: na vā u devāḥ kṣudhamid vadhaṃ dadurutāśitamupagachanti mṛtyavaḥ
analyzed: na vai u devāḥ kṣudham id vadham daduḥ uta āśitam upagacchanti mṛtyavaḥ
translated: The gods do not give hunger as a weapon, but those who do not eat approach death.

original: uto rayiḥ pṛṇato nopa dasyatyutāpṛṇanmarḍitāraṃ na vindate
analyzed: uta u rayiḥ pṛṇataḥ na upa dasyati uta a pṛṇat marḍitāram na vindate
translated: Wealth does not desert him who gives, but he who does not give finds no one to praise him.

original: ya ādhrāya cakamānāya pitvo 'nnavān sanraphitāyopajagmuṣe
analyzed: yaḥ ādhrāya cakamānāya pitvaḥ unnavān sanraphitāya upajagmuṣe
translated: He who, being rich in food, goes to the one who is eager and longing for a guest,

original: sthiraṃ manaḥ kṛṇute sevate purotocit sa marḍitāraṃ na vindate
analyzed: sthiram manaḥ kṛṇute sevate purā uta ucit sa marḍitāram na vindate
translated: makes his mind firm and serves his own house. He finds no one to praise him.

original: sa id bhojo yo gṛhave dadātyannakāmāya carate kṛśāya
analyzed: saḥ id bhojaḥ yaḥ gṛhave dadāti anna kāmāya carate kṛśāya
translated: He is indeed a giver who gives to the one who comes to his house, who moves about desiring food and is emaciated.

original: aramasmai bhavati yāmahūtā utāparīṣu kṛṇute sakhāyam
analyzed: aramasmai bhavati yāmahūtau kṛṇute sakhāyam
translated: He becomes a friend to him who is called, and makes a friend among the others.

original: na sa sakhā yo na dadāti sakhye sacābhuve sacamānāyapitvaḥ
analyzed: na sa sakhā yaḥ na dadāti sakhye sacābhuve
translated: He is not a friend who does not give to a friend who is his companion and who comes to him for a drink.

original: apāsmāt preyān na tadoko asti pṛṇantamanyamaraṇaṃ cidicḥet
analyzed: apa asmāt preyāt na tat okaḥ asti pṛṇantam anya maraṇam
translated: There is no home for him to go to, he is driven away from here. He should cherish another, even if he is dying.

original: pṛṇīyādin nādhamānāya tavyān drāghīyāṃsamanupaśyeta panthām
analyzed: pṛṇīyāt id nādhamānāya tavyān drāghīyāṃsam anupaśyeta panthām
translated: He should cherish him, not to be despised, he should look for a longer path.

original: o hi vartante rathyeva cakrānyamanyamupa tiṣṭhanta rāyaḥ
analyzed: ā u hi vartante rathyā iva cakra anyam anyam upa tiṣṭhanta rāyaḥ
translated: For riches come to him like a wheel on a chariot, one after another they wait on him.

original: moghamannaṃ vindate apracetāḥ satyaṃ bravīmi vadha it satasya
analyzed: mogham annam vindate apracetāḥ satyam bravīmi vadhaḥ id satasya
translated: The food of the unwise is wasted, I speak the truth, it is the death of the good.

original: nāryamaṇaṃ puṣyati no sakhāyaṃ kevalāgho bhavatikevalādī
analyzed: na aryamaṇam puṣyati no sakhāyam kevala aghaḥ bhavati kevala ādī
translated: He nourishes neither a friend nor a stranger, he is all alone, he is all alone.

original: kṛṣannit phāla āśitaṃ kṛṇoti yannadhvānamapa vṛṅktecaritraiḥ
analyzed: kṛṣan id phāle āśitam kṛṇoti yan adhvānam apa vṛṅkte caritraiḥ
translated: The ploughman makes food for the eater, he who turns aside the path by his tracks.

original: vadan brahmāvadato vanīyān pṛṇannāpirapṛṇantamabhi ṣyāt
analyzed: vadan brahmā a vadataḥ vanīyān pṛṇan āpiḥ a pṛṇantam abhi syāt
translated: The Brahman who speaks is better than the silent one, the giver shall surpass the niggard.

original: ekapād bhūyo dvipado vi cakrame dvipāt tripādamabhyetipaścāt
analyzed: eka pād bhūyas dvi padaḥ vi cakrame dvi pād tri pādam abhyeti paścāt
translated: The one-footed one has stepped over the two-footed one, the two-footed one approaches the three-footed one from behind.

original: catuṣpādeti dvipadāmabhisvare sampaśyanpaṅktīrupatiṣṭhamānaḥ🔽samau cid dhastau na samaṃ viviṣṭaḥ sammātarā cin nasamaṃ duhāte
analyzed: catuṣpādā iti dvipadām abhisvare sampaśyan paṅktīḥ upatiṣṭhamānaḥ  samau cit hastau na samam viviṣṭaḥ sam mātarā cit na samam duhāte
translated: The four-footed one goes over the two-footed one, looking around, he stands over the rows.🔽Even though the two hands are equal, they are not equally employed, even though the two mothers are equal, they do not equally suckle.

original: yamayościn na samā vīryāṇi jñātī citsantau na samaṃ pṛṇītaḥ
analyzed: yamayoḥ cit na samā vīryāṇi jñātī cit santau na samam pṛṇītaḥ
translated: Even though the two twins have equal strength, they do not equally nourish their kinsmen.

original: agne haṃsi nyatriṇaṃ dīdyan martyeṣvā
analyzed: agne haṃsi nyatriṇam dīdyan martya iṣvā
translated: O Agni, shining, thou slayest the deserting one among mortals.

original: sve kṣayeśucivrata🔽ut tiṣṭhasi svāhuto ghṛtāni prati modase
analyzed: sve kṣaye śuci vrata  ud tiṣṭhasi su āhutaḥ ghṛtāni prati modase
translated: In your own abode, O pure one, O lord of the house🔽You rise up, invoked with oblations, rejoicing in the ghee

original: yat tvā srucaḥsamasthiran
analyzed: yat tvā srucaḥ samasthiran
translated: When the ladles have settled you

original: sa āhuto vi rocate 'gnirīḷenyo girā
analyzed: saḥ āhutaḥ vi rocate gniḥ īḍenyaḥ girā
translated: The invoked Agni shines with his own light, to be praised with the song

original: srucā pratīkamajyate
analyzed: srucā pratīkam ajyate
translated: He is anointed with the ladle, facing each other

original: ghṛtenāgniḥ samajyate madhupratīka āhutaḥ
analyzed: ghṛtena agniḥ samajyate madhu pratīkaḥ āhutaḥ
translated: Agni is anointed with ghee, invoked with honey,

original: rocamānovibhāvasuḥ
analyzed: rocamānaḥ vibhāvasuḥ
translated: Shining, full of light

original: jaramāṇaḥ samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana
analyzed: jaramāṇaḥ samidhyase devebhyaḥ havya vāhana
translated: You are kindled, bearing oblations to the gods, O bearer of oblations

original: taṃ tvā havantamartyāḥ
analyzed: tam tvā havantamartyāḥ
translated: You are invoked by mortals

original: taṃ martā amartyaṃ ghṛtenāgniṃ saparyata
analyzed: tam martāḥ amartyam ghṛtena agnim saparyata
translated: Mortals, anoint with ghee that immortal Agni

original: adābhyaṃgṛhapatim
analyzed: adābhyaṃgṛhapatim
translated: The unerring lord of the house

original: adābhyena śociṣāgne rakṣastvaṃ daha🔽gopā ṛtasyadīdihi
analyzed: adābhyena śociṣā agne rakṣaḥ tvam daha  gopāḥ ṛtasya dīdihi
translated: With your unerring radiance, O Agni, burn the Raksases🔽Be the guardian of the truth, shine

original: sa tvamagne pratīkena pratyoṣa yātudhānyaḥ
analyzed: sa tvam agne pratīkena pratyoṣa yātudhānyaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, with your light, drive away the sorcerers

original: urukṣayeṣudīdyat
analyzed: uru kṣayeṣu dīdyat
translated: Shining in the wide-spreading abodes

original: taṃ tvā gīrbhirurukṣayā havyavāhaṃ samīdhire
analyzed: tam tvā gīrbhiḥ urukṣayā havyavāham samīdhire
translated: You, O Agni, the bearer of oblations, they enkindle with songs

original: yajiṣṭhaṃ mānuṣe jane
analyzed: yajiṣṭham mānuṣe jane
translated: The best sacrificer among the people of men

original: iti vā iti me mano gāmaśvaṃ sanuyāmiti
analyzed: iti vai iti me manaḥ gām aśvam sanuyām iti
translated: Thus is my mind, thus I will pursue the cow and the horse

original: kuvitsomasyāpāmiti
analyzed: kuvid somasya apām iti
translated: Thus indeed of Soma's waters

original: pra vātā iva dodhata un mā pītā ayaṃsata
analyzed: pra vātāḥ iva dodhataḥ ud mā pītāḥ ayaṃsata
translated: Like winds rushing together, the drunk ones have come to me

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: Thus indeed...

original: un mā pītā ayaṃsata rathamaśvā ivāśavaḥ
analyzed: ud mā pītāḥ ayaṃsata rathamaśvāḥ iva aśavaḥ
translated: The drunk ones have come to me, like swift horses to a chariot🔽Thus indeed...

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: Is it not...🔽🔽

original: upa mā matirasthita vāśrā putramiva priyam
analyzed: upa mā matiḥ asthita vāśrā putram iva priyam
translated: My thought hath come to me, like a cow to her dear calf,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: ahaṃ taṣṭeva vandhuraṃ paryacāmi hṛdā matim
analyzed: aham taṣṭā iva vandhuram paryacāmi hṛdā matim
translated: I have encompassed with my heart the thought, as a carpenter his chariot,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: nahi me akṣipaccanāchāntsuḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: nahi me akṣipat cana achāntsuḥ pañca kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: For my five ploughs are not idle, nor my five ploughmen,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: nahi me rodasī ubhe anyaṃ pakṣaṃ cana prati
analyzed: nahi me rodasī ubhe anyam pakṣam cana prati
translated: For neither of the two worlds, nor any other region,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: abhi dyāṃ mahinā bhuvamabhīmāṃ pṛthivīṃ mahīm
analyzed: abhi dyām mahinā bhuvam abhi imām pṛthivīm mahīm
translated: With might I have encompassed the great heaven, and the broad earth,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: hantāhaṃ pṛthivīmimāṃ ni dadhānīha veha vā
analyzed: hanta aham pṛthivīm imām ni dadhāni iha vā iha vā
translated: I will lay this earth to rest, either here or there,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: oṣamit pṛthivīmahaṃ jaṅghanānīha veha vā
analyzed: oṣam id pṛthivīm aham jaṅghanāni iha vā iha vā
translated: I will trample the earth with my foot, either here or there,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: divi me anyaḥ pakṣo 'dho anyamacīkṛṣam
analyzed: divi me anyaḥ pakṣaḥ dhaḥ anyam acīkṛṣam
translated: One wing of mine is in the sky, the other I have drawn down here,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: ahamasmi mahāmaho 'bhinabhyamudīṣitaḥ
analyzed: aham asmi mahā mahaḥ
translated: I am the great wonder, risen up from the deep,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: gṛho yāmyaraṃkṛto devebhyo havyavāhanaḥ
analyzed: gṛhaḥ yāmi araṃkṛtaḥ devebhyaḥ havya vāhanaḥ
translated: I go to the house, not to be despised, the bearer of oblations to the gods,

original: kuvit / / /
analyzed: kuvid
translated: What?

original: tadidāsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ugrastveṣanṛmṇaḥ
analyzed: tat idāsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas jajñe ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ
translated: This is the most excellent in the worlds, whence was born the mighty one of terrible valour.

original: sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūnanu yaṃviśve madantyūmāḥ
analyzed: sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yam viśve madanti ūmāḥ
translated: As soon as he is born he slays his enemies, over whom all the joyous ones rejoice.

original: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūryojāḥ śatrurdāsāya bhiyasandadhāti
analyzed: vāvṛdhānaḥ śavasā bhūri ojāḥ śatruḥ dāsāya bhiyasan dadhāti
translated: Growing in strength, having abundant power, he gives fear to the enemy of the Dāsa.

original: avyanacca vyanacca sasni saṃ te navanta prabhṛtāmadeṣu
analyzed: a vyanat ca vyanat ca sasni sam te navanta prabhṛtāmadeṣu
translated: He hath measured and hath measured out, the swift one, they praise him in the assemblies of the impetuous ones

original: tve kratumapi vṛñjanti viśve dviryadete trirbhavantyūmāḥ
analyzed: tve kratum api vṛñjanti viśve dvis yat ete tris bhavanti ūmāḥ
translated: In thee all (men) place their thought, twice are these three, the joyous ones, to be

original: svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛjā samadaḥ sumadhu madhunābhi yodhīḥ
analyzed: svādoḥ svādīyaḥ svādunā sṛja samadaḥ sumadhu madhunā abhi yodhīḥ
translated: With the sweeter than sweet, sweet one, win thou the sweet, with the sweet, fight thou for the very sweet

original: iti cid dhi tvā dhanā jayantaṃ mademade anumadanti viprāḥ
analyzed: iti cit hi tvā dhanā jayantam mademade anumadanti viprāḥ
translated: Even thus, O Indra, the priests rejoice in thee, the victor, at every feast

original: ojīyo dhṛṣṇo sthiramā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhanyātudhānā durevāḥ
analyzed: ojīyaḥ dhṛṣṇo sthiram ā tanuṣva mā tvā dabhan yātudhānāḥ durevāḥ
translated: Be thou stronger, O bold one, make thy body firm, let not the evil spirits, the sorcerers, deceive thee

original: tvayā vayaṃ śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyanto yudhenyānibhūri
analyzed: tvayā vayam śāśadmahe raṇeṣu prapaśyantaḥ
translated: Through thee, O Indra, we will be victorious in battles, beholding many a brave deed

original: codayāmi ta āyudhā vacobhiḥ saṃ te śiśāmibrahmaṇā vayāṃsi🔽stuṣeyyaṃ puruvarpasam ṛbhvaminatamamāptyamāptyānām
analyzed: codayāmi te āyudhā vacobhiḥ sam te śiśāmi brahmaṇā vayāṃsi  stuṣeyyam puru varpasam
translated: I urge thy weapons with my words, I sharpen thy wings with prayer🔽I praise the most impetuous, most widely-ruling, most excellent of the Aptyas, the excellent one

original: ā darṣate śavasā sapta dānūn pra sākṣate pratimānānibhūri
analyzed: ā darṣate śavasā sapta dānūn pra sākṣate
translated: He shines with might, the seven gifts, he looks on many a form

original: ni tad dadhiṣe 'varaṃ paraṃ ca yasminnāvithāvasā duroṇe
analyzed: ni tat dadhiṣe varam param ca yasmin nāvitha avasā duroṇe
translated: Thou hast established that lower and that higher in the house where thou hast placed thy help

original: ā mātarā sthāpayase jigatnū ata inoṣi karvarā purūṇi
analyzed: ā mātarā sthāpayase jigatnū atas inoṣi karvarā purūṇi
translated: Thou settest the two trembling mothers in motion, thou sendest forth many a heavy (cloud)

original: imā brahma bṛhaddivo vivaktīndrāya śūṣamagriyaḥsvarṣāḥ
analyzed: imā brahma bṛhaddivaḥ vivakti indrāya śūṣam agriyaḥ svarṣāḥ
translated: This Brahman of the great heaven, the first to shine, the most excellent, addresses a hymn to Indra

original: maho gotrasya kṣayati svarājo duraśca viśvāavṛṇodapa svāḥ
analyzed: mahaḥ gotrasya kṣayati svarājaḥ duraḥ ca viśvāḥ avṛṇot apa svāḥ
translated: the great one shines forth in the lineage, self-ruling, and has covered all the distant ones with his own

original: evā mahān bṛhaddivo atharvāvocat svāṃ tanvamindrameva
analyzed: eva mahān bṛhaddivaḥ atharvā avocat svām tanvam indram eva
translated: so the great one, the one of lofty heaven, Atharvan, spoke to his own body, to Indra alone

original: svasāro mātaribhvarīrariprā hinvanti ca śavasāvardhayanti ca
analyzed: svasāraḥ mātaribhvarīḥ ariprāḥ hinvanti ca śavasā āvardhayanti ca
translated: the sisters, the powerful mothers, the unassailable ones, impel and also increase his strength

original: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ samavartatāgre bhūtasya jātaḥ patirekaāsīt
analyzed: hiraṇya garbhaḥ samavartata agre bhūtasya jātaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ āsīt
translated: Hiranyagarbha, the golden embryo, arose in the beginning, born he became the lord of this creation

original: sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
analyzed: sa dādhāra pṛthivīm dyām uta imām kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: he supports the earth and this heaven. To which god shall we offer with oblation?

original: ya ātmadā baladā yasya viśva upāsate praśiṣaṃ yasyadevāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ātma dāḥ bala dāḥ yasya viśve upāsate praśiṣam yasyadevāḥ
translated: He who is the giver of the self, the giver of strength, upon whose command all beings and the gods depend

original: yasya chāyāmṛtaṃ yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
analyzed: yasya chāyā amṛtam yasya mṛtyuḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: whose shadow is immortality and whose is death. To which god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yaḥ prāṇato nimiṣato mahitvaika id rājā jagato babhūva
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇataḥ nimiṣataḥ mahitvā ekaḥ id rājā jagataḥ babhūva
translated: He who, by his greatness, became the sole king of the moving and unmoving world, of the living and the unliving

original: ya īśe asya dvipadaścatuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema
analyzed: yaḥ īśe asya dvipadaḥ catuṣpadaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā avidhema
translated: who rules over the two-footed and the four-footed. To which god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yasyeme himavanto mahitvā yasya samudraṃ rasayā sahāhuḥ
analyzed: yasya ime himavantaḥ mahitvā yasya samudram rasayā saha āhuḥ
translated: By whose greatness these snow-clad mountains, and the ocean with its waters, are called

original: yasyemāḥ pradiśo yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣāvidhema
analyzed: yasya imāḥ pradiśaḥ yasya bāhū kasmai devāya haviṣā avidhema
translated: whose arms are these quarters. To which god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yena dyaurugrā pṛthivī ca dṛḷhā yena sva stabhitaṃ yenanākaḥ
analyzed: yena dyauḥ ugrā pṛthivī ca dṛḍhā yena svar stabhitam yenanākaḥ
translated: By whom the vast heaven and earth are held firm, by whom the firmament is established

original: yo antarikṣe rajaso vimānaḥ kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
analyzed: yaḥ antarikṣe rajasaḥ vimānaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: He who in the atmosphere is the measurer of the region, to what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yaṃ krandasī avasā tastabhāne abhyaikṣetāṃ manasārejamāne
analyzed: yam krandasī avasā tastabhāne abhyaikṣetām manasā arejamāne
translated: Whom the two worlds, with their support, have looked upon, when they were trembling in the mind,

original: yatrādhi sūra udito vibhāti kasmai devāyahaviṣā vidhema
analyzed: yatra adhi sūraḥ uditaḥ vibhāti kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Where the sun, when risen, shines, to what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: āpo ha yad bṛhatīrviśvamāyan garbhaṃ dadhānājanayantīragnim
analyzed: āpaḥ ha yat bṛhatīḥ viśvam āyan garbham dadhānāḥ a janayantīḥ agnim
translated: When the great waters came to all, bearing the embryo, generating Agni,

original: tato devānāṃ samavartatāsurekaḥkasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
analyzed: tatas devānām samavartata āsuḥ ekaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: From that time the one god of the gods was born, to what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yaścidāpo mahinā paryapaśyad dakṣaṃ dadhānājanayantīryajñam
analyzed: yaḥ cit āpaḥ mahinā paryapaśyat dakṣam dadhānā a janayantīḥ yajñam
translated: He who with his greatness looked around the waters, bearing power, generating sacrifice,

original: yo deveṣvadhi deva eka āsīt kasmaidevāya haviṣā vidhema
analyzed: yaḥ deveṣu adhi devaḥ ekaḥ āsīt kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Who was the one god over the gods, to what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: mā no hiṃsījjanitā yaḥ pṛthivyā yo vā divaṃsatyadharmā jajāna
analyzed: mā naḥ hiṃsīt janitā yaḥ pṛthivyāḥ yaḥ vā jajāna
translated: May the creator of the earth injure us not, nor he who truly created the sky,

original: yaścāpaścandrā bṛhatīrjajānakasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
analyzed: yaḥ ca apaḥ candrāḥ bṛhatīḥ jajāna kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: And who generated the great, bright waters, to what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: prajāpate na tvadetānyanyo viśvā jātāni pari tābabhūva🔽yatkāmāste juhumastan no astu vayaṃ syāma patayorayīṇām
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā jātāni pari  yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu vayam syāma pataya urayīṇām
translated: O Prajapati, none other than you has encompassed all these beings that have been born.🔽Whatever desire we have in offering to you, may that be ours. May we be the lords of abundant wealth.

original: vasuṃ na citramahasaṃ gṛṇīṣe vāmaṃ śevamatithimadviṣeṇyam
analyzed: vasum na citra mahasam gṛṇīṣe vāmam śevam atithimat viṣeṇyam
translated: I praise the wonderful, great Vasu, the desirable guest, the one to be honored,

original: sa rāsate śurudho viśvadhāyaso 'gnirhotāgṛhapatiḥ suvīryam
analyzed: sa rāsate śurudhaḥ viśva dhāyasaḥ gniḥ hotā gṛhapatiḥ su vīryam
translated: He distributes all-sustaining riches, Agni, the priest, the lord of the house, bestows heroic strength

original: juṣāṇo agne prati harya me vaco viśvāni vidvān vayunānisukrato
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ agne prati harya me vacaḥ viśvāni vidvān vayunāni su krato
translated: Accepting, O Agni, delight in my speech, knowing all the ways, O wise one

original: ghṛtanirṇig brahmaṇe gātumeraya tava devāajanayannanu vratam
analyzed: ghṛta nirṇij brahmaṇe gātum eraya tava devāḥ ajanayan anu vratam
translated: Anointed with ghee, send to the Brahman the path. The gods have generated you according to the vow

original: sapta dhāmāni pariyannamartyo dāśad dāśuṣe sukṛtemāmahasva
analyzed: sapta dhāmāni pariyan amartyaḥ dāśat dāśuṣe su kṛtā imā āmahasva
translated: Surrounding the seven abodes, immortal one, give to the worshipper, make him great through good deeds

original: suvīreṇa rayiṇāgne svābhuvā yasta ānaṭsamidhā taṃ juṣasva
analyzed: su vīreṇa rayiṇā agne yaḥ te ānaṭ samidhā tam juṣasva
translated: With the hero's wealth, O Agni, with your own wealth, delight him who has brought you the kindling stick

original: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purohitaṃ haviṣmanta īḷate saptavājinam
analyzed: yajñasya ketum prathamam purohitam haviṣmantaḥ īḍate sapta vājinam
translated: The gods who offer oblations seek Agni, the banner of the sacrifice, the first priest, the seven-horsed one

original: śṛṇvantamagniṃ ghṛtapṛṣṭhamukṣaṇampṛṇantaṃ devaṃ pṛṇate suvīryam
analyzed: śṛṇvantam agnim ghṛta pṛṣṭham ukṣaṇampṛṇantam devam pṛṇate su vīryam
translated: Listen to Agni, whose back is anointed with ghee, the god who satisfies, who satisfies with good heroic strength

original: ṭvaṃ dūtaḥ prathamo vareṇyaḥ sa hūyamāno amṛtāyamatsva
analyzed: ṭvam dūtaḥ prathamaḥ vareṇyaḥ sa hūyamānaḥ amṛta āyamatsva
translated: You are the first messenger, the most excellent one. Being offered, rejoice for the immortal one

original: tvāṃ marjayan maruto dāśuṣo gṛhe tvāṃ stomebhirbhṛgavo vi rurucuḥ🔽iṣaṃ duhan sudughāṃ viśvadhāyasaṃ yajñapriyeyajamānāya sukrato
analyzed: tvām marjayan marutaḥ dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe tvām stomebhiḥ bhṛgavaḥ vi rurucuḥ  iṣam duhan sudughām viśva dhāyasam yajña priye yajamānāya su krato
translated: The Maruts anoint you in the worshipper's house. The Bhṛgus have made you shine with their praises🔽Milking the cow who yields milk in every way, the all-sustaining one, for the sacrificer who delights in sacrifice, O wise one

original: agne ghṛtasnustrirṛtāni dīdyadvartiryajñaṃ pariyan sukratūyase
analyzed: agne ghṛtasnuḥ tris ṛtāni dīdyat vartiḥ yajñam pariyan sukratūyase
translated: O Agni, anointed with ghee, shining with the three truths, going around the sacrifice, you become most wise

original: tvāmidasyā uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu dūtaṃ kṛṇvānā ayajantamānuṣāḥ
analyzed: tvām id asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭiṣu dūtam kṛṇvānāḥ ayajanta mānuṣāḥ
translated: Men have made thee their messenger at the dawns' rising, and have worshipped thee

original: tvāṃ devā mahayāyyāya vāvṛdhurājyamagnenimṛjanto adhvare
analyzed: tvām devāḥ mahayāyyāya vāvṛdhuḥ ājyam agne nimṛjantaḥ adhvare
translated: The gods have magnified thee for great exaltation, O Agni, sharpening thee in the sacrifice

original: ni tvā vasiṣṭhā ahvanta vājinaṃ gṛṇanto agne vidatheṣuvedhasaḥ
analyzed: ni tvā vasiṣṭhāḥ ahvanta vājinam gṛṇantaḥ agne vidatheṣu vedhasaḥ
