translated: The Vasishthas have invoked thee, the strong one, O Agni, the wise ones singing thee in the assemblies

original: rāyas poṣaṃ yajamāneṣu dhāraya yūyaṃ pātasvastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: rāyaḥ poṣam yajamāneṣu dhāraya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Uphold the increase of wealth among the sacrificers. Do ye, O Vasus, protect us evermore with your protections

original: ayaṃ venaścodayat pṛśnigarbhā jyotirjarāyū rajasovimāne🔽imamapāṃ saṃgame sūryasya śiśuṃ na viprāmatibhī rihanti🔽samudrādūrmimudiyarti veno nabhojāḥ pṛṣṭhaṃharyatasya darśi
analyzed: ayam venaḥ codayat pṛśni garbhāḥ jyotiḥ jarāyūḥ rajasaḥ vimāne  imam apām saṃgame sūryasya śiśum na vipra amatibhiḥ rihanti  samudrāt ūrmim udiyarti venaḥ nabhaḥ jāḥ pṛṣṭham haryatasya darśi
translated: This Vena, O ye of spotted womb, hath urged on the light-rayed one in the chariot of the region🔽The sages kiss this child at the meeting of the waters and of the sun, as if he were a son

original: ṛtasya sānāvadhi viṣṭapi bhrāṭsamānaṃ yonimabhyanūṣata vrāḥ🔽samānaṃ pūrvīrabhi vāvaśānāstiṣṭhan vatsasyamātaraḥ sanīḷāḥ
analyzed: ṛtasya sānau adhi viṣṭapi bhrāj samānam yonim abhyanūṣata vrāḥ  samānam pūrvīḥ abhi vāvaśānāḥ tiṣṭhan vatsasya mātaraḥ sanīḍāḥ
translated: Vena hurls the wave from the ocean, the son of the cloud, beholding the back of the tawny one🔽The bands have sung together the common birthplace, in the lap of holy order🔽The many lowing mothers of the calf stand together in the common place

original: ṛtasya sānāvadhi cakramāṇārihanti madhvo amṛtasya vāṇīḥ
analyzed: ṛtasya sānau adhi cakramāṇā ari hanti madhvaḥ amṛtasya vāṇīḥ
translated: They kiss the waves of the honey of immortality, moving in the lap of holy order

original: jānanto rūpamakṛpanta viprā mṛgasya ghoṣaṃ mahiṣasya higman
analyzed: jānantaḥ rūpam akṛpanta viprāḥ mṛgasya ghoṣam mahiṣasya higman
translated: The sages, knowing the form, have come to the cry of the deer, to the roar of the buffalo

original: ṛtena yanto adhi sindhumasthurvidad gandharvoamṛtāni nāma🔽apsarā jāramupasiṣmiyāṇā yoṣā bibharti parame vyoman
analyzed: ṛtena yantaḥ adhi sindhum asthuḥ vidat gandharvaḥ amṛtāni nāma  apsarāḥ jāram upasiṣmiyāṇā yoṣā bibharti parame vyoman
translated: They have come to the river, going by the law, the Gandharva has found the names of the immortals🔽The Apsaras, longing for her lover, the woman bears him in the highest heaven

original: carat priyasya yoniṣu priyaḥ san sīdat pakṣe hiraṇyayesa venaḥ
analyzed: carat priyasya yoniṣu priyaḥ san sīdat pakṣe hiraṇyayā isa venaḥ
translated: Moving, dear, in the wombs of the dear one, sitting in the golden wing, that Vena

original: nāke suparṇamupa yat patantaṃ hṛdā venanto abhyacakṣatatvā
analyzed: nāke suparṇam upa yat patantam hṛdā venantaḥ abhyacakṣata tvā
translated: When they saw thee with their heart, the bird flying up to the sky, they gazed upon thee

original: hiraṇyapakṣaṃ varuṇasya dūtaṃ yamasya yonauśakunaṃ bhuraṇyum
analyzed: hiraṇya pakṣam varuṇasya dūtam yamasya yonauśakunam bhuraṇyum
translated: The bird with golden wings, the messenger of Varuna, the busy bird in the womb of Yama

original: ūrdhvo gandharvo adhi nāke asthāt pratyaṃ citrā bibhradasyāyudhāni
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ gandharvaḥ adhi nāke asthāt pratyam citrā bibhrat asya āyudhāni
translated: The Gandharva stands on the height in the sky, bearing his wondrous weapons on his back

original: vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svarṇanāma janata priyāṇi
analyzed: vasānaḥ atkam surabhim dṛśe kam svarṇa nāma janata priyāṇi
translated: Wearing a fragrant garment, fair to behold, he, whose name is Svana, produces dear things

original: drapsaḥ samudramabhi yajjigāti paśyan gṛdhrasya cakṣasāvidharman
analyzed: drapsaḥ samudram abhi yat jigāti paśyan gṛdhrasya cakṣasā avidharman
translated: When the drop goes forth to the ocean, beholding with the eagle's eye, O of different laws

original: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā cakānastṛtīye cakrerajasi priyāṇi🔽imaṃ no agna upa yajñamehi pañcayāmaṃ trivṛtaṃsaptatantum
analyzed: bhānuḥ śukreṇa śociṣā cakānaḥ tṛtīye cakre rajasi priyāṇi  imam naḥ agne upa yajñam ehi pañca yāmam trivṛtam sapta tantum
translated: The light, longing with bright radiance, in the third heaven, produces dear things🔽Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, five-natured, threefold, with seven threads

original: aso havyavāḷ uta naḥ purogā jyogevadīrghaṃ tama āśayiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: asaḥ havyavāṭ uta naḥ purogāḥ jyok iva dīrgham tamaḥ āśayiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Be thou our carrier of oblations and our leader, as one who would rest in the longest darkness

original: adevād devaḥ pracatā guhā yan prapaśyamāno amṛtatvamemi
analyzed: adevāt devaḥ pracatā guhā yan prapaśyamānaḥ amṛta tvam emi
translated: From the non-god, the god has gone forth, when I see the secret, I attain immortality.

original: śivaṃ yat santamaśivo jahāmi svāt sakhyādaraṇīṃnābhimemi
analyzed: śivam yat santam aśivaḥ jahāmi svāt sakhyāt araṇīṃnā abhimemi
translated: The auspicious one whom the inauspicious one abandons, I go to him from my own friend, as from a churning stick.

original: paśyannanyasyā atithiṃ vayāyā ṛtasya dhāma vi mimepurūṇi🔽śaṃsāmi pitre asurāya śevamayajñiyādyajñiyaṃ bhāgamemi
analyzed: paśyan anyasyāḥ atithim vayāyāḥ ṛtasya dhāma vi mimepurūṇi  śaṃsāmi pitre asurāya śevam ayajñiyāt yajñiyam bhāgam emi
translated: Seeing the guest of another, I have separated the many forms of the abode of truth.🔽I announce to the father, the Asura, the favor. From the non-sacrificial, I go to the sacrificial portion.

original: bahvīḥ samā akaramantarasminnindraṃ vṛṇānaḥ pitaraṃjahāmi
analyzed: bahvīḥ samāḥ akaram antarasmin indram vṛṇānaḥ pitaram jahāmi
translated: Many years have I spent within, choosing Indra, I abandon my father.

original: agniḥ somo varuṇaste cyavante paryāvardrāṣṭraṃ tadavāmyāyan
analyzed: agniḥ somaḥ varuṇaḥ te cyavante paryāvardrāṣṭram tat avāmyāyan
translated: Agni, Soma, Varuna, they are displaced. The kingdom has turned away, it has come to me.

original: nirmāyā u tye asurā abhūvan tvaṃ ca mā varuṇa kāmayāse
analyzed: nirmāyāḥ u tye asurāḥ abhūvan tvam ca mā varuṇa kāmayāse
translated: Those Asuras have become non-existent. You and I, O Varuna, desire.

original: ṛtena rājannanṛtaṃ viviñcan mama rāṣṭrasyādhipatyamehi
analyzed: ṛtena rājan anṛtam viviñcan mama rāṣṭrasya ādhipatyam ehi
translated: O king, distinguishing the false by truth, come to the overlordship of my kingdom.

original: idaṃ svaridamidāsa vāmamayaṃ prakāśa urvantarikṣam
analyzed: idam vāmam ayam prakāśaḥ uru antarikṣam
translated: This is the heaven, this is the good, this is the light, this is the wide atmosphere.

original: hanāva vṛtraṃ nirehi soma haviṣ ṭvā santaṃ haviṣāyajāma🔽kaviḥ kavitvā divi rūpamāsajadaprabhūtī varuṇo nirapaḥ sṛjat
analyzed: hanāva vṛtram nirehi soma haviḥ tvā santam haviṣā āyajāma  kaviḥ kavi tvā divi rūpam āsajat a prabhūtīḥ varuṇaḥ niḥ apaḥ sṛjat
translated: We will slay Vritra, come forth, O Soma. We worship you, the oblation, with oblation.🔽The sage has placed his form in the sky by his wisdom. Varuna, the unvanquished, has let loose the waters.

original: kṣemaṃ kṛṇvānā janayo na sindhavaś tā asyavarṇaṃ śucayo bharibhrati
analyzed: kṣemam kṛṇvānāḥ janayaḥ na sindhavaḥ tāḥ asya varṇam śucayaḥ bharibhrati
translated: The rivers, producing welfare, have been born. Those pure ones bear his variegated form.

original: tā asya jyeṣṭhamindriyaṃ sacante tā īmā kṣetisvadhayā madantīḥ
analyzed: tāḥ asya jyeṣṭham indriyam sacante tāḥ īmā kṣeti svadhayā madantīḥ
translated: They attend on his highest power, they, rejoicing in their own nature, move through these (worlds).

original: tā iṃ viśo na rājānaṃ vṛṇānābībhatsuvo apa vṛtrādatiṣṭhan
analyzed: tāḥ im viśaḥ na rājānam vṛṇānāḥ a bībhatsuvaḥ apa vṛtrāt atiṣṭhan
translated: They, like people choosing a king, have chosen the terrible one, and have stood over against Vṛtra.

original: bībhatsūnāṃ sayujaṃ haṃsamāhurapāṃ divyānāṃsakhye carantam
analyzed: bībhatsūnām sayujam haṃsam āhuḥ apām divyānām sakhye carantam
translated: They call the swan the companion of the terrible ones, moving in the friendship of the heavenly waters.

original: anuṣṭubhamanu carcūryamāṇamindraṃ nicikyuḥ kavayo manīṣā
analyzed: anuṣṭubham anu carcūryamāṇam indram nicikyuḥ kavayaḥ manīṣā
translated: The wise have observed Indra, who is being churned out according to the Anushtubh (metre).

original: ahaṃ rudrebhirvasubhiścarāmyahamādityairutaviśvadevaiḥ
analyzed: aham rudrebhiḥ vasubhiḥ carāmi aham ādityaiḥ uta viśvadevaiḥ
translated: I wander with the Rudras and the Vasus, I with the Ādityas and the All-gods.

original: ahaṃ mitrāvaruṇobhā bibharmyahamindrāgnīahamaśvinobhā
analyzed: aham mitrāvaruṇā ubhā bibharmi aham indra agnī aham aśvinā ubhā
translated: I support both Mitra and Varuṇa, I Indra and Agni, I both the Aśvins.

original: ahaṃ somamāhanasaṃ bibharmyahaṃ tvaṣṭāramutapūṣaṇaṃ bhagam
analyzed: aham somam āhanasam bibharmi aham tvaṣṭāram uta pūṣaṇam bhagam
translated: I support Soma, the bountiful one, and Tvaṣṭar, and Pūṣan, and Bhaga.

original: ahaṃ dadhāmi draviṇaṃ haviṣmatesuprāvye yajamānāya sunvate
analyzed: aham dadhāmi draviṇam haviṣmate suprāvye yajamānāya sunvate
translated: I bestow wealth on the worshipper, on the presser who is easy to invoke.

original: ahaṃ rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnāṃ cikituṣī prathamāyajñiyānām
analyzed: aham rāṣṭrī saṃgamanī vasūnām cikituṣī prathamā a yajñiyānām
translated: I am the sovereign, the gatherer of treasures, the most skilful, the first to be worshipped.

original: tāṃ mā devā vyadadhuḥ purutrābhūristhātrāṃ bhūryāveśayantīm
analyzed: tām mā devāḥ vyadadhuḥ purutrā a bhūri sthātrām bhūri āveśayantīm
translated: The gods have placed me in many places, the all-supporting one, the one who gives much power.

original: mayā so annamatti yo vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇiti ya īṃśṛṇotyuktam
analyzed: mayā saḥ annam atti yaḥ vipaśyati yaḥ prāṇiti yaḥ īm śṛṇoti uktam
translated: By me he eats food who sees, who breathes, who hears what is spoken.

original: amantavo māṃ ta upa kṣiyanti śrudhiśruta śraddhivaṃ te vadāmi
analyzed: amantavaḥ mām te upa kṣiyanti śrudhiśruta śraddhivam te vadāmi
translated: They who are not to be deceived wait upon me. Hearken, O thou who hearest, I speak to thee who believest.

original: ahameva svayamidaṃ vadāmi juṣṭaṃ devebhirutamānuṣebhiḥ
analyzed: aham eva svayam idam vadāmi juṣṭam devebhiḥ uta mānuṣebhiḥ
translated: I myself declare this, which is acceptable to the gods and to men.

original: yaṃ kāmaye taṃtamugraṃ kṛṇomi tambrahmāṇaṃ tam ṛṣiṃ taṃ sumedhām
analyzed: yam kāmaye tam tam ugram kṛṇomi tam brahmāṇam tam ṛṣim tam su medhām
translated: I make him whom I will mighty, him a Brahman, him a sage, him a wise man.

original: ahaṃ rudrāya dhanurā tanomi brahmadviṣe śarave hantavāu
analyzed: aham rudrāya dhanuḥ ā tanomi brahma dviṣe śarave hantavau
translated: I stretch the bow for Rudra, for the arrow to slay him who hates prayer.

original: ahaṃ janāya samadaṃ kṛṇomyahaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśa
analyzed: aham janāya samadam kṛṇomi aham dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśa
translated: I make the people to agree. I have entered heaven and earth.

original: ahaṃ suve pitaramasya mūrdhan mama yonirapsvantaḥ samudre
analyzed: aham suve pitaram asya mūrdhan mama yoniḥ apsu antar samudre
translated: I have produced the father, the head of this (world). My birthplace is in the waters, in the ocean.

original: tato vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanānu viśvotāmūṃ dyāṃvarṣmaṇopa spṛśāmi
analyzed: tatas vi tiṣṭhe bhuvanā anu viśvā uta amūm dyām varṣmaṇā upa spṛśāmi
translated: Thence I extend over all the worlds. I touch this heaven with my summit.

original: ahameva vāta iva pra vāmyārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā
analyzed: aham eva vātaḥ iva pra vāmi ārabhamāṇā bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: I myself move like the wind, supporting all the worlds.

original: paro divā para enā pṛthivyaitāvatī mahinā saṃ babhūva
analyzed: paras divā paras enā pṛthivyā etāvatī mahinā sam babhūva
translated: Beyond this heaven, beyond this earth, so great is he in majesty.

original: na tamaṃho na duritaṃ devāso aṣṭa martyam🔽sajoṣasoyamaryamā mitro nayanti varuṇo ati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ na duritam devāsaḥ aṣṭa martyam  sajoṣasā iyam aryamā mitraḥ nayanti varuṇaḥ ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Neither sin nor evil, O gods, have ye appointed for man.🔽In unison, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna lead him beyond his foes.

original: tad dhi vayaṃ vṛṇīmahe varuṇa mitrāryaman
analyzed: tat hi vayam vṛṇīmahe varuṇa mitra aryaman
translated: That, O Varuna, O Mitra, O Aryaman, we choose.

original: yenā niraṃhaso yūyaṃ pātha nethā ca martyamati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: yena niraṃhasaḥ yūyam pātha netha ca martyam ati dviṣaḥ
translated: By whom ye are free from passion, and lead the mortal man over the paths of the two foes

original: te nūnaṃ no 'yamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: te nūnam naḥ yamūtaye varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: They surely are our help, this Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman

original: nayiṣthā uno neṣaṇi parṣiṣṭhā u naḥ parṣaṇyati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: nayiṣthāḥ unaḥ neṣaṇi parṣiṣṭhāḥ u naḥ parṣaṇyati dviṣaḥ
translated: They are the best to lead us, the best to carry us over the foes

original: yūyaṃ viśvaṃ pari pātha varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: yūyam viśvam pari pātha varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Ye all, O Ādityas, protect us, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman

original: yuṣmākaṃśarmaṇi priye syāma supraṇītayo 'ti dviṣaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmākam śarmaṇi priye syāma su praṇītayaḥ ti dviṣaḥ
translated: In your dear protection may we be, well-guided over the foes

original: ādityāso ati sridho varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ ati sridhaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: O Ādityas, over the enmities, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman

original: ugraṃ marudbhīrudraṃ huvemendramagniṃ svastaye 'ti dviṣaḥ
analyzed: ugram marut bhīḥ rudram huvema indram agnim svastaye ti dviṣaḥ
translated: I invoke the fierce one with the Maruts, the terrible one with the Rudras, Indra, Agni, for well-being over the foes

original: netāra ū ṣu ṇastiro varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: netāraḥ u su naḥ tiras varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: They are indeed our leaders, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman

original: ati viśvāniduritā rājānaścarṣaṇīnāmati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: ati viśvāni duritā rājānaḥ carṣaṇīnām ati dviṣaḥ
translated: Over all the evils, and the kings of men over the foes

original: śunamasmabhyamūtaye varuṇo mitro aryamā
analyzed: śunam asmabhyam ūtaye varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: Auspicious to us for help, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman

original: śarma yachantusapratha ādityāso yadīmahe ati dviṣaḥ🔽yathā ha tyad vasavo gauryaṃ cit padi ṣitāmamuñcatāyajatrāḥ
analyzed: śarma yacchantusaprathaḥ ādityāsaḥ yadīmahe ati dviṣaḥ  yathā ha tyad vasavaḥ gauryam cit padi sitām amuñcata ayajatrāḥ
translated: May they grant wide protection, the Ādityas, whom we invoke over the foes🔽As ye, O Vasus, have set free even the cow bound by the foot, O holy ones

original: evo ṣvasman muñcatā vyaṃhaḥ pra tāryagneprataraṃ na āyuḥ
analyzed: eva u su asmat muñcata vyaṃhaḥ pra tāri agne prataram naḥ āyuḥ
translated: Even so deliver us from affliction, O Agni, grant us a passage to a longer life

original: rātrī vyakhyadāyatī purutrā devyakṣabhiḥ
analyzed: rātrī vyakhyat āyatī purutrā devī akṣabhiḥ
translated: Night hath spread out, the divine one, far and wide, with her rays

original: viśvāadhi śriyo 'dhita
analyzed: viśvāḥ adhi śriyaḥ dhita
translated: Over all glories

original: orvaprā amartyā nivato devyudvataḥ
analyzed: ā uru aprāḥ amartyāḥ nivataḥ devī udvataḥ
translated: The immortal goddesses, the bountiful, from the low to the high,

original: jyotiṣā bādhatetamaḥ
analyzed: jyotiṣā bādhatetamaḥ
translated: With light drive away the darkness.

original: niru svasāramaskṛtoṣasaṃ devyāyatī
analyzed: niru svasāḥ amaskṛtā uṣasam devī āyatī
translated: The unblemished dawn, the sister of the sun, moving towards the divine,

original: apedu hāsatetamaḥ
analyzed: apedu hāsatetamaḥ
translated: Drives away the darkness.

original: sā no adya yasyā vayaṃ ni te yāmannnavikṣmahi🔽vṛkṣena vasatiṃ vayaḥ
analyzed: sā naḥ adya yasyāḥ vayam ni te yāman navikṣmahi  vṛkṣena vasatim vayaḥ
translated: To her, by whose impulse we have come to you today,🔽To the dwelling of the tree, to the bird.

original: ni grāmāso avikṣata ni padvanto ni pakṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: ni grāmāsaḥ avikṣata ni padvantaḥ ni pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: The villages have settled down, the bipeds and the birds,

original: niśyenāsaścidarthinaḥ
analyzed: niśyenāsaḥ cit arthinaḥ
translated: And even the eager hawks.

original: yāvayā vṛkyaṃ vṛkaṃ yavaya stenamūrmye
analyzed: yāvaya vṛkyam vṛkam yavaya stenam ūrmye
translated: Drive away the wolfish wolf, drive away the thief, O Urvasi,

original: athā naḥsutarā bhava
analyzed: athā naḥsutarā bhava
translated: Then be more favorable to us.

original: upa mā pepiśat tamaḥ kṛṣṇaṃ vyaktamasthita
analyzed: upa mā pepiśat tamaḥ kṛṣṇam vyaktam asthita
translated: The darkness has crept up to me, the black and manifest has settled down.

original: uṣa ṛṇevayātaya
analyzed: uṣaḥ ṛṇeva yātaya
translated: O Dawn, drive it away like a debt.

original: upa te gā ivākaraṃ vṛṇīṣva duhitardivaḥ
analyzed: upa te gāḥ iva akaram vṛṇīṣva duhitar divaḥ
translated: I have brought you, as it were, cows. Choose, O daughter of the sky,

original: rātri stomaṃna jigyuṣe
analyzed: rātri stomaṃna jigyuṣe
translated: O Night, the praise for one who desires to conquer.

original: mamāgne varco vihaveṣvastu vayaṃ tvendhānāstanvampuṣema
analyzed: mama agne varcaḥ vihaveṣu astu vayam tvā indhānāḥ tanvam puṣema
translated: Let my splendor be in contests, O Agni. We, kindling you, may nourish our bodies.

original: mahyaṃ namantāṃ pradiśaścatasrastvayādhyakṣeṇapṛtanā jayema
analyzed: mahyam namantām pradiśaḥ catasraḥ tvayā adhyakṣeṇa pṛtanāḥ jayema
translated: Let the four quarters bow to me. With you as our leader, may we conquer in battle.

original: mama devā vihave santu sarva indravanto maruto viṣṇuragniḥ
analyzed: mama devāḥ vihave santu sarve indravantaḥ marutaḥ viṣṇuḥ agniḥ
translated: May all the gods be on my side in the contest, with Indra, the Maruts, Vishnu, and Agni.

original: mamāntarikṣamurulokamastu mahyaṃ vātaḥ pavatāṃkāme asmin
analyzed: mama antarikṣam uru lokam astu mahyam vātaḥ pavatām kāme asmin
translated: May the vast space be mine. May the wind blow for me in this desire of mine.

original: mayi devā draviṇamā yajantāṃ mayyāśīrastu mayidevahūtiḥ
analyzed: mayi devāḥ draviṇamāḥ yajantām mayi āśīḥ astu mayi deva hūtiḥ
translated: May the gods bestow wealth on me; may food be mine; may the invocation of the gods be mine.

original: daivyā hotāro vanuṣanta pūrve 'riṣṭāḥsyāma tanvā suvīrāḥ
analyzed: daivyāḥ hotāraḥ vanuṣanta pūrve riṣṭāḥ syāma tanvā su vīrāḥ
translated: May the divine Hotars, the ancient ones, favour us; may we be safe with our bodies and brave.

original: mahyaṃ yajantu mama yāni havyākūtiḥ satyā manaso me astu
analyzed: mahyam yajantu mama yāni havyā ākūtiḥ satyā manasaḥ me astu
translated: Let them offer to me my own oblations; let my thought be true and my intention fulfilled.

original: eno mā ni gāṃ katamaccanāhaṃ viśve devāso adhivocatā naḥ
analyzed: enaḥ mā ni gām katamat cana aham viśve devāsaḥ adhivocata naḥ
translated: Let me not offend against any of you; all ye gods, be gracious unto us.

original: devīḥ ṣaḷ urvīruru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsa ihavīrayadhvam
analyzed: devīḥ ṣaḍ urvīḥ uru naḥ kṛṇota viśve devāsaḥ ihavīrayadhvam
translated: Ye divine wide-spread (waters), be wide apart for us; all ye gods, rejoice here.

original: mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhirmā radhāmadviṣate soma rājan🔽agne manyuṃ pratinudan pareṣāmadabdho gopāḥ pari pāhi nastvam
analyzed: mā hāsmahi prajayā mā tanūbhiḥ mā radhāma dviṣate soma rājan  agne manyum pratinudan pareṣām adabdhaḥ gopāḥ pari pāhi naḥ tvam
translated: Let us not be deprived of offspring or of life; let us not fall into the power of the hateful, O king Soma.🔽O Agni, repelling the anger of others, be thou our protector, unerring.

original: pratyañco yantu nigutaḥ punaste 'maiṣāṃ cittamprabudhāṃ vi neśat
analyzed: pratyañcaḥ yantu nigutaḥ punar te mā eṣām cittam prabudhām vi neśat
translated: Let the niggardly go away to their own homes again; let him confuse the thought of those who hate us.

original: dhātā dhātṝṇāṃ bhuvanasya yas patirdevaṃ trātāramabhimātiṣāham
analyzed: dhātā dhātṝṇām bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ devam trātāram abhimātiṣāham
translated: The supporter of supporters, the lord of the world, the god who is our protector, who conquers hostility,

original: imaṃ yajñamaśvinobhā bṛhaspatirdevāḥ pāntu yajamānaṃ nyarthāt
analyzed: imam yajñam aśvinā ubhā bṛhaspatiḥ devāḥ pāntu yajamānam nyarthāt
translated: May the Ashvins, Brihaspati, the gods protect this sacrifice and the sacrificer from misfortune.

original: uruvyacā no mahiṣaḥ śarma yaṃsadasmin have puruhūtaḥpurukṣuḥ
analyzed: uru vyacāḥ naḥ mahiṣaḥ śarma yaṃsat asmin have puruhūtaḥ purukṣuḥ
translated: May the mighty one, invoked by many, the wide-spread one, grant us protection, O bull, in this invocation.

original: sa naḥ prajāyai haryaśva mṛḷayendra mā norīriṣo mā parā dāḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ prajāyai hari aśva mṛḍaya indra mā na urīriṣaḥ mā parā dāḥ
translated: Be gracious to our offspring, O thou of Bay steeds, O Indra, harm us not, give us not as prey to others.

original: ye naḥ sapatnā apa te bhavantvindrāgnibhyāmava bādhāmahetān
analyzed: ye naḥ sapatnāḥ apa te bhavantu indra agnibhyām ava bādhāmahe etān
translated: Let those who are our enemies be subject to thee. We repel them by the help of Indra and Agni.

original: vasavo rudrā ādityā uparispṛśaṃ mograṃ cettāramadhirājamakran
analyzed: vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ uparispṛśam mā ugram cettāram adhirājam akran
translated: The Vasus, the Rudras, the Adityas have made me the overlord, the mighty, the all-seeing ruler.

original: nāsadāsīn no sadāsīt tadānīṃ nāsīd rajo no vyomāparo yat
analyzed: na asat āsīt na u sadā āsīt tadānīm na āsīt rajaḥ na u vyoma aparaḥ yat
translated: There was neither non-existence nor existence then; there was no realm of space, no atmosphere of any kind;🔽what covered in, what protected, and where?

original: kimāvarīvaḥ kuha kasya śarmannambhaḥ kimāsīd gahanaṃ gabhīram
analyzed: kim avarīvaḥ kuha kasya śarman ambhaḥ kim āsīt gahanam gabhīram
translated: was the water, deep and unfathomable?

original: na mṛtyurāsīdamṛtaṃ na tarhi na rātryā ahna āsītpraketaḥ
analyzed: na mṛtyuḥ āsīt amṛtam na tarhi na rātryāḥ ahnaḥ āsīt praketaḥ
translated: There was neither death nor immortality then; there was no distinguishing sign of night nor of day;

original: ānīdavātaṃ svadhayā tadekaṃ tasmāddhānyan na paraḥ kiṃ canāsa
analyzed: ānīt avātam svadhayā tat ekam tasmāt ha anyat na paraḥ kim cana āsa
translated: that one breathed, windless, by its own impulse; other than that there was nothing beyond.

original: tama āsīt tamasā gūḷamagre 'praketaṃ salilaṃ sarvamāidam
analyzed: tamaḥ āsīt tamasā gūḷam agre praketam salilam sarvam āidam
translated: Darkness was hidden by darkness in the beginning; with no distinguishing sign, this all was water.

original: tuchyenābhvapihitaṃ yadāsīt tapasastanmahinājāyataikam🔽kāmastadagre samavartatādhi manaso retaḥ prathamaṃ yadāsīt
analyzed: tuchyena abhu apihitam yat āsīt tapasaḥ tat mahinā ajāyata ekam  kāmaḥ tat agre samavartata adhi manasaḥ retaḥ prathamam yat āsīt
translated: The existent one, born of the power of austerities, arose, covered by emptiness in the beginning.🔽Desire came upon it in the first place, which was the first seed of mind.

original: sato bandhumasati niravindan hṛdi pratīṣyākavayo manīṣā
analyzed: sataḥ bandhum asati niravindan hṛdi pratīṣya akavayaḥ manīṣā
translated: They found the bond of being in non-being, the wise ones, with their thoughts fixed in the heart.

original: tiraścīno vitato raśmireṣāmadhaḥ svidāsī ' ' 't
analyzed: tiraścīnaḥ vitataḥ raśmiḥ eṣām adhas svidāsī t
translated: This is the far-reaching, extended ray of theirs, which was lying below.

original: retodhāāsan mahimāna āsan svadhā avastāt prayatiḥ parastāt
analyzed: retaḥ dhāḥ āsan mahimānaḥ āsan svadhā avastāt prayatiḥ parastāt
translated: The seed-sowers were the great ones, the self-existent ones were below, the exertion was above.

original: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocat kuta ājātā kuta iyaṃvisṛṣṭiḥ
analyzed: kaḥ addhā veda kaḥ iha pra vocat kutas ājātā kutas iyam visṛṣṭiḥ
translated: Who indeed knows, who could here proclaim it, whence it was born and whence this creation?

original: arvāg devā asya visarjanenāthā ko veda yataābabhūva
analyzed: arvāk devāḥ asya visarjanena atha kaḥ veda yatas ābabhūva
translated: The gods came after this in its development. Who then knows? Who could here proclaim it?

original: iyaṃ visṛṣṭiryata ābabhūva yadi vā dadhe yadi vā na
analyzed: iyam visṛṣṭiḥ yatas ābabhūva yadi vā dadhe yadi vā na
translated: This creation which was born, whether it was hidden in the womb or not,

original: yo asyādhyakṣaḥ parame vyoman so aṅga veda yadi vā naveda
analyzed: yaḥ asya adhyakṣaḥ parame vyoman saḥ aṅga veda yadi vā na veda
translated: He who is its overseer in the highest heaven, he indeed knows, if he knows at all.

original: yo yajño viśvatastantubhistata ekaśataṃ devakarmebhirāyataḥ
analyzed: yaḥ yajñaḥ viśvatas tantubhiḥ tatas eka śatam deva karmebhiḥ āyataḥ
translated: That sacrifice which is spread out on all sides with a hundred threads, extended with a hundred divine acts,

original: ime vayanti pitaro ya āyayuḥ pra vayāpa vayetyāsate tate
analyzed: ime vayanti pitaraḥ ye āyayuḥ pra vaya apa vaya iti āsate tate
translated: These fathers who have come, they sing; they sit down, saying, The young one in the old one.

original: pumānenaṃ tanuta ut kṛṇatti pumān vi tatne adhi nākeasmin
analyzed: pumān enam tanute ud kṛṇatti pumān vi tatne adhi nākeasmin
translated: The male fashions him, the male spreads him out on this vault.

original: ime mayūkhā upa sedurū sadaḥ sāmāni cakrustasarāṇyotave🔽kāsīt pramā pratimā kiṃ nidānamājyaṃ kimāsītparidhiḥ ka āsīt
analyzed: ime mayūkhāḥ upa seduḥ ū sadaḥ sāmāni cakruḥ tasarāṇi otave  kā āsīt pramā pratimā kim nidānam ājyam kim āsīt paridhiḥ kaḥ āsīt
translated: These rays have sat down on the seat, they have made the Sāmans for the pressing.🔽What was the measure, what the model? What was the foundation? What was the ladle? What was the enclosing stick?

original: chandaḥ kimāsīt praugaṃ kimukthaṃyad devā devamayajanta viśve
analyzed: chandaḥ kim āsīt praugam kim uktham yat devāḥ devam ayajanta viśve
translated: What was the metre? What the Prauga? What the hymn, when the gods worshipped the god?

original: agnergāyatryabhavat sayugvoṣṇihayā savitā saṃ babhūva
analyzed: agneḥ gāyatrī abhavat sayugvā uṣṇihayā savitā sam babhūva
translated: Agni became the Gāyatrī of Agni, the Ūṣṇih of Savitar, he became the Anushtubh of Indra.

original: anuṣṭubhā soma ukthairmahasvān bṛhaspaterbṛhatī vācamāvat
analyzed: anuṣṭubhā somaḥ ukthaiḥ mahasvān bṛhaspateḥ bṛhatī vācam āvat
translated: Soma with the Anustubh, the great one with the Ukthas, the Brihati of Brihaspati's speech

original: virāṇ mitrāvaruṇayorabhiśrīrindrasya triṣṭub ihabhāgo ahnaḥ
analyzed: virāj mitrāvaruṇayoḥ abhiśrīḥ indrasya triṣṭubh ihabhāgaḥ ahnaḥ
translated: The Virat of Mitra and Varuna, the Tristub of Indra is the share of the day here

original: viśvān devāñ jagatyā viveśa tenacākḷipra ṛṣayo manuṣyāḥ
analyzed: viśvān devān jagatyā viveśa tena cākḷipre ṛṣayaḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: The Jagati entered all the gods, by that the Rishis and men were created

original: cākḷipre tena ṛṣayo manuṣyā yajñe jāte pitaro naḥpurāṇe
analyzed: cākḷipre tena ṛṣayaḥ manuṣyāḥ yajñe jāte pitaraḥ naḥ purāṇe
translated: By that the Rishis and men were created, in the ancient sacrifice of our fathers

original: paśyan manye manasā cakṣasā tān ya imaṃyajñamayajanta pūrve
analyzed: paśyan manye manasā cakṣasā tān ye imaṃyajñam ayajanta pūrve
translated: Seeing them with the mind and the eye, those who performed this sacrifice in the past

original: sahastomāḥ sahachandasa āvṛtaḥ sahapramā ṛṣayaḥ saptadaivyāḥ
analyzed: saha stomāḥ saha chandasaḥ āvṛtaḥ saha pramāḥ ṛṣayaḥ sapta daivyāḥ
translated: The seven divine Rishis, with the Stomas, the meters, the Prama, and the Avrita

original: pūrveṣāṃ panthāmanudṛśya dhīrā anvālebhirerathyo na raśmīn
analyzed: pūrveṣām panthām anudṛśya dhīrāḥ anvālebhiḥ erathyaḥ na raśmīn
translated: Seeing the path of the ancients, the wise ones have followed it, like the chariot-wheels their tracks

original: apa prāca indra viśvānamitrānapāpāco abhibhūte nudasva🔽apodīco apa śūrādharāca urau yathā tava śarmanmadema
analyzed: apa prācaḥ indra viśvān amitrān apa apācaḥ abhibhūte nudasva  apa udīcaḥ apa śūra adharācaḥ urau yathā tava śarman madema
translated: Drive away, O Indra, all our enemies, drive away those who hate us, O conqueror🔽Drive away those who are in the east, drive away the heroes who are in the west, that we may rejoice in thy wide protection

original: kuvidaṅga yavamanto yavaṃ cid yathā dāntyanupūrvaṃviyūya
analyzed: kuvid aṅga yavamantaḥ yavam cit yathā dānti anupūrvam viyūya
translated: Who, O Angiras, knoweth the barley-ear, even as they reap the barley in due order

original: ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣonamovṛktiṃ na jagmuḥ
analyzed: iha iha eṣām kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣaḥ namovṛktim na jagmuḥ
translated: Here, here, make thou food for them who have not come to the strew with homage and oblation

original: nahi sthūry ṛtuthā yātamasti nota śravo vividesaṃgameṣu
analyzed: nahi sthūri ṛtuthā yātam asti na uta śravaḥ
translated: For there is no place where the Rtus may not come, nor hath fame been found in the assemblies

original: gavyanta indraṃ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyantovṛṣaṇaṃ vājayantaḥ
analyzed: gavyantaḥ indram sakhyāya viprāḥ aśvāyantaḥ vṛṣaṇam vājayantaḥ
translated: The sages, longing for the cow, for friendship, longing for the strong steed, for strength,

original: yuvaṃ surāmamaśvinā namucāvāsure sacā
analyzed: yuvam su rāmam aśvinā namucau āsure sacā
translated: You two, O Aśvins, with Namuci, the Asura, in company, drank the sweet juice,

original: vipipānāśubhas patī indraṃ karmasvāvatam
analyzed: vipipāna aśubhaḥ patī indram karmasva avatam
translated: Drinking the pure juice, O lords of splendour, you helped Indra in his deeds.

original: putramiva pitarāvaśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyairdaṃsanābhiḥ
analyzed: putram iva pitarau aśvinā ubhā indra āvathuḥ kāvyaiḥ daṃsanābhiḥ
translated: You two, O Aśvins, with your two kinds of knowledge, with your wondrous powers, helped Indra as a son,

original: yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatītvā maghavannabhiṣṇak
analyzed: yat su rāmam vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvati itvā maghavan abhiṣṇak
translated: When you drank the sweet juice with your powers, Sarasvatī, O bountiful one, has gladdened you.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatuviśvavedāḥ
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā su avān avobhiḥ su mṛḷīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the powerful one, be gracious to us in his favours, the all-knower.

original: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasyapatayaḥ syāma
analyzed: bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: May he drive away hatred, may he make us fearless, may we be lords of good heroism.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: May we be in the favour of that adorable one, in his good will, in his gracious favour.

original: sa sutrāmā svavānindro asme ārāccid dveṣaḥ sanutaryuyotu🔽ījānamid dyaurgūrtāvasurījānaṃ bhūmirabhiprabhūṣaṇi
analyzed: sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asme ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu  ījānam id dyauḥ gūrtāvasuḥ ījānam bhūmiḥ abhiprabhūṣaṇi
translated: May that good protector, that powerful Indra, drive away hatred from us even from afar.🔽The heaven, O sacrificer, has been worshipped with good gifts, the earth has been worshipped to surpass it.

original: ījānaṃ devāvaśvināvabhi sumnairavardhatām
analyzed: ījānam devau aśvinau abhi sumnaiḥ avardhatām
translated: The two divine Aśvins have exalted the worshipper with their favours.

original: tā vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā dhārayatkṣitī suṣumneṣitatvatāyajāmasi
analyzed: tā vām mitrāvaruṇā dhārayat kṣitī suṣumnā iṣitatvatā ayajāmasi
translated: We worship you, O Mitra and Varuṇa, the two who uphold the earth, the two who are to be entreated with good wishes.

original: yuvoḥ krāṇāya sakhyairabhi ṣyāma rakṣasaḥ
analyzed: yuvoḥ krāṇāya sakhyaiḥ abhi syāma rakṣasaḥ
translated: We will overcome the Raksases with your help, O you two who are to be entreated with good wishes.

original: adhā cin nu yad didhiṣāmahe vāmabhi priyaṃ rekṇaḥpatyamānāḥ
analyzed: adhā cit nu yat didhiṣāmahe vāmabhi priyam rekṇaḥ patyamānāḥ
translated: When we desire to win the good thing that is dear to the lord of wealth,

original: dadvān vā yat puṣyati rekṇaḥ saṃ vārannakirasya maghāni
analyzed: dadvān vā yat puṣyati rekṇaḥ sam vārannakirasya maghāni
translated: Or when he who gives wealth prospers, let him not diminish his own great gifts.

original: asāvanyo asura sūyata dyaustvaṃ viśveṣāṃ varuṇāsirājā
analyzed: asau anyaḥ asura sūyata dyauḥ tvam viśveṣām varuṇa asi rājā
translated: This other one, O Asura, is born from heaven; you are the king of all, O Varuṇa.

original: mūrdhā rathasya cākan naitāvatainasāntakadhruk
analyzed: mūrdhā rathasya cākan na etāvatā enasā antaka druh
translated: The head of the chariot is not cut off; by this much the sinner is not destroyed.

original: asmin svetacchakapūta eno hite mitre nigatān hanti vīrān
analyzed: asmin su etat śaka pūte enaḥ hite mitre nigatān hanti vīrān
translated: In this white one, purified by the Shakâpuri hymn, he destroys the enemies who have come to the friend who is set in order.

original: avorvā yad dhāt tanūṣvavaḥ priyāsu yajñiyāsvarvā
analyzed: ava urvā yat dhāt tanūṣu avaḥ priyāsu yajñiyāsu arvā
translated: When you have bestowed your favour on the bodies, on the dear, worshipful bodies, you have bestowed your favour.

original: yuvorhi mātāditirvicetasā dyaurna bhūmiḥ payasāpupūtani
analyzed: yuvoḥ hi mātā aditiḥ vicetasā dyauḥ na bhūmiḥ payasā apupūtani
translated: For your mother Aditi, of far-reaching thought, is purified with milk like heaven and earth.

original: ava priyā didiṣṭana sūro ninikta raśmibhiḥ
analyzed: ava priyā didiṣṭana sūraḥ ninikta raśmibhiḥ
translated: Do you two bestow your favour on him; the sun has been purified with his rays.

original: yuvaṃ hyapnarājāvasīdataṃ tiṣṭhad rathaṃ nadhūrṣadaṃ vanarṣadam
analyzed: yuvam hi apna rājā avasīdatam tiṣṭhat ratham nadhūrṣadam vanarṣadam
translated: For you two, O lords of wealth, have sat down on the chariot that stands, that is eager to draw, that is eager to carry.

original: tā naḥ kaṇūkayantīrnṛmedhastatre aṃhasaḥ sumedhastatre aṃhasaḥ🔽pro ṣvasmai purorathamindrāya śūṣamarcata
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ kaṇūkayantīḥ nṛmedhaḥ tatre aṃhasaḥ sumedhaḥ tatre aṃhasaḥ  pra u su asmai puroratham indrāya śūṣam arcata
translated: May they, who are to be praised by us, protect us from that danger; may the wise one protect us from that danger.🔽Sing forth to him the hymn of praise, to Indra, the strong one, as a chariot in front.

original: abhīke cidulokakṛt saṃge samatsu vṛtrahāsmākaṃ bodhi coditānabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
analyzed: abhīke cit uloka kṛt saṃge samatsu vṛtrahā asmākam bodhi coditā an abhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Even in the battle, the maker of room, the Vrtra-slayer in the assemblies and battles, be our protector, O you who are urged on. Let the bowstrings be broken on the bows of others.

original: tvaṃ sindhūnravāsṛjo 'dharāco ahannahim
analyzed: tvam sindhūn rava asṛjaḥ dharācaḥ ahan ahim
translated: Thou hast loosed the rivers, smitten down the dragons, and the Dâsas,🔽Thou art born, O Indra, without a foe, thou prosperest all good things: we closely clasp thee to ourselves.

original: aśatrurindrajajñiṣe viśvaṃ puṣyasi vāryaṃ taṃ tvā pari ṣvajāmahenabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
analyzed: a śatruḥ indra jajñiṣe viśvam puṣyasi vāryam tam tvā pari svajāma henabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Let the bowstrings break upon the bows of those who hate us.

original: vi ṣu viśvā arātayo 'ryo naśanta no dhiyaḥ
analyzed: vi su viśvāḥ arātayaḥ ryaḥ naśanta naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: Drive away all our enemies, and the spiteful thoughts of men.

original: astāsiśatrave vadhaṃ yo na indra jighāṃsati yā te rātirdadirvasu nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākā adhi dhanvasu
analyzed: asta asi śatrave vadham yaḥ naḥ indra jighāṃsati yā te rātiḥ dadiḥ vasu nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Thou art the slayer of the foe: to him who fain would injure us, O Indra, give the blow. Let the bowstrings break upon the bows of those who hate us.

original: yo na indrābhito jano vṛkāyurādideśati
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ indra abhitas janaḥ vṛkāyuḥ ādideśati
translated: He who, O Indra, from around us, from the wolf-infested wood,

original: adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi vibādho asi sāsahirnabhantāmanyakeṣāṃ jyākāadhi dhanvasu
analyzed: adhaspadam tamīm kṛdhi vibādhaḥ asi sāsahiḥ nabhantām anyakeṣām jyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Would fain attack us, crush him down: thou art the punisher, the conqueror. Let the bowstrings break upon the bows of those who hate us.

original: yo na indrābhidāsati sanābhiryaśca niṣṭyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ indra abhidāsati sanābhiḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ
translated: He who, O Indra, from the folk around us, from the clansmen and the stranger,

original: ava tasyabalaṃ tira mahīva dyauradha tmanā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu
analyzed: ava tasya balam tira mahī iva dyauḥ adha tmanā nabhantām anyakeṣāṃjyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Would fain attack us, crush his power beneath thee, as the mighty heaven is under earth. Let the bowstrings break upon the bows of those who hate us.

original: vayamindra tvāyavaḥ sakhitvamā rabhāmahe
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ sakhitvam ā rabhāmahe
translated: We, O Indra, fain for thee, would take upon us the friendship.

original: ṛtasya naḥpathā nayāti viśvāni duritā nabhantāmanyakeṣāṃjyākā adhi dhanvasu
analyzed: ṛtasya naḥ pathā naya ati viśvāni duritā nabhantām anyakeṣāṃjyākāḥ adhi dhanvasu
translated: Lead us by the path of holy Law past all our enemies. Let the bowstrings break upon the bows of those who hate us.

original: asmabhyaṃ su tvamindra tāṃ śikṣa yā dohate prati varaṃjaritre
analyzed: asmabhyam su tvam indra tām śikṣa yā dohate prati varaṃjaritre
translated: For us, O Indra, do thou win that which the milker gives to the praiser in return

original: achidrodhnī pīpayad yathā naḥ sahasradhārāpayasā mahī gauḥ
analyzed: achidra udhnī pīpayat yathā naḥ sahasra dhārā payasā mahī gauḥ
translated: That the great cow may fill us with a thousand streams of milk, with udder never failing

original: ubhe yadindra rodasī āpaprāthoṣā iva
analyzed: ubhe yat indra rodasī āpaprātha uṣāḥ iva
translated: If thou, O Indra, hast filled both the worlds like the dawn

original: mahāntaṃ tvāmahīnāṃ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ devī janitryajījanadbhadrā janitryajījanat
analyzed: mahāntam tvām ahīnām samrājam carṣaṇīnām devī janitrī ajījanat bhadrā janitrī ajījanat
translated: The great, the powerful, the lord of men, the divine mother has generated thee, the auspicious mother has generated thee

original: ava sma durhaṇāyato martasya tanuhi sthiram
analyzed: ava sma durhaṇāyataḥ martasya tanuhi sthiram
translated: Remember to crush the wicked man's body, O mortal one

original: adhaspadaṃ tamīṃ kṛdhi yo asmānādideśati devī janitryajījanad bhadrājanitryajījanat
analyzed: adhaspadam tamīm kṛdhi yaḥ asmān ādideśati devī janitrī ajījanat bhadrā janitrī ajījanat
translated: Make him lowlier than the lowest, him who threatens us. The divine mother has generated thee, the auspicious mother has generated thee

original: ava tyā bṛhatīriṣo viśvaścandrā amitrahan🔽śacībhiḥśakra dhūnuhīndra viśvābhirūtibhirdevī janitry / / /🔽ava yat tvaṃ śatakratavindra viśvāni dhūnuṣe
analyzed: ava tyāḥ bṛhatīḥ iṣaḥ viśva ścandrāḥ amitra han  śacībhiḥ śakra dhūnuhi indra viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ devī janitrī  ava yat tvam śatakrato indra viśvāni dhūnuṣe
translated: O slayer of enemies, may these great viands, all radiant,🔽Shake through thy powers, O Indra, through all thy aids. The divine mother has generated thee,🔽When thou, O Indra of a hundred powers, dost shake all things,

original: rayiṃna sunvate sacā sahasriṇībhirūtibhirdevī janitry / / /🔽ava svedā ivābhito viṣvak patantu didyavaḥ
analyzed: rayiṃna sunvate sacā sahasriṇībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ devī janitrī  ava svedāḥ iva abhitas viṣvak patantu didyavaḥ
translated: Grant wealth to the presser along with a thousand aids. The divine mother has generated thee,🔽Let the thunderbolts fall around us like drops of sweat,

original: dūrvāyā ivatantavo vyasmadetu durmatirdevī janītry / / /
analyzed: dūrvāyāḥ iva tantavaḥ vi asmat etu durmatiḥ devī janītrī
translated: Let evil thought depart from us like the threads of a Dûrvâ plant. The divine mother has generated thee,

original: dīrghaṃ hyaṅkuśaṃ yathā śaktiṃ bibharṣi mantumaḥ
analyzed: dīrgham hi aṅkuśam yathā śaktim bibharṣi mantumas
translated: For long thou bearest in thy thought, O wisest, the goad as with a dart.

original: pūrveṇa maghavan padājo vayāṃ yathā yamo devī janitry / / /
analyzed: pūrveṇa maghavan padā ajaḥ vayām yathā yamaḥ devī janitrī
translated: With the first step, O Maghavan, thou hast surpassed Yama, as the goddess, the mother of the people, surpasses.

original: nakirdevā minīmasi nakirā yopayāmasi mantraśrutyaṃcarāmasi
analyzed: nakir devāḥ minīmasi nakirā yopayāmasi mantraśrutyam carāmasi
translated: We do not despise the gods, nor do we serve another. We go to him who hears our prayers.

original: pakṣebhirapikakṣebhiratrābhi saṃ rabhāmahe
analyzed: pakṣebhiḥ apikakṣebhiḥ atra abhi sam rabhāmahe
translated: With our wings, our shoulders, we here rush together.

original: yasmin vṛkṣe supalāśe devaiḥ sampibate yamaḥ
analyzed: yasmin vṛkṣe su palāśe devaiḥ sampibate yamaḥ
translated: In which tree with good leaves Yama drinks together with the gods,

original: atrā noviśpatiḥ pitā purāṇānanu venati
analyzed: atrā naḥ viśpatiḥ pitā purāṇān anu venati
translated: There our lord, our father, remembers the ancient ones.

original: purāṇānanuvenantaṃ carantaṃ pāpayāmuyā
analyzed: purāṇān anuvenantam carantam pāpayā amuyā
translated: Following the ancient ones, he moves with evil desire.

original: asūyannabhyacākṣaṃ tasmā aspṛhayaṃ punaḥ
analyzed: asūyan abhyacākṣam tasmai aspṛhayam punar
translated: I have looked with envy upon him, therefore I have no desire for him again.

original: yaṃ kumāra navaṃ rathamacakraṃ manasākṛṇoḥ
analyzed: yam kumāra navam ratham a cakram manasā akṛṇoḥ
translated: O youth, the new chariot which thou hast made with thy mind,

original: ekeṣaṃviśvataḥ prāñcamapaśyannadhi tiṣṭhasi
analyzed: ekeṣam viśvatas prāñcam a paśyan adhi tiṣṭhasi
translated: Which thou seest standing above, with one wheel, facing all directions.

original: yaṃ kumāra prāvartayo rathaṃ viprebhyas pari
analyzed: yam kumāra prāvartayaḥ ratham viprebhyaḥ pari
translated: O youth, the chariot which thou hast set in motion for the Brahmins,

original: taṃsāmānu prāvartata samito nāvyāhitam
analyzed: taṃsāma anu prāvartata samitaḥ na a vyāhitam
translated: The Saman has been set in motion along with it, not hindered.

original: kaḥ kumāramajanayad rathaṃ ko niravartayat
analyzed: kaḥ kumāram ajanayat ratham kaḥ niravartayat
translated: Who has begotten the youth, who has set the chariot in motion?

original: kaḥ svit tadadya no brūyādanudeyī yathābhavat
analyzed: kaḥ svid tat adya naḥ brūyāt anudeyī yathā abhavat
translated: Who will tell us that today, how the follower has come to be?

original: yathābhavadanudeyī tato agramajāyata
analyzed: yathā abhavat anudeyī tatas agram ajāyata
translated: As the follower has come to be, from that the foremost has been born.

original: purastād budhnaātataḥ paścān nirayaṇaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: purastāt budhnaātataḥ paścāt nirayaṇam kṛtam
translated: The foundation is laid out in front, the outlet is made in the rear

original: idaṃ yamasya sādanaṃ devamānaṃ yaducyate🔽iyamasyadhamyate nāḷīrayaṃ gīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: idam yamasya sādanam deva mānam yat ucyate  iyam asi a dhamyate nāḷīḥ ayam gīrbhiḥ pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: This is Yama's abode, which is called the assembly of the gods🔽This is his iron millstone, this is he who is polished with songs

original: keśyagniṃ keśī viṣaṃ keśī bibharti rodasī
analyzed: keśī agnim keśī viṣam keśī bibharti rodasī
translated: The hair-holder holds Agni, the hair-holder holds poison, the hair-holder holds the two worlds

original: keśīviśvaṃ svardṛśe keśīdaṃ jyotirucyate
analyzed: keśīviśvam svar dṛśe keśīdam jyotiḥ ucyate
translated: The hair-holder holds the entire world for one to see, the hair-holder is called this light

original: munayo vātaraśanāḥ piśaṅgā vasate malā
analyzed: munayaḥ vāta raśanāḥ piśaṅgāḥ vasate
translated: The sages, with wind as their reins, wear tawny garments

original: vātasyānudhrājiṃ yanti yad devāso avikṣata
analyzed: vātasya anudhrājim yanti yat devāsaḥ avikṣata
translated: They go along the wind's course, where the gods have gone

original: unmaditā mauneyana vātānā tasthimā vayam
analyzed: unmaditāḥ mauneyana vātānā tasthima vayam
translated: We, the intoxicated ones of the sage, the wind-borne ones, stand here

original: śarīredasmākaṃ yūyaṃ martāso abhi paśyatha
analyzed: yūyam martāsaḥ abhi paśyatha
translated: You mortals look upon our body

original: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā rūpāvacākaśat
analyzed: antarikṣeṇa patati viśvā rūpā avacākaśat
translated: It flies in the atmosphere, looking at all forms

original: munirdevasyadevasya saukṛtyāya sakhā hitaḥ
analyzed: muniḥ devasya devasya saukṛtyāya sakhā hitaḥ
translated: The sage is a friend for the good deeds of each god

original: vātasyāśvo vāyoḥ sakhātho deveṣito muniḥ
analyzed: vātasya aśvaḥ vāyoḥ sakhā atho deva iṣitaḥ muniḥ
translated: The horse of the wind, the friend of Vayu, and the sage sent by the gods

original: ubhausamudrāvā kṣeti yaśca pūrva utāparaḥ
analyzed: ubhau samudrau ā kṣeti yaḥ ca pūrvaḥ uta aparaḥ
translated: It moves between the two oceans, the eastern and the western

original: apsarasāṃ gandharvāṇāṃ mṛgāṇāṃ caraṇe caran
analyzed: apsarasām gandharvāṇām mṛgāṇām caraṇe caran
translated: Moving in the footsteps of the Apsarases, the Gandharvas, and the deer

original: keśīketasya vidvān sakhā svādurmadintamaḥ
analyzed: keśīketasya vidvān sakhā svāduḥ madintamaḥ
translated: The sweet one, the best intoxicant, is the friend of the wise one, the hair-holder

original: vāyurasmā upāmanthat pinaṣṭi smā kunannamā
analyzed: vāyuḥ asmai upāmanthat pinaṣṭi sma kunannamā
translated: Vayu has churned him out, he is grinding the crooked one

original: keśīviṣasya pātreṇa yad rudreṇāpibat saha
analyzed: keśīviṣasya pātreṇa yat rudreṇa apibat saha
translated: With the vessel of Keshi's poison, what he drank together even with Rudra

original: uta devā avahitaṃ devā un nayathā punaḥ
analyzed: uta devāḥ avahitam devāḥ ud nayathā punar
translated: The gods have covered it, the gods shall lead it forth again

original: utāgaścakruṣaṃ devā devā jīvayathā punaḥ
analyzed: uta āgaḥ cakruṣam devāḥ devāḥ jīvayathā punar
translated: The gods have made it crooked, the gods shall make it live again

original: dvāvimau vātau vāta ā sindhorā parāvataḥ🔽dakṣante anya ā vātu parānyo vātu yad rapaḥ
analyzed: dvau imau vātau vātaḥ ā sindhoḥ ā parāvataḥ  dakṣante anye ā vātu parā anyaḥ vātu yat rapaḥ
translated: These two winds blow, the wind from the river and from the distant side🔽Let one of them blow away, let the other blow away what is wrong

original: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajaṃ vi vāta vāhi yad rapaḥ
analyzed: ā vāta vāhi bheṣajam vi vāta vāhi yat rapaḥ
translated: O wind, blow away the medicine, O wind, blow away what is wrong

original: tvaṃ hiviśvabheṣajo devānāṃ dūta īyase🔽ā tvāgamaṃ śantātibhiratho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ
analyzed: tvam hi viśva bheṣajaḥ devānām dūtaḥ īyase  ā tvā agamam śantātibhiḥ atho ariṣṭatātibhiḥ
translated: For you are the all-healing one, you go as the messenger of the gods🔽I have come to you with blessings of peace, and also with blessings of safety

original: dakṣante bhadramābhārṣaṃ parā yakṣmaṃ suvāmi te
analyzed: dakṣante bhadram ābhārṣam parā yakṣmam suvāmi te
translated: I have brought you good fortune, I drive away your consumption from afar

original: trāyantāmiha devāstrāyatāṃ marutāṃ gaṇaḥ
analyzed: trāyantām iha devāḥ trāyatām marutām gaṇaḥ
translated: Here may the gods protect you, may the host of Maruts protect you

original: trāyantāṃ viśvā bhūtāni yathāyamarapā asat🔽āpa id vā u bheṣajīrāpo amīvacātanīḥ
analyzed: trāyantām viśvā bhūtāni yathā ayam arapāḥ asat  āpaḥ id vai u bheṣajīḥ āpaḥ amīva cātanīḥ
translated: May all beings protect you, so that this one may be free from sin🔽The waters indeed are the healing ones, the waters are the healers of disease

original: āpaḥsarvasya bheṣajīstāste kṛṇvantu bheṣajam
analyzed: āpaḥ sarvasya bheṣajīḥ tāḥ te kṛṇvantu bheṣajam
translated: The waters are the healers of all, may they make this healing for you

original: hastābhyāṃ daśaśākhā bhyāṃ jihvā vācaḥ purogavī
analyzed: hastābhyām daśa śākhā bhyām jihvā vācaḥ purogavī
translated: With the two hands with ten fingers, with the tongue the leader of speech

original: anāmayitnubhyāṃ tvā tabhyāṃ tvopa spṛśāmasi
analyzed: anāmayitnubhyām tvā tabhyām tvā upa spṛśāmasi
translated: With the two that cause no disease, with them we touch you for good luck

original: tava tya indra sakhyeṣu vahnaya ṛtaṃ manvānā vyadardirurvalam
analyzed: tava tye indra sakhyeṣu vahnayaḥ ṛtam manvānāḥ vyadardiruḥ valam
translated: These, O Indra, in thy friendships, remembering the truth, have burst the strong one open,

original: yatrā daśasyannuṣaso riṇannapaḥ kutsāyamanmannahyaśca daṃsayaḥ🔽avāsṛjaḥ prasvaḥ śvañcayo girinudāja usrā apibomadhu priyam
analyzed: yatrā daśasyan uṣasaḥ riṇan apaḥ daṃsayaḥ  avāsṛjaḥ prasvaḥ śvañcayaḥ girinudā ajaḥ usrāḥ apibaḥ madhu priyam
translated: Where, bestowing gifts, the dawns have let the waters loose, and the impetuous ones have shown their strength.🔽Thou hast loosed the cloud, hast shaken the mountain, hast driven away the dawns, hast drunk the dear sweet drink.

original: avardhayo vanino asya daṃsasā śuśocasūrya ṛtajātayā girā
analyzed: avardhayaḥ vaninaḥ asya daṃsasā śuśoca sūryaḥ ṛta jātayā girā
translated: Thou hast increased the woods with his might, the sun hath shone with a song born of truth.

original: vi sūryo madhye amucad rathaṃ divo vidad dāsaya pratimānamāryaḥ
analyzed: vi sūryaḥ madhye amucat ratham divaḥ vidat dāsaya pratimānam āryaḥ
translated: The sun hath loosed his chariot in the midst of the sky, the noble one hath found the measure of the Dāsa.

original: dṛḷāni piprorasurasya māyina indro vyāsyaccakṛvān ṛjiśvanā
analyzed: dṛḷāni piproḥ asurasya māyinaḥ indraḥ vyāsyat cakṛvān ṛjiśvanā
translated: The firm forts of the strong, the wily Asura Pipru, Indra hath burst open with Ṛjiśvan.

original: anādhṛṣṭāni dhṛṣito vyāsyan nidhīnradevānamṛṇadayāsyaḥ
analyzed: anādhṛṣṭāni dhṛṣitaḥ vyāsyan nidhīn radevān amṛṇat ayāsyaḥ
translated: Desiring to burst open the unapproachable forts, the godless one hath bent them down with his might.

original: māseva sūryo vasu puryamā dade gṛṇānaḥśatrūnraśṛṇād virukmatā🔽ayuddhaseno vibhvā vibhindatā dāśad vṛtrahā tujyāni tejate
analyzed: māsā iva sūryaḥ vasu puryamā dade gṛṇānaḥ śatrūn raśṛṇāt virukmatā  a yuddha senaḥ vibhvā vibhindatā dāśat vṛtrahā tujyāni tejate
translated: Like the sun in the month, he hath taken the wealth of the city, praised, he hath crushed the enemies with his splendour.🔽The warrior with unwounded host, the all-conquering Vṛtraslayer, shines forth with his own might.

original: indrasya vajrādabibhedabhiśnathaḥ prākrāmacchundhyurajahaduṣa anaḥ
analyzed: indrasya vajrāt abibhet abhiśnathaḥ prākrāmat śundhyuḥ ajahat uṣaḥ anaḥ
translated: From Indra's thunderbolt he hath been delivered, he hath escaped from the snare, hath left his chariot behind.

original: etā tyā te śrutyāni kevalā yadeka ekamakṛṇorayajñam
analyzed: etā tyā te śrutyāni kevalā yat ekaḥ ekam akṛṇoḥ a yajñam
translated: These are thy well-known deeds, O thou who art alone, that thou hast made each one's sacrifice one only.

original: māsāṃ vidhānamadadhā adhi dyavi tvayā vibhinnambharati pradhiṃ pitā
analyzed: māsām vidhānam adadhāḥ adhi dyavi tvayā vibhinnam bharati pradhim pitā
translated: He has established the ordinance of the months in the sky; by him the father bears the enclosing stick, when it is cleft asunder

original: sūryaraśmirharikeśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotirudayānajasram
analyzed: sūrya raśmiḥ hari keśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotiḥ udayān ajasram
translated: The sun-rayed one, with tawny hair, is in front, Savitar, the light that rises unceasingly

original: tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvān sampaśyanviśvā bhuvanāni gopāḥ
analyzed: tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvān sampaśyan viśvā bhuvanāni gopāḥ
translated: Pūṣan, the wise, goes forth in his instigation, beholding all beings as their guardian

original: nṛcakṣā eṣa divo madhya āsta āpaprivān rodasīantarikṣam
analyzed: nṛ cakṣāḥ eṣa divaḥ madhye āste āpaprivān
translated: He, the eye of men, sits in the midst of heaven, having filled the two worlds and the atmosphere

original: sa viśvācīrabhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīrantarāpūrvamaparaṃ ca ketum
analyzed: sa viśvācīḥ abhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīḥ antarāpūrvam aparam ca ketum
translated: He beholds all the bright ones, the pure ones, between the former and the latter sign

original: rāyo budhnaḥ saṃgamano vasūnāṃ viśvā rūpābhi caṣṭeśacībhiḥ
analyzed: rāyaḥ budhnaḥ saṃgamanaḥ vasūnām viśvā rūpā abhi caṣṭe aśacībhiḥ
translated: The foundation of wealth, the gatherer of treasures, he beholds all forms with his powers

original: deva iva savitā satyadharmendro na tasthausamare dhanānām
analyzed: devaḥ iva savitā satya dharmā indraḥ na tasthau samare dhanānām
translated: Like a god, Savitar, of true law, Indra hath not stood still in the conflict of riches

original: viśvāvasuṃ soma gandharvamāpo dadṛśuṣīstad ṛtenā vyāyan
analyzed: viśvāvasum soma gandharvam āpaḥ dadṛśuṣīḥ tat ṛtena vyāyan
translated: The waters saw Viśvāvasu, the Gandharva, O Soma, they spread that forth with holy order

original: tadanvavaidindro rārahāṇa āsāṃ pari suryasyaparidhinrapaśyat
analyzed: tat anvavait indraḥ rārahāṇaḥ āsām pari suryasya paridhin apaśyat
translated: Thereon followed Indra, the bountiful one, he beheld the two enclosing-sticks of the sun

original: viśvāvasurabhi tan no gṛṇātu divyo gandharvo rajasovimānaḥ
analyzed: viśvāvasuḥ abhi tat naḥ gṛṇātu divyaḥ gandharvaḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ
translated: May Viśvāvasu, the heavenly Gandharva, the measurer of the region, sing that to us

original: yad vā ghā satyamuta yan na vidma dhiyohinvāno dhiya in no avyāḥ
analyzed: yat vā gha satyam uta yat na vidma dhiyaḥ hinvānaḥ dhiyaḥ id naḥ avyāḥ
translated: Whether it be true or whether we know it not, urging on our thoughts, may he come to us with thoughts

original: sasnimavindaccaraṇe nadīnāmapāvṛṇod duro aśmavrajānām
analyzed: sasnim avindat caraṇe nadīnām apāvṛṇot duraḥ aśma vrajānām
translated: He found the swift one in the course of the rivers, he opened the firm doors of the stone pens

original: prāsāṃ gandharvo amṛtāni vocadindro dakṣaṃ pari jānādahīnām
analyzed: pra āsām gandharvaḥ amṛtāni vocat indraḥ dakṣam pari jānāt ahīnām
translated: The Gandharva proclaimed the immortal ones, Indra knows well the powers of the Ahīnas

original: agne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso
analyzed: agne tava śravaḥ vayaḥ mahi bhrājante arcayaḥ vibhāvaso
translated: O Agni, your glory and strength are great, your flames shine, O you of bright radiance

original: bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājamukthyaṃ dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave
analyzed: bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājam ukthyam dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave
translated: O you of great light, you bestow by your power the praiseworthy strength on the worshipper, O wise one

original: pāvakavarcāḥ śukravarcā anūnavarcā udiyarṣi bhānunā
analyzed: pāvaka varcāḥ śukra varcāḥ anūna varcāḥ udiyarṣi bhānunā
translated: With pure radiance, bright radiance, and perfect radiance you rise with your light

original: putro mātarā vicarannupāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe
analyzed: putraḥ mātarā vicaran upa avasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe
translated: Circling around your two mothers, O son, you support the two worlds

original: ūrjo napājjātavedaḥ suśastibhirmandasva dhītibhirhitaḥ
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt jātavedaḥ su śastibhiḥ mandasva dhītibhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: O son of strength, O all-knower, be gladdened by our well-praised offerings, being helped by our thoughts

original: tve iṣaḥ saṃ dadhurbhūrivarpasaścitrotayo vāmajātāḥ
analyzed: tve iṣaḥ sam bhūri varpasaḥ citra ūtayaḥ vāma jātāḥ
translated: In you they have placed the food of many forms, the variously flowing, blissfully born ones

original: irajyannagne prathayasva jantubhirasme rāyo amartya
analyzed: irajyan agne prathayasva jantubhiḥ asme rāyaḥ amartya
translated: Reigning, O Agni, extend yourself with the people. Give us wealth, O immortal one

original: sadarśatasya vapuṣo vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasiṃ kratum
analyzed: sa darśatasya vapuṣaḥ vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasim kratum
translated: You shine with the form of the beautiful one. You fulfill the successful sacrifice

original: iṣkartāramadhvarasya pracetasaṃ kṣayantaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ
analyzed: iṣkartāram adhvarasya pracetasam kṣayantam rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: The impeller of the sacrifice, the wise one, the lord of great wealth

original: rātiṃ vāmasya subhagāṃ mahīmiṣaṃ dadhāsi sānasiṃrayim
analyzed: rātim vāmasya subhagām mahīm iṣam dadhāsi sānasiṃrayim
translated: You bestow the blissful gift of good things, the successful treasure

original: ṛtāvānaṃ mahiṣaṃ viśvadarśatamagniṃ sumnāya dadhirepuro janāḥ
analyzed: ṛtāvānam mahiṣam viśva darśatam agnim sumnāya janāḥ
translated: The people have set in the front the truthful, mighty, all-seeing Agni for their happiness

original: śrutkarṇaṃ saprathastamaṃ tvā girā daivyammānuṣā yugā
analyzed: śrutkarṇam saprathastamam tvā girā daivyam mānuṣā yugā
translated: Thee, O Agni, with the hymn, the most famous of the famous, the most far-reaching, the divine, the human generations

original: agne achā vadeha naḥ pratyaṃ naḥ sumanā bhava
analyzed: agne achā vada iha naḥ pratyam naḥ su manāḥ bhava
translated: O Agni, come to us and speak to us; be gracious to us and in our favour

original: pra noyacha viśas pate dhanadā asi nastvam
analyzed: pra naḥ yaccha viśaḥ pate dhana dāḥ asi nastvam
translated: Grant us, O Lord of the people; thou art the giver of wealth to us

original: pra no yachatvaryamā pra bhagaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ
analyzed: pra naḥ yacchatu aryamā pra bhagaḥ pra bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: May Aryaman grant to us, may Bhaga grant, may Brihaspati grant

original: pradevāḥ prota sūnṛtā rāyo devī dadātu naḥ
analyzed: pra devāḥ pra uta sūnṛtāḥ rāyaḥ devī dadātu naḥ
translated: May the gods grant, may pleasantness grant; may the Goddess of wealth grant to us

original: somaṃ rājānamavase 'gniṃ gīrbhirhavāmahe
analyzed: somam rājānam avase gnim gīrbhiḥ havāmahe
translated: We invoke with hymns King Soma for help, and Agni

original: ādityānviṣṇuṃ sūryaṃ brahmāṇaṃ ca bṛhaspatim
analyzed: ādityān viṣṇum sūryam brahmāṇam ca bṛhaspatim
translated: The Âdityas, Vishnu, Surya, and Brahman Brihaspati

original: indravāyū bṛhaspatiṃ suhaveha havāmahe
analyzed: indra vāyū bṛhaspatim su havā iha havāmahe
translated: We invoke here Indra, Vayu, and Brihaspati, the swift messengers,

original: yathā naḥ sarvaijjanaḥ saṃgatyāṃ sumanā asat
analyzed: yathā naḥ sarvait janaḥ saṃgatyām su manāḥ asat
translated: So that all the people may be well-disposed towards us in their assemblies

original: aryamaṇaṃ bṛhaspatimindraṃ dānāya codaya
analyzed: aryamaṇam bṛhaspatim indram dānāya codaya
translated: Urge on Aryaman, Brihaspati, and Indra to give

original: vātaṃviṣṇuṃ sarasvatīṃ savitāraṃ ca vājinam
analyzed: vātam viṣṇum sarasvatīm savitāram ca vājinam
translated: Vata, Vishnu, Sarasvatî, and the strong Savitar

original: tvaṃ no agne agnibhirbrahma yajñaṃ ca vardhaya
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne agnibhiḥ brahma yajñam ca vardhaya
translated: Do thou, O Agni, with the fires, O Agni, increase our prayer and sacrifice

original: tvaṃ nodevatātaye rāyo dānāya codaya
analyzed: tvam naḥ devatātaye rāyaḥ dānāya codaya
translated: Do thou, O god, urge on (the gods) for the sake of our worship, and to give us wealth

original: ayamagne jaritā tve abhūdapi sahasaḥ sūno nahyanyadastyāpyam
analyzed: ayam agne jaritā tve abhūt api sahasaḥ sūno na hi anyat asti āpyam
translated: This singer of thine, O Agni, hath become such, O son of strength; there is no other to be desired but thee

original: bhadraṃ hi śarma trivarūthamasti ta ārehiṃsānāmapa didyumā kṛdhi
analyzed: bhadram hi śarma tri varūtham asti te ārehiṃsānām apa didyumā kṛdhi
translated: For good is the shelter, threefold, that is thine: drive thou away from us the flashes of the thunderbolt.

original: pravat te agne janimā pitūyataḥ sācīva viśvā bhuvanā nyṛñjase
analyzed: pravat te agne janimā pitūyataḥ sāci iva viśvā bhuvanā nyṛñjase
translated: Thy generations, O Agni, from thy father, like sisters, all have attained to thee.

original: pra saptayaḥ pra saniṣanta no dhiyaḥ puraścarantipaśupā iva tmanā
analyzed: pra saptayaḥ pra saniṣanta naḥ dhiyaḥ puras caranti paśu pāḥ iva tmanā
translated: The seven swift ones, the thoughts, are sent forth by us, they go before us like herdsmen in their own way.

original: uta vā u pari vṛṇakṣi bapsad bahoragna ulapasya svadhāvaḥ
analyzed: uta vai u pari vṛṇakṣi bapsat bahoḥ agne ulapasya svadhāvas
translated: And, O Agni, thou dost choose the food of the great, the food of the little one, O thou of native might.

original: uta khilyā urvarāṇāṃ bhavanti mā te hetiṃ taviṣīṃcukrudhāma🔽yadudvato nivato yāsi bapsat pṛthageṣi pragardhinīvasenā
analyzed: uta khilyāḥ urvarāṇām bhavanti mā te hetim taviṣīṃcukrudhāma  yat udvataḥ nivataḥ yāsi bapsat pṛthak eṣi pragardhinī vasena
translated: And they become the furrows of the fields: we will not be angry with thy dart and thy might.🔽When thou goest to the food, from the high place, from the low place, thou seekest apart like a greedy woman with her troop.

original: yadā te vāto anuvāti śocirvapteva śmaśru vapasipra bhūma
analyzed: yadā te vātaḥ anuvāti śociḥ vaptā iva śmaśru vapasi pra bhūma
translated: When the wind blows after thee, O Agni, thy flame, like a barber, shaves the beard of the earth.

original: pratyasya śreṇayo dadṛśra ekaṃ niyānaṃ bahavo rathāsaḥ🔽bāhū yadagne anumarmṛjāno nyaṃṃ uttānāmanveṣibhūmim
analyzed: pratyasya śreṇayaḥ dadṛśre ekam niyānam bahavaḥ rathāsaḥ  bāhū yat agne anumarmṛjānaḥ nyaṃ uttānām anveṣi bhūmim
translated: The rows of thy chariot are seen to be one, the many chariots are separate.🔽When, O Agni, thou rubbest thy arms, thou seekest the earth that lies extended.

original: ut te śuṣmā jihatāmut te arcirut te agne śaśamānasyavājāḥ
analyzed: ud te śuṣmāḥ jihatām ud te arciḥ ud te agne śaśamānasya vājāḥ
translated: Let thy flames rise up, let thy flame rise up, let thy powers rise up, O Agni, of the one who strives.

original: ucchvañcasva ni nama vardhamāna ā tvādya viśvevasavaḥ sadantu
analyzed: ucchvañcasva ni nama vardhamānaḥ ā tvā adya viśvevasavaḥ sadantu
translated: Rise up, bow down, wax great: let all the Vasus sit down with thee to-day.

original: apāmidaṃ nyayanaṃ samudrasya niveśanam
analyzed: apām idam nyayanam samudrasya niveśanam
translated: This is the resting-place of the waters, the abode of the ocean.

original: anyaṃkṛṇuṣvetaḥ panthāṃ tena yāhi vaśānanu
analyzed: anyaṃkṛṇuṣva itas panthām tena yāhi vaśān anu
translated: Make a path for him to the other side, by which he may go to the cattle.

original: āyane te parāyaṇe dūrvā rohantu puṣpiṇiḥ
analyzed: āyane te parāyaṇe dūrvāḥ rohantu puṣpiṇiḥ
translated: In your coming and going let flowering Dūrvā grass grow.

original: hradāścapuṇḍarīkāṇi samudrasya gṛhā ime
analyzed: hradāḥ ca puṇḍarīkāṇi samudrasya gṛhāḥ ime
translated: The lakes and lotus ponds are the houses of the ocean.

original: tyaṃ cidatrim ṛtajuramarthamaśvaṃ na yātave
analyzed: tyam cit atrim ṛtajuram artham aśvam na yātave
translated: Even him, Atri, the leader in truth, like a horse for the race,

original: kakṣivantaṃ yadī punā rathaṃ na kṛṇutho navam
analyzed: kakṣivantam yadī punā ratham na kṛṇuthaḥ navam
translated: When you purify him, like a chariot, you make him new.

original: tyaṃ cidaśvaṃ na vājinamareṇavo yamatnata🔽dṛḷaṃgranthiṃ na vi ṣyatamatriṃ yaviṣṭhamā rajaḥ
analyzed: tyam cit aśvam na vājinam areṇavaḥ yam atnata  dṛḷaṃgranthim na vi syatam atrim yaviṣṭhamā rajaḥ
translated: Even him, the swift horse, you have made free from dust.🔽Break the firm bond, as one would break a rope, Atri, the youngest in the race.

original: narā daṃsiṣṭhavatraye śubhrā siṣāsataṃ dhiyaḥ
analyzed: narā śubhrā siṣāsatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O men, most wonderful in your deeds, the two bright ones strive for the thoughts.

original: athā hi vāṃ divo narā puna stomo na viśase
analyzed: athā hi vām divaḥ narā punar stomaḥ na
translated: Then, O men of heaven, your praise shall be extended again.

original: cite tad vāṃ surādhasā rātiḥ sumatiraśvinā
analyzed: cite tat vām su rādhasā rātiḥ sumatiḥ aśvinā
translated: That, O you of good gifts, your favour and gift, O Aśvins, is in your mind,

original: ā yannaḥ sadane pṛthau samane parṣatho narā
analyzed: ā yat naḥ sadane pṛthau samane parṣathaḥ narā
translated: When, O men, you lead us to the wide seat, to the common place.

original: yuvaṃ bhujyuṃ samudra ā rajasaḥ pāra īṅkhitam
analyzed: yuvam bhujyum samudre ā rajasaḥ pāre īṅkhitam
translated: You two brought Bhujyu from the ocean, from the end of the sky,

original: yātamachā patatribhirnāsatyā sātaye kṛtam🔽ā vāṃ sumnaiḥ śamyū iva maṃhiṣṭhā viśvavedasā
analyzed: yātam achā patatribhiḥ nāsatyā sātaye kṛtam  ā vām sumnaiḥ śamyū iva maṃhiṣṭhā viśva vedasā
translated: Come with the birds, O Nāsatyas, for the sake of accomplishment.🔽With your favours, like friends, most bountiful, all-knowing,

original: samasme bhūṣataṃ narotsaṃ na pipyuṣīriṣaḥ
analyzed: sam asme bhūṣatam narā utsam na pipyuṣīḥ iriṣaḥ
translated: Be ready for us, O men, like full-flowing streams for the spring.

original: ayaṃ hi te amartya induratyo na patyate
analyzed: ayam hi te amartyaḥ induḥ atyaḥ na patyate
translated: For this, O immortal one, this Soma flows for you, like a horse,

original: dakṣo viśvāyurvedhase🔽ayamasmāsu kāvya ṛbhurvajro dāsvate
analyzed: dakṣaḥ viśvāyuḥ vedhase  ayam asmāsu kāvyaḥ ṛbhuḥ vajraḥ dāsvate
translated: Daksha, the life of the universe, to the creator🔽This Rभु, the thunderbolt, is ready to give to us, O poet

original: ayaṃ bibhartyūrdhvakṛśanaṃ madam ṛbhurna kṛtvyaṃ madam
analyzed: ayam bibharti ūrdhva kṛśanam madam ṛbhuḥ na kṛtvyam madam
translated: He bears the intoxicating drink that makes one lofty, Rभु the intoxicating drink that makes one powerful

original: ghṛṣuḥ śyenāya kṛtvana āsu svāsu vaṃsagaḥ
analyzed: ghṛṣuḥ śyenāya kṛtvane āsu svāsu vaṃsagaḥ
translated: The swift one, having made (it), is in his own homes, in his own waters

original: ava dīdhedahīśuvaḥ
analyzed: ava dīdhedahīśuvaḥ
translated: He should think of the one who is to be worshipped

original: yaṃ suparṇaḥ parāvataḥ śyenasya putra ābharat
analyzed: yam suparṇaḥ parāvataḥ śyenasya putraḥ ābharat
translated: Whom the eagle, the son of the hawk, brought from afar

original: śatacakraṃ yo 'hyo vartaniḥ
analyzed: śata cakram yaḥ hyas vartaniḥ
translated: The wheel-hundreded, the axle-less

original: yaṃ te śyenaścārumavṛkaṃ padābharadaruṇaṃ mānamandhasaḥ
analyzed: yam te śyenaḥ cārum avṛkam padā abharat aruṇam mānam andhasaḥ
translated: The hawk has brought to thee, O Indra, the beautiful, the fearless, the red prize of the drink

original: enā vayo vi tāryāyurjīvasa enā jāgārabandhutā
analyzed: enā vayaḥ vi tāri āyuḥ jīvase enā jāgāra bandhu tā
translated: Through this may we pass through the years, through life, through life

original: evā tadindra indunā deveṣu cid dhārayāte mahi tyajaḥ
analyzed: eva tat indraḥ indunā deveṣu cit dhārayāte mahi tyajaḥ
translated: Thus, O Indra, with the Soma, he will even sustain the great might of the gods

original: kratvā vayo vi tāryāyuḥ sukrato kratvāyamasmadāsutaḥ
analyzed: kratvā vayaḥ vi tāri āyuḥ su krato kratvā ayam asmat āsutaḥ
translated: Through wisdom may we pass through the years, through life, O wise one, through life for us, through life for us, through life for us

original: imāṃ khanāmyoṣadhiṃ vīrudhaṃ balavattamām
analyzed: imām khanāmi oṣadhim vīrudham balavattamām
translated: I dig up this plant, the most powerful creeper

original: yayāsapatnīṃ bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim
analyzed: yayā a sapatnīm bādhate yayā saṃvindate patim
translated: By which one repels a rival wife, by which one wins a husband

original: uttānaparṇe subhage devajūte sahasvati
analyzed: uttāna parṇe subhage deva jūte sahasvati
translated: O Utanaparna, O fortunate one, O divine one, O victorious one

original: sapatnīṃ me parādhama patiṃ me kevalaṃ kuru
analyzed: sapatnīm me parādhama patim me kevalam kuru
translated: I overcome my rival wife, I make my husband all mine

original: uttarāhamuttara uttareduttarābhyaḥ
analyzed: uttarā aham uttaraḥ uttaret uttarābhyaḥ
translated: I am the higher, higher than the higher, higher than the higher

original: athā sapatnī yāmamādharā sādharābhyaḥ
analyzed: athā sapatnī sā adharābhyaḥ
translated: Then my rival wife is lower, lower than the lower

original: nahyasyā nāma gṛbhṇāmi no asmin ramate jane
analyzed: na hi asyāḥ nāma gṛbhṇāmi na u asmin ramate jane
translated: For I do not grasp her name, nor does she delight in this people.

original: parāmevaparāvataṃ sapatnīṃ gamayāmasi
analyzed: parām eva parāvatam sapatnīm gamayāmasi
translated: To the farthest distance we send away the co-wife.

original: ahamasmi sahamānātha tvamasi sāsahiḥ
analyzed: aham asmi sahamānā atha tvam asi sāsahiḥ
translated: I am the one who conquers, and you are the one who endures.

original: ubhe sahasvatībhūtvī sapatnīṃ me sahāvahai
analyzed: ubhe sahasvatī bhūtvī sapatnīm me sahāvahai
translated: Becoming both of us conquerors, let us conquer my co-wife.

original: upa te 'dhāṃ sahamānāmabhi tvādhāṃ sahīyasā
analyzed: upa te dhām sahamānām abhi tvā adhām sahīyasā
translated: I approach you, the conqueror, I overcome you with what is stronger.

original: māmanupra te mano vatsaṃ gauriva dhāvatu pathā vāriva dhāvatu
analyzed: mām anu pra te manaḥ vatsam gauḥ iva dhāvatu pathā vār iva dhāvatu
translated: Let your mind follow me, like a cow to her calf, let it run along the path like water.

original: araṇyānyaraṇyānyasau yā preva naśyasi🔽kathāgrāmaṃ na pṛchasi na tvā bhīriva vindatī ' ' 'n
analyzed: araṇyāni araṇyāni asau yā pra iva naśyasi  kathā grāmam na pṛcchasi na tvā bhīḥ iva vindatī
translated: You who are going away as if lost in the forest,🔽why do you not ask about the village? You do not find it as if in fear.

original: vṛṣāravāya vadate yadupāvati ciccikaḥ🔽āghāṭibhirivadhāvayannaraṇyānirmahīyate
analyzed: vṛṣāravāya vadate yat upāvati ciccikaḥ  āghāṭibhiḥ iva dhāvayan araṇyā nirmahīyate
translated: The cricket chirps to the bull-frog, the cicada sings.🔽The forest-dweller is honored, moving as if with a rolling pin.

original: uta gāva ivādantyuta veśmeva dṛśyate🔽uto araṇyāniḥsāyaṃ śakaṭīriva sarjati🔽gāmaṅgaiṣa ā hvayati dārvaṅgaiṣo apāvadhīt
analyzed: uta gāvaḥ iva adanti uta veśma iva dṛśyate  uta u araṇyā niḥsāyam śakaṭīḥ iva sarjati  gām aṅga eṣaḥ ā hvayati dāru aṅga eṣaḥ apāvadhīt
translated: They seem to be chewing as if cows, and a house is seen.🔽And the forest-dweller in the evening sets free the carts as if.🔽This one calls for a cow, this one kills a piece of wood.

original: vasannaraṇyānyāṃ sāyamakrukṣaditi manyate
analyzed: vasan araṇyānyām sāyam akrukṣat iti manyate
translated: Dwelling in the forest in the evening, he thinks he has cried out.

original: na vā araṇyānirhantyanyaścen nābhigachati
analyzed: na vai araṇyā nirhanti anyaḥ ced na abhigacchati
translated: The forest-dweller does not kill, if another does not approach.

original: svādoḥphalasya jagdhvāya yathākāmaṃ ni padyate
analyzed: svādoḥ phalasya jagdhvāya yathākāmam ni padyate
translated: Having eaten the sweet fruit, he lies down as he wishes.

original: āñjanagandhiṃ surabhiṃ bahvannāmakṛṣīvalām
analyzed: āñjana gandhim surabhim bahu annām akṛṣīvalām
translated: I praise the fragrant one, smelling of ointment, the bountiful one, the tiller of the field,

original: prāhammṛgāṇāṃ mātaramaraṇyānimaśaṃsiṣam
analyzed: prāham mṛgāṇām mātaram araṇyānim aśaṃsiṣam
translated: The mother of deer, the forest-dweller.

original: śrat te dadhāmi prathamāya manyave 'han yad vṛtraṃ naryaṃviverapaḥ
analyzed: śrat te dadhāmi prathamāya manyave han yat vṛtram naryaṃviverapaḥ
translated: I place in your mouth the first thunderbolt, when you slew Vṛtra, the man, and released the waters,

original: ubhe yat tvā bhavato rodasī anu rejateśuṣmāt pṛthivī cidadrivaḥ
analyzed: ubhe yat tvā bhavataḥ rodasī anu rejate īśuṣmāt pṛthivī cit adrivas
translated: When both worlds follow you, O you who have power, the earth trembles even from your might, O you who have power.

original: tvaṃ māyābhiranavadya māyinaṃ śravasyatā manasā vṛtramardayaḥ🔽tvamin naro vṛṇate gaviṣṭiṣu tvāṃ viśvāsuhavyāsviṣṭiṣu🔽aiṣu cākandhi puruhūta sūriṣu vṛdhāso ye maghavannānaśurmagham
analyzed: tvam māyābhiḥ anavadya māyinam śravasyatā manasā vṛtram ardayaḥ  tvamin naraḥ vṛṇate gaviṣṭiṣu tvām viśvāsu havyāsu iṣṭiṣu  ā eṣu cākandhi puruhūta sūriṣu vṛdhāsaḥ ye maghavan ānaśuḥ magham
translated: You, O faultless one, with your illusions, with a mind that desires fame, struck down the illusionist Vṛtra.🔽You, O man, are chosen in contests for cattle, you in all contests for oblations.🔽Be eager for these wealthy patrons, O much-invoked one, who have offered their wealth, O bountiful one.

original: arcanti toke tanaye pariṣṭiṣu medhasātā vājinamahraye dhane
analyzed: arcanti toke tanaye pariṣṭiṣu medha sātā vājinam ahraye dhane
translated: They praise you in the birth of their children, in the gatherings, the strong one for the sake of wealth in the sacrifices.

original: sa in nu rāyaḥ subhṛtasya cākanan madaṃ yo asya raṃhyaṃciketati🔽tvāvṛdho maghavan dāśvadhvaro makṣū sa vājambharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ
analyzed: saḥ id nu rāyaḥ su bhṛtasya cākanat madam yaḥ asya raṃhī aṃciketati  tvāvṛdhaḥ maghavan dāśu adhvaraḥ makṣū sa vājambharate dhanā nṛbhiḥ
translated: He indeed desires the joy of well-bestowed wealth, who knows your swiftness.🔽You, O bountiful one, O Maghavan, the one who offers gifts, quickly brings forth strength and wealth with men.

original: tvaṃ śardhāya mahinā gṛṇāna uru kṛdhi maghavañchagdhirāyaḥ
analyzed: tvam śardhāya mahinā gṛṇānaḥ uru kṛdhi maghavan śagdhirāyaḥ
translated: You, O bountiful one, for the sake of the strong one who sings with might, make wide the path for him, grant him wealth.

original: tvaṃ no mitro varuṇo na māyī pitvo na dasmadayase vibhaktā
analyzed: tvam naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ na māyī pitvaḥ na dasma dayase vibhaktā
translated: You are our friend, O Varuṇa, the wondrous one, like a father, O wondrous one, you delight us

original: suṣvāṇāsa indra stumasi tvā sasavāṃsaśca tuvinṛmṇavājam
analyzed: suṣvāṇāsaḥ indra stumasi tvā sasavāṃsaḥ ca tuvi nṛmṇa vājam
translated: We, O Indra, praise you, O you who are well-fed, and those who have food, O you whose strength is irresistible

original: ā no bhara suvitaṃ yasya cākan tmanā tanāsanuyāma tvotāḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara suvitam yasya cākan tmanā tanā asanuyāma tvotāḥ
translated: Bring us good fortune, for which we long, that we may go to you with our own bodies, urged on by you

original: ṛṣvastvamindra śūra jāto dāsīrviśaḥ sūryeṇasahyāḥ
analyzed: ṛṣvaḥ tvam indra śūra jātaḥ dāsīḥ viśaḥ sūryeṇa sahyāḥ
translated: You, O Indra, O hero, are born lofty, the Dāsa peoples are to be conquered with the sun

original: guhā hitaṃ guhyaṃ gūḷamapsu bibhṛmasiprasravaṇe na somam
analyzed: guhā hitam guhyam gūḷam apsu bibhṛmasi prasravaṇe na somam
translated: We bear the hidden secret, the hidden treasure in the waters, like Soma at the spring

original: aryo vā giro abhyarca vidvān ṛṣīṇāṃ vipraḥ sumatiṃcakānaḥ
analyzed: aryaḥ vā giraḥ abhyarca vidvān ṛṣīṇām vipraḥ sumatiṃcakānaḥ
translated: The wise one, the sage of the ṛṣis, seeking the favor of the noble songs, should praise you

original: te syāma ye raṇayanta somairenota tubhyaṃrathoḷa bhakṣaiḥ
analyzed: te syāma ye raṇayanta somaiḥ enā uta tubhyaṃrathoḷa bhakṣaiḥ
translated: May we be those who delight in you with Soma, and with food and drink, O you who are to be praised

original: imā brahmendra tubhyaṃ śaṃsi dā nṛbhyo nṛṇāṃ śūraśavaḥ🔽tebhirbhava sakraturyeṣu cākannuta trāyasvagṛṇata uta stīn🔽śrudhī havamindra śūra pṛthyā uta stavase venyasyārkaiḥ
analyzed: imā brahma indra tubhyam śaṃsi dāḥ nṛbhyaḥ nṛṇām śūra śavaḥ  tebhiḥ bhava sakratuḥ yeṣu cākan uta trāyasva a gṛṇataḥ uta stīn  śrudhi havam indra śūra pṛthyāḥ uta stavase venyasya arkaiḥ
translated: These prayers, O Indra, I offer to you, O hero among men, the strength of men🔽Be with those in whom you delight, O mighty one, and protect those who sing your praises and those who offer you oblations🔽Listen to the call, O hero Indra, from the earth, and to the praise of the one who deserves to be praised with the songs of the ṛṣis

original: ā yaste yoniṃ ghṛtavantamasvārūrmirna nimnairdravayanta vakvāḥ
analyzed: ā yaḥ te yonim ghṛtavantam asvāru ūrmiḥ na nimnaiḥ dravayanta vakvāḥ
translated: He who has come to your ghee-filled abode, the waves make him move like a boat in the low-lying areas

original: savitā yantraiḥ pṛthivīmaramṇādaskambhane savitā dyāmadṛṃhat
analyzed: savitā yantraiḥ pṛthivīm aramṇāt askambhane savitā dyām adṛṃhat
translated: Savitar set the earth in motion with his instruments, Savitar made the sky firm without support

original: aśvamivādhukṣad dhunimantarikṣamatūrtebaddhaṃ savitā samudram
analyzed: aśvam iva adhukṣat dhunim antarikṣam a tūrtebaddham savitā samudram
translated: He milked the sky as a horse, the ocean bound to the chariot, Savitar milked the ocean

original: yatrā samudra skabhito vyaunadapāṃ napāt savitā tasyaveda
analyzed: yatra samudraḥ skabhitaḥ vyaunat apām napāt savitā
translated: Where the ocean was scattered, the son of the waters, Savitar, he knows that

original: ato bhūrata ā utthitaṃ rajo 'to dyāvāpṛthivīaprathetām
analyzed: atas bhūratas ā utthitam rajaḥ tasmāt dyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām
translated: From here the dust arose, from here the sky and earth were spread out

original: paścedamanyadabhavad yajatramamartyasya bhuvanasya bhūnā
analyzed: paścā idam anyat abhavat yajatram amartyasya bhuvanasya bhūnā
translated: This other, worthy of sacrifice, has come to be, the being of the immortal one

original: suparṇo aṅga saviturgarutmān pūrvo jātaḥ sa u asyānudharma
analyzed: suparṇaḥ aṅga savituḥ garutmān pūrvaḥ jātaḥ saḥ u asya anudharma
translated: The eagle, O Angiras, the swift one of Savitar, born first, he is in accordance with his law

original: gāva iva grāmaṃ yūyudhirivāśvān vāśreva vatsaṃsumanā duhānā🔽patiriva jāyāmabhi no nyetu dhartādivaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ
analyzed: gāvaḥ iva grāmam yūyudhiḥ iva aśvān vāśrā iva vatsam sumanāḥ duhānā  patiḥ iva jāyām abhi naḥ nyetu dhartā ādivaḥ savitā viśva vāraḥ
