translated: Like cows to a village, like horses to a horse-race, like a cow lowing to her calf, full of love, I milk🔽Like a husband to his wife, may Savitar, the supporter of the sky, rich in all boons, come to us

original: hiraṇyastūpaḥ savitaryathā tvāṅgiraso juhve vāje asmin
analyzed: hiraṇya stūpaḥ savitar yathā tvā aṅgirasaḥ juhve vāje asmin
translated: O Savitar, like the golden-thighed Angiras in this sacrifice

original: evā tvārcannavase vandamānaḥ somasyevāṇśuṃ pratijāgarāham
analyzed: eva tvā arcan avase vandamānaḥ somasya iva aṇśum pratijāgara aham
translated: Thus, worshipping for help, I watch for you, like the rays of the moon

original: samiddhaścit samidhyase devebhyo havyavāhana
analyzed: samiddhaḥ cit samidhyase devebhyaḥ havya vāhana
translated: Though already kindled, you are kindled for the gods, O bearer of oblations

original: ādityairudrairvasubhirna ā gahi mṛḷīkāya na ā gahi
analyzed: ādityaiḥ udraiḥ vasubhiḥ naḥ ā gahi mṛḍīkāya naḥ ā gahi
translated: Come to us with the Adityas, Rudras, and Vasus, come to us for mercy

original: imaṃ yajñamidaṃ vaco jujuṣāṇa upāgahi
analyzed: imam yajñam idam vacaḥ jujuṣāṇaḥ upāgahi
translated: Accepting this sacrifice and this speech, come to us

original: martāsastvāsamidhāna havāmahe mṛḷīkāya havāmahe
analyzed: martāsaḥ tvā a samidhāna havāmahe mṛḷīkāya havāmahe
translated: We mortals call on thee, O all-impelling one, to be gracious to us, we call

original: tvāmu jātavedasaṃ viśvavāraṃ gṛṇe dhiyā
analyzed: tvāmu jātavedasam viśva vāram gṛṇe dhiyā
translated: Thee, O all-knowing one, I praise with song, O Agni,

original: agne devānā vaha naḥ priyavratān mṛḷīkāya priyavratān
analyzed: agne devān ā vaha naḥ priya vratān mṛḷīkāya priya vratān
translated: O Agni, bring the gods to us, whose vows are dear, to be gracious, whose vows are dear.

original: agnirdevo devānāmabhavat purohito 'gniṃ manuṣyā ṛṣayaḥsamīdhire
analyzed: agniḥ devaḥ devānām abhavat purohitaḥ gnim manuṣyāḥ ṛṣayaḥ samīdhire
translated: Agni became the priest of the gods, the Rishis kindled Agni, men

original: agniṃ maho dhanasātāvahaṃ huve mṛḷīkandhanasātaye
analyzed: agnim mahaḥ dhana sātau aham huve mṛḍīkan dhana sātaye
translated: I invoke Agni, the great one, for the winning of wealth, for the winning of grace.

original: agniratriṃ bharadvājaṃ gaviṣṭhiraṃ prāvan naḥ kaṇvantrasadasyumāhave
analyzed: agniḥ atrim bharadvājam gaviṣṭhiram prāvat naḥ kaṇva antra sadasyum āhave
translated: Agni brought Atri, Bharadvaja, Gavishthira, Kanva Trasadasyu to us in the battle.

original: agniṃ vasiṣṭho havate purohitomṛḷīkāya purohitaḥ
analyzed: agnim vasiṣṭhaḥ havate purohitaḥ umṛḷīkāya purohitaḥ
translated: Vasishtha invokes Agni, the priest, for grace, the priest.

original: śraddhayāgniḥ samidhyate śraddhaya huyate haviḥ
analyzed: śraddhayā agniḥ samidhyate śraddhayā huyate haviḥ
translated: Agni is kindled with faith, with faith the oblation is offered.

original: śraddhāṃ bhagasya mūrdhani vacasā vedayamasi
analyzed: śraddhām bhagasya mūrdhani vacasā vedayamasi
translated: On the head of Bhaga thou announcest faith with speech.

original: priyaṃ śraddhe dadataḥ priyaṃ śraddte didāsataḥ
analyzed: priyam śraddhe dadataḥ priyam śraddte didāsataḥ
translated: Faith, O faithful one, to the giver, faith to the giver, O faithful one.

original: priyambhojeṣu yajvasvidaṃ ma uditaṃ kṛdhi
analyzed: priyambhojeṣu yajvasu idam me uditam kṛdhi
translated: Make this my utterance dear among the sacrificers who enjoy the oblations.

original: yathā deva asureṣu śraddhāmugreṣu cakrire
analyzed: yathā deva asureṣu śraddhāmugreṣu cakrire
translated: As the gods made faith among the Asuras, among the fierce ones,

original: evambhojeṣu yajvasvasmākamuditaṃ kṛdhi
analyzed: evam bhojeṣu yajvasu asmākam uditam kṛdhi
translated: So make this my utterance dear among the sacrificers who enjoy the oblations.

original: śraddhāṃ devā yajamānā vāyugopā upāsate
analyzed: śraddhām devāḥ yajamānāḥ vāyu gopāḥ upāsate
translated: The gods, the sacrificers, guarded by Vayu, attend on faith.

original: śraddhāṃhṛdayyayākūtyā śraddhayā vindate vasu🔽śraddhāṃ prātai havāmahe śraddhāṃ madhyandinaṃ pari
analyzed: śraddhāṃhṛdayyayā ākūtyā śraddhayā vindate vasu  śraddhām prātai havāmahe śraddhām madhyandinam pari
translated: By faith, the heart's resolve, by faith one wins wealth.🔽We call on faith at early morn, on faith at noon,

original: śraddhāṃ sūryasya nimruci śraddhe śrad dhāpayeha naḥ
analyzed: śraddhām sūryasya nimruci śraddhe śrat dhāpaya iha naḥ
translated: On faith at sunset, O Faith, give us faith.

original: śāsa itthā mahānasyamitrakhādo adbhutaḥ
analyzed: śāsaḥ itthā mahānasi amitra khādaḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: Here is the great wondrous one, the foe-destroyer,

original: na yasyahanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana
analyzed: na yasya hanyate sakhā na jīyate kadā cana
translated: Whose friend is never slain, who never is subdued.

original: svastida viśas patirvṛtrahā vimṛdho vaśī
analyzed: svasti da viśaḥ patiḥ vṛtra hā vimṛdhaḥ vaśī
translated: The giver of welfare, the lord of the people, the Vrtra-slayer, the controller, the foe-destroyer,

original: vṛṣendraḥpura etu naḥ somapa abhayaṃkaraḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā indraḥ puras etu naḥ soma pa abhayaṃkaraḥ
translated: The bull, the lord of Indra, may he come to us, the one who brings safety.

original: vi rakṣo vi mṛdho jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja🔽vi manyumindra vṛtrahannamitrasyābhidasataḥ
analyzed: vi rakṣaḥ vi mṛdhaḥ jahi vi vṛtrasya hanū ruja  vi manyum indra vṛtrahan amitrasya abhidasataḥ
translated: Destroy the Raksases, destroy the enemies, crush the jaws of Vrtra,🔽Crush the anger, O Indra, O Vrtra-slayer, of the one who is hostile to us.

original: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yacha pṛtanyataḥ
analyzed: vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ
translated: Destroy our enemies, O Indra, cast down those who are hostile to us,

original: yo asmānabhidāsatyadharaṃ gamayā tamaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ asmān abhidāsati adharam gamaya tamaḥ
translated: Send him who injures us to the lowest darkness.

original: apendra dviṣato mano 'pa jijyāsato vadham
analyzed: apa indra dviṣataḥ mano pa jijyāsataḥ vadham
translated: Drive away, O Indra, the hatred of the foe, drive away the weapon of the one who would slay us,

original: vi manyoḥśarma yacha varīyo yavayā vadham
analyzed: vi manyoḥśarma yaccha varīyaḥ yavaya vadham
translated: Give us protection from the anger of the foe, drive away the more powerful weapon.

original: īṅkhayantīrapasyuva indraṃ jātamupāsate
analyzed: īṅkhayantīḥ apasyuvaḥ indram jātam upāsate
translated: The moving ones, the watchful ones, attend on Indra when he is born,

original: bhejānasaḥsuvīryam🔽tvamindra balādadhi sahaso jāta ojasaḥ
analyzed: bhejānasaḥ su vīryam  tvam indra balāt adhi sahasaḥ jātaḥ ojasaḥ
translated: The kinsmen for great heroism.🔽Thou, O Indra, from strength, from power, from might, art born,

original: tvaṃ vṛṣanvṛṣedasi
analyzed: tvam vṛṣan vṛṣā idam asi
translated: Thou art the bull, O bull.

original: tvamindrāsi vṛtrahā vyantarikṣamatiraḥ
analyzed: tvam indra asi vṛtra hā vi antarikṣam atiraḥ
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the Vr̥itra-slayer: thou hast filled full the region of the air.

original: ud dyāmastabhnā ojasā🔽tvamindra sajoṣasamarkaṃ bibharṣi bāhvoḥ🔽vajraṃśiśāna ojasā
analyzed: ud dyām astabhnāḥ ojasā  tvam indra sajoṣasam arkam bibharṣi bāhvoḥ  vajram śiśānaḥ ojasā
translated: Thou with thy strength hast propped the heaven on high.🔽Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the Sun, thy friend, and the thunder,🔽And whettedst the bolt with might.

original: tvamindrābhibhūrasi viśvā jātānyojasā
analyzed: tvam indra abhibhūḥ asi viśvā jātāni ojasā
translated: Thou, Indra, art the conqueror: by might thou hast subdued all creatures.

original: sa viśvābhuva ābhavaḥ
analyzed: sa viśvābhuvaḥ ābhavaḥ
translated: Thou art the Lord of all that is and is to be.

original: soma ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtameka upāsate
analyzed: somaḥ ekebhyaḥ pavate ghṛtam eke upāsate
translated: To some the Soma flows: some worship with the sacred oil.

original: yebhyo madhupradhāvati tāṃścidevāpi gachatāt
analyzed: yebhyaḥ madhu pradhāvati tān cit eva api gachatāt
translated: To those to whom the meath is running forth go thou, O Yarna, even to them.

original: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāstapasā ye svaryayuḥ
analyzed: tapasā ye anādhṛṣyāḥ tapasā ye svar yayuḥ
translated: Those whom no one may violate by penance, those who have won heaven by penance,

original: tapo yecakrire mahastāṃścidevāpi gachatāt
analyzed: tapaḥ ye cakrire mahaḥ tān cit eva api gacchatāt
translated: Those who have wrought great penance, go thou even to them, O Yarna.

original: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāso ye tanūtyajaḥ
analyzed: ye yudhyante pradhaneṣu śūrāsaḥ ye tanūtyajaḥ
translated: Those heroes who in battles fight, those who have sacrificed their lives,

original: ye vāsahasradakṣiṇāstāṃścidevāpi gachatāt
analyzed: ye vā a sahasra dakṣiṇāḥ tān cit eva api gacchatāt
translated: Those who have given a thousand gifts, go thou, O Yarna, even to them.

original: ye cit pūrva ṛtasāpa ṛtāvāna ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
analyzed: ye cit pūrve ṛtasāpaḥ ṛtāvānaḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Those who in ancient time were righteous, righteous, and strengthened Law,

original: pitṝn tapasvatoyama tāṃścidevāpi gachatāt
analyzed: pitṝn tapasvataḥ yama tān cit eva api gacchatāt
translated: The Fathers who are purified by penance, go thou, O Yarna, even to them.

original: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayo ye gopāyanti sūryam
analyzed: sahasraṇīthāḥ kavayaḥ ye gopāyanti sūryam
translated: The sages who with thousand-fold knowledge guard the Sun,

original: ṛṣīntapasvato yama tapojānapi gachatāt
analyzed: ṛṣīn tapasvataḥ yama tapaḥ jān api gacchatāt
translated: The Rishis who are purified by penance, go thou, O Yarna, even to them.

original: arāyi kāṇe vikaṭe giriṃ gacha sadānve
analyzed: arāyi kāṇe vikaṭe girim gacha sadānve
translated: O thou of evil deeds, O thou of crooked sight, go to the mountain, O thou who hast the Dânu spirits.

original: śirimbiṭhasyasatvabhistebhiṣ ṭvā cātayāmasi
analyzed: śirimbiṭhasya satvabhiḥ tebhiḥ tvā cātayāmasi
translated: With the true ones of Sirim-bhid we drive thee away.

original: catto itaścattāmutaḥ sarvā bhrūṇānyāruṣī
analyzed: cattā u itas cattā amutas sarvā bhrūṇāni āruṣī
translated: Smitten from here and smitten from yonder, all the foetuses are destroyed by her.

original: arāyyaṃ brahmaṇas pate tīkṣṇaśṛṇgodṛṣannihi
analyzed: arāyyam brahmaṇaḥ pate
translated: O Brahmanaspati, the wicked one, with a sharp-horned stone, strike him down.

original: ado yad dāru plavate sindhoḥ pāre apūruṣam
analyzed: adaḥ yat dāru plavate sindhoḥ pāre apūruṣam
translated: When that log floats on the other side of the river, without a man,

original: tadārabhasva durhaṇo tena gacha parastaram
analyzed: tat ārabhasva durhaṇo tena gacha parastaram
translated: Seize it, O evil one! Go with it to a place farther away!

original: yad dha prācīrajagantoro maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ
analyzed: yat ha prācīrajagantā uraḥ maṇḍūradhāṇikīḥ
translated: Those who have gone to the east, to the far-stretching, fierce-weaponed ones,

original: hatāindrasya śatravaḥ sarve budbudayāśavaḥ
analyzed: hatāḥ aindrasya śatravaḥ sarve budbudayāśavaḥ
translated: The enemies of Indra are all destroyed, as swift as bubbles.

original: parīme gāmaneṣata paryagnimahṛṣata
analyzed: pari ime gām aneṣata pari agnim ahṛṣata
translated: They have surrounded the cow, they have surrounded the fire,

original: deveṣvakrataśravaḥ ka imānā dadharṣati
analyzed: deveṣu akrata śravaḥ kaḥ imānā dadharṣati
translated: They have made fame among the gods. Who will dare to challenge them?

original: agniṃ hinvantu no dhiyaḥ saptimāśumivājiṣu
analyzed: agnim hinvantu naḥ dhiyaḥ saptim āśum iva ājiṣu
translated: Let our thoughts impel Agni, as if he were a swift horse in races.

original: tena jeṣmadhanaṃdhanam
analyzed: tena jeṣmadhanaṃdhanam
translated: By him may we win wealth upon wealth.

original: yayā gā ākarāmahe senayāgne tavotyā
analyzed: yayā gāḥ ākarāmahe senayā agne tava ūtyā
translated: With that army, O Agni, with which we shall win cows,

original: tāṃ no hinvamaghattaye
analyzed: tām naḥ hinvam aghattaye
translated: Impel it for us to gain wealth.

original: āgne sthūraṃ rayiṃ bhara pṛthuṃ gomantamaśvinam
analyzed: ā agne sthūram rayim bhara pṛthum gomantam aśvinam
translated: O Agni, bring us great wealth, vast, full of cattle and horses,

original: aṃdhikhaṃ vartayā paṇim
analyzed: aṃdhi kham vartaya paṇim
translated: And the treasure of the Dāsas.

original: agne nakṣatramajaramā sūryaṃ rohayo divi
analyzed: agne nakṣatram ajaram ā sūryam rohayaḥ divi
translated: O Agni, thou settest the imperishable star, the sun, in the sky.

original: dadhajjyotirjanebhyaḥ
analyzed: dadhat jyotiḥ janebhyaḥ
translated: Bestowing light upon the people.

original: agne keturviśāmasi preṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭha upasthasat
analyzed: agne ketuḥ viśāmasi preṣṭhaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ upastha sad
translated: O Agni, thou art the ensign of the people, most dear, best, sitting in the lap,

original: bodhā stotre vayo dadhat
analyzed: bodha stotre vayaḥ dadhat
translated: Inspiring, bestowing strength in the praise.

original: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraśca viśve ca devāḥ
analyzed: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ
translated: These worlds we will establish, Indra and all the gods,

original: yajñaṃ ca nastanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityairindraḥ sahacīkḷipāti
analyzed: yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ sahacīkḷipāti
translated: And may Indra, together with the Adityas, arrange our sacrifice, our body, and our offspring.

original: ādityairindraḥ sagaṇo marudbhirasmākaṃ bhūtvavitātanūnām
analyzed: ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmākam
translated: May Indra, together with the Maruts and the Adityas, be our protector,

original: hatvāya devā asurān yadāyan devā devatvamabhirakṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: hatvāya devāḥ asurān yadā āyan devāḥ deva tvam abhirakṣamāṇāḥ
translated: When the gods went to slay the Asuras, the gods, guarding their own divinity,

original: pratyañcamarkamanayañchacībhirādit svadhāmiṣirāmparyapaśyan
analyzed: pratyañcam arkam anayan śacībhiḥ ādit svadhām iṣirām paryapaśyan
translated: Led the sun back with their powers, and saw their own radiant abode.

original: sūryo no divas pātu vāto antarikṣāt
analyzed: sūryaḥ naḥ divaḥ pātu vātaḥ antarikṣāt
translated: May Surya protect us from the sky, Vayu from the atmosphere,

original: agnirnaḥpārthivebhyaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ naḥ pārthivebhyaḥ
translated: And Agni from the earthly regions.

original: joṣā savitaryasya te haraḥ śataṃ savānarhati
analyzed: joṣā savitar yasya te haraḥ śatam savān arhati
translated: O Savitar, whose arrow deserves a hundred sacrifices, be pleased with us.

original: pāhino didyutaḥ patantyāḥ
analyzed: pāhinaḥ didyutaḥ patantyāḥ
translated: Protect us from the falling lightning.

original: cakṣurno devaḥ savitā cakṣurna uta parvataḥ🔽cakṣurdhātā dadhātu naḥ
analyzed: cakṣuḥ naḥ devaḥ savitā cakṣuḥ naḥ uta parvataḥ  cakṣuḥ dhātā dadhātu naḥ
translated: May the god Savitar, and may the mountain,🔽May the creator grant us sight.

original: cakṣurno dhehi cakṣuṣe cakṣurvikhyai tanūbhyaḥ
analyzed: cakṣuḥ naḥ dhehi cakṣuṣe cakṣuḥ vikhyai tanūbhyaḥ
translated: Grant us sight, O eye, sight for our bodies,

original: saṃcedaṃ vi ca paśyema
analyzed: saṃca idam vi ca paśyema
translated: That we may see this world together and apart.

original: susandṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ prati paśyema sūrya
analyzed: su sandṛśam tvā vayam prati paśyema sūrya
translated: May we look upon you, O Surya, as one to be well seen.

original: vi paśyemanṛcakṣasaḥ
analyzed: vi paśyema anṛcakṣasaḥ
translated: May we see with the eye of men.

original: udasau sūryo agādudayaṃ māmako bhagaḥ
analyzed: ud asau sūryaḥ agāt udayam māmakaḥ bhagaḥ
translated: The sun has gone up yonder, my good fortune has risen up.

original: ahaṃ tadvidvalā patimabhyasākṣi viṣāsahiḥ
analyzed: aham tad vidvalā patim abhyasākṣi viṣāsahiḥ
translated: I, knowing that, have overcome my husband, conquering with poison.

original: ahaṃ keturahaṃ mūrdhāhamugrā vivācanī
analyzed: aham ketuḥ aham mūrdhā aham ugrā vivācanī
translated: I am the banner, I am the head, I am the fierce one, the speaker.

original: mamedanukratuṃ patiḥ sehānāyā upācaret
analyzed: mama id anukratum patiḥ sehānāyāḥ upācaret
translated: May my husband serve this sacrifice of mine, coming with offerings.

original: mama putrāḥ śatruhaṇo 'tho me duhitā virāṭ
analyzed: mama putrāḥ śatru haṇaḥ me duhitā virāj
translated: My sons are the slayers of enemies, and my daughter is the powerful one.

original: utāhamasmi saṃjayā patyau me śloka uttamaḥ
analyzed: uta aham asmi saṃjayā patyau me ślokaḥ uttamaḥ
translated: And I am the one who conquers, and my husband is the best of speakers.

original: yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ
analyzed: yena indraḥ haviṣā kṛtvī abhavat dyumnī uttamaḥ
translated: By which offering Indra became the most glorious one,

original: idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnā kilābhuvam🔽asapatnā sapatnaghnī jayantyabhibhūvarī
analyzed: idam tat akri devāḥ asapatnā kila abhuvam  asapatnā sapatna ghnī jayantī abhibhūvarī
translated: The gods have done this. I have become free from enemies.🔽Free from enemies, the destroyer of enemies, victorious, the all-conquering one,

original: āvṛkṣamanyāsāṃ varco rādho astheyasāmiva
analyzed: āvṛkṣam anyāsām varcaḥ rādhaḥ astheyasām iva
translated: The splendor of others is like a tree cut down, and the wealth of the wealthy.

original: samajaiṣamimā ahaṃ sapatnīrabhibhūvarī
analyzed: samajaiṣam imāḥ aham sapatnīḥ abhibhūvarī
translated: I have conquered these co-wives, the all-conquering one.

original: yathāhamasya vīrasya virājāni janasya ca
analyzed: yathā aham asya vīrasya virājāni janasya ca
translated: So that I may rule over this hero and the people,

original: tīvrasyābhivayaso asya pāhi sarvarathā vi harī iha muñca
analyzed: tīvrasya abhivayasaḥ asya pāhi sarva rathā vi harī iha muñca
translated: Of this powerful one, protect all the chariots, release the two bay horses here.

original: indra mā tvā yajamānāso anye ni rīraman tubhyamimesutāsaḥ
analyzed: indra mā tvā yajamānāsaḥ anye ni rīraman tubhyam ime sutāsaḥ
translated: O Indra, may other sacrificers not delight you. These libations are for you.

original: tubhyaṃ sutāstubhyamu sotvāsastvāṃ giraḥ śvātryāā hvayanti🔽indredamadya savanaṃ juṣāṇo viśvasyavidvāniha pāhi somam
analyzed: tubhyam sutāḥ tubhyam u sotvāsaḥ tvām giraḥ śvātryāā hvayanti  indra idam adya savanam juṣāṇaḥ viśvasya vidvān iha pāhi somam
translated: The libations are for you, the invocations are for you. The verses call you, the swift one.🔽O Indra, delighting in this libation today, knowing all, drink the Soma here.

original: ya uśatā manasā somamasmai sarvahṛdā devakāmaḥ sunoti
analyzed: yaḥ uśatā manasā somam asmai sarva hṛdā deva kāmaḥ sunoti
translated: He who with a longing mind, with his whole heart, longing for the gods, presses Soma for him,

original: na gā indrastasya parā dadāti praśastamiccārumasmaikṛṇoti
analyzed: na gāḥ indraḥ tasya parā dadāti praśastam id cārum asmai kṛṇoti
translated: Indra does not give away his cows to him, he makes for him what is praised and lovely.

original: anuspaṣṭo bhavatyeṣo asya yo asmai revān na sunoti somam
analyzed: anuspaṣṭaḥ bhavati eṣaḥ asya yaḥ asmai revān na sunoti somam
translated: He becomes despised by him, he who, being rich, does not press out the Soma for him.

original: niraratnau maghavā taṃ dadhāti brahmadviṣo hantyanānudiṣṭaḥ
analyzed: niraratnau maghavā tam dadhāti brahma dviṣaḥ hanti anānudiṣṭaḥ
translated: Maghavan places him in a place without jewels, he slays the Brahman-haters without being asked.

original: aśvāyanto gavyanto vājayanto havāmahe tvopagantavā u
analyzed: aśvāyantaḥ gavyantaḥ vājayantaḥ havāmahe tvā upagantavai u
translated: Seeking horses, seeking cattle, seeking strength, we call on you to come to us.

original: ābhūṣantaste sumatau navāyāṃ vayamindra tvā śunaṃhuvema
analyzed: ābhūṣantaḥ te sumatau navāyām vayam indra tvā śunaṃhuvema
translated: Seeking your new favor, O Indra, we would serve you well, O Shunahpu.

original: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kamajñātayakṣmādutarājayakṣmāt
analyzed: muñcāmi tvā haviṣā jīvanāya kam ajñāta yakṣmāt uta rājayakṣmāt
translated: I release you by sacrifice for life, from consumption known and unknown.

original: grāhirjagrāha yadi vaitadenaṃ tasyāindrāgnī pra mumuktamenam
analyzed: grāhiḥ jagrāha yadi vā etat enam tasya aindra agnī pra mumuktam enam
translated: If the seizing one has seized him, may Indra and Agni set him free.

original: yadi kṣitāyuryadi vā pareto yadi mṛtyorantikaṃ nītaeva🔽tamā harāmi nirṛterupasthādaspārṣamenaṃśataśāradāya
analyzed: yadi kṣita āyuḥ yadi vā paretaḥ yadi mṛtyoḥ antikam nītaḥ eva  tam ā harāmi nirṛteḥ upasthāt aspārṣam enam śata śāradāya
translated: If he has lived his life or gone beyond, or been led into the presence of death,🔽I lead him away from the presence of misfortune, I touch him for a life of a hundred autumns.

original: sahasrākṣeṇa śataśāradena śatāyuṣā haviṣāhārṣamenam
analyzed: sahasra akṣeṇa śata śāradena śata āyuṣā haviṣā ahārṣam enam
translated: With a thousand-eyed one, a hundred-autumn one, with a life-giving oblation, I have brought him.

original: śataṃ yathemaṃ śarado nayātīndro viśvasyaduritasya pāram
analyzed: śatam yathā imam śaradaḥ nayāti indraḥ viśvasya duritasya pāram
translated: May Indra lead him a hundred autumns beyond all misfortune.

original: śataṃ jīva śarado vardhamānaḥ śataṃ hemantāñchatamuvasantān
analyzed: śatam jīva śaradaḥ vardhamānaḥ śatam hemantān śatam uvasantān
translated: Live a hundred autumns, prospering, a hundred winters, a hundred summers,

original: śatamindrāgnī savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śatāyuṣāhaviṣemaṃ punarduḥ
analyzed: śatam indra agnī savitā bṛhaspatiḥ śata āyuṣā haviṣā imam punar duḥ
translated: Indra, Agni, Savitar, Brihaspati, a hundredfold life and oblation, give him back a hundredfold.

original: āhārṣaṃ tvāvidaṃ tvā punarāgāḥ punarnava
analyzed: āhārṣam tvā avidam tvā punar āgāḥ punarnava
translated: I have brought you back, I have found you, you have come back again, renewed.

original: sarvāṅgasarvaṃ te cakṣuḥ sarvamāyuśca te 'vidam
analyzed: sarva aṅga sarvam te cakṣuḥ sarvam āyuḥ ca te vidam
translated: I have found all your eye, all your life.

original: brahmaṇāgniḥ saṃvidāno rakṣohā bādhatāmitaḥ🔽amīvāyaste garbhaṃ durṇāmā yonimāśaye
analyzed: brahmaṇā agniḥ saṃvidānaḥ rakṣaḥ hā bādhatām itas  amīvā yaste garbham durṇāmā yonim āśaye
translated: May Agni, in agreement with the Brahman, the slayer of foes, drive away from here🔽The evil spirit that has laid hold of your womb, the ill-omened one that has settled in your womb.

original: yaste garbhamamīvā durṇāmā yonimāśaye
analyzed: yaḥ te garbham amīvāḥ durṇāmā yonim āśaye
translated: The evil spirit that has laid hold of your womb, the ill-omened one that has settled in your womb,

original: agniṣ ṭambrahmaṇā saha niṣ kravyādamanīnaśat🔽yaste hanti patayantaṃ niṣatsnuṃ yaḥ sarīsṛpam
analyzed: agniḥ tam brahmaṇā saha niḥ kravyādam anīnaśat  yaḥ te hanti patayantam niṣatsnum yaḥ sarīsṛpam
translated: Agni, in agreement with the Brahman, has destroyed the flesh-devouring one.🔽He who strikes you as you move about, as you sit, as you crawl,

original: jātaṃyaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi
analyzed: jātaṃyaḥ te jighāṃsati tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: He who would slay you when born, him we drive away from you.

original: yasta ūrū viharatyantarā dampatī śaye🔽yoniṃ yoantarāreḷi tamito nāśayāmasi🔽yastvā bhrātā patirbhūtvā jāro bhūtvā nipadyate
analyzed: yaḥ te ūrū viharati antarā dampatī śaye  yonim tam itas nāśayāmasi  yaḥ tvā bhrātā patiḥ bhūtvā jāraḥ bhūtvā nipadyate
translated: He who lies between the two, the husband and wife, who stretches your thighs,🔽Who breaks into your womb, him we drive away from you.🔽He who, becoming your brother, becoming your husband, settles down,

original: prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi
analyzed: prajām yaḥ te jighāṃsati tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: He who would slay your offspring, him we drive away from you.

original: yastvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate
analyzed: yaḥ tvā svapnena tamasā mohayitvā nipadyate
translated: He who, having bewildered you with sleep and darkness, settles down,

original: prajāṃ yaste jighāṃsati tamito nāśayāmasi
analyzed: prajām yaḥ te jighāṃsati tam itas nāśayāmasi
translated: He who would slay your offspring, him we drive away from you.

original: akṣībhyāṃ te nāsikābhyāṃ karṇābhyāṃ chubukādadhi
analyzed: akṣībhyām te nāsikābhyām karṇābhyām chubukāt adhi
translated: From your eyes, from your nostrils, from your ears, from the top of your head,

original: yakṣmaṃ śīrṣaṇyaṃ mastiṣkājjihvāyā vi vṛhāmi te
analyzed: yakṣmam śīrṣaṇyam mastiṣkāt jihvāyāḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: I drive away from thee, O man, consumption from the head, from the brain, from the tongue.

original: grīvābhyasta uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyo anūkyāt
analyzed: grīvābhyaḥ taḥ uṣṇihābhyaḥ kīkasābhyaḥ anūkyāt
translated: From the neck, from the shoulders, from the ribs, from the back-bone,

original: yakṣmaṃ doṣaṇyamaṃsābhyāṃ bāhubhyāṃ vi vṛhāmi te
analyzed: yakṣmam doṣaṇyam aṃsābhyām bāhubhyām vi vṛhāmi te
translated: I drive away from thee, O man, consumption from the shoulders, from the arms.

original: āntrebhyaste gudābhyo vaniṣṭhorhṛdayādadhi
analyzed: āntrebhyaḥ te gudābhyaḥ vaniṣṭhoḥ hṛdayāt adhi
translated: From the entrails, from the bowels, from the rectum, from the heart,

original: yakṣmammatasnābhyāṃ yaknaḥ plāśibhyo vi vṛhāmi te🔽ūrubhyāṃ te aṣṭhīvadbhyāṃ pārṣṇibhyāṃ prapadābhyām
analyzed: yakṣmammatasnābhyām yaknaḥ plāśibhyaḥ vi vṛhāmi te  ūrubhyām te aṣṭhīvadbhyām pārṣṇibhyām prapadābhyām
translated: I drive away from thee, O man, consumption from the lungs, from the liver, from the spleen.🔽From the thighs, from the knee-bones, from the heels, from the fore-feet,

original: yakṣmaṃ śroṇibhyāṃ bhāsadād bhaṃsaso vi vṛhāmi te
analyzed: yakṣmam śroṇibhyām bhāsadāt bhaṃsasaḥ vi vṛhāmi te
translated: I drive away from thee, O man, consumption from the hips, from the buttocks, from the testicles.

original: mehanād vanaṃkaraṇāl lomabhyaste nakhebhyaḥ
analyzed: mehanāt vanaṃkaraṇāt lomabhyaḥ te nakhebhyaḥ
translated: From the bladder, from the penis, from the hair, from the nails,

original: yakṣmaṃsarvasmādātmanastamidaṃ vi vṛhāmi te
analyzed: yakṣman sarvasmāt ātmanaḥ tam idam vi vṛhāmi te
translated: I drive away from thee, O man, consumption from the whole body.

original: aṅgādaṅgāl lomnolomno jātaṃ parvaṇiparvaṇi
analyzed: aṅgāt aṅgāt lomnaḥ lomnaḥ jātam parvaṇi parvaṇi
translated: From limb to limb, from hair to hair, from joint to joint,

original: yakṣmaṃsarvasmādātmanastamidaṃ vi vṛhāmi te
analyzed: yakṣman sarvasmāt ātmanaḥ tam idam vi vṛhāmi te
translated: I drive away from thee, O man, consumption from the whole body.

original: apehi manasas pate 'pa krāma paraścara
analyzed: apehi manasaḥ pate pa krāma paraścara
translated: Go away, O lord of the mind, go away, go away to a distance.

original: paro nirṛtyā ācakṣva bahudhā jīvato manaḥ
analyzed: paras nirṛtyāḥ ācakṣva bahudhā jīvataḥ manaḥ
translated: To Nirrti announce the mind of the living in many places.

original: bhadraṃ vai varaṃ vṛṇate bhadraṃ yuñjanti dakṣiṇam
analyzed: bhadram vai varam vṛṇate bhadram yuñjanti dakṣiṇam
translated: They choose a good boon, they yoke the good to the right.

original: bhadraṃ vaivasvate cakṣurbahutrā jīvato manaḥ
analyzed: bhadram vaivasvate cakṣuḥ bahutrā jīvataḥ manaḥ
translated: The good eye of Vivasvat, the mind of the living in many places.

original: yadāśasā niḥśasābhiśasopārima jāgrato yat svapantaḥ
analyzed: yat āśasā niḥśasā abhiśasā upārima jāgrataḥ yat svapantaḥ
translated: When we have done evil, whether awake or sleeping, with thought, word, or deed,

original: agnirviśvānyapa duṣkṛtānyajuṣṭānyāre asmaddadhātu
analyzed: agniḥ viśvāni apa duṣkṛtāni a juṣṭāni āre asmat dadhātu
translated: May Agni, the purifier, remove all those evil deeds from us.

original: yadindra brahmaṇas pate 'bhidrohaṃ carāmasi🔽pracetā naāṅgiraso dviṣatāṃ pātyaṃhasaḥ
analyzed: yat indra brahmaṇas pate bhidroham carāmasi  pracetāḥ na āṅgirasaḥ dviṣatām pāti aṃhasaḥ
translated: If, O Indra, O Lord of prayer, we have done any injury,🔽May Pracetas, the son of Angiras, protect us from the sin of the haters.

original: ajaiṣmādyāsanāma cābhūmānāgaso vayam
analyzed: ajaiṣma adya asanāma ca abhūma anāgasaḥ vayam
translated: We have conquered and become free from sin. We have become free from guilt.

original: jāgratsvapnaḥsaṃkalpaḥ pāpo yaṃ dviṣmastaṃ sa ṛchatu yo no dveṣṭitam ṛchatu
analyzed: jāgrat svapnaḥ saṃkalpaḥ pāpaḥ yam dviṣmaḥ tam saḥ ṛchatu yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭitam ṛchatu
translated: May the evil, whether in the waking state, in dreams, or in intentions, which we hate, strike him who hates us.

original: devāḥ kapota iṣito yadichan dūto nirṛtyā idamājagāma
analyzed: devāḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ yat icchan dūtaḥ nirṛtyāḥ idam ājagāma
translated: If the dove, sent by the gods, has come here as a messenger of destruction,

original: tasmā arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtiṃ śaṃ no astu dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade
analyzed: tasmai arcāma kṛṇavāma niṣkṛtim śam naḥ astu dvipadā īśam catuṣpade
translated: To him we offer praise and make atonement. May he be auspicious to our bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: śivaḥ kapota iṣito no astvanāgā devāḥ śakuno gṛheṣu
analyzed: śivaḥ kapotaḥ iṣitaḥ naḥ astu anāgāḥ devāḥ śakunaḥ gṛheṣu
translated: May the dove, sent by us, be auspicious to us. O gods, may the bird be harmless in our houses.

original: agnirhi vipro juṣatāṃ havirnaḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī novṛṇaktu
analyzed: agniḥ hi vipraḥ juṣatām haviḥ naḥ pari hetiḥ pakṣiṇī naḥ vṛṇaktu
translated: For Agni, the priest, delights in our offering. May the missile, flying like a bird, spare us.

original: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhātyasmānāṣṭryāṃ padaṃ kṛṇuteagnidhāne
analyzed: hetiḥ pakṣiṇī na dabhāti asmān āṣṭryām padam kṛṇute agnidhāne
translated: The missile, flying like a bird, does not harm us. It makes its abode in the fire-pan, in the place of the eight-footed one.

original: śaṃ no gobhyaśca puruṣebhyaścāstu mā nohiṃsīdiha devāḥ kapotaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ gobhyaḥ ca puruṣebhyaḥ ca astu mā na uhiṃsīt iha devāḥ kapotaḥ
translated: May it be auspicious to our cattle and men. May the dove, O gods, not injure us here.

original: yadulūko vadati moghametad yat kapotaḥ padamagnaukṛṇoti
analyzed: yat ulūkaḥ vadati mogham etat yat kapotaḥ padam agnaukṛṇoti
translated: What the owl says is vain, what the dove does is useless in the fire

original: yasya dūtaḥ prahita eṣa etat tasmai yamāya namoastu mrityave🔽ṛcā kapotaṃ nudata praṇodamiṣaṃ madantaḥ pari gāṃnayadhvam
analyzed: yasya dūtaḥ prahitaḥ eṣaḥ etat tasmai yamāya namaḥ astu mrityave  ṛcā kapotam nudata praṇodam iṣam madantaḥ pari gāṃnayadhvam
translated: To him who has sent this as his messenger, to that Yama, let homage be paid to Death🔽With a verse drive away the dove, the one who is to be driven away, rejoicing in food, lead the cow around

original: saṃyopayanto duritāni viśvā hitvā na ūrjaṃ prapatāt patiṣthaḥ🔽ṛṣabhaṃ mā samānānāṃ sapatnānāṃ viṣāsahim🔽hantāraṃśatrūṇāṃ kṛdhi virājaṃ gopatiṃ gavām
analyzed: saṃyopayantaḥ duritāni viśvā hitvā naḥ ūrjam prapatāt patiṣthaḥ  ṛṣabham mā samānānām sapatnānām viṣāsahim  hantāram śatrūṇām kṛdhi virājam go patim gavām
translated: Binding together all evils, having left, may he fly away to the most excellent food🔽I am the bull among my equals, the one who conquers enemies, the one who endures poison🔽Make me the killer of foes, the lord of cattle, the one who shines

original: ahamasmi sapatnahendra ivāriṣṭo akṣataḥ
analyzed: aham asmi sapatna hā indraḥ iva ariṣṭaḥ akṣataḥ
translated: I am the one who conquers enemies, like Indra, uninjured, unwounded

original: adhaḥ sapatnāme padorime sarve abhiṣṭhitāḥ
analyzed: adhas padoḥ ime sarve abhiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: Beneath my foot are all these enemies, trodden down

original: atraiva vo 'pi nahyāmyubhe ārtnī iva jyayā
analyzed: atra eva vaḥ pi nahyāmi ubhe ārtnī iva jyayā
translated: Right here I bind you, as if with two bowstrings

original: vācas pateni ṣedhemān yathā madadharaṃ vadān
analyzed: vācaḥ pateni sedha imān yathā mad adharam vadān
translated: O lord of speech, restrain these so that they may speak to me with respect

original: abhibhūrahamāgamaṃ viśvakarmeṇa dhāmnā🔽ā vaścittamā vo vratamā vo 'haṃ samitiṃ dade
analyzed: abhibhūḥ aham āgamam viśvakarmeṇa dhāmnā  ā vaḥ cittamāḥ vaḥ vratamāḥ vaḥ ham samitim dade
translated: I have come as the conqueror, with the abode of the all-creator🔽I have given you the vow, I have given you the assembly, I have given you the gathering🔽Having taken away your well-being and security, may I be the best

original: yogakṣemaṃ va ādāyāhaṃ bhūyāsamuttama ā vo mūrdhānamakramīm
analyzed: yogakṣemam vaḥ ādāya aham bhūyāsam uttamaḥ ā vaḥ mūrdhānam akramīm
translated: I have stepped on your head

original: adhaspadān ma ud vadata maṇḍūkā ivodakānmaṇḍūkā udakādiva
analyzed: adhaspadān me ud vadata maṇḍūkāḥ iva udakāt maṇḍūkāḥ udakāt iva
translated: Speak to me from below, like frogs from the water, like frogs from the water

original: tubhyedamindra pari ṣicyate madhu tvaṃ sutasya kalaśasyarājasi
analyzed: tubhya idam indra pari sicyate madhu tvam sutasya kalaśasya rājasi
translated: This mead is poured forth for thee, O Indra; thou art the king of the vat of Soma juice.

original: tvaṃ rayiṃ puruvīrāmu nas kṛdhi tvaṃ tapaḥparitapyājayaḥ svaḥ
analyzed: tvam rayim puru vīrā āmu naḥ kṛdhi tvam tapaḥ paritapya ajayaḥ svar
translated: Grant us wealth with many heroes; thou hast conquered by thy burning heat the light (of heaven).

original: svarjitaṃ mahi mandānamandhaso havāmahe pari śakraṃsutānupa
analyzed: svar jitam mahi mandānam andhasaḥ havāmahe pari śakraṃsutān upa
translated: We invoke the mighty one who wins the light, the gladdener of the juice, around, O Shakra, the pressed (juices).

original: imaṃ no yajñamiha bodhyā gahi spṛdhojayantaṃ maghavānamīmahe
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam iha bodhyā gahi spṛdhaḥ jayantam maghavān amīmahe
translated: Be thou awake to this our sacrifice here; we invoke the bountiful one who conquers his foes.

original: somasya rājño varuṇasya dharmaṇi bṛhaspateranumatyā uśarmaṇi🔽tavāhamadya maghavannupastutau dhātarvidhātaḥ kalaśānabhakṣayam🔽prasūto bhakṣamakaraṃ carāvapi stomaṃ cemaṃ prathamaḥsūrirun mṛje
analyzed: somasya rājñaḥ varuṇasya dharmaṇi bṛhaspateḥ anumatyai uśarmaṇi  tava aham adya maghavan upastutau dhātar vidhātar kalaśān abhakṣayam  prasūtaḥ bhakṣa makaram carau api stomam ca imam prathamaḥ sūriḥ ud mṛje
translated: In the law of Soma, the king, and Varuna, in the joy of Brihaspati and Anumati.🔽Thee, O bountiful one, I have this day praised, O creator, I have drunk the jars (of Soma).🔽I have been sent forth, and have eaten the food, and have overcome this hymn as the first singer.

original: sute sātena yadyāgamaṃ vāṃ prativiśvāmitrajamadagnī dame
analyzed: sute sātena yadi agamam vām prativiśvāmitra jamadagnī dame
translated: When I have come to you with the pressed (Soma) and the prepared (food), O Vishvamitra and Jamadagni, to the house.

original: vātasya nu mahimānaṃ rathasya rujanneti stanayannasyaghoṣaḥ🔽divispṛg yātyaruṇāni kṛṇvannuto eti pṛthivyāreṇumasyan
analyzed: vātasya nu mahimānam rathasya rujan eti stanayan āsya ghoṣaḥ  divispṛś yāti aruṇāni kṛṇvan uta u eti pṛthivi āreṇum asyan
translated: The greatness of the wind, the rushing of the chariot, he goes forth, thundering, with the sound of it.🔽It goes to heaven, making red things, and then comes back, scattering dust on the earth.

original: saṃ prerate anu vātasy viṣṭhā ainaṃ gachanti samanaṃ nayoṣāḥ
analyzed: sam pra īrate anu vātasya viṣṭhāḥ ā enam gacchanti samanam naya uṣāḥ
translated: It moves along with the course of the wind; the young women come to it as to a meeting.

original: tābhiḥ sayuk sarathaṃ deva īyate 'sya viśvasyabhuvanasya rājā
analyzed: tābhiḥ sayuj sa ratham devaḥ īyate sya viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
translated: He, the God, is borne along with them, yoked to the chariot, the King of this whole world.

original: antarikṣe pathibhirīyamāno na ni viśate katamaccanāhaḥ
analyzed: antarikṣe pathibhiḥ īyamānaḥ na ni viśate katamat cana ahar
translated: He who is borne along on the paths in the atmosphere does not enter any particular day.

original: apāṃ sakhā prathamajā ṛtāvā kva svijjātaḥ kuta ābabhūva
analyzed: apām sakhā prathama jāḥ ṛtāvā kva svid jātaḥ kutas ābabhūva
translated: The friend of the waters, the firstborn, the righteous one, where was he born, whence has he come?

original: ātmā devānāṃ bhuvanasya garbho yathāvaśaṃ carati devaeṣaḥ
analyzed: ātmā devānām bhuvanasya garbhaḥ yathā vaśam carati deva eṣaḥ
translated: The soul of the gods, the embryo of the world, this God moves about as he wills.

original: ghoṣā idasya śṛṇvire na rūpaṃ tasmai vātāyahaviṣā vidhema
analyzed: ghoṣāḥ id asya śṛṇvire na rūpam tasmai vātāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: We hear his voice, but not his form. To him, to Vata, let us offer oblation.

original: mayobhūrvāto abhi vātūsrā ūrjasvatīroṣadhīrāriśantām
analyzed: mayobhūḥ vātaḥ abhi vātu usrāḥ ūrjasvatīḥ oṣadhīḥ āriśantām
translated: May the wind blow pure and pleasant, and may it grant us streams of nourishing plants.

original: pīvasvatīrjīvadhanyāḥ pibantvavasāya padvaterudra mṛḷa
analyzed: pīvasvatīḥ jīva dhanyāḥ pibantu avasāya mṛḷa
translated: May the rich, life-giving plants drink, and be satisfied, O Rudra, be gracious to the bipeds and the quadrupeds.

original: yāḥ sarūpā virūpā ekarūpā yāsāmagniriṣṭyānāmāni veda
analyzed: yāḥ sarūpāḥ virūpāḥ eka rūpāḥ yāsām agniḥ iṣṭyā nāmāni veda
translated: Those who are of the same form, of different form, of one form, whose offerings Agni knows.

original: yā aṅgirasastapaseha cakrustābhyaḥparjanya mahi śarma yacha
analyzed: yāḥ aṅgirasaḥ tapasā iha cakruḥ tābhyaḥ parjanya mahi śarma yaccha
translated: Those whom the Angirases created through austerity, to them, O Parjanya, grant great protection.

original: yā deveṣu tanvamairayanta yāsāṃ somo viśvā rūpāṇiveda🔽tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ prajāvatīrindragoṣṭhe rirīhi
analyzed: yāḥ deveṣu tanvam airayanta yāsām somaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi veda  tāḥ asmabhyam payasā pinvamānāḥ prajāvatīḥ indra goṣṭhe rirīhi
translated: Those who have sent forth their body among the gods, whose every form Soma knows.🔽Grant them to me, O Indra, in the cowpen, rich in offspring, swelling with milk, and nourishing.

original: prajāpatirmahyametā rarāṇo viśvairdevaiḥ pitṛbhiḥsaṃvidānaḥ
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ mahyam etāḥ rarāṇaḥ viśvaiḥ devaiḥ pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ
translated: May Prajapati, granting these to me, in agreement with the All-gods and the fathers,

original: śivāḥ satīrupa no goṣṭhamākastāsāṃvayaṃ prajayā saṃ sadema
analyzed: śivāḥ satīḥ upa naḥ goṣṭham ākaḥ tāsām vayam prajayā sam sadema
translated: Be gracious to us, O ye cows, come to our cow-pen. May we be united with you and your offspring.

original: vibhrāḍ bṛhat pibatu somyaṃ madhvāyurdadhad yajñapatāvavihrutam
analyzed: vibhrāj bṛhat pibatu somyam madhu āyuḥ dadhat yajñapatau a vihrutam
translated: May the wide-spreading, great one drink the Soma-mingled mead, bestowing life on the lord of the sacrifice, uninjured.

original: vātajūto yo abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ pupoṣapurudhā vi rājati🔽vibhrāḍ bṛhat subhṛtaṃ vājasātamaṃ dharman divo dharuṇesatyamarpitam
analyzed: vāta jūtaḥ yaḥ abhirakṣati tmanā prajāḥ pupoṣa purudhā vi rājati  vibhrāj bṛhat su bhṛtam vāja sātamam dharman divaḥ dharuṇesatyam arpitam
translated: He who, urged by the wind, protects by his own power, has nourished the people, shines forth in many ways.🔽The wide-spreading, great one, well-filled, best at winning strength, truth is laid upon the support of the sky's law.

original: amitrahā vṛtrahā dasyuhantamaṃ jyotirjajñeasurahā sapatnahā
analyzed: amitra hā vṛtra hā dasyu hantamam jyotiḥ jajñe asura hā sapatna hā
translated: Slayer of foes, slayer of Vrtra, best at slaying the Dasyus, the light has been born, slayer of Asuras, slayer of rivals.

original: idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotiruttamaṃ viśvajiddhanajiducyate bṛhat
analyzed: idam śreṣṭham jyotiṣām jyotiḥ uttamam viśvajit dhanajit ucyate bṛhat
translated: This is the best light, the light most excellent, called all-conquering, wealth-conquering, and great.

original: viśvabhrāḍ bhrājo mahi sūryo dṛśauru paprathe saha ojo acyutam
analyzed: viśva bhrāj bhrājaḥ mahi sūryaḥ dṛśā uru paprathe sahaḥ ojaḥ acyutam
translated: All-shining, shining greatly, the sun, the great light has spread far and wide its imperishable strength.

original: vibhrājañ jyotiṣā svaragacho rocanaṃ divaḥ
analyzed: vibhrājam jyotiṣā svara gachaḥ rocanam divaḥ
translated: Shining with light, thou hast gone to the light of the sky.

original: yenemāviśvā bhuvanānyābhṛtā viśvakarmaṇā viśvadevyāvatā
analyzed: yena imā viśvā bhuvanāni ābhṛtā viśva karmaṇā viśvadevyāvatā
translated: By whom all these worlds have been encompassed, by the all-creating one, by the one accompanied by all the gods.

original: tvaṃ tyamiṭato rathamindra prāvaḥ sutāvataḥ
analyzed: tvam tyam iṭataḥ ratham indra prāvaḥ sutāvataḥ
translated: O Indra, thou hast urged on this chariot, which is ready, of the one who has pressed (the Soma).

original: aśṛṇoḥ somino havam
analyzed: aśṛṇoḥ sominaḥ havam
translated: Thou hast heard the call of the Soma-presser.

original: tvaṃ makhasya dodhataḥ śiro 'va tvaco bharaḥ
analyzed: tvam makhasya dodhataḥ śiraḥ vaḥ tvacaḥ bharaḥ
translated: Thou hast brought the head of the rushing Makha, thou hast laid it on the skin.

original: agachaḥsomino gṛham
analyzed: agacchaḥsominaḥ gṛham
translated: Thou hast gone to the house of the Soma-presser.

original: tvaṃ tyamindra martyamāstrabudhnāya venyam
analyzed: tvam tyam indra martyam āstrabudhnāya venyam
translated: You, O Indra, for the sake of the mortal who is skilled in the thunderbolt,

original: muhuḥśrathnā manasyave
analyzed: muhuḥśrathnā manasyave
translated: constantly loosen the mind of the one who is to be punished.

original: tvaṃ tyamindra sūryaṃ paścā santaṃ puras kṛdhi
analyzed: tvam tyam indra sūryam paścā santam puras kṛdhi
translated: You, O Indra, make the sun, which is behind, come to the front,

original: devānāṃ cit tiro vaśam
analyzed: devānām cit tiras vaśam
translated: even over the will of the gods.

original: ā yāhi vanasā saha gāvaḥ sacanta vartaniṃ yadūdhabhiḥ🔽ā yāhi vasvyā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭho jārayanmakhaḥsudānubhiḥ
analyzed: ā yāhi vanasā saha gāvaḥ sacanta vartanim yat ūdhabhiḥ  ā yāhi vasvyā dhiyā maṃhiṣṭhaḥ jārayan makhaḥ sudānubhiḥ
translated: Come with the forest, the cows follow the path with their udders full.🔽Come with the most bountiful thought, the most delightful sacrifice, with the very generous ones.

original: pitubhṛto na tantumit sudānavaḥ prati dadhmo yajāmasi
analyzed: pitu bhṛtaḥ na tantumit sudānavaḥ prati dadhmaḥ yajāmasi
translated: We set up the one who is supported by the fathers, the very generous ones, we worship.

original: uṣā apa svasustamaḥ saṃ vartayati vartaniṃ sujātatā
analyzed: uṣāḥ apa svasuḥ tamaḥ sam vartayati vartanim sujāta tā
translated: Dawn removes the darkness from her sisters, she turns the path, well-born.

original: ā tvāhārṣamantaredhi dhruvastiṣṭhāvicācaliḥ
analyzed: ā tvā ahārṣam antaredhi dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha avicācaliḥ
translated: I have brought you, be present, stand firm, do not waver.

original: viśastvā sarvā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭramadhi bhraśat
analyzed: viśaḥ tvā sarvāḥ vāñchantu mā tvat rāṣṭram adhi bhraśat
translated: May all the people desire you, let not your kingdom be destroyed.

original: ihaivaidhi māpa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvata ivāvicācaliḥ
analyzed: iha eva edhi mā apa cyoṣṭhāḥ parvataḥ iva a vicācaliḥ
translated: Be right here, do not fall away, like a mountain that does not waver.

original: indraiveha dhruvastiṣṭheha rāṣṭramu dhāraya
analyzed: indra eva iha dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha iha rāṣṭramu dhāraya
translated: Stand firm right here with Indra, right here uphold the kingdom.

original: imamindro adīdharad dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣā
analyzed: imam indraḥ adīdharat dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā
translated: Indra has firmly established this, the firm oblation.

original: tasmai somoadhi bravat tasmā u brahmaṇas patiḥ
analyzed: tasmai somaḥ adhi bravat tasmai u brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ
translated: To him Soma speaks, to him Brahmanaspati.

original: dhruvā dyaurdhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatā ime
analyzed: dhruvā dyauḥ dhruvā pṛthivī dhruvāsaḥ parvatāḥ ime
translated: The sky is firm, the earth is firm, these mountains are firm.

original: dhruvaṃ viśvamidaṃ jagad dhruvo rājā viśāmayam
analyzed: dhruvam viśvam idam jagat dhruvaḥ rājā viśām ayam
translated: This world is firm, this king is firm, this people are firm.

original: dhruvaṃ te rājā varuṇo dhruvaṃ devo bṛhaspatiḥ
analyzed: dhruvam te rājā varuṇaḥ dhruvam devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Firm is your king Varuna, firm is the god Brihaspati.

original: dhruvaṃ ta indraścāgniśca rāṣṭraṃ dhārayatāṃ dhruvam
analyzed: dhruvam te indraḥ ca agniḥ ca rāṣṭram dhārayatām dhruvam
translated: Firm is your Indra and Agni, may they hold your kingdom firm.

original: dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa haviṣābhi somaṃ mṛśāmasi🔽atho taindraḥ kevalīrviśo balihṛtas karat
analyzed: dhruvam dhruveṇa haviṣā abhi somam mṛśāmasi  atha u taindraḥ kevalīḥ viśaḥ bali hṛtaḥ karat
translated: With firm and steady oblation we touch the Soma.🔽And may Indra, the sole lord, make the people pay tribute.

original: abhīvartena haviṣā yenendro abhivāvṛte
analyzed: abhīvartena haviṣā yena indraḥ abhivāvṛte
translated: With the oblation of the Abhivarta, wherewith Indra was exalted,

original: tenāsmānbrahmaṇas pate 'bhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya🔽abhivṛtya sapatnānabhi yā no arātayaḥ
analyzed: tena asmān brahmaṇas pate bhi rāṣṭrāya vartaya  abhivṛtya sapatnān abhi yāḥ naḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Therewith, O lord of prayer, turn thou to us for the kingdom.🔽Having overcome our enemies, having overcome those who hate us,

original: abhi pṛtanyantantiṣṭhābhi yo na irasyati
analyzed: abhi pṛtanyantantiṣṭha abhi yaḥ naḥ irasyati
translated: Stand overcoming those who fight against us, overcoming him who hates us.

original: abhi tvā devaḥ savitābhi somo avīvṛtat
analyzed: abhi tvā devaḥ savitā abhi somaḥ avīvṛtat
translated: Thee hath the god Savitar, thee hath Soma exalted.

original: abhi tvā viśvābhūtānyabhīvarto yathāsasi🔽yenendro haviṣā kṛtvyabhavad dyumnyuttamaḥ
analyzed: abhi tvā viśvābhūtāni abhīvartaḥ yathā asasi  yena indraḥ haviṣā kṛtvī abhavat dyumnī uttamaḥ
translated: Thee have all beings exalted, as thou art the Abhivarta.🔽With that oblation wherewith Indra became most glorious,

original: idaṃ tadakri devā asapatnaḥ kilābhuvam
analyzed: idam tat akri devāḥ asapatnaḥ kila abhuvam
translated: The gods have performed this rite. I have become free from enemies.

original: asapatnaḥ sapatnahābhirāṣṭro viṣāsahiḥ
analyzed: asapatnaḥ sapatna hā abhirāṣṭraḥ viṣāsahiḥ
translated: Free from enemies, the slayer of enemies, the conqueror of kingdoms, overcoming foes,

original: yathāhameṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ virājāni janasya ca
analyzed: yathā aham eṣām bhūtānām virājāni janasya ca
translated: As I may rule over these beings and over the people.

original: pra vo grāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
analyzed: pra vaḥ grāvāṇaḥ savitā devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
translated: May Savitar the god, the impeller, impel you with the impulse of holy order.

original: dhūrṣuyujyadhvaṃ sunuta
analyzed: dhūrṣuyujyadhvam sunuta
translated: Yoke your teams, press the juice

original: grāvāṇo apa duchunāmapa sedhata durmatim🔽usrāḥ kartanabheṣajam
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ apa duchunām apa sedhata durmatim  usrāḥ kartana bheṣajam
translated: O pressing-stones, drive away evil, cast off evil thought🔽The two Dawns make the remedy

original: grāvāṇa upareṣvā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ upara iṣvā mahīyante sajoṣasaḥ
translated: The pressing-stones are exalted in the lower world, of one accord

original: vṛṣṇedadhato vṛṣṇyam
analyzed: vṛṣṇā idadhataḥ vṛṣṇyam
translated: With the strong one who bestows strength

original: grāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vo devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ savitā nu vaḥ devaḥ suvatu dharmaṇā
translated: May the god Savitar verily prosper you by his law

original: yajamānāya sunvate
analyzed: yajamānāya sunvate
translated: For the sacrificer who presses the juice

original: pra sūnava ṛbhūṇāṃ bṛhan navanta vṛjanā
analyzed: pra sūnavaḥ ṛbhūṇām bṛhat navanta vṛjanā
translated: The mighty sons of R̥ibhu sing their songs, the singers

original: kṣāmā yeviśvadhāyaso 'śnan dhenuṃ na mātaram
analyzed: kṣāmāḥ yeviśva dhāyasaḥ śnan dhenum na mātaram
translated: Who are all-sustaining, eating the milk like a mother's cow

original: pra devaṃ devyā dhiyā bharatā jātavedasam
analyzed: pra devam devyā dhiyā bharata jātavedasam
translated: Bring the God with the God-head, with the thought, to Jâtavedas

original: havyā novakṣadānuṣak
analyzed: havyā naḥ vakṣada anuṣak
translated: Who shall bear our offerings in due course

original: ayamu ṣya pra devayurhotā yajñāya nīyate
analyzed: ayam u sya pra devayuḥ hotā yajñāya nīyate
translated: This one, indeed, the pious man, the priest, is led to the sacrifice

original: ratho nayorabhīvṛto ghṛṇīvāñcetati tmanā
analyzed: rathaḥ nayoḥ abhīvṛtaḥ ghṛṇīvān cetati tmanā
translated: Like a chariot, encompassed by the two, the kindly one thinks in himself

original: ayamagniruruṣyatyamṛtādiva janmanaḥ
analyzed: ayam agniḥ uruṣyati amṛtāt iva janmanaḥ
translated: This Agni prospers, as it were, from birth, as from immortality

original: sahasaścidsahīyān devo jīvātave kṛtaḥ
analyzed: sahasaḥ cit sahīyān devaḥ jīvātave kṛtaḥ
translated: Even stronger than strength, the God is made for life

original: pataṃgamaktamasurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasāvipaścitaḥ
analyzed: pataṃgam aktam asurasya māyayā hṛdā paśyanti manasā vipaścitaḥ
translated: The bird, caught by the Asura's magic, the unwise behold with heart and mind

original: samudre antaḥ kavayo vi cakṣate marīcīnāmpadamichanti vedhasaḥ
analyzed: samudre antar kavayaḥ vi cakṣate marīcīnām padam ichanti vedhasaḥ
translated: The wise discern him in the ocean's midst, the creators seek the place of the rays

original: pataṃgo vācaṃ manasā bibharti tāṃ gandharvo 'vadad garbheantaḥ
analyzed: pataṃgaḥ vācam manasā bibharti tām gandharvaḥ vadat garbheantaḥ
translated: The bird bears speech in his mind, the Gandharva utters it in the womb

original: tāṃ dyotamānāṃ svaryaṃ manīṣām ṛtasya padekavayo ni pānti
analyzed: tām dyotamānām svaryam manīṣām ṛtasya padā ikavayaḥ ni pānti
translated: They guard that shining, heavenly thought at the place of holy order.

original: apaśyaṃ gopāmanipadyamānamā ca parā ca pathibhiścarantam
analyzed: apaśyam gopām a nipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiḥ carantam
translated: I have seen the guardian who never stumbles, moving on the paths that go and come.

original: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīrvasāna ā varīvartibhuvaneṣvantaḥ🔽tyamū ṣu vājinaṃ devajūtaṃ sahāvānaṃ tarutāraṃrathānām
analyzed: sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīḥ vasānaḥ ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣu antar  tyamū su vājinam deva jūtam sahāvānam tarutāraṃrathānām
translated: He, dwelling in the east and west, moves within the worlds.🔽We will invoke here the swift one, the powerful one, consecrated by the gods, the conqueror, the swift one of the chariots,

original: ariṣṭanemiṃ pṛtanājamāśuṃ svastayetārkṣyamihā huvema
analyzed: ariṣṭa nemim pṛtanājam āśum svastayā ita ārkṣyam iha ā huvema
translated: the one with unbroken wheels, the swift one of the battle, the eagle, for our well-being.

original: indrasyeva rātimājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvamivā ruhema
analyzed: indrasya iva rātim ājohuvānāḥ svastaye nāvam iva ā ruhema
translated: Calling out for Indra's bounty, we will climb into the boat for our well-being.

original: urvī na pṛthvī bahule gabhīre mā vāmetau mā paretauriṣāma
analyzed: urvī na pṛthvī bahule gabhīre mā vām etau mā paretauriṣāma
translated: Wide, vast, deep, do not lead us astray, O two, whether forward or backward.

original: sadyaścid yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya ivajyotiṣāpastatāna
analyzed: sadyas cit yaḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūryaḥ iva jyotiṣā apaḥ tatāna
translated: He who in one day with his might extends over five peoples, as the sun with its light over the waters,

original: sahasrasāḥ śatasā asya raṃhirnasmā varante yuvatiṃ na śaryām
analyzed: sahasra sāḥ śata sāḥ asya raṃhiḥ nasmā varante yuvatim na śaryām
translated: his strength is worth a thousand, worth a hundred. They do not give him a young woman as a present, as a gift.

original: ut tiṣṭhatāva paśyatendrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam
analyzed: ud tiṣṭhata ava paśyata indrasya bhāgam ṛtviyam
translated: Rise up, look at Indra's proper share.

original: yadi śrātojuhotana yadyaśrāto mamattana
analyzed: yadi śrātaḥ juhotana yadi a śrātaḥ mamattana
translated: If it is cooked, offer it; if it is not cooked, rejoice in it.

original: śrātaṃ haviro ṣvindra pra yāhi jagāma sūro adhvanovimadhyam
analyzed: śrātam havirā u su indra pra yāhi jagāma sūraḥ adhvanovimadhyam
translated: O Indra, the oblation is cooked; go forward. The sun has gone to the middle of the path.

original: pari tvāsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kulapā navrājapatiṃ carantam
analyzed: pari tvā āsate nidhibhiḥ sakhāyaḥ kula pāḥ na vrāja patim carantam
translated: Around thee sit thy friends with treasures, the nine families, the lord of the house who moves about

original: śrātaṃ manya ūdhani śrātamagnau suśrātaṃ manye tadṛtaṃ navīyaḥ
analyzed: śrātam manye ūdhani śrātam agnau su śrātam manye tat ṛtam navīyaḥ
translated: I deem thee roasted on the udder, roasted in the fire, I deem thee well roasted, that is the newest truth

original: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ pibendravajrin purukṛjjuṣāṇaḥ
analyzed: mādhyandinasya savanasya dadhnaḥ piba indra vajrin puru kṛt juṣāṇaḥ
translated: Drink, O Indra, the essence of the midday libation, O bountiful one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, rejoicing

original: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūñ jyeṣṭhaste śuṣma iharātirastu
analyzed: pra sasāhiṣe puruhūta śatrūm jyeṣṭhaḥ te śuṣmaḥ iha rātiḥ astu
translated: Thou hast overcome the enemies, O much-invoked one; let thy most mighty strength be here for our help

original: indrā bhara dakṣiṇenā vasūni patiḥsindhūnāmasi revatīnām
analyzed: indra ā bhara dakṣiṇena vasūni patiḥ sindhūnām asi revatīnām
translated: O Indra, bring hither with thy right hand the treasures; thou art the lord of the abundant streams

original: mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaganthāparasyāḥ🔽sṛkaṃ saṃśāya pavimindra tigmaṃ vi śatrūntāḷi vi mṛdho nudasva
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagantha aparasyāḥ  sṛkam saṃśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūn tāḷi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva
translated: Like a terrible beast roaming the mountains, come from the farthest end of the yonder world🔽Sharpening thy pointed, sharp weapon, O Indra, crush the enemies, drive away the foes

original: indra kṣatramabhi vāmamojo 'jāyathā vṛṣabhacarṣaṇīnām
analyzed: indra kṣatram abhi vāmam ojaḥ jāyathāḥ vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
translated: O Indra, thou hast been born with the lordship, the pleasant strength, of the chief of the people

original: apānudo janamamitrayantamuruṃ devebhyoakṛṇoru lokam
analyzed: apānudaḥ janam amitrayantam urum devebhyaḥ akṛṇaḥ uru lokam
translated: Thou hast driven away the people who hate the gods; thou hast made a wide space for the gods

original: prathaśca yasya saprathaśca namānuṣṭubhasya haviṣohaviryat
analyzed: prathaḥ ca yasya sa prathaḥ ca nama ānuṣṭubhasya haviṣaḥ haviḥ yat
translated: The first and the extended are the oblation of the Anustubh metre, the oblation of the oblation

original: dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇo rathantaramā jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: dhātuḥ dyutānāt savituḥ ca viṣṇoḥ rathantaram āḥ jabhārā vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Vasishtha has yoked the Rathantara, from the shining Dhatr, from Savitar, from Vishnu

original: avindan te atihitaṃ yadāsīd yajñasya dhāma paramaṃguhā yat
analyzed: avindan te atihitam yadā āsīt yajñasya dhāma paramaṃguhā yat
translated: They found what was well hidden, the highest abode of the sacrifice, which was well guarded

original: dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorbharadvājo bṛhadā cakre agneḥ
analyzed: dhātuḥ dyutānāt savituḥ ca viṣṇoḥ bharadvājaḥ bṛhat ā cakre agneḥ
translated: By the creator, the shining one, Savitar, and Vishnu. Bharadvaja and Brihat made it for Agni.

original: te 'vindan manasā dīdhyānā yaju ṣkannaṃ prathamandevayānam
analyzed: te vindan manasā dīdhyānāḥ yaju skannam prathaman deva yānam
translated: They found it, meditating with their minds, the first sacrifice, the path of the gods, which was lost.

original: dhāturdyutānāt savituśca viṣṇorāsūryādabharan gharmamete🔽bṛhaspatirnayatu durgahā tiraḥ punarneṣadaghaśaṃsāyamanma
analyzed: dhātuḥ dyutānāt savituḥ ca viṣṇoḥ ā sūryāt abharan gharmam ete  bṛhaspatiḥ nayatu durgahā tiras punar neṣat agha śaṃsāya manma
translated: From the shining one, Savitar, and Vishnu, they brought forth this Gharma from the sun.🔽May Brihaspati lead us over the difficult passages, may he lead us back again, the wise one.

original: kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: kṣipat aśastim apa durmatim han athā karat yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: May he cast away the evil-minded one, may he destroy the wicked one, and may he make peace for the sacrificer.

original: narāśaṃso no 'vatu prayāje śaṃ no astvanuyājo haveṣu
analyzed: narāśaṃsaḥ naḥ vatu prayāje śam naḥ astu anuyājaḥ haveṣu
translated: May Narashamsa protect us in the fore-sacrifices, may he be auspicious to us in our offerings.

original: kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karad yajamānāyaśaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: kṣipat aśastim apa durmatim han nathā karat yajamāna ayaśam yoḥ
translated: May he cast away the evil-minded one, may he destroy the wicked one, and may he make peace for the sacrificer.

original: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣaso ye brahmadviṣaḥ śaravehantavā u
analyzed: tapurmūrdhā tapatu rakṣasaḥ ye brahma dviṣaḥ śara vehantavai u
translated: Let the head of heat burn the Rakshasas who hate the Brahman, who are to be slain by the arrow.

original: kṣipadaśastimapa durmatiṃ hannathā karadyajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: kṣipat aśastim apa durmatim han athā karat yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: May he cast away the evil-minded one, may he destroy the wicked one, and may he make peace for the sacrificer.

original: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā cekitānaṃ tapaso jātaṃ tapasovibhūtam
analyzed: apaśyam tvā manasā cekitānam tapasaḥ jātam tapasaḥ vibhūtam
translated: I have seen thee, O watchful one, born of penance, manifested from penance.

original: iha prajāmiha rayiṃ rarāṇaḥ pra jāyasvaprajayā putrakāma
analyzed: iha prajām iha rayim rarāṇaḥ pra jāyasva aprajayā putra kāma
translated: Bestowing offspring here, wealth here, beget offspring, O son, desirous of offspring.

original: apaśyaṃ tvā manasā dīdhyānāṃ svāyāṃ tanū ṛtvyenādhamānām
analyzed: apaśyam tvā manasā dīdhyānām svāyām tanū ṛtvyena adhamānām
translated: I beheld thee, meditating with the mind, in thy own body, being pressed with the sacred rite.

original: upa māmuccā yuvatirbabhūyāḥ pra jāyasvaprajayā putrakāme
analyzed: upa mām uccā yuvatiḥ babhūyāḥ pra jāyasva aprajayā putra kāme
translated: Come to me as a young woman, rise up; beget offspring, O thou who desirest a son.

original: ahaṃ garbhamadadhāmoṣadhīṣvahaṃ viśveṣu bhuvaneṣvantaḥ ahaṃ prajā ajanayaṃ pṛthivyāmahaṃ janibhyo aparīṣuputrān
analyzed: aham garbham adadhām oṣadhīṣu aham viśveṣu bhuvaneṣu antar aham prajāḥ ajanayam pṛthivyām aham janibhyaḥ aparīṣu putrān
translated: I place the embryo in the plants, I am within all the worlds, I have generated offspring on the earth, I have brought forth sons from the wombs.

original: viṣṇuryoniṃ kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ yonim kalpayatu tvaṣṭā rūpāṇi piṃśatu
translated: May Vishnu prepare the womb, may Tvashtar fashion the forms.

original: āsiñcatu prajāpatirdhātā garbhaṃ dadhātu te
analyzed: āsiñcatu prajāpatiḥ dhātā garbham dadhātu te
translated: May Prajapati sprinkle thee, may the Creator place the embryo in thee.

original: garbhaṃ dhehi sinīvāli garbhaṃ dhehi sarasvati
analyzed: garbham dhehi sinīvāli garbham dhehi sarasvati
translated: Place the embryo in thee, O Sinivāli, place the embryo in thee, O Sarasvatī.

original: garbhaṃ teaśvinau devāvā dhattāṃ puṣkarasrajā
analyzed: garbham te aśvinau devau ā dhattām puṣkara srajā
translated: May the two gods, the Ashvins, garlanded with lotuses, place the embryo in thee.

original: hiraṇyayī araṇī yaṃ nirmanthato aśvinā
analyzed: hiraṇyayī araṇī yam nirmanthataḥ aśvinā
translated: The two Ashvins, who churn out the embryo from the golden kindling sticks,

original: taṃ tegarbhaṃ havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave
analyzed: tam te garbham havāmahe daśame māsi sūtave
translated: We invoke that embryo of thine, in the tenth month, for delivery.🔽May the high, celestial, invincible favor of the three,

original: mahi trīṇāmavo 'stu dyukṣaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ🔽durādharṣaṃ varuṇasya🔽nahi teṣāmamā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu
analyzed: mahi trīṇām avaḥ stu dyukṣam mitrasya aryamṇaḥ  durādharṣam varuṇasya  nahi teṣām amā cana na adhvasu vā araṇeṣu
translated: Of Mitra, Aryaman,🔽And Varuna be ours.🔽For they have no foe, no adversary, on the paths of the strong,

original: īśe ripuraghaśaṃsaḥ🔽yasmai putrāso aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya
analyzed: īśe ripuḥ agha śaṃsaḥ  yasmai putrāsaḥ aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya
translated: The evil-doer has no power.🔽To the mortal for whom the sons of Aditi

original: jyotiryachantyajasram
analyzed: jyotiḥ yacchanti ajasram
translated: Grant the imperishable light for life.

original: vāta ā vātu bheṣajaṃ śambhu mayobhu no hṛde
analyzed: vātaḥ ā vātu bheṣajam śambhu mayobhu naḥ hṛde
translated: Let the wind blow healing balm, auspicious and joyful to our heart,

original: pra ṇaāyūṃṣi tāriṣat
analyzed: pra na āyūṃṣi tāriṣat
translated: And carry our life away.

original: uta vāta pitāsi na uta bhrātota naḥ sakhā
analyzed: uta vāta pitā asi naḥ uta bhrātā uta naḥ sakhā
translated: And, O wind, be thou our father, and our brother, and our friend,

original: sa nojīvātave kṛdhi
analyzed: sa naḥ jīvātave kṛdhi
translated: So make us live for a hundred winters.

original: yadado vāta te gṛhe 'mṛtasya nidhirhitaḥ
analyzed: yat adaḥ vāta te gṛhe mṛtasya nidhiḥ hitaḥ
translated: What store of immortality is laid up in thee, O wind, in thine abode,

original: tato no dehijīvase
analyzed: tatas naḥ dehi jīvase
translated: Thence give us life that we may live.

original: prāgnaye vācamīraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
analyzed: pra agnaye vācam īraya vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
translated: Send forth your voice to Agni, the bull of the people,

original: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he carry us beyond our foes.

original: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvatastiro dhanvātirocate
analyzed: yaḥ parasyāḥ parāvataḥ tiras dhanva atirocate
translated: He who shines beyond the farthest distance, beyond the desert,

original: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he carry us beyond our foes.

original: yo rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā
analyzed: yaḥ rakṣāṃsi nijūrvati vṛṣā śukreṇa śociṣā
translated: The bull who shakes off the Rakshasas with his bright flame,

original: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he carry us beyond our foes.

original: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati
translated: He who looks on all the worlds and looks on them together,

original: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥparṣadati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he carry us beyond our foes.

original: yo asya pāre rajasaḥ śukro agnirajāyata
analyzed: yaḥ asya pāre rajasaḥ śukraḥ agniḥ ajāyata
translated: The bright Agni who is born beyond the world of men,

original: sa naḥ parṣadati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ parṣadati dviṣaḥ
translated: May he carry us beyond our foes.

original: pra nūnaṃ jātavedasamaśvaṃ hinota vājinam
analyzed: pra nūnam jātavedasam aśvam hinota vājinam
translated: Now send ye forth the swift, the knowing, the all-observing Agni,

original: idaṃ nobarhirāsade
analyzed: idam naḥ barhiḥ āsade
translated: To this our grass to sit upon.

original: asya pra jātavedaso vipravīrasya mīḷuṣaḥ
analyzed: asya pra jātavedasaḥ vipra vīrasya mīḍuṣaḥ
translated: Of this all-knowing one, whose hero is a sage, whose flame is strong,

original: mahīmiyarmisuṣṭutim
translated: The great praise is to be sung.

original: yā ruco jātavedaso devatrā havyavāhanīḥ
analyzed: yāḥ rucaḥ jātavedasaḥ devatrā havya vāhanīḥ
translated: The flames of Agni, Jâtavedas, which bear our offerings to the Gods,

original: tābhirnoyajñaminvatu
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ yajñam invatu
translated: May they inspire our sacrifice.

original: āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnirakramīdasadan mātaraṃ puraḥ
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras
translated: The dappled bull hath come hither, hath sat down before the mother

original: pitaraṃ ca prayan svaḥ
analyzed: pitaram ca prayan svar
translated: And the father, striving for the light.

original: antaścarati rocanāsya prāṇādapānatī
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānatī
translated: He moves within the luminous realm, breathing out and breathing in from his own breath.

original: vyakhyanmahiṣo divam
analyzed: vyakhyat mahiṣaḥ divam
translated: The buffalo hath extended the sky.

original: triṃśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṃgāya dhīyate
analyzed: triṃśat dhāma vi rājati vāc pataṃgāya dhīyate
translated: The thirtyfold abode shines forth; speech is set in motion for the bird.

original: prativastoraha dyubhiḥ
analyzed: prativastoḥ aha dyubhiḥ
translated: He hath filled the two worlds with light.

original: ṛtaṃ ca satyaṃ cābhīddhāt tapaso 'dhyajāyata
analyzed: ṛtam ca satyam ca abhīddhāt tapasaḥ dhī ajāyata
translated: From truth and from truth he hath produced the heat; from heat he hath produced the light.

original: tatorātryajāyata tataḥ samudro arṇavaḥ
analyzed: tatas rātrī ajāyata tatas samudraḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: From that the night was produced; from that the ocean with its waves.

original: samudrādarṇavādadhi saṃvatsaro ajāyata
analyzed: samudrāt arṇavāt adhi saṃvatsaraḥ ajāyata
translated: From the ocean with its waves the year was produced.

original: ahorātrāṇividadhad viśvasya miṣato vaśī
analyzed: viśvasya miṣataḥ vaśī
translated: Arranging the days and nights, the powerful one, while all were looking on,

original: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvamakalpayat
analyzed: sūryācandramasau dhātā yathāpūrvam akalpayat
translated: The creator fashioned the sun and moon as before,

original: divaṃ capṛthivīṃ cāntarikṣamatho svaḥ
analyzed: divam ca pṛthivīm ca antarikṣam atho svar
translated: The sky, the earth, the atmosphere, and also heaven.

original: saṃsamid yuvase vṛṣannagne viśvānyarya ā
analyzed: saṃsamidh yuvase vṛṣan agne viśvāni aryaḥ ā
translated: O bull, you spread out, O Agni, all the treasures.

original: iḷas padesamidhyase sa no vasūnyā bhara
analyzed: iḷaḥ padesamidhyase sa naḥ vasūni ā bhara
translated: You are kindled in the abode of Iḷā; bring us wealth.

original: saṃ gachadhvaṃ saṃ vadadhvaṃ saṃ vo manāṃsi jānatām
analyzed: sam gachadhvam sam vadadhvam sam vaḥ manāṃsi jānatām
translated: Come together, speak together; may your minds agree together.

original: devā bhāgaṃ yathā pūrve saṃjānānā upāsate
analyzed: devāḥ bhāgam yathā pūrve saṃjānānāḥ upāsate
translated: The gods, as in the past, knowing, attend upon their share.

original: samāno mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānaṃ manaḥ saha cittameṣām
analyzed: samānaḥ mantraḥ samitiḥ samānī samānam manaḥ saha cittam eṣām
translated: The same is the prayer, the same the assembly, the same the mind, the same the thought of these.

original: samānaṃ mantramabhi maṇtraye vaḥ samānena vohaviṣā juhomi🔽samānī va ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ
analyzed: samānam mantram abhi maṇtraye vaḥ samānena vaḥ haviṣā juhomi  samānī vaḥ ākūtiḥ samānā hṛdayāni vaḥ
translated: I invite you with the same invocation, I offer you with the same oblation.🔽One and the same is your intention, one and the same are your hearts.

original: samānamastu vomano yathā vaḥ susahāsati
analyzed: samānam astu vomanaḥ yathā vaḥ su sahā asati
translated: May your mind be the same, that you may rejoice in each other.
